Reviews.Author: Jonathan N.
Reviews.Content: Prepare for a wait! Also, make sure to have everyone in your party available because if they call you and not everyone is there, you will be skipped! If you can, avoid coming on Friday/Saturday because the wait is way longer. We sat at a table to order non-sushi items, but after dinner I would not mind sitting at the sushi bar.Ama Ebi - fresh and delicious. They did forget to give us the heads until 20 minutes later though. Uni Dinner - SO. MUCH. UNI. I would definitely recommend splitting this as there is way too much uni for one person! It was really good though and a must get for uni lovers. I am a little disappointed that they charge extra for seaweed that is served in plastic, but i'll get over it. It comes with a side of sashimi or tempura, just get the sashimi.Sashimi Dinner - a ton of sashimi for a low price. It is chef special so you cannot decide what is on there, but they are accommodating to things you do NOT want. It is fresh and again the price makes this definitely worth it.I usually do not write about drinks, but the green tea was actually very good.Well worth the wait! If your wait is over an hour, I would recommend walking around in little Tokyo across the street. It is pretty festive and you can grab a snack before your sushi heaven.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and we had good time.We had no menu, chef told us to just order to the bar so we didI must say, I had the best sake nigiri so far from this place Tamago and Uni was really good too.However, there is no refills here, server offered me another drink, didn't bother me to tell me. pretty reasonable price for the quality.. we only had 10 nigiris and bill was over 100 dollars.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne K.
Reviews.Content: Great quality sushi! I don't like waiting an hour for sushi but lunch specials here are worth it. For the $15 deluxe lunch special, you get side dishes (tofu, pickled veggies, soup) and a hefty plate of sashimi. There's tuna, spicy tuna, broiled tuba, yellowtail, salmon and more! Down side is they charge for ginger during lunch. The main host is very good at estimating the wait time, pretty much right on the dot or less than what's expected. And staff are friendly. Sushi Gen validates for the parking lot but you'll still end up spending a few bucks.

Reviews.Author: Dayae K.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite sushi places that isn't too expensive but has great quality fish and service!Mind you, the wait time is almost always long unless you come right when they open. Luckily for me, I haven't had to wait long because I come almost as soon as they open!Everything on their menu is good and fresh. I especially love their sweet shrimp and I get the head fried. It is so delicious and fresh. My favorite thing though is their tekka-maki which is just a tuna roll. The tuna is flavorful, delicate, and soft. My favorite place to get tekka-maki!If you're eating for 2, I suggest you get a combo platter with a roll. It always seems to do the job for us. We leave satisfied, not too full.Also, service is always great! They are courteous and attentive!

Reviews.Author: Regina H.
Reviews.Content: Everyone comes here for the sashimi lunch special and for good reason! People start lining up even before it opens. For $15, the special is a steal and will definitely fill you up. In addition to the sashimi (which is very fresh), you get a bowl of soup, salad, and rice. Even if you're not coming for the lunch specials, the food is well worth the price!FYI, your whole party must be present for you to be seated!

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: There's always a long line here, but Sushi Gen serves what I think is the best sushi in Little Tokyo. During lunch hours, there are usually a few seats available at the bar if you just want to eat nigiri (they don't let you order other items off the menu when at the bar) without waiting in line.Their rice is on point, as is the quality of the fish--unagi and uni were my favorites. On the pricier side (lunch for two at the bar came out to $120), but it's well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Debbie C.
Reviews.Content: My friend's friend recommended this place. She said it's one of the BEST places for sushi in town. Mind you, it is my first time traveling on my own to LA...so I trust recommendations from a local.Um...not sure if her idea of "best" is the same as mine. I've stayed in Japan...and I adore Japanese cuisine. The menu was just mediocre. I picked a standard item that I would order at any japanese restaurant as a comparison. My friends ordered chirashi. Eh. Neither wowed me. I expected better especially since it's LA. Not worth waiting for nor parking....

Reviews.Author: Derek S.
Reviews.Content: Made a phone reservation for a weekday dinner ~1 week ahead of time and was offered a 6:30 pm slot as the 7 pm slot as already "full." The phone operator informed me that they were strict on attendance and would not hold my table. ...good thing my table was available at the promised time...although the wait was minimal at ~6:30 pm.Started off with the miso soup and Japanese appetizers. The miso soup was decent.Moved on to the sashimi and it was lackluster...didn't really melt in my mouth as other Yelpers mentioned...The unagi don was also mediocre. The rice was lackluster and the unagi seemed to have been some pre-packaged unagi...I've definitely had better.The shrimp tempura was also mediocre...shrimp wasn't too fresh.Finished off with the salmon toro and it was mediocre...nothing special.Service was okay and the experience was quick ~30 minutes from start to finish...~$27/ person after tax and tip for dinner....they claimed a $10 surcharge for sharing plates and they charge $1.5 per person for hot tea...

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: My first impression was, "Finally getting this place off my list of LA restaurants to try!"Sushi Gen is a must try LA spot that seemingly everyone has already tried as represented by the long wait and long lines. Although it seems like a small restaurant it really provides lots of seating compared to other Japanese sushi spots. It is just very popular and for LA, a very good deal. Most people as I witnessed around every table go to Sushi Gen for their Sashimi Plate lunch special. For $15 you get a platter of mixed sashimi, rice, soup, tofu, and picked lettuce.We saw the raves and needed to try it and it was definitely worth it. The sashimi quality was very good, smooth, fresh, just melted in our mouths. The portions were enough to stuff us, and the service was great considering how busy it is. Our total wait time for a weekday lunch was 1.5 hours for 2 people. Although I enjoyed the food, I'm. It sure if I'd wait that long just to get a good deal. Right next to Little Tokyo I'll probably be heading elsewhere. But what can you do? It's good food and the price is right.The lasting impression? "Worth it to come back during off-peak times."

Reviews.Author: Natalie K.
Reviews.Content: I came to Sushi Gen for their lunch sashimi platter for my sister's birthday. It was supposed to be a great deal at $15 during lunch. The wait for a table was insane and we both had plans after lunch so we opted to sit at the sushi bar. I did end up paying more but I don't regret it at all.When you sit at the bar, everything is a la carte and you have to order a minimum of 4 items per person. We didn't have any problems going over that minimum that's for sure. You also are not able to order the lunch special menu.Our sushi chef was friendly. They give you a paper menu but you don't mark anything. You just go ahead and tell the chef what you and he is the one that keeps track of it.We had all the expensive stuff including toro, hamachi toro, amaebi, and uni along with the regular items like salmon, albacore, and yellowtail. There was no price listed so I thought I was going to get slammed with a huge bill but I paid $95 for 2 including tax and tip. It was a much cheaper than I thought it was going to be.The fish is very fresh. I would say it's one of the best sushi I've had in a while. My sister can be a little picky about sushi as she is also a big foodie but even she was impressed. We definitely want to come back again soon.Their parking lot can be kind of a nightmare. You can try to find street parking. The restaurant will validate so that you only pay $2 for the lot but be aware that the lot does fill up during busy times.

Reviews.Author: Garrett L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi is good.  Sushi rice could use a little work.  On the hard side for my tastes and couldn't really taste much in the rice.  Service is a little speedy, so if you're looking to hang out and take things slow, try sitting at the bar or go elsewhere.  One thing.  DO NOT ORDER THE RAW OYSTERS.  Had them once maybe a year ago and both my friend and I broke out around our mouths.  Tried ordering them again a couple weeks back--they were room temperature and fishy.  I would strongly suggest that they remove them from the menu or learn how to handle them properly.

Reviews.Author: Rajiv I.
Reviews.Content: We were three of us and only waited for about 30 minutes.  We had the Sashimi Dinner and the Sushi deluxe.  The sashimi and sushi were fresh, varied, big pieces.  All in all this is a great place for the price and u will leave satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: Not much more to add about the infamous $15 sashimi weekday lunch that Sushi Gen offers. Plenty of food and fresh fish with a side of massive crowds. We got here 30-40 minutes before opening and was the 2nd table to be seated. Only 4 chairs available when waiting outside the restaurant.The line was friggin' long by the time the restaurant opened (around 11:15am). The restaurant is a well-oiled machine. Everybody pretty much orders the same thing so they kinda serve group style. The service was polite and table turnover is pretty quick. While the sashimi was good, I'm not sure it is "wait 30 minutes" ahead of time before opening good. FYI: The sashimi mix does not include raw salmon sashimi.Parking: Honda plaza lot - $2 for 2 hour with validation (lunch), $3 for 3 hour with validation (dinner)

Reviews.Author: Julia H.
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 9 pm on a weekday night. The parking attendant warned us we may not get in without a reservation and let us pay afterward in case we decided not to eat here. Super chill of him to do that. Sat at the bar with 3 admittedly rowdy friends including myself (hey, we were excited for Anime Expo). The sushi chef was totally awesome and was really supportive of our friend who was clearly new to sushi. He even gave a little cheer when our friend finally used his chopsticks successfully. The waitstaff was extremely quick to refill our drinks without us even noticing. At the end, the damage came out to $200 for the four of us. After saying "arigatou gozaimasu!" the sushi chef fist-bumped all of us.

Reviews.Author: Evelyn H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen deserves 5 stars without question. I can say this with confidence. I have been going to Sushi Gen for the past 10-15 years and I use to come 5 days a week with my Aunt. The waiters and waitresses would joke by saying "See you tomorrow!" This restaurant has been recognized and received many accolades. (Please view entrance lobby).  The fish is delivered FRESH... EVERY MORNIN [with an adjacent storage room]. The ojichan runs a tight ship. As an elderly man who owns a flourishing valued restaurant in the Asian community he has the luxury to retire, sit at home, drink green tea and read newspaper, but instead he works everyday as the head sushi chef front row and center, literally. There is consistency in the food every visit. Sushi Gen, I love you, but you do have one flaw. One specific waitress ruins the customer service experience with her urgency to get customers out so the next table can come in. I understand this is part of the Japanese work ethics to be efficient, but it can be unsettling sitting there trying to enjoy food with her piercing eyes and prominent presence. I hope this can be addressed, thank you.With Much Respect

Reviews.Author: Chester M.
Reviews.Content: 1. Line up before they open.. like at 10:45ish?2. Get the Sashimi lunch special or else you are just dumb. 3. Eat the fish. Be mesmorized in its wonder. 4. For $15 this place can't be beat.5. The food is so bomb..Line up early  and then get Sashimi Lunch Special. (follow that and you will have a great experience)

Reviews.Author: Lannie L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch with my friends. Got here at 10:45 am and waited in line for it to open at 11:10 am. Couldn't believe it but there was already a line.  By the time it opened we were seated and I ordered the tempura and sashimi lunch combination.  My sashimi consist of two pieces of tuna, two pieces of yellow tail, and two pieces of hailbut. The tempura consist of two shrimps, two zucchini, and one sweet potato.  Lunch special came with miso soup, rice, sweet tofu, and pickled cabbage. Every I got only cost me $15 what a deal. Everything was delicious. Can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Author: Angela D.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the lunch time sashimi special with Katrice Q. We got in line around 10:45 and were seated for the first seating. It was crazy how long the line got as we waited for the restaurant to open.We were quickly seated and they knew what we were there for - the sashimi! As many many many people have mentioned, the sashimi plate is amazing. There is a large variety and a LOT of fish! My favorite was the marinated tuna. It tasted like teriyaki chicken! There were generous cuts of tuna and other fish. The sashimi special comes with a big bowl of rice and some miso soup. The quality of fish was good, but not great. All in all, it was a great and VERY filling meal. All for $20 (including tax and tip)! Yum yum! My friend wants to go back like every day!!

Reviews.Author: Mandi T.
Reviews.Content: This review is for their take out - not dine in, 'cos we all know (from reading the reviews) this place is packed AND it was at 2 pm on a Friday afternoon.We telephoned an order during lunch to be picked up - both of us got the lunch special - Chirashi bowl, or deluxe on the menu. Did I mention it was only $15?  It had various pieces of tuna, salmon, yellow-tail, eel, octopus, shrimp, salmon roe, and tamago served over rice. nom nom nom.Only gripe, three teeny packages of soy sauce and no small container (note to self - ask next time) for mixing your ginger, wasabi, and soy to dip your fish. I had to pour it over my "bowl". However, my meal was delicious. I can't wait to come back and sit in to try other things!Btw, they only guarantee your sushi for 1 hr for take out. However long it takes you to eat, it's up to your discretion. hehe.Very cute packaging.Yum yum yum in my tum tum tum!!!Parking is terrible - there are a bunch of restaurants and all and this teeny tiny parking lot in the Honda Center. Also - there are some street meters, but it's hard to find. Good Luck and god speed.

Reviews.Author: Rusty G.
Reviews.Content: The freshest sushi in la at reasonable, not cheap prices.  Always consistent, always a line and wait. Come early, dinner opens at 5. If you are waiting in line by 4:30 you will be in the first sitting at either sushi bar or table.  Minimum 4 orders per person at bar.

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: SASHIMI LUNCH SPECIAL!!!Parking lot is small. Restaurant is super small. Service is meh. The wait is crazy! I came at 10:30 am and there was already like 20 people in line. I had to wait an hour to eat.Sashimi Lunch - $15 - You get a huge variety of sashimi. It isn't the freshest fish but for $15 it is an awesome deal. The cooked salmon was terrible. Overcooked and dry. Should replace it with salmon sashimi. Wait sucks but the deal is unbeatable!

Reviews.Author: Francis R.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to try to this place for a while, but wow... I wish I could have gone here sooner. My mind was blown at how good sushi can get. So fresh, so savory, so flavorful. Tuna, Salmon, Snapper, and Salmon Roe where all amazing, but the Toro (Fatty Tuna) was like nothing else I have ever had. The food alone deserves more than 5 stars here.If I had any cons, it would be the fact that there is always a line of people waiting no matter what time you go.

Reviews.Author: Tunaidi A.
Reviews.Content: I took my friend to Sushi Gen for omakase at the bar. He took one bite from the first sushi we had, fatty tuna, and his manly eyes turned red and there were tears welling up inside his eyes. No... it wasn't the wasabi, it wasn't because this meal was going to make him broke... It was because it was THAT good.Yes... if you ever want to treat yourself to a $150 meal, this is the one place to splurge without any regrets. You'll get to try all sorts of fish you've never seen or heard of before. Your taste buds won't allow you to go back to any of the other sushi places you've been to in the paste. You'll see how chermoya will revolutionize your fruit-eating experiences. You won't want to tell the chef to stop the omakase because you just want to keep seeing what comes next. You'll dream of sushi for days to come.Yes... Sushi Gen is THAT good.

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: nice and fresh sushi, and good service. But too many people! Too crowed. And always need to wait for long time.It should be a 4 stars. However, the service makes it lost a stat. They serve very slowly, and the food coming slowly as well. The quality for sushi is above average. Not too bad, not too good. It's a one time try restaurant for me. This is the place you won't get wrong if you choose it to have sushi.

Reviews.Author: Emily T.
Reviews.Content: One of the best lunch spots in LA. At Sushi Gen, you'll get top quality sushi at great prices. I've only been here for lunch, but the $15 sashimi lunch is probably the best bargain you'll get in the area. With this order, you'll get at least 10 different types of fish, miso soup, a pickled side, and rice.Doors open at 11:15. If you want to get a spot in the first seating, be sure to line up outside well before 11 - 10:30 would probably guarantee you a spot. I've arrived at 11 and didn't make it into the first seating :( If you don't make it, expect a 40 min ~ 1 hr wait time. Overall, lunch service is extremely fast & efficient. Notes:* Must order -- $15 sashimi lunch* Arrive around 10:30 if you want a guaranteed spot in the first round for lunch* Lunch reservations - yes, they take them, but call in a couple days (4+) in advance* No special combos at the sushi bar* Parking - street / lot (the lot in the plaza is a bit tight).

Reviews.Author: Shelley Z.
Reviews.Content: If you think this place offers the best sushi you can ever have, YOU ARE WRONG.Go to Sushi Zo and tell me Gen still serves the best sushi. Actually, no, just go to Sushi Go 55 a block down and tell me Gen is still better. If you do, you need a lot more work on your palate.This place would not be nearly as popular (or have nearly as high ratings) had it never offered those EPIC LUNCH SPECIALS. The quality of the fish is nothing to write home about, but where else in LA can you drop a shy $15 and get a decent sashimi platter with salad, soup, and rice?TL;DR:IF YOU COME FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN THE LUNCH SPECIALS ($15 SASHIMI/CHIRASHI), YOU ARE DUMB.

Reviews.Author: Nicole N.
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to write a review since Sushi Gen already has over 2000 rave reviews. Regardless, Sushi Gen serves the best sushi I have ever tasted. The sushi joints near by pale in comparison to Sushi Gen's unbeatable fish quality and the amazingly efficient and prompt service. The times I have eaten here, I've only eaten at the sushi bar but I've heard of their great $15 lunch deal, which is only served at the tables. I would recommend the red snapper, toro and salmon sushi. To die for!

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: Make sure you call 2 weeks ahead and make a reservation unless if you're cool with standing for at least 40 min till a table opens up.Sashimi meals are really good.  It comes with cucumber salad in what tastes like a combo of sugar and vinegar.  Then they also serve you miso soup and green tea with the meal.  On top of that, there's rice and vegetable tempura.  If you are not a big eater, then one order can be good for two people.  But I eat a lot so that's out of the question.Sea cucumber - not for those with quesy stomachs.  It smells really fishy but I love the texture and crunch.Steamed egg - served on a dainty egg cup.  Very creamy.Uni appetizer - not worth the price.  I'd say its 2 pieces chopped uni mixed in something.Uni sashimi plate - the uni itself is tasted good to me as with everything else on the place but as what the patrons on the other table pointed out to our waitress numerous times as I was shoveling each piece into my mouth, it was not fresh uni.  It came in a bamboo box.  -.-  And they possibly cannot eat it or they get sick.  Whatever.  My stomach is used to third world country food.  I can handle an uni that came in a box.As much as I like this place, surprisingly I love the sahimi from this place right now the street.  Review for that one coming soon.You'll spend around $100 for two people plus tip.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: This is my all-time favorite sushi restaurant in LA now, and I've been to my fair share of them.  Let me start off by explaining how I learned about this mystical sushi restaurant.It all started out one day when I decided to challenge a couple of my friends to an "omakase-off".  What is an "omakase-off" you may ask?  Well it's basically when you take a group of know-it-all folks that think they know the best omakase place in the city to go to, and you go to each place to compare them.  Win-win if you ask me :)Anyways, Sushi Gen was the one they had nominated and I had nominated Asanebo in Studio City.  I should have known they would've won since Sushi Gen is in Little Tokyo.   Least to say, both places are awesome, but Sushi Gen won out due to  the caliber of the fish combined with the overall price.  When we went on a Saturday night the place was packed, but we ended up getting a great seat right in front of the sushi chefs.  Everything they prepared was very fresh and tasty, and I think it was even better than Sushi Nozawa back in the day.  We had so much to eat, but some of my favorites were the uni (sea urchin), salmon, sweet shrimp, yellowtail belly, snapper. and toro (tuna belly).  I actually usually don't care for sweet shrimp, but their preparation was excellent and made it creamy and sweet.The parking there was pretty simple as they have a lot right in front.  Service was very attentive.  Food was excellent.  I'll definitely be coming back here again and this will likely be my new top recommendation whenever someone says "lets go get some sushi".

Reviews.Author: Ann K.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait in line for 30 minutes or more.....Sushi Gen is ALWAYS packed and for good reasons. The reason I give it five stars is because of the price vs quality factor. They are known (infamous)   for their sashimi combos, sashimi deluxe. Btw you can only get the sashimi combo dinners at the table and NOT at the sushi bar. Their sushi is usually always fresh and the COMBOS are an extremely good deal ranging from 25 to 35 dollars. The uni combo is 40 dollars. You can also order a la carte (of course) but trust me get the Combos because you'll be trying a bit of everything and it's such a good deal.  Basically the best deal in town for the  high quality of fish you will be getting  which is why this place is SO popular. Love their dark green tea as well but the service is a hit or miss. It's always jam packed there and I see servers running around in havoc.

Reviews.Author: Victoria S.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi deluxe had unique flavours because not only do they have slices of fish but a palette of their house recipes on the side. I believe the wait is worth it if you make reservations and there's no wait at the bar. The only downside to the service is we weren't regularly checked upon and when my deluxe came out she neglected to inform me what was displayed. Just because we ordered the deluxe doesn't mean we know what the chef picked for us. It'd be nice to know what I was eating. You get what you pay for. The fish is fresh.

Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Got here 30 minutes before opening (10:45 am) on a Thursday in Honda plaza and a line was already forming. Park in the plaza and get 2 hours for $2 with validation from Sushi Gen during lunch. I'd say people who got there up to 10-15 minutes before opening were able to get a seat in the first round when sushi gen opened. Definitely get the Sashimi Lunch Special ($15). Best deal hands down with an assortment of sashimi, cooked fish, tofu, etc. It's not the highest quality fish you'll ever have per se, but the quality is up there and the assortment of items is wonderfully satisfying. I can't think of a better deal than this for japanese food.Service is rushed due to the number of customers they have to get in and out, but I thought they were efficient and friendly. There's a reason this place has so many reviews and yet maintains such a high rating on yelp... if you want japanese food for lunch, it does not get better than sushi gen.

Reviews.Author: Tamara K.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is amazing the service is unbelievable best sushi place in the world I will go back for sure

Reviews.Author: Sam Y.
Reviews.Content: Came here for one of our date nights and especially because my boyfriend and I are avid hardcore sushi fans. Our favorite sushi restaurant so far is Ohshima, and how did Sushi Gen fare compared to Ohshima? Not quite there yet.Gen is good, don't get me wrong, but it's missing some kind of Japanese authenticity that Ohshima offers. Fishes were good and fresh and I liked how it was "unlimited" omakase. Unlimited in a sense that you can tell the chef when you want to stop as opposed to being just offered 10 or so different fish. However, you do still have to pay for every fish you order. We racked up a $240 bill just for the two of us. Oops. It's ok though because we don't dine like this that often, right?I haven't tried the chirashi bowl but we were eyeing it the whole night. It looked scrumptious. Maybe I can try it next time.

Reviews.Author: Fujiwara S.
Reviews.Content: I so much enjoyed almost same level sushi in Tokyo. Sashimi moriawase, salmon skin was a great starter. As a main dish I had sweet shrimp, fatty tuna, engawa, and Japanese mackrel which was amazing. And plus, I have to insist that I had a miso soup with sweet shrimp head.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine L.
Reviews.Content: I love their lunch special for sashimi ! Good portion with many different sashimi ^_^ recommended to go there early 1130am so you don't have to wait too long. If you are rush to somewhere you may seat sushi bar with minimum 4order sushi ^^

Reviews.Author: Anna Y.
Reviews.Content: Found this place on yelp while I was visiting LA , the wait was so  long !  Was it worth the wait? i didn't think so . We ordered a sashimi deluxe, uni , eel and miso soupClam miso soup - really good miso soup , the clam made it really tasty. Tofu miso soup - your ordinary miso soupSashimi deluxe- an assortment of sashimi , they were okay not like super fresh. Uni & eel - really nothing spectacular

Reviews.Author: Gavin K.
Reviews.Content: Went there for lunch. Waited an hour. Would do it again. What is there to say the food is traditional and simple as they mean it to be.  Ika, uni, and ikura is fresh and salmon is at the right temperature nothing is to cold and you can taste the fats. FYIIf you sit at the sushi bar the wait is generally shorter but you can only do a la carte.The lunch menu does NOT list the $15 sashimi set.  This is the thing to get.

Reviews.Author: Elaina P.
Reviews.Content: Long overdue update here. Yelp, it's been 6.5 years that I've felt bad about giving Sushi Gen 3.5 stars and I just can't stand the torture any more. Sushi Gen is a 5! It deserves all the stars! ALL THE STARS!I'm sure there is better sushi in LA but I am never rich nor ambitious enough to go find it. Sushi Gen is great and the fact that it's in my hood is even better. Now maybe I can finally sleep at night.

Reviews.Author: Tenzo A.
Reviews.Content: Now THIS is sushi! I'm so tired of all these Americanized sushi joints that soak the rolls in sauces and pill up a bunch of junk. The fish was sooo fresh and delicious - my mouth is literally watering talking about it. The kinda spot that has no soy paper and no spicy mayo We got there around 9:20 on a Friday night and waited 20min. We had the sushi deluxe - which was delicious but I think next time I'll stick to ordering what I liked - or the sashimi plate because that looked soo much better Make sure you get the Snapper sushi (which the waitress recommended) ohhh myyy goddd it was like butterThe salmon sushi was THE BEST I've ever had - you almost don't want to eat sushi anywhere else after eating here Id skip on the handrolls only cause I'm used to the Americanized style and there was hardly any fish in there

Reviews.Author: Anna P.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant was on my list of to go sushi in LA, but it wasn't my cup of tea.I was prepared for the wait and actually it only took 25 minutes instead of the promised 30-45. So it wasn't too bad. We also came early.We finally sat down and I was excited to try what the hype was about. We ordered a white fish with ponzu, shrimp/veggie tempura, toro/yellowtail/yellowtail belly/salmon/Japanese snapper/halibut sushi and a spicy tuna dish.The white fish in ponzu was tiny and ok. There was nothing outstanding about this. It was kind of like a little sample for you to try.The spicy tuna was served with nori and was one of my favorites. You wrap it inside the nori and eat it like a wrap. I believe there was no mayo in this and that's why it had a nice kick at the end.The tempura was by far the best! I usually don't like tempura, but this was to die for! Lots of flavor in this one...The sushi that I ordered was VERY average. The first bite I took was of a chewy fish. To me that is a very low quality place. Fish should never be chewy! The yellowtail belly that everyone raves about about was the worst one I've tried. Yes this piece wasn't chewy, but had 0 flavor. It didn't leave you wanting more that's for sure. The price was good. I didn't feel it was expensive for the amount of food we ordered. There's way more pricier places out there.Overall, for the long wait and completely mediocre fish I will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: Steph C.
Reviews.Content: I got the memo, you guys. Sushi Gen is great for dinner, but boy is it better to go for lunch.The doors open at 11:15, and if you want to make sure you get a spot in the first seating, you have to line up outside well before 11. I've been twice and I think we had to wait the first time. The second, my awesome mom showed up at 10:20 and was first in line. Almost overkill, but we were a party of six and booth seating is limited.Lunch service is very fast, so turnover is probably pretty decent. Servers are efficient and polite but not friendly; sashimi platters must get plated before the doors open. With the size of the lunch crowd, the speed and impersonality are desirable things.The lunch menu is full of well-priced specials, most of them centered around sushi and sashimi. You also get miso soup and pickles and some silky cold tofu with every meal.The fish is obviously the main draw at Sushi Gen. I think the sashimi lunch is the most popular item. It's a great deal, with something like ten kinds of fish for $15. All fish is top quality, and there's a nice variety to the plate. The sushi deluxe is also good, with one piece each of several nigiris, along with some cucumber and tuna rolls. The deluxe combination comes with tart slurpable mozuku and an excellent salmon skin salad. If you want to go big, I recommend the uni sashimi combination--it comes with a sashimi appetizer and a whole box of creamy, briny, beautiful uni, surrounded by even more sashimi. It's a good one to split, since it's less of a budget option at $35. The only thing I'd recommend skipping is the giant clam special. It's cooked and tough and kind of weird.Sushi Gen has to be one of the best lunch spots in L.A., and it has the crowds and Yelp reviews to match. The sushi and sashimi are excellent, and the value is pretty unbeatable. If you haven't gone yet, I suggest you get in line.

Reviews.Author: Heidi H.
Reviews.Content: BE PREPARED for the long ass wait.  DON'T come here starving.   Ugh the BF and I went starving & we were SOO grumpy by the time we were seated.  There was room at the bar but we waited for a table cause I really wanted tempura for some reason that day.Their dinner combos are HUGE and sharable.  We ordered a sashimi tempura combo, salmon and yellowtail belly sushi, uni, and various rolls.  It ended up being too much food and could barley fit on our tiny table.  EVERYTHING was delicious and seemed fresh.  Yellow tail belly was SOOOO good! This is a place for authentic Japanese sashimi/sushi lovers.  Worth the wait? Yes and no.  Just don't go starving and hopefully it would be for you.

Reviews.Author: Lorraine P.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi, so good. Waited for ever, it was worth it but I can't give 5 stars because the wait really Is that bad. Waited for like an hour and a half, maybe 2. I basically lost it. BUT it's definitely worth trying once in your lifetime.  It was round 3 of my birthday food conquests, no ragrets!

Reviews.Author: Jade P.
Reviews.Content: Great quality and quantity of sashimi for $15! ( lunch menu) definitely worth the drive and wait.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.Here's the thing, if you want amazing sushi you have to shell out the pesos for it. If you want to stuff your face, sushi shouldn't be the food for you if your looking for quality on a budget. Be real and get your shit together.Pricing:For sushi, though people may complain about the pricing, in my personal opinion, for what you get, it's well within its worth. It's not STUPID expensive in the sense that for about 50 dollars a person, you can get a pretty amazing meal of fresh fish.Quality:I personally think that the quality is representative in it's price. It's not the MOST amazing sushi I've ever had but it is DELICIOUS. All in all, the price reflects the flavor and quality well.What I get:Chirashi. I love the charashi here. Lovely assortment of fish for a decent price.Tip:Get there right when it opens for dinner or lunch or be prepared to wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Brad L.
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this place has such a high rating. Their sushi are definitely not the best I've had. Service is not top par. And the ice water glass smell fishy which is totally not acceptable for a restaurant aimed at high end market. Menu is not clear and the amount of food is really not enough for anyone. Not recommended.

Reviews.Author: Tracie P.
Reviews.Content: Always fresh fish and great Japanese dining experience every time I go there. Long wait, but defiantly worth it.

Reviews.Author: Diane W.
Reviews.Content: Having fun at the bar with the Chefs is a great time. Buy them a beer and they will party with you all night long...Over the past two years I have tasted myself thru their menu several times and it always reminds me why I come here - the food is great. It is real Sushi Gen, not the "politically correct" stuff. You get good portions, but it adds up, especially several Supporos later.

Reviews.Author: Eunice K.
Reviews.Content: BEST SUSHI EVER!  I had lunch with my cousin and friend and the sushi is the best I have ever had! The sushi melts in your mouth and is amazing. I didn't know how good the tuna roll or cucumber roll could be. It is so so so good! The price for lunch seemed fairly priced. I think they require at least $10 per person because we ordered two sushi things and the lady told us we had to order one more thing. The parking inside the sushi store is cheaper than street parking because they also validate for parking (2 hours free)

Reviews.Author: Tony W.
Reviews.Content: I got the sashimi deluxe todayI have seen many good views about this but I'm rather disappointed.Quantity is 5 stars but quality is 2-3starsI could taste some fish scales and the tuna had chewy" in between parts"

Reviews.Author: Joyce M.
Reviews.Content: Got the lunch special to-go.What a great value for the price! Having heard so much hype about Sushi Gen, I couldn't wait to chomp down some fresh sashimi. The trick is to order over the phone and take the meal to-go instead of eating inside. You'll save so much time and it's just as good. The lunch special comes with about 15 pieces of fresh fish. It also comes with a box of rice. I'm typically a big eater but this was a hard battle to defeat. By the end of the box, I was collapsing over full of food. I definitely recommend this to all friends! A great value for exceptional sashimi.

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I have been to. Pretty much all the reviews listed before me had taken all the comments and compliments. This place definitely deserves 5 stars. The restaurant needs to be bigger to fit all the people waiting outside

Reviews.Author: Nik E.
Reviews.Content: If you come during the week get there before 6:30pm or expect a looong wait. The food is pretty great. Go for the shashimi deluxe and you'll be on your way. They recommend that it's for two people but not really if you're a shashimi lover. The Salmon Skin Roll tasted over cooked.The service is sub par. I was given the shashimi platter and I wasn't given the deets about the dish at all UNTIL I asked what I was going to eat. The waitress didn't even check in with me as I ate. Great foodLess than great service

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of my favorite sushi places in LA/California. I actually heard about this place because the sushi chef here was on Throwdown with Bobby Flay. But that's not important...what is important is the quality of fish and food here. Two words: LUNCH SPECIAL. For a mere $15, you get quality sashimi at a pretty large portion. There's three types of tuna (maybe more), ika (squid), salmon, dried fish, yellow tail and possibly other types of fishes that I don't remember. All of it is super fresh, melts in your mouth and, again, a bang for your buck! Definitely worth the wait. BUT, only come here if you enjoy authentic sushi and sashimi because you will not find those fancy, Americanized rolls with tons of sauces and fried stuff on them.TIP: Come here around 10:45 if you want to be seated first. People start lining up around 10:30. I swear it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Dani H.
Reviews.Content: It's okay. Not sure what the crowd is about--this place isn't something to wait for.Lots of tempura. Tempura everything. And WAY expensive.Maybe don't go.

Reviews.Author: Y M.
Reviews.Content: The treatment from the host tonight was really horrendous. They have a strict policy on not seating your party until everyone is present. That's understandable, but the arrogance and tone was just inexcusable. I suppose that since the restaurant has a steady stream of customers, it no longer cares about customer service. My family has been coming to this establishment for years. We were here to celebrate a birthday, but the attitude and vibe ruined a special occasion. By the way, don't even think about bringing a cake. They won't even let you take it out of the box.

Reviews.Author: Alfred M.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars! So last monday I tried taking someone somewhere nice, and it was closed. Perfect. I was at a loss. In little tokyo, the food is extremely hit or miss. The misses aren't even close. I was worried I was gonna end up settling for some crap, when she spoke up and recommended Sushi Gen. Open on Mondays, sweeeet. Ordered some monkfish liver, and the deluxe sashimi plate. I have had issues with monkfish liver. I know it's a delicacy, and I've tried it on a couple of occasions, but here it was so fresh, sort of crumbly, and had a little soy based sauce with some scallions and some finely shredded shallot on top. It was beautiful, and delicious. Pungent, dense, creamy, nutty, and great. I'm a fan, but it has to be somewhere REALLY good, I know that now. The sashimi was excellent,. in particular the clam and the octopus were my favorites, but they always are. I'll be back here. The reason this place gets 5 stars though, is the whole experience. I was blown away on my first shot, something that rarely happens. We didn't have to wait that long, the service was efficient but stayed mostly out of our way, and we had an awesome meal. I'm actually going to have to go back to my favorite sushi spot now, and see if it really is my favorite anymore. It shall remain nameless, since it is also very very good.

Reviews.Author: Bailey Z.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special FTW!This popular lunch spot is well-known for their sashimi lunch special, which definitely lived up to the hype. It comes with miso soup, soft tofu, pickled vegetables, and a large bowl of rice. The plate itself consists of several different varieties of fish including three types of tuna, yellowtail, squid, crab, cooked salmon, fermented fish, amongst others I couldn't recognize. I've had my share of expensive sushi and the sashimi here is right up there. The tuna and yellowtail were the best of the lot; the thick cut slices were melt-in-your-mouth buttery. I also loved the fresh crab. Everything was delicious, even the wasabi tasted better here. Other menu items that looked good were the kumamoto oysters and the uni. Make it a priority to come for lunch if you get the chance. I guess it's not really a secret that it's the best sashimi lunch in town anymore. Parking can be annoying, but validation drops the price to a couple of bucks.

Reviews.Author: Alison W.
Reviews.Content: This has been on my to-eat list for quite some time. Finally, I was in the area during a weekday for lunch and we stopped by. There was quite a lot of people waiting outside around noon. But the host assured us it was only a 10 minute wait. Tip: We walked over to Frances Bakery in the same strip mall and got some cronuts to tide us over. More like 15 minutes later, we were seated at a table. The sushi bar was fully open but you can only order al la carte sushi there not the lunch specials. And we all ended up with the sashimi combo for $15. Well one of us got the chicken teriyaki with sashimi combo. But what a steal. It also came with tofu, miso soup, pickled cabbage and rice. So much food, it was a struggle to finish it all but I did. Maybe if I didn't have that cronut beforehand. Haha. For the sashimi, there was tuna, yellowtail, some minced up raw fish, cooked salmon, seaweed, some white gelatinous stuff, shredded crab, and some other stuff. Wish they had some raw salmon. But otherwise everything tasted fresh and was delish. I will def be back. Service was quick and efficient. In and out within a half an hour and more sashimi for the next person. Also parking in the lot for $2 with validation.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey L.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely worth the wait. The food is great and very fresh! The presentation is also gorgeous. My favorite item to get is their Chiraishi bowl which is a rice bowl topped with a variety of sashimi. Always crave this dish. This is a very popular restaurant so don't expect to get parking in the lot in front of the restaurant on the weekends. There are lots of parking lots nearby, so we usually park at one of the bigger lots a block away and walk. The restaurant is in the heart of Little Tokyo so the area is a nice place to explore and walk around.

Reviews.Author: Tai Z.
Reviews.Content: Terrific sushi? Yes.Worth the wait? Debatable.I've been here a few times, and I don't personally find that Sushi Gen is so head and shoulders above everything else in Little Tokyo that I would want to wait here to eat rather than go somewhere a little less popular or off the beaten path like Sushi Go 55, Oomasa, or Mako. Maybe my taste buds are just too crude to know the difference, but I think there is a bit of a Bottega Louie effect where the critical mass of 2000+ reviews has built up the sort of enormous hype that draws in a disproportionate number of followers who want to see what the fuss is all about. These same people, after experiencing what is legitimately very good sushi, inevitably leave 5 star reviews to confirm the bias after having forgotten the hour+ of their life wasted standing among an impatient throng of sushi aficionados.I actually like Komasa more personally, but I'll give you that the selection there is not nearly as extensive, and the wait can also get pretty daunting unless you're one of the first 20 people there.

Reviews.Author: Katie D.
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I ate at a restaurant by myself in a while (not counting airports of course)...11AM and the wait is already 40min+ for a table. So I said screw the lunch special, let me just sit by the sushi bar.What I got in order of how I liked them...1. Toro - oh man oh man, amazing. Just look at that marbling!! So sweet and melts in your mouth. Loved it!2. Scallops - super fresh and light.3. Monk fish liver - creamy and very tasty. the older chef gave me a dollop of seaweed to put in the dish, and I thought that really made it better. chef knows best =)4. Sweet shrimp - definitely fresh but not as crisp as I had expected, perhaps even a little too mealy for me. I liked my sweet shrimp at Hide on Sawtelle better (that thing was still moving on the sushi rice!). But the fried head was really good, especially with roe inside.5. Salmon - meh, a bit disappointingly normal.Took only 30min to rack up a $50 bill... By myself... Oops... Guess when you have no one to talk to, all you do is stuff your face.

Reviews.Author: Tammy W.
Reviews.Content: The value you get for your sashimi here is unbelieveable.  We got the sashimi deluxe of 35$ and two pieces of sweet shrimp nigiri, I think it was 13$. The sweet shrimp were definitely great and fresh, but the value of the sashimi is unbeatable.  My boyfriend and I easily got full off of just the sashimi deluxe, it had TamagoOctopus (cooked)spicy tuna blob regular mashed tuna blob Salmon Mackeral Tuna Fatty Tuna Kelp what looked like preserved eel I think raw squidlooked like bass Yellowtail two pieces of shellfish (can't remember the name)Cooked salmon chunk The variety and quality of the sashimi plate was wonderful, I don't think I've ever gotten a plate where I dug everything there. I think the best pieces were the Tuna, fatty tuna and the yellowtail. So GOOD.

Reviews.Author: Charlene L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen has great lunch specials! My sister and I were in the area and decided to test our luck on a weekday lunch, hoping the wait would not be too bad. We arrived at 11am but sadly did not get seated until 12pm. Now I understand why my family tends to wait outside before they open to avoid the long wait times. Sashimi Lunch: I have never tried anything else on the menu because this is pretty much what I have gotten every time I've been here. If you dine in, they also offer miso soup and a small tofu appetizer. I wish there was a bit more variety in the sashimi offered in their lunch special considering about half of it is tuna in some form or another. However, it is a great deal for $15! The sashimi is fresh and absolutely delicious. Personally, I don't think it is worth the long waits. There are other places in the area with just as fresh sashimi without the ridiculous wait time. The lunch specials at Sushi Gen are definitely a steal though! I believe their teas were complimentary a while back but now they're $1.50 each. If you manage to score a parking spot in the lot, it's only $2 for 2 hours with validation :)

Reviews.Author: Sherlyn S.
Reviews.Content: Second time here... Why did it take me long to come back?Sit at the sushi bar, even if it's a longer wait, you'll get to see the chefs do their magic at crazy speeds. Grab a drink right next door at the tapas place while you wait, it has pink fuzzy walls and waitresses dressed in anime style attires - weird? Yes, but I dig it. Def do the omakase at the sushi bar. I like to try different varieties of nigiri so I let my lucky companion finish my second piece but after a few rounds I ask for just one per order. Normally not a fan of uni as it can be very fishy but it's heavenly here... Great silky texture and subtle taste of the sea goes so well with the crispy nori delicately wrapped around the slightly salty vinegary soft warm sushi rice. Is your mouth watering yet? Mine is just recalling my dining experience.Everything was phenomenal but here were some other highlights: red snapper, unagi, raw scallops, raw sweet shrimp and sayori. For the sweet shrimp, get the heads fried and eat it all! Eyes and brains and tentacles ... Yummmmeeeee

Reviews.Author: Sarah W.
Reviews.Content: I took a day off work to play around and go to lots of new (to me) places in LA.  I've read about the Sushi Gen lunch special and have wanted to try it for a while.  When they say you need to get here early, you really do!  We went on a Monday at  10:00 am (it opens at 11) and there were already some people in line - maybe 15 or 20?  We decided we were going to chance it so we drove the two blocks over to the LA Flower Mart and did a quick walk around for 15 minutes and then came back.  We were back by 10:30 am and the line was now long!  We waited until 11 when the restaurant opened and just missed the first seating.  We put our names in and went over to the little Asian grocery store nearby.  We bought a couple snacks and a beer which we paper-bagged while walking around  and then went back to the line about 45 minutes later.  They seated us shortly thereafter.The $15 dollar lunch special comes with an assorted sashimi platter, rice, miso soup, some soft tofu, and some picked vegetable.  The sashimi isn't the most beautiful cuts you've ever seen, but it still tastes great and I was stuffed!  Can't wait for my next day when I play hookie from work!Insider tip: The Japanese ladies waiting in line in front of us told us that the jewelry store that is right next door has good prices and they often shop there while waiting in line.  This time was no exception - one of them bought a beautiful pearl pendent on a gold chain while we were waiting!

Reviews.Author: aaron s.
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest Japanese restaurant in downtown LA. Fresh tasty sashimi deluxe is the best.

Reviews.Author: Eeeeestar T.
Reviews.Content: I'm a Sugarfish type of girl, so the variety on the Sushi Gen menu nearly short-circuited my brain. Luckily, it seems like you can't go wrong with the sashimi platter here...as much as I missed my usual Trust Me flow, that huge and diverse assortment of fresh seafood was an awesome change-up.

Reviews.Author: Rosa S.
Reviews.Content: The hype here is REAL! I'm glad that once I got here, the wait didn't take long since I had someone waiting there for an hour before I came.. SORRY! lol anyways what can else I say that hasn't been said? This place serves up some really good sushi! I got the omakase and none of the fishes that I got to eat here disappointed me! I ate past my limit just to try all the fishes that I could... So worth the food coma!

Reviews.Author: Leena A.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST & FRESHEST Sushi I have ever had!Every time I have been there has always been a wait. Proves how popular this place is. But last time I made a reservation and it was perfect, we walked in and the table was ready on time. But I gotta say, if its just 2 people going I would recommend the sushi bar. Its perfect you just order little by little.

Reviews.Author: Justin Y.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of THE BEST lunch specials ever in the DTLA area. The $15 lunch special has been inflation-resistant for YEARS (quite an amazing thing if you think about it...) and you gotta love Sushi Gen for that. There's always a wait, but if you arrive early (i.e. 10:30am) you should be okay. It's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Karen Y.
Reviews.Content: Sushi gen is one of the places where I would see the line and go elsewhere.  I am always in tow with someone who will just not wait.But I went with the flow since I was meeting up with high school/college friends and one of them is going through a long Asian food dry spell, especially good sushi dry spell.Well, my little one was not happy with the wait and even a macaroon from France's couldn't change his mood.  20 minutes later we were seated, and the perseverance was rewarded with excellent sashimi.  Buttery, fresh and cut into perfect little bit sizes.  I wish I ordered the full sashimi lunch but the little one is not quite ready for it, so I ordered the combo with salmon teriyaki.  Not a big fan of teriyaki sauce in general, but I would make an exception for it here.  It's not too sugary sweet and didn't over power the salmon which was grilled perfectly, skin crispy and fish was moist.  Tofu must be very good, my son didn't share it with me and he generally will not eat it either.The sashimi was worth the wait, for the cost it's some of the best I have had in LA.

Reviews.Author: Miriam Z.
Reviews.Content: Went to sushi gen yesterday for a lunch with my husband. We decided that we gonna seat at the counter  cause all other tables were occupied. There is a min. 4 order per person, which i hate but we were like ok.Well sushi was ok, definitely not the best i have ever head and it rolls were kinda small.Me and mu husband order together 8 kinds of different sushi and still were hungry.What I didnt like is that they dont show you price on sushi, we had no idea how much it was gonna cost.We paid $55 plus tip and left hungry. To compare when we go to Komasa we pay around $25 and are fullDefinitely won go there again.Thank you sushi gen but I have no idea why are you so popular.Just a small tip. I love Komasa which is just down the street and I have a foodorgasm everytime i eat there. Their sushi rolls are to die for.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: Downtown little tokyo.... traveled solo from orange county. Didnt feel like waiting for an hour so I did omakase at the bar. Oh boy did I not regret it. What can say when they habe allready 2000 + reviews allready? The food was really fresh and omg the toro just melted in my mouth. Parking sucks but I went on a weekday and had no problems. Remember to bring your ticket to get validated.

Reviews.Author: Sally M.
Reviews.Content: Opens at 11am???? Really? Cuz it's 11:15a and your customers are all still waiting outside..and this is the 3rd time in a row for me. If you don't plan on opening on time, you might as well change your business hours.Food is good.

Reviews.Author: Kate B.
Reviews.Content: When I think lunch special, I ALWAYS think Sushi Gen because their weekday Sashimi Lunch is probably one of the best deals in Los Angeles. For only $15, you get a full plate of fresh sashimi. Every single bite is fresh and amazingly delicious. You are definitely getting your money's worth.The Sashimi Lunch comes with a bowl of rice, miso soup, and a small plate of warm tofu. There's something about the rice too that makes the meal even more amazing. Because this place is amazing and worth your every penny, there's always a wait at lunch time. I suggest you either come right when they open or just be patient. You can also walk around Little Tokyo for a little bit while you wait so it's not that bad. They validate your parking here - $2 for 2 hours.

Reviews.Author: Alice Y.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen has the best, freshest sushi in Los Angeles. Bar none. The fact that they're not open for business on Sundays goes to show that they will not not serve you day-old sushi. Fish markets are not open on Sundays in LA!The only way to dine at this fine establishment is omakase at the bar--the price is reasonable and the interaction with your chef provides the complete experience. You can also order two separate pieces as opposed to a pair per order.The toro is by far my favorite. It's so soft it melts in your mouth like butter. And the scallop is simply divine. I didn't even like scallop. Now I know it's because I've never had really good scallop before!For those who complained about the rice being too warm or that the sushi collapse while being picked up--please know that authentic sushi is made with loosely-packed warm rice eaten by HAND, not chopsticks! And turn the sushi upside down when you dip (lightly) into the soy sauce dish and ingest with the fish touching your tongue first. It makes a whole world of difference. Under no circumstances should you ever use soy sauce on scallop or sweet shrimp.I've been here for more than 3 times since I found out about it a few weeks ago. A really awesome place to bring a date or significant other, but might be problematic with a bigger group.No reservations for the bar. So come early!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline T.
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why this place is highly rated, and absolutely JUSTIFIED. Even on a tues nite 6pm, we waited for 20 mins to get a table for two. RESERVATIONS recommended! The food was orgasmically pleasing. Everything we ordered exceeded our expectations. Ordered the following (I'll even categorize for you!):MUST GET: MONKFISH LIVER (for those pate lovers)YELLOW TAIL BELLYExceptional:Steamed Clams (bigger portion than I expected and the broth was good!)Eel Avo Roll (the eel was warm, just melts in your mouth)Sashimi Dinner (portion is larger than expected: comes with 8-10 pieces, the deluxe comes with 15-20 pieces. the sashimi is unique because it also comes with different sides like: broiled salmon, spicy tuna mix, etc.) Good:hot house sake (large :P)could do without:smoked salmon salad (not bad, but would rather replace this with 93845734x more of the yellow tail belly mm~) We finished EVERYTHING!The service was on par! It could get a little loud during a full house, but it's bearable. You really come for the FOOD!

Reviews.Author: Mykael R.
Reviews.Content: There's no need to even review this place, just look at the 4.5/5 rating. #RARE.Come for their $15 sashimi lunch, but be prepared to wait in line for a v long time.

Reviews.Author: Kristie W.
Reviews.Content: Even with a reservation, my party of 4 waited 15 minutes to be seated.  Not a huge deal to us, but some may think otherwise.  I was delightfully surprised by the high quality of sashimi and sushi at Sushi Gen.  I ordered a few pieces of nigiri here and there and my favorites of the night were the o-toro (very buttery and tender) and the amaebi (fried heads on the side of course!).  For those uni lovers out there, my friend ordered the uni dinner which looked very impressive, and also came with some assorted sashimi.  For $40, she said it was worth every penny.  Service was excellent and our waitress was more than willing to answer our detailed questions about the dinner sets.  Everything was a bit pricey, but you get exactly what you pay for.  I'd definitely come back for our next special occasion!

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!Lines can be very long most of the time, but it's well worth the wait.Fish are very fresh and of good quality. Prices are very reasonable too.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen do not play when it comes to their sashimi lunch special and lunch rush.  For $15 dollars, you get an assorted sashimi platter that comes with rice, miso, soft tofu, and some pickled cabbage. Talk about bang for the buck! I got there about 35 minutes before opening and the lines were long! It covered about 6-7 storefronts! RIDICULOUS! Once open, they will seat everyone until they hit capacity. For the remaining folks in line, be sure to continue waiting in line until you reach the podium. Your name will be put on the waiting list. We got sat by noon. It's definitely worth the wait.The sashimi platter came with squid, yellowtail, tuna, spicy tuna, and a few other types of fish. I was stuffed by the end of the meal.I remember coming here awhile back and got the same platter during dinner for double the price. Service: On point. Server knew exactly what we wanted. Quick and efficient. We were in and out within 45 minutes. Parking: Park in the lot and bring your ticket for validation. I believe it's $2 for 2 hours.

Reviews.Author: Ziqian G.
Reviews.Content: Waiting time is a little bit too long. Food is so good!

Reviews.Author: Anna C.
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews warned vegetarians to stay away and if you are one, you should listen. Sushi lovers will love this place. My co-worker said her shrimps were so fresh that they were literally alive 2 minutes prior to laying on her plate. My two stars is for their vegetable roll. So overpriced ($15 + tax + tips) and lacking that everyone who saw my lunch felt terrible and started donating me their side seaweed. The vegetable roll is the only vegetarian offering from this restaurant. It is so lame that they should just not offer it at all period. When I asked the manager what's inside the vegetable roll since the menu made it sound all fancy... he said a bunch of names in Japanese and made the roll sounded awesome...when the roll came... I saw avocado, cucumber, and something white wrapped in seaweed. It was so simple that it could be an encyclopedia definition for minimalism.*Facepalm*

Reviews.Author: Nancy X.
Reviews.Content: Sigh :( I feel really lame for not liking this place, but I gotta be honest. Maybe it's because I don't live near Little Tokyo? Maybe it's because my palate isn't refined enough? Or maybe it's just cause this place is kinda overhyped...Came here for lunch at 10:30 am, because I heard that's how you do it to avoid the lines. And damn, were they right! We were 5th in line, but by the time Sushi Gen opened at 11:15 (oh yeah, Yelp, Sushi Gen opens at 11:15, it even says so on their website, so I dunno why Yelp says 11 am....) there were a good 30+ people in line.That made me excited, because I was like, damn this place must be good if people wanna take their lunch breaks early to wait in line.We were seated quickly, and the waiters and waitresses were SUPER attentive, taking our order right away, bringing us water, bringing our food quickly, pointing out the bathroom, etc. We got the sashimi lunch special (which was on everyone's table) and the sashimi/tempura lunch special. Both were $15, which was very reasonable. They came with miso soup, pickled vegetables, tofu, and a big bowl of rice. The soup and tofu was yummy.The tuna belly was buttery and delicious. The grilled salmon, not so much. The octopus, tuna, whitefish, and yellowtail (i think) were okay. The spicy tuna was pretty good, and so was this weird salty brown preserved eel in the upper lefthand corner (they're all plated the same). The non-spicy tuna mix was DISGUSTING! and so was the other thing on the left side of the plate. You know, you see the pictures. It's those 2 slices of unidentifiable white/translucent stuff with a sauce on it. I think it was just sliced konjac....It was not yummy.The tempura was...okay. It was not crispy and light like tempura I've had at other places like Maki and Sushi, Chiba, etc. It was weirdly doughy and the shrimp inside was overcooked :(Definitely a nice atmosphere with super sweet people, but all in all, I'd much rather just go to Maki and Sushi, where I can get the delicious sashimi and rolls I want at a decent price. It was worth a try, though.

Reviews.Author: Cara K.
Reviews.Content: Pricey but worth it.Orders come out quickly and everything going into your mouth will melt into fishy goodness.I definitely appreciate the thick cuts of fish in the sashimi dishes.I would suggest beating the dinner rush. Got in by 5:15 PM and by 5:30 there was a line out the door.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: Came here twice so far and each time the sashimi was fresh and tasted great. My girlfriend and I order the deluxe Sashimi plate, extra rice and maybe a couple of appetizers. For the quality of fish and the amount you get it, I would say this not only good bang for your buck but high quality food.   Service is very good from start to finish. I am definitely looking forward to the next trip to this spot.

Reviews.Author: Jane S.
Reviews.Content: I have heard plenty about their lunch specials however, I wouldn't say their sushi is spectacular. My family and I came here for dinner - ordered the sushi deluxe combination, sashimi deluxe and uni special. Uni special cost $40 and all it was was basically a larger box of uni that you can easily buy at any japanese market. With the uni special came seaweed, in just regular packets (as in those little plastic packs) - again, can buy for a much cheaper price just at a market. Out of all these combos, the uni special is the only one that comes with rice. The sushi deluxe has a lot of tuna is all I can say about that. And lastly, for the sushi deluxe combination -- I guess their sushi is pretty fresh but so are all the other sushi restaurants that I have tried in little tokyo (Oomasa, sushi enya etc.). Basically, one piece of unagi, tamago, snapper, tuna, fatty tuna, ika (actually can't remember the rest but it wasn't that much). I'm surprised they didn't have salmon though in the sushi combination. Tempura that came with the combo was no good. Miso soup too salty. Finally, the reason I gave it only one star was because of the service. My family and I were celebrating Mother's day a week in advance (to avoid all the full restaurants and whatnot). We had gotten to the restaurant at 5 pm, 30 minutes before they opened for dinner. We waited these 30 minutes to finally be ushered in around 5:35. We noticed that the guest immediately in front of us had been in the line alone but received a seat at a table waiting for 2. My family and I had been waiting on one more person of our party to arrive as they were caught in traffic coming to LA from the OC. So, the rest of us got a seat first and ordered in advance. However, when the last member of our party arrived, Sushi gen refused to let him have a seat at our table stating that all guests must have been present when seated. We had gotten to the restaurant early at 5pm just to be early enough to get a seat, knowing they had long lines. And now they were refusing our last member to eat all the food that we had ordered. We had already ordered more than $200 worth of food too. Not only that, when we asked if our last member could just have a seat, they threatened us to leave the restaurant within 10 minutes. It's understandable if the guest in front of us in line had also been refused a seat for not having all members in their party present before being seated - however, since they were ALLOWED to sit, we only thought it was ok for the last member of our party to be a few minutes late. The manager (I believe his name was James?) was rude when handling the matter, asking us to leave the restaurant in 10 minutes. With more than $200 of sushi on the table, we were not allowed to finish eating at a comfortable pace. Basically, our last party member had to drive an hour to get to Little Tokyo only to be kicked out within a few minutes without having enjoyed this meal.Honestly, I don't know why they have such high ratings. When you have to pay $3 for parking despite having validation, having to wait so long for a table, this place is overrated. Terrible service, not spectacular food. Why should anyone even come to this place...There's so many sushi places around the same area with far better service and quality of sushi. And of course, as everyone probably knows already, it's not like Sushi gen is cheap. Please, don't come here and give them high stars if they don't deserve it...

Reviews.Author: Jane L.
Reviews.Content: I came here ten minutes before dinner re opening and there was already a short line. I can only imagine how long it gets... We sat at a table. The place is a decent size so a good amount of people can be seated at once. Our waitress was definitely in a rush. She didn't do much besides the minimum since it was so busy. Just like the service the food was fast. Prepared quickly and brought to table quickly. We didn't order anything cooked except the side of tempura and misoThe food was fantastic. We ordered an array of sushi and my favorite was the hamachi, uni, and toro in that order. The fish was fresh and cut generously into thick slices. The rice was also really great so I recommend sushi pieces over sashimi.  Overall this place offers amazing food but the service is just okay but I guess it's understandable because the place is so busy.

Reviews.Author: diane k.
Reviews.Content: I will never come back to this place again. I was a fan of this place for many, many years, but now I'm letting this place go.If you would like to eat assorted sashimi or sushi platter stuff for lunch then sure. Go ahead and get seated at the tables and enjoy.If you want high quality and exciting sushi at the sushi bar then this is not the place for you. At least not any more.Last 3 times I was there sushi rice was worm and over cooked and salty. Seriously you're going to serve me that kind of crap rice for sushi? My new rule is if they don't serve you freshly grind wasabi and charge you $$$$ for sushi then all they want is your money and care less about your taste.

Reviews.Author: Ellen P.
Reviews.Content: I went here for lunch with my mom and we loved it! The lunch special is definitely worth the money!FOOD: We both got the sashimi lunch special and were so glad we did. You get a wide variety of sashimi and it is all very delicious and was only $15 each! How crazy is that.SERVICE: They weren't over the top friendly (which was expected because of how crowded/busy/hectic) it was but we didn't have any complaints.Try it out! But be prepared for long lines. Just a FYI, go at least 40 minutes before it opens if you want to avoid a long wait. Some people apparently wait up to an hour before it opens for lunch :O

Reviews.Author: Lori N.
Reviews.Content: Lunch Special was a steal! Fresh & great quality!Sashimi - $15Box Uni & Sashimi - $35 because you get a box. =PEven at 10:30 am, it was pretty packed. The wait was about an hour or so long, so prepare yourself to dwaddle around. I can't even imagine what Dinner looks like, if this is lunch.Lunch Special comes with pickled cabbage & miso soup. Yum!Tofu - it was slightly blanched in a broth, I would like to say a kombu/sukiyaki broth, not too sure. The flavoring was just right as it gave a little more flavor to tofu. Yum!Sashimi Combo comes with variety of sashimi as well as smoked salmon, spicy tuna, tuna, toro, yellowtail, squid. Quality with each was there as each piece was pretty fresh and melts in your mouth! However, the spicy tuna and such, I felt wasn't as great. Uni Combo - Box of Uni and all the varieties of Sashimi Lunch Special, but maybe a smaller portion. Uni was fresh, but maybe cause it was morning and I felt like it wasn't as fresh. I could taste a little of the freezer on some pieces, but not all. Still better quality than most other box uni. =] I would have preferred live with the shell, but hey you can't have it all! =]Overall: I see why there is a long wait, the quality is superb, lunchtime is a steal! However, I'm not so much of a fan of the wait. =P

Reviews.Author: Laura Y.
Reviews.Content: There's probably nothing I can say that hasn't been said in the previous 2000+ reviews before me. So why the need for a review? I've been coming here for lunch every Monday without a fail. I've always wanted that one spot that I can consider myself a regular at and I've finally found the place! The wait always varies but I've never sat right away. Shortest I've waited is 5 minutes and the longest is about 25 minutes. I usually get a Lavazza cappuccino and cronuts from Frances which is a couple stores down while I wait. I recommend getting there at 12:00 (after the first rush) or around 1:30? I think I've had the best luck at those times.Service is consistently good. They can get backed up on busy days but can you blame them?? Lunch is chaotic due to the amazing 15$ specials they offer. The servers do what they need to do. Take drink and food order, deliver the food, refill drinks, drop check. The food comes out slowly once in awhile and comes out lightning fast some days. We got our food within five minutes today. For two people, I would recommend one sushi deluxe and one sashimi deluxe combo. Or you can do what we did today and order a sashimi deluxe, sushi deluxe, and chirashi bowl and pig out! I think we're going to try ordering a $30 sashimi deluxe special next week and one sushi deluxe and see how that goes. If you ever have room for more, try ordering the snapper sushi and engawa sushi a la carte. If you have some money to spend, try the omakase at the bar as well. I believe it was about $100 per person and they give you the best fish of the night. It was well worth it-- comparable to omakase at Sushi Zo or Sasabune. Pretty awesome! One thing I do want to mention is that I do wish the sushi menu had prices listed for their a la carte items. The prices for certain items can be exorbitant! The quality of the fish will have you ordering more and you'll get the bill and be like damn I did some damage tonight. I'm sure I'll be a regular at Sushi Gen until I eventually move away from the downtown area. And even if I move away I'll make a conscientious effort to stay a regular. :)

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: I quit eating seafood especially sushi because the ocean is dying but i had a major cheat day and my good friend howard and i ordered the sashimi deluxe and then some.  The price is fair and the ambiance is simple which i like.  It can be casual or more dressy type of place depending on your preference.  the menu is different at the sushi bar and seated tables so that's something you might want to think about.  The parking is not bad at all $3 for a weekend.

Reviews.Author: DanVy N.
Reviews.Content: My faaaaavorite all time sushi joint!!!So sad I only recently discovered this gem as it's only 10 min away from my campus.  Discovered it during my 6AM rotations...lunch was the only thing that got me through the day! Haha. But anyways, this place is known for their amazing $15 sashimi lunch special! I was skeptical at how much sashimi it could be and the quality of it, but it did not disappoint.People start lining up before 11AM to get into the first wave. Expect to wait up to an hour or more if you don't get here early (or come on a rainy day like we did once and there was NO line!). There's also France's bakery in the same plaza, so if you're really hungry, you can grab some cronuts while you wait :). I'd save my appetite tho, cuz the lunch is actually very filling!The sashimi lunch deal consists of miso soup, a tofu bowl, and the main course, the beautiful sashimi plate. The fish is so fresh and seriously melts in your mouth, ESPECIALLY the toro. This was my very time having toro and it was love at first bite. I can't get over how heavenly the toro is. The rest of the plate is amazing too - i really like the tuna as well. ALSO, for an extra dollah, you can get SUSHI RICE instead of regular white rice! Pay that extra dollah, it'll be well worth it ;)

Reviews.Author: Anna K. S.
Reviews.Content: *LATE POST*Ate here a few years ago. I loved it but my husband did not. We ordered a few sushi items and a bento style dish with several different sushi and sashimi items. That seemed to be the popular way to go. It was a cool bento. Very expensive for our everyday budget.

Reviews.Author: Brad P.
Reviews.Content: There once was a man who suffered a great defeat at the hands of his enemies. Stuck in a strange land, stumbling around California, he sought the greatest piece of toro in the USA. His quest led him through twists and turns, through sunny beaches and stormy metaphorical seas. It ended at Sushi Gen.He found what he was looking for. There it was - perfectly colored and marbled with a pattern akin to the finest stones in the Vatican. The taste was perfect. The texture of the rice was perfect. The fish tasted as if it was caught moments before being placed into our protagonist's gullet. His strength restored with 1/125 of the soul of the fish who's meat he consumed, he picked himself up, put his sunglasses back on, and got back in the ring, ready to swing again.tl;dr - Sushi Gen has fantastic sushi.

Reviews.Author: Shasta M.
Reviews.Content: Great service, fresh fish... good stuff

Reviews.Author: Leanne T.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite sushi restaurants in the heart of Japan town in Downtown Los Angeles.  The place is run by Japanese people (so you know it's authentic), the sashimi is always fresh, and the menu is simple and basic.  We always make sure to sit at the sushi bar when we can.  They don't take dinner entree orders at the sushi bar, but why waste your stomach on tempura or gyoza when you can save room for delicious sushi made by some of the best sushi chefs in LA? If you do plan on coming here, the food is not cheap and the wait may be quite long.  But it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Leona S.
Reviews.Content: I've had this place bookmarked for years. Finally~~~ I got to try this place. Gawked at lots of pictures on Yelp and heard great things about this place. I brought my Japanese mom who would be able to tell what great sushi is.Made reservations for 6:30pm because I heard the wait is notorious. Thank goodness because there was a crowd of people waiting and it was only a Tuesday evening. We got seated right away. The restaurant is not big at all as many Yelpers have said before. The waitress was very nice and reminded me of my grandma a little. We spoke to her in Japanese because it just seemed easier.We got 2 Sushi Deluxes and al carte orders of ama ebi, uni, yellow tail belly and hamachi & negi handroll. First off, everything was extremely delicious and fresh. Service was very quick too! What stood out (excellent):- Ama Ebi w/ fried heads (so sweet and succulent)- Yellow Tail Belly (so smooth)- Medium ToroWhat was good:- Ikura- Egg (nice thick cut)- Unagi (it was seasoned nicely)The rest of the sushi deluxe was good but not anything mind blowing. I wish there was a piece of Salmon in there, but there wasn't. Not too much wasabi or rice in the nigiri which was good. I have to agree, this place will put a little dent in your pocket (total cost $105 without tip) which is a bit expensive for sushi. But you are getting quality, fresh sushi. You would easily pay that at a sushi restaurant in Japan. I'll be back for the lunch sashimi special!

Reviews.Author: Maryann T.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi plate was fresh and good! The rice was perfectly cooked too. Good service. Def recommend :)

Reviews.Author: Angie W.
