Reviews.Content: This has been on my radar for quite a long time, and we were finally able to come for the Sashimi lunch special!  I know it opens at 11 am, but we didn't get there until about 11:15 am and there was a half hour wait, which was no problem.  There were some sushi bar seats available, but they don't serve the lunch special at the bar.  :(  Just an FYI:  there is a minimum of 4 orders to eat at the bar. After we got seated, we ordered quick and they brought the food even quicker!  We saw a guy at the sushi bar exclusively making the sashimi lunch special.  It was amazing how many people order this hugely popular dish.  It is a great deal for the variety and freshness of the fish.  There were 11 types of fish, a couple of them were either grilled or smoked, but most were raw.  There were 3 types of tuna, we found out that one of them was toro & it was delish!!  There was grilled salmon and a sweek smoked fish that was really good but I didn't know what it was.  There were some yellowtail pieces that were very fresh.  The lunch special also came with tsukemono, miso soup and tofu.The service we got was pretty good, quick and friendly.  We were able to get out of there in about 45 minutes.  The location itself is not huge, I counted 18 tables and about 12-15 bar seats.  It is decorated pretty simply.  Most tables are 2 seaters or 4 seaters.Sushi Gen is located in the Honda Plaza across the street from the Little Tokyo Gold Line Station and the same parking lot as Frances' Bakery (known for macarons and their version of the cronut).  Park in the big parking lot - $2 for 2 hours with validation, it's cheaper than the street meters at $3/hour.  Better yet, take the Gold Line, its across the street!Definitely try it out for the sashimi lunch special!!

Reviews.Author: Ralph B.
Reviews.Content: Sushi purist? Go here. No flash, no gimmicks, no embellishment, just honest to God fresh fish, prepared the best way possible. By that I mean the least amount of hoopla. the fish speaks for itself. When you walk in take time to notice everything, how the tables are arranged, how the staff interacts with you, how you order and the food. You'll notice how different this place functions in a grand scale compared to other sushi places.+Lunch menu $15 special.+Tuna or GTFO

Reviews.Author: Tracie L.
Reviews.Content: Was craving sushi and heard about the awesome $15 lunch deal at Sushi Gen from many friends. My bf took me here and all I gotta say is CRAVINGS BEYOND SATISFIED END OF STORY. Coming from OC there wasn't too much traffic we arrived around 10:45AM and there was already a long line out the door. The restaurant is located in the Honda Plaza, validated parking is $3 for 2 hours, but if you're like us and feel like exploring little tokyo more and walking a bit to the japanese american museum then parking is $9 for all day which isn't bad. The anticipation and hunger standing in line was killing me as we waited til 11:30 for Sushi Gen to open!The restaurant is big yet small at the same time. It's big in the sense that there are 2 huge kitchens (makes sense w/ the amount of ppl they gotta feed). The inside makes me feel like I'm in Japan. The sushi bar seating is really clean and there are about 8 chefs working that section. There weren't too many tables which is why the restaurant is a bit small, hence the long lines.The service was really fast here, but not pushy. The waitresses were really friendly and helped us on deciding what to order since it was our first time. FYI the a la carte sushi/sashimi menu has no pricing you gotta ask for it. Right when we sat down we were given miso soup, pickled cabbage appetizer, and some sort of marinated tofu. THE TOFU WAS SOOOO SOOO GOOD! Tastes very house made and fresh.$15 Sashimi Lunch Special - Had to order this since it's their most raved about/popular menu item. Definitely best $15 you'll ever spend! There were thick cuts of sashimi along w/ other mixtures like spicy tuna, a piece of baked salmon terriyaki, jello, and some sort of marinated fish in brown sauce. The tuna was delish and very tender. My bf said it was comparable to the sushi places he had in Hawaii which were really good$18 salmon terriyaki combo - comes w/ a sashimi appetizer! BEST LUNCH COMBO EVER!! Where can you go that gives you a big nice piece of grilled salmon terriyaki w/ potato salad, cabage salad, miso soup, rice AND SASHIMI APPETIZER!? I honestly think this was better than the $15 sashimi lunch special. The terriyaki sauce was great, not overly sweet (but make sure you ask to put the sauces on the side like I did or else your meal will come out drenched in sauce) They do use thousand island dressing for the salad which I didn't really care for. The potato salad was creamy and gooooood. The sashimi appetizer came w/ yellowtail, seaweed, and tuna which were the same big thick cuts as the $15 sashimi lunch special.A LA CARTE SUSHI:Halibut - was about $9 for 2 pieces. The cuts of sushi were perfect. If you've ever watched Jiro Dreams of Sushi on Netflix you'll love Sushi Gen. The rice here is made just like in the documentary!! Omg best white rice I have ever eaten. Normally the rice that comes w/ the nigiri is either too dry, flavorless, or I don't care for it. However at sushi gen the rice is beyond perfect. The halibut tasted great w/ ponzu & wasabi sauceFresh Water Eel - I think this was around $8 for 2 pieces. By far the best Eel I've had. Almost wish I had ordered their Eel lunch bowl after eating this. There were nice big thick cuts of eel atop the rice. The sauce was not overpowering either and the nigiri wasn't drenched in sauce which is a good thing. The eel was tender and meaty.Definitely worth the drive up here to try the sushi. FYI my bf & I noticed after we were done eating (bout 12pm) that there wasn't too long of a line anymore. So if you don't feel like coming really early and waiting around, just come around 12ish :)

Reviews.Author: Claudia C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is the place where I first realized that I loved Sushi. I remember my dad chatting with the sushi chef and asking for a recommendation and the sushi chef plopped down two pieces of engawa that were lightly salted and sprinkled with lemon juice. I was familiar with sushi but had never had halibut fin before. I took a bite of that chewy but crisp slice of fish and I swear my whole universe stopped. I think that was the exact moment I realized how much i loved food as well. Claudibee the foodie was born! Fast forward 8 years, I was super excited to return to my childhood go-to sushi joint. And sidenote: for some reason, my dad and I never went back to Sushi Gen after my foodie birthday (I think we began exploring new sushi places?). My friend and I went 30 min before it opened to avoid the ridiculous lines and were promptly seated. I let me friend do the ordering (with the exception of engawa and kanpachi) and he chose sweet shrimp and yellowtail, hamachi collar, a beef dish, and salmon skin salad.MY THOUGHTS++ ENGAWA: i was hoping for an epiphany again but no fireworks this time. :(++ The sushi was better than average and nicely cut. However, I feel that there are many sushi joints out there that have similar good quality fish without the long wait and have better quality fish for the same price.++ the beef teriyaki (and other dishes) was (were) expensive and average. Why!?Perhaps my palate has matured over the years (or maybe my friend's choice in dishes isn't my cup of tea), but Sushi Gen no longer possesses that WOW factor it did for me in the past.Anyways, Sushi Gen is one of those sushi places where you must go at least once if you're a sushi lover. If I end up there again, I probably wasn't the one who suggested going there. I hate waiting in lines for food. :TBUT DO TRY THE ENGAWA!! Ask them to lemon and salt it. I hope your foodie universe stops the way it did for me! :D

Reviews.Author: Eunis H.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi platter FTW!!Fresh sushi!1. Quality sashimi (thats all that matters!)2. Long wait. Worth the wait3. Parking lot always full. Not good4. Did i mention, gooooood sashimi?!!Simple. Good. Sushi & Sashimi

Reviews.Author: Cindy N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing lunch special! $15 for a platter of sashimi with rice, soup, tofu and mini salad. I was skeptical about whether it would fill me up but I guess it all really does add up. I was so full by the end of the sashimi platter! They give you a little bit of everything--except salmon, which I was really disappointed about. And most importantly, the quality of the fish was good. My tips: Come around 10:45am (restaurant opens at 11:15). You'll be happier to wait that half an hour to be seated in the first wave rather than come later when there's a HUGE LUNCH RUSH.

Reviews.Author: Vince M.
Reviews.Content: As I was reading the reviews down below, there were a lot of good things about this restaurant and they were right! I arrived there at around 10:30 am and by the the time when it's 11:00 the line starts to get really long. Other than the wait, I ordered the $15 sashimi lunch special and oh my god the sashimi is like heaven on earth! As soon as I had my first bite, tears started to come out not because of the price, not because of the wasabi, it's because ITS THAT GOOD! There are many different types of fish that comes with a bowl of rice and miso soup. The fish is really fresh and it's high quality fish.  I can say that this is my favorite place to go to whenever im in LA. Make sure that you arrive EARLY and your whole party is there,  otherwise they won't let you in. Next time I  will try the bar and see what it's like.  Even though this place is small, I like the atmosphere. This is a good date spot whenever your hanging out either with your friends or even possibly with your girlfriend/boyfriend. I will definitely come back and try out new things.

Reviews.Author: Jackie W.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for DELICIOUS and EXCELLENT sushi this is the spot in little tokyo. Best sushi spot by far, hands down.  I think I've been to this place no joke 20 times. My family and I eat here almost every week or every 2 weeks for the past 2 years. It's bit on the expensive side, BUT you're paying for QUALITY and FRESH sushi. Everything here is good. We usually get the sashimi deluxe (it comes in a huge sashimi platter) side order of tempuras (which is fried to perfection and then we'll also order the chicken teriyaki. Probably the best chicken teriyaki I've had and then we'll also get the black cod or one of the other fishes. mmmm!

Reviews.Author: Ana C.
Reviews.Content: Line is loooong... And i got here half hour before they opened on a weekday (Tuesday) lunch.I got their special lunch.  The sushi is fresh, but IMHO it was OK.  I guess I went in with very high expectation due to all the reviews.  Definitely, it is not a budget sushi place.

Reviews.Author: Binh T.
Reviews.Content: Woah! This place is everything you'll expect from the reviews below! It was such a great experience and I left so full. Thanks to some of the reviews, the boyfriend had made reservations for our dinner. He was told they are very strict on attendance in a timely manner so try and get their early rather than later of you'll be waiting for quite some time. The wait time when we arrived for walk-ins was 30 minutes on a Wecnesday night at 7:30PM. The restaurant is located inside the Honda Plaza. You cannot see if from the streets but it's in there right on Central and 2nd. You can park at the lot for $3 with validation or find street parking. Parking after 8PM are free for the meters. All credit cards are accepted so bring your Amex!The restaurant was actually pretty small. They have a little dining area and then the sushi bar. When you sit at the sushi bar, you have a bar minimum to order. When you dine at the tables, sharing will cost you $10 a person. So... the boyfriend and I each got our own Sashimi Dinner Combination for $26 each. The entrée came with miso soup, some cucumber and seaweed salad appetizer, tempura (2 shrimps included), and about 8 different types of raw fish and a grilled salmon piece. Do not underestimate the portion when you first see it. Along with a bowl of rice, this will be a filler for sure. All the fish was delicious and fresh. The tempura was crispy, not soggy. The entire meal was worth the $26, in my opinion. Now for $15 during lunch, that's just a no brainer!Service was not that great. Our server hardly checked up on us. It took them a while to take our order as well and get us water. Once we paid, we had to wait more than normal also for them to run the transaction. Like I said, the restaurant is pretty small and they had plenty of serves... That was my only gripe of the night. Food wise, probably one of the best sushi places I have been too!

Reviews.Author: P S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a business lunch, and was really pissy at first about the long line to get in, before it even opened. And then I ordered a Salmon Teriyaki and I understood why we waited outside in the heat for so long..Oh My! This food is simply excellent. A little pricey, but the atmosphere is lovely and the service is great. I strongly recommend this for slightly formal, nice lunches/dinners.

Reviews.Author: Toa B.
Reviews.Content: There's nothing left to be said about this place that hasn't been said in the previous 2000 reviews.We came by here on a cold damp rainy Tuesday night with high hopes after reading the reviews and to be honest, it did not disappoint although there are certain expectations you should heed.1. Expect to be frustrated with the lack of parking2. Expect to wait for seating.3. Expect to wait outside for seating as the waiting area sits about 5 people4. Expect to talk a little louder as this place is bustling with people5. Expect to eat some of the best sashimi/sushi in LA6. Expect to pay a little more ($35 for the Sashimi Deluxe, $26 for Sushi Deluxe)7. Expect to leave a happy camper and wishing you didn't wait 6 months to finally come here.Stay Hungry!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer V.
Reviews.Content: Went here for the lunch special.  For $15 dollars, you get a plate full of sashimi, rice, tofu, and pickles.  Bang for your buck, if anything.  We also ordered yellow tail belly, toro, and sweet shrimp a la carte.  I'd recommend just ordering single dishes if your budget allows because they taste way better than the cuts on the sashimi lunch.  Either way, the fish was fresh and the meal was filling although I was a bit disappointed in the lunch special.

Reviews.Author: Claudine T.
Reviews.Content: My 100th review!!Like this place needs another good review, but it's a review well deserved. This place has always had great quality sushi for a great price. The sashimi lunch is a great deal. You will definitely get full with the amount of fish they give you. The sashimi dinner is almost the same thing plus a plate of tempura (not the best for the dinner price). They offer an uni bowl for dinner which is also VERY yummy!

Reviews.Author: Amber K.
Reviews.Content: I had my first Sushi experience here and wouldn't have had it anywhere else.Came here for my Birthday dinner and we didn't have to wait because we had reservations.  Spent around $400, but worth it!  Fresh!

Reviews.Author: Stefaney B.
Reviews.Content: 5 for sushi , 3 for miso soup . so it comes to 4 total . Overall I liked it .

Reviews.Author: John U.
Reviews.Content: Great food great price at fancy so if you are going just to eat it doesn't get any better.Sashimi special was the best call

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I can get behind this place. We were newbies. I mean I have seen the crowd outside this place every time we go to shabu-shabu house, but one day we finally decided to go right after work, and no wait! YES!Anywho, we  did the sushi deluxe and sashimi deluxe. Those were plenty of food. So for two I would suggest to go the route of sahimi deluxe and an array of ala-carte things :) Great place, great service, great food.

Reviews.Author: Gavin C.
Reviews.Content: Awesome sushi!The portions have gone down a bit, but the quality of the food and the lunch price is hard to beat.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: Since my roommate, Shoko O., of more than two years was leaving for New York soon, we decided to have one last lunch together in Little Tokyo. Though she has been to Sushi Gen for dinner already, we decided to have a go at the legendary $15 lunch special.We claimed a spot on the waitlist (45-minute wait), rushed over to Poketo to kill some time and came back to see that we were only two names behind from being seated.Before I got to even try the sashimi, one thing that stood out to me was the lightning-fast service. The lady who served our table was very efficient and, as soon as we sat down, took our order down and brought out our miso soup and tofu. Not too long after, the whole sashimi she-bang had arrived.Because the menu doesn't come with pictures and because I didn't bother to look at the photos on Yelp before coming to Sushi Gen, I was amazed by how good and fresh everything looked in front of me. The sashimi was bright and shiny and looked incredible.We began to chow down, and didn't exchange too many words after that. We were both silenced by the deep and natural flavors of the sashimi. The thinly-sliced squid with the light miso dressing was outstanding. The generous portions of tuna and fatty tuna were so delicious. I could describe each and every fish on my plate, but I won't so that YOU'LL TRY IT YOURSELF.As much as I'd want to keep this lunch special a secret, I'm pretty sure the cat's out of the bag. Even if you've already been to Sushi Gen once, you NEED to try this lunch special. I mean it -- get off the computer and try it now!

Reviews.Author: Richard B.
Reviews.Content: Waited over an hour for the sashimi lunch special.... But, am I complaining? No way!! It's worth the wait... And I had the time.Always good! You can't go wrong with their lunch special sushi or sashimi. Just be sure to get there early so you're one of the first ones to sit. Otherwise, your wait will be very long.Good eats!!

Reviews.Author: Edward P.
Reviews.Content: Pros: Always fresh and delicious, Sushi Gen is one of my favorite Japanese spots anywhere. I usually grab their Sashimi Lunch Special at least once a month.Cons: There is a long line so plan accordingly. Also, if you wish to not wait in line, you can also call ahead and pick up instead.Overall: Definitely check this spot out if you are in the Little Tokyo area.

Reviews.Author: Richard A.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Sushi Gen countless times - sometimes alone and sometimes with friends. The restaurant is very clean and the service is fast and attentive. The atmosphere is always cheerful and the patrons are usually willing to share in a sake or two.The bar regularly has a wide variety of fresh fish, but rarely sees specialty items such as amberjack, baby toro, or blue crab. Even when packed, the chefs are attentive and prepare orders quickly. The sushi rice is of a good temperature and prepared with fish in a good size that isn't too big to eat in one bite. I've had some good times at the sushi bar here, but I usually end up spending about $85 on myself without drinks. At that price, I'd rather go to Sushi Zo.The only time I sit at the table here is for lunch. Offering a wide variety of sashimi, grilled salmon, unagi, minced toro, and sometimes spicy tuna, the sashimi lunch is a great deal at $15. It also comes with tofu, pickled vegetables, miso soup, and a bowl of rice. I have noticed that the fish is not as fresh as the fish at the bar, so I assume this is a way for Sushi Gen to profit on the fish that has sat a few days at the bar. The fish is still of decent quality though. The clam special, baked giant clam and mushrooms on top of lemon slices, is also good.If you're looking for a true high end sushi experience, Sushi Gen is not the right choice. However, the sashimi lunch truly is a great deal if you're looking for your sushi fix. You should prepare to wait in line for about 30 minutes though. This restaurant has a strong following.

Reviews.Author: Lorena C.
Reviews.Content: The long wait is true and yes that sucks, but it is worth the wait. I am a huge lover of yellowtail and this place takes the cake for the best yellowtail. All of their sushi is delicious and like buttah! Prices are decent and it's a cute little place. If you're in the area stop in.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: Lives up to the hype! Came here for a weekday lunch - arrived ~30 minutes BEFORE opening and still had to wait about an hour. Ordered the $15 sashimi lunch as well the kanpachi head $18. The kanpachi head came with all the fixings (sides, rice, soup AND a sashimi side). For only $18!! The sashimi was really fresh and melt-in-your-mouth. It's not the BEST I've had, but seriously the value is GREAT. The rice was also really good..plump short grain. I'm not a big rice fan but I ate the ENTIRE bowl. And, the server asked us if we wanted more. The servers here are remarkably quick and efficient. We also received a free 2014 calendar!

Reviews.Author: Young S.
Reviews.Content: This sushi I never back againWe waiting around 50minuteWe order lot a thing but they sad lot a thingOut of orderVery suck me and my wife very upset. .

Reviews.Author: Julianne B.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 4:45 on a Saturday and there was already about 30 people lined up. By the time they opened at 5, the line was a lot longer!We sat down right away without waiting but I feel like eating dinner at 5pm isn't always do-able.We ordered:sashimi dinneroctopus sunomonoyellowtail collaryellowtail belly sushitoro sushiThis was too much food for 2 people. the sashimi dinner is too much food for one person and I honestly thought it was the weakest part of our order. There were a few pieces of fish on the plate I found less than impressive including the cooked salmon which was overcooked.The sushi pieces and the sunomono salad were top notch. And I ate every bit of the yellowtail collar.I would recommend to choose your sushi/sashimi pieces vs. ordering the set plate. Will likely be more expensive but you will have a better meal.

Reviews.Author: Henry O.
Reviews.Content: By far the best sushi you can get in Los Angeles. I know this is a pretty strong statement, but jeez, this place knows how to serve their food. Sushi Gen is always crowded whether you come for lunch or dinner. For dinner, I would recommend making reservations possibly two to three days earlier. I haven't came here for lunch but I've been told you can wait to get seated a bit easier. The lunch specials are a bit cheaper if you want to experience this restaurant without having to spend too much.  I brought a friend here who is also a sushi fanatic and we decided to sit at the bar. The chef greeted us and we chose all our favorites ranging from the simple cut of Tuna to Uni to Toro. Omg... The quality and the freshness of the fish was amazing. The amount of love and dedication that goes into every cut of the fish is noticeable when you put the food in your mouth. When you order the Sweet Shrimp, you have an option to deep fry the head or use the head for miso soup. Since the restaurant is located in the complex, you can go ahead and park in their parking lot. I believe they validate as well. Sushi Gen is my all time favorite sushi spot in Los Angeles. I personally believe Sushi Gen is the closest sushi and sashimi you can compare to Japan.

Reviews.Author: Christopher C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a wonderful little sushi joint in Little Tokyo.  Located inside Honda Plaza, this little hole-in-the-wall...well it's a little bigger than a hole, but not much bigger.  The place is tiny so if you don't like eating right next to someone, this might not be the place for you.  However, if you like fresh fish of the highest caliber then this is the place for you.I've been told the lunch deals here are very good and very affordable for the amount of food you get.  Unfortunately, we didn't go for lunch.However, that's not a detriment toward the dinner service.  The wait was long, but don't make the mistake we made and walk away just because they tell the wait is over 45 minutes.  The wait was actually far shorter than expected.  The service is pretty good.  If you sit at the bar like we did, order directly from the sushi chef.  Don't ask what's fresh today, because it's expected that everything is fresh.  Ask what would they recommend today and tell them what you usually like.  The chefs are fast and friendly.  The favorite cut of fish for us was the Fatty Tuna.  It was buttery and literally melts in your mouth, but everything else is good too.  If you like the old sushi nozawa, you'll definitely like Sushi Gen.Parking is available in the small lot at Honda plaza, but save yourself some cash and find street parking either on Third, Los Angeles or Alameda and take a short walk.

Reviews.Author: Alexis C.
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible. The waitress was super rude to my grandparents who go there weekly. Was late by 2 minutes for our reservations and they refused to seat us so we had to wait 2 hours for a birthday dinner, not to mention way over priced.There's great sushi everywhere in la. My money will go to a place like sugarfish and nobu. Will not be going here ever again.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: NEWSFLASH: You can get the sashimi lunch to go if you don't want to wait and at $15 its the best deal in America!  Also if you don't want to wait make sure to arrive at least 15 minutes before opening other wise you'll have to wait for the entire first seating to finish up.

Reviews.Author: Salma H.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushis I've ever had. I've been to a few sushi places in downtown, they're ether not good or they're too pricey.This place has really fresh fish, and they're very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Granola G.
Reviews.Content: With over 2200 reviews under its title and a 4.5 star average what can I say that hasn't been said already? Sushi Gen is the quintessential Japanese American restaurant. Perfect in its execution of authentic sushi, as well as staple Japanese American items such as teriyaki chick.Then why the 4 star rating you ask? Parking... I know it's down town but I just really hate having to pay for parking.

Reviews.Author: Luby H.
Reviews.Content: Good sushi and fresh fish, but easily not the best in the area.Came here with my family with a reservation on a Friday night, but somehow still waited over an hour to be seated. After the long wait, we ordered around 6 different dinner sets including the sashimi dinner, teriyaki dinner, uni dinner, chirashi deluxe, and other side items such as the fish chin, California rolls, and sweet shrimp sashimi. I personally was not too fond of our waitress. After ordering a decent amount for a family, we told her that she didn't give us enough rice, in which she doubted us, and started counting the number of rice bowls on our table (note: each dinner set comes with a bowl of rice), then pointed to my baby cousin and said he had that extra bowl of rice when really that was an extra bowl we had asked for the baby and put rice into it. Really?! Come on, how much can cooked rice be? After we explained, she reluctantly brought out snore howl of white rice for us, but the overall experience just wasn't very pleasant. I got for myself the sweet shrimp sashimi and the sashimi dinner, in which I didn't entirely love. For $26, the sashimi dinner did not offer enough fresh fish pieces, but instead, around half of the tray was filled with cooked seaweed, a chunk of spicy tuna and another chunk of some other ground fish mush. If I asked for sashimi dinner, I really am not expecting blobs of minced fish on my plate. The sweet shrimp sashimi on the other hand was just ok. It didn't taste that fresh and the shrimp was a lot smaller compared to what other Japanese restaurants normally serve you. We asked for our shrimp heads to be cooked into a soup, and that soup was probably my favorite part of the entire dinner. Since we were celebrating my uncles bday, we received a big scoop of free green tea ice cream which was nice. Overall, the bill for our family came out to $406 with tips, which was why I expected more out of the service instead of witnessing accusation and rice counting. Oh, and I wasn't happy about the fact that they charge $1 extra for each tiny plate of ginger upon not giving you any with the sashimi or rolls. Really?! It just seemed like they were way too calculative rather than customer service focused.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L.
Reviews.Content: The Sashimi deluxe is my regular choice. Each and every time, it has been outstanding.

Reviews.Author: Zane O.
Reviews.Content: Here's the skinny on Sushi Gen.1. It's fresh, the product is brought in daily and it has the taste and flavor to prove it!2. Customer service and price is unbeatable! Prompt, efficient, and excellent for sushi that came in that day3. Yes it's best to go with "reservation only" mindset, because getting in is a nightmare.,,and it's open pretty much 4 hours a day...just read 1 & 2 and you'll get over it. Oh and good luck finding parking, wear comfortable shoes kids.4. To my fellow gentlemen...take your sushi/roll loving lady here...please do yourself that favor. 5. Read number 1 again and realize VERY few places in LA (yes even the ones on the docks) do that...it's a fact. Read all about it. Mic drop.

Reviews.Author: J S.
Reviews.Content: Ate here today.  Good not great.  Wasn't really blown away.  Waited 45 minutes for a table and it was a good meal, nothing over the top or out of the ordinary.  Was the fish fresh? Sure.  I mean for 2215 reviews and 4.5 stars you would expect something to really come out and prove something to you.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, who knows.  Will have to come back and order the sashimi and try things they recommend.

Reviews.Author: Joseph L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Cravings!!! Dinner was the time, and unfortunately didn't get to try the lunch deal so had to fork out mucho dinero.  It wasn't cheap, but the quality is A+. The presentation was absolutely enticing and every bite makes you want to have another bite; and then inception.... Long wait, so reserve ahead; we didn't! Will definitely come back for some more sushigasmic experience. I'm coming back Sushi Gen; 2014!Ambiance 5Flavor 5Presentation 5Service 5Price 4.8Grade: 4.96

Reviews.Author: G Y.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here a few times, and each time the fish has been super fresh. Sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go. The sushi chefs are pretty attentive and pieces come out fast.Long story short, they consistently have great uni, tuna, and yellowtail belly. The sweet shrimp is pretty spectacular too. The salmon I've eaten there has never been amazing--fresh, but not one of the highlights.The prices are pretty reasonable too. Just make a reservation about 3-5 days in advance and you won't have to wait long.

Reviews.Author: Ralph V.
Reviews.Content: I have never had such an amazing assortment of sashimi in my life. When it comes to straight up traditional no frill, no crazy Americanized toppings, this is the place to go. What makes this place stand up above the rest is how fresh and well prepared each item on the menu is. I can not stress enough that this is a much try spot for those who love sashimi.Big downside is that the place is so small that you will be waiting for a while to get seated. The lines can get ridiculous during peak hours.The price of his place may seem a bit high but when you taste the difference in quality you will understand why you are dropping a few extra dollars on the sushi. Heck their miso soup has clams in it? How many places you know does that?!

Reviews.Author: Sandy L.
Reviews.Content: On  12/26/13, my dad, brother and I made our way to Sushi Gen to celebrate my dad's bday.  My dad loves Japanese food!We got to Sushi Gen at 10:30 am for an 11:15 a.m opening and there were already 8 people waiting.  But as it got closer to 1115, it turned out that the people at the front of the line was a party of 15!!  The line behind us also grew to about 100 people.  The dining room seats 72.  So, plan ahead and don't be too hungry!!On to the food, the three of us ordered the Sushi Deluxe, Fried Kanpachi head (comes w sashimi appetizer), Baked Big Clam, Unagi Lunch "box.  This was enough food for 4 people!  They charged $1.50 for green tea (really...).  The total bill came to $115 for lunch.  My brother liked this place a lot for value and quality. I just thought it was "ok".  Sushi Gen is  fine, but not worth the wait. My favorite sushi place is still SugarFish for the melt in your mouth fresh sushi, housemade soy sauce and no frills menu.

Reviews.Author: Amber M.
Reviews.Content: Oh my dog. This place truly merits the 4.5 star rating. Doesn't merit being listed as a $$$ restaurant. Prices here are more like $$. Anywho, mouthwatering sashimi platters for a reasonable price. Come for lunch and the price is as unbelievable as the wait is long- but so worth it. Fresh fresh fresh. Yum yum yum. My #1 sushi spot in LA. Still would be my #1 if the prices doubled. So good.

Reviews.Author: Ashley T.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a surprise dinner at Sushi Gen on our one night in LA, and the value of the meal overall was unforgettable! The price I paid for the quality of the food I got still blows my mind. I had the sushi special, which included nigiri of four different kinds of fish, tamago, unagi, roe, as well as a cucumber roll and a tuna roll. My boyfriend had the chirashi, which was beautifully presented, and featured the same fresh fish. Each fish had a unique texture and flavor that was accentuated by the perfect sushi rice. I've never had sushi with a better rice to fish ratio, allowing me to feel like I wasn't just filling myself up with plain rice. Sushi Gen is pretty much as good as it gets, so if you're ever in Little Tokyo, wait in line!

Reviews.Author: David F.
Reviews.Content: Very tasty although quite pricey. Unfortunetly both me and my girlfriend became sick the next day after eating here. Will never go again.

Reviews.Author: Albert K.
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first because of the hour and 15 minute wait, especially because we were only a party of two. It was probably my fault because we came on a Friday night without making a reservation the week before. When we were finally seated, the waitress gave us some hot green tea and a wet towel to wipe our hands. I ordered the teriyaki beef dinner and the sushi deluxe. The teriyaki dinner came first, with an option of choosing sashimi or tempura. I went with the sashimi because of all the good things I had heard about it. The sashimi melted in my mouth like soft butter. I don't know how else to put it. The teriyaki dinner also came with a bowl of white rice, lettuce with salad dressing, and a scoop of potato salad. The meat was surprisingly good. The sushi deluxe was eaten in a very similar manner, with the fish being very soft and tender. I would recommend this sushi restaurant to all my friends! I really hope they remodel in the near future and make the restaurant bigger!

Reviews.Author: Mimi W.
Reviews.Content: This would have been five stars except for the wait. Expect to wait about an hour if you come here at about noon. But you should go for lunch because the lunch specials are excellent deals. The dinner specials are less so. The sashimi lunch special is definitely a great deal, but if you're willing to splurge a bit more and you love uni like it's your job, definitely go for the uni platter, which is just an enormous plate of delicious uni. There's some other side things too but I was only paying attention to the uni. Parking is fairly easy even though the lot always looks full.

Reviews.Author: julie T.
Reviews.Content: Lucnh special $15... best bang for ur $. Fresh sushi. Fast. Only con is that line out the door.

Reviews.Author: Sum H.
Reviews.Content: With over 2,000 reviews for this place, it's pretty hard to say something that has not been already said. And like everybody said, this place is extremely popular and you will not disappointed. I came here yesterday for their sashimi lunch special for $15 which is pretty the most ordered items around lunch time. I came here 15 minutes after they opened and there is already an expected wait of over 30 minutes. If you don't want the wait, definitely come here as early as you can because the line is only going to get longer as the lunch hour gets closer.For the sashimi lunch special, it is such a bargain considering the variety of fish and the portion that you get. Honestly, those 3 big pieces of fat tuna in the middle of the plate is already worth the price. Even though these types of sashimi are not the kind that melts in your mouth, you can still taste the freshness in each bite and it is absolutely amazing! Once you finish your meal here, I would suggest taking a walk to the Japanese Plaza and get yourself some delicious mochi as your dessert. There is a parking lot in the Honda Plaza. If you are someone who is like me who wants to avoid finding parking, I would suggest coming here to Little Tokyo through the metro gold line. It is convenient and just a short walk away.

Reviews.Author: Denise A.
Reviews.Content: Because of the convincing reviews I came here to celebrate a friends birthday. We went on a Thursday night, around 9pm which was a lot later than we expected. Luckily, we only waited ten minutes even when they told us that the wait would be twenty.Was the sushi as good as everyone says? That would be a resounding YES. Four stars for the sushi. We ordered the fatty tuna (toro), albacore that was topped with shaved ginger and thin slices of green onion, Japanese red snapper that was topped with this green floral-tasting mixture that I did not appreciate at all, salmon and scallops. The front runners were the toro and albacore for sure. Behind the pack were the rolls and karaage we ordered, unfortunately. Three stars for the spicy tuna and eel and avocado rolls. As cute as the small cut rolls were, I couldn't taste what they were filled with. Being a lover a fried chicken, I felt naturally compelled to order the karaage. However, I'm not used to how they prepare it at Sushi Gen. The chicken meat was rolled into big balls (think meatball) and breaded and served with a lemon. So instead of the nice crunchy texture that you would expect from strips of karaage, you get a chicken ball without the spicy mayo dipping sauce. Don't get me wrong, it was still yummy, just not what I expected when I ordered their "fried chicken." Another four stars for the service. It's also as good as everyone says. Our drinks were topped off, the server came by numerous times asking if we needed anything and our food was served with lightning speed. We even got a cup of green tea ice cream with a candle since I told them that it was my friend's birthday.Overall, it's three and a half stars rounded up to four for Sushi Gen for me. Will definitely be coming back for more of that sushi soon. Everything else? Well, maybe not so much.

Reviews.Author: Ray N.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the sashimi lunch special, and it was nothing less than PERFECT.Sashimi was cold to perfection, fresh, and delicious (although it's quite upsetting that the sashimi lunch special does not include salmon sashimi -- if that's your favorite).Service was decent, parking was bearable (since they do have validation-- Yay to free parking).Other than that, the lunch sashimi special is the biggest hit here. Prices seem to skyrocket for dinner, so your call!Turn Ons:- Lunch Sashimi SpecialTurn Offs:- Location/wait -- if it's busy, there might be a wait. Oh, and there might be this homeless man around asking for money-- more than once. Just, fyi :)

Reviews.Author: Kathy T.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for 10+ years now and its HANDS DOWN the best sashimi I've ever had in my entire life. I've been to more expensive sushi restaurants but never felt like it compared to my beloved Sushi-Gen. To be honest.. Parking can sometimes be a pain (it is LA) and the line during lunch can be long but I'm willing to overlook both of those things for the great quality of food. Its truly one of the must-go places if you're a sashimi lover. The sashimi plate is a wonderful variety of some cooked but mostly raw fish and everything is top-notch quality. In all my years here I have never had bad fish (which is important because food poisoning is no bueno).I will add that the lunch special attracts so many people that it becomes unspokenly unacceptable to have those long "lets catch up" type meals.. So dont plan on having those here. Overall GREAT food with quick service at an unbeatable price. Lunch specials are only on weekdays too so make sure to beat the rush by lining up early.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: OMG! This place SUCKS! Some of the worst sushi in Los Angeles! Not only is the sushi imprecisely cut but the management LIES to the diners! My fiance recently dined at this dump and was notified AFTER their small lunch that both her and her mother needed to order an additional FOUR sushi servings, only because they were sitting at the sushi bar!!! They apparently require a minimum four orders per person at the sushi bar! What makes the management at this trash pile of a sushi joint even worse is that they sat my fiance/mother at the bar because there were no other seats available and they did NOT notify them of the minimum order. When the manager was summoned by my fiance, he was rude and completely LIED to her and insisted that he had told them about the minimum order at the bar. How's this for an idea, DON'T require a minimum at the sushi bar!!! I've never heard of this and I've been to many, many sushi bars around the world!!Unfortunately I cant give this crap sushi joint a half-star....because one-star is really too nice!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: I've been on roll with sushi lately... a sushi roll. Heh.I'll start with the best of the best.Sushi Gen has almost 2000 reviews (1994 as of November 10, 2013) and an average rating of 4.5 stars. That's f-ing amazing.Walked in on a Thursday night around 5:30pm with a friend and found that there was no wait. Score! We were seated in a quiet corner and given menus by the host. Having had looked through the Yelp photos millions of times beforehand, I already knew what I wanted to order: uni nigiri (market price) and the sashimi dinner ($26). My friend opted for the chicken teriyaki dinner ($20), and we shared the albacore tataki appetizer ($15).... it was all amazing.The albacore tataki was the perfect dish to start our meal. There are no words to describe it besides "delicious." It came on top of a bed of mixed greens and drizzled with a bit of ponzu (?) sauce. Yes. Yes. Yes.Shortly afterwards came my sashimi dinner. Oh my lord. Melt-in-your-mouth. So, so fresh. I wanted to cry, and I would have... but my tears would have spilled onto my plate and ruined the fish. Plus, I had already my wasabi + ginger + soy sauce concoction ready to go. The tempura that came with my dinner was perfectly crisp and provided a nice crunchy texture that complimented the sashimi. YUM.Then there was the uni. Wowie. I might have shed a tear when I took the first bite, but I made sure not to let the droplet anywhere near my meal. TOO GOOD.Being the gluttonous fatty that I am, I also ate some of my friend's chicken teriyaki. I kid you not, it was the BEST chicken teriyaki that I've ever had. I'm not even usually that big of a fan, but damn. I was blown away.The dinner proved to be too much and I ended up not being able to finish the last fifth of my sashimi, so I took it to-go. You can't waste this stuff.Total came out to around $85 for the albacore tataki, sashimi dinner, uni nigiri, chicken teriyaki dinner, and a large Sapporo. Not bad!But seriously... is this place even real, or was it all just a dream? Guess I'll have to find out by visiting again!

Reviews.Author: Mendel L.
Reviews.Content: Come here for the lunch specials and come here early or prepared to wait! Came on Saturday with a big party at 11:30 and first seating was already full (open sat 11:15)Get the sashimi deluxe, it's perfect for 2. (If you eat a normal amount)Overall Gen is good and well priced, but def would not wait an hour for it. Also remember that parking is $2 for 2 hrs with validation during lunch. Be prepared to pay more if you have to wait longer!

Reviews.Author: Johnson K.
Reviews.Content: Wow, came here half an hour before it opened for lunch and there was a line out the door two storefronts down.  By the time the place actually opened, the line was at least 5-6 storefronts down.  And, this was for lunch on a Tuesday!This place definitely feels rushed the minute you sit down.  For $15, you definitely get a good helping of several types of fish.  It's fresh.  But, it's missing paper ginger and had a tad bit too much of seaweed.  There's quite a bit of stuff that comes with the meal:  a soy sauce infused tofu appetizer, as well as some pickled vegies.  Miso soup and a bowl of rice also comes with the meal.All in all, I came out of the restaurant holding my stomach because I was so FULL!  Too bad I feel very rushed as they were putting the down the check halfway through my meal.   Oh yeah, I'm also not that big of a fan of how they charge $1.50 for hot tea.

Reviews.Author: Stephen C.
Reviews.Content: Worst sushi ever.Imprecise cuts of mediocre fish atop even more mediocre rice. The wasabi is also very grey and pastey.Sushi omakase is served 2 pieces at a time which to purists is not the proper way because the fish sits on the plate for too long. I requested that the chef not serve it this way and he promptly ignored my request. He also deliberately ignored another request to not serve any salmon roe. The Amaebi was slimy pungent and not live harvested. The toro (chu and o) were also incredibly awful. We ended up cutting omakase short due to these sushi atrocities. We will never be back.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special? CMON!!!! Great place and worth the wait. Try this place out when you have the chance! You'll be full from just one order of the lunch special.

Reviews.Author: Joshua D.
Reviews.Content: Long wait because this is the best sushi/sashimi in LA and maybe the whole dang old U S of A !

Reviews.Author: CJ S.
Reviews.Content: Good quality fish, but I think is overpriced. I would have given it 4 stars if it weren't for the price lol My boyfriend and I ordered sushi a la carte and the check came out to be around $300 for just the two of us. I would typically pay around $200 for the amount we usually get another restaurant of the same caliber (if not better). Service and quality was great, but for being the most popular spot for sushi in Little Tokyo (and for being that pricey) I would have expected the food to be more authentic.

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi bar you'll ever go to. I've been eating at this place since I was 10 and the quality has never dipped below perfection. The quality of the fish is beyond, and I can personally assure you Yelpers of this fact because my dad supplies the fish the company who supplies Sushi Gen. Yes I know that was complicated, but they only order the highest quality of fish for their restaurant. If you can't afford to eat at the bar, I highly recommend you go for their lunch special. For $15 you get their sashimi special which is still grade A and perfectly filling. The only downside is that no matter what day of the week, you're bound to wait. But if you can spend that $40-50 a person for lunch, go to the bar and you probably won't have to wait. They also have an uni lunch special for $30 if you're into that!My recommendation, skip the rolls and go for either the nigiri or the sashimi. It's a shame to waste the fish in a roll. Their tempura is really good as well, very thin batter which makes for the perfect crisp. And if you love miso soup, their clam miso soup is soo tasty! All in all, I'm the biggest fan of this place and only wish that they would open up comparable places in the East Bay.

Reviews.Author: Dia De L.
Reviews.Content: Great fish , love this place . The only thing I don't love about this place is ......it's so God damn bright .  Like your in a hospital or something . But the fish is great .

Reviews.Author: Shirlene L.
Reviews.Content: If I had to describe my dinner experience at Sushi Gen in one word, it would have to be: surprising. I've only ever come here for their sashimi dinner and the way the meal is presented is to you is quite the treat - a constant flood of surprises. I wouldn't want to spoil it, so check it out yourself! The sashimi and all the extras, absolutely delicious with the upmost beauty in quality. The wait for dinner, though... not so surprising. Do expect to wait up to an hour. But the service is admirable. As for parking, it's Los Angeles - specifically, Little Tokyo - don't expect much.Must come back to try their lunch special.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: For sushi anywhere in the Los Angeles area, I would say that Sushi Gen provides the absolute best value when it comes to freshness and portions.  While they are not traditional Hokkaido, you won't regret the large slabs of fish they cut for you served over their warm nigiri rice.  This is USA sushi in its best.  The freshness is to die for, and you really begin to wonder how much of a margin places like Sasabune and Zo are taking.  Overall, our eating experience here was fantastic.  Each fish was as fresh and well cut as the last.  I only had gripes with one item, and that was the Ikura (salmon roe) which proved to be not as fresh as the other fare that was served this meal.  PROTIP:  Try the ankimo.  It is to die for.

Reviews.Author: Minh N.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen has become my favorite place to get sushi, any time of day!I've been here on 3 separate occasions: dinner, omakase, and lunch.The quality is the best I've ever had in the states. The rice is well seasoned and the fish is fresh and generously cut. What I really appreciate about this place is their salmon. It is not the usual creamy orange commercial farm salmon. This salmon is dark pink and it's wild caught, but still flavorful. They have a dinner set that is reasonably priced. For $26 you get a salad and soup starter as well as a nigiri sushi set. Omakase is going to cost you a pretty penny, depending what you get. You can also make requests of what you want as well. Of course I had to order sweet shrimp, which comes with the nigiri as well as the freshly deep fried head. The uni (sea urchin) is sweet, mildly salty, and creamy without any hint of metallic taste (which is a sign of age or lack of freshness). Needless to say, I was very happy and full after $80.Sushi Gen's claim to fame I have to say is their sashimi lunch special on the weekdays. For $15, you get a large plate of various cuts of fish, some poke and other items. You also get some appetizers as well, and I was served some pickled veggies, seasoned silken tofu, and a miso soup. But be warned that people line up for this deal. I'm not kidding. I came at 10:45am (doors open at 11am) and there was already 40 people waiting in line! By the time the doors opened, there were at least 100 people in line. My group didn't make the first round of seating, so we waited for at least an hour for a table. It's quite a bit of a wait, but the quality of the meal makes it all worth it.Parking in the Honda Plaza lot is $2 for the first 2 hours.

Reviews.Author: Doo K.
Reviews.Content: I've been going hear for over 15 years and there quality is good. The quality of fish never changes. I'm kinda of a expert on sushi this place is my fav in LA

Reviews.Author: Ann N.
Reviews.Content: Went for valentine's dinner which of course took 1.45hr wait but the host stated it will only be 45-1hr wait :( The service was great even thou it was so busy and the food of course was worth the wait and the hype. Great place for sashimi very fresh and great selection.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina L.
Reviews.Content: I ate here with a friend visiting from SF. She requested sushi  for dinner and I looked up on yelp the best place to go. Sushi Gen sounded quite promising.However, perhaps all the hype on Yelp made my expectations higher than they ought to have been. I felt Sushi Gen was more of a 3.5.Yes it was good service but I find most real sushi places have pretty good service.The fish was fresh but not phenomenal.My friend and I thought the yellow tail belly was the best.The rest of the dishes were good but not amazing nor particularly memorable.I know I'm in the minority here so I say...like Toni L. I say it is fresh but pricey so I'm not sure I'll be back any time soon.

Reviews.Author: Fanny T.
Reviews.Content: For the price and quality the sashimi box is the right way to go. The box is only $15 and you get an assortment of both raw and cooked fishes which also comes with a side of tofu, bowl of miso soup and rice. Other people in my party ordered different items and I would say the $15 sashimi box would be the better option although I am dying to try the uni. The sashimi box varies every time maybe due to the supply of fishes the restaurant has in stock. There's a $2-3 fee for parking and the restaurant doesn't open for lunch during the weekends. In general Sushi Gen is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: Always fresh and insanely good.  This is what every sushi bar dreams of being.  The best sushi spot in LA regardless of the hype.Keep it coming!

Reviews.Author: Cody S.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is not hype...it's the real deal. There's a reason why selecting "5 stars" on Yelp says "Woohoo! As good as it gets!"  That's exactly what I feel when I'm eating here.At Sushi Gen you will wait...always, for a place at the sushi bar.  Even if you get there 1/2 hour before they open there is already a line.  It's worth the wait.  Like most sushi places, who you get as your itamae is makes a huge difference.  We will wait...often an extra 45 minutes or more to make sure we get seated in front of Kazu.  He is a an artist with the knife and presentation.  He cuts only the best portions and each piece is sized properly for both the type of fish and the customer (male or female).I can't even begin to tell you "what" to get here b/c tastes vary so much and personally I have liked everything I've ever had here.  Some things though, I love.Just put yourself in Kazu's hands (omakase) and tell him what types of fish you normally like.  Sit back, relax, have a sake (or three) and enjoy the ride.NOTE: The reviewer below who talks of there being a 4 order minimum at the sushi bar is (with all due respect) totally off base.  I sense he must have had a bad experience is venting...1 star, really?) I've been eating here for 5 years, always at the bar, and you can order however you like.

Reviews.Author: Jessy P.
Reviews.Content: Bomb sushi for a reasonable price. Two of us split the sashimi dinner. The platter to my surprise had a large variety and for $35, the quality was melt in your mouth fresh!  The miso soup with mushrooms was delicious too! As a warning rolls are limited. When we arrived an hour after dinner opening there was already an hour wait. Make sure your whole party is present otherwise you won't be seated. Between the price and quality, we will be back!

Reviews.Author: Christopher L.
Reviews.Content: Just a few necessary things to say:To date, the finest fish I've had in the states.Quality, fresh fish.Delicious rice (very important).So good that I hate myself.There are too many reviews.Impatient (kind of understandable) but okay service...Because hectic.There is a wait.Yum.

Reviews.Author: Gisselle R.
Reviews.Content: i went here for my Bday and it was a place i have been wanting to go for a long time..I'm a sushi fan bar none..but i might have made the wrong selections when i was here.. overal i wasnt at all that impressed but sushi and other items were very good...but it made a serious dent in my wallet... its very high priced...Not coming back here again..unless someone tells me how to order !

Reviews.Author: Ema I.
Reviews.Content: I lived in Japan for 11 years and I have not been to a good sushi restaurant in la until now.  Sushi Gen was amazing!  I recommend sitting at the counter so you can see all the fresh sushi and watching the chefs make it is exciting too.   I really liked all of the sushi but my favorite ones there was Japanese scallops, Sea Urchin and Otoro.  The sushi chef recommended what is good too.  Negitoro roll was amazing.  He added takuan so it had that awesome texture.  We ate so much I thought our bill would be over $100 each but it was only $60.  Totally worth it.  I would eat here everyday if I could!

Reviews.Author: Grace K.
Reviews.Content: Best chirashi in all of Los Angeles! Make sure you get the chirashi deluxe and not just the regular one.  The bowl is literally packed with an assortment of the day's freshest fish and their sushi rice is just way too good to be true!  You know that a sushi joint is legit when their tamago (cooked egg) is done right and at this place, they definitely know what they are doing. So many reviews already explain why and how this is so good so I'll keep my review short but if you have yet to try their chirashi, go ASAP.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie T.
Reviews.Content: I'm review number 2000!You have to come here for the sashimi lunch special. It is an absolutely unbeatable deal.They've kept the price constant for the last several years. $15 for a serious quantity of seriously high quality fish - I wouldn't hesitate to get in line for another 45 minutes right now to eat this again. Price aside I probably give this a four star review overall. Not the Jiro-dreams-of-sushi kind of experience you make reservations for years in advance but the fish is as high in quality as any solid four star sushi establishment.And good god if you are anywhere near LA in Japantown at lunchtime this place is well worth your while! (And awhile you may need)Few other tips: 1) validated parking costs $2 at lunchtime 2) you can expect the wait to be 30-45 minutes for two people 3) the $15 sashimi special is only available at the tables, not the sushi bar

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: Wait. Wait 3 HOURS if you had to. What 1000+ yelpers saying are true, it's totally worth it.First time, I've sat by the sushi bar. Chomped down on all the delicious art sushi chef gave me and ended up dishing out $180 by myself. It's worth every penny. But if you are not ready to do that every day, do sit by the table side and order it from the menu. You can get these awesome sushi for $35 for sashimi deluxe. May be enough for two, not for me. I can eat this stuff EVERYDAY. DO come and try this out.Parking is valet $3 but parking lot gets full fast. Park across the street for $7 (they take cards) or good luck finding street parking!

Reviews.Author: Ken T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a busy place, make sure you have reservation before you go. The wait can be very very long. They offer fresh sushi & combination choice for dinner. Though this place can be expensive. Its a popular japanese restaurant in Japanese town, good quality of food.

Reviews.Author: Tommy L.
Reviews.Content: FRESH SUSHI; GREAT PRICEI've been hearing about this place for the longest time and I finally tried it this week. Knowing that unless we got there before 11am, we would have to wait-- we decided to get there a bit past 1 and score! No wait! The whole place was packed though. Except for a few empty chairs at the sushi bar. I had already eaten sadly before this so I was terribly full from my last meal but I still wanted to eat. We ordered two sashimi specials ($15 each) and one uni sashimi combo ($35). When the food came out, I was amazed at how much we got for for the $15 set meal. It came with of course sashimi, spicy tuna, salmon, rice, soup, tofu, and some kind of marinated fish. More than enough to fill you up. The uni was one of the freshest I've had in a while. It was delicious!!! I would come back here again for lunch. Heard that dinner is the same thing but slightly higher prices. Parking is $2 in the lot with validation (2 hours) or you can find parking on the streets.

Reviews.Author: Michael Kay K.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi experience I have had in Los Angeles. The wait is a little long but totally worth it. Either hang with the humans outside and make some friends while you wait, or go three doors down to Bar C and have a few drinks until they call your name (that's what I did). The host will actually walk into the bar to find you as they've got a cool tag team agreement the two managers do. We sat at the bar and opted for Omakase style (chef's choices) - which is the only way to go in my opinion. Sushi after sushi starting with Toro and ending with Albacore the meal was unforgettable. A bottle of Sake and a beautiful lady by my side - beat that. The folks next to us were cooler than ice to top it off. And who cold forget Toyo the dude handing out the goodies from the bar.I'll be back, for sure!

Reviews.Author: Shay S.
Reviews.Content: Bad things:1. Pay for parking - no problem2. Over priced - I'm OK with that too... 3. The sushi roll is the smallest thing ever! (6 small pieces) - Why???4. They "hurry you up" to leave the place... just finished eating and they push the bill at your face - Rude!5. You have no prices on the order menu... most of it is in Korean - Korea town is still in America : ) Good things:1. Fast service2. Food is tasty 3. Nice people at the sushi placeOverall experience: Very bad! Left the place fast,  still hungry with a bigger bill than normal. The good things I mentioned can be found in so many other places.

Reviews.Author: J C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi gen is my hidden gem. It's amazing that I could even get such quality sashimi for $15.. Like is this even real life? The portion size is perfect to the "T." So with that being said, this is my favorite stop for a brunch date :-)The sashimi lunch is genius being that it comes w a bowl of rice, tofu, a bowl of HOT (not lukewarm) miso, and a wonderful selection of sashimi goodness.In addition to the already lovely food. The service has always been impeccable.. And that says a lot due to the high volume of customers anxiously waiting/eating in this little cute restaurant. I love coming here even when there is a wait.. I know CRAZY. But the host does a great job of getting everyone in and out happy. Mad kudos to him. I've eaten here on a weekend and today, and for a Tuesday it was packed! Still, I didn't mind the near 20 minute wait. So I'll probably be back here in a week or two :-DTip: validate your parking. And if you get your name on the waiting list before 2pm, you're set for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Oulie T.
Reviews.Content: Love love love. $15 Sashimi Lunch Special.  There is an abundance of vibrantly hued fresh fish arranged on my plate and I haven't the slightest clue as to what species I am consuming but this fact doesn't bother me. There are the usual identifiables like tuna and salmon but there are a few undeciferables on my plate that pique my curiosity as to what names they could be identified by. Whatever they are they are tasty.I wouldn't know where to go to get this high quality fish for this price. It's an amazing deal, and the large gathering of people waiting outside for a table will attest to this fact. Don't be discouraged to dine here if you are afraid of a wait as it goes very fast. There were many people in business attire dining on their lunch hour here. Sushi Gen is well skilled in getting it's patrons in and out. Service wasn't lacking either. I enjoyed being served by an adorable old grandma aged japanese woman. She looked like she was going to topple over at any moment. She was so tiny and fragile but she was on top of it. Our food came out efficiently; drinks, then soup, then the sashimi. Quick courteous service. Sushi Gen, I love you.

Reviews.Author: Pam K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi gen is a cute little place in Little Tokyo in downtown LA. The sashimi special is delicious and at a great price. The sashimi I had here was probably the freshest sashimi I've ever had. I would definitely recommend getting the sashimi plate if you're in the mood. The rice was also delicious - it had a great consistency and it just bolstered the flavor of the sashimi.Everything was perfect. Except for the long wait. My friend and I had to wait about an hour for a table for two. Other than the long wait, everything was great.I definitely recommend going here - if you're prepared to wait.

Reviews.Author: Chasen H.
Reviews.Content: By far the best sushi I've had anywhere.  I wake up craving this place.  It's an authentic place in HOnda Plaza in Downtown Los Angeles.    I am afraid to even write a positive review because the waits are already super long.  If I can, I try to get out of work and bolt over there before the masses of fans get there.  But when I do have to wait, it's worth it.If you don't like authentic pristine sushi and think it should instead be pre-made and floating around on a boat, this is not the place for you.  Many people on here have complained about the price.  And it's not cheap, but the value for the money is off the charts.

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: I just finished my first sashimi lunch special that I ordered to-go. AmazingggI counted at least 7 different types of sashimi and all in generous portions. Not to mention, the take out itself is packed with so much care and consideration. A separate paper box for the sashimi, a little takeout of warm fluffy rice (not placed in the bag itself), wrapped chopsticks and 3 soy sauce packets. All this in a paper bag sealed with a sticker that warns of if kept out in room temperature too long, fish will spoil AND then in a plastic bag. While not necessary eco-friendly, it is duly appreciated. For $15 and change, this is one of the best sushi meals I've had in a while. Free parking validation. And quite crowded for a Tuesday at lunchtime.However, their phone line for take-out was not working so I could not order it over the phone.

Reviews.Author: Lucy L.
Reviews.Content: First time here, love the lunch special! Just the waiting was bit long. Next time need to come early !

Reviews.Author: Yonnie Z.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I've been to.  Great quality and selection.Unless you come here at the right time, the wait is pretty ridiculous because of the amount of patrons exceeding their room capacity.  But if you can get a seat, you won't be disappointed with your order.My usual order from Sushi Gen is their tempura and sashimi combination.  Their selection of fish changes depending what they have in season.There is a parking lot in the Honda Plaza but limited spaces and it's paid parking without validation.

Reviews.Author: D S.
Reviews.Content: The line was already 20 deep when I jumped on the bandwagon! NO PROBLEM! We got seated immediately(wow!). Went for all the good stuff(toro, uni, ama ebi, mirugai, kanpachi, crab, etc...). I must say, the place does deserve all it's Yelp stars!  Good prices, great, helpful, attentive and friendly staff.  Tip : saw every1 else ordering a sashimi platter which looked delish!! Had to ask and ends up being their most popular dish ($32).  Great deal! I'll give it a try next time when I'm in the area Fo'Sho!

Reviews.Author: Maggie W.
Reviews.Content: 4 simple steps1. Get ur butt in line before 11am or u won't get in for an hour.2. Order right away. (Personal fave: monkfish liver appetizer and uni combo) 3. Validate your parking ticket 4. Smile at the host when leaving and repeat steps 1-3.

Reviews.Author: Christina Y.
Reviews.Content: I made a day trip to LA for work, and  I was only able to eat one meal. This meal was worth flying to LA for one day. I'm not entirely sure of every sushi piece we ordered, but the highlights of my meal had to be- the extra fresh uni, the baby octopus , hamachi, and ankimo. Each piece of fish was so fresh and  satisfying. It's very hard to find a good sushi place in Houston, so this was a treat. They also offered fresh wasabi and ginger. I hate ginger, but it was bearable at Sushi Gen. I've read alot of complaints about the wait, but we walked in around lunch time and sat at the bar. The sushi chefs were very fast & attentive. Next on my list is the uni platter!

Reviews.Author: Chub M.
Reviews.Content: Very standard and non inspired Sushi rolls. Don't expect more than 4 or 5 choices of rolls.   My fiancé ordered the beef teriyaki and the stake was very chewy.  Taste was ok, but not great.   The salad that came with it was very good though.

Reviews.Author: Sharon T.
Reviews.Content: First off, we need to talk about parking. To put it simply, it SUCKS. the lot is small and during busy hours there is NO parking at all. It's also a private lot that requires validation. Depending on the mood of the guy at the booth, you will have to pay A LOT of money or none at all. Also - the wait is horrendous unless you come at least an hour or two before opening. Last time I came around 10:45 for lunch (which I believe opens at 11) and I waited over 2 hours. With all these complaints - why the 5 stars you ask? Because the food is AMAZING. The moment the fish touches your lips, your forget about the parking and you forget about the hours you spent waiting outside. The fish is fresh, melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The price is totally reasonable for the amount and quality of food you get. The lunch price is incomparable. I usually just get their sashimi deluxe but their unagi bowl is amazing too.

Reviews.Author: christine p.
Reviews.Content: Thw line was out the door, down three stores, and when we go to the front, we was ask to be waited 45 minutes.. which we did. The menu was very vague and not many options. I asked for the veggie roll, she just looked at me. She said it is very small and that I won't be full.. long story short. This place is not vegetarian friendly.  What a shame. We just left. Smh. Go to sushi go :)

Reviews.Author: Rossi H.
Reviews.Content: On occasion I have quite vivid dreams, in full HD, Dolby beta digital mega sound: big budget style dreams. A week or so ago I watched The X-Men and then last night I had X-men style powers in my dream.I was the froggy/toad guy.Fitting.I was craving uncooked meat, so I jumped down to Sushi Gen from the hotel I was staying at. Why wouldn't I be below ground, I don't know. But it was a dream so take it as you want.The line stood about twenty people deep, but I didn't feel like waiting.So, I hopped right through the people to the waiting area, knocking all the Japanese businessmen (and one gratuitous round eye) to the ground. And as I picked up the last little guy I knocked over.I told him I had a reservation. I learned that this is proper etiquette from the little old Chinese lady that put her fist in my back as she nudged me aside the last time I was at Sushi Gen. She taught me that if you have reservations you get to go to the front of line and manhandle people in your way.I was quickly seated and a menu was forcibly pushed into my hands andthe waitress told me that I should get the sashimi plate. Everyone gets it and I should also.I was at a sushi place and was craving raw fish. So why not? When in Rome and you are like a froggy/toad, might as well.The best part of the dream was when they started bringing out the trays of perfectly cut slightly below room temperature succulent raw slabs of fish.I was able to lick every ones plate as it was placed in front of them.That super tongue came in handy.I pulled off the ultimate lick every donut in the dozen-box trick but this time with the best cuts of sashimi I have ever had.And I ate everyone's plates of fish.It was heaven.

Reviews.Author: Alisa C.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to try this place for a long time. Waited 45 mins to be seated at a table for two. Parking is not the most convenient here, but it's discounted after validation. I ordered salmon teriyaki and sashimi dish. They came separately, which I didn't expect. The order also came with miso soup, pickled dish, tofu and meat, and rice. The sashimi melts in your mouth, the tofu was warm and savory, but the teriyaki was a little too salty for me. Otherwise, it was a good meal. Be prepared to get rushed because of the line of people waiting to eat!

Reviews.Author: Stephen H.
Reviews.Content: Solid, dependable sushi spot serving up B+/A- level sushi at a good value. Been coming here on and off for a few years (almost each time I've visited LA). Not sure it's worth more than a 15 minute wait, but I'm always glad I come.

Reviews.Author: Eric F.
Reviews.Content: There's certainly no doubt that the fish quality here is exceptional after the thousands of positive reviews and a first-hand run through of the variety of sushi.  My friend and I were able to get a couple seats at the bar fairly quickly and I enjoyed most of the items including the sake, maguro, toro, aji, shellfish, uni, etc.  The rice quality was indeed very good though I wish they used freshly ground wasabi given the prices.Which leads me to my main gripe: the quality here is great, but I've been to enough places around LA and other areas that offer comparable if not better sushi for less and in a more comfortable atmosphere.  I left spending way more than I would've liked considering how hungry I still was by the end.Worth at least one try if you've never been, but I won't be back again.

Reviews.Author: Hovik N.
Reviews.Content: This place had been on my list for a long time. Due to long wait time since this place gets slammed it took we a few trys before I finally ate here. Gen sushi has great fresh fish. Everything I had was great but nothing that blow me away. Also it's on the pricy side. I will probably go to other places near here. Glad I checked it off my list.

Reviews.Author: Luke L.
Reviews.Content: I always hear stories about how people just come here and spend more than $100 and how this is the most popular sushi restaurant in the entire Little Tokyo.Man, there's no doubt this place is popular. We were told to wait about 45 minutes, but luckily we got in after 30 minutes of waiting.Now I see why anyone could EASILY spend more than $100 ... a la carte prices weren't labeled at all. With that being said, I was a bit surprised my portion "only" cost $75 (tax included).Japanese Fried Chicken (aka Chicken Karaage, $7) - It was decent, but a bit dried for me.Sweet shrimp (with fried heads), toro (aka fatty tuna), spicy tuna roll, and eel avocado roll (a la carte - total of $39) - Sweet shrimps were perfect, just simply melt in your mouth. Toro weren't as good as sweet shrimps, but toro were tender and so good. That eel avocado roll ... probably the best eel avocado roll I've had EVER. Spicy tuna roll ... decent, but just not as good as sweet shrimps and eel avocado roll.  Miso-marinated black cod (Gindara, $18) - Very tender black cod and it wasn't drench with sauces (which was a good thing). Green tea mochi ice cream ($3.5) - Shouldn't listen to my friend and not order this at all. Tasted like Trader Joe's Mikawaya green tea mochi, but you only get two pieces for almost $4.Definitely worth the wait as long as the wait is less than one hour. I did not regret every bite that I've had here, with the exception of chicken karaage and green tea mochi ice cream.

Reviews.Author: Wes C.
Reviews.Content: Gen is the best and most famous for their amazing lunch special. My ma and grandparents often took me and my brother here for lunch growing up. My grandparents who lived in Japan for many years, felt Gen was the best in Little Tokyo. I have to admit - the sushi is fresh, quality is fantastic, but personally, the hour+ wait just isn't worth it for me when there are several other options around. Overall, great service and sushi.

Reviews.Author: Kevin J.
Reviews.Content: Such an enjoyable dinner at Sushi Gen! Lots of seating, but the place was packed for dinner time! Happy my friend and I came early, as when we finished, there was a tiny crowd waiting outside for seats. Lucky for us, being a group of two, it didn't take us long to get sushi bar seats! Win...The place is really lively, yet despite the loads of people, the sushi chefs are pretty attentive to the customers and make your sushi soon after you order.The fish quality is very fresh, and the textures are quite nice. The sushi rice was also well made. The dab of wasabi under the fish and the other toppings for some of the orders went well with our nigiri. My favorites were the tuna (all of them), uni, salmon, and scallop. The yellowtail fin was quite chewy, and was very tough to eat. (Not something I was used to.) I also ordered both the Spanish mackerel and the Japanese mackerel to check out the differences. Apart from slight differences in texture, nothing much else. After the dinner, I felt like it was a wasted comparison as they were both good - but in the end, I just ordered lots of mackerel...My main gripe with the place was the amount we paid. Not so much about how much, as we ordered quite a bit. But rather, I was really annoyed that we had no idea how much every order of nigiri cost when we ordered them! The paper slip with all the options had no pricing, and our receipt didn't even break it down for us! Such a trap... Be very weary the next time you come here, and order selectively. Otherwise you'll end up paying an arm and a leg, while not feeling full after the dinner.You've been advised and warned! Hope you enjoy the sushi!

Reviews.Author: Samuel L.
Reviews.Content: Finally had a chance to come here.I would first like to say that the parking is horrendous during peak hours so plan ahead. 3 bucks for parking or you can look for street parking.First impressions were great. We were greeted as we entered and then seated once there was space available. We got seated and decided to order the sashimi deluxe and tempura dinnerFood:Sashimi deluxe- the fish was super fresh and was a great deal for the price we paid. Loved all the variety and balance of everything. Tempura- Light and not oily. Crisp and came with a side of sashimi. Was very filling.Service: - The wait staff was super friendly and the lady was more than consistent in checking up on us. - environment was clean and not too loud. bustling but not loud. Overall:Everything was super great and I really don't have anything to complain about except for the parking. This might not be the best sushi in the world but its one of the few very solid and very fresh locations around the la county area. FIVE STARS:Great service. Fresh fish. Decent price.

Reviews.Author: Mark R.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to check this out because of how many good reviews it got on here, and let me tell you, these reviews don't lie! The best sashimi I ever had. Everything was delicious especially the yellowtail belly. It was 28 bucks for 6 pieces but damn, it would just melt in your mouth. I also got the sashimi deluxe, which is more than enough for a person. I shared my plate with 3 people. This place is expensive but it's worth the quality. Sashimi lovers must try this place.

Reviews.Author: Massiel S.
