Reviews.Content: I wish I would have started yelping a long time ago so you all can see how often a person that NEVER EVER liked seafood comes to this place! :PI strongly disliked anything from the ocean. This placed changed my views by far. I almost always eat at the sushi bar too so I'm eating the fishiest fish!Salmon sushi is delicious! I always ask for no wasabi since they add some in between the rice and fish. Tuna and yellowtail are just as good too! Another fav is the toro! YUM! It just dissolves in your mouth! I usually always get salmon hand skin rolls, soo good!I've tried their teriyaki sashimi plate too! It's good! They give you a little bit of everything in my opinion! I don't like waiting in line too long when I come here. I've seen tons of people wait for this and I don't blame them! It's delicious! The chefs know what they're doing, the service is also nice and the ambiance is always good.Try the raw stuff, I did, and now I'm a sucker!

Reviews.Author: Erik S.
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice lunch here just after going to sushi zo.  It's hit or miss.  It's not the most refined, but if you want to get a sushi fix, big portions, go for it.  Went back, not as good.

Reviews.Author: Kevin K.
Reviews.Content: So I had their Sashimi plate dinner (the $30 one). Wow, their sashimi is fresh! I got all kinds of tuna and other fish which I am not able to identify off the top of my head. It comes with rice, side dishes, and tempura. I eat ALOT, and this thing got me full, I couldn't even finish the rice! I haven't tried any of their other dishes, but they've got tons of options that seem to be as great as the sashimi. The restaurant is a pretty typical Japanese-style sushi place. They've got a bar that you can only order a la carte, but the place has a lot of seating. You're most likely going to wait at least 30 minutes to a hour depending on when you go there. I went there at ~9 and waited 30 minutes. This place also has parking, which you have to pay for and you can find street parking, but it's Little Tokyo so good luck with that. Overall, the place is delicious, definitely worth a try. But for me, it's going to be a one time thing. I'll still give it a 5/5.

Reviews.Author: Rosemary T.
Reviews.Content: Nah, this place is all hype. I really looking forward here, but there's nothing special here at all. The sushi quality is good, but not to the point that I would pay $100 per person for it. For four people, our bill was around $400, and none of us were even full. All of their sushi menu are a la cart and does not have a price on it, so there's no way to check what they charge you for. The wait is also super long by 5:15, so if you're not here by 5:00, be prepare to wait for at least 1 hour.  Tip: There are better sushi places out there that doesn't break your wallet.

Reviews.Author: Tam N.
Reviews.Content: This is my go to place for great authentic sushi and sashimi.   No fancy rolls...Japanese sushi chef's.   My friend and I have been going here for about 10 years and not only is the fish fresh but the service is great.

Reviews.Author: Joyce L.
Reviews.Content: There are few things in life I am willing to wait in line for; many of these things are food related.  If you go to Sushi Gen for the famous $15 sashimi lunch special, you WILL have to wait-- either at the front of the line like I did (getting there 45 minutes  before opening) or at the back of the ~30 person line (if you get there 15 minutes before opening).*Sushi Gen is a great bang for your buck.  A huge plate of extremely fresh sashimi beautifully presented for $15?  Verdict:  I would wait in line again.Minus 1 star because the service was rather brusque, and a few pieces of fish were slightly raggedy and sinewy.*Note to the group that tried to cut the line when I was there: YOU ARE TERRIBLE PEOPLE.

Reviews.Author: Simon K.
Reviews.Content: My favorite under $25 sushi lunch spot in Los Angeles.They have long history in their business with fans willing to wait for hours at the door to get in.  The vive is closer to old Japanese restaurant look & feel.The servers are highly knowledgeable but super busy to care too much about each table.  My favorite is their Chirashi bowl for the lunch hours.  They open for few hours during the lunch and people were waiting for their doors to be opened.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn V.
Reviews.Content: There are a few things you should know...If you are going to come for lunch (and I know you are) get here early. I'd say 15 to 20 minutes early so you get to be the first rounders in the restaurant ready to eat otherwise the wait will be 30-40 minutes. Now...on every table you will see the all hailed sashimi lunch, that is all you need to order. You get a huge bowl of rice, warm tofu, miso soup, and some sort of pickle-y salad. The fish was fresh, smooth, and it felt like the fish was eerily still swimming/flopping/gasping for air in my mouth. Nonetheless, this meal was a incredibly filling. Very filling. Make sure your WHOLE party is here because the host will not let you get a table. Do a favor to everyone else and not waste our time. Be prepared to get rudeness if your whole party isn't there. Service was nice and polite. Very attentive. Don't forget to get your validation for parking. $2 per hour with validation.-Give it a try!

Reviews.Author: Fran B.
Reviews.Content: Update! Came back here with my bf and his parents, because they love their sushi. But we went to the bar this time and had the omakase. MMMMThe sushi chef was very very nice, and he accomodated to us very well. We had several different sushi..... I can't name all of them, but there were some that stood out well above the rest.. such as their TORO! Well, he gave us each a tuna onigiri, chu toro, and otoro. OMG soooo gooooood. The fat just melts in my mouth. Even the regular lean tuna was delicious. And the SALMON! Damn, he gave us a piece of salmon belly and salmon something else, and both were absolutely fresh and melt in your mouth.Also had the kumamoto oysters, which came with some ponzu and lemon..... DROOL. It was fresh to deathhhhhhhhh. Literally lol.And also had the spicy tuna hand roll and OMG best handroll I ever had.Only thing I didn't like was the wasabi in my sushi. That's just a personal preference, I don't like the sting it gives me lol. But otherwise, SO BOMB! But of course the bill was over 300+ for 4 of us (and my bf had the chicken teriyaki LOL). So yeah, I wouldn't come here regularly lol.

Reviews.Author: Monsieur I.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST & THE WORSTTHE BEST:  Sushi Gen's best-tasting item is NOT on the menu:  UNI WITH QUAIL EGG.  Some people will order several rounds of uni (raw sea urchin innards) just to come off as being a sushi pro.  Yet, these same people are baffled when you ask if they've tried uni topped with a raw quail egg.  That little egg grenade doesn't detract from the sweet flavor of the uni, but explodes to creates a luxurious sensation as you chew.  Novices may reflexively gag.  Skill level to handle this dish:  sushi Jedi.  THE WORST:  Sushi Gen's most visually-appealing and intriguingly-named item on the menu, the "GIZZARD SHAD", is also their worst-tasting sushi.  Many diners have ordered this small silver fish (kohada) out of pure curiosity.  Don't do it. Look at the pretty pic I posted and move on.  Gizzard shads are very much like porcupines or your neighbor's parrot:  not to be eaten unless you're starving and run out of choices.

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: I went with a larger group (7 total) for lunch.  We arrived right after they opened and ended up having to wait about 30-40 minutes to be seated.I have to admit I was slightly disappointed by the freshness of some of the fish, especially the tuna - it tasted/smelled very fishy to me.  But, the other fish tasted fresh overall.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive and there was more than enough raw fish to be had from the 6 dishes we ordered for 7 people.  Good value overall for lunch, but I probably won't be going back.

Reviews.Author: Linda K.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, fresh sashimi. Great lunch combos. Great serviceI highly recommend going for LUNCH because the prices are reasonable ($15-18 per combo) and they give you a good amount of food too. I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki combo which came with a bowl of sashimi (about 8 pieces), tofu appetizer, miso, pickled veggies, a plate of chicken teriyaki, rice, potato salad, salad. It's a pretty big portion and will fill you up.I won't get into too much detail since everyone has already talked about how good the food is, it's a fact. They also have other combos such as beef teriyaki, sashimi deluxe, salmon teriyaki, etc.Our waitress was an older lady who was SO sweet. She was very polite and always laughing and smiling. Even though we waited 40+ minutes in the scorching hot heat (they don't let you wait inside since it's so cramped), the sweet waitress and the food made up for it.TIP: Show up at 10:45 am or at least before 11 am so you don't have to wait too long...

Reviews.Author: Simin E.
Reviews.Content: I totally don't understand the hype about this place. The food is simply not very good. But to be fair, my standard for sushi is super high. So perhaps for a lot of people Sushi Gen is satisfactory enough. I don't want to ruin anybody's experience but l'll just say this; If you are a foodie, and you like super fresh and elegant sushi, this place is absolutely not the place to go. It's certainly better than many places in general but still, I am not going back.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hypeLike everyone said, the staff, especially the host, is VERY STUCK UP and snobby. I left countless times just because I asked him how long the wait was and his response and tone was "however long, just wait." It's Little Tokyo, i can settle to save a few bucks and eat somewhere else without that kind of attitude. It's a restaurant, not a castle. You are not royalty, there are many choices around you.

Reviews.Author: Gigi M.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know, like every sushi fan has been here but me!  I'm still anti-driving around DTLA but I got another ride this time and we rolled up into the plaza parking lot right about 5:30 on a Saturday night.  They already let the line in and surprisingly they had a table open, but we wanted to sit at the bar for omakase.  Lucky us (NOT), an hour wait for 4 seats to open up at the bar!  The host was snobby and annoyed when we kept bugging him while waiting, just checking!  Sheesh!!  (Couple doors down is a hole-in-the-wall, Aloha Cafe, where we waited and snacked on yummy spam musubi.  They even offered to validate our parking, so we only paid $3).So when we were finally seated, no smiles, no hello, no small talk, the sushi chef had a stick up his a@@!  Not cool at all!  Doesn't omakase translate to VIP?  Psssh!  Whatever, dude!  Anyway, no doubt every morsel was super fresh!  While other places would yield 3 stars for that food/service combo, I'll be generous and give them 4 stars due to my appreciation for sushi and cuz I was omakasing with my cool cousin for her bday!  Happy bday, KL!  If I ever return, I'd grab a table and do sashimi!  Omakase was cool cuz it introduced us to a good variety; however, I still prefer sashimi over nigiri.  Ginger is bomb here cuz they make it themselves, no pink coloring!!Thanks guys for offering to validate parking (NOT)!

Reviews.Author: Valerie R.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the one hour wait. The first time I attempted coming here with my boyfriend we were told it was an hour and a half wait and we were way too hungry to stand around for that long, but because we saw how popular this place was we knew we had to try it...so we woke up early to be prepared. The line was still long before the place even opened! By the time it hit 11 it grew 3x longer. The service is fast but good. The sashimi lunch special is such a deal. I thought it was $15 for just the plate but it also comes with rice, miso soup, tofu and a small side of pickled salad. Everything is such good quality. If you plan on dining at the sushi bar, it's a shorter wait but there's no lunch special and it's a 4 order minimum per person.Would highly recommend this place to anyone! Will be back again!

Reviews.Author: John V.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Dinner: Pound-for-pound best sashimi deal in Little Tokyo. Fish quality is excellent and can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: Lord this is good sushi, definitely the best I have had in LA. You are going to pay for quality but don't be fooled, these prices aren't that much higher than what you will get less than a mile away at other places. The attention to detail in all of their food is evident is the consistent cuts of fish, the temperature of the sashimi and the professional demeanor of the waiting staff. The only thing that rubbed me the wrong way was the parking. I didn't have three bucks and after dropping 100$ on food the staff wouldn't charge me an extra 3$ so I wouldn't have to cross the street and get money out of an ATM. That was a bit ridiculous and honestly is the reason I haven't been back. But I cant give this place three stars because the food was too good. Experience raw fish the way it should be, and bring some cash for parking please.

Reviews.Author: Roland R.
Reviews.Content: BELIEVE THE HYPE, Sushi Gen is LEGIT!Now, is the food that great where a one-hour wait (sometimes two) is justified?  HELL NO!  But then again I wouldn't wait an hour or two even if Jesus was turning cherry tomatoes to sashimis right before your eyes!  Maybe the water to wine bit but....I digress, back to the review.  Yes the fish is REALLY fresh & high quality and the service is always FAST and friendly (enough) BUT it's PRICEY.  You do get what you paid for!  Here are some tips that can help you maneuver through the Sushi Gen madness.- they have a few spots for reservation right when they open for dinner (7pm)- park someplace else, their small lot is always chaotic and an imminent risk of a ding to your car.  Tight parking spaces and Asians don't go well together (JK....I'm Asian, I can say that)  - try and sit at the sushi bar, the service is faster - order the tuna belly and the yellowtail belly, buttery goodnessI'm sure there are other spots in Little Tokyo with the same high quality & fresh sushi/sashimi at a cheaper price BUT finding it is tough.  Sushi Gen has already been discovered and has proven itself throughout time hence its popularity!  So if you're craving high quality sushi and don't want to gamble on a new place, Sushi Gen will deliver.  Total damage $165 plus tip!  Arigato!

Reviews.Author: Lisa K.
Reviews.Content: WOW $15 sashimi lunch special!? Considering how steep prices can get for fresh sashimi I knew I had to check this place out. I was in LA on a layover after working a red eye flight so I was pretty exhausted. After a power nap, I forced myself to get up and I power walked to Sushi Gen. I barely made the lunch cut. They let me slide I think because I was by myself and I looked tired, hungry and desperate. I still had to wait over 30 minutes but it was definitely worth the wait! I knew what I wanted so I ordered as soon as I sat down and the food came out pretty quickly. I was shocked on the amount and quality of sashimi I got! The sashimi lunch special came with a plate of sashimi, miso soup, big bowl of rice, tofu appetizer, and some pickled veggies. I felt like I was in heaven with every bite of sashimi. The sashimi was very fresh and they were generous with their portions. I was amazed with the variety of fish I got as well. It was the best meal I've had in awhile and instantly my jet lag went away. It was at this restaurant I've decided that I would make it a point to try new yummy places on my layovers no matter how tired I am!The waitress was nice and always kept my tea full. I was the last one seated for their lunch time and one of the last ones to leave but I never felt rushed.I will definitely come back here for lunch and I would love to come back for dinner time as well!

Reviews.Author: Charli T.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, the sushi is great here.  No frilly fancy stupid rolls where all you can taste is the sauce and not the ingredient....it's all good ingredients here and the awesome balance of what makes sushi great.  Go here for good authentic style sushi. :)I take my rainbow roll loving people here to let them experience what real sushi is like. :3

Reviews.Author: ken T.
Reviews.Content: If you have 2 hours to kill waiting in line, it dosent get much better than this place.Put in name- wait 2 hoursEat bomb ass fish (sushi plate deluxe)Leave.Consistantly amazing.

Reviews.Author: Susie L.
Reviews.Content: Made reservations. So the wait was no problem for me on a saturday night....my bf raved about the quality at sushi gen...so I came here ready to spend 200 easy...but after a few bites...I think ill take my money else where.we BOTH left disappointed and unsatisfied.Dont get me wrong...its decent! Just not worth the price nor time. i saw the same customers when we got there still waiting when we finished dinner. poor things.What did we order? uni..sweet shrimp..toro..salmon..tamago..smelt..oystersthe best thing on our plate? bf said sweet shrimp...me tamago! lol.. everything else wasnt fresh.. slighty chewy.. and ive had better portions.I think consistency is key to a popular restaurant like this.. and even if it was good before. it def wasnt good that night.

Reviews.Author: Andrew O.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best sushi special in LA.Wait's too long sometimes.Overall great sushi.mmm.

Reviews.Author: Zack S.
Reviews.Content: BEST LUNCH SPECIAL IN LA. PERIOD.Be prepare to queue for at least 40 minutes if arriving close to lunch time.  When arriving at 11am when the restaurant actually opens there will already be a queue outside in the parking lot. BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT.Order the SASHIMI LUNCH SPECIAL platter for ONLY $15!!!.  Really, this is truly a steal.  Miso soup, some leafs, a huge plate of extremely fresh, fatty and different types of sashimi covered on your plate with rice.  Amazingly fresh and delicious and filling as well!   Don't bother with the sushi plate, just get the sashimi lunch special.MONKFISH LIVER - this is an additional must order with your lunch.  Best appetizer on the menu.  The monkfish is so fresh, smooth and frolicking (yes, i just used frockling to describe my taste buds' feelings) with delicious soft bites.will be frequenting this place often when I have the time to queue for this amazing little toyko lunch special

Reviews.Author: V T.
Reviews.Content: Rude!!!  We arrived around 8:25pm for our 8:30 reservation and waited at least 4-5 minutes in line to let the host know we arrived for our 8:30 reservation.   When we got to the host, it was  8:32 and he  dismissively and rudely says I gave your table away.  Said the wait would be 15-20 minutes which is not bad.  BUT, he was so rude I will never go back again. My grandmother has brought us and our entire huge family here for over 10 years and we would go here at least 6 times a year. I even once arrange to celebrate my grandmother's birthday here once with the whole family of at least 20 people.  We won't be coming back after this incident.  The food is very good, but the rudeness and the arrogance by the host has discounted this altogether. LA has grown in sushi and Japanese food and there are many more options nowadays. Bye bye Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Nitar L.
Reviews.Content: If you're lost trying to find this place, it's the only restaurant in the Honda Plaza with a huge mess of people waiting outside. Keeping that in mind, the wait can get to 2 hours! So don't go hungry!I was lucky enough to have my first time during lunch with only a 10-minute wait. Although our bill came to $160 for 3 people, it was the best lunch I've ever had! The sashimi combos are a steal during lunch! Also, you HAVE TO try the MONKFISH liver. I don't like guts or insides of anything.. but wow, that monkfish liver changed my world! It's like butter and melts in your mouth and it's seasoned with ponzu and scallions, yum!I've also eaten at the sushi bar, which is not as fun because you are not allowed to order combos while at the bar. So you'll spend an extra big penny just ordering plates of sushi and sashimi.Definitely in my list of top 5 sushi joints!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline H.
Reviews.Content: The lunch sashimi special is much sparser than before, but still a good deal if you didn't have to wait over an hour for it.  I finally tried their dinner sashimi special and it is even sparser than the lunch special!  They do add an order of tempura, but the fish is mostly maguro, few other variety.  Except when I have time during lunch, this place has been crossed off my list forever, unless someone else is treating.  So many other good sushi places around that this sushi factory just doesn't cut it anymore.

Reviews.Author: Julie D.
Reviews.Content: I come for Toro and it always good.

Reviews.Author: Michael O.
Reviews.Content: I see what the hype is about.  I went to lunch here on a Friday with a friend and my gf.  We got there at about 10:45AM and there were already 18 people in line waiting.  By the time they opened the doors at 11:15AM, there were close to 40 people waiting.  If you go, make sure your whole party is there.  I saw a couple of people have to step aside and wait for their other party members.  Bummer for them..but more room for me to get in haha!   The menu is pretty small.  This place is all about simplicity.  It lets the fresh fish and seafood do the talking.  You won't be getting your dragon rolls or rainbow rolls here boys and girls.  The three of us shared two sushi deluxes and the big sashimi deluxe.  I highly enjoyed the big pieces of toro and yellow tail, and the unagi nigiri. Final bill came to $80.  A bit steep.  For the wait and the price, I think I'll make this a "once every couple months" type of place.

Reviews.Author: Cathy S.
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype, not because of the value of the sashimi lunch set, but for the freshness of the fish here. In fact if you are a diehard sushi fan, don't get the precut sashimi lunch plate, get anything else on their lunch menu ( they have an amazing uni lunch set if you love uni), or simply sit at the bar and order the pieces you like. Ask for recommendations as well! The sushi chefs here do not speak very good English (at least the one that is serving me) so i suggest doing your homework ahead, like know the fish name in Japanese.

Reviews.Author: Nicollette B.
Reviews.Content: Yum Yum Yum! Put my name on that lengthy waiting list any day! I was spending a lovely day in Little Tokyo and decided to look for a good sushi place to get my fix. Sushi Gen should be called Sushi GEM, because that's really what it was!The line was far too long to wait, so my cousin and I took a seat at the bar--we were forewarned though that we must each order 4 items each--no biggie!I was then handed a long list of sushi choices, no prices, no descriptions, barely any English words. This only excited me! I had a chance to be adventurous and give my 3 semesters of Japanese a go. I ended up trying the Tuna sushi, albacore sushi, oyster in a half shell, and the spicy tuna. Had I been hungrier I would have liked to try everything! The cuts were beautiful, clean and delicious. Probably the best sushi cuts I have had anywhere. The chef sliced with care and skill! I will definitely be returning to eat at the regular dining area, since they offer more plates--I'm dying to get my hands on the sashimi platters!

Reviews.Author: Michun R.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a friend, and it was the first time here for both of us.I loved the steamed eggs !!The Sushi Deluxe Combination was really good too.I'm a fan of having a little bit if everything, So that was perfect.The environment was clean and nice, I would come back :)

Reviews.Author: N M.
Reviews.Content: I believe this describes Sushi Gen best..完全に一つのことをやってKanzen ni hitotsu no koto o yatte"doing one thing perfectly" in Japanese

Reviews.Author: josephine v.
Reviews.Content: Oh sushi gen, sushi gen... What can I say... You have probably heard of this place before, and the ever so famous $15 dollar sashimi lunch. First of all, plan to wait in line! if you are coming down from the DTLA work hustle, this might not be the place for you unless you have 30-40 minutes to spare to wait in line. Line aside, I really enjoy this place. Almost everyone has the sashimi plate on their table, and it is everything that people describe it as. FRESH... FILLING... Totally worth it. The whole thing comes with miso, warm tofu, and pickled salad to start... a big fat bowl of rice, and sashimi that includes halibut, spicy tuna, tuna, squid, albacore, toro, cooked salmon, cooked mackerel. And oh boy it was so good, ESP the toro. Washed this all down with a nice saporro and your meal is complete!!Worth $15! Try it out!

Reviews.Author: Miss J.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a double date with my fiance and our two friends.I had the BEST but MOST EXPENSIVE sushi here... I think  you can't walk out without spending at least $100/per person but it's WAY worth it if you have that money to blow. I'm not the type that would blow my money like that everyday, but it's just special to do so once in a while. You'll love the fish, it MELTS in your mouth..Truly a delicious experience. NOMMmmmm. xx

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: ***Sushi Gen is very highly regarded, but it reminds me a lot of sushi restaurants in Torrance--located in a heavily Japanese populated or Japanese traveled area and definitely an authentic feel, but the quality of the sushi just does not measure up to some of the more expensive and higher quality sushi restaurants in West Los Angeles***Sushi Gen is a very popular sushi restaurant in Little Tokyo.  It has an authentic feel and the restaurant features reasonably priced sushi dinner combinations, which makes this a decent value when compared to ordering a la carte at Sushi Gen or other Los Angeles sushi restaurants (I've been to quite a few sushi restaurants that did not offer a sushi dinner combination in the same moderate price range as Sushi Gen).We ordered a la carte and there were some high points but far too few of them given the many items we ordered.  Their monkfish liver was good--creamy and strong in flavor.yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…I also liked their toro.  While the flavor was not as good as toro I have had elsewhere, it had the appropriate amount of marbling and fattiness.  The salmon roe was also good--very fresh and bursting with juiciness.The fresh water eel was good and the yellowtail was pretty soft and fresh.  The uni was incredibly creamy, but it lacked the pronounced ocean flavor and subtle sweetness of really good uni.  The salmon was decent.All of the other sushi pieces were just average.  The surf clam was quite chewy and the amberjack lacked the softness and moistness of what you get at Sushi Zo (amberjack is a real star there).  The mackerel was dry and the special snapper was not as good as the melt-in-your-mouth snapper at Kiriko. The yellowtail belly was not as fatty as I was expecting given my experiences with toro and albacore belly, but that could just be how the cut is.yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…We had a seaweed salad that was decent as well as good and crispy tempura fried sweet shrimp heads.yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…Service was okay.  I did not like how they brought out all the sushi at once.  I was hoping they were going to space it out.  Once we finished, it did take a very long time to get the bill.  The staff was pleasant though.The dining area was comfortable and it was both nicer and bigger than I was expecting.  Though Sushi Gen is located in a tight and not that attractive retail strip, there are actually a lot of tables and the restaurant has a simple but also clean and fresh feeling look.In terms of dinner prices, sushi dinner combinations are in the $25 range, which feels reasonable given the decent quality and good portions.  Ordering a la carte results in a very expensive meal and the fish at Sushi Gen just does not measure up to expensive and higher quality sushi spots like Sushi Zo, Asanebo or Kiriko.I was hoping that Sushi Gen would be better given its strong reputation.  I would not go back, but I think it might be worth a try as well as better bang for your buck if you opt for one of their sushi dinner combinations.  I think if you are looking to spend a lot of money on a fancy sushi dinner, I would suggest Sushi Zo or Kiriko instead.The retail plaza that holds Sushi Gen has its own parking lot, which is free for 3 hours if you get your ticket validated by the restaurant.  Both free and metered street parking are also available.

Reviews.Author: T M.
Reviews.Content: One star for not opening on time. If you say you open at 11am then do so. Seems like a bad habit to leave your customers waiting outside 15 min after and this is the 2nd time I have experienced this. There will be no 3rd time. Other than this the food is good.

Reviews.Author: Henan J.
Reviews.Content: Food-the sushi is probably the freshest and most satisfying you will find in Little Tokyo...which says alot! The sashimi melts on your tongue and the entire menu is one that intrigues you and makes you want to try the new fareDecor-the look and feel of the restaurant is very welcoming. You could be there on a date-a guys night out-a sushi diner after a long day at work-this place is versatile.Service-It felt like i had 3 people waiting on our table at all times, dropping off food, filling glasses, picking up empty plates, asking if everything was to our liking...I was happily surprised.

Reviews.Author: Catherine T.
Reviews.Content: Dear Sushi Gen I love you! Come here every 2 weeks and the sushi is so fresh. Enjoy it every time and the sushi chefs have great personalities. Although it not the cheapest meal in town it definitely is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Sandy Y.
Reviews.Content: I love you, Sushi Gen! You never fail to impress me with your quality fish. Come here for sashimi plate and you will not be disappointed. Even better, come during lunchtime, you will score a lunch special deal with the sashimi plate which is normally $21-$26(if you want to add miso soup and salad) during dinner timeService is great. There is often a wait. You can make reservation for dinner. If you come during the weekday for dinner, the wait can range from 15-20, which is not bad compared to lunchtime where the wait can be up to an hour. Parking is easy to find because they have a lot and you can get validated for parking.

Reviews.Author: Tram D.
Reviews.Content: Sushi gen....hmm...Bullet S. and I came here for dinner and we ordered the Sashimi Deluxe platter. I don't really like eating raw fish...but it was good..not like super amazing, but good. lol. We waited for about 20 minutes, and parking was a beezy. :( Free parking with validation tho! :) I believe the lunch special deal is better for $15 vs. $40..i think..yeah..I'll come back and try the lunch sashimi!

Reviews.Author: Melissa L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi bar was the best! The kama collar bone was so huge and soft on the inside so yummy. Unagi is always a favorite of mine, but they also had this appetizer which was seaweed with shredded mountain potato....I had to have two... ^^"

Reviews.Author: Summer F.
Reviews.Content: No parking?!? I ended up parking across the street for $7 because their lot was full. (Still $3 at their own parking lot) I had to because I am meeting my friends. Then waited outside in the cold to get called. Waited some more because my friend is late and we lost our table. The sushi is okay. Is it just me? The portion has gotten smaller now. I normally wouldn't care, but I am not liking this $7 parking situation. Not coming back.

Reviews.Author: See W.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch at $15 never fails.  If you don't want to wait too long, come before 11AM for the first seating at 11:15 AM.

Reviews.Author: Henry D.
Reviews.Content: This place has been many years running and it is still one of the best sushi deals in LA based on quality for price. The main reason you'll want to come here is their $15 sashimi lunch meal, which you will find numerous pictures of on this yelp.The plate includes several slices of lean tuna prepared in various ways, by itself, spicy mixed, etc. Also there is a couple slices of bluefin tuna, some yellowtail, calamari, a piece of octopus, among other variables. It comes with as much sushi rice on the side as you need, a couple pickled vegetable dishes, as well as miso soup and green tea. And this is fresh, caught off the West coast fish.Quite the amazing deal.And by the way folks, all of this is absolutely NO SECRET to the public. If you get there after they open, be prepared to wait at least an hour in line outside before you are seated. If you come about half an hour before they open at 11am, you will most likely be seated right when they open.Like I said, fresh fish, very good knifework, very traditional flavors. This place was very close to the quality I had been eating in Japan recently on my trip.

Reviews.Author: Candy W.
Reviews.Content: Came here New Years Eve and was told that the wait would be around 40 minutes. Okay, not a problem. So I put my name down for four people. Waited outside for almost an hour and go back in asking how much longer the wait would be for Candy, the table for four. The guy tells me there are three more people in front of me and that I would be seated pretty soon. So cool, I don't mind waiting for sushi that is going to be amazing! Btw, this is my first time here and we drove an hour just to come eat here.Anyway, the host comes out and calls my name, get super excited cus it's freezing and we were starving. The host doesn't even walk us to the table, but instead points at the table we're being seated at. We walk up to the table and the busboy was still cleaning the table so we stand their for a few awkward minutes. Then the busboy looked confused and the host walked over and told us that our table was the clean one in front of us (it was a two seater). I stare back at him and was like, "there are four of us..." so we all walk back to the front where the host station is and the stupid four eye harry potter guy put me down for two people. I confronted him and said that I said four and even repeated it two or even three times!! He then said with major attitude, "well I heard two." I was super annoyed at this point, not because they got the number of people wrong, but he was EXTREMELY RUDE!! And he even saw that I came in with three other people, my bf and his two little sisters. Like seriously?! Get better glasses you mofo. I wanted to punch him. He made us wait another 20 minutes and eventually sat us next to the kitchen door. It was a horrible seating, I'm pretty sure he sat us there on purpose. At this point I was only just annoyed, but later on this four eye harry potter wannabe guy ruins our dinner and our night.Don't get me wrong, the waitresses and busboys were pretty nice.My table ordered...Shrimp Tempura - not the best I had, very average. It's crispy on the outside but soggy on the insidecold tofu - pretty good, it's cold tofu (what could go wrong?)butter salmon with sashimi combo - salmon was good (not dry), but the sashimi looked and tasted like left over sashimisalmon - pretty goodfried calimari - not good, don't get this"live" sweet shrimp - DISGUSTING!! IT WAS FROZEN AND NOT FRESH!!So here's where I started to get pissed off. This is what I mainly came here for, live sweet shrimp. LIVE. I was excited when I received my sweet shrimp sashimi (comes in three pieces btw.) because apparently they have scrumptious sweet shrimp. I look at it when it arrives and it looked milky and not clear and fresh like how live shrimp is suppose to look. I take a bite out of it and omgosh, it was so mushy and slimey like it was frozen for couple of days then defrosted. So gross, worst sweet shrimp I've ever had. I immediately called the waitress and told her to take it back (nicely, of course). Then bam! Here's the good part. The annoying four eye host came by our table and was like,him: what's wrong with itme: well it's not live for onehim: well it's not shrimp season so we don't have any live shrimpwth, that's the first I've heard of it not being "shrimp season"me: well it says LIVE sweet shrimphim: well there's no live shrimp right nowme: then you shouldn't be selling "live" sweet shrimp to customer, especially if they're paying more than $10 per piece of shrimp. And plus, I called last week asking if you guys had any live shrimp and the person said yeshim: that's not possible, there's only two guys that answers the phone, me and the other guy... so I'm here thinking (blanking out cus I didn't want to be mean), are you calling me a liar... plus a girl picked up when I asked...him: what do you want me to do thenme: if you guys have live shrimp I'd love to have that, but since you guys don't could you please return it pleasehe gets mad, rolls his eyes, and promptly walks awaySo I was pretty pissed at this point from this little dispute between me and the host. My boyfriend was pretty mad and was ready to punch the guy in the face, but he sat their quietly so that I could handle it.So yeah, I had a pretty horrible experience here because of the faggot host and the unfresh sashimi. If you love sashimi, go to hama sushi. They're not the best quality, but at least their not live sweet shrimp doesn't taste slimey and gross like Sushi Gen, and only at the fraction of the price!I never put a price on good quality food, but if you're serving me shit at the same price of a top quality restaurant. You can suck my "live sweet shrimp"!Anyway, I would have given this place maybe a 3 or 4, but because of the RUDE four eye host. I will never, ever come here again. I will also tell all my family and friends never to come here for as long as he is working at this establishment.

Reviews.Author: Yoona S.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! I made a reservation at 7pm on a Thursday night. As soon as we walked in, we were seated. This place is always super packed, so do make a reservation. It will definitely save you a lot of time. My friend and I both ordered the chirashi deluxe and what can I say. It was super fresh and super delicious. Sashimi literally melts in your mouth. It's a decent portion of food and only $21. Not bad at all! Service is awesome. Food is awesome. Price is awesome. What more can you ask for? I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Author: Ivy W.
Reviews.Content: My dad loves sushi and hadn't been to Sushi-Gen yet, so I brought him and my family here to celebrate Father's Day last month. I made reservations a month in advanced for the Saturday before since they're closed on Sundays. They warned us on the phone if we were even a minute late, our reservation would be forfeited. We arrived with 2 minutes to spare... but we still had to wait 10 minutes for a table.Dad started off with a bowl of Steamed Clams ($10), which he thought were delicious. My parents shared a Uni Dinner ($39) and Sashimi Deluxe ($35), and being the human garbage disposals they are, they finished both easily and loved every bite. I had a piece of the uni and surprisingly, I didn't hate it as I have at other restaurants. Mom finished off with a Hamachi Kama Ala (Yellowtail Collar, $15) and thoroughly enjoyed it as well.yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…I ordered the Sauteed Sole Dinner ($20), which they actually ran out of and replaced with Red Snapper. The fish was good but not amazing enough for me to order again next time. My sister opted for the Salmon Dinner ($24), and felt the same way. Both dinners came with a scoop of potato salad, which got me super excited 'cause it's one of my favorite sides. yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…Service was really friendly and attentive; the staff constantly cleared the empty dishes from our table but that's mostly due to the fact that our table was quite small and we ordered a lot of dishes. The only thing I didn't like were the hosts. There were two male hosts and both were grumpy looking, unfriendly, and short to the point. I even witnessed one yelling at a busser for not cleaning a table quickly enough, which I thought was unnecessary.The bill was $153 (pre-tax and tip) for our party of four, which isn't tooooo bad for fresh and quality sushi. I probably wouldn't come again just because I don't really like raw fish and they don't have too many cooked entree options. However, Sushi-Gen definitely hasn't seen the last of my parents.

Reviews.Author: Demetri E.
Reviews.Content: this place is the best in the west.. toro, amaebi, hottate, aji,... all as good as it gets... hard to get reservations so make them 2 weeks out or do the sushi bar... freshest quality in LA for less than those other more fancy trendy spots that invest more in fancy decorations and less in good fish.

Reviews.Author: Forrest D.
Reviews.Content: No longer even near the best sushi I've eaten, it's still very good for the price though not worth the wait. There are a number of neighborhood places with better sushi though. An excellent place to try good sushi and start a journey towards the upper tier restaurants in the Westside and the Valley.

Reviews.Author: Jcub O.
Reviews.Content: All of the sashimi was very flavorful and the side dishes were tastefully done. Prices are quite reasonable for the quality of food and the service was great. Nice to have a local sushi place that takes reservations and can accommodate small groups (I love Hama and Komasa as well but they are very small and don't take reservations).

Reviews.Author: Candace L.
Reviews.Content: I gotta give it a 5 stars for my last visit..Knowing the crazy wait without a reservation, I quickly found my way here around 5:15 just when they opened for dinner and it was already a packed house with wait. Luckily, I only had to wait about 5-10mins for a party of two which is pretty darn good considering the usual wait is about 45mins! The hosts were very polite and the service was really quick and helpful.This time around..I ordered the Sushi Deluxe dinner which also came with Tempura and a Salmon Skin Salad which was really good and really green! Which is a plus for me cuz I really don't care for side salads that only consist of iceberg lettuce. The sushi was sooo fresh and seriously could tell the difference in quality! The Toro that they included was OMG. BLEW. MY. MIND. It was soo ridiculously soft, melt-in-your-mouth, GOOD. I should've ordered more of this now that I think about it!The Sashimi Plate is interesting.. I like SOME of the sashimi they include.. but I think they also include a lot of nonsense that I don't care for and could do without.I also got one order of Fresh Salmon. The catch today was Canadian Salmon something something which happened to be superrrrr buttery soft. So good!

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi melts in your mouth!!The first 2 times that I came here, I ordered the sashimi deluxe platter, which was a great way to sample a variety of fish. Third time around, I realized that my faves were the toro/fatty tuna & salmon, so the boyfriend and I just ordered  a la carte - totally worth it.  I was also craving teriyaki chicken, so we ordered a bowl of that, but I'd recommend steering clear of this.  Definitely come for the sushi!  Service: Service was decent, but it could be better.  I think it just gets so busy inside that the staff gets a bit overwhelmed.  The service wasn't awful, so I wouldn't dock that many points off from the overall experience.Parking: The lot can get pretty full, and be sure to ask the host at the door for validation!  Otherwise, there will be a small fee at the exit of the lot.Reservations: YES! Please make a reservation unless you want to wait about an hour for a table.  Pricing: It's sushi... GOOD quality sushi, so don't come here expecting to pay $20/person.  TIP: I hear they have a deluxe special during their lunch hours, so if you have the time during the day, I suggest coming for lunch instead of dinner to save yourself a few bucks.

Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: First time in.  I thought the fish was quite good, BUT, they don't have prices on their sushi menu.  I ordered 6 things, ie 12 pieces of sushi and water and then received an unitemized bill for $56.  I know sushi isn't cheap but that's a bit ridiculous.

Reviews.Author: Daniel P.
Reviews.Content: Everything is fresh here and there are many different types of fish to choose from.  After dining here, I can't eat sushi/sashimi anywhere else unless its AYCE. prices at the table are very reasonable. For two, getting  two entrees, such as sushi deluxe and sashimi deluxe, with a drink and everything included will run around $90.  At the bar, things can get real pricey and can easily reach $250 for two people.  Well, that's because I always get the specialty items and omakase for a few rounds. Chefs are talented and they are fun to chat with.  Be prepared to wait up to an hour if you come at dinner time.

Reviews.Author: Hans T.
Reviews.Content: So over rated !the rude waiter took our name and told us to wait for an hour and 30 mins for 8 ppl table. But he never called our name, after an hour and 30 mins later, he told us we have to wait for another 30 mins because he assume we don't have all 8 ppl. he didn't ask but just assume! what an butt head. Food here is no special anyway, price so high, service sucks. I guess my money is not worth anything here, can't even get an fair treatment. This place sucks for group. I'll never come back again.

Reviews.Author: Shirls K.
Reviews.Content: Came recently on a Saturday evening and sat at the sushi bar. Had a wonderful dining experience! The yellowtail sashimi and the wild salmon sashimi were my favorites!!  It was so fresh and tasty that we ordered seconds, lol. The sardines were also very good. Parking: We arrived after 8pm and found free meter parking on 2nd street and central.

Reviews.Author: Maurice l.
Reviews.Content: Defiantly one of the best sushi spots ever.Low key, chill ambiance, awesome bar, defiantly sit at the bar and always ask your chef to make you his favorite sashimi or sushi because it is always awesome and they make it with love.

Reviews.Author: Lucine C.
Reviews.Content: why people keep saying this is the best sushi/sashimi place in LA? I just don't get it.Tips:Parking is $2 with their receipt. But you have to ask. Or they will charge you a lot!Service is not good. When you asked them "what's inside xxx?" they will just point at another table who ordered the same dish and tell you "just like that" with no smile on their face. I understand they don't like to talk too much because of their language proficiency. But what the heck is that attitude? Food is just ok. Though I didn't have much sushi experience in LA, I can tell at my first bite that this is definitely not the best here.Even the sashimi I had in Todai the seafood buffet is better than this!!!!The fish sashimi is not that fresh. They lack the bounciness and fattiness that a fresh,  high quality raw fish should have. And the uni sashimi, omg! I got small particles of sand in it!!! Don't tell me this is what the fresh uni should be. I will never have this again.And the price is ridiculous. About $23 for a water ell rice lunch set, and $35 for a uni/sashimi lunch set. We got like $70 for two people after tax and tips. If you order uni sushi, it will be 2 for $12. That's crazy! Well, I'd rather go to Todai buffet, which is even cheaper!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Matthew T.
Reviews.Content: I've been here so many times now to have their sashimi deluxe and all times have been just delicious.Yellowtail collar was awesome! And I was surprisingly full from just the sashimi deluxe and yellowtail collar. The sashimi deluxe is the perfect size for two. Also, wow, how can I not talk about their lunch special where for $15 you can get a sashimi lunch combo with many of the items they have during dinner. It isn't quite as big but you still get a lot of sashimi thats fresh for a price that can't be beat anywhere. The only thing keeping Sushi-Gen from being a five-star restaurant is the wait. It's hard to get a table but if you're calling ahead for the lunch special you can be in and out with take-out in 10 minutes flat.

Reviews.Author: Scarlet W.
Reviews.Content: This review is for dinner. I suspect that most of the 5-star reviews are for their lunch specials, which admittedly at $15 is a good deal. I made a reservation in advance so did not wait in line, but there was an enormous horde of people standing outside of the restaurant when I arrived. I personally have no desire to go to Sushi-Gen again, much less wait outside in a long line.I ordered the toro and the sashimi deluxe. The toro was fine but unmemorable. The sashimi deluxe was memorable for the strange piles of what looked like chopped, leftover tuna at the edges of my sashimi plate. For once in my life, I couldn't finish tuna sashimi -- the tuna was bland and far from fresh. I have high standards for sushi, and Sushi-Gen didn't meet my very basic requirements for sushi I would consume. Point of advice for people that see all the wonderful reviews and want to try Sushi-Gen: go because you expect it to be good value, not because you expect the best sushi dinner of your life.

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for years and have always recommended it to friends and family. However during my last visit, how we were treated is simply unacceptable and I will never go back again. The three of us arrived at 6pm so we got seated immediately.  When the waitress came and asked us what we wanted my mother mentioned that we were still waiting for my wife to arrive. The waitress said that we were not allowed to sit and wait.  I understood where she was coming from because I have worked at restaurants before so right away I assured the waitress that we would order for everybody at once which should have alleviated the problem, right?  WRONG!!She said she would inform the manager and he could make the decision. The manager came over and angrily told us either my wife would not be allowed to sit with us or that we would have to leave.  Keep in mind there were no other parties waiting for our table and we again offered to order everything at once, right away - to no avail.  If we were holding up the table I'd understand. If we had to add another chair and block a walkway, I'd understand as well.  But that was not the case in this situation and to be treated this way with no compromise or reasonable solution offered by an angry manager is unacceptable.

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at 5:35, we got the LAST table and the sushi bar was full. We're talking a room with 75+ table seating... they open at 5:30.  The waitress was friendly and succinct with our order, which I like.  Now the food... we ordered the sushi deluxe and a couple of rolls.  We were in sushi heaven. We are regular customers here, but finally decided to let ya all know.  Yep I'm a fan.

Reviews.Author: Carmen T.
Reviews.Content: Quality sashimi and sushi in Little Tokyo! You will always see a line out the door and trust me, it does live up to the hype! Great service and attentive staff. Do make reservations ahead of time to avoid the one-hour wait. My parents and I came here for Christmas Eve dinner and we ordered the Sashimi Deluxe, Yellowtail Collar, Miso Soup & Calamari. The Sashimi Deluxe consists of salmon, tuna, yellowtail, toro, shrimp, jellyfish, surf clam, etc. Good presentation and this is enough for two people! The Yellowtail Collar was fresh and seasoned perfectly. Everything was on point and I would definitely come back here again :)

Reviews.Author: J S.
Reviews.Content: The food and service deserves 5 stars, but it's overpriced.  Priced way higher than Sugarfish.For overall value Sugarfish wins.

Reviews.Author: Clara B.
Reviews.Content: Great place for amazing sushi, in fact a lady sitting next to me was visiting from NY and it's her favorite place in LA....Enjoyed a dinner out with friends, we had a great table and ordered quite a few dishes, loved the sashimi bowl for $35 and the ice cream was truly special...I have had dinner here a few times and sat at the bar and enjoyed it each time with friends and alone as well...The sushi chefs are amazing and the sweet shrimp is quite nice...I heard they have a lunch Sashimi special, I must try that next....There is always a waiting line, so I recommend you make reservations or put your name down, easier to get a table as well.

Reviews.Author: Liz M.
Reviews.Content: Opens at 11 but they don't actually open the doors and let the patrons sit until 11:15. So I guess their official opening time is 11:15am. Two Monday's in a row I've already come to enjoy their sashimi lunch special and both times I've left feeling satisfied. So yes, to me this is "as good as it gets" especially with that $15 price tag!The only other thing I've tried besides their sashimi lunch special is the uni topped with a quail egg which was so fresh and so clean tasting. MmmmMmmm, makes me want some right now. From the variety of fish you get on the sashimi lunch plate you can tell their fish is most definitely fresh so don't be afraid to order some nigiri off the menu. I kind of wish the plate that the sashimi comes on had the names of eat cut of fish I got, just so I know what I was having. I mean for the most part I know. If anyone can name each item that'd be great!*They do take reservations, but heard you still have to get in line.*Don't forget to get your parking ticket validated.*Most importantly enjoy the fresh fish!

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: Line starts before 5pm on a Friday and they open at 530pm. Come at 530ish and should be seated. Get the sashimi combo or platter. Great to share with someone! Not the best but its pretty good! Apparently its a very popular place for lunch? Parking: Small lot. It gets filled up quick. There are meter parking spots on the street if otherwise.

Reviews.Author: Dave H.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places in the LA area located nearby Little Tokyo or "J-Town" - always full of business people, hipsters and even a few uncles & auntys from the neighborhood.Great lunch specials and super fresh quality sushi.  Very friendly service.  Sashimi is like the stuff you see in Japan.  Very fresh always and probably hand selected daily.  Go for the sashimi moriawase for best effect.  Always nice plate presentation.  Sushi rice is of best quality along with their fish and slicing skills - this one is a hit. One of the better miso soups in the area even for J-Town.  All your standard japanese small dishes.  Always a wait but well worth it for the price & quality.

Reviews.Author: Jenny Y.
Reviews.Content: This is THE BEST place to come for sashimi. I'd recommend the Sashimi Dinner with tempura for $26. It comes with a huge variety of sashimi and four pieces of tempura (shrimp, potato, zucchini and eggplant). With the miso soup and rice that comes on the side, the meal will more than fill you up. I don't normally eat sashimi very often, but I could see and taste the difference between Gen's sashimi and other Japanese restaurants in terms of freshness, variety and quality. The sashimi included spicy tuna, kani (crab), sake (salmon), toro (fatty tuna), hamachi (yellowtail), among others which I can't name. Everything tasted so delicious and it was really filling! The only downside is the restaurant is pretty small and there's only one location in LA. If you're coming anywhere near the peak lunch or dinner times, definitely expect a wait. Luckily, the food comes out pretty quickly and the servers are really friendly and check on you often. If you want to know how good sashimi can taste, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Author: Sharon C.
Reviews.Content: Indeed, the day I get food poisoning from this place is the day I reconsider my zeal for coming here any freaking day I can. Luckily for my stomach, this hasn't happened yet, so bring on the sashimi lunch special! I've been here on three different days for the sashimi special, and each time I've been here the restaurant service has been fast, the staff friendly, and the fish fresh with generous portions at the outrageously low price of 15.00 a plate. True, this place is wildly popular and I've always had to wait at least 30 minutes to an hour to be seated (keep in mind that I've only been here M-F for their popular sashimi special) but I've always found that the wait has been worth it. The sashimi plate is a mixed assortment of what appears to be mainly different types of tuna, with yellow tail, squid, and two mounds of chopped up fish mixed with spices that is really yummy. Altogether there are about 15-20 pieces included on the sashimi plate and it also comes with a side of rice, tofu, pickled cabbage, and miso soup.  Once seated, the total turn around time to finishing your meal and paying off your check is probably about 45 minutes to an hour as the high demand for this special makes the service prompt and attentive to keep the flow of customers going- not a bad thing in my opinion cause it allows me to move along quickly and enjoy the rest of my day. Would highly recommend this place for the sashimi special- can't vouch for anything else though cause everything else on the regular menu is quite pricey in comparison.

Reviews.Author: Virgil A.
Reviews.Content: Overrated. I hate to be a hipster, but I just don't understand the long lines for average sushi.  The Uni and Sashimi combination, specifically the uni, was fucking brilliant.  The sashimi, however, was decent and didn't make me want to text my fish snob homies immediately.If this place didn't have a half hour to an hour wait every time, I'd probably knock it up to 4 stars, but to each his own.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: Classic hole-in-the-wall in a dingy plaza right off of 2nd street that caters to some of the FRESHEST sushi around LA! I've gotten the toro sushi, and chirashi bowl on my previous visits to Sushi Gen.  The toro was amazingly buttery and smooth, and the chirashi bowl was assorted with a great variety of fish (with the yellowtail being my favorite) - and was very filling.  I always ask for my chirashi with just yellowtail & salmon, to avoid getting the other cheaper things on it, but all ingredients here were just so fresh & delicious that I happily scarfed each piece down.  Next time I'll have to brave up and try to wait in the giant line for its ever-so-famous lunch special!The only down-side is the incredible wait (the lunch special is so popular that people line up from 10a.m. on, hoping to get in around noon...). Other than that, it is pricey but you definitely get what you pay for - fresh sashimi and the sushi chefs that know how to do sushi right!
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Charlene K.
Reviews.Content: the only reason why im giving sushi gen 4 stars is because of the wait. I came here for lunch and i waited what seemed like forever. I have to admit i hate waiting and am very impatient so i hated waiting for a table when i was hungry. I actually didnt even go late. 10 mins after they opened!! but obiously 10 min too late! haha I dont know why restaurants wont just take reservations :(But anyway, my lunch was only $15!!!! I got a sashimi plate which was so filling. I got a side of salmon sushi because i LOVE salmon, however i definitely didnt need to eat that. I was so full. But the sashimi plate came with miso soup, a cucumber side dish, tofu side, and a big bowl of rice. For the amount of food that came out, the price was so good! Their lunch specials are very nice so definitely worth a try for those who havent gone. Appaently their dinners just as good but i have yet to try that because everytime i go they are either closed or the waits just too long :/ hopefully ill get another chance soon :)

Reviews.Author: Hanh D.
Reviews.Content: Hard to go wrong here but giving it 4 stars because of the  wait. Also would like to see their omakase a little more inspired. Hubbie ordered and after 5 pieces the sushi chef asked him what he'd like to try next. I thought it was you choice chef!?! If you're not crazy about sushi, go elsewhere please and let the rest of us get in 5 mins faster. :) But seriously though their basic bentos stuff is delicious too. I enjoyed my salmon shioyake.

Reviews.Author: Assal N.
Reviews.Content: after reading all the yelp reviews i decided i had to try it...we ordered the assorted sashimi platter,,, i cant believe how much toro was in a assorted plate.... we loved the atmosphere but i think we had way to much raw fish and it got me a little sick

Reviews.Author: Andy O.
Reviews.Content: Have always told myself I need to check out this place, but heard that the wait was horrible and that the reservation system was very cut-throat. That's a problem for me because I don't do lines and my friends are completely unreliable Koreans who would cause us to forfeit our reservation.But we had an excellent and surprisingly simple plan: just walk in right when it opens and it'll be fine. It almost failed, but we did walk right in and grab the last two empty seats at the bar. I like this place. It's very no-frills. This is just good sushi with friendly, attentive service, in a no-bells-and-whistles environment. They also aren't eager to hustle you out. You order a bunch of sushi, and they serve it at whatever pace you're consuming. Not those spots where you get a gigantic, quickly-turning-to-questionable plate of fish at once. Importantly, the sushi is delicious. I'm no sushi pro (and, aside from wine-snobs, I think pretentious sushi-snobs are among the most horrible people in the world), but I can always pick out at least one item in the course of a sushi dinner that was just so-so. Not the case here. We'll be back. Always at 5pm. And always break-dancing.

Reviews.Author: Ammii W.
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at Sushi Gen, as always! I was first introduced to Gen on my 22nd birthday.  Few years later, I went back to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday!  He is a sushi-holic!  Gen impressed us once again.  They always go beyond our expectations.  We waited about 2 hours, but it's really worth the wait.  If you are little impatient, then maybe consider making reservation :).   If you would like have an exquisite sushi experience, you should try this place!

Reviews.Author: Kent M.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special.  Do yourself a favor and come early, though.  I got there 30 minutes before opening time and there was a loooooooooong line.  My only minor gripe is they charge $1 for gari (pickled ginger) and $5 for nori.  I'd rather they just raise the price of the lunch special (way underpriced) than nickel and dime me for  stuff that's usually free.

Reviews.Author: Euna J.
Reviews.Content: Fresh Fish Authentic Japanese style sushi & other dishesGreat Lunch SpecialUsually long waiting line, especially during lunch, easy parking.

Reviews.Author: Ben G.
Reviews.Content: The kicker here is FRESH and TRADITIONAL! Don't walk in thinking you're going to get a volcano jalapeno roll or anything like that. if you want expertly prepared insanely fresh fish this is the place, NEW NEW favorite spot when I'm in yucky downtown LA.CHEERS

Reviews.Author: Carissa J.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the random strip mall and the dinky blue sign catch you off guard. This is some of the freshest sushi I've had. The quality of the sashimi was superb. Surprisingly got really full from it. Got the sashimi deluxe. The colors on the plate were so beautiful and so so yummy. Luckily went at a good time and didn't really have to wait. Hope I have as good of luck next time as well!

Reviews.Author: Z L.
Reviews.Content: I come here frequently for their sashimi lunch. For a generous amount of sashimi at a price of $15, this place simply can't be beat!

Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: This place has the potential to be an awesome restaurant if they weren't so fucking full of themselves. It's like that sports prospect that every team knows is really good, but most teams pass on drafting due to personality issues. Likewise, Sushi-Gen has quality sushi at a reasonable price, but everyone from the host to the servers are pretty much dickbutts, which definitely detracts from an otherwise great sushi/sashimi experience. The wife and I carpool as much as possible and she works near Little Tokyo so we actually got to Sushi-Gen before they even opened on a weeknight, yet already there was a mob of people. Upon opening their doors it felt like being at Walmart for Black Friday because people were shoving and shit to be seated. Seriously, they need to take a page from other busy Japanese restaurants like Shin Sen Gumi Yakitori in Gardena or the Shabu Shabu House in the Japanese Village Mall by having a sign-in wait list. Anyways, once we were seated at our table, the wife and I ordered an overpriced sea cucumber appetizer that was pretty much flavorless. For $8 we were definitely underwhelmed. So yea, fuck the sea cucumber! Next, the gluttons inside us had us ordering two, that's right count 'em, two sashimi deluxes ($35 each) for dinner. Seriously, what the fuck were we thinking? The portions were humongous and we were unable to finish everything... then again not everything tasted good.The problem with Sushi-Gen is that they have no descriptions by their menu items and the servers don't really explain shit. What makes things worse is that there is no fucking AT&T reception inside the restaurant so I couldn't log onto Yelp, which would have averted the disaster of ordering too much shit. I know that they say hindsight is 20/20, but I should have done a little more research before coming. So onto the sashimi deluxe... When one thinks sashimi, one thinks raw fish, yet the sashimi deluxe also came with a piece of tamago (egg omelet slice), a piece of overcooked salmon, and some weird soy sauce marinated tuna side. I guess deluxe at Sushi-Gen must mean cooked leftovers. Chikusho!As for the actual sashimi on the plate, it consisted of slices of toro (fatty tuna), maguro (tuna), salmon, mackerel, yellowtail, octopus, squid, mirugai (geoduck), cubes of leftover tuna, a heap of some mysterious white fish in a ginger marinade, two globs of marinated tuna (spicy and non-spicy) and shrimp. While I loved the toro, maguro, salmon, and shrimp, the octopus and squid were dry and aside from the spicy tuna marinade, the other items just took up space. Regardless, for $35 it is a good bargain and the sashimi slices were nice and thick. However, if you come with a party of two, just order one sashimi deluxe. Usually when you go to a "real" Japanese restaurant and not one run by Koreans or Chinese people, the service is awesome. Even within Little Tokyo, at other sushi places like Hama and Komasa, I feel like they want me at the restaurant despite the "credit card rules" signs. However, at Sushi-Gen, not only was there a lack of geniality, the service was sub-par and what fucking pissed me off was they charged an extra $1 for ginger. I was surprised that they didn't charge me extra for soy sauce and wasabi, stingy fucktards. Maybe if we were in Japan I would have been more forgiving, but when even Yoshinoya does not charge for goddamn ginger, the last thing I expected was to be nickeled and dimed at Sushi-Gen. At the end of the day, the quality of most of the sashimi was good enough to warrant a return visit. However, I will not be ordering the sashimi deluxe ever again because I expect just sashimi when I order sashimi. Oh yea, and that hot tea? It's $1.50. At least they don't charge for refills. --------------------------------------------------­-----Pictures:Sashimi Deluxe bit.ly/14KHXljSea Cucumber bit.ly/Y3uLRp

Reviews.Author: Ran J.
Reviews.Content: I came into Sushi Gen on a Thursday at 12:30 pm and was seated after half an hour, which was not bad at all, considering how long I've had to wait at other places. The little Japanese lady who served me was so adorable, and so fast at bringing me my food and drink.My order was the sashimi lunch, and it was DA BOMB. A plate of assorted fresh sashimi, a little bit of barbequed meat, a small plate of veggies, a small bowl of tofu, miso soup, and a HUGE bowl of rice later, I was ready to never eat again. It filled me up and sustained me for the rest of the day, which is pretty impressive since I have quite a voracious appetite and I had eaten nothing else that day.Overall, I had a pretty good experience there. The only minor downside was that I felt a tiny bit rushed at times, which is pretty understandable given how crowded the restaurant gets.

Reviews.Author: Thomas N.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was craving sushi on our trip down to socal. She looked up a place and saw the number of reviews. So we had to try this place. Parking was in a lot and they charged 3 dollars to park. I'm guessing because it was a Saturday night.  Also was full when we got there. This is not like any sushi restaurant where you order rolls. This is fish and sushi rice. The wait was 30 minutes for 2 people for dinner. If you want fresh great sushi, this is the place to go. We ordered the tuna tataki, edamame, salmon sashimi, a sushi deluxe and a bbq bento. The tuna tataki was not the best that I had before. However the fish itself was so delicate I melted in my mouth practically. Hands down the best freshest prepared fish I will ever eat. Although the price is high, well worth it. SOOOOO GOOOD!Must try? YES!Would I go here again? YES!

Reviews.Author: Lily Y.
Reviews.Content: Great place for sushi and sashimi in Little Tokyo! So worth the wait!! :)PRO: The best thing about this place is the sashimi lunch special (FYI, only offered on weekdays) !! :DCONS: Usually you have to wait about 30-45 min for a table. FYI, they don't offer the sashimi lunch special at the sushi bar. So make sure you ask for a table, which is a longer wait.Service: Good and quick! The moment you sit down and order the sashimi lunch special, everything will come out in less than 5 min.Food: Delicious! Very filling! You get miso soup, tofu, and tsukemono for starters. Then the big plate of sashimi will come out with a big bowl of rice. I really like the tuna, salmon, seaweed and crab. The plate will be different each time you come. I've had the squid, shrimp, mackarel, spicy tuna, octopus, and some other things on my plate. I can barely finish it! I usually end up not eating the rice to save room for the fish. :)Parking: Fairly small parking lot in the Honda Plaza. Make sure to validate your parking ticket. Parking is $2 with validation.Whenever I get off work early or have a day off, this is my go-to place for lunch!!

Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the best sushi in LA/OC for the $$$.  Quality of the seafood, and extraordinary preparation is the main reason to make this your go-to sushi restaurant.  Reasonable prices is the icing on the cake.  It's always nice to occasionally splurge on a $100+ per person sushi dinner, but it's not so friendly on the pocket book.  Dined a few times for dinner and enjoyed my experiences at the sushi bar while enjoying Omakase.  The sushi chef will work with you if you don't like a particular type of fish.  But, be adventurous, it's all really good!  I love the toro, sweet shrimp (fried head in a soup will follow), scallop, mackerel, fatty tuna, red snapper, octopus, and my absolute favorite....uni. I recently came for the sashimi lunch special.  For $15 you get miso soup, rice, and a sashimi platter that will fill you up.  Toro is NOT offered at lunch, but you will not be disappointed with the other selection.  Get here early or make reservations.  ALWAYS packed at lunch, and an hour into dinner (opens at 5pm).  No reservations for the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: It's rare that I will rate a restaurant as "5 stars" because there are so many things to consider. Obviously food should be at the top of the list. However, price, service, and impression rank as important factors as well. Sushi Gen receives my stamp of approval because it has a well-rounded mixture of all the things that I think make for a great restaurant. So without ado, I shall begin an account of my experience.The Saturday night started out with a bit of parking trouble, as the private parking lot was filled. However, I was able to quickly find some on-street parking. Once at the door, we found that the line was sizable: 1.5 hrs for a table. However, the sushi bar came with only a 45 minute wait. Before, people start criticizing about this point, let me clarify the nature of supply and demand. When you come to a popular restaurant (ie. ranked 4.5 on Yelp), you expect that it will be busy. So then, it should follow that there should be no reason to complain about a long wait. Think of it as the price of admission. And for me, the wait was definitely worthwhile. And having said that, the sushi bar, which I ended up choosing, was by far the more desirable choice. There is definitely a sense of magic when you're right up close to the sushi chefs, and are able to see their culinary magic and knife skills. Now for the food. To put things short, the sushi was excellent, amongst the best I've had, even when compared to places that charge $140+ per person. Though before I start however, I must make a disclaimer that my assessment is based solely on the sushi menu, as the dinner menu was not available at the sushi bar. But to qualify the validity of my statements, it is my belief that the sushi should also be the star, not the cooked dishes. Speaking of benchmarks for excellence, one of the key plates I order is called Uni (Sea Urchin). This delicacy is very fresh-dependent: one can tell very immediately if the Uni has been sitting around in a refrigerator for a while. Here, the Uni was just perfect. Not bitter, slightly sweet, just as it should be. The texture was perfect, and the presentation was immaculate. It simply melts in the mouth. Once I had tasted the Uni, I knew I was in for a treat. The next dish, which I have really only tasted at one other restaurant, was the Monkfish Liver. It was served as an appetizer in some sort of soy-sauce-based sauce with spices. I think we oftentimes expect fish liver to have an oily and salty consistency to it. However, such was not the case for the Monkfish Liver here. The combination of product and spice was just perfect, lending to a savory flavor with just the right amount of acidity to open up the dish and provide a refreshing aftertaste. To clear the palate, the sushi chefs followed up with some seaweed which was meant to be dipped in the same sauce. Other sushi we tried were Sweet Shrimp, Abalone, Yellowtail, Half Beak (needle fish), Sardine, Spanish Mackerel, Scallop, Herring Roe, Japanese Snapper. Amongst these, there was definitely a standout. The Half Beak (Needle Fish) was recommended by the sushi chef, and ended up being one of the most delicious plates I've ever tried. I don't know if it was the subtle vinegar/wasabi flavoring, or whether it was simply a fresh cut of fish, but the flavors just seemed to explode in my mouth. I have never tasted anything quite like it. This is a MUST TRY sushi. Other notable include the Herring Roe (Herring Caviar), which unlike the Flying fish roe (flying fish eggs) that people so often see, do not taste salty and bitter. This dish was served as single piece. The flavor was subtle and understated. No bitterness or saltiness. Just the slightest hint of sweetness. This was the best Fish Roe I have had. At end of the day, the bill came out to $104 + tax/tip for 2 people. Given that prices were not published on the menus, I was a bit shocked at how cheap this all was. However, some people will complain that you can get $2 plates at your local rotary sushi bar. However, those who complain simply do not know that the mark of good sushi is that is does not need much help from spices, especially that horrid "spicy mayo" which is so popular in these cheap sushi joints. I think ~$50/person for a meal like this is a good bargain, especially given the near-instant service of being at the bar.Once you experience this you will never go back, and you will always crave these extremely fresh cuts of fish. Do yourself a favor. Go ahead and try this place out. The wait and cost of food is well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Anhtuan T.
Reviews.Content: Hmmm what hasn't been said in the last 1900 or so reviews?So to re-iterate, sashimi platter = BOMB

Reviews.Author: Edward T.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten here several times over the past few months as I was living.working in Burbank during the week.  Having sushi at Sushi Gen is an exceptional dining experience -- the quality of the fish AND the always important but often overlooked and undervalued sushi rice are always perfect!  Having been to several sushi eateries in Japan during my global travels, . . . . . . . .this is as good as it gets for "real sushi" but being able to speak in English.What I do find amusing is the LA crowd who eat here and think they know sushi, especially the loud, obnoxious, opinionated middle easterners.  I listened to one idiot talk about the sushi rice being too hot.  The sushi chefs looked at him and gave me the raised eyebrow look like, "Can you believe this idiot?"  Too funny!Oh, by the way, I am part Japanese, so, I do speak with some authority.

Reviews.Author: Kendra V.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is hands down 5 stars. I couldn't complain about even if I tried mega hard. Their sushi marinade/brine is top quality. You won't taste a single fishy fishness in any piece and the marinade/brine makes the sushi extremely tender and buttery (all sushi is placed in a brine or marinade if you did not know. It is what distinguishes ok sushi from superior sushi.)I took a star off because the tempura is sadly not up to sniff to the same level of quality as their fish. It is very oily tasting and the pieces I received were soggy on the bottom. That's never happened to me for any tempura I've ever ordered in my life so that was very disappointing. So if you are ordering one of their dinner combos skip the one with the tempura added and just do straight up sushi or sashimi combo. Good sushi alone doesn't cause the crazy stupid lines this place has every. single. day. So what causes this you might ask? It's the insanely cheap combo prices for the equally insane quality of sushi you get and for the insane amount they give you for that price plus extras they give you on top of everything. 20 to 30 bucks for what you see in the pictures. Ya it's nuts. It's the American sushi portion we've all dreamed about with a McDonalds price and French Laundry quality.

Reviews.Author: Pearl C.
Reviews.Content: Very terrible and impolite host, after waiting for 45 minutes, he offer a small table for six to a party of ten, and then refused to let us take the next small table of two. Then ask us to keep waiting if we don't want to squeeze in to the small table. Very bad attitude, I will not go to this place again and will tell everyone to avoid it. Zero star for this rest.:(
