Reviews.Author: Michelle W.
Reviews.Content: lines lines lines! The line is super long and starts really early about an hour or so before it opens which is RIDICULOUS! There's so much food and you might look at your plate and say "I CAN FINISH THIS SO FAST" but actually sashimi is super filling! The place is pretty small and if you sit near the door it could be intimidating with people staring you down while you eat since they want your spot haha!Definitely try the $15 sashimi lunch which includes lots of fish and rice.... It's super yummy but the only thing is you have no idea what you're eating because they don't tell you but you can ask them or tell by eating it! They also give you miso soup, tofu, and a pickled cabbage appetizer which was a nice surprise!

Reviews.Author: Joshua P.
Reviews.Content: This place is overly expensive! they should also post their sushi bar prices, and not just in japanese..... $15 for a california roll? then how much would a rainbow roll be if they had it? $50? the fish is very tasty and fresh, but stick to the combinations since those look to be a better deal.

Reviews.Author: Eva K.
Reviews.Content: So, this review is for the $15 lunch special sashimi plate everyone raves about. I am sorry to report that while I found the portions of the fish large, the cuts seemed roughly put together and there were some pieces that were sinewy and difficult to bite through. Plus, the cooked salmon was overcooked.What's more -- we waited an hour to sit down, and when we actually did, the miso soup, rice, tofu app, and salad all came out instantly -- and the sashimi plate was not far behind. I wondered if they just had it already prepared on the sidelines, which made me sad -- but I suppose that sort of preparedness is necessary when everyone around is ordering the same thing. And efficiency is key when there's a line of 30 people waiting on the other side of the door. Perhaps we DID come at a bad time, because I noticed the tables all around us had their food delivered in a well-paced manner, giving them time to eat and talk and laugh. Although there's a lot of food that comes with this lunch special, I'm sorry to report that I don't believe this is worth the hour wait. Ever. Next time I'll be ordering a la carte at a sushi bar... somewhere else. Y'all can have Sushi Gen. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Mamie J.
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I are a fan of this place. Sushi Gen is an excellent choice for beautifully crafted dishes and extremely fresh fish. I am the ultimate critic on sashimi, but I have to say this place gets 5/5 for its tender fish that feels like butter when you bite into it. The sashimi deluxe was definitely the highlight our meal.We were taken right on time for our reservation. I would definitely recommend having one, as there were MANY people waiting. Service was prompt and we were checked on just enough during our meal. I saw everyone from couples, families, groups, and business people here. Great place for quality traditional Japanese food -- I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Ate here twice and each time was just as good as i remembered it.  Service is not rude as what some yelpers are saying but it will probably be a hit or miss.First time we at the sushi bar and had a grand ole time for omasake.  I think it was about $130.Second time we sat at the table and just ordered the deluxe sashimi special for $35 and an order of uni sushi.  I wish they gave us more uni for each bite for $13 but you know going in its expensive.  The uni was not as amazing as the first time around.The Deluxe Sashimi had toro and it was amazeballs again!!!! it just melts in your mouth and we had 5 pieces..  Definitely worth it. Still need to try the lunch special - but waiting over an hour keeps deterring me.Until next time!

Reviews.Author: Elvin C.
Reviews.Content: It's good, but I feel like Sushi Gen is one of those over-hyped sushi places. I know it was featured in some Dine LA guide to Downtown or whatevves, but honestly I don't even think it's the best sushi spot in Little Tokyo.FOODEverything was good, but not amazing. Usually, sushi joints will have certain selections that are just amazing and it almost forces you to get seconds, thirds, or fourths of it, but I felt none of that here. Their Tempura was excellent, though. The Sashimi Dinner Combination was alright and very nicely presented, but yes, it bothers me still that nothing stood out. It's all quality stuff though, regardless.SERVICEThe service was alright. They could have been better, but still not worthy of any complaints from me. AMBIENCESo this is where I get a little nit-picky (as if I haven't been already). Everything is CLEAN and looks like a legit fancy restaurant almost. I just really prefer my sushi joints to be cozy and almost intimate. I felt like this was a nicer and Japanese version of a Korean sushi house where there's like a ton of sushi chefs and it is a relatively larger restaurant than what I've come to like. Personally, I like that personal experience where that sushi chef remembers you and shit like that. There's two or three or maybe even four maximum making everyone's sushi. I like it when sushi chefs remember my likes, dislikes, how much I eat, makes good conversation or at least acknowledges my existence almost as if I'm the only one there. If I ever became a regular here, that could never happen. Not at a place like this. That's why it's a four star place to me. I can see myself coming back at some point in my life, but I rarely, if ever, crave it enough to rush back.

Reviews.Author: Steve R.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten sashimi all over the west and the sashimi lunch special is the best tasting and by far the best value I have ever seen. Every time it am in Los Angeles I must eat here.

Reviews.Author: Spunky M.
Reviews.Content: I always see a crazy line, so today I got in it.  The sashimi platter lunch special is quite filling.  Almost, too much food.  I didn't quite like the cooked fish the filled out the platter.  But the sashimi, especially the tuna, was great.  Service was really nice.  And the interior had that neat, orderly quality that old school LA sushi places have.  I probably won't be back for lunch not because the food wasn't excellent but the wait was an hour.  I'd probably make a dinner reservation or do the sushi counter, which has its own, separate wait list.  Be aware:  the sushi counter does not serve the lunch specials.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: It's been my 3rd visit to Sushi Gen and I gotta admit the restaurant's food quality is impeccably consistent! Here's what we ordered:1) Uni and Sashimi Combination $352) Sashimi Combination $153) Tempura and Sashimi Combination $17As soon as we took our first bite into these three amazingly prepared set lunches, our taste memories were absolutely refreshed! Especially for the Uni and Sashimi Combination, could you imagine that Sushi Gen is serving one complete box of uni for its set lunch?! It's totally ridiculous! Other than the Uni set lunch, the Tempura and Sashimi Combination is also very delectable! It's definitely crunchy on the outside chewy in the inside! Serving with bowls of miso soup and sukiyaki tofu, I mean, what more can I ask for! Being said, Sushi Gen's laudable dishes deserved our 5 stars out of 5 on our yummy scale. We will definitely return for their incredible set lunches!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: We visited on 3/16/13 and were placed on the waiting list at 6pm. We were told the wait was an hour, which was fine. After an hour, we checked the waiting list and were told that they had already called us, and so skipped us. Oh well, we thought, stuff happens. But then we were placed on the BOTTOM of the list which was rude to say the least. We then waited another 30 mins indoors, and re-checked the waiting list to be told AGAIN that we had already been called...So now we were paying close attention. We observed the host telling at least 5 parties that their name had already been called and skipped. This was responded with much confusion and shaking heads. We then listened as the male hosts stepped outside and called guest names... Ever so softly. Wow, man up! So incompetent. No wonder guests waiting indoors did not hear their names. Anyway, we were starving by the time we were finally seated and ordered immediately. I had the sashimi deluxe for $35 along with sushi rice and miso soup. The sashimi was excellent quality but the selections were tragically boring. There was like 6-8 pieces each of tuna and yellowtail. Definitely should have checked Yelp photos before choosing this place. There was even minced tuna, cubes of reject tuna parts, shredded imitation crab, jello slices - like imitation squid, and an extremely dry chunk of salmon. Totally unnecessary and bad tasting decorations. My friend's teriyaki salmon was overcooked as well. Baking tender, juicy salmon is incredibly easy. What a sad, sad kitchen. On a postive note, I enjoyed the silky melt-in-your-mouth toro and buttery ankimo appetizer.  Overall, the sashimi was very fresh and quite delicious, but the fish selections were overly safe and repetitive. Sushi Gen is great for sushi first-timers but a disappointment to even slightly more adventurous eaters. 4 stars for price and quality, -1 star for selection, and -1 star for incompetent hosting. Table service was average.

Reviews.Author: Kate S.
Reviews.Content: I think this place is over rated.I got sushi combo. It was not impressive.Perhaps I need to order what I like instead of combo...One think I know is that my standard for sushi has got so high this place does not live up to my standard-_-

Reviews.Author: Namella K.
Reviews.Content: Jen, the owner of Wax Candy told me to try this place. OMG I'm puzzled that I never tried this place before as I am an avid sushi-phile. You can make reszos but if your party comes separately they won't seat you. There's no place to sit and have a beer while you wait. Being the MacGuyver of drinking, I snuck over to the Izakaya next door to down a draft Kirin while I waited for the rest of my party. This place is a classic sushi bar. No rolls. No Spider, Vegas or any of those overstuffed American bastardization of sushi. Blech!This is the real deal. Great sake selection and they have a range of Japanese beers. They have Eichigo!I ordered for the table: uni, ankimo, yellowtail belly, mirugai, oysters on the half shell, and a sashimi platter filled with jewel-like morsels of freshly prepped sea creatures from tuna, fatty tuna, crab, spicy tuna, yellow tail, squid, octopus, tai and a few other classics. OMG, this was so heavenly. I waited on purpose to make this my 400th review. Jen, you are so right. This place rules!

Reviews.Author: MARIA L.
Reviews.Content: in the heart of LA lies Little Tokyo and in the heart of Little Tokyo lies a sushi restaurant hidden in a little strip mall that one may never have the interest of walking into if it weren't for good ol' yelp or maybe by word of mouth by a fellow Japanese friend. Sushi Gen is rated 4.5 stars on yelp with almost 2000 reviews. With such a high number of reviews and high rating my expectations for the place were...well... quite high...and sushi gen certainly didn't disappoint. FOR PHOTO+FULL REVIEW :foodologie.tumblr.com

Reviews.Author: Food L.
Reviews.Content: we came here on a wednesday night. Legit Japanese restaurant was my first impression. host and servers were pleasant; we sat at the bar. ordered yellow tail belly, albacore belly, tuna belly, fatty tuna, oysters on the half shell; he ordered the snapper with green onion - great compliment to the sushi - simple yet flavorful. - all were FATTY, BUTTERY, MELT IN YOUR MOUTH quality deliciousness. Our sushi chef was Mesa - really nice guy. we are usuals at sugar fish nozawa but this is our new favorite. we live in the valley and sushi gen is a 15 min drive but so worth it (versus nozawa which is 5 min. away). our next venture is b.o.s which asian fusion and also happens to be right next door to sushi gen. must say, it will be hard not to want to come in here instead! factoids:this is located in a strip mall - bright blue rectangular sign. pay for parking in the lot - i think it's $7this place also serves hot dishes which i read are delicious and flavorful too!we pretty much ordered until we were full. bill came out to $163 not including tax

Reviews.Author: Aaron S.
Reviews.Content: I have moved away from LA, but as I look back on my past I hear a faint voice on the wind. "Sushi Gen" it whispers, not speaking to me, but directly to my belly. If you love sashimi, this is the place to go. I have never gone for dinner because it seems pretty expensive, but bless it be he or she who decided to have a sashimi lunch special. Get there at least a half hour before it opens because there is always a line. Obviously get the sashimi special ($15). I've had friends who had to get some of the sashimi to go because there was too much of it. I leave you with this story. One time when I was at Sushi Gen, I went to use the restroom. There was a sweet old Japanese man that needed help getting through the door. Being in high spirits (thanks to sashimi) I jumped to help the old man. He looked up at me with the gentle face you would imagine in a Hayao Miyazaki movie. He didn't say thank you, he didn't tell me his troubles, all he said was "This place has the best fish in all of Los Angeles County". I stared deep into his eyes and nodded. It was a beautiful moment.

Reviews.Author: Pauline P.
Reviews.Content: Some of the most quality and fresh fish you will find in Los Angeles! Have been eating at Sushi Gen for a few years now, but today I finally got to try to the touted sushi lunch special// WAIT // 20 minutes at 12 pm on a Wednesday. Come 10-15 minutes before they open at 11 am if you do not want to wait.// PARKING // $2 for 2 hours in the lot with validation from Sushi-Gen. No limit on the number of cars validated per table which is nice // SERVICE // The host writes your name down and keeps the list at the register. Although everyone is running around in a rush to serve the constantly packed restaurant, you still get great service with your tea/water constantly refilled and your order promptly brought out // FOOD // Sashimi lunch special ($15): Considering how pricey this restaurant can be for dinner, this lunch special is an enormous steal and you will leave stuffed! The platter is a very fresh and tasty assortment including squid, tuna, mackerel, crab, spicy tuna, and even grilled salmon. The lunch set also includes miso soup, delish warm tofu, a small pickled salad, and a big bowl of white rice (not vinegar sushi rice though).

Reviews.Author: Victoria K.
Reviews.Content: It was great for last couple times but this time so disappointed cuz this sushi chef cut the size of the sashimi in half but same price. This is my favorite restaurant but now I've changed my mind cuz it's just a tiny slide for sashimi and wanted me to stay loyal? Omg! So tricky :(

Reviews.Author: Christopher S.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars after 1785 reviews is revelation that even a small, secluded shopping strip can't hide away this perfect gem of a sushi joint.Umami to the 10th degree.  Coming from a hardcore fisherman, who enjoys the most fresh sashimi one can attain...I am happy to spend my Benjamin's at a type of restaurant that I usually balk at spending money due to the fact that I can catch fish myself and make the same stuff.  But, this is the real deal!

Reviews.Author: Jae K.
Reviews.Content: I'm a very picky eater when it comes to Japanese Sushi. I have lived in Japan for about a year and while my stay in Tokyo and varies places in different parts of Japan, I have tried at the most famous Sushi restaurants all over Japan. I'm currently living in Socal and one of the most difficult thing living here was that I could not eat anywhere that really satisfied myself fully eating out at a sushi restaurant. In Japan, most high end Sushi restaurants have this epic type of atmosphere that just makes you go "Oh wow... O man... O no way... WOW!! ... ooooooo my.... this is it..... WOOhooo" every time the chef prepares the sushi. I have not felt this in any restaurant outside of Japan.Now talking about Sushi-Gen... I would proudly say this is my favorite Japanese sushi place in the country. As matter of a fact, outside of Japan. It does not have the most high end luxury sushi vibe, nor the presentation of food that makes the place feel that great. But I have to say for its price, sushi (sashimi, rice) grade level, chef's preparation skill, it is definitely bang for buck.1. I have tried so many high end, 4.5+ review, sushi restaurants over Socal, and I have to say no place beats Sushi-gen.2. The sashimi used in Sushi-gen is what a sashimi should taste like which you cannot find any other restaurants around that have this much complex flavor in otoro, maguro, uni, amaebi, kanpachi, hamachi.3. The rice used in Sushi-gen is again how the authentic high grade level sushi should have. The rice is cooked perfectly, perfect temperature when prepared as sushi, sticky, and elastic like it should be. You can feel every drop of the rice when you chew the sushi.4. The vibe is not the super high end sushi like but it is very much similar to how bargain real sushi shops in Ginza, Tokyo, taste like. It is the taste of $300 sushi but at a affordable price without the extra high end atmosphere and just going for the quality of the food itself.5. Everything in the menu is great but the real great stuff is not the "COMBO" or any of that. It is many times written in Japanese menu and you simply have to ask for it since many are seasonal items. So regulars and first timers that order Combo menu that leaves yelp review can be easily distinguished from the food thats on their table.6. For the money and quality, Sushi-gen cannot be beat and really sometimes I don't know how they make profit with the quality of the sashimi they offer for such a reasonable price. It makes every other high end wanna be Japanese Sushi shop look like they are ripping people off with low end sushi that is dressed like high end sushi.If you want the best tasting, (same sushi you would expect from a famous shop in Japan), come to Sushi-Gen. You will not be disappointed.Hence I like to proudly say that I come to Sushi gen every week because this place is bargain and I know I cannot have sushi or sashimi this quality even when I'm paying 2x the price of the Sushi-Gen. I really recommend sushi-gen, and give yourself a shot by orderings things not on the combo menu but the seasonal items that you ask "what is the best thing to eat right now?" The chef, waiter, waitress will gladly guide you to the right path. Just expect to pay :)

Reviews.Author: Lance W.
Reviews.Content: Good traditional sushi.  Definitely choose the sushi bar! !Went again, a little disappointed.  Sushi was not as good and the portions seemed smaller.  Not living up to the reputation this time.

Reviews.Author: Phillip F.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sushi with amazing service! Come here with my nieces and nephew and they were so friendly and accommodating. And the fatty tuna was like pure butter. For sure coming back!

Reviews.Author: Robert B.
Reviews.Content: The problem with reviewing sushi restaurants is that it's hard to tell what other people expect. Sushi Gen is very good high quality sushi. It's not in the upper-tier of restaurants around the US, but its also not in the upper-tier of price. What you get is decent ambiance, similar to wherever your favorite sushi restaurant is, with extremely fresh and high quality fish at reasonable prices. After a 20 minute wait at lunchtime, which was much better than I expected, I sat at the Sushi Bar. I ordered Salmon, Sweet Shrimp, Bluefin Toro, Yellow Tail, Eel and Octopus, along with the Miso Soup and Green Tea.A couple of quick measures for a decent sushi place: Fresh warm and wet napkin to refresh yourself and the number of grades of toro they carry. The napkin was not warmed, but was available and they only carried one or two grades of toro.The Miso soup was much fresher than most restaurants -- not the ultra top tier but top of very good. The Salmon nigiri was pedestrian. You'd probably get the same quality where ever you normally eat sushi. The Bluefin Toro was as good as many places. The Sweet Shrimp and Yellow Tail were simply in another category. Exceptionally fresh and tasty. The Octopus was excellent and the eel was more refined than I expected.The bill was very reasonable. (At a higher end place you can go through several hundred dollars.) There are no fancy rolls and the wine and beer menu is very similar to wherever you've eaten before. What sets Sushi Gen apart is that for the money you spend, you get exceptionally high quality sushi. That means that for everyone not ordering Omakase at a $400 sitting, this is going to be some of the best sushi you'll have.The folks at the Sushi bar were great and the place has a good ambiance, notwithstanding the unassuming exterior.  (As a side note, parking does look like it could be a problem. It took me about 5 minutes to find a spot, in a parking lot. Although they do validate for all but $2.00.)In short, if you are looking for excellent high quality sushi for good value, you'll be in good company in Little Tokyo, along with Japanese patrons, surgeons and foodies alike.

Reviews.Author: Ahadin H.
Reviews.Content: Good experience if you are sitting in the bar. Most nigiri are made with care;I will suggest their whitefish/with salt and citrus juice. Uni gunkan-maki is so good and the nori so fresh that you'll taste the ocean. Also ask for hirame en-gawa  if they have it, also with salt and citrus juice....Sweet shrimp is good. Salmon is a little bit wet. Tuna taste just the same, very predictable there. Wasabi portion varies between preparers. If you drink beer, order Echigo. Its a hybrid rice/wheat beer.  Lightly sweet and it should compliment most of the dishes.I also found  that any tokubetsu junmai sake goes well here. I only took out one star due to feeling like being rushed while sitting in the bar sometime.

Reviews.Author: Dom C.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi spot in Little Tokyo! They have good quality sushi. But I always go for the Sashimi and I've never been disappointed. Everything just melts in your mouth. Yummy! :DThe lines can be a bit long sometimes and they will not seat you until your whole party has arrived.

Reviews.Author: Gary H.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi and sashimi.  Excellent value for lunch.  HOWEVER they're way too popular for their own good.  Expect at least a 45 min wait.  Also it get really loud here.  Add a couple more $ for Validated parking.

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: So we didn't do the lunch special today because bf didn't want to wait. So we did the sushi bar. They just told us to order and then they gave us a sushi list without a pen and told us just to order. Not sure if we were even overcharged or not.The fish was ok today. I may or may not be upset because bf had to pay $70 for lunch today. I think Komasa is better both in price and quality. The sweet shrimp here was meh and the fish today was ok (not melt in your mouth style).OVERALL: waste of money.

Reviews.Author: Disha C.
Reviews.Content: 10:45am. A line 40 people deep.  Heart of Honda Plaza.  $15 SASHIMI LUNCH SPECIAL.  These characteristics describe none other than the celebrity of Honda Plaza in Little Tokyo: Sushi Gen.  My first time at Sushi Gen was a little less than a year ago when I decided to play hooky from work one day; someday's I wish I still worked the swing shift at my old job just so I could fill my belly with fat, tender, melt-in-your-mouth pieces of fresh tuna.  If you arrive at Sushi Gen after 11:30, there is no guarantee that you will be able to get in because there might not be enough sashimi for the special. The special is NOT at the bar, so you MUST wait in line.  Don't fret though, the wait is  more than worth it.  As soon as your turn arrives, you are seated immediately.  Faster than you are seated, your server arrives; faster than you can place your order, you have a plateful of generous cuts of fish (cooked, uncooked, grilled and smoked) along with tsukemono, miso soup and tofu.  Some of the fish which will be bestowed upon you are slabs of grilled salmon, maguro tuna, spicy tuna, imitation crab, tuna with scallions, squid, octopus, hamachi, yellow tail, toro, and a teriyaki-ed albacore.  I am salivating just thinking about how wonderful it is.I did not experience sushi until I turned 22-almost three years later I am unsure how I had lived my life without it.  Sushi Gen is truly an iconic LA hot spot, there has never been a day where I have seen it not packed to the brim.  Each cut of fish is FRESH; most places cannot stand true to that.  This is the most bang $15 can get you.  If you have not waited in line to experience Sushi Gen yet, you are missing out!

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Have ordered omakase twice now n the last 2 months. Best sushi in LA (others maybe equal or close to equal? nobody better..).

Reviews.Author: Mimi H.
Reviews.Content: Best $15 and 45 minute wait of my life!! Their sashimi lunch special is extremely popular here, for many good reasons, and with restaurant capacity, you either get in or you don't when they open their doors at noon and close two hours later at 2pm. My boyfriend and I came here at 10:15am on a Tuesday morning to line up, in hopes of securing a table inside. We were about the 15th party in line and luckily got in after everyone in front of us started showing up with their friends and families -_-If you are getting the sashimi plate, you have to sit at a table, just because they like seating the people who are only ordering a few items the opportunity to see and interact with the chefs.The sashimi plate comes with miso soup and a salad, both of which are really yummy and flavorful. The plate itself comes with 10 different kinds of fish (tuna, fatty tuna, tuna tartare, yellowtail, albacore, cooked salmon, salmon tartare, crab meat, seaweed, cooked sweet pork?). Definitely loved the texture and taste of the fresh fish. Yellowtail and tuna just melts in your mouth. Their cuts were very generous as well so I was almost bursting out of my pants from happiness. We also ordered some Uni and Amaebi, both delicious! Uni was glistening and thick....mmmm. Amaebi was sooo good with perfect sweetness and everything.Seriously one of my favorite lunch places if I remember to wake up early enough to wait. They don't take reservations for lunch but do for dinner. My boyfriend came here for their omakase and loved everything about it so I will definitely be back to try that and many more lunches!

Reviews.Author: Elysse P.
Reviews.Content: I've had this place bookmarked for years. Holy shit, have you seen the pictures of the sashimi?? Drool, I fell in love the first time I laid eyes on the picture of the Sashimi Deluxe plate. Finally went last night with a friend and I think we waited an hour. Not bad for Valentines Day dinner... but I think there's always a decent wait so be prepared. Pretty casual spot, I was confused to see lots of girls in dresses, but it was Valentines Day so... I guess? Anyway, the sashimi was ridiculously fresh. He ordered me the Sashimi Deluxe when all I really wanted was the Sashimi Dinner. Difference is the deluxe has double the portion of fish... but the dinner comes with miso soup, tempura, and rice. I think the Sashimi Dinner would've sufficed... even though the sashimi deluxe was fucking bomb and yes, I finished all that sashimi like it was my last meal. So damn good and again soooooooooooooo fresh.Minus one star for our rude waitress and rude host. But they were probably really stressed because of how busy they were... we all know how Asian parents get when they're stressed. No buens.

Reviews.Author: Linda W.
Reviews.Content: Good food, nice place and good serving job.Definatley nice place to go.

Reviews.Author: Elliott H.
Reviews.Content: If all things were equal, and all reviews were based solely on quality of food, Sushi Gen would easily earn a 5/5.There exists no comparable $15.00 sashimi lunch in Los Angeles. Hell, I doubt there's anything comparable in the state of California. There was toro on my plate. Quality toro. Amazing toro. Mouthwatering toro. Read other reviews for the rest of the lunch special, but the toro. The toro. Yes. The toro.I have no idea what, if anything else, is on the menu. That lunch special alone wins it 5/5 stars.In fact, I'm planning on going back within the next two weeks for another $15.00 serving of amazing raw fish.So why two stars?The host was the most abysmal, horrible human being I've ever encountered working at any restaurant. Anywhere. Ever.Trust me. I get you don't like dealing with a 45 minute backlog of customers. I worked in food service once too, I get it. I really do.But let's get some stuff out of the way.First, don't you EVER let anyone cut a 45 minute line, and figure nobody's going to notice. My family saw it. The elderly Korean ladies saw it. And hopefully, your manager saw it. I don't care if it's your fairy godmother come from on high to give you a shiny new Ferrari, that's just plain rude.Second, when a customer asks you the remaining wait time, you're not Heracles cleaning the Augean Stables. This isn't a trial given to you by the Gods of Olympus. You're not moving small mountains of horse feces. Therefore, don't groan as if you were. If it's too much for you, find another jobFinally, and most offensively: you disrespected both my mother AND my grandmother, by giving my mother crap when she expressed concern with the "3 person" seating arrangement given to our party. Here's a quick recap of the dialogue, in case you've forgotten it by now:- - - - -Mom: "I'm not sure my mother can sit there, she has bad legs."(Note: booth/table combination in question is very, very cramped. Also, it's more of a two-person booth with a chair haphazardly wedged into the corner. A large Russian man managed to twice step squarely on my feet while exiting and entering the semi-booth next door, crushing my toes into a fine powder.)Host: "It's. A. THREE. SEAT. TABLE. Do you want it or not."Mom: "Excuse me? She's rather elderly.."(Grandma's approaching 90.)Host: "It has three seats. Do. You. Want. It. Or. Not."Mom: "Uhh..."- - - - -Enough said.On the flip side, the serving staff was great. Too bad the host ruined the entire experience.tl;dr summary:Amazing food from Heaven above, abysmal host from Hell below.2.0/5.0 Stars. When eating out, both food and service should be an experience worth remembering. The food certainly was. The service, while memorable, was as well.. for all the wrong reasons.If the front desk idiot's gone next time I visit, this review will be immediately edited from 2.0 right back to 5.0 where it belongs. That man has no business working in any job involving people, up to and including wearing a blue vest at the front door of a Wal Mart.

Reviews.Author: Brian T.
Reviews.Content: Packed ALL THE TIME, busiest sushi restaurant in LA probably.I visited this place many times, but this place could be really the busiest sushi restaurant in LA, especially during lunch time you will have to wait for 30 min. minimum. However their food is worth waiting more than that.Seriously, all fishes are very fresh and flavorful, you cant find this high quality Blue Fin Tuna this reasonably, because I know some restaurants charge 15 buck a piece for Fatty Tuna.....once you try here you cant go any other places in LA.

Reviews.Author: John Y.
Reviews.Content: The GO-TO spot for  Very Fulfilling Sashimi Lunch at Downtown Little Tokyo.Most of the times it even comes with 3 think cuts of medium Toro.The Marinated veggies, tofu and the miso soup are all good - but the rice is an awesome, simply awesome.  I grew up eating rice all my life, so I know rice.Their rice is awesome.  Not too many restaurants can make rice like that.So, very fulfilling rice and a plate full of sashimi with sides for a measly $15 bucks.This is exactly what people want.Servers are timely and knowledgeable - looked like they were used to the rush.  The restaurant is always busy and the parking is very difficult.Either book reservations or prepare yourself for the waiting list.

Reviews.Author: Sarah H.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of my favorite sushi bars!  The quality of the sashimi is excellent, the fish melts in your mouth.  I enjoy sitting at the sushi bar interacting with the chefs...they really take good care of you.  My personal favorite is the yellowtail belly, toro, fresh scallop, Aji (Japanese mackerel) and red snapper with yuzu!  This place is not cheap, but worth it!

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: I have not had lunch here yet as everyone raves about, so my reviews is solely on dinner experiences.I see most of these 5 stars reviews about their lunch are for the value, and I feel that is the problem with sushi Gen. The couple of times that I dined here for dinner, the food is decent. But my gawd, can the servings be any more stingy?!?! An order of Ankimon has 2 pieces, literally 2 tiny pieces =( And the fish on nigiri sushi are abnormally thin and small. They are fresh and decent quality, but far from satisfying... Although Sushi Gen is somewhat of a staple of Jtown, there are just too many better sushi places in LA with better price. To conclude my review, decent sushi, way overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Ooooh, yeah. This was on our list of places to try when we visited LA. We made it on our last day. They have a very long wait, so we put our names down, left, and came back and still had to wait! Parking isn't the easiest to come by either. But the restaurant is actually not that small, just very popular for a reason. V and I both had the yellowtail collar / hamachi kama. They give you really generous portions!! Also came with sashimi and soup. Such a good deal for lunch! Try it, but get there early! Before they open even!

Reviews.Author: Rock L.
Reviews.Content: They are the best! Brought my family that was visiting here. Reservations are a must so you look like a hero!

Reviews.Author: Will L.
Reviews.Content: I honestly expected a lot more since I've been hearing people rave about this place for a long time. I ordered the sashimi dinner with a side plate of uni and toro. Every piece on the sashimi dinner was good but not great. The tuna was actually pretty subpar. The uni was really good, but the toro was just decent. I definitely don't think I got my moneys worth here.I'm always down to try coming back another time, because maybe I just came on an off night. Next time I'll be trying the $15 lunch special that I've heard so much about.

Reviews.Author: Tina H.
Reviews.Content: They quoted us 35-40 mins and after almost an hr we went in to check how much longer. The host said they called my name 5 mins ago. Are u kidding???!! We were standing right in front of the door and every name they called went in!! They definitely didn't call my name....I hate liars!!! Even after that he could had placed us next but didn't. He called in a few more ppl so we left. Never will I go to this horrible place again.  Bad customer service!

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: Last day in LA and I just had to experience this. After all those reviews on yelp, one could not resist. The wait was like 40 mins but that's what I had expected. Nothing less. The venue itself wasn't too big but very traditional. It was a nice eastern feel. The fish was prepared fresh and I was told they actually pick it up at the fish market daily. The toro was amazing. I only wanted to stick with sashimi and sushi. I was quite pleased. I must say my highlight was was cheering a cup if hot saki with strangers and a chef. I would recommend this and I will definitely be returning on my next visit.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: Man is this place hyped or what? $15 dollar sashimi special for lunch at a normally 3 dollar signed place (as stated on Yelp)? Count me in!The happy hour sashimi was surprising filling, but more importantly, the presentation was AMAZING and it tasted pretty good. Salmon, tuna, albacore, oh my! The fish tasted good enough that I didn't bother dunking my fish in soy sauce very much (actually it's better without it!). Green tea was a great complement to the meal, too.Service was really good and the waitress made sure to check our table often.BIG DOWNSIDE: The hour long wait was pretty disappointing since my buddies and I were starving. Furthermore, we had to pay for parking and I almost got charged another hour. Because of the wait time, don't expect to get off out of work for an hour to get a quick meal because this isn't the place to go to.Overall, great experience. Even if the line is long, this place must be doing something right for that to happen, eh?

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: My date and I had a reservation here for dinner, and I must say the service was entirely unsatisfactory. My date arrived at 5:55 (our reservation was at 6:00). The host informed him upon arrival that our table would be given away if I did not arrive shortly. I arrived at 6:04, whereupon the host suggested that we should sit that the bar. After being informed that was unacceptable, we had to wait a further 15 minutes to be seated. Being seated in this case means someone threw some menus on a table in the back corner and left, and we had to figure out which table that was, and seat ourselves. Clearly customer service was a priority.Sushi itself was of decent quality. Menu was pedestrian, but fish quality was good. Presentation was simple and traditional. Decor was converted strip mall with wood. Not upscale by any means, but not dirty or worn in looking. Price was I felt rather high for the experience we were provided. All things considered I would not go back.

Reviews.Author: Angie H.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what else can be said about this place that has not been said before... Amazing fresh sushi, a little too expensive for poor college students. But no fear! Lunch special- $15 beautiful sashimi plate is here! I almost faint when I took a bite of the tuna. Melts in your mouth deliciousness with no fish stink what-so-ever. The seaweed is so fresh and refreshing. The rice goes well with the cooked fish too. Parking: the small lot shared with other businesses is pretty small. During rush hour, it might be a little hard to find a spot. Be careful, once you pull in you have to pay. So I'd recommend you to be patient. Drop someone off to put your names down, while you drive around to wait for a spot to open up. Service: professional courteous japanese servers who are very attentive. When we put our name down at 1, the wait was 45 minutes. I love this place, I have dreams about it sometime, and I want to go back in the very near future for more affordable sashimi lunch. I was satisfying full, not uncomfortable full. Definitely have room for some Ozero boba or lette macaron from across the street.

Reviews.Author: Lilo Z.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is amazing the seafood was all very fresh. It is a little different then your average sushi bar and a little pricy but it is overall amazing food.

Reviews.Author: Tim H.
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, one of the better places for sushi in the Little Tokyo area, where your choices are endless.The wait can be ridiculous. Made reservations this last time around and ended up getting seated around 9:30pm on a Friday night (closing time listed is 9:30pm). Surprisingly, was never rushed or given the stink eye. Was probably cut some slack as reparations from years of Japanese oppression over Korea. Thank you Sushi-Gen.- Ankimo was fresh; devoid of any fishy-ness.- Uni was on point.- Fresh Oysters- Nigiri was good too: Toro, ika, amaebi, kanpachi, tai, saba, sake, etc... Toro probably the stand out out of all of them. Decent prices. A strong choice if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Armando N.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what to say...I feel as though my sushi world has been rocked! Sushi-Gen has, without a doubt, some of the freshest fish I have ever tasted. Sure you look at the prices and say "Umm maybe I should go to the discount sushi place down the streeet instead". Um no you should not! As soon as you take your first bite you will be screaming "shut up and take my money! Oh and bring me some more sake!....Well you might not even need the sake because the food alone will put you into a blissfull state...no need to ruin it getting crunk. So bring a friend or ten, just so you can see the looks on their faces. My face looked like this :-O then like this :-) then finally :'( only because there was nothing else on my plate.

Reviews.Author: Ken K.
Reviews.Content: My brother was in town this past week, so he and I, along with my wife and my dad, went to Sushi Gen for dinner. None of us had ever been and we had all wanted to eat there, so this was our chance.We were seated in the dining area after a twenty minute wait, and we proceeded to order the following:Deluxe Sashimi PlatterA nice assortment of sashimi, most of which I thought were good. Everything was fresh and enjoyable, but only a couple were outstanding in my opinion.Chicken Teriyaki w/ TempuraMy wife ordered this since she's pregnant and can't eat much raw fish (though she did have a couple pieces). Nothing extraordinary about the teriyaki, but it was better than most places I've had it.Sushi a la carteNow you can hate me all you want, but being such a carbs person, I prefer sushi over sashimi; I just need that little bit of rice with the fish to complete the experience. So I loved the sushi more than the sashimi. The classics that I usually get (Sake, Hamachi, Unagi, and Albacore) were all as good as or better than any I've had in the past, but the two that rocked my world were the Yellowtail Belly and the Toro. I had never had YB before, and now I don't think I can ever go back to just Yellowtail. And the Toro... well, I've had this before at other restaurants, but I was never wowed by it. Not so anymore! The Toro here was mind-blowingly rich and buttery; my brother and I could not eat just one, so we ended up ordering a few more at the end of our meal. Holy cow.I also tried Oyster sushi for the first time (which I wasn't a huge fan of) and the Sea Eel (good). The Uni was also really good, but I've actually had better.In the end, had it not been for the Yellowtail Belly and Toro, I think I would have just been content with my meal. I do have to say though... next time I come, I will have to eat at the bar, since I know it's a whole difference experience when you're eating sushi. And maybe then I'll be able to give them 5 stars. For now, they get a solid 4.

Reviews.Author: Clara Y.
Reviews.Content: Came here a couple of times for their $15 lunch special-very fresh sashimi plate :DThe lunch combo:assortment of fresh fish-tuna, salmon, albacore, yellowtailtuna tartare and spicy tunagrilled/braised salmon and mackerelchunks of crab meatseaweedserved w/ a bowl of rice, warm silky tofu, tsukemono (Japanese pickles), and miso soupMake sure you line up by 10am (doors open at 11am), it's worth the wait!  Also tried their beef teriyaki lunch entree and it was very yummy! I love you Sushi-Gen!

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: Tips for getting the $15 dollar sashimi lunch at Sushi Gen:- Arrive early...like 10:45 am from Monday to Thursday, and 10:30 on a Friday. Have a plan B if you don't get in with the first wave...- Make sure you get a seat at a table...you cannot order the lunch specials if you're sitting at the counter!- Get your parking validated - if you are at the top of the wait list, it'll take about 15-30 minutes, but not as long as you think since they turn over the lunch tables pretty fastCredit cards accepted, parking is decent. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Julie Y.
Reviews.Content: There are many if-statements you may want to consider before coming to Sushi Gen for lunch. Here are a few: If you...1. love fresh quality fish enough to invest 40+ minutes of your time during lunch rush hours2. haven't been diagnosed with claustrophobia within the last 6 months3. don't mind making your wallet cry from paying up some big $$4. are a stingy college student like me and find yourself in a position where someone else is generously covering the bill 5. are mentally prepared to tolerate some tense on-the-edge lunch goers who have yet to be seated or6. have no problem fighting for a parking spot with other desperate drivers then this is the place for you. Fortunately, my dad decided to treat us all out for a nice lunch over at the sushi bar (spoiled child I know), so despite all the inconveniences trying to secure a spot, our family had a fun and yummy bonding experience over some sushi. :) My favorites were probably the yellowtail and the toro. The yellowtail was mild in flavor and slightly chewy; the toro was a melt-in-your-mouth sort of sensation. Both highly recommended. I love salmon so the salmon was just heavenly, the albacore was refreshing, and the halibut was chewy in texture, but just as lovely as the rest. Tuna was standard, and the fresh water eel was phenomenal, just because the fish sort of broke apart in your mouth as you bit into it. I liked the sweet shrimp because of its unusual sticky and moist texture, but some people may not like it because of this quality. We were told that we could have the shrimp heads either fried or in miso soup, and I opted for the fried version; who would have known that fried shrimp head is better than calamari? NOM! Think crispy shrimp chips. I think the reason why this experience was so fun was because our sushi chef, Toyo, was super entertaining. You could tell he enjoyed his profession and that passion transfers into the food, which makes the food taste that much better. In essence, when you come here, you pay for not only quality of the food but for the quality of your eating experience. Will be back again, except to try that lunch special everyone is raving about! Notes: * the meal ended up a good ~60.00 per person including tax and tip! It wasn't cheap.* another diner told me that should I get a chance, I should try the red snapper because it's THAT good. will try it out next time. *service: super efficient. The staff may ask you want you'd like (drinks, food) and they follow through. * you can ask that sushi be made without the wasabi if you like to take your spice as you dip the fish into some soy sauce. * you will never be able to get a sushi roll with the rice on the outside. the chefs consider that an abomination. LOL!

Reviews.Author: Tricia M.
Reviews.Content: After waiting for an hour to be seated, we were ready to grub. Even though we had snacked on small foodies and apps from Nijiya and Aloha Cafe next door, the $15 sashimi lunch special called our names.. although they were a bit surprised when they saw us walking right out of Aloha Cafe.. But it don't matter. Cause miso always hungers for miso soup.. and a lil cabbage salad.. and rice... and sashimi of course! Everything was top-notch quality; service was attentive; the experience was fun. If I hadn't eaten before, I would have liked to try the different combos and whatnot they have.

Reviews.Author: Ramesh Y.
Reviews.Content: Two words, Sushi Heaven!!!!! The best sushi i ever had in my life, service was amazing and food out of this world!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Miko H.
Reviews.Content: This place gets packed but I can see why. I've been here only three times or so and the wait has been crazy every time.  I always get the sushi combo deluxe.  It comes with a piece of toro that just melts in your mouth.  Yum!!  Food is good, and service is good.  I don't like to wait that long to eat (I'm also not the most patient person ever) so I don't go often but if you're in the area looking for good sushi, I would recommend Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Another restaurant that lives up to its reputation on Yelp. The sashimi is extremely fresh and words cannot describe how much of a difference that can make! The lunch special is incredible with a Chirashi deluxe combo only being $15. It had various pieces of tuna, salmon, yellow-tail, eel, octopus, shrimp, salmon roe, and tamago served over rice (yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…). Definitely the best quality and value of any lunch I've had.Our server was pretty friendly. She had forgotten to give us soy sauce but immediately apologized and brought one out within seconds, which is pretty impressive given how busy the restaurant is during the lunch hour. Speaking of the busy lunch hour, you're better off getting there half an hour before you plan on eating as any given wait can range from 30-45 minutes. Lunch is also only served 11:00 am - 2:00pm.Tip: Hungry? The sushi or sashimi deluxe combos (lunch only) have generous portions. Parking is $2 for first two hours in the lot.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE SUSHI GEN!The quality of fish you get here is really fresh!!! and i have to say if you are coming to eat here on a weekend for dinner, better make reservation first or otherwise prepare to starve for a few hours before you get seated, and even that, most of the fish/sashimi would be gone by 8 or 9pm. I got the last order of Uni last time I went there around 8ish, and they ran out of spanish mackerel...So definitely go early to eat here and the price is a little high, but it is so worth ittt!!!

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: Really, nothing much more needs to be said about Sushi-Gen other than an affirmation of all the positive points that previous reviews have pointed out. This spot is where you go for no nonsense, straight-up sushi (no fusion rolls, no sauce slathering à la SugarFish, etc.) and typical dishes such as tempura. The menu reads like many other sushi joints -- all the more palpable, then, the difference in quality, which warrants the difference in price. Fish without the fishiness; squid without the chewiness; even the miso soup is superior. This time I got the sushi deluxe; next time I want sashimi.You may be able to shorten your wait time by requesting a seat at the sushi bar, though you must waive your right to order from the hot menu or combos (à la carte only, minimum 4 orders per person). If all you want is sushi, particularly some of the more individualized delicacies, this policy won't pose any problems. If you opt for table or booth, you'll be pleased with the white table cloth and generally upscale feel (timelessly upscale, not trying-to-be-trendy feel).The gentlemen at the front who take down names and call them out are generally friendly and do their best to maintain their courteous composure in the face of hungry hoards. Bottled beer. Credit cards gladly accepted.

Reviews.Author: Sarah T.
Reviews.Content: Hands down best sushi ever! Clean friendly!!  When I'm in the area this is where I make sure I stop and eat! Everything is fresh

Reviews.Author: Hae A.
Reviews.Content: This place is good, but I don't know if I would wait an hour or more for it. The sushi combo was okay. I liked most of the sushi but there were a few bland ones. The sashimi combo, in my opinion, is a better choice. It comes with rice so its pretty much like the sushi combo, but you get more pieces. You just gotta put the rice on the fish yourself. The proportions of rice, wasabi and fish that you put in your mouth may be wrong but at least you get a few tries. We also got toro (fatty tuna), uni (sea urchin) and Spanish mackerel. These were good, but the toro was very skinny and the uni was not as abundant as other sushi places. I don't think I'll be back. If I do go back, it will only be for the sashimi combo and maybe uni and toro.

Reviews.Author: Mss M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Delicious ! The atmosphere was great! The best sushi I EVER had. Definitely one of the freshest sushi to ever go into my mouth. The workers here are very welcoming and pleasant plus they also have great service. I tried several fishes that were absolutely mouth watering. I will be coming here more often. I tried the Uni for the first time and I must say I enjoyed it! I'm glad I was invited to come to this amazing restaurant by a new friend.

Reviews.Author: Haru T.
Reviews.Content: Worst customer service ever. Sushi is good, but the host's attitude was unbelievable and completely unacceptable. He needs serious training. No wonder he is stuck in that position for a long time. There is no way he can work else where or get promoted.

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: Not sure why service level has declined for a while now and attitude issues with front door host/hostesses.  I suppose you can't blame them when you have the place packed all the time - you get sick of customers.  Been coming here for years and this will be last time.  Always have been overpriced, quantities have gotten smaller, but the poor service and attitude has made me say sayonara to Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Natasha F.
Reviews.Content: 1 star less from 5 stars because this place is always...always a long @$$ wait. But when you come here often enough, you realize they do have VIPs that they just walk in, and this sometimes...makes you a wee bit upset. But it's ok, their food and quality is still good, it's still a great place to satiated your fresh raw fish desire. And yes, their lunch special is a great steal. But NO, they do not do take outs when the weather is warm. So if you're working in DTLA and you're in a hurry and you want to-go, do not keep your stomach growling for this. I don't know if they allow take outs any other time, but they definitely don't in summertime....even if you just wanted to eat it immediately

Reviews.Author: Robert- Bobby C.
Reviews.Content: I was wondering how popular this place is when I saw a huge line out the door while I was driving by a couple of weeks ago.  I was thinking "Nah, it might be just the hype".  I ate those words from what I said that day. It was our first time here so me and my wife decided to come early around 5pm before it opened at 530pm. Might as well wait by the front door since there were a couple of chairs outside. I'm glad we did. By around 520pm, there were 20 people waiting behind us. As soon as the doors opened, it seemed like a Macy's thanksgiving sale stormed by when people were trying to get seated. I was still puzzled why people are so crazy about this place. After we got seated, we ordered right away because we were so hungry waiting in line. We both ordered the sashimi deluxe which had baby yellowtail, yellowtail, tuna, octopus, spicy tuna, and other stuff that I don't know. The deluxe came with shrimp tempura, tempura veggies, and miso soup.Hands down one of the best sushi I've ever had. So fresh and taste like jelly in my mouth. I was in heaven daydreaming about sushi jumping over the fence. Most of the sashimi tastes awesome especially that baby yellowtail that had a light pink texture to it.  I thought I wasn't going to be full with just sashimi, so I ordered some rice just in case. And ordered some fried chicken also just in case. My stomach wasn't that full but very satisfied. The bill came out to be almost $80 with tax and tip. Pricey but well worth. Highly recommended sushi joint to all the sushi lovers out there looking for some very delish yummy goodness. Parking is free with 2 hours validation. Come there early to get good parking. Customer service is great when we were there. No wonder this place is 4.5 stars overall ratings with over 1700 reviews.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: The sushi deluxe set for $15 is perfect for lunch.Fresh fish, just-cooked rice and a surprisingly strong hidden smear of wasabi to send your taste buds soaring.Next up is the sashimi lunch!

Reviews.Author: Michel P.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is THE sushi lunch spot. Crowds do form and are even bigger on Friday for lunch. Best bet is to come a bit early. Parking is $2 including validation. The parking is very limited!The sashimi lunch is where its at! Includes thick, fresh cuts of maguro and hamachi. The tuna is unbelievably fresh and delicious. Tuna is something i normally dislike too! The yellow tail is very good and fresh and it will not disappoint! The sashimi lunch includes pickled cabbage, miso soup, rice and tofu.If youre in the mood for sashimi, the lunch sashimi deluxe cannot be beat! It includes the above mentioned as well as toro, salmon and other delicious bites! Down side is they do not include rice, tofu, miso soup or the pickled cabbage. I usually order a side of rice to pair with the sashimi.Fresh cheap sushi...what more could you want?find some of these pics and other amazing eats on my Instagram. @theothergaymer

Reviews.Author: Nick V.
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good sushi in downtown! Came here for lunch with a few coworkers and we had super fast service, and the sashimi lunch special is an excellent deal. I went with the salmon bento box that had huge portions. The chef was also very generous with ginger/wasabi servings, which I loved. We also received a ceviche gratis, which was amazing. Definitely recommend checking Sushi Gen out for lunch, not sure about dinner.PS. Free valet parking. At least during lunch. Parking sucks anywhere downtown!

Reviews.Author: Scarlet C.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jade T.
Reviews.Content: Very busy, noisy, lonnng wait even *with* reservations, buzzed-about sushi place.  Justifiably.  The fare at Sushi-Gen is outstanding.Interior is pleasant, traditional-- very much like many Japanese restaurants.  Except... I don't think I've ever seen quite as many sushi chefs working in one place behind one sushi bar, as I have here.  So, that should tip you off that Sushi Gen is quite serious about their fish.Still, for the prices, I think I'd expect a scoshh more atmosphere or something.  Not asking for Yamashiro vibe or penthouse view, but... oh I don't know.... just a little anything fancy-ish.  Ehh, minor point.Dinner was really good.  Five-star company, five-star fare.  Very pleased with the Chirashi bowl.  Thick slices of a variety of seafood blanket a ball of glistening pearly gohan.  Superb fish, tako, salmon roe etc.  And I must say, the sushi rice is beyond excellent.They probably use the premium highest quality rice grains, rinse it like 500 times, sprinkle in their exclusive secret recipe sushinoko, then lock it into some custom manufactured Mercedes Benz of rice cooker steamers.  Et voilà:  the ideal, sticky starchy rice.  Yeah, I kiiind of like the gohan at Sushi Gen. :]Nigiri and sashimi are great-- lovely presentation and delicious.  With such high quality, I would hope fresh grated wasabi was de rigeur at a place like this.  But it does not accompany every sushi entrée; you have to shell out extra.Then again, I suppose I'm getting crotchety and whinier about everything food related, in my fast forward to the golden years.  Didn't you know, I was already a little old lady on my born day.  Yeah, so?  Benjamina Button-- without the youth-ifying, unfortunately ha. :|Dinner fare was solid.  Top-notch fish.  Service was satisfactory.  I was amused that among various Asian languages overheard at surrounding tables, none of them was Japanese.Few people ever like to talk about it, but everyone's slightly more money conscious these days.  I have a sneaking suspicion, the difference in five-star ratings versus three or lower, is whether you had lunch or dinner here, and how much waiting you can tolerate.I'd gladly return for lunch at Sushi-Gen, if the wait isn't too gnarly.  Just to see if everything is just as oishii, at a slightly better price.

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-gem of LA is what it should be called. Deserves to be reviewed.Never disappointing. I've been here several times since I discovered this place back in college. In college, I've only tried their lunch sashimi special and I fell in love with the place. Over the course of the years, I've maintained a long term relationship with this sushi establishment and it's never disappointed me. I've never left unsatisfied. Instead I always think about when I can come back next!If you're on a budget but appreciate good food (college me), come during the lunch hours for their sashimi lunch special. If you're willing to splurge on good food (current me), come during dinner. Must orders are the Sashimi Deluxe (which comes with a wide assortment of fish), uni, and yellow tail collar. The toro is very good here as well as the sweet shrimp and fresh oysters. Good place to bring a date/family/visiting friends or to celebrate a special occasion. Not good for groups larger than 6. Make reservations!

Reviews.Author: Lynda P.
Reviews.Content: Party in your mouth!  I concur with other Yelpers that the sushi here is "orgasmically good," although I've yet to hear people moan and scream when I dine here.  That would be pretty interesting though, because I'd come here just for the show. HahaThe sushi here definitely "tastes like butter!" It's melt in your mouth, tantalizing to your taste buds goodness.  Even at 7 in the morning, I am drooling thinking about it, and I don't even eat breakfast!  Bad... yes....I know.  And I used to teach Health classes many many years ago... I am no sushi snob by any means, but Sushi Gen rates as one of my favorite sushi joints on my list in terms of superb quality and selections in SoCal that doesn't break your wallet.I love their sashimi deluxe ($35), which is an assortment of delicious fish.  It comes with salmon, toro, maguro, mackeral, octopus, and much more.  I typically don't eat a lot in one sitting, I believe in "Hara hachi bu" the Japanese way of lifestyle, "Eat until 80% full."  However, I had to make an exception to this rule because the pieces of fish were so d*mn good that I didn't even want to share it with my dinner date and also ate their food!!  Boy was I stuffed!  But it was all worth it!I'd love to try their omakase here next time. Currently taking reservations for anyone who wants to treat me. JK :) Pros: Great sushi, good service (friendly, quick and attentive).Cons:  Wait time could be atrocious, so I'd recommend making reservations around the time of opening, or else you might still have to wait.  Also, they don't offer exotic selections like higher end sushi restaurants, but this place is still great nonetheless and definitely worth checking out if you haven't already.P.S. Shout out to Phil C for recommending this place to me!

Reviews.Author: Steven J.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to place for great sushi.Don't get fooled by some other over rated trendy place.Sushi here is absolutely delicious and it has been for many many years.I usually sit at the bar and opt for an oomakase. It has never failed me thus far. Love the uni, toro, engawa and all others.If you come here for lunch and choose to sit at a table,  it is most likely that you'll wait awhile. However, the bar is a quick fix.

Reviews.Author: Aileen K.
Reviews.Content: I came with my date for omakase, and some good Asahi beer.I personally think everyone should do omakase, even if it is expensive, because it is the only way you will truly taste the wonderful flavors that this restaurant and its amazing chefs have to offer.My date and I ate and drank until we were stuffed, and finally told the chef no more. I was nervous to ask for the check, but it only came out to be about $200, which is amazingly priced compared to the high-end sushi places that charge wayyy more for omakase.Close your eyes and splurge when you come here. If not, might as well go down the street to Hama Sushi and get a sushi platter, which is just as fresh and yummy.People say the lines are long, but come on a weekday and the wait isn't TOO bad, especially if you don't mind sitting at the bar. (20-30 minutes)

Reviews.Author: Juan F.
Reviews.Content: I come here a lot. Last time I came for dinner and got their sashimi dinner, they hooked it up with TORO. YES!!!!!!! Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Kimberlie L.
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off by saying that I dream about this place. The food is beyond amazing. I went through a phase when I ate here everyday for a week for lunch and dinner. Never have I ever been disappointed. Fish quality, dish selection and overall meal experience is great. I always order the sashimi place (the large one) and it comes with a generous serving of fish and you get to sample a little bit of everything they have. Perfect for the sahimi lover. Many other dishes that are cooked so if you don't eat raw, no worries! Chicken teriyaki here is good, their sauce is just the right sweetness and stickyness - heavenly with the mashed potatoes and small side of salad. If you only feel like eating light try the salmon skin salad, mozuku and ankimo. Everything is fresh and very very yummy with all authentic flavors. Lunchtime is cheaper than dinner a bit since they have the lunch sets, but the wait times are pretty much identical - be prepared to wait. Inside a plaza in J-Town across from the Office Depot so you can walk around while waiting for your table. Yes, the prices are a bit higher than most places around the area for sushi, but you won't regret it!

Reviews.Author: Patricia L.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite sushi/sashimi.Unfortunately it's located in Little Tokyo, which means: a) it's a bit of a journey from Torrance and b) parking sucks.Luckily there's a parking lot here that's pretty cheap ($2 I think).I came here for the lunch special. We got here at 11am. We tried to go earlier, but that failed... Anyways, the line was pretty long already. They just opened the doors. We were in line for just 35 minutes or so, so it wasn't too bad.Of course I ordered the $15 sashimi lunch combo. It comes with amazing sashimi, rice, miso soup, salad, and a side tofu dish. The sashimi is so fresh, perfectly room temperature, the way it should be, and they're not just dinky pieces. They give you a lot of rice, but you don't need to eat it all. There's a variety of fish, typically whatever they have is fresh and in season. I love toro. They didn't skimp out on the toro either.If I ever feel like splurging, I'll definitely be back for dinner. Otherwise, lunch special it is!

Reviews.Author: Tara M.
Reviews.Content: This review is only for my to go order. All my trips here for sit down have been 5 stars, but who always can afford an one hour wait lunch time. I ordered the sushi deluxe with salmon skin salad and mozuku and an order of sashimi lunch. Called 20 minutes ahead cause I know they have a lot of business during lunch. Got there in about 20 minutes and when I went to get my food, it seems like they haven't even started the order yet so waited another 15 minutes to get my order. The fish was fresh like always and very good value for the price. The one problem I had with it and why I took off a star is the siZe of their container is very small. So for the sushi deluxe, the sushi pieces were packed up tight like a can of sardines. Good rice for sushi should be loosely packed and breaks apart easily once you put it in you mouth but the rice was too tightly packed.  Also different pieces of sushi was touching and overlapping each other making flavors mixed up. The salmon salad also didn't have any taste and was not as good as when I had it in the restaurant. Overall ill probably still keep getting to go orders but will probably stick with the sashimi lunch instead of getting the sushi. Also really liked how they packed the rice separate with the sushi so the heat from the rice would not ruin the sashimi. I also had trouble finding a clear picture for the lunch menu so took some and hope they will be useful for those ordering to go orders in the future.

Reviews.Author: Janice L.
Reviews.Content: Eating sushi at places like this is both an ultimate blessing and a curse. The fish is so fresh and flavorful that you'll never be able to stomach the defrosted stuff ever again. The price is steep but the quality is definitely apparent as the entire dining experience is true to the traditional japanese way of eating sushi. It's not like those other over-priced LA joints that serve mediocre stuff (Katsuya)... :P If you eat at the sushi bar, you can only order a la carte off the sushi menu, no kitchen items can be served at the sushi bar. But you'd be crazy to order anything cooked here. My boyfriend and I have very singular tastes, we know what we like and want a lot of it. We had the toro, salmon, yellowtail belly, amberjack, and spicy tuna rolls. All of it was great, especially the toro and amberjack :) can't wait to go back once I replenish my checking account!

Reviews.Author: Kelly N.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch and waited 1 hour. Friend and I got there around 10:45am and there was a line already. It's as if Sushi Gen was giving out free sushi. Once we were seated waitress took our order. Restaurant was like an oil machine, getting people in and out as quickly as possible. This is great for people waiting. We both ordered the sashimi lunch special for $15 and oysters for $20. Looking at the tables around us, everyone basically came here for the sashimi lunch special. We got lucky. The waitress didn't charged us for the large sake and coke. Everything was so fresh and worth the 1 hour wait.

Reviews.Author: Khoa T.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special!If you're there for lunch, just ask for that; in our case the waitress pointed that out on the menu and we said "yeah we came for that, 2 please!". So many people order that dish I bet the sushi chefs can make it with their eyes closed...I don't know how they don't take a piece of that delicious sashimi themselves. It's been 2 days, and I'm still dreaming of that fresh and savory sashimi. For $15, we actually got quite a bit of fish, which had fish from the seven seas.I think my favorite was either the spicy tuna or the fatty tuna. yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…Definitely going to come here more often. But be warned though, we came here about 10 minutes after 11am and there was already an hour wait, so make sure to get there extra early.

Reviews.Author: Isabelle T.
Reviews.Content: $15 Sashimi lunch came with a lot of food, but 2/3 of which was not sashimi. The fish was yummy but the spicy tuna mix looked like cat vomit. Their miso soup was very good.$1 for ponzu sauce$1 for pickled ginger(I expected to be charge $1 for chopsticks)Would I go back? Sure, but not anytime soon. The long wait is kinda ridiculous. at least you can park in the lot for $2 during lunch.

Reviews.Author: Sundoro T.
Reviews.Content: I ate here tonight and love it. OmekaZe are excellent, quality is very close to sushi dai @ Tsujiki market without going to Tokyo . I had Kama toro , abalone, giant clam, amber jack , sardine, Spanish mackerel and other goodies total of 16 nigiri

Reviews.Author: Dawn I.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!Being as Japanese food is my favorite go-to food growing up, I can never get sick of sashimi! I'm definitely a foodie and I have to say that if you are willing to wait in a big line, you won't be disappointed here! They are known for their sashimi combinations so be sure to order it when you come here! Chirashi is usually my go to meal but for 6 little pieces of fish over sushi rice for $15, you are better off getting the sashimi combo that comes w/miso soup, rice, and tofu.Tip: be sure to arrive here 20 minutes before they open at 11:15 a.m. I arrived here at 10:55 a.m and there was already a long line. By the time we got in there, we were 2nd next to be seated and the wait after us was 40 min - 1 hour wait!!! But this place is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Author: Ily V.
Reviews.Content: Hand down the best & most fresh fish in Los Angeles. The lunch Sashimi special is an incredible deal even if you factor in the wait, which is usually between 25 to 45min.If you like fancy rolls this is not your place, but if you can appreciate the taste of fish than this is a godsend

Reviews.Author: Sky N.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi in downtown LA.

Reviews.Author: Tim L.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! This is as good of sashimi/ authentic Japanese sushi as you're gonna get in the LA area! Now ill get straight to the point. The place is a bit small and the line gets really long really fast. My suggestion is to go there right when it opens and be one of the first customers so that you don't need to wait in line. The ambiance here feels quite nice. It has a very traditional Japanese feel to it. Now on to the important part, the food. I usually get the sashimi dinner which is 26 dollars. What you get in that dinner set is really amazing. You get rice, tempura, and superb quality fish ranging from braised tuna, blue-fin tuna sashimi, hamachi, grilled salmon, and a few other fish. If you're lucky some days they include octopus in it! All the seafood is super fresh and quality is some of the finest! The service here sometimes can suck because they try to rush you out because of the long lines but i don't think that matters too much because all the waitresses are always there checking up on you. Overall if you love sashimi or sushi of the finest order This is the place to get it! Pros-Fresh fish and superb quality-nice ambiance-extremely clean (bathroom is extremely clean as well)-not TOO expensive (i say this because you get a pretty good amount and you get superb quality) Cons-the wait can suck balls-parking is a pain in the ass at night -everyone in your party has to be present when they call your name otherwise they wont let you get your seat -if you're a big eater and you eat at the bar prepare to shoot a hole through your walletOverallterrific place to go eat Japanese food! YOU WONT REGRET IT! Sushi Gen keep up what your doing!

Reviews.Author: Christi P.
Reviews.Content: Amazeballs fish, tempera was perfect! The ice cream was to die for. But... Too bad the wait was almost an hour. The hosts are pretty damn rude and talk to you like you're an annoying child. Servers were nice though. Just wish they had a better wait and better people up front.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Quality quality quality,The first bite you take here, you will notice the difference,  They must inspect ever fish before it enters Sushi-Gen because wow it felt like I was eating the best traditional Japanese Sushi out there.Everything has already mentioned by other reviewers, the sashimi lunch plate, but I want to go out on a limb and call out the Unagi Roll,  Simple? Yes.  Typical?  No way!Unagi is usually served on top of rice, this was rolled into the center and topped with sesame.  It was a new flavor with a great texture.   Never had anything like this and I plan on stopping by to get this to-go.It's a nice side roll to get to share with friends!

Reviews.Author: Ji-In L.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi place in LA I've tried so far.  The fish is fresh, the rice is perfectly cooked, and the nigiri is skillfully made.  I've also had some great sushi at Hama, but I like the atmosphere at the bar at Sushi-Gen better.  The chefs are friendly and it's just much more relaxed.  There's usually a wait, but it's worth it.  Heads up: you can't order off the non-sushi menu at the bar, but you'll be seated faster if you ask for the bar.

Reviews.Author: Roy C.
Reviews.Content: Incredibly fresh sushi at very reasonable prices!Sushi-Gen is, dollar-for-dollar, the best sushi I've had in LA.  The prices are average, but the fish quality is through the roof. Don't expect anything fancy or creative here, it's about the fish and ONLY the fish. Sat at the sushi bar and had the:toroankimounagialbacoreyellowtailscallopsalmonamaebiunihamachi bellysnapperAll were phenomenal. My favorites were the Toro (of course), Hamachi Belly, and Ankimo.Extremely crowded and takes a while to get seated, but worth every minute.

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi in town!  Actually, one of my favorite restaurants.  They have the highest quality fish so you can't go wrong with any dish here.  i have been coming here for years with my hubz, family, friends, in-laws and other VIPs that i'd like to impress!My faves: toro sashimi, sweet ebi with the heads prepared in miso soup, the albacore tataki...well, let's just say that there's nothing i have ordered that i've sent back or disliked!  Order your faves first and if you still have room in your tummy and don't know what else to get, go omakase...it's a great way to explore new dishes and the chefs will almost always ask you if you have any aversions to something before serving it.  Once upon a time, i had uni somewhere and thought it was disgusting!  However, Sushi Gen saved it and is now on my OK-to-eat list!Tip: sit at the bar (if you don't care for all the other stuff), avoid going in large groups as the venue is not that accommodating and avoid dinner "rush-hour" or else you'll be waiting for about an hour!

Reviews.Author: Joe H.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here, it is as good as what the hype is all about. Lunch special is the way to go here.We ended up ordering more than the lunch special and dang! our bill came to about $85, and there were not that much food. Should've known when there are no prices on the sushi menu ( ha ha!)We arrived 30 min before opening to see a long line already. This place IS popular.Lunch special is a must have!  I heard horror stories about dinner (mostly price ha!) Will try to come back again for sure!

Reviews.Author: Soo H.
Reviews.Content: Came here a little past 9pm on a Monday night because our favs (Komasa and Hama) were closed/full.  It's a short walk from the main village, but worth it.  We were seated immediately at the bar, and I would really recommend sitting at the bar because then you can ask the chef what he recommends, and also your food comes out REALLY fast.  We ordered a ton of nigiri sushi, some fried shrimp heads, and I got to try monkfish liver for the first time.  The fish here is fresh and tasty, the fried shrimp heads taste like Korean shrimp crackers (which I LOVE), and service was quick and attentive.  I'd come back here again, although apparently from reading the other reviews, I shouldn't come at peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Victoria N.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi here is melt in your mouth delicious. We were visiting in town and our friends decided to take us here and I'm sure glad they did! We both ordered the sashimi deluxe, akimo pate and lots of uni!! All I can say is wow! Everything was so fresh and delicious. The sashimi delux included an assortment of generous cuts of fish such as salmon, tuna, ebi, tamago, and much more.  The uni we ordered was especially fresh and sweet. Not fishy or smelly at all. I'm drooling thinking about how tasty everything was. The wait was a little more than an hour but I am sure glad we waited. Totally worth it! The place is small, but clean and service was good. Overall, we averaged about $50 a person with plenty of food and drinks.

Reviews.Author: Mythi N.
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. God. This place has changed my life.  I can't believe that you can get these kinds of deals with sushi.  Great prices and really fresh fish.  April, I love you for showing me the light!
