Service is not that great - little Asian guy at the door is a little snob in my opinion, but whatever - the food is worth it.  Servers are sweet though.   Get there early if you wanna eat.  The line gets insanely long.  Got there at 11 am (when they're actually open)  and the wait was 1.5 hours.   There was already a line waiting outside.  URGH!

Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of good, traditional sushi. Quite sadly, Sushi-Gen did NOT fit that bill. It was, at best, a very average sushi experience. The fish was fresh, but uninventive and the prep was unfortunately very poor. The nigiri was inconsistently sized, often being way too big, and the sashimi was (I swear that I'm not being overly dramatic here) cut with a level of attention reserved for dog food. Minus 1 star for the price. I treasure my  LA sushi experiences, so I left this dinner very sad...

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: Price is...wow! Fishy Freshness is a WOW! I love how they have three different types of mackeral. THREE! Halibut, Red Snapper, Yellow Tail, Yellow Fin and Blue Fin Tuna...amazing.They have fresh, i say FRESH Wasabi.Did not have to wait...WOW!Finished and came out and saw a crazy line...WOW!

Reviews.Author: clarence e.
Reviews.Content: Very good place. It's a whole in a wall so except less seating and crowded bar but other than that the sushi is the best I've had. The service are in their toes.

Reviews.Author: Ashley L.
Reviews.Content: There 15 dollars sashimi lunch special is totally worth the money. You can't get such a good deal anywhere else! There is a great variety, and everything is very fresh. But do expect a crowd and long wait

Reviews.Author: August T.
Reviews.Content: Great food, fantastic service, weird on reservations!I made reservations days ahead for a 5pm seating - when their doors open.  We arrived 10 minutes early and there was a line.  Folks with reservations still had to wait in line; I assume they held our table as we did get seated - there were about 20 people ahead of us - but I thought it still weird that they didn't take reservations first.Food was great, fresh sushi. I've had better tempura but hey, it's not a tempura house.

Reviews.Author: Onn S.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi place in LA. Worth the wait and very authentic Japanese sushi bar. Fresh and high quality fish.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany T.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi gen. Their sashimi deluxe is the way to go if you come for dinner. The plate comes with a great variety of fish, thick cuts of chu toro, and is big enough for two people to share. Their sashimi lunch is also a great deal ($15) if you can beat the lunch rush. Otherwise, be prepared to wait 45+ mins to be seated. Their kumamoto oysters, crab sunomono, and chawanmushi are also amazing. If you are a true sushi snob, you can also go with ordering nigiri a la cart. I noticed the toro and other fish are noticeably better when ordered a la cart. This is seriously one of the most delicious and reasonable sushi places in LA. I would've given the place 5 stars for the great food and price point but I admit the quality has slightly gone down  over the years while the prices have gone up, greedy much? Also, I'm not a fan of the long waits these days due to the popularity of the place. Still, Sushi gen is a must go for visitors to LA.

Reviews.Author: Lino K.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sashimi places I've been to, and you can't get a better deal for the quality of fish you get during lunch hours. $15 for an amazing assortment of fish, miso soup, rice, and salad. And the uni is so creamy and fresh, I could eat it all day every day! Lot of different options for those who want nigiri, or teriyaki combos too. Go get some fresh fish!

Reviews.Author: Sarah J.
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this amazing place...CON-long wait-a bit expensive for mePRO-AWESOME quality of fish-great fish to rice ratio-great menu (traditional yet creative)-rice is great-fat sashimi cutsWish I could have this everyday.

Reviews.Author: belle n.
Reviews.Content: Very good quality sushi and the sashimi platter is worth every penny. The wait can be a little long so don't come hungry and be prepared to wait an hour-ish. Service is fair too.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars!Surprised by the prices and quality of ingredients! Came in on a Monday around 11:30AM, and waited about 30 minutes for a table (not at the bar). Bf and I saw the menu and basically shocked to see $15 for a sushi combo/sashimi combo. You will never see those prices in SF, EVER - even at crappy Japanese restaurants. Definitely come for lunch for the great deals (not sure what the prices are at night)! The ingredients are super fresh, and it's definitely enough food to fill you up. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Derick E.
Reviews.Content: Have you seen Sushi Jiro? This is like it. Dude, this place is sick in a good way. Never had sashimi that fresh in my life. Bourdain is right, you never had  real sushi in your life unless you spend $$$ to experience the real deal. Does it make sense to you? Definitely will go back. One word: "Wow".

Reviews.Author: Stacy C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of those authentic Japanese restaurants with no frills because the quality of their fish speaks for itself.  Nested in a small strip mall in Downtown LA's Little Tokyo, it may be hard to find.  There is a parking lot attendant visible on 2nd St.  Make sure to get your ticket validated.  I've been a few times for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed my experiences at the sushi bar while enjoying omakase.  The sushi chef's work with you if you do not like a particular type of fish voice it to them.  I love their seared otoro, shrimp that comes with fried head in a soup, and their spanish mackerel.  Beware, do not use soy sauce or come expecting spicy mayo.  The sushi chef will let you know how each piece should be appreciated.  I recently came for their sashimi lunch special which in all honestly is a steal. For $15 you get miso soup, rice, and a sashimi platter that will be sure to fill you up.  Although there isn't any toro offered at lunch, this amazing deal will suffice.  Make sure to either get there early before they open or come after the first set of people are seated.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: This isn't so much a review as it is a commentary.  Yes, the $15 dollar weekday sashimi lunch special (that you can only get at non-sushi-bar-tables) is a ridiculous deal, and yes the quality is fan-flipping-tastic, and yes the service is an endearing example of Japanese efficiency and politeness.  But you already knew all this.  What my main question is why there are always so many people able to take off at least 2 hours (counting in wait time and eating time) during a weekday lunch period to eat here? WTH.  I am a health professional and often have weekdays off rather than weekends.  But what about the rest of the working world? What job allows you to have so much time off during lunch to wait in the 30-45 min line during the week day? Bizarre.  Anyways, off my soap box now. Come eat here.  The 2 hour parking validation for 2 dollars should be enough time to wait in line and eat.

Reviews.Author: Anelle H.
Reviews.Content: Good place for sashimi but not the best and is overpriced. I wanted to love this place trust me but after an hour of wait and their okay service and their okay food I convinced myself it was a three star place compared to sushi go 55 down the street. Would I come back? Maybe if we make reservations ahead of time.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Made a same day reservation for 7 people. We got there 10 minutes before it opened for dinner and a line had already formed. On the phone, they had told me that they would only seat us if our entire party was there and this held true. The restaurant is pretty small with a sushi bar area and table area that maybe held 50 people. Service was a little slow and it took a while to get our food but once we got a couple dishes, service seemed to speed up. I didn't pay but the bill was pretty high for 7 people. My favorite thing that we ordered was the Toro which was like butter. The spicy tuna roll was also pretty good (nice texture). I didn't really care for the sweet shrimp (comes with fried head, kinda cool). Parking was a breeze (they have a lot that you pay a couple bucks for). If I went back, I would probably opt for a sushi set instead of getting individual pieces. Pros- Toro- Parking- Spicy TunaCons - Sweet Shrimp- Service

Reviews.Author: Brian R.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The fish is so fresh, it's ridiculous. I would eat here more, but it gets super busy during lunch time (especially if you want a table). If you sit at the sushi bar, you have to order a la carte. Sushi bar is expensive, but awesome!

Reviews.Author: Jeesu K.
Reviews.Content: I have to say their sashimi combo is one of the best sashimi I've had in awhile. Its so fresh and inexpensive for good sashimi!I took a star off however because their service wasn't that great. I had made a reservation for 11:15 am for lunch which is really early for lunch for me but they had said it was the only time available so I said okay. When I got there at 11:05 there was a long line out the door already. I had told the guy at the front desk that I made a reservation however he asked me to wait in line anyways. After waiting in line for about 20 minutes we were seated and as we sat down the server asked if we were ready to order. As it was my first time trying out Sushi-Gen I told her I was not ready and asked her a few questions about the menu. The servers generally seemed annoyed by my questions and didn't even answer them. I ended up ordering the uni combo which was way too much food for me and left more than half my plate because I couldn't finish it :( it was sooo good but I just couldn't finish it.

Reviews.Author: Erica Y.
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of our favorite places until we had the rudest restaurant experience with the host/manager yesterday. The experience made those really gruff waitstaff in Chinese restaurants (where you go for the excellent food not the service) seem like angels, because at least those servers don't tell you "WE JUST WANT YOU TO LEAVE" so they can make more money. The fish is fine and service is fine, so I have nothing to say about that -- but you can get delicious sashimi/sushi at numerous other places in Little Tokyo where we will be going now.Our party of 4 ordered a ton of food and a large bottle of sake. We were about halfway through dinner when my husband got out of work surprisingly early and we asked him to join us since Sushi Gen is (used to be) his absolute favorite, and he started speeding back from OC like a madman. Our group was at a booth where he could have easily just sat down to join us at the same table, but the host/manager rudely said he could not join -- restaurant policy "for the past 30 years" -- because it would add extra time to our total dining time if he came to eat. We said we weren't done eating yet anyway, and we even promised not to close our tab and not order any more food (a restaurant that doesn't want you to order more food??) so it wouldn't add more time since there was plenty of food as it was. None of that mattered because "we just want you to leave so we can have our tables back." This was a Tuesday night and there wasn't even a long line, and even if there was -- since when does adding an extra mouth to help eat the existing food and drink already on the table add extra time when you're only halfway through your meal? We're not inconsiderate people and would have made sure to eat expediently if there was a line (which there wasn't). So basically, Hubby rushed back from OC for no reason, was not allowed to eat with us and instead went to eat by himself at Aburiya Toranoko while we finished up as fast as we could to get out of there like they wanted. (And a big shout out here for ABURIYA TORANOKO on San Pedro which has melt-in-your-mouth fresh sashimi/sushi and chirashi for roughly the same price range, 50% OFF ALL DINNER FOOD on Wednesdays, a fantastic happy hour, a great space, and really friendly people.)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen was an awesome experience. We had the monkfish liver which was my favorite dish. It tasted like foie gras from the sea! We also got the sashimi lunch deal and the fish was really fresh. The tuna was melty in your mouth good. Also, the prices are extremely reasonable and you get pretty big portions. The only thing I didn't love was the beef teriyaki because it was kind of tough. Also, if you order hot tea, they will refill it for you with no charge. The lunch deal also comes with miso soup and tofu. Overall, I really loved this place and I am looking forward to coming back soon. :)

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: Yes it's impossible to get in but it's worth it. Heck I took a day off from work and got there a little before they open during a weekday to try their lunch special. TOTALLY WORTH IT. So fresh and so generous portion. A treat for sure.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing sushi, one of the best I've had in a long time. The fish is so fresh and melts in your mouth. I got the deluxe sashimi platter ($35) and finished almost all of it, but you can definitely make it a meal for 2 people.The variety of fish was spot-on. Usually when you get an assorted variety with no substitutions allowed, you get some leftover crappy fish that nobody wants. Not in this case - there wasn't one thing on the plate that I didn't like. They also included some egg, seaweed salad, and other unique and flavorful items. The quality and presentation was awesome.It appears the wait is really long. My party of 4 made reservations for 9 pm on a Friday night (yes, it's late), and didn't have a problem. We were seated quickly and done eating in an hour.I don't live in LA, but I can see myself coming here again on my next visit. I keep thinking about this place and trying to figure out how soon I can go again! 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Stephen C.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the better sushi places in little Tokyo.  There's always a crowd at dinner.

Reviews.Author: Hang N.
Reviews.Content: Solid sushi. I particularly enjoy their sashimi lunch specials. However, I prefer Hama (down the street).

Reviews.Author: Bruce K.
Reviews.Content: No respect for places that advertise being open at a different time then they actually are.  Yelp says 11am and the door sign clearly says 11:15am.  I wouldve got more work done if I knew!!! Wasting my time in line right now

Reviews.Author: Daniel Dong-Kyu K.
Reviews.Content: The fact that Sushi-Gen has 7-8 chefs skillfully slicing up fresh fish behind their sushi bar should give you the impression that their sushi is legit. Came on a Tuesday night, and the whole restaurant was packed. Waited about 25-30 minutes for a table. Traditional and simple Japanese interior. The most fresh and mouth-watering nigiri and sashimi I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. Every piece literally melted in my mouth, and the uni was unbelievably delicious. There is no doubt in my mind that this place has the best sushi in LA, period. Looking forward to trying their omakase as well.

Reviews.Author: Alison H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for our anniversary dinner. Made reservations but had to wait a little once we got there (something like 15-20 minutes), so I can't imagine what it would be like NOT to have reservations.We shared the shashimi platter and a few other sushi rolls. We were very impressed at the quality and the service. Our waitresses and waiters were so friendly and made our first time here quite the pleasant experience.

Reviews.Author: Roxy S.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness, if I had the money to eat here everyday I would. They give you TORO as part of their sashimi deal. Freaking TORO! Yeah, they don't give you salmon sashimi but NO ONE gives you toro like Sushi Gen does! I've had the sashimi lunch special before and their sashimi deluxe that I shared with my friend. The fish is so good it melts in your mouth, you seriously go to bed dreaming about this stuff.The line is long, but it moves very quickly - the staff works like one giant well-oiled machine. Once I make more money, I can't wait to blow it on sitting at the sushi bar and ordering a ton of mysterious omakase items from the sushi chefs.

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: Definitely get the sashimi lunch here! Only $15 and you get a TON of sashimi, in addition to a bowl of rice, soup, salad, and a tofu appetizer.The sashimi is great quality - we had 3 fat pieces of TORO (nom!?!?), 6 big pieces of hamachi (I think), a big pile of red tuna, a pile of spicy tuna, a pile of spicy TORO, a piece of cooked salmon, a piece or 2 of squid, and some other things that I couldn't figure out on the plate. It's definitely a filling lunch.We got there around noon and had to wait an hour for our seats - we just took a walk around Japanese village and the time passed quickly.Do it!

Reviews.Author: Sandra H.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this place has such high reviews. These people only care about the turn over. They straight up told us they were going to tell the people before us to leave before we sat down since we waited a while. They rushed us out on our way out too. The sushi was mediocre. Not impressed at all. They also forgot to bring like half our order. Granted we were too full for it but still, who forgets that much food? Anyway not recommended at all.

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi here is amazing. Super fresh, well prepared and very tasty. I love coming here for lunch during the weekday and ordering the sashimi plate. For $15 you definitely get your money's worth with this plate. There are so many different types of fish, prepared in wonderfully different ways, and it comes with a bowl of rice, warm tofu, a small dish of veggies and miso soup. And all of it taste amazing.There will almost always be a wait when you come here so be prepared for that. But it's so worth it that I really don't mind standing outside for 40 minutes just so I can get the sashimi plate. The service is excellent despite how busy they get. My drinks are always refilled promptly and the food basically gets put in front if you as soon as you're done ordering. Well, maybe not that fast. But the food does come rather quickly - probably to get you the door just as quickly because of the people still waiting outside. But I don't mind because that just means yummy food right away!I love this place and highly recommend it to anyone who loves lots of fresh sashimi without making your wallet cry.

Reviews.Author: Starving Student P.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the $15 Sashimi Platter is of amazing value. However, if you want the best of what Sushi Gen offers, dine at the Sushi Bar as most people are completely missing out on as they primarily go for the sashimi platter mainly due to the price. They have fish that's considered traditional in Japan yet uncommon in the US such as Engawa (Halibut Fin), Aji (Spanish Mackerel) and Kohada (Gizzard Shad). The best thing to order that will make you drool on the table is O-Toro (Very Fatty Tuna)!The Non-$15 Sashimi Platter Blog Review: themetropolitanlounge.bl…

Reviews.Author: Ji T.
Reviews.Content: does it live up to the hype-yesis the food good-yesis the service attentive-yesis the wait long-yesdoes the food blow my mind-not so mucheverything was what i expected from a restaurant with 4 star rating over 2000 review, food tasted great, not blow my mind take my money i'm done amazing, but still great, i wouldn't come back here on the weekend consider the wait ...even if it was only 45mins

Reviews.Author: Paola M.
Reviews.Content: Good sushi and service but definitely on the pricey side. Boyfriend and I came for sushi dinner and ordered various sushi and drinks:*1st Round of Sushi: tuna, fatty tuna, Spanish mackerel, Japanese mackerel, yellowtail, uni*2nd Round of Sushi: Japanese mackerel, yellowtail belly, red snapper*Clam Miso*Fried Calamari (had to do it)*1 Large Sapporo*1 Hot SakeThe sushi here is handcrafted like little works of sushi art, but the pieces are small and some items like the tuna and mackerel were quite bland and dry. The yellowtail belly, red snapper, and uni were pretty good. The clam miso was tasty as well.The meal was satisfying overall, but at $120 including tip it was a bit over my budget for a casual dinner. I really wanted to like Sushi-Gen because of everything I had heard about it, but the price and fish quality were not up to par with other local sushi haunts. I think next time I'll try the sashimi combos since those seem to be the best deal here.

Reviews.Author: Kate Z.
Reviews.Content: Very much worth the drive and wait!The deluxe sashimi plate is large and very, very, very good!!  I enjoy everything on it but like the scallops and toro the best.  I love squid but the first time it was good and the second time, it was a bit stringy.  Several types of white fish and all were exellent.  Minor issue with the squid on an otherwise great selection, will definitely be back many more times with gusto.And because my love of sweet shrimp has no bounds, we got some extra orders of uni and sweet shrimp.  Very fresh and they will fry the shrimp head for you which is also yummy.  I like to save my favorite bite for last so I eat one shrimp to begin my meal and I save one piece  as the last thing I eat!  It makes me smile to just think about it and to type about it.And I absolutely love good sushi rice, so I just ask for a small bowl of it to the side ... it just becomes this big, beautiful plate of sashimi with random small bites of perfect vinegary rice that is much better than a chirasi or kaisendong because the fish to rice ratio is much better!

Reviews.Author: Joanne L.
Reviews.Content: 15 bucks for sashimi lunch special?? Not only do they give you a hearty amount, the quality of the fish is the best in LA. But be warned, this place isn't for a quickie lunch. There's always a wait (30-45 min), even on weekdays or for an early lunch, and it's closed on Sundays as do most sushi restaurants. Another favorite is the yellowtail collar. It's a pretty big piece of fish, perfectly grilled.yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…

Reviews.Author: Margeaux R.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those restaurants where you wonder how they are still in business. I don't even know where to start. All I know is that my stomach has felt the pain since coming here. I ordered 4  rolls here and I only ate 1. It was the spicy tuna with shrimp. It was decent that's it, nothing special.  When the lettuce wraps came, I was presented with week old lettuce that was brown and wilted. I asked for a new head of lettuce "the server goes let me check with the kitchen" How did he not notice it was old when he brought it to me. He didn't even take it out of my way. How on earth would any chef let that head of lettuce leave a kitchen is beyond me. One of the rolls was supposed to be a baked scallop roll and the scallops were raw. The service was just awful. I was there with a bunch of people for a birthday and they really couldn't get it together. People were waiting and waiting for their rolls.You would expect top notch sushi i "Little Tokyo" I'll PASS, thanks.

Reviews.Author: Aris L.
Reviews.Content: i went here for lunch..i tried the omakase...the sushi was quite fresh and they give the fish quite generous...staff are very friendly...for the price it is very reasonable...CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Author: Pearl Y.
Reviews.Content: This is a very traditional Japanese restaurant.. If you're looking for cream cheese or macadamia nuts in your sushi roll, don't come here! The fish is very fresh and they have a great selection of sashimi and sushi rolls. If you like your fish straight up and fresh, this is the place to go! However, we had a bit of a wait and our waitress was a bit snappy and had attitude (maybe it's because it's so busy?) I don't think that's an excuse, but other than that we had a great meal! My date got the sashimi dinner and I got spicy tuna rolls and the teriyaki chicken dinner. yums!

Reviews.Author: Renee F.
Reviews.Content: This place is seriously worth looking around, especially if you're a sushi lover. It's simple yet great enough to leave a wonderful experience in your diary. We loved the sushi - which not just had a perfect blend of ingredients, but also had ample amount of servings to fill up your tummy. The service is simply amazing at Sushi Gen, always quick to help you and guide you through their rich variety of cuisines (sashimi with some specialty rolls and pieces are simply to die for). However, it's the posh carte du jour that could make one think twice before visiting this place and forking out heavy. But the star of the show is undoubtedly the fish - which gets served nattily in considerable size portions and sheer freshness. Glad that hopped by this one!

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: "You will always be lucky if you can make friends with strange cats" - an ancient proverb from an old old wooden shipThere were three sushi places all in the immediate area. So we parked in the lot and observed all three. Thinking they all looked about equal we asked the parking attendant who said that Sushi-Gen was far and away the best of the lot. So we listened and walked inside. It is a pretty small place so there was a wait for a table for three. Which was fortuitous as otherwise I would never have noticed that charming little kitty in the corner. See attached photo of said kitty cat.Hot house sake is $7.50 for a "large" which is actually rather small, it goes pretty quickly if you have had a rough day and it goes even faster if you are sharing it with another person. The "large" Sapporo is $7 but at least the beer glasses are tiny so you feel like Godzilla as you drink from them, you are large and in charge.Octopus sushi: amazeballs. But everything octopus is great. It only comes with 2 pieces though so be forewarned if you are dining at a table of 3. And it is very loosely wrapped so the rice will jettison even if you are being careful.Eel avocado sushi: besides the octopus the clear best of the sushi lot. The avocado is so delicious and green you have to like it.Because of lots of sake and Sapporo you have probably hit the restroom at this point. It is back behind the sushi bar area as opposed to the table seating area. The men's is small and cramped and not extraordinarily clean, but as long as you are not dining off of the bathroom floor like one Captain Zapp Brannigan, then just get up and atom quickly.Salmon sushi: good. Made even better with wasabi. But that is one of my biggest complaints that the wasabi portions on each sushi plate were so tiny. I like it hot. Drop it like it is hot. Ghost ride the whip. Wait, scratch that last one.All in all a nice downtown LA sushi spot. The sushi rolls all seemed much smaller in size than I am used to.

Reviews.Author: Taryn M.
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things to say about this place!! The sushi is fresh and delicious and the portions (at least for the sashimi lunch special) are large. My friends and I got the Sashimi Lunch Special for $15 and were very satisfied. It comes with big portions of different fish as well as salad, miso soup, and steamed rice. You can get more steamed rice without being charged as well. Afterwards we were all pretty full for a good portion of the day. Since it seems like everyone who frequents Little Tokyo knows about this spot, it's beneficial to get there early or be willing to wait. My group lined up at 10:40am for the 11:15am opening and the line was already forming!! If you don't get in during the first wave then you'll wait about 40 minutes to be seated. Another good tip:  Make sure your whole party is here or you won't be seated.  There's parking available in the lot, but it is minimal. You also have to pay once you enter the lot so I recommend dropping someone off to stand in line while you figure out the parking situation. Overall, great lunch special, large portions, good quality, and worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Tom H.
Reviews.Content: This is the rudest and least friendly restaurant I have ever experienced.  The host is the nastiest and least welcoming person I have encountered.  I would not dine here again ever.

Reviews.Author: Victor L.
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't get a chance to try this place. We got here 10 minutes before opening and there was already a line. We were one of the unfortunate ones to not get a table when they opened. We waited for almost an hour and were about to leave because we had other plans when suddenly they called my name. Another group tried to swoop in on our table, but you have to get up pretty early to pull a fast one on me.I finally got a chance to eat their popular Sashimi Lunch Special. The first thing you will do is eat with your eyes because it is presented so beautifully. Now can I name you what kind of sashimi was on my plate? Not a clue! The menu and the waiter did not specify what fish was what. If I had to guess there is tuna, yellowtail, squid, albacore, and salmon tartare. The other stuff I have no idea. The fish is so fresh and cut so clean and neat.  You get a good amount on your plate and I was very satisfied afterwards. Is it the best sushi I ever ate? I haven't eaten at enough sushi restaurants to make a good comparison, so i'll say it is some of the best.

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: Go early and go with just one person and sit at the bar. I don't like lines nor do I like mainstream joints as the quality seems to suffer but this place has kept it as consistent as I can remember. Everything here is good or excellent.

Reviews.Author: Tina W.
Reviews.Content: Arrived like 20 mins before lunch service, there was already a queue. The seafood was good quality. Will come back again

Reviews.Author: Erika M.
Reviews.Content: A) I don't get the hype. B) The wait time is ridiculous. Make a reservation weeks in advance if you plan on hitting this spot up. Just sayin'. C) With the amount of people that roll through their doors and the crazy wait times, you would think they had some sort of system in place (e.g. pagers or texting peeps when their table is ready?). Nope. If they tell you it'll be an hour wait, and you check in at the 30 minute mark, and they tell you 30 mins more, and then you come back 30 mins later... there's a HUGE chance that your table will be given away. Why? Because you decided to have a beer in a neighboring warm restaurant, than stand and wait in the cold. Ridiculous! So, of course, now we have to wait another 30 minutes. In. The. Cold. Uuuuuuuuggggghhhhh. D) Their prices are just as ridiculous. We were in Little Tokyo last time I checked, right?!E) Friends ordered their sushi platter and every single piece of sushi had a ginormous wad of wasabi in it. Ummm...thanks for the heads up? It was almost inedible, unless you wanted to spend your dinner time scraping the wasabi off. At least you were doing so with ultra clear sinuses. Silver linning?F) After making us wait an hour-and-a-half, I would appreciate it if I could eat my food in peace. As opposed to being stared down by the wait staff because they've closed up shop and want you to pay and go home already. Ummm...I had just gotten my food. Should I have ordered it to go?G) I reeeeaaaaalllllyy don't get the hype.Meh.

Reviews.Author: Karl K.
Reviews.Content: thank you for wasting an hour of my time. if you say the wait is 45 minutes but come back in 30, and i do, don't freaking say i didn't answer and bump me to the back of the line.  if you don't want people to leave, say so. and don't bump people to the back of the line when they return like you asked. wtf!!!you're damn right this is a rant. i freaking hate it when people waste my time.

Reviews.Author: Lorena K.
Reviews.Content: Super fresh high quality sushi and sashimi. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Author: J. W.
Reviews.Content: Usually when I pay $170 for sushi, I get pretty pissed-off. However at Sushi Gen, I did not mind paying a premium at all. This was probably the best sushi I've had in recent memory and I've lived in Vancouver, Boston, and spent significant time in New York. This restaurant is comparable or better than Tojos in Vancouver and far superior to Morimoto in New York.The sashimi was definitely the highlight of the meal. The fatty tuna just melts on your tongue. It was savory and delicious. The salmon (Pink or Alaskan) sashimi was excellent as well. The surf clams were also very good. If you come here, I would go with the ala carte rather than the set menu. However, prepare for some sticker shock.I was expecting the portions to be tiny, but in actuality,  it was the opposite. The sashimi portions were huge! The miso soup was perfect, not salty. The side dishes were good as well. I often judge a sushi restaurant by whether or not they use REAL wasabi, not the artificial kind with food coloring; this place used the real deal.I would recommend making reservations well ahead. We came here on Sunday 15 minutes before opening and there was already a line . We were lucky to be seated. The atmosphere is very plain for such great food. The capacity of the restaurant is only about 75 people tops. I highly recommend coming here for special occasions.

Reviews.Author: Stacey C.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I've had in a looooong time.  It's all about sitting at the sushi bar watching the chef make the sushi right before your eyes!!!My favorite was the red snapper with a salt & lime juice.  It was simple yet so fresh!I also enjoyed their yellow tail, toro, salmon, and sweet shrimp.  Pricey but worth the wait & the experience.  Melts in your mouth...wish I could have had more!I would not sit at the table at this place, go to the sushi bar!!! =DIt's a LOOOONG wait, just warning you.

Reviews.Author: Fullson C.
Reviews.Content: This review is for their service. My friends and I went to this place for dinner because we heard about the great reviews about their food. We went there, gave them our name, and waited just inside the restaurant entrance to be called. We waited for 30 minutes and still were not called, which is fine because good food is worth waiting for. We waited for another 15 minutes and eventually asked the host, whose name was Brian, I think, about the approximate wait time. That was when we found out he actually scratched off our name because apparently he called our name and no one answered. There were 3 pairs of ears in my party and we were standing right in front of him the entire time. I find it hard to believe that no one noticed when we were called. That's fine, because he got us a table in about 5 minutes and someone finally led us in. Now while I was waiting I had a grande iced chai tea latte in my hand, and I did not realize that they have a no-external-drinks policy, and when I sat down at my table I had literally one sip left in my plastic cup. All of a sudden Brian ran over, reached out for my chai tea latte, and says: "You can't have that in here. Can I take it?"I don't know what kind of employment training he had, but that was unacceptably rude for Japanese standards, and I honestly expected more from a famous Japanese restaurant owned by Japanese people. Needless to say that spoiled my mood for the entire night. The food itself was alright. I had better sushi at a random Kaitensushi place in Osaka. The female Japanese server for our table was extremely polite and nice though. This restaurant just needs to screen those people they place at the door. Base on this experience I don't ever plan on returning to this place.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to come here for a while, since it came highly recommended from a friend. It's been a local favorite for ages, which doesn't always speak well to quality, but it did not disappoint. The service was good, the price was nice, parking was easy, and the fish/sushi/sashimi is fresh. It's a good lunch place and every now and then does have a Groupon/LivingSocial ad.

Reviews.Author: Lovella A.
Reviews.Content: You should only come to this place if you're looking for quality sushi and sashimi - none of that American fusion type of restaurant. I've tried several of their dishes, but if you want to truly see what this place is all about I highly recommend the sashimi platter! It's way cheaper at lunch but even if you come here during dinner I promise it's worth the price. The portion is very generous and it's super fresh! I suggest you come here 30 minutes (maybe even 45-1 hour) before it opens due to the size of this place.

Reviews.Author: B L.
Reviews.Content: FOR LUNCH ONLYI came here around 12:45pm after going back and forth between 2 parking lots after one said that our ticket would be voided if we crossed the street and the correct lot was FULL even though we just saw that it had spaces and drove across the street to find out it was full.. FACE PALM. So then we parked the car across the street from sushi gen at the office depot lot and just paid the $5 flat rate so we could cross the street. And guess what.. The sushi gen lot became open again... When we finally got to the restaurant, we were told the wait was 1.5hrs, which was way too long because it would have closed at 2pm and we wouldve missed the lunch special we came here for. Which was the sashimi lunch special for $15. Thank goodness they let us do take out for the lunch special. They told us it would take 20 minutes, so we went over to four leaf for some boba. 30 minutes later we came back and it still was not ready! Basically it took them 45 minutes to cut up some fish and box it for us. I'm not sure if the take out for the sashimi lunch special was suppose to include soup and salad. But overall, the sashimi was delicious! Those were some pretty fresh fish. And it was actually a lot of fish for the amount we paid. We probably received AT LEAST 14 pieces of fish. There was good variety in there. I lovee this place and would come here everyday, but I would not want to park here. If anyone know better ways to park around Little Tokyo, let me know. We broke so many traffic laws that day.

Reviews.Author: Lisa T.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a party of 5 for a 8pm reservation. They require the entire party to be present before getting seated. My party was late by 3 minutes and a bunch of the large tables were seated. Luckily my friend got in there and pointed out that we could fit in a 4 person booth if they just add a chair at the end, and it worked. Only had to wait 10 minutes. I got the sashimi delux and shared a sake. The sashimi was very fresh, and a lot of food. Actually took home a good potion. Thought the service here would be bad based on the reviews, but we had a good server. We even got the host to take a picture of us in front of the restaurant. Would definitely come back here again. Also, the private lot is always full, just get there early to park on the street.

Reviews.Author: Elvis S.
Reviews.Content: Are you kidding me, who the heck waits this long for mediocre at best sushi, don't believe the hype

Reviews.Author: Lil L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing find!  We had to wait 45 min but it was totally worth the wait!  The sushi was super fresh.  We went for lunch and ordered off the lunch menu which is a super bargain (esp the chirashi) and we also ordered a la carte.  The service was amazing and everything just felt and tasted authentic.  I highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Author: Vivian W.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi here is drool worthy.  I mean...drooling more than an English Bulldog drooling.  I've been coming to Sushi-Gen for years and the sashimi has always been consistently melt in my mouth goodness.  I swear my review may be slightly incoherent because I'm thinking about Sushi-Gen.  I've come by a few times for lunch and for dinner.  If you're coming for dinner, definitely make reservations.  The place gets packed and the wait will be forever and a day.  The place isn't that big and it's really popular.  If you're coming for lunch, get there 15 minutes before opening and stand in line with the rest of us.  There's nothing more I can say that hasn't been said in the other 1000+ reviews about how awesome this place is.  This is THE place to get your sashimi and sushi fix but you're going to drop a hundred dollars or so for 2 people.  No joke, but so worth it.  The fish is fresh, service is usually on par, and the sushi chefs are awesome.  Lunch time is significantly cheaper than dinner time so if you're on a budget and want to try this place, go during lunch.  Other than that, have a few bucks ready for parking and get ready to go to your sushi happy place.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: They have a private lot for $3.00, which may be worth it as gas isn't cheap and street parking is hard to find. But even if you pay as you enter, don't forget to get your ticket validated when you leave. You may instead opt to take your chances and have someone sign you up as you try to find street parking as the wait can be quite long.The quality of the fish is quite good. Although they do offer dishes like California rolls, the overall vibe of the restaurant and its food is more faithful to traditional Japanese cuisine. So, don't expect heavy seasoning or lots of soy sauce in everything. They offer cold and hot green tea as well as hand towels. I usually order the Chirashi Deluxe, which has a good serving of sashimi over a bed of seasoned rice. The squid sunomono serves as a great appetizer. It comes with squid, thinly sliced lemon and cucumbers with seaweed. You have to include all ingredients for the perfect bite. It's absolutely delicious.I hear the fried chicken is quite good, too. Will have to come back to try that sometime.

Reviews.Author: Joey L.
Reviews.Content: In the words of Wayne and Garth,  " We are not worth, we are not worthy!" Hidden in Little Tokyo lies this hidden gem called the Sultry and Sexy Sushi Gen. My friend has been hyping up this place for the longest time. I heard that they are pretty authentic and serve SAVORY sushi that melts in your mouth. I met my friends there for dinner around 6:30. To my surprise, there was no wait in line.  We went buck wild on ordering sushi from toro, scallop, amaebi, uni w/ quail eggs, yellowtail belly, kampachi, albacore, spanish mackerel, giant clams with a side of shrimp tempura and oyster. All of them were AMAZING! It was like BUTTER baby!It's Joey's World, Joey's World, party time, excellent! This is my new favorite local spot for Sushi. Thanks Sushi Gen for the great experience!

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: What can be said for this top-quality sushi restaurant that hasn't already been said in 1500+ other reviews?Not much. It's just fresh and delicious. $15 sashimi lunch is awesome. And I really like the green tea.Also, I wouldn't come planning to share dishes, either, because the split plate charge is $10 - almost enough to buy another sashimi lunch (which is exactly what two of my lunch-sharing coworkers did)!We were hunting for lunch today (Thursday) no more than a few minutes past 12:00 pm, and my ever hopeful coworker decided she was going to walk past the dozen or so people waiting outside and ask how long a wait would be for a table of 6. "We have a table. Is the party all here now?" Yes! Immediate seating at the lunch hour. So don't let the large gathering of people outside dissuade you... sometimes it's just a matter of timing (and I'm sure that they were holding the booth for a larger party rather than just for parties of two, anyway).

Reviews.Author: Tera T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Sushi! Great selection and very fresh. Best in LA for sure! There will no doubt be a wait, but the food is well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: HIGHLIGHT: Fresh sashimi that melts in your mouth, bite size sushi with warm rice and crisp nori.  Lots of people had told me that sushi/sashimi is way better in LA than the Bay Area so I had to try some on my recent LA food run.  Friends had mentioned about this place for lunch so my husband and I came early.  We got here at 10:30 AM and to my surprise, there was already a line of 5 people!  So we decided to get in line thinking it opened at 11.  Turns out they didn't open until 11:15.  The line grew longer and longer with sushi hungry people.Once it opened we were quickly seated.  We ordered the $15 Sashimi Deluxe and the $15 Sushi Deluxe.  I noticed the sashimi lunch sets just kept coming out.  I guess it's that popular that they make the plates in advance and they bring it out to the counter waiting to be ordered.  It's kind of gross that it sits there for 10-15 minutes. The sashimi lunch set came with warm tofu and miso soup.  When I got my sashimi lunch, I wasn't visually impressed.  I noticed the slices of sashimi in the middle, but everything around it was crappy.  Visually, it looked like a sashimi plate at a non-Japanese restaurant.  It seemed like scraps of tuna 3 ways along with some crab meat, wakame (seaweed), and thin slice of cooked salmon.  What you pay for is really the hamachi, toro, and the hirame sashimi, not the rest.  The sashimi indeed was fresh as I was told.  Melts in your mouth that it made me realize how dry the fish is back home.My husband's sushi deluxe was much more visually pleasing.  Sushi was delicious.  Small portion of warm rice and crisp nori for the rolls.  Next time, I'll get this instead.

Reviews.Author: Sophie L.
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love Love Love! The BEST Sushi place EVER!!!This is not our first visit and as expected, it's quite busy even during lunch time. We wanted sushi only so we didn't mind sitting at the sushi bar. Everything is SO fresh and it's just so yummy.We tried: TaroAmaebiUniHamachi ToroKonpachiIkuraSakeScallopHamachiGiant ClamUnagiTamagoIt's a bit on the expensive side but it's so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: Seven years after leaving L.A., I've moved back. And the first thing I begged my new husband to do? Wait in line with me at Sushi Gen. The $15 lunch Chirashi Deluxe is just as incredible as it was years ago-- filled to the brim with warm, fragrant rice and fresh, succulent pieces of sashimi. So. Happy.

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: Great place! Fresh Fish, good price & awesome service! 4 stars tho cause its always packed & its like eating in a cafeteria. No intimacy, packed like sardines & typically theres a long wait but its clean, effecient & makes you feel fancy.. Try it out! Place doesnt need my review. Lol

Reviews.Author: Alex D.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it. I just don't get it. Did I visit on an off night? Was the regular sushi guy on vacation? Was I at the right restaurant? All these questions and more will be answered at the end of this review. When I decided to visit this place last night, I thought of calling in for a reservation and was very impressed with the fact they were so busy. I was also told to arrive on time as they do not hold tables. My friend and I arrived promptly and decided to seat at the bar. We sampled somewhere between eight and ten different kinds of sushi and not one, not a single one stood out. Not only did they not standout on the menu, they were also quite mediocre at best on our palettes. Everything had some sort of an overpowering element on it that would prevent you from tasting the actual fish or any of the stars of the sushi. The fish was not tender and some of the rice fell apart. Too much wasabi, too much yuzu, and too little exciting options. The fried shrimp heads from the Sweet Shrimp were soggy; the Mochi ice cream was from Trader Joe's, and a refill on a Sprite was extra. These are just some of the things I am going to mention. So were we there on an off night? I don't think so. I just don't think I'll be coming back either. Thoroughly disappointed in the food, although the service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Matt C.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch!  Best deal in town when you consider the quality and proportions of the meal.  I would come here more often if I did not have to wait at least 30 minutes every time.

Reviews.Author: Dana K.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi in LA - hands down.Get there early, or be prepared to wait - i get the sashimi platter, but EVERYTHING is good

Reviews.Author: Tammy L.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant seems to have quite a reputation since it's been around for quite a few years, and seems like it's a place that is consistent with its service and quality.  I guess it's pretty easy to believe considering our 40+ minute wait at 1pm.  Thankfully, they have a parking lot that validates diners at Sushi Gen.Though there were seven of us, all of us either got the Chirashi Deluxe (sashimi assortment over rice) or the Sashimi Lunch Special (both $15).  Both include an assortment of the fresh raw fish available in shop that day - including tuna, toro (fatty tuna), yellowtail, octopus, as well as other assortments of shrimp and fish.  The Chirashi tends to have less sashimi and more of an assortment of other items rather than raw fish, which is better for those that don't like to have that many raw items.  The rice was really tasty, as they season it with sushi vinegar, and the texture was also really nice.  They serve complimentary miso soup, and the lunch specials come with a mini appetizer (ie. tofu).The sashimi was mostly fresh, although some of it seemed like mediocre sashimi, and the Chirashi had more cooked items than I'd liked.  I would say that this place is good for the value (during lunch at least), but can potentially become quite expensive.  Another plus is that it's near the Japanese Village Plaza, so afterwards, you can take a peek in the stores!
Reviews.Author_Location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Author: Randy I.
Reviews.Content: Often times I ask people, if you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, the most common response I get is sushi.  If you're one of those people who answered sushi, you must come here!What's sad though is I'm freaking allergic to seafood and shellfish.    Why did I go you ask?  Well, my girlfriend can be very persuasive.  People spoke very highly of this place and with the numbers to prove it, I figured it'd be worth a shot. 1400+ reviews with an average 4.5 star rating says it all.  I also thought I could just order chicken teriyaki.Definitely call in for RESERVATIONS ahead of time.  Otherwise, you may be in for quite a long wait.  We waited for about 30 minutes before we were seated since one of our party members was an hour late and we missed our reservation time.Aside from that little bump in the road, I was very impressed with the quality of this place.  The hostess was dressed perfectly for the occasion, extremely professional and welcoming.  This place was a well oiled machine.  The attire to the environment screamed of authenticity.  There were many framed pictures on the wall of japanese culture from sumo to tsunamis.Since my body decided since birth to give me an allergic reaction to anything from the sea, I decided to order the only thing on the menu that I knew I could eat, the good ol' chicken teriyaki.  But for a price of $20, it was a little steep, but seeing as how I didn't want to just be looking at everyone else eat their food, I went with it.BEST chicken teriyaki I ever had.  It came out with some tempura.  BEST tempura ever. Hah.  The presentation was amazing as well as the ingredients and the taste.  It was cooked perfectly and I was satisfied.  I wouldn't really go back again but this place gets the award for highest quality japanese food I've eaten.If you're big on seafood, all my friends say its the best they've ever had.  Worth a shot.

Reviews.Author: Stephen C.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi place i have ever been to. The sushi is so fresh and everything is expertly prepared.  I dont think there is a single thing on their menu that isnt well done.  The toro is unbelieveable.  Everyone who eats here gets spoiled and cant eat sushi or sashimi anywhere else. Im surprised anyone can give less that 5 stars for food here.  There are long lines but how is that the restaurant's fault?

Reviews.Author: Walt D.
Reviews.Content: Wow now this is sushi. The fish was very fresh tasted like melting butter once I took a bite. Worth every penny

Reviews.Author: Ram W.
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but the sashimi are pretty fresh. Very busy and parking does suck, but for a night out in Jtown this wouldn't be a bad place to stop at. I usually get their sashimi plate ($21) or their chirashi bowl. And if i feel really ballin' then maybe their deluxe sashimi ($35) "usually share the deluxe though. =) So 4 stars for service and freshness.

Reviews.Author: Monte H.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch and it was pretty crowded! Luckily we only waited 5 minutes and got to snag a seat at the bar. I asked for the omakase and it was solid. The rice here is pretty good - a little sweet, a little tangy, and at a pleasant temperature - slightly higher than room temp. The fish is good and tasted fresh, although I wish I had been served some of the leaner fishes. The chef started right off the bat with toro, and then uni, which left me sitting there wondering "well ...not sure what left to look forward to." I was under the impression that the fatty pieces were normally saved for last, with leaner fishes served first. Alas, there weren't many lean pieces at all. Still, towards the end, the chef created this wonderful handroll, with tuna, pickled veggies, perhaps some mango/jalapeno, and it just blew my mind. I would've rated this place only 3 stars for having such a 1 dimensional omakase but this last handroll really lifted my opinion of it.

Reviews.Author: Enoch C.
Reviews.Content: Irasshai!Sashimi Deluxe Plate, FOOOOO!Itadakimasu!WAHHHHH SOOO GOODEHHHH??? $$$$?!?! Quality A+, ahh sodesukaDomo!

Reviews.Author: Kathy C.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for some fresh sashimi that won't cost you an arm and a leg.  The lunch and dinner sets are so affordable that I second guessed the quality for a second, but the sashimi is really that good.  The restaurant is a bit on the smaller side and you'll probably have to wait an annoying amount of time if you come during peak hours, but I think it's worth the wait to try out Sushi-Gen at least once to judge the place for yourself.  The waitresses are all really cute and friendly.  They really try their best to give you good service and explain any questions you may have.

Reviews.Author: Michaela F.
Reviews.Content: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. Fish. Made reservations for dinner so no wait time.

Reviews.Author: Wanny C.
Reviews.Content: Well. I was there for dinner and waited for about 20 minutes. This place has great quality fish. I was really enjoyed the uni dinner  and sashimi dinner. The beef teriyaki was also great too. Loved it!

Reviews.Author: Billy T.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fish, good lunch prices and attentive service. Sushi-Gen was a fantastic choice for lunch while in LA. Beware of the wait. My friend and I came around 1 and had to wait about an hour to be seated. If you run into this problem, I suggest going over to Xlixe Pizzeria and having a beer while you wait. The servers here may seem rushed, but they give you quick service and are very attentive to what you want.The normal menu looks pretty price-y, but the lunch menu is a lot more manageable and is a great value. The chicken teriyaki and sashimi combo was well worth $15. The sashimi is fresh and delicately sliced. The miso soup was was light and earthly. The chicken teriyaki was the standout part of the meal. You might be thinking "Come on dog, its chicken teriyaki....how good can it be?" Well Sushi-Gen has the best chicken teriyaki I've ever had. The chicken is juicy and flavorful. The teriyaki sauce is thick and a perfect balance of salty and sweet. The best part is the crispy chicken skin. It adds great crunchy and fatty flavor. I could eat of pound of just that skin and I'd die happy.

Reviews.Author: Franklin C.
Reviews.Content: This place has one the best selection of sashimi to dine for in Little Tokyo.  The fatty tuna from the Sashimi Deluxe was so delicious I wanted to order more. I was here on a weekday and didn't have to deal with the crazy wait on the weekends!!! Definitely get the uni here as a starter. It will blow your mind away !!!This place was so good I had to come back a second time on the weekend!!!!! Be wary to be patient for the wait. And get ready to get a taste of Little Tokyo

Reviews.Author: Patrick W.
Reviews.Content: Yes there is a long wait if you don't get there early.  Yes this place is pricey. The sashimi plate is the best in town and totally worth the price. I've also sat at the sushi bar and spent a lot on lunch but the quality is one of the best in Little Tokyo so the experience was worth it. If you go for lunch don't order off the menu if you are not sitting at the bar like my idiot friend did. Just get the sashimi plate or you will end up spending twice as much for less food.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call myself a sushi snob.All I know is that is I hate rolls fried and drenched in sauce. My up-to-par standards start with a nice slab of soft, hefty, buttery bite of fish. Is that too much to ask for? :O)By the quality of the fish, I could tell I could easily rack Sushi Gen up to 5+ stars if I tried their omakase (next time!).I ordered their sashimi deluxe and everything was soft, fresh, and delicious. yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…I thought, "no way I could get full off this" sharing with a couple girls, but we were pretty darn full with a side of CA rolls (not my decision, don't judge me!), cucumber, spicy tuna, and salmon skin rolls.And the rolls were nowhere near drenched in sauce, while they were pretty simple, plentiful, and kinda cute!yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…;yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…I devoured my order of uni + quail egg sushi in 2 seconds. It was damn delicious. Although I love runny yolk, I'd hate to see that it costed the ratio of uni to be smaller (as expected). Will order a tub of uni by itself, next time!I definitely recommend this place, but had to knock down the star because the wait was ridiculous, which usually indicates the restaurant is popular and great.HOWEVER, the host was really rude. We were told that we were "2nd" after the next party, but failed to mention we were the 2nd of the list for "table for 4." He impatiently asked us to wait outside as we saw 10 more parties filter in.And icing on the cake, he practically bulldozed my girlfriend over without an apology.   - Perhaps it was a bad day for him..If you don't mind waiting (a long time) for good sushi. Go to Sushi Gen!

Reviews.Author: Ahrianna L.
Reviews.Content: I've had better sushi.

Reviews.Author: Greg N.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen, set me freeFrom my miseryI can't take it no morePlate of sashimiMakes me so happyYour food I lovingly adoreWith twelve kindsIt's divineI won't share, this sashimi plate is mine!And now I'm back Sushi-GenI miss you, want you, need you soAnd now I'm back Sushi-GenThere's a feeling inside I want you to knowYou're number one, and I can't let you go...Tempura so rightBatter crisp and lightA good match with the fresh raw fishGreen tea first harvest Miso soup is bestSunomono fills my five-taste wishHere I amWith my peepsPsyched to eat your awesome food so cheapAnd now I'm back Sushi-GenI miss you, want you, need you soAnd now I'm back Sushi-GenThere's a feeling inside I want you to knowYou're number one, and I can't let you go...

Reviews.Author: Cesar R.
Reviews.Content: What's better than bacon for breakfast?If you answered anything other than MORE BACON....I'm sorry but you're wrong.What's the next best thing?SUSHI!Yup, a little raw fish for breakfast/brunch was EXACTLY what I was in the mood for.  I also wanted to prove to Dani S. that I could have a meal without pork.....so there's that too...SASHIMI BREAKFAST SPECIAL ($15)Yeah, yeah it's technically a lunch special....but I was here at 10:45am and was eating just past 11am...so I'm calling it breakfast!The meal starts innocently enough with these cute mini versions of sunomono "salad" yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk… as well as miso soup yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk… ....oh, and 3 cubes of what I can only refer to as nature's cruelest mistake......no, not turkey bacon...TOFU! yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk… I think I ate a cube just for laughs then stabbed the other 2 with my chopsticks and used those atrocious, tasteless lumps as chopstick holders. Anywho...fu*k tofu.Now...on to the fish! yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk… It looked so beautiful....I didn't know where to start....I had a little bit of everything all at once and savored every bite.  There is a small piece of grilled salmon which seemed out of place...also some shredded crab, spicy tuna tartare, toro tartare, hamachi, white fish, halibut, squid, and tons of tasty tuna!  It all tasted exceptionally fresh and there's practically no need for soy sauce or wasabi....if that wasn't enough you also get a bowl of steamed rice to finish filling you up.  I was positively stuffed and it was WELL worth the measly $15!I leave you with the timeless words of that illustrious wordsmith and world renowned sushi connoisseur....Ol' Dirty Bastard....youtube.com/watch?v=MjyB…Oooh baby I like it rawYeah baby I like it rawww

Reviews.Author: Raphael F.
Reviews.Content: Along w/ Sasabune, Sushi Zo, and Urasawa, I think this is the best sushi bar in LA. Well worth the drive to downtown. Nearly Tokyo-level quality.Gen has the best UNI in town. yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…Great toro, too. yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…The red snapper with lime and salt is among my favorites there. Their yellow tail belly is a can't miss. Ask for the SIA roll (pronounced see-uh). yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…It's a secret concoction named after one of the sushi chefs, which only a handful of regulars know about. If your sushi chef doesn't know about it, ask him to ask his coworkers. They will be impressed. It's a hand roll consisting of spicy tuna, uni, ikura, toro, and several other "secret ingredients" that really differentiate the roll. The Sia Roll comes together in a perfect soft, spicy, savory, salty collection of bites.God bless you Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Eli G.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre, boring, safe, over rated, middle of the road, overpriced, lackluster, and so average it hurts. These are some words I would use to describe Sushi Gen.Don't get me wrong, nothing was that bad, but nothing was "WOW" good. And since the bill was so high, I left feeling cheated. The atmosphere reminded me of Sushi Sasabune, trendy, factory like, and lacking a soul. To start, the ankimo was not very dense or creamy, and the portion size was the smallest of any sushi place I've been to;yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…To make matters worse, they didn't carry half the sushi we requested. The chef would always reply to us, "Try some tuna or salmon!" NO! I want good fish! I won't go into detail of every piece I ate (see business pics for that) but not a single piece was great, just okay. I guess since Gen is downtown, people will continue to flock here, not knowing that they need to drive 20 miles south to get truly great sushi. Oh well, that leaves more for me.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Z.
Reviews.Content: Pros: Amazingly fresh fish,Really friendly serviceNice looking platesUni is really freshAmazing large chunks of TunaGood PriceCons: Long LinesSmall place I think Sushi Gen is one of the best places I've ever had for sushi. We ordered the Sashimi Combo, and it was amazing. The combo came with Tuna Tartare, Spice Tuna Tartare, and all different types of fish that I don't really know. I know there was mackrel and bass or something. We also ordered uni sushi and the color of the Uni was great yellow hue as it's suppose to be, and the amazing part of it was how great the sushi was wrapped perfectly. We also got a fried calamari, which tasted really good due to the freshness of the squid. I would come back to this place in a heartbeat, and recommend it to anyone , even those that don't like sushi.

Reviews.Author: Maggie C.
Reviews.Content: Where do you for cheap sashimi lunch?  Sushi Gen!!The wait is always annoying but it wasn't too bad last time.  Park on the plaza and you pay $1.50 with validation.  "Can I have sashimi with tempura lunch?"The lady looked confused.  I pointed at the menu.  She said "that's tempura with sashimi lunch"  "Same thing"I asked for ice water and my water has no ice.  "Can I have ice with my water?"  She took my glass and gave me the same glass few minutes later.  "Excuse me...can I have ice with my water?"  "There was ice before and you wanted me to change it to water"*^$^&%$$)*I had a witness.  My friend saw my glass with ice.  The lady got  mad and got me ice with water this time (90-10 ice to water ratio).  She started slamming the dishes to the table.Sashimi lunch was better than sashimi tempura lunch.  Tempura wasn't bad though.  Nice batter but I could tell the shrimps were frozen and tasteless.  Yummy sweet potato.  Dunno about the zucchini.  My friend ate it.Overall it's a cheap lunch so I can't  really complain.  Yes I can...the lady was rude!!2 stars!!  Sushi Gen is almost yummylicious!!

Reviews.Author: Libby R.
Reviews.Content: So apparently, God lives in Little Tokyo.I know what you are thinking..."What the hell are you talking about Libby R.?  If God does, in fact, exist, he must live somewhere more grand and more snazzy than a little, unpretentious sushi bar in Downtown LA."Well, you'd be wrong.Because last Tuesday, at about 5:30pm, when I rolled into Honda Plaza and parked at the lot for a measly $2.50 I met the big guy and his newest apostle - my sushi chef Masa.My pilgrimage was started with my girl Amanda L.  After returning from her own enlightenment last week, she loudly proclaimed, "Libby, I found a new sushi place and, I'm telling you, it will change your life."And man, was she right.Amanda and I walked in without having to wait the normal 20 minutes to be seated at the bar with my homeboy Masa.  We asked about the chef's choice and how much it would set us back.  Masa let us know it was up to us as we'd let him know when to stop.  My first bite was the salmon.  Salty, meaty and fresh as the breeze from a top Mt. Sineai...and, good Lord, I saw the light.I can't say for sure how many pieces of sushi Amanda and I shared....after all religious experiences are hard to define.  What I can tell you is that I walked away, soul touched and tummy full for $60 bucks (my half including tip).  Now I realize my testimony may not be enough to convert you.  That you may be a nonbeliever in this intangible experience that is hard to describe. But like all elements of faith, all I can do is follow my own pathAnd my path is going bring me back to Sushi-Gen for another experience of enlightenment.  Amen.

Reviews.Author: Rose V.
Reviews.Content: We came for lunch today and upon arrival, we noticed a large amount of people waiting oustide. Doh! It was about a 45min wait. But once we were seated, our order was taken fairly quickly and our food arrived just as quick. Waitress was very nice. Sashimi Lunch for $15, you can't beat that! And it's presented so beautifully as well. I only wish we knew what was what. Surprisingly, no salmon sashimi included. I ordered the salmon teriyaki & sashimi combo (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) and pretty much cleared my plate. Then again, I love all things salmon..It's a fairly small place and it being so popular, do expect a wait or come as early as possible.

Reviews.Author: Nick H.
Reviews.Content: Dearest Sushi Gen:Sometimes I eat sushiNow and again..Today I had it...At sushi Gen.Tempura was good, But not the best..3.5 Stars..And now the rest...Sashimi was ok, But one piece was chewy.I chewed and chewed..Aww fooey.The price is right on. It's  kinda cheap..Good luck, however..Finding a seat.If it's a long waitThat you're looking for..You  chose the right place..There are seats outside the door.I would come back here, After awhile..I actually left with..A 3.8 Star smile..Parking is a buck fifty with validation. Lunch is priced right!

Reviews.Author: Yuko G.
Reviews.Content: What a let down. 402 reviews and 4.5 stars for this place? Way over hyped.  Came here last night and was surprised to see so many people standing outside waiting for their tables. You may think that's a good sign, but in my head, there was a loud "warning" siren blasting off. In my LA Sushi experiences, the "crowded" "popular" places never turned out to be decent. It's always the one that's small, hidden, not so crowded that offers great Sushi.And my initial thought was confirmed right away. Sushi riceWay too warm. The contrast between warm rice and cold fish was much greater than what could possibly be a harmonized fusion. It was especially bad with extra cold Uni on top. Also, the rice wasn't squeezed firmly enough, so it was quite a challenge to not make rice fall apart when I picked it up.Selections/Line-upsIt was just like any other mediocre LA Sushi joints. Meaning, very "standard" and nothing special. Several of my requests were turned down with "oh we don't have that" and I was very sad. It wasn't like I asked for something so unique and so unusual. In fact, any of those would have been offered at several of the good Sushi joints in South Bay. The chef didn't even talk about what they had that's in season or what they had that's the freshest of the day.  All he kept recommending was salmon, tuna, albacore, giant clam, halibut... you know, the "usual." Oh god, can you be more boring than that?For a moment they made me happy when they said they had sardines, but it instantly became a disappointment as their sardine was vinegared. And it wasn't the good vinegared version, but it was "the fish got old so I tossed it in vinegar for a while" version. No delicate nice flavoring what so ever.GarnishGarnish is one of the important contribution to the Sushi. You can't just put Wasabi, ginger, Momiji Oroshi (grated Daikon and red pepper), or green onion on top of the fish and be done with it. The combination as well as amount has to be right for it to be good. Their garnishing was nothing but sloppy and not only it didn't help their sushi tastes better, but in fact, it made it worse. For example, we had oysters on the shells. Each oyster was quite small, which was fine as the size and flavor differ depending on where it was produced.  What was appalling to me was that they came with ton of Momiji Oroshi and chopped green onions on top. Oysters, especially smaller oysters, are known for their very creamy flavor and soft texture. Ton of Momiji Oroshi first killed off the flavor of nice mild creamy flavor, then the rough and hard stems of green onions just completely killed the beauty of the soft and smooth oyster texture. If the chef really cared about each ingredient's character and quality, he would have never chosen to put ton of Momiji Oroshi and chopped green onions. Chives would have gone much better as they are smaller and got less texture than green onions. Shame.At this point, I was pretty disappointed with what they had to offer, and the bill made it even worse. Long wait, ok service, boring selections, and poor cooking for the steep price.No thank you, really.

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: A sushi restaurant that lives up to its hype. Unforgettable otoro + expert fish-cutting skills. For the best experience, sit at the sushi bar (even if you have to wait 60-90 minutes). The bar is very cramped but worth it.In a sushi restaurant, I look for two things: Expert fish cutting by Sushi Jedi Masters and sourcing. Sushi Gen fared well in both. As contrary as it may sound, it's not about freshness (fish can be aged) but about sourcing. In every industry, there is a pecking order - unless you have connections, the "new guy" isn't necessarily going to get the best stuff. Sushi Gen commands high-quality fish.I had a few pieces with overly warm rice but I overlooked it. Additionally, the service is VERY unsatisfactory but I blame this on management - the restaurant is just too busy. If you order fancy smancy sashimi plates (dining tables), chef assistants make your order as opposed to a Sushi Jedi Master so sit at the SUSHI BAR!MY HIT LIST (18 nigiri pieces and 4 maki pieces):Sapporo (large, bottled)Sayuri nigori sake Otoro (3 pieces): Sublime (look at the pic); at $8/piece, savor it slowlyAmaebi (1): Standard (but delicious) sweet shrimpHamachi belly (1): Creamy, intense fatty flavorTako (2): Octopus was okay; small and a bit dryTai (2): The red snapper was beautiful with a tangy accompanimentAnkimo (2, nigiri-style): It was a bit dry but flavor was intenseKohada (2): Salty goodness (it's a 4-inch gizzard shad)Shiro maguro (4, not orders, maki-style): Buttery and flavorfulTamago (2): Simple but excellentAnago (2): The "dessert"; perfect, happy endingTo finish your palate, complete your sushi dinner with tamago, anago or unagi...or all three ;)May the Spanish Bluefin toro would be you. Cheers.

Reviews.Author: Caroline Y.
Reviews.Content: I gotta hand it to them...they have awesome sushi. Fresh, party in your mouth sushi. Uni, halibut, octopus, toro, mirugai, yellowtail, kanpachi were all delicious. 5 stars for the sushi only. The salmon skin salad and fried chicken were pretty good. The tempura and oyster shooters were mediocre. The service was pretty slow.This place needs to work on giving a better estimated wait time. I actually called to make reservations and the employee told me he didn't have anything available until 9pm but to come in and just get on the waiting list because it wasn't going to be very busy. So naive little Caroline did. I get there and the host tells me it's going to be about 30 to 40 minutes. Not bad I thought...that is...until it really wasn't 30 to 40 minutes. It was an hour and a half~!! Argh. Hungry and cranky. And it was my birthday. :( No one apologized for the long wait nor did they thank us for waiting so long. I think the problem was that the employees were seating their "regular" customers before the actual people on the waiting list. Uh huh. The sushi was good but not an hour and thirty minutes wait good. Maybe the secret is to become a "regular." Not. Oh and remember...I HATE waiting. Hate it.

Reviews.Author: Sean D.
Reviews.Content: Another reviewer says, "Don't tell anyone about this place". Well. Considering that the line at lunch is about an hour or so of wait time, you get the sense that that piece of advice may no longer be pertinent.I lived across the street from this spot for 4 years. So you can say that I had my fair share of Sushi-Gen (pronounced with a Hard G) experiences. Let me give you the rundown.1) Sushi: SOME of their fish is fresh. Not Tsukiji market fresh, but ok. Some things that are not so amazingly fresh also happen to cost a bloody fortune here like UNI (sea urchin) and O-TORO, CHU-TORO, (Tuna). I have even had salmon here that was lackluster and a little fishy. It was honestly better at Nijiya. It's funny, because when the chefs serve it up to you, they have this little guilty look in their eyes that sort of says, "it's not my fault, the owner makes us", and that's probably true, while not an excuse.As you sit and order, you will notice most of the customers asking for "Spicy Tuna Handrolls", "Spider Rolls", and the like. And if you know what kind of sushi chefs rejoice in drowning their fish in mayo, siracha, etc. - you know where you're eating. 2) Why so busy? A long time ago, I heard that this place was run Japanese-style and built a great rep, excellent service and the chefs made the call on the fish. Reputations - good or bad - can last a lifetime. This one floats on it.No longer Japanese style, but perhaps owned by one - this is kind of like a Dim Sum experience without the cart ladies and MSG. It's a buffet line of pushy/shoving people, and mostly frequented by Taiwanese, Koreans and "in the know" Gai Jin that are ignorant enough to consider this good. Japanese stay away for the most part as the service is often sub par - meaning that the whole etiquette, and beauty of the Japanese dining experience doesn't really exist here. And of course price is relatively high unless you get one of their cheapy special lunches which many people line up for 1 hour to munch on. God knows why when they could get this from Hisa-san at Toranoko for about 15 bucks: danconiacreative.com/201…First time I came here, I made the error of ordering 4-5 pieces of sushi. When the bill came, I couldn't believe it - 25 bucks! Wow. I mean, that's not too cheap for a little snack at lunch. Then the waitress came back with my credit card receipt...um...75.00, not 25!!! I could not believe it. So yah. Order the specials if you must go here at lunch.On rare occasion, some poor fool friend of mine who heard from his buds that this was somehow "authentic" (whatever that means), and we had to go. They all learned their lesson. And then once or twice, I convinced myself that I must of just had a bad experience here 6 times, and should try once more. On the last attempt, after dropping 200 on enough food to feed my goldfish, we went to Mako sushi just to have a better memory of the evening.Bottom line is that this place runs on hype/steam mostly from people who are used to Korean-owned fake Japanese restaurants, or faux-Japanese like Kagaya. They come here and taste something pretty close to what sushi should be. But then, it's a miserable fail in comparison with Mako just up the street. But then at Mako, you need to invest a few trips until he knows and love you. All in all, if you want a one stop wonder - try Kimagure in Pasadena. Likely the best overall newbie Sushi experience in North America.

Reviews.Author: Danielle F.
Reviews.Content: I wish the sushi chefs here were friendlier because the food here is so fresh and tasty. The salmon melts in your mouth and the sashimi is sliced thick just how I like it.But I'm telling you, these sushi chefs were a real buzz kill. They refused to smile and would bark at you if asked them what they would recommend. It was really uncomfortable. I'm used to chefs that say hello and give a shit about your dining experience. They actually want to show off their fish and drink beer with you. Now that's my kind of place. I suggest you sit a table where you can order a more variety of food and your experience won't be tainted by the grouches behind the bar. You can't dispute that the food is excellent here. It's just not cosy and welcoming. Hence, no 5 stars for you Sushi Gen. The way you treat your customers is equally important as the food you give them.

Reviews.Author: Jenny B.
Reviews.Content: We finally came here after months of postponement due to my snowboarding season. Virginia, Shauna and me opted to seat at Sushi bar because that's how Omakase supposed to be. Just as Shauna's review, I was prepared to spend about $85 tops for this Omakase, but I guess we're heavy eaters, the fishes here were great, pretty fresh and generous portion. We were lucky that we only needed to wait for 20minutes before we got seated at the bar. Every order of sushi came in 2 pieces.
