It was smooth as a stripper's rump, but like a lap dance this sushi restaurant is a little pricey for my small salary. I should probably stop writing because I'm starting to crave their products. Oh well I suppose this restaurant is to cherish rather to than to visit often, got to reserve my desire for those special days. Anyways, enough of my lament. I say come ye come all with fat wallets. This is J-town's reigning sushi house, the biggest shogun in the neigborhood.  Hmmm, now if this place had samurai fighting ninjas?  Or a yakuza bath house? Too much kudos to count.

Reviews.Author: Emily T.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi is always FRESH and the place is an actual authentic Japanese sushi restaurant. This place is the best in Little Tokyo if you are not into americanized sushi rolls. In fact, I don't think this place has rolls here. Anyways my advice is: Eat sashimi here! The menu is pretty short in variety compared to its neighbors, like Tenno Sushi, but the place is absolutely delicious and the focus is on their fish. This is a real sushi joint and you can tell from the menu and its selection. The only bad thing is that lots of people love this place so this places tends to have a line before it opens for lunch or during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Nhung T.
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why so many people raved about this place and why there was such a long line, it was not like the price was cheap or something. Funny story to this restaurant, we had reservation at 6:00pm and the host mentioned that we can not be 1 minute late. Being that there was a road block near our hotel and taxi took forever, we literally jogged to the restaurant. Worst ever!! Upon arrival, we still had to wait at least 30 minutes, bs!!!We ordered the sashimi combination and uni on the side. The sashmi was fresh, but not excellent quality.  We ordred this grilled clams and it was so nasty!!! Just say I don't even recall anything amazing about this place.  Afterward, we was stil hungry!!

Reviews.Author: Dtl A.
Reviews.Content: Every other 5-star review is not an exaggeration.  Therefore, I won't write a lengthy redundant review of my own.  I will just say that Sushi Gen's sushi is fresh and delicious.  I could come here everyday of my life.  A couple of tips.  Lunch prices are great but the wait is not that fun.  If you can, come at 11:30.  I always came right at 1 for several lunches and ended up waiting 20-30 minutes :(  It is worth the wait though!  Parking can be annoying as well because they only have one exit so drive slowly or look for street parking.

Reviews.Author: Dave L.
Reviews.Content: At 10:30AM there's already a line 20 deep.  20 deep!  I asked the guy in the front what time he got there and he said 10:00AM.  Like seriously?  Well, I LOVE sushi Gen.  It's one of my absolute all time favorite sushi places and to have an amazing Sushi or Sashimi lunch for $15 is worth that long wait.  If you're here for dinner, try the Omakase.  You'd love it.  It is a little pricy (approx. $70 per person)  for the 10 course meal but it's good enough to make you come back again and again.

Reviews.Author: Allen M.
Reviews.Content: I know this place is supposed to have long wait times but luckily the four of us waited only 15min to be seated. After experiencing the food I'm glad we didn't have to wait because I would've been much more upset than I already am.I picked this restaurant based on the many great yelp reviews and I'm not sure what the rave is all about. All four of us walked out disappointed... We drove to a close-by restaurant to have deserts and get the fishy taste out of our mouths. We ordered Tuna, Albacore, Amber-jack, Jack Mackerel, Spanish Mackerel, Yellow-tail belly, halibut, unagi, and a couple of rolls as well as oyster shooters (disgusting). The only half decent sushi's were the albacore and the amber jack... the rest was BAD!     I'm never going back. Food: 3/10Service: 6/10

Reviews.Author: Allen F.
Reviews.Content: 7:52 pm - almost at Sushi Gen. Took about 45 mins from Santa Monica. Not bad for a Thursday right? Passed the plaza on my first pass via Alameda. Entrance is on 2nd. $3 for parking ain't bad given there are currently no free metered options on the street. 7:59 pm - gotta wait for a table... and we didn't wait very long. Place is kinda packed with old and young folks. Sushi Gen's got a lot of hype coming in from all directions. I've given it 5 stars for now based on the hype alone. 8:01 pm - waitress came with moist towels. 2 large Sapporos please! I'm here tonight with Cousins Reno and Josey - always fine dinner companions and they've already commented on whether I'll be buried in my phone all night. 8:05 pm - going the a la carte route. All sashimi with a side of rice.  i've just learned from Reno that omakase is only available at the sushi bar.8:08 pm - took a quick potty break. I've never seen so many flowers and plants in a men's room before.8:17 pm - soup's here! Nice bowls (they've got lids on them). 8:22 pm - time for squid tempura! Looks nice and crispy. Very tasty.  Not too much batter, but squid is one of those food items where you can't bite it off.  So you just gotta pop those suckers in.8:25 pm - fried sweet shrimp heads! Lost an eyeball, but damn good (miss the ponzu sauce on these things though).8:27 pm - food is coming fast and furious now. Might have to do a cumulative review afterwards.8:31 pm - one of the best sweet shrimp sushi ever.  some sweet shrimp I've had in the past had a lingering aftertaste... this one was aftertaste-free8:32 pm - the monkfish liver tastes mostly like the nori wrap.8:44 pm - had to stop eating and mention the salmon. I don't usually like salmon but this salmon sashimi is BOMB!  a bit saltier than most off the bat.9:04 pm - Sooo full. Really thick pieces of sashimi.  Salmon was delicious. Toro and octopus were yummy. Yellowtail belly, and yellowtail were ok.  We also had mackerel, but I'm not a fan so I can't really judge.9:16 pm - ordering a la carte, pretty much 100% sashimi set us back about $215 for the three of us, not including tip.  not bad for quality sashimi.9:24 pm - don't forget to validate! Otherwise it's more than $3 on exit.

Reviews.Author: Ann C.
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, get reservations!!  And, just swallow the parking because it could take forever to find something.This is a delightful experience in sushi with friends.  We ordered both on and off the menu.  The ultimate sashimi platter is a great deal at $35, considering that it can serve up to four people.  The prices were decent, the people were friendly, the fish was fresh, and they had a reasonable corkage fee.For four, during a Friday night dinner, we splurged a mere $200 (with tax and tip).

Reviews.Author: Angelie D.
Reviews.Content: Why is this place at almost 900 reviews and averages 4 1/2 stars!?!?!?!? It's that GOOD! Tucked away in the midst of Downtown LA right in Little Tokyo, Sushi Gen is more like a GEM! While we were waiting to be seated a saw there was a NO Cell Phone sign. I must admit, it was a first and I didn't quite understand the meaning of it. I took a look at the bar and saw many business men eating, thinking this must be difficult for people like them. Anyways, we were seated right at the bar where all the excitement is! This is a LEGIT Japanese establishment. They serve straight nigiri and several rolls that are very traditional. No fancy shmancy rolls names after the chefs, just fresh fish and wonderful appetizers. The sushi chefs were amazing nice and funny! There is a minimum of 4 orders per person so be aware of that. I'm thinking that is why it becomes very pricey. Yellow Tail - Yes it's been a while since I've tasted fresh yellow tail. Scallop - juicy and mild tasting Spicy Tuna Roll - surprisingly good since this is something I do not order quite oftenUnagi - can't beat the flavorful taste of fresh eel Snapper - tender and meaty Salmon Skin Roll - small but sufficient Salmon Collar - they pretty much gave us an entire piece of salmon.. I for one did not complain :) Japanese Mackerel - one of the faves. Not salty at all! This place works hard to keep the tradition alive and I'm glad I've experienced it.. FINALLY! Now I know why this place averages 4 1/2 stars.. can't beat it... no way!

Reviews.Author: Francine L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a very popular spot for lunch and this place closes it's doors at 2:00P.M and then reopens a little bit later. So if you are coming to this spot you better arrive early to wait for a line. I wasn't that shocked about how many people were here at lunch. This place has some good sushi. :)I ordered a sushi plus salmon skin salad. The salad was pretty healthy I would consider it having lots of dark greens and purples. Which is always lovely! The sushi was a lot !! I didn't finish all of mine due to the fact that I was already pretty full from the salad.My friends really enjoyed the sashimi plate and I think this is going to be our new lunch date ! Woohoo I'm glad I came and tried this place out. I been meaning to and after Cesar R has been raving about how good it was..I decided to finally try this place out! You really can't go wrong with a place that gives you fresh sushi, faster service! They are doing something right and I hope many more people check it out!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: I am so use to going to a sushi restaurant and all the chefs and servers are Korean. Its actually quite refreshing to visit a sushi restaurant where it feels authentic , Japanese food made by Japanese people.. ( not trying to offend any Korean people, i personally believe my mommy makes the worlds best Sushi ever and shes Taiwanese ! ) anywhoot- I called in to make a reservation for 2 to celebrate my best friends bday. When we arrived it was packed with people, so it was a good thing i made that reservation! My Best friend ordered the sashimi dinner and that plate comes with so many things he was overwhelmed with what was on his side of the table. He had a cup of miso soup, some noodle thingy, sauce, rice for the sashimi plate and some fried tempura. He said everything melts in his mouth literally and was full at the end of the meal, surprisingly, as it was sushi!! I, the vegetarian- not to down play my side of the table, i had ordered vegetable roll and avocado roll ( a requirement to order at least 2 items if you just want simple rolls) . I wasn't sure what it was that made my rolls taste so good, something in it was extremely soft and yummy..even for a simple roll like the avocado roll. o we also ordered Red Wine, they only had one choice for red wine, thankfully it was tasty and a creeper. At the end of the night they brought out a green tea ice cream to wish my best friend a happy birthday! Glad they remembered it! Even though the options are low for vegetarians ..i was happy my best friend enjoyed his dinner which is why i am a Fan! =)

Reviews.Author: Sue Z.
Reviews.Content: I blame Ben G. If you read some of my first reviews on yelp, this name comes up ALOT. "Spent the whole day shopping at an Italian specialty stores, trying out truffle oil".all ben's fault. "omg...wally's tent sale... so amazing, free tastings -- wine for breakfast". ben's fault. And if i'm not mistooken, I'm sure more then a few yelpers have mentioned this mr. connoisseur of all things lavish in their reviews. So when we went on an adventure for sushi (after a whole morning and afternoon of wine, truffle oil, fatty meats, breads and cheeses). figure, it's slightly healthier right? So far-- the best sushi place I've gone to is Sushi ZO (located in culver city). It had a fusion of french food in it's flavor, which I enjoyed. After this was Sakura, located on Centinela, where their huge hunks of salmon always keep me coming back. I have to be honest. When they sat us in front of Kazu-san, at the sushi bar, I was not remotely hungry. We had omakase, and I'm still dreaming about the meal. The toro was, a tour de force. Something so fatty and succulent, it enraptured my taste buds, while slowly enveloping in my mouth. It melted slowly, while the perfectly cooked rice (still warm), fell apart in my mouth. and THAT was the first order. I had seawater and freshwater eel, side by side. Never had I gone to a sushi bar, where the chef made this distinction nor, took the time to describe it. I personally like the freshwater eel better, though I would have happily, swallowed up the whole ocean to get more of those eel goodies. There was albacore with added zest and a hint of mint, which shook my senses. (I usually dislike any hint of mint like substance next to my sushi, but this worked). I apologize I don't know the exact name of the japanese herb, but hey- i'm sure Ben knows!We had Uni, unlike any other uni ever. The orange goodness was literally overflowing from the crisp seaweed (excellent seaweed!!), and I think I was actually drooling WHILE I was eating. we didn't talk much. there was just a lot of mmmmm, and oooohhhh, and whhhhhaaaaa. The fried shrimp heads were DELICIOUS! not too oily, or heavy, and it came with also shrimp heads in soup. Be careful, those little suckers will stick in your teeth all night! The bill came out to be about 98 a person. We had 9-10 orders (can't remember, food coma-ing at the time), and I walked out, knowing that I will never go back to anything less. Kazu-san, thank you so much for taking care of us. We weren't hungry, but you somehow made us into hungry hungry hippos with your magic. Will I be coming back soon? ppshhh. yeah! Note: come before 6 pm, to beat the traffic and wait. If you do come after, please don't BITCH and COMPLAIN and give the poor host an attitude. Really grinds my gears. (for all your family guy lovers). We love you ben! but we still blame you for our waistline...
Reviews.Author_Location: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Arden C.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here more times than I can count. I've only been disappointed once but everyone has an off day. Overall the quality of fish is very fresh. The only thing I don't like here is the sashimi combo because it's just alot of tuna. So I normally order sashimi or sushi by the piece or the sushi deluxe combination.But I'd recommend the Okonomi Sushi your choice sushi or Okonomi Sashimi your choice sashimi. Even though Sushi-Gen is super popular to be honest I'm not that impressed by it. Don't get me wrong, it's good and I still eat here often it just doesn't "wow me". I still think Asanebo is way better, even though it's not as popular. It might be because I feel like Sushi-Gen is a tad bit overrated. There's always a long wait here as well. If you're visiting LA and you want to try a popular sushi spot, this is definitely one of the places to go to but I'd still recommend Asanebo.

Reviews.Author: Seung Eun C.
Reviews.Content: Saturday night.  Opens at 5:00.We arrive at 5:10.No crowds outside.  YAY!  It's empty..We run in.It's packed.  The sushi bar is 100% full.WTH?So we wait. Patiently.  Finally about an hour later, our party of 4 gets seated.Dad's birthday and we ate our to our stomach's content.Uni, Otoro, Hamachi, Awabi, Mirugai, Saba, Amaebi, and everything else was FRESH FRESH FRESH. Sushi only had ittybitty pieces of rice =)Toyo-san was wonderful & cheerful.Hands down our #1 Sushi Bar in LA.Nothing else compares!

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: If you want some of the best sushi in LA I highly recommend sushi-gen! Parking: Plenty of spots within the plaza and also street parking if needed.Service: Excellent service from all of the staff.Food: Insanely freaking delicious! The sashimi just melts in your mouth and the rolls are also delicous. Price: Sushi-gen is pricey, but is worth every penny. *I highly suggest you arrive 30 minutes prior to them opening if you don't want to wait in line. The first time I ate here I came 20 minutes before the dinner opening and there was already plenty of people waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Yulree C.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait, b/c there is always a line here; lunch or dinner, weekday or weekend.Parking can also be a pain. I suggest parking at the JVP parking structure across the street.One of my favorite restaurants in Little Tokyo.They have fresh quality fish. And it's consistent! Always fresh.They serve traditional Japanese food, which are all fresh, mostly healthy, and light. Pretty good value as well.If you sit at the sushi bar, you can only order sushi/sashimi, unless you are VIP (I've seen people order hot food! I wish I knew how to be VIP; I'm trying to become friends with the sushi chefs there :D). The staff is courteous, never had a problem with them.

Reviews.Author: Ashley L.
Reviews.Content: Came on a Saturday approx half an hour before opening time. There was already a line forming! Glad we got there early, by the time they opened the line was huge. Staff is very friendly. Try the Sashimi Deluxe platter. Its huge and a great value. I've shared this and a side of rice with another person and it has been more than enough.Sashimi Deluxe: yelp.com/user_local_phot…. Toro- So fatty, melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness. Hands down, favorite.Yellowtail belly- Delicious, not as fatty as toroAlbacore- Soft and very butterySpicy Tuna- Very good hereClosed on Sundays. There is always a wait, and the wait is always WORTH IT!

Reviews.Author: Elaine Y.
Reviews.Content: Wow this place already has 600+ reviews, so I guess I won't be telling you anything new.I got a recommendation to check out Sushi Gen as an authentic sushi joint.  I took my mom to eat here.  She grew up in Japan so I trust her opinion on how authentic/good a Japanese place is. We went on a Monday around 11:30 am and the wait was going to be 1 hour.  I say, put your name down and walk down Alameda to the shopping mall.  Since you will probably always be waiting to go in, definitely park in their lot because they will validate parking so the parking will be minimal (much better than the meters).We later found out that we could have been seated earlier if we wanted the bar.  We ended up sitting at the bar where there's a 4 sushi pieces minimum and no lunch specials are served there as well (which seemed popular).I thought the sushi was good and fresh.  My mom thought it was amaaaazzzing.  I absolutely fell in love with our sushi chef.  An old Japanese man with a ton of personality and knew what he was doing.The host was not so nice and the other servers seemed frazzled.Next time I go, I will definitely order the scallop sashimi.  I saw someone order it, and they are litterally cutting it out of the shell in front of you- amazing!

Reviews.Author: Jerry L.
Reviews.Content: Lunchtime starts at 11:15am, not 11:00am.There was a healthy line forming before the doors opened.  I believe there were 20 people in line ahead of us.  Seating for 2 would be a 30 min wait, so we opt for a couple of seats at the sushi bar.  There is a 4 order minimum per person at the sushi bar, which was no problem for us.The orders:Yellowtail - large slabs of creamy hamachi - YUM!Scallops - drizzled with lemon and some special spicesTuna - pretty good grade with just the right amount of fat contentMurugai - pretty fresh and right amount of crunchI had not been here since the 80s, when my older sis would introduce me to new sushi spots periodically.  I remember this place being really good, and this brought back some good memories.Best sushi I've had this year, and I've had plenty of sushi.

Reviews.Author: Jacq L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen has been on my bookmark list for aloong time.  I finally got to go as an early birthday dinner for me and going away dinner for a friend.I got the sashimi dinner.  The food was tasty and great quality, but I didn't expect there to be so much of the same thing.  Also there was some cooked items, that I wasn't sure what I was eating.Overall, the food was tasty, but I was expecting more.

Reviews.Author: Valerie G.
Reviews.Content: Very tasty and fresh fish (4 stars, but...) A good place to go if you want to impress your date with how little you care about the cost of love. Perhaps this is just a poor grad student gripe, but I would like to know how much I am paying for my food before I get the bill. The dearth of prices on the menu makes this impossible. Nevertheless, there seemed to be many authentic Japanese dishes not available at the typical California sushi restaurant. I especially enjoyed the cucumber and pickled plum in addition to the scallop sashimi. We also had some nice salmon sashimi, although for the price there is definitely better. The service was also very good, except that the host insisted on seating my date while I was in the bathroom after being told it would be a fifteen minute wait. Just a little awkward when you're looking around the restaurant like a fool hoping she didn't change her mind.

Reviews.Author: Dani S.
Reviews.Content: I had the fortune of coming here for business lunch twice in the past 2 months and let's just say I was glad I didn't have to pay the bill. Our bill came out to be about $50/each. I must have tried 10 different type of sushi and the best one was the Toro sushi. Everything else was great also. I give this place 5 stars for freshness, texture, presentation, quantity, and service. I'll be back soon, even if I have to pay for it with my own dime (or in this case a one-hundy bill).

Reviews.Author: Sam V.
Reviews.Content: Over a thousand reviews now.  Well,  I still want to throw my hat in the ring. Five stars from me.  I'm having a stay-cation this summer and I want to eat here every day.  The lunch special is fantastic.  Get the sashimi plate. I have noticed there is some variety in the types of fish that come with the sashimi lunch but they're all good. Park in their lot $3.00 with validation or park on the street  $2.00 with your credit card in the meter. Plan to arrive at 10:45 to que up for food.  Yes there's a line.  Yes, it's of value to be in the first seating.  Food comes fast. Service is not attentive, I hate sitting with an empty water glass but when they're busy, they're busy.I've had the sushi delux, the Chirashi and the sashimi lunches and I must say Sashimi is my Fav.  The tuna is so fresh and crispy it sings in my mouth.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth H.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for the lunch special. For $15 their sashimi combo is an absolute steal and will leave you full and satisfied. It's cheaper and much bigger than Sugarfish. It's a win win. There is a miso soup and bowl of rice served on the side.   I am not a fan of regular tuna (the red kind) but the medium fatty toro which comes with the lunch special is delicious and makes wish all tuna could be this great.  If they can serve this much toro for only $15 dollars everywhere else is just a rip off.I've come right when they open and there is already a line to get in. Coming at a later time doesn't help and there is still a line. Parking is $3 with validation at their lot but it's cheaper than the street parking around here

Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite lunch place in Little Tokyo.  They have really good sushi/sashimi lunch combinations at reasonable prices.  The fish is always fresh and the daily crowds that gather there are always hungry, so expect a wait.  I always order the sashimi lunch.  The meal starts with a tiny plate of tsukemono (pickled cabbage), some silken meat-stewed tofu, and a miso soup.  Then you get your plate of tuna-FIVE different ways, Hamachi, Halibut, crab(mixed with imitation crab), grilled salmon, seaweed, and octopus.  Your plate does vary slightly from day to day depending on the availability so don't be distressed if it does. Personally, I believe there's way too much tuna on the plate.  I would much prefer a variety of different fish but tuna is popular and Gen's tuna is the best. They are super generous with their portions.  I'm usually hungry after a sashimi lunch but I'm STUFFED after eating it at Gen.  I find myself trying to give away my fish away!  What a value at $15 bucks!  If you don't like sashimi try any of their other lunches.  You won't be disappointed. Their bar is pretty darn good too but it can add up to a pretty penny.   For a while this used to be my favorite sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Violet K.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi I've ever had in my life.  Need I say more?I've had the pleasure of going with my friends who never let me pay, so I don't know how much the bill comes out to but I hear it's berry berry expensive!  We even drank a $250/bottle of sake, 2 of them!Always sat at the bar, even with a group of 6.  They don't take reservations but for my one particular friend they do, since he's been a regular from they beginning.  So I've never waited nor have I paid. But aside from that seriously the best sushi I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Shelly T.
Reviews.Content: My friend found Sushi-Gen on Yelp and wanted to give it a try, and wow, was it delish!When we got there, people were waiting outside and I thought "oh crap, it's going to be a long wait"... however, we got lucky and got a seat at the bar within 10 mins!  Woo!  Score.  Turns out sitting at the bar was probably one of the best things we could've done.We ended up seated next to this really nice couple - Shanna and Ted - and they just happened to be regulars!  So they really helped us out, as we had no idea what to order.  Three things they recommended  & were yummy (and I have no idea if I'm spelling these correctly):  "Thai" (japanese snapper) - SOOOOO Goooooood.  White fish on top of rice, but they put this sauce that's lemmony and gingery and oh-so-good.  "Toro-chu" - It's like regular toro, which is fatty tuna, but just, well, fattier.  haha.  So good too!  Seriously melts in your mouth.  No joke.  "Salt Water Eel" - not your typical "fresh" water eel-- I didn't know there was a difference. :P  So good!  Cooked differently than fresh water eel.  Order one piece with the regular sweet sauce and get the other one with that gingery lemmony sauce that you get on the "Thai" -- SOOO GOOOOD!Everything else we ordered was delicious as well, and definitely did not disappoint.  Food is not cheap, but you definitely get what you pay for- everything is so fresh.  I recommend sitting at the sushi bar to get the full experience.  The chefs were awesome and service was pretty quick for the most part. Next time I want to try the soft shell crab and oysters - they looked yummy yum too!

Reviews.Author: EL L.
Reviews.Content: Pro:Fresh FishFast serviceFriendly staffPricesCons:The wait We ordered the sashimi platter and it was fantastic. Plenty of Toro, yellow tail, tuna, salmon and more toro. All for $35!! We also ordered the Uni which was good but I wish we would have ordered the dinner portion of it since it came with more for the price of 3 orders of the nigiri. Too bad this place was in LA or we'll be there everyday.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: If you're a UCLA student, the only sushi places you might know are Amis and Yamato in Westwood.  My friend told me he wanted to get sushi and was craving Yamatos saying the sushi there was great...  I didn't know if he was joking or not, but after I realized he wasn't, i told him we would go to a REAL sushi place.  He didn't understand since he thought that all fish tasted the same, but I told him thats because he hasn't had real sushi yet.I took him and 2 others who were sushi noobs and we sat at a table because we are poor college students.  (When I came with my parents we sat at the bar and I did my duty and went all out).  I made a reservation earlier for dinner so we only had to wait 5 minutes even though there was a huge wait to get in (8PM Friday night).  We were all starving so we ordered a bunch of food:Sweet Shrimp w/ the heads friedFresh oysters2 orders of Sashimi Deluxe2 orders of Sushi Deluxe (comes with miso soup)2 orders of Uniand four salmon skin handrollsAs soon as the guy earlier ate the sweet shrimp, it was game over.  He knew right away that this was simply a different level of seafood.  I watched everyone closely as they put a piece of toro sashimi in their mouth, and I saw everyones eyes light up.  They couldn't believe how soft and full of flavor it was.  Everything was great and I was happy everyone was satisfied.  The bill came out to $260 with tip but then again we ordered a good amount.  The real experience would have been the sushi bar but since we are college students, I'll save the bar for when I come with my parents or I get a job after I graduate.  The sushi bar will run you more, especially if you get "omakase" (chef, its up to you).  Anyways, for sushi in LA Sushi Gen is the place to be (if you are willing to shell out the $$$)!

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time for with a co-worker just yesterday (she swears by this restaurant). We got to Sushi-Gen around 12 and there were, I kid you not, 20 people waiting for a table. The entire restaurant was already PACKED. While waiting, we asked the host if there's ever a time that it's not so crowded. Unfortunately, he shook his head and told us that even at 11:15, when the restaurant opens, there's already a long line outside. Boo.The service is great and the food comes out very very fast. My friend ordered a spicy tuna cut roll and I had the sushi and tempura lunch special. The sushi was incredible...as in melt-in-your mouth incredible. The tempura was a tad on the greasy side, but still delicious. I loveee sweet potato tempura, and Sushi-Gen's was divine!I was really surprised by the portions! 5 or 6 pieces of tempura, 6 pieces of sashimi, rice, miso soup, pickled vegetables, and some tofu all for $15. Not bad at all! I'd come back here for lunch more often if it weren't for the atrocious wait.

Reviews.Author: Karin D.
Reviews.Content: All I can and have to say is OMFG, the best sushi ever.  You must go there now.

Reviews.Author: Joseph A.
Reviews.Content: It's been years since I've been to Sushi Gen.  The wait is usually way too long for my hungry tummy. So, I typically leave for another restaurant. We scored with a 30 minuite wait the other night.   Sashimi is as fresh as you can get in LA. I could only wonder how it is to have it straight from the docks. I ordered the sashimi with tempura dinner, albacore tataki, and an order of hiyayako. I swear that albacore melted like butter. I could eat albacore tataki every day if I could.I ate at Sugarfish in DT a while back. In comparision, it's great also but I left there still hungry.  Sushi Gen is very traditional. You won't see much creative rolls on the menu. There's no need to cover up the flavor and quality of the fish with sauces and add ons.Can't wait to come back here again. It's hard to go anywhere else until I probably try Urawasa.

Reviews.Author: Tajira M.
Reviews.Content: By far, the BEST sushi meals I've had in Los Angeles have been at Sushi-Gen.  Can you say uni??  Lunch or dinner, I'm having a full tray of uni.  I was there for lunch yesterday, and I had the uni and sashimi combination lunch.  Though it costs $32 for this lunch order, you have to consider what you're receiving:  hot tofu, miso soup, a little salad, a bowl of rice, mixed sashimi, a tray of uni, a little tuna tartare, sliced cucumbers, and STILL more!  Everything is extremely fresh, they're generous with the portion of sashimi, and you finish your food wanting to go back every day as long as you can afford it.  The service is friendly, and the food comes out quickly.   The iced green tea is a little strong, but I like it that way.  MAKE SURE you get your parking ticket validated -- the parking is crazy expensive if you don't.  Note:  this plays STAYS busy from the time the doors open.  The wait can be 20-30 minutes relatively quickly.  It's worth the wait, the money, and the drive to have this sushi.TRUST.

Reviews.Author: Cindy B.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for traditional sushi, this is the place to go. It's legit. The fish tastes really fresh and it's very good. Don't go here looking for fancy rolls with sauces, fixings, and tempera all over the place.If you are trying to dine with a party, expect to wait. I came in alone and got seated after a couple of minutes. Ambiance is pretty simple and nice.

Reviews.Author: Karla P.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a sushi gem! I just had to.No really, it's that good. Living in a city saturated with all the sushi your appetite could ever fathom, Sushi Gen stands out for its' quality and authenticity. The wait can get pretty long but if you're not with a big group, I recommend sitting at the bar. I actually love sitting there! Watching the chefs slice heavenly slabs of fish is an art in itself. Okay, I sound like a total weirdo. Not on the menu but readily available, their fatty salmon is no doubt the best I've ever had. And for you uni-lovers, the friend said that was the best uni he's ever had as well.  Take note they put wasabi in each sushi or handroll they make so keep that in mind before you dunk yours in more. You'll thank me later ;)

Reviews.Author: Richard M.
Reviews.Content: GEN is the Sushi "Gem" of downtown Los Angeles!Trust me on this one! I've been to many sushi restaurants in Los Angeles area and nothing comes close to GEN. They serve the freshest sushi in town! Sushi Deluxe, Chirashi Deluxe, Tempura plates, Salads, Sea Urchin, Unagi, Salmon, Halibut... I tried almost eveyrhing. I also tried the Toro once. (Tuna Belly: very expensive). They were all good and melt in your mouth like ice cream.

Reviews.Author: Alexandrea Y.
Reviews.Content: I am only writing on a memory, so your experience might be different from mine.First, they won't allow cell-phone.Second, they won't allow your less then half filled water bottle on the table (mind you, we've already ordered the bottle of "Onigoroshi" from there, which was close to $75!)Third, their sushi wasn't that good compare to other places, but the price was really over the top. This was my first and last experience there.My apologies to anyone who've had better experience there.

Reviews.Author: Alan J.
Reviews.Content: I honestly think Sushi-Gen is a bit overrated. Like literally everyone in LA brings up this place when they talk about "great sushi in LA". It's good but really??... I don't know about 4.5 stars. They have a wide variety but at times it can taste like the fish was frozen and just defrosted. Prices are not too wallet friendly either.. I'd suggest going for lunch. But okay aside from playing devil's advocate, I'd say it's not bad sushi (i might have been harsh). It's a decent spot and you can probably not worry about getting sick from eating non-fresh sashimi. Wouldn't put it on the top shelf list though.

Reviews.Author: Arlene C.
Reviews.Content: Here for the weekend to attend a wedding, Masa, acting as the official LA Yelp Chief of Protocol, was gracious enough to treat me to a Sashimi lunch here.  It was the perfect choice, as others in the wedding party had gone to Daikokuya (my other consideration) and were complaining of Aginomoto induced comas.  We both had their Sashimi lunch special. The fish was really fresh and had a variety of preparations including Spicy Tuna.Thanks Masa!

Reviews.Author: Aaron C.
Reviews.Content: I've heard for years that Sushi Gen is easily one of the top Sushi joints in Los Angeles.  I've tried no less than 5 times to have lunch/dinner, but the wait was always intolerable so I always fell back on neighboring substitutes.I was finally able to try it out.  I didn't have a whole lot of time, so I ordered the Chirashi so I could get a quick sampling of their fish.  Overall, it was quite good.  Every piece of fish was fresh and was satisfactory.  In retrospect, I guess a Chirashi isn't going to be the best sampling of fresh fish as it would be typically all the strange "leftover" cuts that aren't nice enough to put into an order of Sashimi or Sushi.Next time I'm in a splurging mood, I'll give it another go with an Omakase at the Sushi Bar.

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: What more can be said? Look at the score and the amount of reviews. Sushi Gen is a phenomenal sushi joint.The Sashimi lunch special is an amazing bang for your buck. A plate piled with sashimi, a big bowl of rice, miso soup, tofu, and cabbage. So so good. Also, I'd like to second the opinion that this is a place for sushi on the authentic side, so don't expect all sorts of crazy sushi and wacky rolls. It's a simple menu which makes it a delightful change from the rest of LA.Look at the reviews people, Sushi Gen is not to be denied.

Reviews.Author: Yong C.
Reviews.Content: Good quality sushi overall.  Not very friendly - asked Masato a few questions and his answers were very curt, those of one-word variety.  And he was carrying a conversation in Japanese with people sitting next to me, not knowing that I understand Japanese...What's with the attitude people have when the restaurant is obviously doing well?  Anyhoo, neta quality is of first rate.  Don't understand why they killed the tai (snapper) sushi with yuzu-kosho (yuzu pepper which is very strong).  They trying to hide something???

Reviews.Author: Mike T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is, in my mind, one of the PREMIER sushi bars in the Los Angeles area.  Speaking not only from myself but friends and family also, Sushi Gen has super fresh, super delicious sashimi and sushi on a regular basis.  The quality of the fish combined with the just moderate price makes it #1 in my book.For those on a budget date I suggest splitting the Sashimi Deluxe plate.  It is more than enough food to split between 2 people.  And if you aren't quite full, theres always great dessert in Japanese Villiage Plaza ^_^!!Come early or make reservations, it gets crowded!!

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a group of 4 people and had a reservation but still waited about 20 minutes to get seated at a table. I was expecting fantastic things from all the amazing reviews that was given here and was also fully expecting it to be quite pricey since it is supposed to be an authentic sushi place that serves raw fish only.The menu was quite authentic and I would also not bag on the waitresses either as they knew what we were into; however, the portions were surprisingly small and their cooked food menu was very limited to a few things not like many of these types of restaurants that had fried / cooked / grilled fish collars. I wasn't extremely impressed by the quality and taste of the fish and it was definitely pricey in the end. I just felt like for a sushi place of this caliber their selection was not impressive and what they had was fresh but not mind blowingly delicious. After getting out of the $2.50 parking with some usage of feminine features from my friend and I, I don't know that I'd come back again with so many smaller, less expensive and more homely feel sushi places in Little Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: Apparently Wed night is the slow night. Parked in pole position. YEAH! $2.50 parking fee, wtf?!But the guy in the car next to my door didn't seem to signal clearly if he was getting out of his car or staying put. Ayo, get off the pot! I stared at him and motioned for him to egress first which he did. Then the chap lingered. No surprise why -- he was waiting for his date to exit as well. "Thanks for letting me out first", he said. I slyly responded, "It's cool, but I'm gonna beat you inside!" You might be on a date, but on my birthday I wanna eat first sucker. You get one courtesy that's it!And apparently this is a sushi date spot, we got seated next to one of my brethren trying to explain to his non-Asian date all the kinds of seafood she was ingesting. He seemed a little anxious, chattering away rapidly and shaking his whole leg over the meal. She glibly laughed at all his little stories and was dressed to impress; dude relax - you got this like Kobe.$43 uni dinner w/ sashimi side (tax and tip y0) Love it. They give you strips of nori and a bowl of sushi to roll your own. Yeah a happy sushi meal. Why do I waste time at Chaya?!

Reviews.Author: Carrie N.
Reviews.Content: *Updated* I went back after being away from this place for two weeks - consistently good!!  Ordered the same exact thing as the first time. Just as good if not better than the first time. "Ima Japa, they are Japa - all they serve is Japa Japa"   Great service even with the line going out the front door!!!  I love this place. (I think - as with most authentic Sushi  places - if you sit at the Sushi bar, you may pay more for your sushi/and or the whole menu may not be available at the sushi bar.)*My first time*I read.  I went.  Now, I believe.  Its all that with happy ending. High quality sashimi - extremely reasonable prices.I did the sashimi and tempura dinner ($23) and I will return - nothing short of the freshest sashimi I've had in a long time. Maguro, spicy tuna, HAMACHI, tako, negi maguro - a feast for the eyes and a delight for the palate. Served up with soup, pickled veggies and rice - not to forget the Tempura - battered lightly and cooked up crisp and perfect for that melt in your mouth satisfaction.Plum wine ($4) sweet and an excellent pairing with the wasabi and did I mention this place was PACKED!  Dinner, Monday? Packed!! The service did not fail, though.  Excellent service. Im so glad to have tried this place.Happy ending?  The price - what a deal!

Reviews.Author: Ann N.
Reviews.Content: It's located inside the Honda Plaza. I went to see what all the raves were about. So I came here w/o ressies for dinner on a Saturday. The wait was about 30-45 minutes. Once inside there's a long sushi bar on the left and table seating on the right. We were seated by the door. Anyway, we ordered: 1. SALMON SKIN SALADMixed greens with bits of salmon and salmon skin. Only complain is the skin needs to be crisper. 2. SHRIMP TEMPURAYou'll get 3 pieces with ponzu dipping sauce. The shrimp is butterflied, so it's not as meaty. 3. SUSHI A LA CARTE (2 pieces)From the sushi list we ordered: giant clam, tuna and yellowtail w/ginger and scallions.4. SUSHI DELUXE COMBOSpicy tuna roll, yellowtail, tuna, and halibut.The sushi was good, but not "wow-zers." I've had better and fresher fish. Like Smitcha B. says, "I'm not saying I wouldn't come back, but I'm saying that by the words of others and all these 5 star posts, I was a bit let downed."Cost for party of 2 for 4 dishes and 1 Asahi and 1 ice green tea is about $70 w/o tip.

Reviews.Author: Steve D.
Reviews.Content: Since I was only going to be in SoCal for another day, I wanted to satisfy my appetite for fine sushi before returning home to the Bay Area.  So I wanted to try out a new sushi place and thanks to Yelp, I found Sushi-Gen.Sushi-Gen has some of the freshest sushi you can get and portions are decently sized.  My order included Hamachi belly, 2 orders of Hamachi, Maguro, Shiro Maguro, Unagi, Spicy Scallop Handroll, Salmon, Salmon Skin Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Salmon Skin Salad, and 2 Iced Teas which came to about $70.The fish here is so fresh, they actually keep them alive on life support and carve away at them for each order.  No...J/K.  But honestly, the fish does really look and taste that fresh.

Reviews.Author: Marian C.
Reviews.Content: Please don't throw sushi rice at me, but this place was a real disappointment. I've heard so much about this place and even my parents say it's awesome. But I have to disagree. First of all, I feel like I am at a fast food restaurant with the service. Okay I could understand it's super busy, but when we ordered, the waitress was talking super fast and when my dad asked if we could substitute some items in the "sashimi deluxe," she said "no" and didn't give any alternatives. So we ended up just getting that and tempura since she seemed like in a big rush. She didn't even ask us for anything to drink so we were sitting there parched for awhile until she came back and apologized that she forgot. When the sashimi deluxe came, I was appalled at what were were getting. Really distasteful chopped up fish in piles. Some of them were in nice slices, but mostly random (as my dad would call it: "cheap crap") and non-sashimi items like a small piece of dry grilled salmon. Why the heck would you even call it "sashimi deluxe"?? Everything was below average in terms of taste except the fatty tuna, but of course anything that's fat, drenched in butter, or fried is good. The tempura was good but not spectacular. Also ordered 4pc spanish mackerel that came out to 12 dollars!! There were no prices on the menu, so I had no idea.. but you'd think... $4-5 for 2 pc. It was good but definitely not worth $3 a piece. It wasn't even nigiri! The other odd thing about this place is how they charge you for everything. The ginger is $1, rice $1 (ok that's normal).... i'm surprised they didn't charge us for soy sauce! At the end, the waitress quickly gave us the bill without us asking, subtly signaling that she wanted us out quickly. The second I signed the card, another lady took it away so fast I didn't even have time to blink.Would NOT come back unless I had to (like a birthday party).. I think there are way better places in little tokyo or elsewhere. Not worth the trek, especially with the rushed service and feeling like you're at a $ restaurant. I get better service at In-n-out

Reviews.Author: Manu m.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi place in LA, Fish quality is so much better then any other spot in town. If you dont want to spend a bank on omakase, (yep it can run over $200 per person, and is well worth it), "shishmi deluxe" is good option and enough for 2 people to share.

Reviews.Author: Vivien L.
Reviews.Content: I arrange my course schedule every semester just to ensure that I can have lunch at Sushi Gen at least once a week.  Is that good enough to convince you that this place has the most amazing (not to mention well-priced!) sashimi lunch special ever?!  What? $15 you say?  How is that enough sashimi to even get full? And how can it be good quality?Well...believe me...I have turned many a non-believer into Sushi Gen lovers~  For the price you actually get a decent amount of food (yes I clear my platter to the point of only leaving the garnish of lettuce...but I am always w/o fail full to the point of bursting...but it's a good kind of full, I guarantee you =D)For $15 you get miso soup, steamed tofu, sunomono, rice, and a 9"x6" platter of sashimi that usually includes the following:3 slices of tuna3 slices of yellowtail3 slices of white fish1 slice of squid 2 slices of a konyaku (at least that's what I think it is... 0.o)1 piece of grilled salmon1 mound of cubed tuna1 mound of chopped tuna w/scallions (like spicy tuna w/o the spicy...although sometimes you get two mounds of cubed tuna)1 mound of a marinated tuna that tastes similar to Chinese "fun yu" (anyone know the proper name?)1 mound of spicy tuna (the best spicy tuna I've ever had. very little mayo, but a whole lotta flavaaa!)...and lots of seaweed! (I like to put it in my miso soup to warm it up a little~After tax & tip, the $15 meal comes out to about $20--Now that I know I can bypass the wait for my sashimi fix I'm probably going to get mercury poisoning and go broke at the same time...

Reviews.Author: Tony O.
Reviews.Content: I have been here quite a few times and the sushi is good.  The memorable items that I have enjoyed is the toro, uni and live shrimp.  I especially enjoy the shrimp heads in miso soup.  The sushi chefs are nice and if they warm up to you give you complimentary pieces of sashimi.So, why two stars?  I usually walk out of this place paying $175-225 for two.  For that price, I would prefer to pay a few bucks more for an omakase in the LA area. I also tend to dine after 830-9, so by 945, the waiters are usually trying to rush me out.  Big no-no especially if I am ordering toro at that time.  I would recommend sushi gen to people that are getting out of the tempura roll phase and willing to experiment with other cuts of fish and seafood.

Reviews.Author: Sharon T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen is my favorite place for sushi.  I've only been out there twice for dinner over the past year, which is not nearly as enough as I would like.  I went on a Saturday night both times, and the wait was about an hour long each visit.  It didn't matter that I went around 8, which is what I consider as a late dinner.  So your best bet is to go early like everyone suggests.The parking lot is tiny, but the flow of traffic is constant.  I only had to wait about 5 minutes for a spot.  I would highly suggest that someone in your party put in their name down while waiting to find a parking space.  In order to keep ourselves entertained while waiting to be fed, the boy and I walked across the street to walk around Little Tokyo.  It reminded me of my trip to Japan years ago, and how I need to make it out there again in the near future.Back to the restaurant...there is a bar section, which may be a shorter wait.  But I always opt to sit at the tables.  I got the chirashi bowl again, and it was heavenly.  The pieces of fish were fresh, melt in your mouth kind of deliciousness!  I had a couple pieces of toro in my bowl, and that was the winner.  The boy got the sashimi dinner combo, which is the most popular according to our server.  It came with tempura, miso soup, and a variety of sashimi.  It's a few bucks more than my chirashi, but I think sashimi dinner is the way to go.  We both demolished our dinner in no time.  The service was superb as well.  Oh, and don't forget to get your parking ticket validated before you leave the restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Katy H.
Reviews.Content: I'll try to ignore the fact that I seriously broke the bank on this place, but honestly that is my fault for not asking for a price list.I sat at the bar and basically let other people's plates be my guide. HOLY cow... this was hands down the best sushi I have ever had in my entire life. No joke. I tried so many things it was crazy. The tip top had to have been the scallop. Yum.I really want to go back and try a roll though, I feel like that might be an excellent experience.**Extra Tip: If you want free parking head a few blocks east and you can avoid paying for either the lot or meters and it is a short walk.

Reviews.Author: Mookie D.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is undoubtedly the best sushi restaurant in J-Town. Not only because of the unbeatable sashimi lunch special, but mainly because of the extremely high quality of the fish itself. Since the customer volume is so high everyday, the inventory goes out quickly so new fish comes in daily.  Furthermore, the restaurant itself is very traditional, like something out of Japan. The owner is the head chef at the bar, having been passionately dedicated to the art of sushi making and customer satisfaction for nearly 20 years. Seriously, he has some of the most exotic and advanced sushi for the connoisseurs. The main attraction here is the sashimi. For $12.50 lunch, you get 4 appetizers, green tea, and a sashimi plate of over 20 pieces of fish. That's right. Sometimes even TORO comes in the sashimi, as the dish is a mix between raw fish, cooked fish, and seaweed. So it has a very varied and balanced taste. Find another restaurant that can beat it. Note: don't come here expecting Rainbow rolls, Caterpillar Rolls and all that garbage (which isn't even sushi). As mentioned, the fish is the main attraction here, so sashimi and nigiri sushi are what attracts the real sushi customers and all the Asian customer base. Highly recommended. The wait can be 45 minutes sometimes so come early.

Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen (the "Gen" part is pronounced with a "hard g" as is "gun) is my very favorite sushi place in all of Southern California. When I want sushi, I could care less about sleek, trendy surroundings and techno-crap music, and I don't need a place with all kinds of pseudo-sushi inventions (DUI roll, Screaming Orgasm hand roll, etc.). I want fresh, authentic sushi prepared by guys with whom I have a serious language barrier. During the "go-go" business climate of the early 1990's, Sushi Gen was chock full of visiting Japanese businessmen just about every evening. Those guys knew a little something about real sushi, and this is the place they'd walk down to from the New Otani Hotel. And it's not like they didn't have a slew of other choices in Little Tokyo. Well, it's no longer the 1990's and the wave of visiting Japanese businessmen has subsided, but Sushi Gen remains a top-tier sushi restaurant where authenticity trumps meaningless westside flash and trash. The hamachi (yellowtail) is the best. Period. The stuff is so delicate and dissolves on the tongue. The uni (sea urchin) with quail egg is perfectly cold and moist--terrific stuff. The Spanish mackerel is also a standout. This is still the one sushi place I go to when I'm prepared to pay up for my addiction, and I never regret the experience. There are a handful of other places closer to my hometown that can quiet my sushi cravings, but Sushi Gen is always a monster slam dunk!

Reviews.Author: Kunney T.
Reviews.Content: I am determined to eat at every single japanese restaurant in lil tokyo.  Some thoughts.- Lunch is 11-2.  The whole place shuts down after 2.  Beware.- The green tea is fresh and free!  More points!- The sashimi combo was 15 bucks and had lots of tuna, albacore, and snapper.   There was also cooked salmon, cured eel, spicy tuna and normal tuna chunks.  This also includes miso and some sides.  BEST DEAL EVER!- The ladies are nice and cute with their accents.  I felt like my mom was serving me.All in all, fish was not as tasty as Hama.  But then again, it's more bang for the buck than hama.

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: My God - how does this place have such high ratings??? Service is slow, the packaged napkin they give you at the beginning to wash your hands is grey... like it's been used 1 too many times, the food i wayyyy over-priced for what you get - why am I am paying $24 for chewy beef teriyaki? Why is my friend paying $24 for burnt salmon teriyaki? The ONLY thing I could say about this place is the beer is moderately priced and that the sushi does taste fresh, but not so fresh that it blows your socks off.People, I know there's a fine balance between  price vs quality vs quantity but don't believe the hype - especially you manly men like me... avoid this place and check out tons of other places that meet that balance in an affordable tasty manner.

Reviews.Author: Annie G.
Reviews.Content: Oh man; I've heard about this place since freshman year! And if you just look up sashimi or sushi near downtown LA, Sushi-Gen is always on the list! I finally went for dinner one night during finals week, and the two of us split the sashimi deluxe for $35. It was so GOOD, and the best part was that we were STUFFED by the end as well! Generally, I can't imagine being full by eating raw fish, but with this stuff, it's possible. I don't remember what was on the dinner menu, but I've gone back for lunch multiple times.  My sashimi platter came with grilled salmon (at least I thought it was grilled), toro, tuna, yellowtail, halibut, squid, spicy tuna tartare, toro tartar, glutinous yam slices, and some salted/smoked tuna. My favorite was the toro, so I always save it for last :) It's so fatty and delicious!I always intend to get there at 11, but I usually get there by 11:30...And then the wait is almost an hour... So I'd say get there just before 11 if you don't want to stand around and wait. Once you sit down, service is so freaking fast! (Which makes sense considering what you're ordering) And I got lucky this one time with a waitress who consistently refilled my water glass. Not so lucky with a different waiter... but I'd say service better than just acceptable.

Reviews.Author: Sandee T.
Reviews.Content: Seriously some of the freshest sashimi I've EVER had.We closed shop dining here one fabulous Friday night!   (No, seriously, the wait staff stood around waiting for us to finish stuffing our faces...so we hurried.  Kinda.)Main:Sashimi deluxe [see pics] = everything and anything you can think of...we ate... enjoyed every succulent bite.Sides:Sea cucumber, salmon skin salad, seaweed salad, etc.WOA:* Street or lot parking* Always a wait...be patientCan't wait to come back for more fresh sashimi~!

Reviews.Author: Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: Alrighty, I'm a fan!I didn't think that this place would have hit the spot for my craves for sushi, but alas, it did! My boyfriend and I were the first to walk in at 530 when it opened for dinner. We were kindly greeted by all of the sushi chefs, and were seated at a table near the sushi bar. The ambiance of the place was sort of trendy with the red wooden walls, japanese cartoon pictures, and wood floors. Service is exceptional. We were promptly asked what we wanted to order by a shy, Japanese speaking waitress who needed everything we ordered to be translated to her coworker. She said the cutest thing after we ordered our dishes, "No rice?" heheMy boyfriend and I ordered the SASHIMI DELUXE dinner! It was DELISH! My goodness! I couldn't believe how fresh and tasty each of the fish were! Everything that was on that huge plate was so good, and suprisingly filling! The presentation was very nice as well. We also ordered their spicy tuna roll (nothing special), and their salmon (always good!).As for drinks, my boyfriend had the hot green tea. It was pretty good. Oh, I just love my green tea and sushi!FYI: They charge $1 for extra ginger. It gets busy at 6pm! (There were no more seats available!)Our bill came to $64 for the both of us! Not too bad for what we ate! I would definitely venture out here to get some fresh sushi anytime!

Reviews.Author: Andy D.
Reviews.Content: This is the best Sushi in all of LA.  I've tried some really amazing stuff at this place... really amazing.. stuff that I have no idea what it was called, I just ate it.  It's a great place to take someone that knows their sushi.  I just know I like sushi, but have no idea how to order it, I'm not gonna lie.  I can't say that I'm a sushi-snob as Stephy S., so I can't say I've had better than this.  For my taste, this place is top of the list for Sushi.   Only downside, I've always had to wait to get a seat, and sometimes longer than I really wanted too...

Reviews.Author: Denis K.
Reviews.Content: I don't know how the wife did it but we bypassed everyone and got 2 seats at the sushi bar with no wait.  I'm sure all y'all know that there is always crazy wait in front of Sushi-Gen. We sat in front of Kazu-san who was friendly and attentive. The sushi was fresh at par and the cut size were normal. Nothing really melted in my mouth but it was good honest sushi.

Reviews.Author: Joel Y.
Reviews.Content: Who wants cheap fresh sashimi? Hmmm.. that is a tough question.. ok you twisted my arm. I do!Dood, this place has the best lunch sashimi combos ever. Fresh large pieces of fish, delicious and delectable, melt in your mouth stuff. Located inside Honda Plaza, the special sashimi lunch is only offered during lunch hours.  Keep in mind if you work in the downtown area or you are unemployed and in the area, come here early! This place is easily a 45 min wait for lunch!Annoying tidbits:*Screaming mini Japanese host that is crazy*Long long lines*No substitutions on anything... what you see is what you getBut it is still 100% worth a try if you are a sushi lover! Avoid the potato salad.. it was extremely salty.Another fun fact- one of the sushi chefs from Sushi Gen just opened a new sushi joint that took the place of Sushi 333 @ Japanese Village Plaza. I will need to check it out soon!

Reviews.Author: Serina T.
Reviews.Content: There always seems to be an extremely long wait for a table but that's usually a sign that the food is good.   We came here after the Tofu Festival with a large group so the wait was about an hour.We ordered the clam appetizer which was tasty but the clams were pretty small.  We shared the chicken teriyaki dinner which came with a bowl of tuna and red snapper sashimi.  The tuna was extremely fresh!  Also ordered the toro (so good!), yellowtail belly, salmon, unagi, and surf clam.  The quality is great but I wouldn't say that it's my favorite place.  Also the rolls are really small.I think next time I will have to try the omakase to get a more accurate review.  Our bill came out to about $30/person which isn't too bad considering the freshness of the fish.

Reviews.Author: Jenn H.
Reviews.Content: One of my new fav sushi joints in LA. The thought of their scallops, hamachi belly, uni, salmon and toro still make my mouth water.Came here for a catch up session w/my cousin - spent about 2+ hours and a tab over $200+. We have HUGE appetites for GOOD sushi. None of that California Roll bs. We were lucky to get a reservation right about 30 mins after they opened on a Sunday, sat at the sushi bar (the best way to go). When we left, the line was still ridiculously long.Def would go back. Sushi-Gen you are awesome! :)Only neg thing to say was that we ordered the sweet shrimp for the heads to be cooked in a miso, but we never got it. On the sweet shrimp alone - I had better.

Reviews.Author: Zahir H.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch is amazing value. Took half to go. Amazing selection of fish included.

Reviews.Author: Skylo S.
Reviews.Content: If you order the sashimi here, then 5 stars.   Very, very fresh uni and toro belly.  If youorder sushi then 4 stars.   Fresh fish but kind of cheap on the pieces of meat.   Surrounding sushi with too much rice is not cool.  If you order anything else on the menu like chicken teriyaki like my white friends then 3 stars.  It is no better than something you would get at Japanese buffet like Onami.

Reviews.Author: Tabitha C.
Reviews.Content: Review is only for lunch, make sure you get there at the very least 30 minute before lunch even begins.  The line will start very soon after, definitely worth the wait.The waitress's are use to the lunch crowd, so expect them to push you along as soon as you sit down, probably have at most 5 minutes to decide what you want before they come asking for your order.Their sashimi lunch special ($15) is the most affordable sushi plate I've ever had and the quality can't be beat.  Soup and rice is included with their lunch special along with a pickled vegetable medley dish.  I was full after everything.They have items on the menu, but its hard for me to stray from the sashimi lunch special.  I just wanted to add to their raving lunch review.

Reviews.Author: Kat T.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!! Yummmmmiee!! The sushi is fresh and so good! My cousin took me and my husband here. But we had to make reservation! That's what you need to do.. if you don't make reservation you need to get there in LINE (yes line) before it opens, at least 30 mins before because the line is soooo long.. When there is a line you know the food is that good!!! Food is a little pricey but it's worth is once in awhile!! The only Cons to this place is how you have to wait in line and make reservation at lunch time.. but just do it.. all worth it!!!And the food gets to you fast also.. plus plus to me.. when I'm hungry!!

Reviews.Author: Denis S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner on a Friday night a couple weeks ago.  No reservations, and it was pretty late, so we had to wait for about 20 - 30 minutes.  I think during a more peak time, we wouldn't have been able to get in without reservations. I can't remember exactly what we ordered, but it was pretty much an assortment of various types of sushi to try.  They don't have many rolls so if you're a roll person, this place isn't for you.What they do have is amazingly fresh and delicious cuts of fish.  That's it.  They have a lot of other things, but that's why I came and that's why I would come back.  So if you're into very fresh raw sushi or sashimi, this is a great place.  If not, move along, nothing to see here.

Reviews.Author: Esther K.
Reviews.Content: Apparently this place has the best sushi ever. My friends consistently spend almost $100 every time they come here with nary a complaint.So why just 3 stars? At the risk of everyone coming after me and killing me, I have to admit that I do not eat sushi. I know. Gasp. In my defense, I was dragged here by sushi-obsessed friends who forced me to sit at the sushi bar. WHY?!But the experience was worth it. The sushi chef was so nice and understanding. I ordered the eel avocado roll (yum!), sweet shrimp, and salmon roe. All very delicious.It was pretty amazing seeing him prepare all the different sushi items - I can kind of understand why people wait for such a long time (we had about a 40 min wait) to eat here and for so much money.I must say, however, that my wallet was very happy that I do not eat sushi since my total came out to be $20 whereas everyone else paid $80-110. KEKEKE.In conclusion, I would say that if you are a sushi lover, you should come here at least once. If you are a faux sushi lover like me, don't come here unless you absolutely have to. Thanks!

Reviews.Author: May W.
Reviews.Content: Did Sushi-Gen change their hours or something?  I remember coming here and waiting in line until 11:30AM for them to open their doors.  Now I see that they open at 11AM?  Damn, I should have checked Yelp before eating here on Monday.  I waited for 30 minutes for an open table.  It was worth it for their $15 sashimi lunch though.  I sat in my car and listened to music while other people braved the cold weather outside the small sushi restaurant.I came here with my aunt and brother & we all got the same lunch special.  Everything was pretty enjoyable and we even got a free 2012 calendar at the end of our meal!!  I especially love their tofu side dish that comes with the lunch.  And man, their bowl of rice seemed to have gotten bigger or something!  This is a plus for me because I love rice even when I should be cutting back on it!We got validation from the podium and paid $2 for parking.  They used to comp parking for the first 90 min with validation, but times are tough so are now charging.  I also didn't know this little tidbit before eating at Sushi-Gen again.  Oh yeah, they had a different host from the rude guy I dealt with the last time I ate here.  Plus one star for that!  This newer host is more...refined than the previous one.  He doesn't seem stuck up at all.  Yay!A downer for me is that the sashimi lunch does not come with salmon sashimi.  they give you a smaaaall piece of cooked salmon, but it's definitely not as good as salmon sashimi.

Reviews.Author: susy h.
Reviews.Content: The fish was fresh... Definitely had some of the fattiest tuna I've ever had here... That tuna was FAT! Geez, I felt like I was eating pork...Deluxe sashimi plate and a beef teriyaki dinner was enough to feed two.Wasabi here is mild.

Reviews.Author: bernice c.
Reviews.Content: Holy Moley I guess I'm reviewer 536.  This place is definitely delicious!  I came here to treat my friends after moving me into my new apartment.  We got there on Saturday at 5:25pm and there was a 15 person line waiting for this place to open at 5:30pm.  All the people were authentic older Japanese people, which I thought was super cute.  We got the sashimi plate and it was super yum!!  The sashimi plate had, I believe 15 different small dishes on it.  My friend got the beef teriyaki plate, but I thought this was so-so, since it was really dry.  The tempura was light a fluffy, tofu was perfect and the salmon skin salad was delicious.  We had the cutest Japanese lady waitress, she seemed like a Japanese mom straight out of a Japanese anime.  Definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Author: Foodie S.
Reviews.Content: This place is always sooo crowded...not suitable for big crowd...2 of us waited for more than 45 minutes for table on Friday night..but it's all worth it. Sushi is so fresh..luv the sashimi deluxe,  monk fish liver, and uni here.

Reviews.Author: Rockit O.
Reviews.Content: What is wrong with Gen?  Well, it is a Sushi factory.  There are like 7 or 8 chefs working behind the very long sushi bar.  They seem to want to rush you in and out of there as fast as they can in order to knock down the long line of people waiting outside.   One thing I can't stand is being rushed through my sushi!   If I am going to drop a "Benjamin" on sushi, I expect the chef to take his time and make each dish to perfection.  These chefs here are like blackjack dealers in Vegas.  What is right with Gen?  Fresh fish.  Yes the fish is good, but there is no "wow" factor.   I did not have anything here that blew my mind.  And I certainly did not have anything that surprised me.  I Stayed downtown for two nights, the next night I went to Sushi Go 55 and had a much better 5 star experience.  Summary- Sushi Gen is overrated.

Reviews.Author: alex C.
Reviews.Content: My, my, my.  Sushi-Gen, you are quite possibly the best Sushi I've ever had!I needed a good place to take my visiting parents out on a workday lunch, and this was the right spot to satisfy our fresh fish urges.  They've got a pretty simple menu featuring typical restaurant dishes (teriyaki, cutlet), sashimi, and sushi combos.  If you're adventurous with your sushi, I recommend sitting up at the bar and ordering to your heart's content, but be aware of the four dish minimum before you sit down.  The restaurant only seats 72 people, so sitting at the bar would be your best chance to lessen the long wait (20 minutes even on a Monday for lunch).I got the sushi combo, which was perfect for $15 bucks.  It was a sample of just about everything... five fish, egg, salmon roe, unagi, squid, sweet shrimp, and three each of cucumber and tuna.  Each piece of fish was extremely fresh and fatty.  It filled me up with really good sushi for around a dollar a piece, what a great deal.  Sashimi combo here goes for $30, so it's something to look forward to next time... maybe to split with a group of 4.Another thing I liked about this place was the chicken teriyaki my mom had.  She's not a big raw fish fan, so she stuck to a common dish I wouldn't have come to Sushi-Gen for, but it ended up being some of the best I've had.  The flavor of the teriyaki seems to be marinated into the chicken much longer instead of slathered on at the end, and the SKIN is kept on to provide some extra crispiness.  Delicious!Definitely will be coming back if I can find a good time with friends to avoid their talked about lines.

Reviews.Author: Anastasia K.
Reviews.Content: So many reviews, so many 5-star ratings. What can I possibly contribute to the overwhelming majority of those who LOVE Sushi-Gen? Nothing mind-numbingly brilliant or interesting but I just want this extra star to make up for any other review that could show a lower rating! GASP! Because seriously, if I read one more review about how you were disappointed this place doesn't have the bento box you want or the fried this or that, I will take a picture of your review (or profile), save it as a JPEG, then dump it in my trash. That'll be satisfactory, yes. Thursday, December 3rd, I had the honor of taking a guy I'm dating (who, later that night, asked me to go steady ;)) to dinner at Sushi Gen for his 29th birthday. I had made reservations at a steak house (JAR) two weeks prior to his birthnight but he wanted to get sushi (he hadn't had Sushi Gen in nearly a year!) so hey, whatever the birthday boy wants, right? Luckily for us, because it was 9:00p.m. on a Thursday night, we didn't have to wait AT all. We were immediately seated at the bar, which means ... faster food! We ordered our drinks and two bowls of clam miso soup. Mmm!We ordered the following (and I rated them out of 5 stars):***** Salmon (3 orders of 2) ****  Yellowtail (2 orders of 2) ****  Unagi (2 orders of 2) ***** Albacore (2 orders of 2) Spanish Mackerel (1 order of 2) - he ordered this so I can't rate it.***    Spicy Tuna Handroll (1 roll) ***** (x 100)Toro (2 orders of 2)I only took a picture of the albacore and toro (as shown in the gallery) because I forgot. I was too busy enjoying the food! I loved ALL of the fish; they were SO buttery in texture. Melt in your mouth like buttah baby. I would say the TORO and SALMON were my favorite. But I'm biased because I generally love salmon. ;)The total bill came out to be $93.00 for the two of us. I don't know the pricing for each individual fish. I left a total of $112.00 before leaving. Parking was $2.50. Along with the attendant, there were 4 of his friends loitering so I'm sure if you're with a lot of women, he'll let you go without paying. (Not that this measly amount will make up for your dinner bill!)  ;)I give it 5 stars. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Shelley C.
Reviews.Content: gotta love sushi gen!Even though its only walk ins and we waited for an hr.Started with a bottle of hot sake to warm up after standing in the cold. baked clam and salmon skin salad were tasty. Oyster was delicious and had to get the uni sushi w quail eggs. ( MUST GET!!!) to die for haha I had 2 orders.main we had assorted sashimi, fatty tuna was very very yummy, everything is fresh.

Reviews.Author: joseph y.
Reviews.Content: Wait? What wait? I got seated in 5 minutes! Oh that's right, my friends waited for me while I was stuck in traffic. Thanks girls!I ate here with friends and fellow yelpers EJ C., Su L., and Long T. (from Houston) on a Friday night. Upon being seated, the waitress distributed hand towels which (as I explained to my friends) are used to clean your hands (obvious?) in case you wanted to eat sushi the proper way: with your hands (not so obvious). The exception of course is sashimi, so I kept my hands nice and grubby. You can read more about sushi dining ettiquete here dummies.com/WileyCDA/Dum… in case you want to be a pretentious snob about it. Otherwise, keep rubbing those chopsticks and mix that wasabi with soy sauce like an uncivilized connoisseur. Kidding!Everything on the menu was a bit pricey, so I figured I'd get the sashimi deluxe dinner since sashimi is pricey anyway. It comes with a side of tempura and a bowl of rice, and of course, a random assortment of sashimi. While everything on the sashimi deluxe was excellent, I was severely disappointed to find that my favorite sushi, sake (salmon), was cooked! Arrrrrrrrrrrrg. Maybe I didn't read the menu properly, but that was so sad. Otherwise, I enjoyed generous servings of hamachi, toro, etc.If it wasn't for the fact that my salmon came cooked, I would have easily given this place a 5. I know, it's trivial, but not to a salmon sushi lover. Don't mess with my salmon!

Reviews.Author: Carlos G.
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed with this place for the sushi bar section.  Way overpriced, next time I am going to the sit down restaurant style instead of the bar. I will have to update this review at a later date, but I do not suggest the sushi bar. Go for table seating, since you cannot order from the reg menu at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Ruby C.
Reviews.Content: I've only been  here once for lunch.  Had the sashimi set and was not impressed.  The fish for the most part was fresh and pretty good considering it was all basically different types of tuna ...but it's kinda gross if u think about it...eating a huge plate of just TUNA?  i dont even like tuna.  i guess maybe that was the only fish of quality that day at the tsukiji...but honestly i dont care...i would like some variety please...looking at other reviews, i guess it was an off day, but it really wasn't worth the wait and the trouble of getting there...not motivated to go back.

Reviews.Author: Linda K.
Reviews.Content: I always hear the word "long wait" when people talk about Sushi-Gen.Fortunately, I didn't have any trouble getting the table but just to prepare that there will be some wait. But you won't regret it.I won't say this place is the best but I definitely keep this place in mind as one of the place to go when I'm around the area. Very fresh, delicious and perfect Sashimi. I enjoy every bit of all the order that we had from Sushi-Gen.

Reviews.Author: Sam K.
Reviews.Content: I believe if Japan and Korea met over tea and sushi at Sushi Gen....war could have been avoided.   The food is....well, how do you say....it make me horny.-Sam

Reviews.Author: Maxine T.
Reviews.Content: The lunchtime sashimi ($15) on weekdays is a great deal. There are extremely generous portions of tuna sashimi with lots of interesting flavors in the spicy tuna and side dishes. My table had mixed reviews of the teriyaki tuna (great flavor, slightly dry texture) and we all would have preferred salmon sashimi to the crispy fried piece of salmon that came with the meal. Overall, I thought it was worth the wait (arrived at 10:45am, restaurant opened at 11:15am, seated in second seating at ~11:50am) even though we were in the second seating, since the service is very fast. I would definitely return again when I have another weekday off. I would include photos, but the ones posted are accurate.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: This place came highly, HIGHLY recommended for great sushi at a decent price.  Did it live up to the legendary hype?  Let's just say, the only way this place could be even more legendary is if they prepared their sashimi with samurai swords, cut straight from live fish.This also marked the first (or second, I don't remember) time I've had sushi in 2008 without sake + beer.  It was 1130am, we went early to beat the rush, and it just didn't feel right pounding sake before noon.-1 star because our sushi chef had a hard time understanding us / remembering our orders.  At one point ihe just started arbitrarily preparing sushi because I think he forgot what we had all ordered.

Reviews.Author: Ian B.
Reviews.Content: Its midnight, I just got home from a marathon night of amazing wine and Sushi Gen.  I hate the fact that I'm the 324th person to review this restaurant, and it was my "1st" time - that's right, I was a SUSHI VirGEN.I heard it was good, I read it was good, and every time I went there - so many people were waiting, I just went to one of the 50 places next door.  What is that, that they say when you walk in the door at a Japanese Restaurant?  "AL-IZE!  (the cocktail?) - NAMASTE (like at yoga?) - GO-A-WAY (oh no?)  YOURGOINGTOPAY! (oh shit!) Sushi-Gen replaces R23 as my favorite Sushi in Downtown...  (Fifteen years it was #1)The fish is "hi-ya!" amazingThe sushi bar is "wa-yo!" cleanThe service is "he-za!" fastand no $8 "Val-et" - yippee!Nomo negatori's Absolutely ridiculous bad wine list!The $20 corkage - it's worth it - and this is the only place I would say that!Drink beer - they have crap glassware for wine anywaySuper simple food as far as presentation - not a bad thing - but with all the 5 star reviews you might expect Picasso in the kitchen - NOPECan't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: 5-stars for their sashimi lunch special. Best. Sashimi. Lunch. EVER! $15 for a heaping plate of the freshest sushi you'll find in LA. It's only served on weekdays, and it's always really crowded! I recommend either going really early at 11 or at the end of lunch at 1:30 pm.The sashimi plate comes with a mixture of raw and cooked fish. The raw fish (tuna, yellow tail, squid, octopus, spicy tuna, and toro) is so fresh! The cooked fish is not as exciting but it's still really good and complements the raw sashimi very well.
