The lunch comes with steamed tofu, miso soup, cabbage, and a HUGE bowl of rice.I've been here for dinner too. It's good quality sushi but it is pricey (you pay for the freshness and quality). I'd give 4.5 stars for their dinner, docking that half star because it's a little expensive and not too spectacular.

Reviews.Author: Yu W.
Reviews.Content: The lunch special sashimi is pretty a deal~But the Monkfish liver is the reason I'll come back!

Reviews.Author: Alissa M.
Reviews.Content: The food here is never bad and this place is more than amazing! Any one who put less than 5 stars is a straight up gaijin.YES it is expensive but if you don't want fresh fish that melts in your mouth, then feel free to hit up benihana because Sushi Gen is TOP dog in this contest.

Reviews.Author: Katherine W.
Reviews.Content: After all these years, I finally walk into Sushi Gen.  Tried it for lunch, must return to check out dinner.  The four stars are mostly for the great value for the price.Got the $15 sashimi lunch.  They give you lots of raw fish!  The three different cuts of tuna sashimi were ok, not much flavor, and the sliced tuna was icebox cold, really cold--not a good thing.  The yellowtail was nice.  There was also squid sashimi, spicy tuna, and some cooked items.  Plus miso soup and rice.  Lots of good (not excellent) fresh fish, a great value.

Reviews.Author: Smitcha B.
Reviews.Content: I gave this place a shot because my friend was raving about "Sushi-Gen" over dinner one night. I went against my instincts of going to my usual sushi spot and wanted to see what the hype was all about. To be honest, I wasn't too thrilled. The place was packed. It was a Thursday night and we waited a little bit for our table of four. There were many parties of 2 that got seated before us which I think works out better because the place is small.When you come here, bring your wallet. This place isn't overly pricey but it won't be a cheap sushi fix. Order enough appetizers and sushi + alki and that tab will light up like a Xmas tree. The fourth person on our table didn't really eat and if he did, I know the bill would've came out to more than $125 easily.The fish was good but I've had better where it's been fresher. The cuts are decent though so you get a nice portion. When I left this place, I was ready to go grab a taco or something. I wasn't too full.The service was good. The environment is a little crampy but it's okay, there was some talent on the other tables to look at.I'm not saying I wouldn't come back, but I'm saying that by the words of others and all these 5 star posts, I was a bit let downed. And remember, it's okay to text and browse your cell phone here but there's no yapping on the cell phones allowed, read their signs.

Reviews.Author: Mitch W.
Reviews.Content: YES, YES, YES!  We decided on sushi last Friday night, so we decided on Sushi Gen since it's close and we know what we like there.  We shared the Sashimi Deluxe plate and I have to say the quality and freshness this time was excellent.  I think it was the best quality fish I've eaten at Sushi Gen.  I posted some pictures of the dish.  We got five pieces of Toro that melted in your mouth!  Ohhh sooo good!Other than Sashimi Deluxe, we ordered our standby of 3-piece shrimp tempura.  Also, my friend had an order of Uni sushi that she said was one of the best she's tasted.Overall, an excellent experience.  We waited for about 20 minutes for a table.Ciao!

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Drove 2 hours and 52 minutes from San Diego; parked 0.46 miles away; waited an additional 26 minutes outside to finally experience some sushi that everyone and their mothers say is the best that they have ever had. I am not doubting their experience, but since it was a borderline 4.4 to 4.5 star range, this place definitely warrants another visit and another review in the near future.Although this place provided some very good sushi, I could not rate it high enough to make the 5-star range (4.5-5.0). The sushi alone was definitely in the 5-star range, but combine that with ambiance, and experience, it came down to a high 4-star range...4.4 stars.During my 26 minute wait...I noticed a few posted rules that some may overlook and lots have broken. They're posted at the check-in stand. One was, no cell phone use. Oh well, they didn't really enforce it. Also, all parties must be present to be seated, and finally no outside food and drink.I came alone, so my 26 minute wait period was pretty fast compared to everyone else's, but I normally eat at the sushi bar anyway. Sorry, no reservations taken at the bar, you'll just have to wait it out. That's where you will get the best sushi experience....period. But, there will be times where sitting out at the bar area may be shocking to the keen observer.Lucky for me, I got the old sushi chef. I figured, this guy has to be a master chef, that he has been around for decades just doing what he did best....the art of sushi preparation. And although his sushi preparation was superb, his handling of the sushi meat was unacceptable. He would throw back the excess sushi meat back in the cooler regardless of where it originally came from...ie throw back the excess tuna on top of the halibut sushi and obviously causing possible cross-contamination. Yah yah....I know I'm just being paranoid, but that you probably won't get contamination, but think about it....why did Dr. Egon Spengler say "Don't cross the streams."  And on a side note, his Engrish wasn't the best. One of the sushi he recommended later, I just could not figure out what the heck he was saying...sounded like Giant Cramps. And I'm thinking, why would you recommend Giant Cramps too me. Didn't want to cause a scene, so I said yah yah, give me some Giant Cramps. Finally got home, and googled it, and he actually said Giant Clams. Whewww...case solved.Besides the sushi-mixing ordeal, he would throw back excess sushi and let it touch the window glass portion. Big deal again right??? Well, if you have ever stuck around until closing, you would see these guys use Windex to clean the windows...something to think about if you see them throw back the sushi and it just lingers on the glass for awhile. But again, the average person doesn't see this nor they care because it is so fast that they just overlook this or just too busy talking with your party.Anyhoo, on with the sushi. Again, sitting at the bar will allow you to see the master at his best, so you should order the best. Here is what I had on this particular Friday night. All nigiri pieces.Sopporo - 22 oz...enough said.Tuna - nice, dark red vibrant piece of meat. As good as it gets.Salmon - bright orange piece of meat, sooo fresh, sooo good.Yellow Tail - nice piece of slightly pink colored meat, very shiny too...glistens against the lighting.Chutoro - wow...amazing. I asked for Otoro, but they ran out, so they gave me the second best, Chutoro instead. One of the better Toro pieces I have eaten ever. It will literally melt in your mouth. Savor this piece slowly people. I wasn't sure how much this meat is, but I can tell you, it is somewhat expensive. But definitely a very very good piece of meat.Snapper - very well prepared, shiny creamed colored piece of meat.Spanish Mackerel - basically all the colors of the rainbow on this meat, with chopped green onions.Halibut - nicely cut, parallel along the striations of the meat with chopped green onions and soy.Kampachi - nice cut farmed yellow tail. Look real close to see the veins...coolness.Giant Clam - first time trying this, chewy, shiny piece of meat. It's a different taste.Tamago - nice, cold sweet omelette, perfect way to end this evening.Ten different meats tonight...20 pieces total!! Suhweeet!!!!Sushi-Gen is one of the better sushi I have been in. It also makes my cut to as close as Japanese as it gets. They serve the sushi in wooden plates, and to me, this enhances the flavor. You can taste the difference, so when they place it on your plate, just let it sit there for a minute or two to get the best flavor. I have a super high standard on sushi, and this place comes as good as it gets. Definitely worth the wait and definitely worth coming back.  Definitely worth another updated review in the near future.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know about you, but I don't know of another sushi place that has this quality of FRESH fish at these prices, especially during lunch. This place is a little more expensive for dinner, so come for lunch!!!The "special" that makes this place so special is the $15 sashimi. It comes with a variety of sashimi, not just plainly sliced ones, but also spicy tuna mixes as well. The platter really depends on the season and what fish is available, which I love because you know you are being taken care of when the chefs are so thoughtful. The special also comes with miso soup, salad, handmade tofu side dish, and rice. Talk about a deal!Now parking is a little bit of an issue. You can park in the plaza for $3 or park elsewhere and walk. The wait for lunch is usually around an hour. In the beginning of the year they also give every table a calendar for the new year!

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Wasn't the biggest sashimi fan before Sushi-Gen but I'm sold now! Went on a Tuesday lunchtime and the wait wasn't long at all. The lunch special is where it's at anyway!The portion for the lunch special is huge and it comes with a nice assortment of fishies. All things considered, if you want a large, filling portion of sashimi at great quality for a reasonable price, do the lunch special! Can't really speak to anything else though :).

Reviews.Author: Sharon S.
Reviews.Content: Usually wonderful sushi an I LOVE it. Worth the hour wait. But I went during an extremely busy holiday weekend. Wait was 2 hours but we stuck it out... The fish was much smaller in quantity and quality on the sashimi deluxe platter.... Why???

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: Sushi place is ok. If you want an awesome sushi spot, check out Nobu in Malibu. That was the most unbelievable sushi spot in LA.

Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: The sushi platter lacked the fancy rolls other restaurants have, but the fish was extremely fresh. The sashimi platter was just cuts of raw fish. Most of the sushi was just fish, wasabi and rice. They brought out soy sauce holders but no soy sauce. Still confused on that. Without soy sauce, I'd say it was sorta bland. I'm going to being back a quote from another review from a korean yelper : "unlike the japanese, [koreans] like flavor in their food." Applies.Definitely was not happy with what I paid and what I got, but giving it lower than 3 would imply something worse than it was.

Reviews.Author: Corinna C.
Reviews.Content: In short:Long wait for Excellent sushi and service...Plan to go early so that you can avoid AS long of a wait and to get parking.  Reasonable prices for the quality of fish.Look out for specials too.  Last time i went a while back, they had a Uni sashimi special for only $18.  That is a steal!!!

Reviews.Author: Eileen T.
Reviews.Content: We had plan to have a sibling lunch with my sister and brother.  My sister was craving for Japanese so I suggested lunch at Sushi Gen.  Usually I like to go to Sushi Gen super early and wait for them to open the door.  But my brother works graveyard shift and cannot wake up that early.  We got to Sushi Gen around 1:30pm, and only had to wait for about 20  minutes for a table.We ordered 3 lunch entrees.  Each entree came with a bowl of miso soup, small plate of sunomono, and tofu.  I remember the tofu I had before had a very tasty stew sauce.  But this time, the tofu was rather bland.  The sauce had no flavor at all.We ordered 2 Sashimi.  My brother had his own, and my sister and I shared one.  Everything on the plate was super fresh and delicious.  My brother came to Sushi Gen before and had sushi set.  He didn't think the sushi set was memorable.  But he said the sashimi not only tastes better, but it's also a better deal.  My sister tried Sushi Gen for the first time.  She said she will never have Japanese food in SGV area again.  A lot of the Japanese restaurants in SGV are not Japanese owned, and the fish is not as fresh.We also ordered Grilled Salmon Collar to share among the 3 of us.  The salmon came with sashimi appetizer. We had to wait a little longer for the Grilled Salmon Collar, but it was well worth the wait.  The collar had so much soft and tender meat.  The ponzu sauce with scallion and daikon was a perfect dipping sauce for the meat.  The citrus flavor in the sauce was a perfect balance to the fattiness of the fish.  We all love this dish.Delicious and healthy lunch!  We enjoyed everything.

Reviews.Author: Andrea L.
Reviews.Content: Love when I get to go against the grain with a review... mostly so all of you can give me dirty yelp looks when you come across my posts.Here it is then:Not so much on this one. Sashimi was meh, rolls tiny, uni off, bill and etc. from the kitchen took forever and a day.. ..In sum, the hype just doesn't deliver. On the plus side, they WERE friendly.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: It's okay. I went on a date there because I fell for all the hoop- la that I've heard about it... Over priced - long wait - rude servers - and annoying to find parking .. Overall, c+---- wasn't impressed

Reviews.Author: Akiko I.
Reviews.Content: LOVE*  Why 4 stars?  You have to set aside at least 2 hours for lunch and parking is a pain.  We got there around 11:30am and our wait time was a little over an hour.  We were finally able to sit down and the service was pretty quick.* Sashimi lunch ($16) = GREAT DEAL!!!  The quality and cut of the sashimi was amazing.  It can't get better than that with that price.* Sashimi and Beef Teriyaki combination ($15) = It was good but honestly, Sashimi lunch was way worth it.  I still like Azuma's beef teriyaki better.Overall, this is a great place to have lunch "IF" you have the time and patients to wait for a table.  I think they take reservations so next time, we will plan ahead.  Other than that, great great lunch place.  We will definitely go back for sure!!!* Service = pretty good, quick* Price = GREAT deal at lunch* Quality = GREAT, amazing quality* Location = a little annoying since parking is a pain in that plaza.  Also, some people were leaning on my car while waiting and that really annoyed me.  (BTW, it is $2 with validation)  If you can find street parking, take it.

Reviews.Author: Evelyn C.
Reviews.Content: Ate here for Dinner a while back, everything was awesome we ate at the bar had couple bottles of sake between 4 of us.  My most memorable was the Spanish mackerel! try the bar sometime. Went here very recently with my best friend from back home and we sat down for lunch, I had the sashimi lunch (15$) amazing price, came out with miso soup, steamed tofu, rice and a platter of different sashimis and a piece of cooked fish, that day was salmon, but the waiter told me every day its different.  All in all it was really satisfying and just a great experience for my friend too.  we also got kumamoto oysters, my friend had only tried oysters once so I wanted her 2nd experience to be great, I remember it took me a handful of times to like oysters, maybe cause I only had mediocre ones, but she was in love and I think it was her favorite thing there!  I couldnt believe how packed they were, they open at 11:15am this was a tuesday, we got there around 11:20am, i made reservations, we had to wait! wow. just opened and packed already lol. luckily we waited for max 15 minutes.  I will most definitely be back!!

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11:45a on a Friday. No wait for lunch if you go to the sushi bar. Traditional and pricey if you don't do the lunch specials. Good hard to find fish that is VERY fresh. Had (kanpachi) amberjack for the first time, firm and deliciously buttery, not as "fatty" as yellowtail. Yellowtail belly and Japanese snapper was delicious as well. Japanese mackerel was meh, never really liked the slightly chalky texture that mackerel has.If i come here next time and sit at the bar, I'm asking the sushi chef for omakase because that seems more economical to get a tasting of all that is fresh that day. Also, note that all the lunch specials are made by "sous" chefs, and not the pro sushi chefs that man the sushi bar. I have yet to have the chance to try it, but it seems very popular. You have to be seated at a table to get the specials, they are off limits at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Charlotte Y.
Reviews.Content: I'll give it 5 stars for LUNCH onlyFor $15 dollars you get a generous amount of raw fish. For what you pay, its an amazing deal. Between the assortment of sashimi and little side dishes such as agedashi tofu, miso soup  :) and a giant portion of rice, I leave really, really full.Bang for your buck.

Reviews.Author: Mel L.
Reviews.Content: Location:Easy place to find, easy to park but no parking.Service: Nice and SpeedyFood:Very Fresh and Delicious. Its worth coming at lunch because its decently priced compared to dinner, but its high quality sushi so i can't really say much about it. Try the Chirashi ! all meals comes with miso soup.

Reviews.Author: Chitown D.
Reviews.Content: Biggest let down by Yelpers to date. This place was mediocre at best. I had edamame (cold, almost raw, and saltless), miso soup (best item of what I ordered), spicy tuna roll (just ok), and CA roll (tasteless). The place was jam packed, which is weird because it is SO unremarkable. So unremarkable that I've said enough already. You can do better. WAY better.

Reviews.Author: Carolyne H.
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about this place! Sushi-Gen is always packed so reservation is recommended. It's not that expensive. I love sashimi and rolls here, the cut is generous and the fish is fresh and tender. Great place for traditional and authentic Japanese cuisine.I recommend the sashimi deluxe plate, the UNI is amazing, spicy tuna roll, unagi and salmon.A MUST for any sashimi - sushi fanatic.

Reviews.Author: Jessyka L.
Reviews.Content: Don't think this place needs another rave review of it's food, so I'll just offer some tips. It seems like the main issue here is the wait. I've been here numerous times and never had to wait! One time was a on Wednesday night at 6pm, and every other time was weekday lunch at 11:15 (right before they open). The lot outside the restaurant gets filled up sometimes, but there is plenty of street parking one block south on 3rd between alameda and central. Best sushi restaurant in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Eddie T.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Heard about this place through a few friends who heard I was moving up to the neighborhood.  I always need a handful of restaurants to choose for lunch when I am post call.  Sushi/Sashimi lunches superb value for great tasting fish.I arrived around 1130 and of course there was a line.  We put our name down and noticed some open seats at the sushi bar.  After inquiring about those seats, found out the bar was only for a-la-carte orders.  Wait was about 10 -15 minutes for table. Menu simple, I went for the "Sashimi" lunch.  They also have another selection of Sashimi that was considerably more expensive, but from what the server said, it's considerably a larger portion with more varieties of sashimi (next time!).  Miso soup, pickled cucumbers and bowl of rice came with my order.  Sashimi portioned well for the price and the fish very fresh.  Tuna varieties were fabulous with melt in your mouth texture.  Nothing but simple straight forward great tasting sashimi.  Service attentive, fast and on point.  Perfect for lunch.Left the place stuffed even with the smaller sashimi portion.  I would not come here for anything other than sushi/sashimi.  Come during lunch for the ultimate value, but expect a wait.  Will I return? YES!

Reviews.Author: Nicole Y.
Reviews.Content: I had the uni dinner, it came with a whole box of uni, nine sashimi pieces, miso soup, rice, seaweed, and it is just $38, not a bad price at all.  The sashimi is fresh, but not the best I have ever had.  I still think that Akasaka has the freshiest sashimi.Maybe its just me.

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: I hate your lines Sushi Gen, but your Sashimi is damn good!!  I was not sure what to expect when I was waiting outside with the other 20 customers but it was definitely worth the wait.  If you are a fan of Sushi or Sashimi, the best deal in town is Sushi Gens Sashimi lunch special for $15.  You get a total of 12 different items of all varieties on a plate along with miso soup, bowl of rice, and tofu.  The sashimi is so fresh and so delicious that it practically melts in your mouth.  The parking is $2 with validation for under 2 hours but if you come for lunch the parking lot gets a little crowded.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany S.
Reviews.Content: Friends keep talking about this place, finally tried, Sushi Gen did live up to my expectationsPro:* Lunch sashimi combo for only $15 (comes with soup, salad, and rice). Big enough for one person unless you are a big eater* Tuna sashimi here is amazing, just like many wrote before, it "melts in your mouth"* Food came out quickly even with the entire restaurant fullCons:* Long wait even for the weekday lunch (about 40 minutes or so)* Loud. So many customers were talking loudly making this restaurant an anti-romantic place* For the kind of popularity Sushi Gen has, I am surprise to see their decor is just averageHints:* If you are not going to order their combo/lunch special, no need to wait in line, their sushi counters are usually open, but they have a 4 orders/person minimum policy* Don't park on the street, park in the plaza's parking lot and get validate, it's only $2 for the first two hours

Reviews.Author: Brad L.
Reviews.Content: I stopped by last night before making the drive back from LA and as usual, it was amazing. I had the spicy tuna and a few pieces of nigiri. This place never disappoints.

Reviews.Author: Marial L.
Reviews.Content: Dinning was once an artisan experience.   My Yelper friend, Nick H. had written a review which got me thinking of our recent visit.Actually I started coming to Sushi-Gen way way back before its expansion, let's say twenty years ago maybe? I remember, even though the restaurant was packed all the time, nevertheless, it was cozy, friendly; we enjoyed sitting at sushi bar chatting with the chef and got some goodies on the house all the time. On the contrary, on my most recent visit for lunch, the restaurant was packed still, but the server was so mechanical, all the good old  tradition of fine service was gone. We're so rushed through the entire time.  So do I want to come back?   Yes, I still miss the Chef's Deluxe Sashimi Combination! - and...at such time I shall be prepared for  "Zen" in me. :)

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen has become me and my coworkers' go-to spot for sashimi in LA. There are six of us, and we get 3 sashimi deluxes and 6 bowls of rice and we are good to go! The sashimi deluxe plate screams quality, presentation, and variety. Its like I took a pen and checked off the entire sushi list. The deluxe can easily fill up two people so it is perfect for groups or couples. I once starved myself for the day in an attempt to eat one deluxe by myself for dinner. I failed. To conclude, this place is a great deal and a must try.

Reviews.Author: Susan L.
Reviews.Content: OMG what yummy goodness! it's time to do the happy food dance! if you've seen me happy w/ my food then you know what i'm talking about. the head bopping cuz the food is just soooo goood and satisfying!the only thing that's bad is the pricing for the sushi. there is NONE listed!! so you blindly mark off which fresh fish you want and pay the bill when it come.. kinda scary.. well for me at least, but just be prepared to pay a lot and just enjoy the food :) the toro (fatty tuna) wow! i have nothing to compare it with since i've never had it. but wow it was good. it just melts in your mouth! no chewing necessary. grandma this ones for you. haha. i just put it in and rub it against the roof of my mouth and it just melts away.Soft shell crab appetizer: yummy as well. you can even see the eggs in the crab! very fresh.Shrimp tempura: was ehh.. a little to greasy for me and i like grease!Beware they do run out of selection towards the end of the night so come early. we did wait for about 30-40 mins but i think it was well worth the wait for my 1st time there.our bill for 3 girls, was 90 including tax and tip, so it wasn't too bad at all. but then again we didn't order too much.

Reviews.Author: Jannice A.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere of this place reminds me of the Sushi places in Studio City (where I grew up) and thats a great thing! White/asians packing up the sushi bar....Completely unlike any other sushi places in lil tokyo-- im speaking architecturally and the environment.Albacore sashimi and sushi were soo delicious and flawless. Of course it is a bit more expensive... 2 people came out to be a $100 bill. However the couple next to us (tourists) got away with like a $26 bill for a roll and 2 pieces of sushi (Why did they come here?) Not a fan of the Giant clams. Also the chicken dinner-- too much sauce. My new fav sushi place in Lil tokyo. Expect a short wait, as this place is ALWAYS PACKED with white and asians.

Reviews.Author: pauline c.
Reviews.Content: I'm actually quite torn on how many stars to give this place.  On one hand, the sashimi was pretty fresh.  I got the sashimi deluxe, and it was pretty deluxy.  It was huge, so by the end of the meal, I was pretty sure I didn't want to see any sashimi in a long long time.  The plate consisted of sake (salmon), hokkigai (surf clam, the half reddish half whitish tongue looking one), toro (fatty tuna), tuna, whitefish, yellowtail, squid, octopus, tamago, shrimp, spicy tuna etc.  Anyway, I was kind of disappointed that there was only 2 pieces of sake(salmon) because that just happens to be my favorite.  Also, the hokkigai was a little bit fishy, and the yellow tail was a little dry.Also, I am not a fan of octopus or squid, so that was just wasted space.  And, what is up with LA and spicy tuna?  That is hardly what I think of as deluxe sashimi.  But apparently, it's a staple of LA "sushi" dining and what people think of as exquisite and fantastic.  Come on guys... bring on the amaebi, uni, oysters...I think it was good to get the deluxe to taste a little bit of everything, so that IF i ever come back, i'd know to order a la carte.  And only get what I want to eat.  Ok this is really starting to sound like 3 stars, but the tuna was pretty exquisite.

Reviews.Author: Hana J.
Reviews.Content: Get the Sushi Deluxe. $15 and it comes with everything you want--fat slices of every kind of sashimi. It's worth every penny. Even the biggest sashimi eater will be satisfied. I ate to my absolute fullest (I love sashimi) and still, I had half leftover.Don't waste your money getting stuff like California rolls or other platters. A table next to us kept on ordering tons of stuff, but none of it amounted to the diversity in the deluxe.  One star off for charging for green tea and ginger. We're already dishing out quite a lot!!Oh, and come either right when it opens or around 2. If not, expect to wait over an hour. I warned ya!!

Reviews.Author: Elle C.
Reviews.Content: I love this little spot when I'm in the mood for sushi!The fish is extremely fresh, and served just at the right temperature. You can tell they don't leave fish out to get greasy on the surface. Traditional fare and true to it's roots, no 'fusion' rolls or anything fancy, just straight up Japanese food!Parking can be difficult, small lot but you can have your ticket validated. Wait wasn't too long, as there is alot of traffic but all within good reason.

Reviews.Author: Gino E.
Reviews.Content: I hated this place. No Las Vegas roll or Mexican roll??? How disappointing...Really though, like ODB, you better like it raw. No deep frying or stuffed "ethnic" rolls... just straight up, delicious raw fish. The sushi snob I was with ordered just about every fish on the menu (possibly, twice), and every single one was delicious. The fish was so fresh, it tasted like it just came out of the ocean (or Echo Park lake). Just don't asked me what I ate, because my response is going to be "fish."Definitely a hidden gem in a mini-mall. Great service, attentive sushi chefs, and ocean deliciousness. If you're not down with rawness and need your sushi deep fried with witty names, read my review below for Niko Niko.

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the dinner sashimi combo with side orders of toro, salmon, and yellowtail belly.Fresh.The portion was generous and the quality was excellent.  The toro just melts in your mouth.  Heck, all the fish they served did... this is THE place to go for fresh sushi!  Be prepared for the long wait though....

Reviews.Author: Edward H.
Reviews.Content: I know this place is ridiculously hyped up...but it actually is hyped up for the right reasons. Like everyone else, I came here to try the sashimi lunch special. And although I did not think that the sashimi was the greatest pieces of fish to ever grace my taste buds, for the price no other place can compare. For  like 16 dollars you get a abundant amount of high quality fish, some tofu, miso soup, and rice. You cannot go wrong with that. The fish is definitely the highest quality you'll be able to find for that price, and would definitely even compete with some of the best sushi restaurants in los angeles. My favorites were probably the toro and the yellowtail.Came again for dinner and order alacarte from the dinner menu. Got the toro, uni, yellowtail belly, salmon, abalone, and monk fish liver. Absolutely divine. Top 3 best sushi I've had for sure.

Reviews.Author: Sophia L.
Reviews.Content: Really not quite sure what the big deal is... Ordered a variety of sushi and while it was decent, I'm not sure I'd wait in that line often. I did like the hamachi collar which was nicely grilled with just the right amount of fat. Perhaps next time, a meal at the sushi bar would bump up a few stars. Oh, and the total meal was $70 person which I thought was too high for the quality of sushi we had....

Reviews.Author: Rick W.
Reviews.Content: There's only so much I can say about this joint. Many have wrote about it, and I truly backed it up. No lie. At first, I thought it could be a overhyped place and with all the reccomendation I've gotten, I finally gave it a shot. Came on a lunch time, party of 2 still had us waiting for at least half an hour. However, The wait was totally worthed it.Let me break it down. Had the Beef Teriyaki with Sashimi Combination along, with Toro, Uni, Salmon, Japanese Mackarrell and Monk Liver. The beef teriyaki was cooked to perfection which really caught me off guard, it was tender, juicy and its medium rare was just how I expected. Of course, the sashimi were fresh. The sushi were just so fresh and excellent. I really thought it was one of the best sushi I ever had. The bill came out to 60 even with tips and taxes included. Sometimes, being overhyped can be bad, I was wrong this time. The prize was totally worthed it, and for its wait, I'll do it again.

Reviews.Author: Nathan W.
Reviews.Content: My dad recommended this place to me when I wanted to get some sushi in Little Tokyo. I ended paying a lot of money. Over $80 for three people at the sushi bar, we all got hot tea, and a complimentary calendar at the end, but damn. It was worth it though. Our sushi chef was cool and hooked us up with his recommendations of the day. The Japanese cod with yuzu pepper sauce on top was so great. My girlfriend's cousin got the monk fish liver which was also quite good. The best thing though was the toro nigiri though. Man that was great. Some of the freshest sushi I've had, it was fabulous.My dad always said the test of a good sushi restaurant is actually the sweet egg. I've always thought it is the sushi rice, and the rice was perfect. Usually when a sushi restaurant has mastered the "small things" you can bet they got the fish down pat.It is always busy though, so I wouldn't bring a large group on the fly, cuz you will be waiting. Parties of 3 or less seemed to get seats much quicker.

Reviews.Author: Josie C.
Reviews.Content: An unassuming (but fanastic) find in the quaint Japanese shopping malls of downtown L.A. !They had some cuts of fish that you would not necessarily find in run-of-the-mill sushi places such as yellowtail belly, sea urchin, and monkfish liver. The Chirashi dinner special had great value for the price! You get to try all of their main cuts of fish (minus salmon, but I think they were out that night). Yellowtail, snapper, tuna, belly, squid, octopus, plus tamago and eel. Recommended for those who want to try a variety of sushi without the pressure of doing a la carte.Kudos to my Aviator connoisseur who was brave to venture out of his California rolls by gettting the Sushi Dinner special instead. It had the same cuts of fish as Chirashi, but sushi-style. He explored what fish he liked (and did not like). He also made reservations and discovered the place (double down bonus points).We also ordered the sweet shrimp (large portions, hint of natural sweetness) and monkfish liver appetizer (tasty). They serve up the fried shrimp head too, a gesture by the chef to indicate the shrimp was indeed, fresh.Make note of the 4 order minimum per person if you sit at the sushi bar. Parking is limited on the mall lot, but Jtown Plaza across the street has a competitive flat rate. Bonus points for not having the pomp and circumstance of WeHo or Hollywood.A step above the dizzying array of sushi places in L.A. Save to the list of places to go when downtown.

Reviews.Author: Linda SingaSong S.
Reviews.Content: DDDDdrrrrrOOOOOLLLLL!!! I have never tasted such fresh sashimi before in my life! My sister & her bf have been debating and arguing which sushi restaurants reign number one. First pick by the bf was Yoshi's...it was great! Can't complain. Now it was my sista's turn, & her poison was Sushi Gen. Me??? I just let both of them feed me :) This place was bumpin when we arrived, but thankfully, we got a seat in seconds by the entrance. We started with hot sake. Smooth, hot, and just right. We started out by ordering the [Sashimi Dinner] and couple rolls of albacore tuna, fatty tuna, yellowfish, salmon, Ikura, and I forget the others. When the Sashimi Dinner arrived to our table, we def got the curious stares from our neighboring diners. The two ladies to my left immediately asked, "oh my..what is that dish called?? that looks delicious!" Yes....it was delish, fresh, melts in your mouth, and I was left speechless guzzling down smoked salmon & tuna and washing it down w/sake. Then we got our sushi pieces. The Ikura (big fish eggs) was just as we remembered it as lil girls...fun to eat and a burst of happiness in each egg. I ordered the fatty tuna and told my sis to try it. She was shocked at how it melted in her mouth like a dream. The rest of our feast was....a feast. I didn't have the heart to give it a complete 5 stars because I felt our waitress had a hard time communicating with us. We asked her about a sushi we didn't recognize and she got someone else to answer our question. But other than that... this place met my standards and exceeded my expectations. Sushi Nirvana tucked in heart of Little Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Jane D.
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind  having a meal in a super crowded and busy restaurant, you will like Sushi-Gen. For me, having Japanese food not only is a treat to your taste buds, to your eyes, but also to your mind. I don't like to have to shove my raw fish down hurry and leave because I could hear my neighboring tables' conversations and almost could touch their elbows. The food is alright. I have had much better raw fish as well as more creative Japanese cuisine. This is more of a straight up sushi place. It's just okay for me dawg.

Reviews.Author: Mina W.
Reviews.Content: If you're wondering what a traditional sushi bar in Japan might be like, this is it!  There are no bells and whistles here folks, just a plain restaurant where the fish is the shining star.Word to the wise: order the omakase at the sushi bar!  The sushi chef will have free range to prepare the highest quality fish available at that moment.  It's fun being surprised and not knowing whats coming next.  Everything the chef brought out was amazingly fresh and melts in your mouth.  Expect a hefty bill, but you definitely get what you pay for :)      Outside of Tokyo, this is probably my favorite sushi bar.  Worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Cheryl F.
Reviews.Content: I love the sashimi lunch special here.  Such great food at great value. The only thing is the long wait for lunch if you aren't already in line by 10:45a.  But knowing that, I wouldn't come here if I'm not prepared to wait.  Once seated, the food comes pretty fast.

Reviews.Author: Melody L.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here ever since I was little. That would strike anyone that knows me as a little odd, since coming here when I was little implies that my dad took me here, and my dad doesn't take me out to eat anywhere other than Seafood Town in Torrance. So that definitely says something. My dad drives 40 minutes out of his way to get his sashimi at this finnnnneeee establishment.We always arrive about 20-30 minutes before the restaurant opens for lunch and we are never the only ones waiting for them to open.   My dad usually orders the sashimi plate, and depending on what I feel like I'll either get a teriyaki beef and sashimi combo or just teriyaki or just sashimi, but regardless of what I order, I never finish. The fish is freshly cut and the price is exceptional.Service is generally good, not necessarily warm, but they're as quick as they can manage with as many people as there are.

Reviews.Author: KevCheng ..
Reviews.Content: This place is the standard with which I measure every other Sushi place by.The best thing about this place is the essential ingredient for every sushi restaurant on this Earth. Fresh. Good Fish.You can tell these people did their homework, someone probably got up in the middle of the night to go buy the best fish at the wharf or SOMETHING, 'cause the fish is always top notch and beautifully cut and arranged. I'm not a terribly experinced sushi eater, so I sit at the table and order their lavishly loaded deluxe sashimi combo ($30 dinner, $25 lunch, worth every penny.) They also have a list of very nice sake (I don't know my sake very well yet, but I'd humbly recommend the Kurosawa.)Of course, if you know what you're doing, sit at the sushi bar and enjoy the incredible work of the chefs. This place never dissapoints.

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: Where else can you get three slices of toro AND generous servings of assorted sashimi (with rice, shrimp tempura, miso soup to boot) for $23 at dinnertime in LA?!My mouth is salivating at the mere thought of Sushi-Gen's sashimi deluxe dinner.  Chunks of ruby red tuna nestle against fresh albacore; glistening slices of sweetly-glazed squid lay against little nuggets of yet more toro; a piece of chewy octopus, shredded crabmeat, and a mound of savory spicy tuna salad add textural contrast.All this sashimi goodness is pillowed upon beds of undressed seaweed with luscious tamago on the side.  The only disappointing portion lies on the NE corner of the plate - a dry and flavorless hunk of broiled salmon - but this can easily be overlooked in light of the platter's true value.Accompaniments include your standard rice and miso soup and cucumber salad.  The tempura deserves a mention for the shrimp is lightly battered and fried, giving a crisp bite to the succulent meat that is surprisingly non-greasy.It's lovely to walk to Sushi-Gen (from my place it's about 2 miles one-way, a perfect distance to whet the appetite) and to contentedly stroll back through the cool night air after yet another satisfying meal.

Reviews.Author: Lauren Y.
Reviews.Content: Delicious.I've been to a lot of upper-scale sushi restaurants, and Gen can fight with the best of them. The day I visited everything was high-quality and authentic Japanese. Wasabi was freshly made and the fish tasted like it was caught that day. I found out that the amaebi I ate was shipped in that day, and I could definitely taste it.I highly recommend this restaurant. Delicious oysters, sushi, sashimi, and green tea. Very authentic.

Reviews.Author: Garrick F.
Reviews.Content: I went here during an impromptu food tour of the Little Tokyo area while Chris S was visiting from out of town.  This was our third stop after eating at Wurstkuche and Orochon, so needless to say, we weren't exactly starving at this point.  We got there a little after they had opened and were lucky enough to grab one of the last seats at the sushi bar before they reached capacity.  After we got seated, the waitress took our drink orders and the sushi chef turned to us and asked us what we wanted.  Only problem is, we had no menus and we werent hungry enough to roll omakase style. We sat there for a good few seconds staring back at him as we tried to conjure up any and all of the sushi names that we could think of.  We ended up ordering uni x2, toro x3, amaebi with fried heads, unagi, hamachi x2, and yellow tail cheek. I think we did a pretty good job.  Everything is prepared right in front of you and oh man once it hits your lips... can't stop, won't stop, get it get it. Not having a menu was kind of fun because you get to see the other patrons struggle with their orders just as much as you have been, haha.  Apparently, one of my friends said that you just have to ask for a menu if you're seated at the bar... but what's the fun in that? Our ten items came out to about 100 bucks.  I think it was worth it, and I'm gonna go there hungry next time and try the omakase

Reviews.Author: Candice L.
Reviews.Content: Authentic, authentic, authentic. Came for dinner on a Sat night.No substitutions for any of the dishes and no soypaper! Was a little sad about that.Made reservations, but came well before 5pm. There was already a line outside, so make sure to come early!ParkingLot parking. 3 hours for $3 with validation.Seating&DecorTypical home-like Japanese restaurant. A lot more space than I thought.. bar and table seating. We were the 1st ones seated for the night, but the place filled up VERY quickly, and there were still lines when we finished our meal.ServiceQuick, considering how incredibly busy this place is/gets. I'm sure you'd get your food much quicker sitting at the bar.Food&DrinksSashimi Deluxe- a variety of sashimi on a plate. Literally melts in your mouth. Quite glorious.Spicy/Regular scallop handrolls- Spicy, yet you could still taste the freshness of scallops. Salmon, albacore, yellowtail, yellowtail belly, toro- The yellowtail belly and toro were my favorite of the night!Eel and avocado roll- The sauce wasn't overpowering, and the eel was warm and fresh.Sapporo and sake- Good, but I'd rather fill my tummy with food!PriceRather pricey, but def worth your buck if you love sushi! I think coming for lunch would be really great, since the lunch combo is so affordable. I would def come if I didn't have work. Prepare to spend here!Loved this place, but found it a little too authentic from time to time. Menus were mostly in Japanese and weren't very descriptive. Wonderful experience, but I def need my fusion sushi fix now!

Reviews.Author: Charles O.
Reviews.Content: I've seen this place everytime I go to Kagaya and always wanted to try it. My buddy recommended it and I gave it a shot today. For $50 along with a 15% tip I was able to get the following: Spicy Tuna Hand RollYellowtail SushiAlbacore SushiSalmon SushiGrilled Yellowtail PlateFor the freshness $50 is a great value.  It was amazingly fresh. It's no wonder there is always a wait here. I sat at the sushi bar to bypass the line. The only problem is that I didn't have access to their lunch menu...which restricted what I could order at the sushi bar and made my bill higher. No worries because it forced me to test out how fresh the fish was. It passed with flying colors. I barely used any soy sauce becuase I didn't want to miss out on the great fresh taste. Definitly in the top 5 for sushi spots in LA. The attmosphere is old school sushi restaurant. No frills but old school japan feel to it. You can also validate for 2 hours in the parking lot for $2.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay L.
Reviews.Content: We showed up pretty early for lunch since we were told that people start lining up at 10:30. Doors open at 11:15. So we got lost and showed up at around 10:45ish. We were the second people there. 11 rolls around and people come flooding through the gates. We stood in line and when the doors open, some group really has the audacity to just walk in right in front of everyone. Gr! So basically there was plenty of room for all the people in line but I would suggest getting here early because a wait forms immediately. They are pretty prepared and speedy because right away they ask for drinks, bring out the plates of sashimi and leave it chilling on a counter in preparation of all of those who they know are going to order it. So we ordered the sashimi (pretty typical) and the combination sashimi with teriyaki beef. Both are such a great deal. Large portions and great quality. The sashimi is fresh and the beef is pretty typical teriyaki beef. It was good, not drenched in sauce and not too fatty. For the price this place is good, but I can't say it's the best sashimi I've had. They charge for hot tea also, just an fyi. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Author: Emerson L.
Reviews.Content: If the sashimi were any fresher here, they would have to start passing out "SHAMU" nametags to all the patrons of this restaurant.It's more expensive that most of the Japanese restaurants I've been to, but you will be surprised by the amount of FRESH sushi and food you will get here.

Reviews.Author: Robert A.
Reviews.Content: Lets just say that when anyone talks about sushi that this place comes into my mind first and foremost!Have you ever tried a fatty tuna that melts in your mouth? Yellow tail belly sounds interesting, right? Well it has a very interesting and unique texture that leaves your mouth watering for more. Sea Urchin is tricky business, but not at this place... So fresh and tasty, that you will be begging for more. Also, sweet shrimp is sweet as can be. I ordered mine fried and it had so much flavor to it.THE KEY THING TO REMEMBER IS THAT EVERYTHING IS FRESH AND CLEAN!You indulge so much, but it is so worth it. Location is in the heart of Little Tokyo and the wait is not too bad. Friendly waiters and hostess, who help you understand the menu and food you have questions about.If you are looking to suppress that sushi craving, please try this place and you will agree that no other place will suffice! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Ben R.
Reviews.Content: Eaten here for the first time today and i had to say that I am impress. I recommend anyone who hate to wait in a long line to go there early. The restaurant open for dinner at 5.30 PM, We got there at about 6 and there were already a line forming infront of the restaurant. We had to wait for about twenty minutes, but it was worth the wait. I had an Unagi dinner set with a couple orders of Toro. I got to say that the quality of the food here is exceptional!!! I would be coming back again!!! The price of the food is not expensive for what it is!!! Totally Worth it for Sushi Fan.

Reviews.Author: su l.
Reviews.Content: My first time actually eating here was this past Friday with few friends.  This was my third attempt to eat at this restaurant and I was finally successful. The first two times I gave up waiting and went somewhere else.  The third time, I waited an hour and half but I must say the wait was well worthwhile. Sushi was fresh and the waitresses were very attentive even though it was a full house. While waiting to be seated I made small talk with other people who were also waiting and found out they have a lunch special for $15. I would definetely rate this restaurant as one of my top places to eat sushi.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: There are two kinds of sushi places: places where I would consider ordering omakase, and places where I would never consider doing such a thing in a million years. I'd estimate that 90% of the sushi places around L.A. fit in the latter category. One rule of thumb: if they have "philly rolls" on the menu, don't order omakase. I'm not so snobby that I avoid places where I'll order some rolls, I just think the two types of places should be rated differently. Sushi-Gen is an Omakase spot. This has an important implication for customers (and reviewers): If you go to Sushi-Gen and order spicy tuna rolls or the typical round-eye "sushi deluxe", you're not making the most of the place. Not only do you miss what they have to offer,  you usually overpay for what you get. It's like going to be best wine bar in town and paying $12 for a beer instead of $15 for a great unusal wine you wouldn't have known to order yourself! With that backdrop, I think the first criteria for Omakase is that the ingredients should be absolutely stellar and fresh. No problems here: Sushi-Gen's fish is very high quality and fresh, as others have pointed out. Additionally, the rice is a bit warm - when combined with the cool, fresh fish it creates a very nice sensation on the pallatte. The second is an interesting mix of selections. If I'm giving the chef carte-blanche to choose my meal for me there should be some surprises. Indeed, there were a few dishes I'd never seen, and some I'd never heard of! One example was a spicy scallop sushi, which is to be eaten WITHOUT soy sauce. It had a lemony flavor to it with a subtle mix of spices. Finally, I we live in a showbiz town and I like some drama in my Omakase. Surprise me. Make it a conversation! My friend I had lunch with told me while we ate that he liked chopped up tuna. The chef overheard this and made a special toro roll that mixed chopped up tuna with some little fruit pieces - it was phenomenal!!! There was a flow to the meal and the sequence of dishes was as exciting as it was fufilling. Bonus points: we said we wanted to spend around $50 each, and the tab was $51 (pre-tax). So, that's why I give this place 5 stars. I think the price is reasonable for what you get when you make the most of what Sushi-Gen has to offer. It is unfortunate that people order a salmon roll, give this place 3 stars, and say it's overpriced. Fortunately that leaves more seats at the bar. I will be back...

Reviews.Author: Christy S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Sushi-Gen on two separate occasions, first time with my boyfriend and second time with 3 other friends. I was not impressed the first time and thought I would give it another shot so went back for a second time. Both occasions were dinner. However, still don't understand why this place is so highly rated.Food quality is average at best. It's better than most sushi places, but it is definitely NOT the best sushi place I've been to in the LA area. There are a number of great sushi restaurants in the SouthBay that offer better quality for the same price. Both times, I spent around $70 - $80 per person.And then there is the service. The waiters are okay, nothing really to complain about. Although, we did get our check even before we finished eating. It seemed like they just wanted us to finish up quickly. However, the host at the place is a total snob. Our reservation was at 7PM and one of my friends checked in with the host BEFORE 7PM was lectured about how our entire party needs to be arrived at 7PM in order to be seated. Finally when the 3 out of the 4 people arrived, still BEFORE 7, and the last person was literally 20 feet away from the front door, I checked in again and told the host the last person would be walking in in the next 8 seconds, but I still was told to let him know when my entire party arrive. Seriously, can't make this kind of stuff up. That whole process was a pain in the butt. If I want to go to a snobby place, I would head over to Beverly Hills. It's the last thing I expect from a Japanese restaurant.For that, I will not return to or recommend Sushi-Gen until they can significantly improve their food quality and customer service. But if you really want to try this place because of the other reviews, I suggest you making a reservation because it is totally not worth the ridiculous long wait. Also, make sure your entire party arrive at least 15 minutes before your reservation time to avoid the snobbiness. As for the food quality, just hold your breath and hope for the best.

Reviews.Author: Brandon W.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi lets start there... this is my favorite sushi bar in Southern California, if not my favorite sushi bar period.  The quality is always top notch.  The service is always excellent.  This is the one place where I will splurge and get mostly sashimi and skip the nigiri.  The fish here is second to none.  This is also one of the few places where I will eat omakase.I have never left here without a fully belly and a smile on my face.

Reviews.Author: O O.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this joint but now I'm disappointed. I sat at the bar and still, the fish was disappointing. No essence of freshness left at all.Worst part was I ordered live sweet shrimp and they tried to pass dead ones to me. I called them on it because I know my live fresh shrimp in a heartbeat. At first they denied it. Then they fessed up. And I guess in their remorse, they actually sent an order of a more recently dead sweet shrimp to me. It was a nice gesture, but dead sweet shrimp is still dead so don't lie to me thinking I don't know my sushi and don't pass on crap and charge high prices for it. I asked them why said it was live sweet shrimp when it was obviously mushy and dead in my mouth and they said that it WAS alive in the morning, but they peeled it all in the morning to save time. these people do not care about their sushi at all anymore. sad to say. At these prices, they really should.

Reviews.Author: M F.
Reviews.Content: Some coworkers asked if I wanted to come along for lunch. Sure! It was friday and even though I don't really eat meat with the exception of salmon, I figured I could find something to eat at Sushi-Gen.The parking lot was paid parking and incredibly small. We found a space and then joined the rest of our, party waiting outside. I think we waited for about 30 minutes before being seated.Many of my coworkers came along for the sashimi plate, so they were happy. Unfortunatly pretty much the only vegetarian option on the menu was a veggie roll. It was the same price as the sashimi plate, at $15, but I ordered it anyway. It had to be good, right?Everyone got their soups and eventually our meals showed up. Well, everyone except for the veggie rolls. We saw our waitress and asked her about the rolls and she kinda ran off. Finally, once the rest of the people had consumed about half of their meals, our veggie rolls showed up. Although the rolls were fine, they weren't special and I could have made the same item at home for probably a dollar.For me, this place was way overpriced and not worth the wait. I am glad I went along to spend time with people and not for the food.

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: 1. Effin packed for dinner. Make reservations or get there early.2. Melt in your mouth salmon sashimi.3. Melt in your mouth albacore sashimi.4. Melt in your mouth hamachi sashimi.5. Service was meh.6. Dining area felt a bit cramped, but not in a gross ew that dude stinks way.Go hungry and leave happy. Seriously.

Reviews.Author: Vinh N.
Reviews.Content: There is only one other thing that I love as much as sushi and that is sashimi!!!  But most of the time I can't afford sashimi as its more expensive =( I was downtown visiting a friend and we needed to decide on a place for lunch.  What a perfect time to try out this sushi place in Little Tokyo.  A sushi place in Little Tokyo, no really?  But seriously the wait wasn't as long as I had read on previous posts on Yelp, but it may have been the fact that today was a Monday afternoon and people haven't built up the eating out yet.  After about 10/15 minutes we were seated and we noticed that everybody sitting at a table ordered the same thing and it was what was recommended to me by an acquaintance.  The Sashimi!!!The fish was fresh and tasted wonderful.  Different cuts of tuna, baked salmon, yellow tail, squid, octopus, baked tuna for only $15.  What a deal!  The lunch dish also came with cold tofu, miso soup, rice, hot green tea and 2 mini veggie/salad dishes.Service was on par with the food and overall I had such a great time and would recommend this place for lunch to everyone!  This place and Daikokuya will be my go to places for lunch in downton.

Reviews.Author: Brian G.
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Sushi Gen, I know what it feels like to be a bird circling its prey.  For the past 6 years or so, I'd always try to make it a point to visit Sushi Gen, but for whatever reason I just wouldn't be able to go.  So when a business meeting warranted visiting downtown LA, I made a straight beeline to Sushi Gen for my long awaited sushi dinner.The lot parking is almost always full, but there is plenty of street parking around the corner if you don't mind walking a bit.  Luckily, we were able to snag a table for two at the sushi bar at 7:30pm in a mere 3 minutes.  All the stars must have been aligned because I think everyone else had waited at least 15 minutes.  The action behind the sushi bar is happening.  I counted at least 6 sushi chefs and a handful of other guys working the back of the sushi bar.I make it a habit of ordering omakase only at the better sushi establishments so I had no qualms putting our dining adventure in the trustworthy hands of our sushi chef.  Overall, very impressed with the fresh quality of the fish.  Kanpachi, mirugai, toro, and ebi were particularly delicious.  The shrimp head miso soup was robust and flavorful as well.  IMO the portions were actually quite generous and the sushi to rice ratio was just right.  We could have stopped at the end of the omakase, but the kanpachi and toro were just too good that we placed another order.This may not be the best sushi joint in LA, but Sushi Gen definitely ranks in the top 20.  And in this town, that's still saying quite a lot.

Reviews.Author: Duke C.
Reviews.Content: Just go.  Right now.  Discover why Sushi-Gen is such a LA staple now for sushi.  After reading this of course! :D  hahahLast Saturday the gang took me out for a late birthday dinner at Sushi-Gen in Little Tokyo. It really is a hotspot and a staple in LA.  People have high expectations when they go to Little Tokyo for Japanese food and many disappoint but never Sushi-Gen.  Whenever I pass by this place there's always a line out the door, sushi bar filled with patrons, dining room filled with people from all sorts of life: businessman, families, college students... Because of the crowd, you can say that their sushi and sashimi will always be fresh. LA's very picking with sushi since we have such a wide selection and when a restaurant has been gathering crowds like Sushi-Gen for as long as they have, you know they are doing something right.I had the sashimi dinner set and that night it came with  akami, toro, maguro, hamachi, ika, tako, whitefish, spicy tuna, crab, and konjac.  Fresh fresh fresh fresh fresh!  Especially the spicy tuna.. O M G.  Adding salmon roe totally adds a whole nother dimension to texture.  Delicious.  Not a big fan of whitefish and wish it had salmon on there instead, but that's just a minor detail :PThe dinner set also came with tempura.  Perfectly fried shrimp, potato, zucchini, and eggplant.  I almost considered ordering another a la carte haha.If you love fish collar, definitely try the yellowtail collar.  It's a little bit annoying to eat, but really, nothing's more perfect than that!I shall save up and try their omakase next time since I've been hearing a lot about it.  Also if dinner price is too much, try it out during lunch!

Reviews.Author: Julie K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is good. It's a really reliable sushi spot in LA but always, always busy!The vibe is very Japanese. I wouldn't say this is the best sushi ever, but it is consistently good. I would stay away from the sushi dinner and go with either the Sashimi + rice bowl or Chirashi. I was surprised that neither the Sashimi dinner, Chirashi or the Sushi dinner included salmon as I feel Salmon is one of the staples of any combination at a sushi joint.  Other people that dined with me felt depraved of salmon and put in a side order...only to say it wasn't very good. The waitress did mention in the beginning that the sushi chef will choose the freshest ingredients for the combinations so maybe he didn't include the salmon on purpose. They did however, include toro in all the combination dinners. I had a side order of the Spanish Mackerel at the suggestion of Yelp, and it did not disappoint. It literally melted in my mouth so I was happy. Sashimi dinner is A LOT of raw fish. I think you can safely share it between two people if you just add a bowl of rice. Be sure to make a reservation, and also be sure that all your party is there on time. Sushi Gen is a huge stickler for the right amount of people being there on time for their seats. They made this clear over the phone but we had someone who wanted to come last minute and the host made sort of a fuss over it. I completely understand since they were super busy and made sure over the phone about our party, but my friend wasn't having any of it...haha. Also, there is a 10 dollar minimum per seat so don't come here with 6 people when only 1 is eating.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night because I kept hearing that this place was the go to place for quality sashimi. The first step in coming here is to make sure that you have a reservation! The line is pretty long and walk-ins (especially on weekends) can wait anywhere from 45 min to 2 hours. Thankfully, I had read reviews talking about the quality of the sashimi here and that's pretty much all we ordered. We had the sashimi deluxe platter and chrirashi deluxe bowl between three of us. Personally, my favorite was the fatty tuna and the the hamachi. Both of which taste extremely fresh and are cut professionaly so all of it was tender and still maintained the texture that you hope to have in quality sashimi. Prices were extremely reasonable and I think between us 3.. we spent around 25 a person? None of us came in starving so the food was just right! I hear there's an amazing $15 lunch special but given that I work in SD and have a tough time making it there before lunch break is over.. I'll have to settle for dinner prices which are still extremely fair!

Reviews.Author: Juliet Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: I recommend calling in ahead of time to make reservations because this is a very popular sushi joint, known for their high quality fish and freshness. A line does build rather quickly during prime lunch and dinner times, so if you're going to walk in without a reservation, be prepared to wait for up to 45 mins to an hour. Parking can become very limited in the small and overpopulated lot, so there were times when I would just park in the JVP structure and conveniently walk over.I always order a plethora of different types of Sushi and Sashimi: Uni (Sea Urchin), Albacore, Unagi (Fresh Water Eel), Salmon, Hamachi (Yellowtail), Yellowtail Belly, Spanish Mackerel, Toro (Fatty Tuna), Sweet Shrimp, and every morsel I've eaten here has been supremely fresh and absolutely delicious! If you don't want to order individual orders of Sushi or Sashimi for lunch/dinner, I would highly recommend their Sashimi Lunch Special, Sashimi Dinner, The Chirashi bowl, or their Sashimi Deluxe.The 5 stars given are for their fresh fish, authenticity, superior taste, portion sizes, efficient and attentive service (from personal experience), and despite how insanely crowded it gets, I still think it's totally worth the time and energy to come!!

Reviews.Author: Amy W.
Reviews.Content: Gosh, my review before was short.  It's okay, I can make it up now.  They close between lunch and dinner, so don't come here in the middle of the day. Upon entering the small parking lot, you will need to grab a ticket from the machine.  Don't forget to validate it before you leave, so your parking fee will only be $2.50.  There's metered parking on the street as well, but sometimes it's tough to find a good spot.We got here around 5:15 on a Monday night.  They open at 5:30 for dinner, and already there were 7 parties before us waiting.  We were still sat right away though.  Looking around the room, most people order the sashimi or sushi set dinners, since they are great deals.  Since I'm cutting back on eating raw fish, yes I know it sucks, I ordered a few cooked appetizer dishes.For sure one of the great things about their menu is that it does cater to everyone.  They have the more "americanized" items like beef or chicken teriyaki bento to the izakaya style tapas to fresh sashimi and sushi.I ordered the Salmon skin salad, Ankimo (monkfish liver), Ume-Shio cut roll and Grilled Yellowtail collar.  My dinner-mates all ordered the sashimi dinner.  We also ordered Uni sashimi for the table to share.Salmon skin salad was just okay.  Nothing to rave about.  Actually I barely had an salmon skin.  Ankimo was delicious and fresh!  By the way, ankimo is not a raw dish.  It's steamed, but served cold.  Ume-shiso cut roll was not the best I've had.  It was more salty than sour.  Ikko actually makes the best ume-shiso cut roll.  The yellowtail collar was grilled perfectly and just super tasty!  The portion was also rather large too!  I couldn't even finish it, had to share.  The uni was super duper fresh!  When ordering sashimi, they give you the whole box plus a side of chopped fatty tuna.  It's all accompanied with sliced cucumbers and crispy seaweed.  It's $30, but so worth it.The sashimi dinner was a ridiculously large portion!  All for only $26!  You get two small starts of pickled cucumber and a sunomono.  Then you get a big bowl of rice and a plate of mixed tempura.  Finally a full plate of fresh assorted sashimi.  My dinner mates were very satisfied and full.  The servers were also very nice and filled our hot teas regularly.  Oh, they have lots of ice creams and mochi ice creams for dessert as well as exotic fresh fruits such as cherimoya.  Definitely a great place to go for fresh and delicious Japanese for a good price!

Reviews.Author: Zo L.
Reviews.Content: ***From May 2008***I am with the majority of people here that give the food a 5 star.  Fresh and tasty sashimi made to order. So here's my gripe:A friend and I decide to go for lunch, looking for some sushi.  I remember hearing that Sushi Gen is top notch, a rave for foodies, etc. etc.  And that we needed to get there early for lunch as there would be a crowd.  So at 11:15 we go, with a mindset that we would beat the lunch crowd.Wrong.The line was already out the door.  Host says "40 minutes" for a table for two. Bummer.  I guess we could go to that other sush-"But the sushi bar is open.  Want to sit there?" he says.Hmm.  My friend and I have a quick debate, then agree to sit at the bar."There is a 4 item blah-blah-blah for each of you. Appetizers, sushi and sashimi only." (under his breath.)Wait what did he say?Too late.  We were seated.  Sushi chef starts naming things at warp speed, we nod at random, he makes 2-piece items, yells something else out in Japanese, we look confused, smile in confusion, he whips up something else, then we ask for check.$64 and change.  Let this be a lesson to all you novice sushi bar patrons. Get to Sushi Gen early for a table, wait it out, or find somewhere else to eat. Unless you feel like throwing down hundos for lunch.  I will go back again to try their $15 sashimi plate though.  That sounds tasty and a lot less fleecing.******************************              UPDATE:******************************On the second go round, I jumped out to beat the crowds at 10:45 am.  There was a line starting at this point.  After waiting in my spot for 10 minutes, the line tripled in length.Geez...The guy ahead of me said, "This is nothing.  Wait til 11:15 when the place opens.  There were people here last week for lunch that came from Van Nuys and Brea.  On a Tuesday!"Once the doors swung open, we funneled through like the herd of cattle that we were.  I ordered the sashimi lunch special.  $15.  What could I possibly get for $15 that is worth such a wait?  And then the food came.  Holy. Underwear.Side dishes galore, including miso, sweet cucumber salad, pickled cabbage, and tofu.  The sashimi was plentiful to the max. Four types of tuna, hamachi, salmon, crab, and a bowl of rice. The sashimi was so fresh, perfect texture, perfect taste. Quality and quantity abound; no frills, no rockin' rolls, just authenticity.$15 goes damn far in this place.  Get there VERY early, and you will be in for a treat.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: My friend, and fellow sushi lover, asked his fishmonger buddy which restaurant he would go to for the freshest fish. The answer: Sushi Gen. That was all I needed to know. Instead of heavily researching I just showed up with my friends. I expected some fancy restaurant and was caught off guard by it's location in a rundown looking strip mall. Step inside and and it's a different world. Everything about the restaurant declares: I am authentic Japanese.The food is a sashimi purist's haven. I came on a Tuesday night and the restaurant was bustling with patrons. You can tell they have a high demand and thus turn around for fish. The restaurant focuses on the flavor and textures of fresh, unadorned fish. No fancy toppings, sauces and preparations here.One of my friends and I split the sashimi dinner and ordered a few nigiri alongside. The sashimi dinner is an excellent value ($21) and comes with a lot of fish: lots of tuna, 3pcs yellowtail, 3pcs halibut, several small pieces of octopus, squid, spicy tuna, a small piece of cooked salmon, steamed egg custard, seaweed. The octopus was not chewy at all and I was also pretty satisfied with the tender halibut. I was a little disappointed with the quality of hamachi. It's one of my favorite pieces of sashimi and it just wasn't as soft as I've had before. There was an overwhelming amount of tuna on this platter and it was all blue fin. I wish they would have replaced even a third of this with another type of fish, even if it were different types of tuna.Nigiri:Albacore tuna- luxuriously soft and melted away beautifully. Wonderful flavor. One of my favorites overall, and definitely for the evening.Spanish mackerel- very mild and soft. topped with a few thinly sliced scallions.Japanese mackerel- first time having this particular fish and it tastes more like mackerel than the Spanish mackerel. I think I like it better but it's fishier and not for sushi virgins.Yellowtail- again, very good but not quite the quality I was expecting.One of my friends got her usual Chirashi bowl that was overflowing with various cuts of fish/octopus/squid. Portions are very generous. And the rice below was really good! It had a hint of sweetness and the texture was spot on. I kept stealing some from her bowl.One of our less adventurous sushi eaters did quite well, but needed to supplement all the rawness with a cooked dish: fried chicken. It was like giant baseball sized popcorn chicken you find at Boba places. Only it doesn't come with the spicy powder seasoning, and you get four large pieces instead of a handful of smaller ones. It's dark meat and really juicy.Lastly: service. Wow, everyone here was SO gracious. The server, the busboy, the waitress... oh the poor waitress. We had so many questions about the menu. What's on the sashimi dinner? How's it different from the sashimi delux? We even dragged her over to ask what the table next to us was having because it looked that fabulous (it was the sashimi dinner). She had to come back three times because we couldn't decided what to get, but every time she came back with an easy smile and endless patience! They didn't mind us sitting and catching up for a half hour after we finished eating. And as we walked out, they thanked us kindly for stopping by.A few details: Parking is $2 with validation inside the restaurant.They don't seat you until your entire party has arrived.

Reviews.Author: Eugene N.
Reviews.Content: Dang this place gets packed! It is well worth it, especially during the weekdays for lunch! Such a great deal for the lunch sashimi combo. I think it's like half the price of the dinner price (so I heard). Another good dish to try is the yellow tail collar. Delicious!Of course, gotta come here during lunch time but come early because the line starts before it opens and the sashimi is unstoppable here. Sushi Gen rocks... hands down!

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi joint.  Small place and there usually is a wait, but it goes pretty fast.  If you don't want to wait, the sushi bar usually has seats open but a minimum of 4 orders and no lunch specials can be ordered.  The kampachi(sp?) fish head with appetizer sashimi lunch special ($15).  The fish has lots of fatty meat goodness that melts in your mouth.  Service is good and fast.  The only bad thing is that you have to pay $1.50 for parking even after validation.

Reviews.Author: Sam B.
Reviews.Content: Not sure why i am writing this review - I guess it does make me # 430, which is always nice. Felt like an impromptu Monday night sushi extravaganza  and found this place last minute on Yelp. It was exactly what I was looking for. Authentic little place, great quality, and what I felt were descent prices. Everyone keeps acting like this place is SUPER expensive. I did not see it that way. We (3 college guys) ate a fishing boat's worth of fish, and drank enough sake and Asahi to complete my little fishing boat/sailor analogy. in total the bill was $170. An expensive meal I guess but in the sushi world we defintiely got what we paid for.Also, amazing waitress. She was a tricky one though. When she would come up - instead of asking if we would like anything else - she would ask "More beer? More sake?  More sushi?" Who in their right mind says no to any of those...

Reviews.Author: Tammy L.
Reviews.Content: I have only been to this place once and it's true what the other reviews says...the fish is really fresh. I ordered a sashimi plate and everything was FRESH.  I really like this hole in the wall place. We were told to wait much longer than we waited so that was good.  Once seated, menu was very simple and there's a goood crowd..service was friendly. Although, its a little far for me, I would love to go back and try some of the other crzy stuff on their appetizer menu

Reviews.Author: Satoshi H.
Reviews.Content: As I walk through the plaza to go to Raku, I always wonder... "Why are there so many people waiting in line to get into Sushi-Gen!? It's so, so-so."I guess you can say Sushi-Gen is the standard for sushi in Los Angeles. It's fairly priced and the quality is alright. There are those sushi bars that go for the high-end approach, and they should be providing you with great sushi. Then there's the rest which I won't get into... But I've had better sushi further out from central LA for the same price, for better quality of fish (or better cuts of fish), and with better execution of sushi. OK, the last bit is subjective as people have their preferences of how loose/tight the rice should be, fish to rice ratio, etc.  But Sushi-Gen is so... average. It's like buying a Toyota - reliable but nothing special about it. It almost reminds me of the takeout sushi I had as a little kid in Tokyo. Of course, it tasted so good back then since you're just a kid, but you go back as an adult only to find out that it was just OK.So Sushi-Gen deserves an average A-OK, at least in my books.

Reviews.Author: Maggie W.
Reviews.Content: everything that needed to be said about sashimi/sushi at Sushi Gen has already been said.I shall add my two cents about the salmon dinner/with teriyaki sauce (photos uploaded)first off, it came with sashimi(7 assorted pieces), miso soup, a couple of side dishes, a bowl of rice (BEST rice i've had at restaurants), potato salad, and some lettuce salad on the side with a slice of oranges. onto the salmon, it was really really well cooked, flavorful and i loved the teriyaki sauce with it. all this for $24, i actually think it is VERY reasonable priced, for the quality of the salmon, and the sashimi alone. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Art C.
Reviews.Content: After much research, my gf decided to take me here to celebrate my bday. I was really pleased that we got seated right away despite how some restaurants still make you wait 10-20mins even when you have reservations. We ordered the sashimi deluxe plate, the yellowtail collar, soft shell crab and uni, sweet shrimp, toro sushi (way too much food for two). The food came out promptly and the service was excellent. For the most part, everything tasted good (all the vibrant colors made the food taste even better). The sweet shrimp (loved the fried head) was top-notch and the toro was exceptional. However, the salmon, yellow tail, and the tuna tasted a little off. I have been eating sashimi long enough to know what each fish should taste like (plus I just had it 3days ago with coworkers). Against my better judgement, I still ate it (talk about being a top candidate for the Darwin award). Oh my, what a mistake that was. Within 30mins of concluding our dinner, I had one of the worst stomach aches in my life (this ranks among the top 5). Instead of cutting/ eating my bday cake, I spent the rest of the night in the bathroom. Its safe to say this ruined the rest of my evening. Since we ordered way too much food, we took half of it home. Well that half is going straight into the trash can; a $160 dinner. Thanks for the memorial birthday Sushi-Gen.Now if you can excuse me, I need to go chug Gatorade to replenish my lost "fluids".

Reviews.Author: Mira C.
Reviews.Content: Ok... Forget about waiting for a table! Just sit at the bar and order away... Everything is good and yes really really affordable! My mouth is watering just thinking about all of the good fresh fish and the endless amounts of choices they have. Every single time I have been here the service is really quick and they are super nice. Think twice about coming here for the lunch specials the line is always out the damn door! Sometimes it's a long wait for the sushi bar too ;0( But it's definitely worth every minute of the wait :0) I love you Sushi-Gen! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Author: Carol L.
Reviews.Content: Like what others said, their sashimi and sushi are fresh and delicious. I got their sashimi deluxe, and it was amazing! Their toro (fatty tuna) sashimi is so good that it just melts in your mouth! YUM. The sashimi deluxe was also big enough to fill two people, and if you split it, it is fairly cheap!
