They have uni sushi,but I didn't get a chance to try it. Next time!Wait can be long, but if you have two people, then it usually takes 15-30 minutes. Their service is good, and our waitress kept coming back to check up on us. You can also sit at the sushi bar, but they only have a la carte menu and boxed dinner/lunch.They have a parking lot, but it can be full pretty quick. It also cost around $3-4 to park there (be sure to validate)! There's also metered parking around that area.Overall, a good experience and I will definitely come back again to sample other sushi and also to get their sashimi deluxe again.

Reviews.Author: Kem D.
Reviews.Content: By far my fav sushi digg in LA.  There are fancier/more expensive places but the quality here is top notch.  I love family owned restaurants; the owner mans the sushi bar every day and his son runs the floor everyday.  They are the epitome of what LA should be, rather than what LA has become.  They treat the regulars well and they move an amazing number of people in and out nightly as we crowd the entrance drooling for some fresh cut fish. Sushi Gen never disappoints. I heart you Sushi Gen.  I will continue to give you my paycheck weekly!Don't bring kids, don't bring large groups, don't bring people who order chicken terri off the menu!  Other than that, get ready to grub.

Reviews.Author: Tanis G.
Reviews.Content: We sat at the bar (and you should too) and ordered Omakase. We were paired with a fantastic sushi chef who made the whole experience amazing. We started out with mackeral, then had some of the fattiest, most amazing toro I have ever seen, then some delicious snapper, salmon that practically melted on your tongue, albacore, yellow tail, giant clam, and then we ended with a great piece of eel. The entire meal was truly amazing. Delicious, fresh, and extremely well prepared by a great sushi chef. Worth the hour wait and more than worth the price. In fact, we were surprised at how cheap the bill actually was; they could totally get away with charging more for their omakase because its worth it. This meal earns a spot in my top 5 best meals I've had in LA. I cant wait to return.

Reviews.Author: Lauren S.
Reviews.Content: There are only a handful of sushi restaurants in LA where the chef still goes to the fish market early each morning to pick out each piece of glorious fish.  Sushi Gen is one of them.The staff here is incredibly friendly and the service is excellent.They do take reservations which is very helpful on a Friday night.Great place to grab sushi before heading to staples center.Things to try: The Japanese snapper with lemon and the toro (the best and fattiest in LA!)Sushi-Gen is the real deal.  In fact I really shouldn't be telling you about it, you're going to ruin my spot!

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: I usually do not review restaurants after only one visit but this has to be an exception. Never before have I had such fresh and delicious sushi. From San Diego to San Francisco, Sushi Gen is by far the best sushi I've experienced. The Toro melted in my mouth. I almost cried. Even their wasabi was made so much better than other spots. The Wasabi! Great atmosphere. The sushi chefs were artists in the truest sense. Fast service at the sushi bar. One downfall is the price. But...you get what you pay for, that's for sure. If you're a true sushi lover, you must experience Sushi-Gen!

Reviews.Author: Nihaahs E.
Reviews.Content: Consistently excellent food and service. Try the Ahi rolls with salmon tartar and crispy rice! Yay! Love you guys!

Reviews.Author: H W.
Reviews.Content: One of the top 5 authentic sushi restaurant in la  for the price, place can get crowded but it's def worth the wait. My lady and I come here every other week to have good sushi and sake. Great place for a date night

Reviews.Author: Cheryl N.
Reviews.Content: I think this is the first time I couldn't wait to write a yelp review. After a 45 minute wait (since I tried to reserve at last minute and was unsuccessful), we finally sat down! We tried a lot of sushi but my favorites were fatty tuna, albacore, and yellowtail. What made them so delicious was the unexpected feeling of pure sushi satisfaction upon entering my mouth and slowly chewing. All were very fresh, so tasty I didn't use soy sauce at all, and the rice was perfection. This was the first time I felt the fish and rice really complimented each other. I really didn't know sushi, good sushi, until eating here and now I'm addicted! Too bad they ran out of yellowtail collar and yellowtail belly sushi and our waitress switched our order on the fatty tuna and albacore but that was ok. We ordered another fatty tuna and the second time around was even better! I didn't see the prices for the sushi, didn't really want to look too. For the quantity and quality of it, it wouldn't matter anyway. Next time I'll make reservations, and early, so I can't miss out on the yellowtail collar and belly. I can't wait to come back here again!Btw, no cell phones and laptops here. You wouldn't think of using them anyway, the sushi is that good!

Reviews.Author: Deborah Y.
Reviews.Content: This is the freshest sushi you can find in los angeles.I have gone here for their excellent lunch special and for dinner. Both times I got the sashimi combination.At lunch for 15 dollars you get different cuts of meat along with a small tofu appetizer, salad, and miso soup. At dinner I got the Sashimi Dinner for 26 dollars and it came with tempura, miso soup, salad, and another seaweed salad. On the side I also ordered some spicy tuna rolls to share and 2 pieces of unagi sushi. Everything was so fresh and the fish would just melt in my mouth. Although at dinner time this place is a little pricier than most, you are getting bang for your buck. It is so worth it. If you are gonna eat sushi might as well eat it as fresh as possible! The spicy tuna rolls were so good, I am really glad that I ordered that on the side.

Reviews.Author: Stephen C.
Reviews.Content: Skip the fancy ish,Just stick with all the raw fish.Fresh! right on your dish.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best sushi you will find anywhere. After eating here, I am completely ruined (read: spoiled) and I can no longer eat sushi from other sub-par places. I've taken 2 friends and my fiance on separate occasions and they all loved it as well.Sit at the sushi bar, the chefs are amazing and their fish is as fresh as can be.

Reviews.Author: Elyse A.
Reviews.Content: Do you know that Sushi Gen is the best place for sushi in this city?  I first found out many years ago after reading about them in the LA Times newspaper.  There was a detailed food review regarding them.  After going there just once I was addicted.Not only is there primo fresh fish here, but they also make some of the most scrumptious tempura in town.  I'm sure they have a patent on the batter because it always comes out so fresh tasting and fluffy and an angels wing.Do yourself a favor and check them out.  They really are the Best!!  The food always comes out so beautiful that you will want to take a picture of it and not eat it.

Reviews.Author: Gavin G.
Reviews.Content: Although currently about 40% of sushi restaurants are owned and operated by Koreans, Sushi-Gen stays true to it's traditional Japanese Nigiri and Tekka Maki style roots. Offering amazingly fresh fish and ingredients . They're one of the oldest traditional sushi restaurants in the LA. area and conveniently happens to be located just a block away from one of the biggest producers of fish companies in LA. The LA. Fish Co. Which is set up to be a first come first serve bases with fish buyers and restaurant consumers. If you're looking for a great sushi restaurant in the LA. area and are not looking for a fusion style sushi restaurant. Dragon rolls, Caterpillar rolls, etc) then Sushi-Gen is the place.Definitely not Sushi Sabo or Ryokos in San Francisco but it's about up there.

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: Over priced and over rated. My girl and I went here to grab a little sushi and have some sake for a light late night mini-date. The sushi was pretty good, decently fresh, but not nearly worth the price that they charge. I have had far better for less. However, I was ok with the price as long as the service would be good.Not only were we kind of rushed, but as we were enjoying our drinks and conversation while munching on some sushi. We were told we had to order more food because there was a minimum per person. She then showed us the minimum of $10.00 per person which we had surpassed.Although we spent well over the minimum per person, we were told that since we only order one platter we needed to order something else and that drinks did not count.I don't think I should be told how I should divide my spending at a restaurant. Especially when your margins are better on alcohol than on seafood. We were a more profitable table for you with a drinks heavy bill.I kindly informed her that we had exceeded their minimum per person and did not want any more food, but that we would have another round of drinks.She said she had to check to make sure that was ok.It is my experience that if a place has to put a minimum amount spent or charge more if you split something, they usually aren't worth it. If your food is good and your drinks are good, then money will be spent. This place lived up to that idea. It was not very good.Maybe this place used to be good because the reviews are great. That is why we went there, but this was a very bad experience and ruined what should have been a very nice night.By trying to force us to buy more food that we didn't want, instead of having a potential repeat customer, they have now ensured that we will never again spend our money there.There are far better sushi places in LA.  If you want good, authentic Sushi, go to Sugar Fish. Avoid Sushi Gen, it's really not worth it.Sugar Fish is worth every penny.

Reviews.Author: Kenny G.
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this place because my friends recommended it. Had the Sashimi dinner as everyone else did. I really like the quality of fish they served. But to be honest, I have had better. The dinner came with tempura which was not great. The miso soup and side dishes was pretty good. Also had the yellow tail collar, that was really good as well. The tempura may have been  an off day LOL. I didn't come here for the tempura. I can for the sushi.. Hehehehe. I'll dine here again!

Reviews.Author: Kiko' N.
Reviews.Content: So many people and waited long but if it was good I did not complain...avarage.

Reviews.Author: Todd O.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for legitimate sushi/sashimi, go to Sushi-Gen.  You're welcome in advance for the recommendation.  I would highly recommend calling in to get reservations, as people are willing to wait an hour plus for what I consider the best sashimi you can get in Lil Tokyo...heck, the continental United States for that matter (and I can speak to waiting over an hour for a table). The sashimi deluxe ($35) comes with a variety of sashimi pieces so fresh you'd think the chefs went fishing right before your visit.  The sashimi dinner with tempura ($26) is another great deal for those who want something other than sashimi.I'll note that in all of my visits, I've never actually had their sushi...why get full off of rice when I can just eat fish all day long =)Once again, you're welcome.

Reviews.Author: Patrick N.
Reviews.Content: The $15 Sashimi Lunch Plate was pretty deceptive looking, at first. When it came, I thought I would probably eat it all in just a few minutes. It didn't look like a whole lot of food. But it actually is a great portion, not too much to make me completely stuffed, but definitely enough for lunch. The best item, I thought, was the 3 large slices of albacore tuna. Very good, rich and fatty. I'll admit that I don't know a whole lot about sushi, but I definitely know this was fresh stuff. It was amazing quality, and for a good price too. I DIDN'T like the cooked salmon, it had a very ocean-y after taste and was pretty tough. They give you three pieces of tofu, a tiny salad (3 bites and it's gone), a cup of miso soup, and a large bowl of rice with the lunch special. Overall, it was very good sashimi. But next time I'll just order the pieces I like and not get the plate.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: LOVE!HUGE portions...reasonable prices... bento's come with soup and salad... you will leave full!Sushi/Sashimi combo is popular.Fresh fish.Expect a line and a wait.Great sushi place in Little Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Debbie O.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to place for sashimi lunch on a weekday. They're closed for lunch on weekends, and their best deal is the sashimi lunch. If you look around, 7/10 people order that, and it's not surprising. They have a decent amount of raw fish and everything is fresh because of such high turnover rates. You don't get raw salmon, which sucks, but you do get like three variations of tuna, hamachi, grilled salmon, and octopus. I mean, the plate comes full, and it's very satisfying. The best part is it's only $15!! Oh, I forgot they also give you miso soup, pickled cabbage, and tofu. Their tofu is by far the best tofu I've ever had. I don't even like tofu, but I can eat this for days. It's pretty much stewed in soy sauce and sugar. The texture is so soft and literally melts in your mouth. It's SO yummy!! If their sashimi wasn't such a great deal I might have to come just for their tofu! People who rate this place lower than four stars probably don't come for the lunch sashimi, which makes me sad their missing out on such yumminess! People, that's why we read yelp reviews before we order!!Lastly, I deducted a star just because I've been coming here for at least five years now, and they've definitely taken advantage of their popularity. First, they've repeatedly increased their lunch sashimi price. I started eating this at $12.50 a plate, and now after two increases it's now $15. Still a deal, but leaves you wondering when they'll hike it up again. Also, they used to have a complimentary pickled seaweed dish along with the stewed tofu. I used to eat that with the rice, but now it's completely gone. Finally, green tea used to be free, but now its like $1.50 or something silly. C'mon, you're an established Japanese restaurant. Please serve tea for free!

Reviews.Author: A T.
Reviews.Content: One of the better sushi places in LA.  Love the quality and service.

Reviews.Author: Sara J.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi restaurant in LA! The fish is incredibly fresh, the rice, perfect.  I usually order omakase (chef's choice) and I am always happy--except when the bill comes, but it's worth it!!The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars are the price and the wait.

Reviews.Author: Julia L.
Reviews.Content: The fish is very fresh here and everyone from the sushi chefs to the water boys are friendly and always seem so darn happy to see you.The price is medium range and this is where you come if you're a true sushi/sashimi lover.  It is definitely not a real roll place...which is perfect for me, but some people who like those fancy rolls with artsy names & caterpillar heads sticking out of one end, this is not the place for you.  Most you'll get as a roll is the standard Tekka/Kappa maki, spicy tuna roll, california roll and salmon skin roll.  I "heard" that there was this awesome lunch special where you get miso soup, salad and a preset assortment of sushi/sashimi for a great price.  So I went one day at lunch time.  There was a line of 20 people waiting for the doors to open in front of me.  Once we got in, I was the ONLY person sitting at the bar.  Pretty much everyone came for this lunch special.  By the time I left an hour later, maybe five people were sitting at the bar but there was a line of people still waiting to be seated at a table for the lunch special.The only thing I wish they did have was reservations, but this place is 1st come, 1st served only.

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stand outside and wait for sushi, you may as well get the best sushi... and you may as well get it for the sort of prices that make you feel like going to confession. To that end, I'll usually default to Komasa or Hama (in a pinch) every time. This is, of course, simply personal preference.The quality of Sushi Gen is undisputed -- they serve very good sushi here. It's just often very hard to get in, there's long waits, and it's arguably a bit off the beaten path. Unfortunately, their prices are just a bit higher than most of the comparable competition in the area, and I think that factors in quite a bit when I have to decide where to get my sushi on.All that said, if you don't mind the wait and you feel like loosening your purse strings a bit, you can't go wrong at Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Katherine K.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi spot for a quick, no-fuss meal. The fish is very fresh and the price is very good for how much food you get. I always order the sashimi deluxe- can't go wrong with that. I could bathe in their minced tuna with scallions!! So yummy, craving it again now just writing about it. There usually always a wait at dinner, but it goes quickly as the restaurant is decently sized. Go, it's worth it, and thank me later!

Reviews.Author: Liz T.
Reviews.Content: FRIED SHRIMP HEADS!!!!!!!!We came here for sushi date night and BOY was the shrimp head and sushi breath WORTH IT!!!!It was a bit crowded and crazy on a Friday night so we just signed up for the sushi bar. EVERY SINGLE THING we ordered was like, the BEST piece of whatever it was I've ever had. How is that possible?!?!? I don't freakin know. We had toro (*****), yellow tail, salmon skin hand roll (OMG YES YES YES), the fried shrimp that seriously made me so happy that I thought about ordering two more just so I could take them home and relive the shrimp head-y goodness.Pricey, but I would say reasonable for the most deRicious sushi I've ever scarfed.

Reviews.Author: Aaron R.
Reviews.Content: I don't remember the sushi here as it was over-shadowed by my first experience with Sea Cucumber.UPDATE: I've now been back and sat at the crowded sushi-bar. After a mix-up with the sushi chef, about whether the ladies i was with wanted rolls or nigiri sushi we got them what they wanted, which were rolls. me moved on to some nigiri once they felt more emboldened, I ate some yellow-tail, some kanpachi, unagi, anago, all which was really good.Our Sushi-Chef was hilarious, when asked about a fish he would enact the part of the fish, flapping his arms for halibut fin, etc.Pretty amusing, and all after he scolded us for wanting maki at the sushi bar. But now I get it.Line or not, I think the sushi here is good, and in a pinch if you don;t know where else to go this place will do just fine.

Reviews.Author: Sara L.
Reviews.Content: It's tough to know what to rate Sushi Gen.  The place is a bit of a contradiction of terms.  On one hand they do fresh sushi extremely beautifully.  You can taste the freshness of the fish.  They serve it at the right temperature.  You can taste that they properly make their sushi rice--the whole bit.  They also have a nice sake selection.  The prices are above average, but not by a ton.  Then again, they are only *steps* away from the cold storage section of the city, where ALL of the freshest fish goes, so there's really no excuse for there to be ANYWHERE in Little Tokyo that doesn't have the freshest fish that money can buy.However, the service last night left a LOT to be desired.  Our server was curt, not particularly attentive, and even seemed judgmental of my order.  I mean, I was at a real sushi place.  Don't look at me all funny 'cause I wanted a California roll and asked to make sure it had real crab in it.  I thought it'd be fun to order one in a REAL sushi place.  Geez!  If you're gonna judge me for it, don't put it on your menu!  This wasn't the best fish I've had in LA.  That was definitely Sushi Zo, but then I've not had omakase here.  If nothing else, you'll know that you're going to get fresh, Japanese sushi and sashimi here.  Frills, service, smiles?  You won't.  But I suppose you don't always get those in Japan, either, so...enjoy.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: After my most recent visit I realized that LA has too many quality sushi joints for Sushi-Gen to stand out.  Heck even the Little Tokyo area has several quality sushi joints.  I definitely feel you can get equal or better quality elsewhere including Mako, Hama, Komasa, or Hirozen for either larger portions with comparable prices or similar portions for cheaper prices.   Ordered the uni, aji, albacore, toro, japanese snapper, kanpachi, ama ebi, hamachi, and salmon all for myself and was just barely satisfied.  My biggest disappointment was the hit and miss of the taste and quality of the nigiri and their small portions.  Disliked the albacore and aji.  The fish was bland and not fresh and the garnish overpowered the fish anyways.  The aji was the smallest cut of fish I have ever eaten in a sushi joint.  Kanpachi, hamachi, salmon and ama ebi were ok.  The uni, toro and japanese snapper were very good and enough to provide an A-Ok dining experience.  The total came out to $86 with tip and tax for one.  I highly recommend going to Mako Sushi in Little Tokyo over Sushi-Gen for the larger portions, cheaper prices, better taste and service.  Go to Hama or Komasa for cheaper but quality alternatives with the same bustling vibe as Sushi-Gen.  I would still visit Sushi-Gen but only if I'm treating or showing guests or friends.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: When I went, it was a really good day for tuna. Anything tuna tasted crazy delicious. The freshness of their fish is definitely something. However.Minus one star, because it is overpriced, the wait is insanely long, and their parking lot is always full. Minus another star, because the sides that came with the sushi combo were really really really bad.I left my meal a little unsatisfied, a little unfulfilled.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I have ever had.  Fresh, flavorful, soft, melts-in-your-mouth sushi. --Vietnamese-American obsessed with sushi.

Reviews.Author: PJ L.
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic!  Freshest sashimi and delicious handrolls make this easily the best sushi experience I have had in a while.  Ordered fatty tuna, yellowtail belly, albacore sashimi.  You can taste the high quality of the sashimi with each bite.  Also ordered 2 handrolls, eel avocado roll and the spicy tuna roll.  Again, you can taste the quality of the ingredients in preparing the handrolls.  Overall, the price and wait to be seated is worth it.  I will definitely be coming back here.

Reviews.Author: Karissa K.
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best sushi bars I have been too! I sat at the bar and had a great experience! All the sushi chefs are great! The uni is the best I have ever had! I usually don't like uni but this uni was amazing! If you are ever in LA this is a must! Pricing was decent. I'm not sure how much each piece was but we averaged about $8 per nigiri. I thought it was fairly priced (maybe even a little unpriced) for the quality you get.

Reviews.Author: Marie C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is definitely the best. Fresh, not fishy, just right. The staff are rushed because they are always busy, but still manage to be friendly. Plus the sushi chefs all cheer you on your way out -it's sweet.  Tip: Try to get a reservation at least two days in advance- that's how quickly they book!  Also, show up with your whole party or they won't seat you until everyone is present.   Guess they've earned the right to be a little bit snooty. =) 'Tis expensive. We spent about $130 for three people if you want a price estimate... But good stuff - and worth the wait!!!

Reviews.Author: cindy m.
Reviews.Content: My first experience here was a bad one because I sat at the bar with my mom, got a bone in my albacore, my sweet shrimp tasted nauseatingly metalic, and the bill ended up costing +$70 between the both of us for maybe 3 or 4 orders each. My second visit wasn't much better-- my date decided to phone her exboyfriend while we were looking over the menu to ask him, "what was that thing that we used to always get?" Well, at least 'that thing' that they used to always get was filling, tasty, and affordable. Their sashimi plate saves them from less than three stars.

Reviews.Author: Maggie K.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious and absolutely fresh!My best friend and I went in here completely clueless but the chef was very funny, and helpful.We pretty much tried every type of fish.We had the salmon, red snapper, yellow tail, tuna, octopus, and shrimp.All amazing, but since we were so clueless we didn't know how to really order because everyone around us was getting these amazing dishes.Most definitely a place for real sushi! And a place to put a dent in your pocket, but I don't mind since it was well worth it!Oh, and the chefs are a bit creepy. They like to stare...

Reviews.Author: Mel Z.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is probably one of the most traditional Japanese sushi places I have been to in Little Tokyo/LA. They basically serve only what is fresh that day and do not mask the nigiri with to much unnecessary flavor. If you sit at the sushi bar they expect you to know what you are doing. Eating here reminds me of eating sushi in Japan. If you are not an experience sushi eater than don't sit at the bar... and if you do, please don't be that guy! You know what I mean =0)Only bad thing is that this place is ALWAYS packed for lunch and dinner!!.. and can be very expensive... but I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: jenny t.
Reviews.Content: i'm a little torn between this review but it's a good place just not what i was expecting but nonetheless i will give it's rightful rating of 4 stars out of 5FIRST what this place is NOTthis isn't an american style sushi place...MEANING there are no typical rolls we have come to love such as (CRUNCH ROLL, DYNAMITE ETC) THIS IS TRADITIONAL SUSHI meaning simple tradition sushi rolls (literally around 5?) which were california roll, spicy tuna roll, tuna roll etcthe menu is VERY LIMITEDBUT this place is DEFINITELY FRESH...there's no denying it! the raw fish literally melts in your mouth! i swear it's like they're fishing back there and cutting it up for us! my boyfriend who's not into the whole raw fish thing (he cant stand the texture) actually enjoyed it  here.DO NOT order the rolls...the price aren't on the paper (i'm assuming it's based on market value) but they're TINY 6 pieces and not worth it! we order like 3 and it was 30 bucks for just those!I HIGHLY SUGGEST you order the combo places or the bentos or whatever i forgot what it's called...well worth it...same price but way more foodi got the sashimi combo (I WAS IN SASHIMI HEAVIN! will post pic later...it came with a side of tempura (yummy as well) big bowl of rice, miso soup and two side vinegar dishes...it was GOOD! boyfriend got the typical beef teriyaki...portion was big..he liked itout bill was around $90 or $115 after tipit was my birthday so i ened up yacking it all out =( due to friends forcing me to drink insane amounts of alchy =(overall go if you want good sashimi DONT go if ur looking for rolls...there arent' any really

Reviews.Author: Ashley K.
Reviews.Content: I HEART sushi-gen!!I have been frequenting this gem for the last 5 years. Every single time I come its worth the wait and the money. I went tonight, Friday night at  8pm. The wait was not bad at all, but that might be because 4 parties on the waiting list before us were absent. Yayyyy!! HahaSo to the important information... THE FOOD!!Sashimi Deluxe $36 ( big enough for 2 hungry girls) ...aka bombskies. I particularly enjoy the fatty tuna that they give you and the large assortment of fish that comes with the dish aka tuna, spicy tuna, salmon, squid, octopus, yellow tail, cooked egg, cooked salmon, and tiny sardines. Since its sashimi it does not come with rice. And what is odd is it also does not come with GINGER!! They charge extra for that. However absurd, I can forgive them only because the quality of the fish is so great. Green Tea ($1.50 per person) One disclaimer you should know is it is really expensive to order at the bar. Its a much better deal to sit at a table and order the sushi combo, sashimi combo, and other stuff. Granted sitting at the bar is a whole different experience but those sushi pieces add up easily to $50 a person!! So to be friendly to you wallets get combos or the deluxe and share.

Reviews.Author: Julie N.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places in L.A. to get traditional sushi in my opinion.  I just had dinner here recently on a weeknight and first starting come here in the mid-90s, so it's been around for a while.In addition to the high quality of the fish, I feel what sets them apart from other sushi restaurants is the quality of the sushi rice and right amount of rice vinegar they use.They take reservations, but be sure your entire party is on time.  Otherwise, you're not going to be seated.  I recommend eating here on a weeknight when it's less crowded.Located in the Honda Plaza strip mall in Little Tokyo...2nd St. and Central Ave.  You'll have to pay $3.00 for parking.Bathroom is clean.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places in LA.Uni, sashimi, nigiri are all good quality seafood at a good price.My must-order item: Sashimi dinner The portion is big with good variety of fish. Fresh tempura with ponzu sauce is tasty, not greasy.A bowl of hot sushi rice....yum....Uni is also another great choice! A big box of fresh uni!! you can taste the sea in your mouth!!Quick Tip: try go to their lunch time, you will pay less and have same quality and quantity of food!

Reviews.Author: Iroeki L.
Reviews.Content: 3 words. Best Sushi Ever!!!!Great customer service!!!

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: Come early because it gets super packed here.Lunch specials are great and reasonably under $20 to start. The salmon collar is pretty darn good.I went crazy here at dinner when I was sitting at the sushi bar and racked up a $100 bill on nigiri, sushi and rolls. The fish is really fresh here, but it's so easy to keep ordering more.Good luck finding parking during lunch time!

Reviews.Author: Silviya K.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best sushi I've ever had in the US.  I would go back every week if I could afford it.  The prices are a bit on the high side, but the quality is well worth it.There is usually a wait if you go for dinner, but it's worth it -- just be patient or go next door for a drink.  The best place to sit is by far at the sushi bar.  And if you can, try sitting next to the older sushi chef with the bald head.  He is super sweet and very entertaining when you get him talking.

Reviews.Author: Melissa K.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Sushi Gen since I was like...10.  It hasn't changed and it really shouldn't since it's just about perfect.  My family knows the head chef and he always sends over a huge complimentary plate of sashimi to my grandma, though she probably has no idea who he is anymore.  We used to go every week...I'm not quite sure why we stopped.  I think it's because it was hard to maneuver her wheelchair behind the sushi bar to the restroom.  The spicy tuna is sooooo good and all the fish is so fresh and delicious.  Even the cooked stuff is good, especially the yellowtail collar, I'm getting goosebumps just thinking about it.  They even have yamakake and they'll put maguro in it and everything!  We usually don't wait in line, but I've seen people outside and they don't seem to mind the wait.  I've heard the lunch specials are good, but I've never been because of my ridiculously short lunch break.  Try this place out.  I swear you'll think you've died and gone to Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Dee Dee X.
Reviews.Content: I am pretty much always in the mood for sushi so I was pretty excited to go for Sushi Gen.  It was a Friday night, so of course it was packed.  We waited around for about 30 minutes and when they discovered 1 person in our party was not there,  they refused to seat us! :( So sad.  We had to lie and say he wasn't coming anymore. Shhh! Seriously fresh fish!  We got the Sashimi Platter and it was so satisfying.  The Sushi Platter was eh, normal.  The BEST part of what we got was the Ama-Ebi which is delicious x 2 because not only do you get the sweet shrimp part, but also the fried head! mmmMMM.  Ok, I lied, the Uni shares the spot for BEST part of what we got. I think I'm starting to drool.... I would totally go here again.  It's pretty decently priced for such good sushi.  Definitely 5 star material but I had to -1 for 1. making me wait, and not seating me with 1 person missing, 2. Ebi/Uni seemed unusually expensive although the rest wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Author: Grace P.
Reviews.Content: Mm hmm...Sushi-Gen deserves to get the full 5 stars!I just came back for lunch hour today. I am a very happy girl right now.Parking is only $1.50 for 2 hours.I was expecting a crazy line, but there wasn't any around 12pm.  Maybe because it was a Monday?I got the Sashimi lunch and it was a huge plate of sashimi&sides, miso, small salad, and rice.  The sashimi is SOOO FRESH it should be illegal.  Lunch specials average around $15.  I would try to win the lottery  just so I can eat Sushi-Gen everyday for lunch ....or possibly own it.

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: You know this place is authentic by walking in and realizing that you're one of the only 5 non-Japanese people there. It's not only the atmosphere that gives the authenticity away. The food definitely does too.I didn't realize just how Americanized most sushi restaurants are before I tried Sushi-Gen. There are none of your usual rolls like the dynamite or the crunch roll here. No, not even close. They basically only offer regular sushi (fish with rice on bottom), sashimi and a few other rolls that come with seaweed paper but merely contain fish, avocado or one other ingredient. I guess the simpler the sushi is, the more authentic it is. We ordered the baby yellowtail, toro, eel and albacore.  Everything was very fresh, but definitely not the freshest I've had. Maybe I'm just white-washed but I just couldn't get myself to love the food. I like my sashimi but I also like to order my fried rolls with eel sauce and baked scallops mixed with mayo and all the other yummy generic rolls that most sushi restaurants in LA offer. And even if I don't feel like ordering them that day, I'd really appreciate it if they were at least on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Aiko S.
Reviews.Content: It is one of high end sushi restaurants in LA.You can eat very rare stuff there. Uni was so-so though.These places get fish from the same market, so you know, NOT much different from other high-end places afterall...

Reviews.Author: Jiro K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is perhaps the most over-rated and under-rated Sushi restaurant in LA.  The long lines definitely drive a lot of people away.  It makes the place seem so commercialized, everything a good "traditional" Sushi restaurant usually isn't.  But when you actually overcome your repugnance for the commercial aspect and actually try the Sushi at the Sushi Bar, it is absolutely excellent!  Sushi Gen doesn't have the wide variety of Neta (fish) that's flown in from Japan that some of the top Sushi restaurants on the Westside (Kiriko, Sushi Sushi, Yamakase, Nishimura, etc) have, but the fish that they do have tend to be FRESH.  Especially basic East coast fish such as Yellowfin Tuna, Snapper, Halibut, etc, are extremely fresh, and possibly the freshest in LA.  I guess it's because they have such high turnover, that they are never in the position where they have to serve old fish.  Some of the more "exotic items" such as mackerel and Uni were not as fresh, which leads me to believe that my turnover theory is correct.  So when you go to Sushi Gen, if you order the simple stuff, you will probably be in for a treat.  If you want to explore into the more exotic flavors, such as Kohada (gizzard shad), different types of squid, etc. you are probably better off at Kiriko.  And finally, as always, I need to be a bit critical about the rice.  I personally like my rice to be a tad warmer with a stronger vinegary kick, a bad habit I picked up dining at such ultra-traditional and legendary Edomae sushi joints in Tokyo as Sukiyabashi Jiro (of "Jiro Dreams of Sushi" fame) and Mizutani.  The top sushi restaurants in Tokyo add no sugar to their rice, whereas many US-based sushi restaurants load the Sushi rice with sugar (in addition to salt and vinegar) to please the sweet-seeking palates of the Americans.  As for rice, I do think Sushi Sushi or Yamakase do the best job of emulating Tokyo here in the US.

Reviews.Author: T Z.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely unacceptable service! We decided to have an early dinner, so Sushi Gem sounded like a perfect idea. My husband was starving already since we had to deal with crazy traffic to get to downtown, but he didn't complaint. So we got to the restaurant to realize that there is a half an hour wait. I was surprised that my husband agreed to wait, we informed the waiter that we have a baby in a stroller to make sure they can accommodate us. After a 30 min wait our name was finally called, and to our surprise when we walked inside the host asked us if we have a car seat with us?!!! Since there is NO WAY we would fit our (small stroller) at the table they have for us!!! Why would not you inform us when we told you about the stroller 30 mins ago? So now we would have to walk back to our car that was park far and walk back with the car seat? I could not believe the level of service you get at this place! I was speechless! I am not here to do their job and their inability to comprehend simple things shouldn't be our problem. Restaurant is a SERVICE business, so please figure YOUR crap out! Don't waste your time or money on this pathetic place!

Reviews.Author: Sparky P.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is good sushi. It's at an establishment that has a line out the door. To be honest, I'm sure that the regular dining and the bar would be a different experience. This review is for the regular dining and not for the bar.The lunch specials go from $15ish to - $35. Is it worth it? To be honest. . . not really. . I have eaten a wide variety of sushi in my life. .  costco dirt cheap, most of the little tokyo establishments, hidden japanese owned gems throughout the county, a place that ended up being $300 per person. . . that being said. . I think I can safely say, that the wait plus the higher price point, at least for the lunch regular dining is not worth it. Yes it is fresh fish, but they don't give you that much of it. Even when they do give you fish, most of it is cheaper cooked eel etc. Is the Yellowtail and the tuna and the rest of the fish they give as part of the lunch menu blow your mind great? not really. . . If they charged more competitively as slightly above sushi Hama, that would be an accurate reflection of their value. Sushi Gen is a must go to establishment bc of the name, but I don't think it's worth returning to.

Reviews.Author: Helen O.
Reviews.Content: My niece took me for a B-DAY dinner at Sushi Gen, and I ordered the dinner combo plate and it was very FRESH and delish, too bad my niece is a Palian  vegan so she happen to just Sake Bomb and got  pretty jack'd up like a lush ,  luckily we had a short wait compare to most of the people that got there after us,  service was really nice and I hope to be going back .

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi and try to check out most sushi restaurants.  After a string of bad sushi eats, I always need to go back to the roots and check out Sushi Gen.A true Los Angeles staple in Japanese food, it is owned by Master Sushi Chef Toyashima.  The frail, old Japanes sushi chef barely takes a day off and always treats his customers with the utmost respect.  His work ethic trickles down to the other sushi chefs, waiters, and even the hosts.  The fish is ALWAYS fresh and the toro is to die for.  I know the fish wholesaler he gets his fish from and when I heard of his dedication, it was like hearing that Jessica Alba can cook as well.He is the first one at the fish market EVERY MORNING to get the best pick of the day's catch.  He hand picks his stock guaranteeing the highest quality of fish.The owner of American Fish has clients coming in from Japan and takes them exclusively to Sushi Gen to showcase the quality of fish on the west coast.  Sushi chefs worldwide recognize Sushi Chef Toyashima as a master at his craft and an icon in the art of raw cuisine.Well worth the price, although its almost always crowded.

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi lunch special is the best deal ever!  EVER!!!  For $15.00 you get miso soup, soft tofu (to whet your appetite), a bowl of rice, and a good selection of 9-10 different types of sashimi (salmon, mackerel, tuna, squid, and I don't remember the rest).This place is packed during lunch.  Trust me, there will be a line formed outside the restaurant before it even opens.   I suggest getting in line 10-15 minutes before it opens.

Reviews.Author: Master B.
Reviews.Content: I can't recall how many times I've been here....but lets just say it's a lot. And yet I recently noticed that I've never wrote a review about them? Probably because I rather not reveal that I've been cheating on Angotei and Nana San...but hey, this place is in LA. I guess it's ok for me to have a ritual Sushi Bar in LA then..right? I hate to admit it, but the quality of fish at Sushi Gen rivals (if not supersede) that of Nana San (which i thought was impossible). The lunch scene is always chaotic..mainly with folks that want the lunch box/value meal, which is only served in the main dining room however if you're just interested in sushi, there is usually NEVER a wait...they'll seat you immediately at the bar. There is a minimum order at the bar during lunch (4 orders/person is nothing....that's an appetizer - oh yeah, ONLY sushi at the bar - don't even think about ordering a rainbow roll here)Here are a few must have's if you go:- Otoro: the best part of the tuna belly and most fatty. Better than sex. You will want 2 orders- Hamachi Hara: again, the belly of yellow tail. it literally melts in your mouth. - Fresh Scallops: usually they have 5-6 for lunch. Grab one before its gone- Fresh Takko : this is amazing..don't be fooled by the boiled version that every other place serves...once you've tried this version, the rest pales in comparison.Other stand outs: Uni, Salmon Belly,

Reviews.Author: KJ L.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this place for over 10 years and have found their sashimi to be of consistent quality.  They have the best sashimi lunch deal in town. You can tell by the long lunch lines that extend up to a 30 minute wait outside. I don't mind the wait because the raw fish is melt in your mouth. In terms of their sushi, it is above average, but can get pricey. Be aware that this is a traditional Japanese restaurant., so don't expect rolls or fancy setting. I wouldn't recommend straying too far from their Sashimi Combo, as everything else is slightly above average and far more expensive. Don't even bother with dinner, because lunch is where its at. If you are looking for high end sushi go to Beverly Hills.The Sashimi Combo used to cost around 11 dollars in the early 2000's, which made this large plate of assorted sashimi and a bowl of melt-in-your-mouth rice a crazy deal. If there is one thing that has been decreasing in quality, it has been the bowl of rice...its melt in your mouth quality has decreased over the years. Not sure why that is...In recent years, they have raised the price of the combo a few dollars, but it still remains the best value in town, beating out many high end locations for sashimi offerings. Just know that the sashimi assortment consists of cheaper cuts and fish, but they are perhaps the best of those cheaper fish, which is better than average high end fish...if that makes sense. They gots the ocean in their backyard!Sushi Gen is situated in the middle of Little Tokyo amongst a strip mall with parking provided. It is near Frances a good cake place in the same strip mall.Go there!

Reviews.Author: fred h.
Reviews.Content: Decent sushi, but mostly filled with out-of-towners and power lunchers who somehow have in their mind that this is 'the' sushi place in little tokyo.  Not true.  The wait is way too long, both in waiting to get seated and for the food to get prepared.  Decent food -- but not the best.  All native little tokyo'ers know,  cross the street instead and find the frosted white glass restaurant called Hamakawa right on the corner of 2nd and Central.  Open only after 5pm and closed on Tuesdays, but offers a much tastier, prompter, cheaper and more genuine sushi eating experience.  I've been going to both Sushi Gen and Hamakawa for years and can say that while both are good, Hamakawa is the best.Also i've been reading some people are complaining about a *fishy* smell.  One key thing to keep in mind:** Fresh sushi/sashimi smells like the ocean.** Bad sushi/sashimi smells fishy/stinky because of bacteria (which can make you sick)Keep that in mind when evaluating sushi restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Martin T.
Reviews.Content: Best value: sashimi set lunch/dinner

Reviews.Author: Jin Y.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I've been to! My best friend took me here for my bday and we ate about 100 dollars worth of food. We ordered the sushi deluxe (good, but still room in our stomach for more, and the cucumber roll almost killed us with the shocking amout of wasabi in it) and the giant clams (soooo gooooooooooodddd), and then we were still hungry so we ordered the sashimi delux ($30). Next time we go there, we will just order the sashimi delux. It was huge, filling, and the fish was so buttery. My friend tried to make me eat the snail-like thing and I tried it for the first time in my life. Not bad... I liked that they gave a lot of tuna cuz...that's mostly what I eat (yes, i'm a sushi neophyte). we ordered the plum wine, which was HEAVENLY. the Tuna with shredded yam was weird. I was thinking that the yam was going to be cooked but it was sticky and raw... not used to that. We also got the yellowtail collar, which melted in your mouth. I want to try the salmon collar next time. Mmmm. so good..

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Sushi Gen as long as I can remember.  Toyo-san practically watched me grow up.  So naturally, I'm a bit biased when I say this is a great place for traditional sushi.   Actually, I've been to many other sushi restaurants and I think this is the BEST one in LA.  I've had better fish in only other two places, Ritz-Carlton (Kapalua, Maui) and Tsukiji Fish Market (Tokyo, Japan).  The overall price-to-quality package is GREAT!  The fish is fresh, the price is reasonable and the services is friendly.  This is also the first place I ever had toro and uni, my two favorites.  Try the other usual suspects...salmon, unagi, soft shell crab, fresh shrimp, albacore tune, etc.If you have a choice, sit at the bar.  Arrive earlier because the line can be intimidating after 7:30pmdon't think about it...just do it...go there...

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, like this place NEEDS a 485th review. (sigh).Still, yes, go. We mixed and matched and had a great amount and variety of food. I ordered the sashimi dinner (like the regular sashimi, but for a few $ more, you get soup, rice, sunomono AND tempura. Tasty and well worth it.)Also ordered the grilled marinated black cod. Mmmmm. And it's a Best Choice' on the seafoodwatch.org pocket guide to sustainable fish.Red Bean Ice Cream was great. And the cold bottled saki was awesome. The place was busy, and at times at little distracted/disorganized with the service, but nothing to get miffed about. A great place for dinner. I look fwd to trying lunch sometime!

Reviews.Author: Allison S.
Reviews.Content: So I've heard that this place is crazy popular and the best for real, authentic Japanese sushi, so of course I couldn't resist trying it! I came on a Monday night around 5:30 pm and the place was already filling up. By the time I left, there were people waiting outside the door for a seat. Take from that what you will. And yes, the restaurant is located in a parking lot that charges $2.50. Make sure you get your ticket validated at the restaurant so you don't have to pay even more.- Sashimi deluxe ($35): this comes with a variety of sashimi and other side dishes: salmon, yellowtail, octopus, tuna, fatty tuna, shrimp, and then a spicy tuna, cooked salmon, crab meat, and seaweed. It is a lot of food and very filling! The salmon and yellowtail were my favorite. It is SO buttery and just melts in your mouth. Delishhhhhh!!! Other items-- crab meat, spicy tuna, cooked salmon-- were just mediocre. It comes based on the Chef's choice.- Tempura (Large: $14): Shrimp, sweet potato, zucchini, carrot. The tempura was perfect-- it is so light and crispy and crunchy. It is definitely one of the best tempura platters I've ever had.- Assortment: we also tried the uni (good, but not fab), the yellowtail belly, and the salmon skin roll. I didn't find the roll that great because it was bits of salmon skin. I prefer pieces of salmon skin (I know I'm picky, but I swear it matters!) Overall, I think Sushi-Gen captures the feeling of authentic Japanese dining that is rare nowadays. For example, I think my parents would love this place. I, however, prefer eating Japanese food with a twist (anyone check out Ikko, my favorite?) Bottom line: come here if you love traditional Japanese sushi.

Reviews.Author: Jay K.
Reviews.Content: A long time favorite, known for quality and taste.PROS: The freshest fish, the best taste, a real traditional restaurant w/ real sushi chefs. CONS: Busy (always a wait), Service is not very friendly (2 stars), parking is tough. Expensive. Recommendations: Chirashi Thumbs up (Karate Kid II style)

Reviews.Author: Heidi C.
Reviews.Content: "A-OK".Coming here I was expecting spectacular sushi.Sashimi dinner combo:(Sashimi plate, tempura, miso soup, rice)-I was ordering the regular sashimi plate but the server sold me on ordering the combo. For $5 more I got tempura, rice and soup (wish I stayed without the combo, it was mroe than enough)-Sashimi plate was bountiful, but too much tuna and no salmon sashimi-I personally never liked squid sashimi maybe that's what made me iffy-Had a "grilled" piece of salmon on it but it was dry and very saltySushi deluxe:-Was an ok amount-It had ikura (salmon roe sushi) which wasn't bad-Don't expect california rolls here, they'd rather keep it legit and top the box off with simple tuna rolls and cucumber rolls-bf ate most of this order but it seemed good :)Giant clam special:(Grilled giant clam pieces wedged between mushroom slices atop lemon slices in a filded foil tray)-Did not like this-Lacked the sweetness of mirugai-Taste combination was wrong-A waste of mirugai-Should have known they'd use the parts at the "body" of the clam that weren't used to make sushi/sashimi (the somewhat mushy part?) but it should have still been sweetNotes:-Good for nigiri and sashimi-Not your "special roll" kinda joint-Sushi menu does not have prices listed-May seem pricey but portions are adequate-Packed by the time we left at around 8:00pm on a MONDAY NIGHT!-Didn't like the tiny two seater tables, had to manuver our dishesVerdict:-Good portions for the price-Will be back in the future but not rushing

Reviews.Author: Isaac L.
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "$15 sashimi lunch plate".It was so good, there wasn't even any time to snap a pic.Hamachi was buttery.  The ahi was not CO treated.  The entire plate was fresh, clean, cold, and outright bananas.The place was poppin' by 11:15.  On a Tuesday.  I'm coming back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Chuck S.
Reviews.Content: Traditional quality you can count on, that sums up Sushi Gen.  Lines can be horrendous, so get there as early as possible.  I've waited 40 minutes before.Mostly Japanese staff, the whole menu is traditional Japanese, all great compositions.  Quality sushi, a delight to eat with my hands.  The toro sushi especially was very tender, rich, and even left it's flavorful oil upon my fingertips.  Miso soup, muzoku, salmon skin salad...  well executed.Older demographic and professionals come here.  Has a quaint, old-school atmosphere.Not my favorite sushi joint, but you can't really go wrong here.

Reviews.Author: Phil C.
Reviews.Content: Wow over 1k reviews and 500+ photos. What else is there to add?! 4.5 stars!!I'm definitely with the reviewers that praise this joint and I've finally got a chance to experience it. First time here was great. Despite the 20min wait, the service was good and attentive. The chefs are friendly and helpful. Food.... omg, the food. I come for the food!Here's what i ordered* toro sushi - was fresh and really good... toro ftw!* smelt fish sushi - chef recommended "no soy sauce, big bite" and so i did, the fish melted and the flavor was really good w/ a little kick of spice from the drop of the topping* spanish mackerel - the best mackerel i've had!* monkfish liver - was surprisingly very good, i enjoyed this one a lot. the chef suggested adding this green (seaweed?) to the dish and it gave it some body as well as texture to each bite. the monkfish liver had a creamy, flan-like texture to it and didn't have the overly "livery" taste i was a little sketch it may have at first. * soft shell crab - one of the items i always get at a japanese restaurant. this was pretty good and the dipping sauce added a nice flavor. this little guy was meaty to. crispy outside and tender meat. yum!* oyster sushi - was good with a light flavor,  more refreshing than savory. was the last dish I got so it was a nice endingcan't wait to try this place again... definitely wanna try the sashimi deluxe or omakase! :)

Reviews.Author: Sylvie C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best in this city! I've literally waited across the street at starbucks for 5:30 pm to hit, so I could run to the sushi bar as soon as gen opened. I was craving sushi gen's red snapper in a very serious way. They put a tiny bit of this insane salty-bitter-umami delicious seaweed pickle on top of the snapper, and it's one of the best things I've ever tasted. That seaweed pickle takes me right back to Tokyo, and I would happily eat their red snapper sushi every day of the week. If you're planning on eating at the bar, come with an extremely empty stomach! I went once with my boyfriend when I had eaten kind of recently, and it's just a miserable experience to see all that glorious sushi and not be able to consume. The red snapper, like I said, is a must. You really can't go wrong though with any choice. The Spanish mackerel is delicious, as are the halibut and albacore. Their miso soup is also awesome, and just emphasizes how authentic this place is. It's so flavorful, and doesn't fall flat like many miso soups do. We were pretty adventurous the last time, and tried the live abalone, which they literally kill right in front of you...not at all what i was expecting. I'm not even sure I knew exactly what abalone was...but now I'll know forever. I'm glad we tried it, but I could live without having it again. I haven't tried anything but the sushi, but when I see the entrees coming out of the kitchen, they look pretty amazing. You can't go wrong with sushi gen, it should definitely be your number one if you want sushi in little tokyo!

Reviews.Author: Les S.
Reviews.Content: The wait here is no joke.  Got here around 12:45 p.m. on Tuesday and didn't get seated until 2:05 p.m.  I guess everyone decided to take a long holiday weekend.   I can't imagine how anyone can come here during lunch break at work if they have to wait this long.  Based on many Yelp reviews, ordered the sashimi lunch and sushi lunch.  Both were about $15.  The fish was pretty fresh, probably the freshest out of all the good sushi joints in this area.  Was it worth the wait?  Hell no.  I'm not a sushi connoisseur so I may be missing a beat but I honestly don't understand why this place gets so many more customers than others.  We sat at a table so it may be different if we ate at the bar.  Regardless, I'm not willing to wait for an hour to get sushi.One weird thing.  The sashimi lunch came with cooked salmon.  Not sure why they cooked a fish on a sashimi combo.  This only leads me to believe they didn't have fresh salmon that day.  I thought salmon was a pretty common item for sushi/sashimi. Everything else on the plate was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Brittany K.
Reviews.Content: 3 1/2 stars.It's a 5 minute drive from Silver Lake which is an absolute plus.  It was our first time here last night and we were really excited because we still can't seem to find amazing sushi on the East Side. Sigh.So, off to Sushi Gen we went, where we waited 40 minutes for a table. We got there around 5:45 on a Saturday hoping to beat the rush, but this place is so popular, the rush was already in full swing.The ambience is cute, super authentic in a little strip mall in Little Tokyo.  The sushi was  good, not amazing to us. We got the:albacore tatakiwhite fish ponzushrimp tempuratuna nigirisalmon nigirihalibut nigirisnapper nigiriyellowtail nigiribaby yellowtail nigirispicy tuna rollOf all of the above, the yummiest was the snapper.  It had sea salt and lemon and was really refreshing.  The rest of the sushi was good and fresh, much of it melted in our mouths, but I went in with such high expectations...We liked it. But the price was also pretty steep.  I dunno, I don't know if I'll be rushing back.  I still prefer some other spots West of La Cienega to Gen, unfortunately for the mileage in my car.

Reviews.Author: Jacinda T.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE.Anyone who thinks it's overrated needs to dig a little deeper into his/her wallet and actually get the REAL sushi.  no skimping with lame rolls or hot foods. do yourself a favor and fill yours tummy with deliciously sushi and sashimi. please.  I don't remember anything I've gotten here that I didn't like.  I'd recommend getting a platter or deluxe thing. (I'm sorry, terrible memory.  But the ones that let you try a bunch of different fish)Sushi Gen is actually pretty large for a sushi place, but it gets packed incredibly fast.  I'd highly recommend MAKING A RESERVATION the day before, or else you may end up waiting 2 hours.  Oh, and don't forget they're closed on Sundays, or you will be a very sad panda.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence L.
Reviews.Content: "Sushi-a-Gen..."More like Sashimi-a-Gen.  Everyone comes here for the $15 sashimi lunch weekday special which is a terrific value, so much that it's practically an assembly line.  That's what I did and I got in after waiting 10 mins at 1245pm on a Monday.  How did I manage to do that you ask?  Well for one thing, I came solo and I was willing to pair up with another singleton.  That's fine, I wound up sitting with another guy who would never be confused with the most interesting man in world.  A couple of type-A's like us got along just fine --  I don't always eat at Sushi-Gen, but when I do I sit with strangers (haha!).  Funny, but we both ordered the same thing, got our food at the same time, finished eating at the same time, got the bill reconciled at the same time, blah, blah, blah.  Btw, I gotta hand it to the host though, when I asked him how long it would take he said 10 minutes if I was willing to sit with another, and he was right on the money, no bs there...You get a nice generous amount of sashimi, along with some strictly non-cut raw fish items yelp.com/biz_photos/sush… but it's a nice mix, and for $15 with soup, tofu appetizer yelp.com/biz_photos/sush…, and a nice bowl of rice, it's quite a value yelp.com/biz_photos/sush….  At the end of the day, the fish is fresh, it's pretty good, but nothing that says OMFG!  C'mon you can't say that it's the best ever because if you do, then I would question your objectivity and say that you're a victim of all the hype.  The operative word here is VALUE...Parking in the Honda parking lot is hit or miss but if you are fortunate to roll in like I did while someone was leaving, then it's $2 for 2 hours with validation;  some people park at Starbucks for 90 min or whatever if you know that you're going to buy a drink but you know how that goes...If I worked nearby, I would come often, but it's also a risky thing because of the wait. Probably a 4.5 rating factoring in the wait and the iffy parking...

Reviews.Author: Theresa L.
Reviews.Content: So every time that my friend from the bay area comes down, she ALWAYS has to eat here.  I never quite understood why this was such a big deal for her until a few days ago.  Now, I think I would have given it 5 stars, but I'm waiting to try a few more sushi joints before I award it the infamous perfect score. However, I was impressed by their sashimi deluxe platter (which came highly recommended by fellow yelpers) and succeeded in not disappointing my tastebuds and belly.  My particular favorites within that plate were the spicy tuna, the cooked salmon (how can you go wrong?), the tuna cubes, and another fish that I have no idea what it was (which goes to show that other than tuna and salmon, I really am no expert on sashimi because I can't differentiate the different kinds).  My bf loved the toro.  I'm not too keen on fatty tuna though.  I highly recommend making reservations well in advance.  Otherwise you're looking at a reasonable wait.  Parking can be a female dog, but try parking in the Office depot lot.

Reviews.Author: Narumi O.
Reviews.Content: OK, is Sushi Gen one of those over rated places?I've heard from people that Sushi gen is pretty expensive and I was not sure if this place was " Omakase worthy", so I decided to order Sashimi deluxe.The portion was American size and it was way too much.There are 6 pieces of Toro on my plate and I couldn't finish it. It's just too much.The fish selection on the deluxe plate was very interesintg,,,,, there was a tiny piece of grilled salmon, and I thought it was odd. It looked like left over from Makanai.I also ordered Ankimo sashimi, and it was not my favorite.(It was better than Otafuku,though)I will go there one more time and see if this place is at least 4 star worthy.

Reviews.Author: Keila N.
Reviews.Content: I was here recently and I was very delighted by the food and the service.  I did wait for about 15 minutes because there were a lot of people before us.This place is reasonably priced.  The sushi is good.  The service is fast and courteous.

Reviews.Author: Daisy C.
Reviews.Content: why hands down? HANDS UP!This place serves the best sushi, out of all the sushi served restaurants that I've been to.The place is small, but gets really packed really fast. Even with reservations you will probably need to wait a bit. I ordered their chirashi which was about 18-22 bucks from what I remembered. *thumbs up-hands up!* tuna everywhere! theres no site of salmon which I wished they had in the chirashi because salmon is my favorite. But omg they had unagi in this, and it was mother freaking good. I mean what on earth have I been eating this whole time? This is where it's at! Salmon sashimi, *thumbs up-hands up!!!* It tasted like the salmon just swimmed out of fresh water, de-skinned itself, de-boned itself, sliced itself, and jumped into my mouth. I don't care how dramatic I sound. I'm paying for the fish, so I can say whatever I want. The best salmon I've had.If you plan on visiting, be ready to drop some $$$ because these people aint playing.banzai

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Why oh why do I live in the valley where all the alleged "legitimate" sushi bars are all but Japanese owned and operated? Why can't there be more establishments like Sushi-Gen around here? I suppose I'm going to have to move as a solution to that problem...Sushi-Gen IS the place to go to for sashimi in Los Angeles without having to pay out your ass. For $15 during the designated lunch period, you can stuff your face with a platter of clean and fresh cuts of yellowtail, albacore,  octopus, and salmon with an order of their "sashimi lunch" --- all while sheeplessly contributing to the global decimation of wild-caught fish populations. A zesty miso soup and a hefty individual serving of rice is served with the fish. I eat a good amount of sashimi (surprised I'm not dead from mercury poisoning) so I'm confident to say I know fresh seafood when I eat it.They don't have any of that Americanized-fusion "Las Vegas high-roller tempura cowboy roll" or "Caterpillar rainbow dandelion cut roll" crap.REAL, JAPANESE PREPARED FOOD. REALLY FRESH SUSHI. That's all there is to it.Highly recommended if you're down in that part of DTLA (Japantown). Here's a little heads up though...it's not a "well kept secret" in L.A. Too many people know about this place and for good reason...which results in the restaurant being packed for every hour they are open (especially lunch), so you may have  to wait awhile to be seated.A very solid 4.5 stars.Parking in that lot with validation from the restaurant costs $1.50.

Reviews.Author: Victoria J.
Reviews.Content: Possibly a divine sushi experience.  Sort of felt as though I was sent to sushi-heaven and back.  Wow.While visiting my friend in L.A. I figured I would explore the city alone while he was at work and I stopped by for an early dinner as I had read incredible things about it on Yelp.I couldn't believe it was in some random strip mall, odd.  Once inside, I was greeted warmly and seated at the sushi bar, per personal choice.  And so my experience began.I decided that this was my chance to try what West Coast sushi was all about, but none of this Tempura Roll stuff - the REAL stuff.  Below, is what I ordered and my assessment. Tobiko Sushi - Almost sweet, delicious!Toro Sushi - the first time I ever tried it and HOLY COW, I am a believer.Uni Sushi - I ordered 3 orders of this, one after the other because I couldn't stop.Unagi Sushi - THEY BROIL IT AT THE SUSHI BAR!!! It's super warm, sweet, and delicious.Maguro Sashimi - big, beefy cuts of wonderfully fresh tunaHamachi belly Sushi - OMG.  I didn't even think something so glorious existed. I knew, after reading much about West Coast Sushi culture, that I would be impressed; but I never thought I would be blown away to the point of having a spiritual sushi experience.  This will possibly be the best sushi I will ever have.

Reviews.Author: Marianne S.
Reviews.Content: Yay I am a definite fan. Took a trip to my husband's dermatologist today and inquired about a good sushi place.  Kinda hard since his dermatologist is located in Little Tokyo but Sushi-Gen came highly recommended. We were 1 1/2 hour early so we decided to walk around and finally decided to make our way there around 10:55am.  Got there at 11:00am (since they open at 11:15am) and there was already a long line out. Lesson #1: GET HERE EARLY. GET HERE 20-25min early for a table guarantee.  Table=lunch special. And their lunch special was great. Had the combination salmon terriyaki and sashimi and it was made just right.The salmon was not too salty, the sauce was just right. And you can never go wrong with their sashimi.  Possibly the best have I've by far. It melts in your mouth. The lunch special comes with rice, salad, tofu and soup. I hear that at night the prices bumps up to almost $100 for the sashimi...I heard.  Anyway, definitely worth a try and a trip when around downtown L.A. Ohh and this place runs pretty efficiently though so even if you are waiting, table shouldn't take too long before one opens up.

Reviews.Author: Downtownbaby T.
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time, I was taken here for a special occasion...my companion LOVED Uni, so...trying to be the sport that I am, I try it.  Yes...it was slimy...yes it was...slimy...yes...slimy...yes I spat it out.  I just spat out a very expensive piece of sushi--but..everything else, you'd have to pay me to spit out.  The sushi here is amazing, this establishment has been around for ages, it's very expensive, very crowded--very obvious that it's a top-notch place, isn't it?Now, I'm addicted to Uni...and it's the first thing I order at ANY sushi place.  It's how I rate sushi restaurants, and this place is one of the best.

Reviews.Author: Min S.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Sushi gen few times and ate at the bar.  I could see that they only use high quality fish and they have been selling a lot. I mean A LOT. I have been very much impressed about their quality of fish and the number of chefs working on supposedly-not-busy-weekdays(8 chefs for Tuesday night... wow. )This time I went to Sushi gen for lunch sashimi ($15) and  it had about 7kinds of fishes including toro.ytail.crabmeat.spicy tuna.squid.salmon braised. salmon teriyaki. seaweed. I loved them all, but I wished they serve them with vinegared rice. (not plain white rice) I think that is more appetizing and tastes much better. Nothing to complain and will be back definitely!

Reviews.Author: Carissa U.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars!Wow... even for a Monday, this place has very good sushi and sashimi. I went here Monday for lunch with my boyfriend and we had the sashimi lunch and the sushi combo. We were impressed and left with happy tummies. We were seated fairly quickly even though we were told it was a 30 min wait. It was more like 15 min. The parking lot is small, but you get $2 lunch parking for 2 hours with validation. The only thing that lacked was a refill of drinks. I was quite thirsty at the end of the meal. Other than that, great quality for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Author: Teresa W.
Reviews.Content: We were still hungry...The sushi was fresh, and good, but nothing spectacular, the portions and rolls were tiny, and we were left starving after everyone at the table shelled out $20 a piece.  we had to go to yogurtland afterwards to fill ourselves.The wait was long, and the service was a tad slow.If you're a trust fund baby, it's a great place to get sushi.  If you're not, go for lower quality, but at least it's filling sushi, elsewhere in little tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay H.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi combo at lunch: affordable, none fishyTheir tea (which they now charge for): deliciouswait time: usually extremely long, but today we had a big group (5) hahathey told us to wait 25minutes, after 3 minutes, they took us in since we were the bigger group :D Yay~]Sashimi quality: it is not the best in the world, but for what you can get for the price, it is INCREDIBLE and did I say it was SOOOO worth it?

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here since ages ago but I'm happy to review it now.  It's a good establishment.  Authenticity and freshness are great combo for a sushi joint; Sushi-Gen embodies these two elements which makes it easy for me to come back to.  With a lunch outing with my aunt, at 11:30 we waited about 20 minutes to get seated.  Seriously at lunchtime, 20 minutes is practically like no wait.  There's always a wait here, so if your in a hurry this might not be the right choice.  I ordered the Salmon Lunch Special which comes with grilled salmon, sashimi, miso soup, mini tofu, rice and mini salad.  I say for under $20 this is a good deal. The grilled salmon took 20 minutes to cook (which the waiter told us while ordering).  Once it came out, it was amazing! the flakes of salmon came off the bones and really it melts in your mouth.  The fish was fresh and well cooked.  The sashimi was amazing! I had 8 pieces from tuna, halibut and salmon.  Really a melt in your mouth experience.  The service was good, the waitresses were constantly refilling my water and my iced green tea.For lunch, I think it's really worth it if your willing to wait.  It's a good price for great fish!  I can't wait till I go back again!

Reviews.Author: sybril s.
Reviews.Content: Okay, adding to the million reviews that are already there... but I gotta do my part as a responsible Yelper. LOLThis is one of my favorite sushi restaurants of all times.  With that said, fish quality is good, there's a good variety of items on the menu.  My favorite is the uni-ika (find it on the menu, not sushi list)... sliced fresh squid mixed with fresh uni... heaven!!  Staff are friendly but it gets crazily busy sometimes so be patient :)

Reviews.Author: Todd O.
Reviews.Content: PIcked this place by chance about 6 months ago. I will never forget it, probably because it was the first time I'd had omikaze. Took my friend there for his first sushi experience and my first, albeit unknown, omikaze/a la carte...It started with some beers and a few nigiri selections that I am fond of, then I began to notice the  little old chef serving us the fish (at the bar, and apparently lucky to be seated there). I felt like striking up some conversation with him even though I don't speak Japanese and he barely spoke engrish'. Feeling a bit adventurous that night I decided to ask the chef for random pieces from the fridge in front of us. He would name the fish for me and I would ask him to hook it up, and he did. BLEW MY MIND. He would serve a piece at a time, if I liked it, he would hand me another. And on and on till I was at about 200 hundred bucks or so. The sticker shock was somewhat of a buzz kill but well worth the experience. I felt a kinship with that man. I hope to eat there again one day. Oh, btw, I travel constantly, eating sushi whenever I can afford it, and this was some of the freshest sushi I've tasted anywhere...other than the last time I had mackerel served up from the top of an igloo chest' on the back of boat.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi place in Los Angeles and has yet to fail me. Quick words of advice if you're thinking about coming here for the first time.1. Don't bring your non-Sushi loving friends here or else you will waste a lot of money! There are plenty of cheap alternatives in Little Tokyo that will satisfy your friends who only eat "California Rolls"2. Don't get a table, sit at the bar. You will  waste your experience if you sit at a table instead of the bar. The sushi chefs there are awesome and authentic, whereas you have no idea who is making your rolls in the back-of-the-house.3. You have to order the Toro (Fatty Tuna). Best damn thing on the menu.4. Come Early! This place gets packed around prime time on the weekend!5. No Reservations!6. Don't forget to get your parking validated!What makes this place stand out from the other sushi places in Little Tokyo (other than the price) is that each cut of fish is perfect. You really have to appreciate fine sushi in order to savor the most of your meal here. Temperature of the food is perfect as well. The only negative side is that you're looking to pay ~$75 a person if you're ordering food and alcohol (still not the most expensive sushi place I've been to, but that's pretty pricey). I will honestly say that you get your monies worth if you're an avid sushi lover.

Reviews.Author: Luia Y.
Reviews.Content: *Highlight: lunch special sashimi plate!!Their lunch special is ridiculous-- you can get a HUGE plate of assorted sashimi plus soup, rice, and tofu for $15. The sashimi is so fresh and amazing. It's gotten to the point that whenever I go to other Japanese restaurants, I sit there missing Sushi-Gen. ;)It's not so horribly crowded at 11-11:30ish on weekdays.

Reviews.Author: Sera K.
Reviews.Content: WOW. One of the best sushi places I've eaten in California so far!I've actually been looking for a good sushi place, cuz I simply L-O-V-E SUSHI!! It's my favorite food out of any other out there. I am seafood's greatest enemy (: I went here today for early Christmas dinner with my fam bam. Good thing I made a reservation because as soon as I entered the door, there were a lot of people standing there waiting to be seated! I couldn't find Sushi-Gen as I was driving on E. 2nd St. But as I cornered the other side of the plaza, Sushi-Gen was hiding in the corner with a blue sign that read "Sushi-Gen."We were seated inside, not at the sushi bar since it was full. The waitress was really nice and at first I wasn't really sure how the menu worked, because they didn't have any explanation to it whatsoever. So we decided to order lots of sushi because I wanted to eat sushi I love!So here's the list:-Sweet Shrimp(THE BEST RAW SUSHI EVER)-Uni AKA Sea Urchin (This was very very fresh)-Tuna -Clam-Octopus-Yellow Tail-Spicy Tuna Roll-Eel Avocado Roll (The rolls are really small, unlike the ones you get at places that have happy hours)They were all very delicious. I didn't want the fried shrimp heads since I am on a diet, but they had another choice you could get: Shrimp Head miso soup. YUM! That was delishhhhhh.I ordered diet coke. I wasn't sure and am still questioning if refill of it is free... The cup was so tiny. But that doesn't matter because one cup of diet coke was enough (: Little Tokyo has so many sushi places, but so far, Sushi-Gen is my favorite! I have to read some more Yelp! reviews and try some other good rating sushi places. Our bill came out to be over $200 with tip, but it was all worth it for a special occasion. Christmas! (; I'm gonna try some other great sushi places and see if I'll come back to Sushi-Gen or some other place. I was also trying to go to Urasawa, but their reservation was full ): So I'm guessing their sushi is REALLY good. Most def. try this place out, cuz you won't regret it!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: Introduced by a friend (if possible, see Vivien L's review)... SASHIMI LUNCH SPECIAL. $15 w/o tax/tip and it's great quality, clean, fresh, filling, and with more than enough to last another meal. Not saying I doggy-bagged raw fish.... and still ate it........One of my favorite (if not THE favorite) Japanese restaurant to go to in Little Tokyo.For convenience, pay a couple bucks (w/ validation) and park in their private lot.

Reviews.Author: Elisha G.
Reviews.Content: First of all, shoutout to my friend Joyce H. for treating me and Andrea P. to a wonderful meal!! :) Thank youuu!!15$ for a sashimi platter lunch combo is a really great deal. Included in the meal is some tofu, a picked salad, and miso soup. Tofu was quite good, but I think it would have been even better if they had used soft/silken tofu. Mmm... I also really enjoyed the miso soup. The platter is very significant. I was so full that I couldn't even finish it... and I'm a girl that can eat! (also the reason for my stretchy pants) So that is really saying a lot. I typically prefer sushi/nigiri over sashimi, but I felt it was a better deal (and I'm Asian so I can't turn down a good deal). Anyway, I wish our waitress had described the lunch sashimi to us though. From what I could tell, we had some cooked salmon, blue fin tuna, hamachi, squid, bbq pork? (it tastes like char siu!), cooked crab, a spicy tuna, another seasoned fish, maybe a red snapper? and two other things that I couldnt make out but tasted like yellowtail tuna. Haha, I probably should have asked. Anyway, all the fish was extremely fresh, and all were cut extremely well, except for my possible red snapper that was a little roughed against the fibers.
