For a place like Sushi-Gen, I kinda wish I got a little bit more variety in the raw fish, but at $15, that is a price that can't be beat! :) If I am ever in downtown LA again I will try their sushi platter or it at the bar. Overall, this place doesn't totally blow my mind, but it gives you good quality sushi and doesn't empty your wallet. For parking, just park in the lot -they give you 2hr validation for $2. It's much easier than trying to find something else.

Reviews.Author: Christine B.
Reviews.Content: This place is busy CONSTANTLY.  Service:  our waiter was a very cute and attentive Japanese woman.Food:  Dinner special.  Everyone has written about how delicious the sashimi is here.  I will confirm what everyone else says.  I was blown away by how much food they give you here.  My friend and I couldn't possibly finish everything that came w/ the dinner special but we gave it our best effort.Be ready to wait in line or come RIGHT when its about to open (and stand in line with the others that are waiting to get seated).

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: This place has, in my opinion, the best and most freshest fish in the LA area. (sashimi style)The sashimi is fresh, flavorful, and decently priced. I ordered the sashimi combo for dinner and it was HUGE! There were at least 20 pieces of thick sashimi so it's definitely meant to be shared. Also, I tried their calamari and fried tofu which were also pretty good. Although the lunch specials make it more worthwhile, I still believe the dinner is well worth it for the quality of the fish. On the negative side, the wait can be pretty long so be sure to make a reservation at least a day in advance. Also, parking can also be somewhat difficult since the plaza is pretty popular and fills up fast. However, there are plenty of street parking around the block as long as you're willing to pay for the meter. This restaurant is definitely worth the price and wait for the quality of fish so if you love fresh sashimi, definitely check out Sushi-Gen!

Reviews.Author: Jane N.
Reviews.Content: Hell yeah this is ranked as the best sushi restaurant in LA! This is the BEST sushi I've ever had in my whole life.  SERIOUSLY.  I feel like all the sushi restaurants I've ever been to in the past are nothing but lies!  This is a true, authentic sushi restaurant - so please don't expect any fancy, elaborated rolls - those are the Americanized versions.  The sashimi was fresh and melt in your mouth.  Please do yourself a favor and order the Uni sashimi, or in fact, please order any sashimi from this place!!  I feel like from now on I can never eat any sushi or sashimi again, unless it's from Sushi Gen.  Oh, and the place was super cute!  Our waitress was sooo cute!  She was so nice and attentive!A fan of sushi? Stop by this place, you will NOT regret it!Btw, there will be a long line.  We got lucky and got a table right away, but after we left, I saw a hugeeeeee line trying to get in around 7-8 pm.  I don't blame them.  It's just too good!

Reviews.Author: Chrissy E.
Reviews.Content: Delicious! And only a 5 minute wait (which I hear is good).I ordered white fish something for an appetizer and the sushi deluxe. I tried a few things that I've never had before and everything was tasty. Including the complementary miso soup. I'm glad that I finally made it here and was completely satisfied.

Reviews.Author: William S.
Reviews.Content: This is the single GREATEST sushi I've had in my ENTIRE LIFE. And I've only been there ONCE! Love it love it love it!

Reviews.Author: Suzanne O.
Reviews.Content: This is so far my favorite sushi place in LA. After visiting Japan sushi has been kinda ruined for me here, most things in LA aren't that fresh or they are dolled up in mayonaise and other unnecessary flavors to hide the taste of the fish.Sushi-Gen and Sugarfish are the two places that still make me dance when i take a bite.

Reviews.Author: Simon S.
Reviews.Content: I'm adding another great review to the restaurant! We had to wait on a Saturday night so that was expected. About 40 mins at 800 for a bar spot for two.   Expect to wait but the wait is well worth it. Pretty much the freshest, tastiest sushi I've ever had.  Our bill came out to about $80/person with alcohol so it's not bad. No omakase but you just sit at the bar and order whatever pieces you want...which is nice also.  The best fish was Toro and Kampachi aka Amberjack.  Incredible and melts in your mouth.  Perfect rice portions and seaweed.  The sushi chef can recommend the best fish of the day.My wife loved the Uni and I loved the Salmon Roe.  The Tuna itself was a tasty other sushi joints' "Toro"! We were saddened to hear that they ran out of some fish like Yellowtail belly and fin, but hey...we understood...it means that they keep their stuff fresh for the day.All in all an excellent experience and definitely recommend it to anybody. Great staff but like most things that are excellent...you have to wait.

Reviews.Author: Evan A.
Reviews.Content: Excellent sushi, reasonable price.  Highlights:  uni, saba, albacoreWe ordered the chef's special, which had a roll that looked and tasted like cooked salmon and carrot, which sounds like something you'd get at Cheesecake Factory (not in a proper Japanese Sushi restaurant).  That almost knocked it down to three stars.The uni and mackeral were phenomenal though.

Reviews.Author: Patty H.
Reviews.Content: Reputedly the best & freshest sushi place in LA (I hear alot of unsubstantiated rumors from all sorts of sources), & I must agree. The fish is SUPER fresh. The quality of ALL the dishes from the complimentary appetizer (there's more than the usual) to the combo plates is fantastic. And the price for what you get is a little unbelieveable. My only problem each & every time we go (& I have alot of patience) is THE WAIT, usually an hour to an hour & a half no matter what time we arrive...though we've only gone for lunch each time. Once we arrived about 30 minutes early just to wait in line for the doors to open, & only waited 5 minutes to be seated.(4.5 stars)

Reviews.Author: zoe h.
Reviews.Content: Thanks Yelpers for pointing me in the direction of Sushi-Gen!I'm in LA for work this week and staying in Little Tokyo.  I checked out sushi restaurants in the area on Yelp and decided to try this one after seeing all of the positive reviews.  My friend and I walked over to the restaurant and thought about going somewhere else when we saw how crowded it was.  Although there were lots of people standing around, we got seated immediately.  I'm assuming the others were either a big party of wanted to sit at the sushi bar.The best part about Sushi-Gen is the quality of their fish.  Everything we ate was fresh and delicious!  We started with a bottle of cold sake that we had the waitress pick out.  It was smooth and crisp and reasonable ($18).  We ordered a spicy tuna roll, a yellowtail roll, a california roll, a couple orders of salmon nigiri, and a couple orders of albacore nigiri.  Each piece of fish was better than the next.  The rolls were just the right size and the pieces were perfect too.Our bill wasn't outrageous and we left full and very happy.  If I'm ever in Little Tokyo again, I'll definitely come back to Sushi-Gen!

Reviews.Author: Lem K.
Reviews.Content: The best sashimi and sushi combo plates in Los Angeles!  Go for lunch or dinner and you won't be sorry you did.  There is such a variety and freshness to each it's like you've died and gone to filleted fish heaven.  I can't talk too much about this place or I'm going to cry.  See you soon, my love.

Reviews.Author: Gary K.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch and Sashimi Dinner. Fresh/Delicious, great compliments. At lunch, Sashimi order comes with miso soup and rice. For dinner, Sashimi w/Tempura comes with miso soup/rice/some kind of cold noodles (very small as an appetizer).Lunch ends around 1PM.Inside Honda Plaza (need to pay parking, can be subsidize/validated depending on how long you park. Waits can take as long as an hour. I don't recommend groups because there are not many tables.

Reviews.Author: asuzak H.
Reviews.Content: Best lunch spot for Sushi/Sahimi lover.I always get sashimi combo. It is always make me happy.Fresh fish, cooked fish, rice, soup, pickles, tofu appetizer for only $15!This is the only place that I don't mind waiting to get a table for 20 minute.20~30 minutes wait time is normal for this place since they don't take reservation.This is not a place for you to take a long lunch, so please just eat and leave. You can get some coffee,dessert and conversation at the bakery next door.

Reviews.Author: Toshiko N.
Reviews.Content: OMG! The best authentic sushi bar that I have been to in LA! The moment when you walked in to the restaurant, you feel like you are in Japan. Friendly host welcomes you with smile. We sat down at the bar because if you go to an authentic sushi bar, you MUST sit down at the bar or you will lose the point of being there. The sushi chefs there are so friendly, they will ask you for the next order when you finish your sushi. You can chat with them and they are so nice too! The sushi? I have zero complain to their sushi including rolls that my friend had ordered.  Next time I would love to taste more rolls since I already experienced that their sushi was absolutely delicious!! I would love to go there soon. I just loved it. Who would like to go with me? (LOL!)

Reviews.Author: Nina C.
Reviews.Content: My choice for birthday dinner with my boyfriend.  I made reservations for 7pm on a Saturday night, and we were seated promptly.  The wait for those without reservations seemed quite long.I went with the sashimi dinner plate, a side of rice, and one order of the umeboshi roll.  The boyfriend had the chicken teriyaki and tempura combo dinner, which came with a variety of side dishes.The fish was definitely fresh, and the portion huge.  I could have lived without the minced fish (spicy tuna and one other type), but just a personal preference to have to sliced fish.  The umeboshi roll with shiso leaf was nice, and my boyfriend enjoyed his dinner.  We were stuffed afterwards!Service was brisk but fine...the dinner felt rushed, but they are a very busy restaurant so I wasn't too bothered.  Atmosphere is casual.

Reviews.Author: Shening S.
Reviews.Content: ok so I had a hard time finding this place...and thus I didn't know where to park...but itss allll goooodGREAT VALUE FOR LUNCH!! only $15 for sashimi lunch special!!there will be a line..so its best to come early..around 12pm. they give you a generous portion of tuna...2-3 kinds, halibut, squid...all i remember was the melt-in-your-mouth TUNA! YUM~for all y'all 1st timers: its located in a lil mall area and the parking lot is called Honda...plaza? it's $2 for 2 hrs with validation.

Reviews.Author: Tara L.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmm :) I LOVE coming here. Too bad that I only get to eat this a few times a year when I fly back home to visit family and friends. However, after my last update, Sushi Gen has regained their 5-star throne from me! Lunch is great at $14 for Sashimi Lunch, and dinner at $28 for Sashimi Dinner is equally as satisfying.On numerous occasions, we've come super close to closing time (around 9:15pm and they stop accepting patrons at 9:30!!), and still, the sashimi, tempura, and appetizers are still oh-so-fresh!Love that after all these years that I've been coming here, their quality hasn't been compromised substantially. Will keep on coming here whenever I'm in town! Mmmm yummy!!! :)

Reviews.Author: Lertchai P.
Reviews.Content: the lunch special sashimi set was worth every penny. for $15, you can get pretty good amount of sashimi and a bowl of rice. i thought i would have to order 2 of them but one was enough for lunch.The wait wasn't that bad. It took me about 15-20 mins on Thursday lunch

Reviews.Author: Virginia D.
Reviews.Content: Eh --- I don't know what's the hype about this place.  Although it was the weekday, there is still a 30 minutes wait, which I heard it isn't that bad for a normal day.I got the sashimi deluxe, although it is fresh, it isn't memorable.

Reviews.Author: Janet L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best sushi I've ever eaten. I actually couldn't talk while I was savoring the pieces in between bites.Sit at the sushi bar for faster service from the chefs (but only recommended for 1-3 people!).Had 2 orders of toro (very very good), tuna, salmon and red snapper sashimi - and everything is just mouth-watering delicious. We had all that, and a beer for $60pp - definitely very good deal!!There is always a wait, but sushi bar waits are between 20-30 min only.The only negative about this place - it makes other sushi places taste blaaaah

Reviews.Author: Asilia D.
Reviews.Content: Sorry folks, this place does not deserve anything over par...If one were to use one word to describe Sushi Gen's food, I think the word "standard" would be quite appropriate.  There really isn't anything wrong with their food.  Fish are pretty fresh, and everything is done right, but to all honesty their sushi feels like they came out of a factory rather than prepared by sushi chefs creating them with their hearts.You know those sushi for dummies menu with pictures for different types of sushi that has both Japanese and English names?  That's exactly like what Sushi Gen serves you, nothing less but nothing more either.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan F.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner here Wednesday for the first time, I had read many reviews here before.The Sashimi Deluxe platter was $35 and worth every penny.  There was an excellent assortment of raw fish and plenty of it.  Plus there was ample garnish and even some smoked salmon too.  Did I mention raw crab, octopus, king clam, tuna, shrimp and a bunch of other stuff I don't remember.The Sashimi + Tempura platter was $26 and also VERY good.  The Sashimi was everything on the deluxe except for the shrimp, just a slightly smaller portion.  Plus the tempura aspect came with 2 shrimp and 3 or 4 large vegetables.The staff was very nice and pleasant and I did not have to wait for a table.Everything was very nice.I'd recommend this to anyone who likes Sashimi.  If you're looking for "exotic" kabuki-esque rolls you probably are not in the right frame of mind for this place.  If you're a carb watcher, this place is an excellent place too.

Reviews.Author: Turbo G.
Reviews.Content: This place is for traditional sushi eaters.Very reasonably priced lunch menu... love the teriyaki and sashimi combo.The sushi bar offered the best fish available from market.The decor is old and outdated. but overall is a great experience.Will visit again!

Reviews.Author: george H.
Reviews.Content: Ahem.I'm very white and enjoy my sentiments of sushi-elitism just as much as my other fellow white-ians on this site do, and I can safely say that my recent trek to Sushi Gen - after, of course, having been coming here all my life before any of you/since the dawn of time/I MADE & INVENTED SUSHI - was one of utmost astounding wonderment.I called the owner up (which is me by the way) and demanded he know of my impending presence.His exact words:  "yes".I hopped in my G5 as fast as I could - I live in Tokyo, Japan, [in the heart of Pyongyang] mind you - instructed my pilot to set a course for Downtown, Los Angeles and off we were into the sunset to this most sought-after of Sushi joints.I landed the G5 in the enormous parking structure considerately provided for all and showed the valet my security credentials. Jose (the valet) and I shared a laugh as we caught up on old times - on account of our not seeing each other for such a temporal allotment of nothingness.My 5 girlfriends and I- the 5 of them completely OK and already complacent with the fact I bone all of them simultaneously - walk up to Sushi Gen's entrance, shoving everyone away to their deaths in our path. We all authoritatively take our seats and foresightedly demand our meal be free on the grounds of it being too delicious for any normal, serf human to fathom.My 5 GF's and I then commenced having sex on the sushi bar while the owner regaled us with stories from the old country  (about how samurai used secret progressions to attain the meaning of life). I then acceded into God-status and took many, many lives that day.Oh yeah... the sushi was good.

Reviews.Author: Season C.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the lunch sashimi-  it came with miso soup, pickled cabbage, tofu, sashimi and rice. The fish was fresh and the miso soup wasn't grainy like other places. The service was fast and pleasant. Would definitely come back

Reviews.Author: Todd S.
Reviews.Content: My better half took me here as a surprise for my birthday.  We were both really excited since we had heard great things.  All was going well, we ordered some cold sake, told the server that we would like omakase, sat back and waited for the feast that was to come. I went slack-jawed when the first thing I saw on the platter was a spicy tuna roll!?!?!  For, the uninitiated, spicy tuna is a means by which tuna that is a bit past it's prime is run through a meat grinder with some hot sauce and sold to willing customers.  Nothing inherently terrible in that, but as your lead dish for omakase?If McDonald's opened up an omakase joint (don't laugh, they own a patent on McSushi) I would expect this, but Sushi Gen?  I cut my losses and didn't say anything, complaining about the food at your birthday dinner is not so classy...But, I did call a week later to ask WTF and the management blew me off, they politely blew me off, but I was blown off nonetheless.

Reviews.Author: Shirley P.
Reviews.Content: Maybe the best sushi restaurant I know of in LA these days.  My parents used to make lunch visits often, especially when decent Japanese food was scarce back in the days.  On the occassion when I wasn't in school, would I be able to go with them.My usual is the broiled yellow tail collar.  My mom recommended it to me and I've been hooked ever since.  The sashimi and sushi is also some of the best quality, especially good if you're all about the raw fish and not so into the fancy fusion cut rolls.

Reviews.Author: Jodi H.
Reviews.Content: if you do not understand sushi or are new to it- the magic of this place might be lost on you.  Its the real deal.  Pick your favorites & let the chef blow your mind with his sashimi choices also. Incredible.

Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Kumi K.
Reviews.Content: I'm adding two stars for eating AT THE COUNTER only.Otherwise, don't even bother.

Reviews.Author: Minh D.
Reviews.Content: Waited about an hour for this during dinner time.  The whole I'm thinking, "Why is this place so popular?", "Is it worth the wait?", "Yelp loves this place". So what did I think?We tried the sashimi platter, sushi platter, all kinds salads.  The dressing on the salads was tangy and delicious.  The sashimi was fresh, the sushi was prepared excellent.  The moisture of the sushi rice was perfect.  They did use a bit too much wasabi in some of the sushi pieces though.  The tempura was very... tempura-ly.  Of course we ordered too much and didn't finish, we always do that.  I haven't had sushi since, being forced to stuff down sashimi pieces isn't amusing.  Service was great of course.It's not the best sushi I've ever had, but it's pretty darn good.  Pricey though because our bill raised the roof.  I'd come back here if there was no wait.

Reviews.Author: Jeannie K.
Reviews.Content: I've been 10+ times so I can't give it 2 stars (which, for me, means I wouldn't go back as opposed to 3 stars which means I wouldn't object)... but I won't go back.The lunch menu is a good deal.  You get a LOT of food for $15.  The dinner - best bang for the buck on the menu is sashimi deluxe with an order of sushi rice on the side. I haven't had cooked food here, and if I go back, that is what I will get.  The hamachi collar looks pretty awesome, and it's hard to mess up such an oily fish anyway.Small parking lot, ~$2 with validation.

Reviews.Author: Christine A.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is hands down one of the best sushi places in LA! I love their fresh sushi/sashimi & I love sitting by the sushi bar! I just really like how they melt in my mouth! *DROOOOOOOOOL*The only complaint is really the crazy long wait! :(  I am willing to pay for slightly high priced fish, but the wait? I don't know... I also heard amazing stories about their lunch special, but I work too far to come here for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Alexander Y.
Reviews.Content: While eating dim sum for lunch, my friend tells me about this place in Little Tokyo that has a ridiculous $15 sashimi plate for lunch that is probably worth more than what I'd pay. I'm like...dude, that can't be serious.Well, he was serious. Very good sashimi at an epic price. Salmon, yellowtail, tuna, spicy tuna, albacore, toro...I'm probably missing something right now, but for around 25 pieces it's worth its weight in value and then some. I don't even mess with the soy sauce on something this good.Granted, parking is kind of a pain in the ass (it's L.A. after all) and the wait took about 30 minutes at lunch. But for this deal? I'll wait gladly.

Reviews.Author: Peter H.
Reviews.Content: All you need to know is the sashimi is fresh and great quality.  You need to come here and try it for yourself as my words cannot adequately describe what great sashimi tastes like.  Stick to the best stuff - sushi and sashimi.  They have teriyaki this and that but don't distract yourself.  I recommend ordering the sashimi plate for lunch.  You get salmon, albacore, yellowtail, some poke tasting stuff and a few other items.  Even the seaweed that comes with the sashimi is good.  The portion is generous enough to satisfy most people.   Service is fast and on the ball.  Make a reservation or face waiting in a long line.

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: I do love sushi, and I love a real sushi restaurant.  For those expecting to find trendy cut rolls to fill your American appetite, try somewhere else.  This is a Japanese sushi restaurant.The fish quality is excellent, and always very refreshing.  Rice is magnificent and glutinous and delicious.  I'd recommend sitting at the sushi bar to get your full-on sushi meal.  The sushi chefs are very obliging and give freebies here and there, so make sure to tip them well!  Presentation is an excellent accompaniment to the quality of food.  There is this one dish that's a kind of assortment platter (no idea what it's called) and it was great to try more authentic Japanese concoctions besides sashimi and sushi.Raw oysters are sooooo bomb, but small and very expensive.  Very, very good quality though.Price may be the biggest deterrent for me, as Japanese food is already pricey, and this place is no different.  I understand that I'm paying for quality, but I'm still paying alot.  It's a good place to splurge every once in a while.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: Food was great. But the wait was crazy. I don't know if it's really worth the wait given that I had equally delicious food from Oomasa just the day before too. I ordered Chirashi sushi from Sushi-Gen. So the deal with seating: you can only order sushi if you are sitting at the bar. Usually this includes chirashi because it's really just a bunch of sushi on top of a bed of rice. Oomasa let me order chirashi from the bar. But nope, not at Sushi-Gen, because they are super busy. If you want anything from the dinner menu, you have to wait the super long line to be seated at a table. I ended up ordering to go because I wanted chirashi, but I didn't want to wait an hour for a table.The chirashi from Sushi-Gen included slightly better quality sushi. I am not a sushi connoiseur so I am only judging based on the texture and my preference. The chirashi from Sushi-Gen comes out a little ahead, but not  enough to justify the wait.

Reviews.Author: Jessie M.
Reviews.Content: Alright alright I finally went back, waited the painful 30 minutes to be seated at lunch, and tried the famous sashimi lunch. It was good. Great value, good quality. Worth a try if you haven't already.They should leave out the salmon and teriyaki beefy stuff and just add more fish, in my opinion. Maybe some sweet shrimp or ikura? Also got a side of uni which was great, but $11 for two pieces? Sort of crazy when they had just handed me a massive plate filled with thick cut slices of tons of different fish for $15...... hmm....

Reviews.Author: Dahlia S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the lunch special. Having to wait twenty minutes to get a table for two definitely was too long, especially when two people came in after us and got seated before us (no, my hungry tummy did not impair me from catching that).Fish was definitely good quality and a good price, and came out really fast once we finally got seated. Didn't really like all those pickled veggies that came with it but then again I never like pickled anything.If I come back I would sit at the bar and just order sushi. There are a zillion other places in Little Tokyo that have good quality fish.

Reviews.Author: Rachael K.
Reviews.Content: Occasion: Lunch with Rich (before spontaneous drive to Venice Beach!) What I Had: Chirashi Deluxe ($15!) Food Review: Good, but not as great as Sugarfish for sure! All of the fish and other seafood (e.g., squid, octopus) were tasty. I will say that on second thought I should have probably gotten the lunch sashimi platter, which is also $15 but seems to have a larger quantity of fish and a side of tofu. The rice was well seasoned and true to a proper sushi restaurant, they paw out the warm rice with a slightly damp cloth so the rice grains don't get crushed. LEGIT. Service Review: Nothing in particular about the service. Venue Review: The restaurant is extremely well kept and classy! While we were waiting for a table I went and checked out the sushi bar. Everything is kept immaculately clean in and out of the display case, almost like a museum for sushi meats. There are seats at the sushi bar, at tables, and also at booths. There is parking available in the private lot in front of the restaurant, but we found street parking across the street without any trouble. Overall Impression: Solid sushi at a bargain price at lunchtime! Maybe I'm just obsessed with Ponzu sauce, but not as great as Sugarfish. With that said, again, bargain sushi deal for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Erica R.
Reviews.Content: This is the place for serious sushi eaters.  Don't expect your sauce-glazed-tempura-baked-creamy-rolls on the menu here.  Instead enjoy the Sushi-Sashimi dinner plate, that's the best bargain.  Otherwise, ordering individual sushi will add up real quick.And of course, with any great popular restaurant, expect to WAIT.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best sushi places I've been to in LA.  The sashimi is great.  Very fresh and good proportion of slices.  I always go during lunch but there is always a wait.  Another thing, that guy who talks real fast?  He doesn't work there anymore.  At least that is what this other guy/host said when another group asked.  The akimo is good but the garnish on top is a bit big spicy.The sashimi deluxe plate is great but the sashimi lunch special are just as good.

Reviews.Author: Jackie B.
Reviews.Content: My brother loves this place. Loves the sushi bar and green tea. I'm also a growing fan of this traditional Japanese restaurant. And the bakery next door, Frances, is great.My mom and I went in for lunch - it was very busy. There was room at the sushi bar, though, so we sat there and had sushi and sashimi. First thing I ordered was fatty tuna. I love toro. And it's so fresh and good here. Dab a piece in wasabi cut with soy sauce... delicious!The sushi chef in front of us was preparing a whole meal for a guy sitting near us. We asked him what exactly he ordered... He explained but I didn't really understand. I think it's called omakase. It's like "give me whatever you, the chef, suggest." Everything he received looked really good. I got toro, yellowtail sushi, unagi and avocado roll, a spicy scallop hand roll... and lots of iced green tea.It's pricey. But it's the best sushi place I've been to.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin M.
Reviews.Content: The company was awesome: as was the decor, still, the food left a lot to be desired. The atmosphere was a little ruined by the hovering employees and the lighting: still (or maybe because) our service from the hovering employees was prompt and they were nice enough to help me out with some extra chopsticks.Food: I was only vaguely pleased. Others seemed to enjoy it, but I found the fish to be just OK (except the fatty tuna, which I've never seen done wrong). The fishy odor was REALLY upsetting to me: I've been to enough fish markets that I don't need it to assault me in a restaurant as well.Ultimately, worth a trip if you're in the area: but not worth going out of your way.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie N.
Reviews.Content: Ever wanted to find sushi perfection? It's here in a small spot in J-Town in Los Angeles.I found my way here from Yelp reviews. My first indicator that it was going to be good: it's in J-Town. Second indicator: patrons arrived 1 hour before dinner time to stand outside to get in line. Dinner was at 6 pm, we were outside at 5 pm and we were not the first in line! Third and final indicator: the menu is in Japanese and there are no prices next to the specials.The parking lot charges you to park in it so if you want a decent spot, arrive early or risk walking and parking in the surrounding area.I ordered their tempura and cucumber roll. I was in SHOCK that a damn cucumber roll could even be so tasty! My bf ordered some toro (fatty tuna) sashimi... I had to convince him not to order another plate because it was gonna be another $30.We are definitely going to make another trip down to L.A. just for this place. I can't believe I didn't write this review sooner but yes, I am willing to drive/fly/roller blade or row a boat down to SoCal from the Bay for this place. - That's how good this spot is!

Reviews.Author: Diana H.
Reviews.Content: Ain't nobody dope as Sushi Gen dressed so fresh so clean(So fresh and so good good)Outkast sums it up pretty well here. No fuss sushi bar with super fresh high quality fish. What's not to love? Make sure to sit at the sushi bar even though there might be a long wait and no wait for the tables. The wait is worth it!!! I made this mistake the first time I went and the sushi was a bit warm by the time it got to our table. Needless to say, I wasn't too thrilled. The next time I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi was 100x better.

Reviews.Author: Janet K.
Reviews.Content: I planned a little surprise birthday dinner here for my boyfriend with six other friends, and it was probably the best decision I've ever made as far as dinner/birthday/sushi decisions go.Why I chose Sushi-Gen: my boyfriend is the biggest sushi nut I have ever encountered. I wanted to take him to enjoy some authentic, delicious, fancier-than-normal sushi, and Yelp showed me that Sushi-Gen was the only way to go. 650+ reviews, a 4.5 rating, photos showing delicious sashimi and a recommendation from a friend saying that Sushi-Gen has "the freshest fish she has ever tasted" got me hook, line and sinker. I was incredibly eager to try this place out. The week leading up to the dinner, I kept stalking Yelp photos of the sashimi dinner plate, waiting in anticipation!Why I recommend Sushi-Gen for its service: our reservation was for 8PM on a busy Saturday night, and we were all running late (I had to stall a lot since my friends were late too!), but all eight of us were seated right away and the restaurant was very accommodating of our party. Our server was FANTASTIC and so very cute and smiley and polite and came to check on us periodically despite the busyness. They also gave my boyfriend a delicious green tea ice cream dessert for his birthday. Also, I had to call and change my reservation plans four times and probably caused a lot of trouble... but everything still went so smoothly! Thank you, Sushi-Gen host... I forgot your name :(Why I recommend Sushi-Gen for its food: the fish literally melted in my mouth. It was so fresh, so tasty, so soft, so melty, so delicious and heavenly... I ordered the Chirashi Deluxe, most others ordered the Sushi Deluxe, and my boyfriend ordered the amazing Sashimi Dinner. My order was basically the Sashimi Dinner but with all the rice lumped together and all the amazing fish placed on top. I highly recommend the Sashimi Dinner, though. Just look at the photos and you will be similarly enticed. Oh! And they had good Kirin beer and sake. The food is a tad pricey, yes, but it is DEFINITELY worth it, because the portions are large and the fish is so, so, so satisfying.I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Deannie W.
Reviews.Content: Pros: fresh, large portion, cheap Cons: wait time if you come at prime time I love coming here for lunch. The best time to come is around 11:20-11:30 otherwise, be ready to wait for a table. Everytime I come, I order the sashimi lunch special. In my opinion, they give you a lot for your bucks. I never eat the rice but yet I still can't even finish my sashimi. The sashimi special comes with miso soup, rice, and appetizer (normally, braised tofu), then for the sashimi you get about 10 different items including grilled salmon, eels, tuna, squid, spicy tuna and others that I don't remember. Writing this review makes me what to go there tomorrow for lunch. *drools*

Reviews.Author: Karen K.
Reviews.Content: My friend took me here. We arrived at 11:05am and there was already a line. I believe it was opened at 11:15 and we promptly were ushered in. Somewhere behind us the line was cut off and the people were told to wait a while since the restaurant was at capacity. We both ordered the sashimi plate and I soon realized that almost everybody was ordering the same thing. It came not even 5 minutes after we ordered. Boy, the chefs must have anticipated the sashimi plate order rush and armed themselves before opening the doors to us. What makes this place so famous for its sashimi plate? Well, it could be the very fresh pieces of fish, it could be the generous thick slices, it could be the colorful variety or it could be the sweetly smoked tuna, which I totally love. I should bring my husband here. He'd thank me so much. LOL

Reviews.Author: Melissa O.
Reviews.Content: I just went to Sushi-Gen after a long absence. I had been going to Oomasa for a couple months and totally forgot how mind blowing Sushi-Gen is.We arrived at 5:20ish on a Wednesday (before they opened) and we weren't the first ones there. Once again, we formed a line like we were waiting to get on a ride at an amusement park... the most delicious sushi ride of our lives.We sat at the sushi bar and were greeted by our sushi chef and his mentor, whom I assume is the owner. With attention and care, our sushi chef took our order, and, in addition to the owner, asked us how each order tasted. "No soy sauce! No soy sauce!" he teased when we ate our salmon. I held up my soy sauce dish to show him that was my intention.Sushi-Gen at the sushi bar is a completely different experience than Sushi-Gen at the tables. At the bar, you can watch the incredible talent prepare your food for you, and you can interact with them. At the tables you get great food without the ambiance or attention (or fun!).So Oomasa is still really good... The fish is fresh and it is SO reasonably priced. But imagine good sushi, and then try to imagine EXTREMELY GOOD sushi... I'm talking 11 notches of goodness above good... That would be Sushi-Gen.Tuna, white tuna (butter fish), salmon, halibut, mackerel, eel, tamago, salmon skin hand rolls, scallop hand rolls, spicy tuna hand rolls... You name it, it'll blow your mind.

Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: OK, ladies and gentlemen.  Sushi Gen is all around excellent!  I mean both the food and the ambiance.  I've been enjoying this eatery over the years and the quality is alway consistent.   Please try everything but the spicy tuna hand roll and uni (sea urchin), my favorite, is a must!!Sit at the sushi bar ONLY because the sushi chefs is alway fun to be around, trust me on that.  Great crowd, festive ambiance, fresh fish with the most entertaining sushi chef; I could not ask for anything more... five star; )

Reviews.Author: Syn L.
Reviews.Content: SOLID!  Consistent sushi and sashimi.  Can't add much more to the 90+ reviews already here so I am just adding my 2c to get Sushi Gen closer to 100 reviews mark :)My recent fave is still Zo.parking is a pain, there is always a long wait.  Be patient!

Reviews.Author: Robyn S.
Reviews.Content: My brother lives near Sushi-Gen and he has been raving about it to me so I figured I'd try it out.  Yes, the sushi is fresh but I just wasn't impressed with the service. The service was not that great and I felt that the waitress were rude.  The place is so small you have to wait for a table and it's not really worth the wait plus the parking situation is horrible!

Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is so delicious! It is one of the places I always come back to even though it's about 30 miles away from my house. So whenever the opportunity arises when I am in LA, I'm sooo there. *Of all the times I've been to Sushi-Gen, I rather sit at the bar than the booths simply because the sushi comes out immediately for you. BUT feel free to go to the booth if you want to order a meal AND/OR sushi (it'll just take a slightly longer time before the sushi comes out). *The sushi chefs are really helpful, especially if you ask them for assistance on what they would recommend. (Note: Do not ask for what is the freshest fish of the day is because you are indirectly saying that some of their fishes reek. Now we know that happens a lot...but let the chef feel more respected and he will be glad to help you.)*An advice from me would be to make sure either you have a reservation OR come early before they open because-- TRUST ME-- the line can get loooooong. It won't be too long before the entire restaurant fills up with hungry people.Happy eating! :D

Reviews.Author: jenn t.
Reviews.Content: As a long time sushi-gen patron, I can tell you the rants about the wait is no joke! Get there early or die!! .... from hungerA few tips (aside from early arrival): If you're planning to sit at the sushi bar, and you've got the patience, ask to be served by the head sushi chef! He's really nice, and you'll get the best cuts because the sushi sensei gets first pick on the fish. If not, don't fret. They'll never have bad fish with their rate of turnover. Can't make it early? Be prepared for some rejection. Hamachi Kama (Yellowtail Collar) and some other items may be sold out for the night. The best bang for your buck is the dinner special, but that's usually some kind of teriyaki or fried fish. Personally, I'm not a teriyaki kind of girl but if that your thing, go for it! For more adventurous eaters, I'd recommend the following:- Ankimo (Monkfish Liver): very fresh! yum yum. - Mozuku Tororo (Yam with Seaweed): Light, great texture, try this!! I don't see this dish too often. It may not be shown on the menu, but your server will know- Hamachi Kama (Yellowtail Collar): If the HK is sold out, a good substitution is the Yellowtail Head. Both sold out? sucks for you :P jk. I'm sure their other fish dishes are excellent, but they wont beat the Hamachi. - Uni (Sea Urchin): Very sweet- Fatty Yellowtail: !! you must try this. mmm so good. I'd def pick this over their toro. The last 2 times I had their toro, it was pretty disappointing. Stringy toro rubs me the wrong way.Haven't had these in a while, but worth a try- Giant Clam - Sweet Shrimp

Reviews.Author: Sherry Y.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi place in LA. Although I'm sure it's not the best, but since it's close to my house, has great sushi, friendly sushi chefs, and reasonable price, I would give it 5 stars anytime. If you are feeling adventurous and don't have any food restriction, definitely sit at the sushi bar and ask for the omakase (chef's choice). Depending on how much you eat, but normally it would cost you about $50 - $60 per person. I did it a couple of times and was always provided with the greatest and the freshest ingredients. One time the chef brought out a special type of ika (it's seasonal and smaller than the regular ika) and it was so delicious I asked for a second, but then he said he ran out since he gave me the last one. One suggestion, don't even bother sitting at the table unless you have a large party. I always get better quality sushi when I sit at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Liza T.
Reviews.Content: YUM YUM!  I love the sashimi combo lunch!  The fish was so FRESH and YUMMY.  And the combination of the fish were so special and different from other Japanese restaurant.  $15.00 what a deal!  No wonder so many ppls ordered this lunch combo!Service was pretty good, fast, friendly and efficient!  But be prepare the line.  I believe the wait should be hella long during peak hours.  My friend and I (two ppls) were there around 1pm on Friday and we still needed to wait 15 minutes!

Reviews.Author: Derek T.
Reviews.Content: Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, and YUM!!! One yum for every yelp star! This place is one of the best Sushi restaurants in downtown.  Fish is super fresh. Those old ladies serving you not so much, but they're super sweet. Came here yesterday for my bday lunch with co-workers.  It was my first time here and it certainly won't be my last.  I'm a Hama fan too, but this place is just as good.  Fresh sushi that is prepared deliciously and with great service...there's no beating this place.  Get there early or you're gonna wait and the line is outside the door.       We also got two lunch entrée beef teriyaki...beef was money, super tender and not like those flimsy beef you normally get...it was nice and thick.  The other one was the salmon...again no surprise...it was good.  The entrees all come with miso soup, big bowl of rice and side of sashimi.  Go, eat, & I promise you that you'll be back!Parking: Lot for $1.50

Reviews.Author: Rengie M.
Reviews.Content: This place is a good find.  The place is small but not too tight...  One item worth remembering is the grilled black cod.  It was fresh and simply melts in your mouth and explodes with flavor.   It has so much flavor balanced by what seemed to be yuzu fruit rind...The sushi and sashimi is fresh and delightful.  The shrimp & vegetable tempura is okay and didn't really stand out.So as of today, 6/29/10, Sushi-Gen just made it to my top 5 Japanese spots1. Urasawa2. Matsuhisa3. Yu n Mi4. Sushi-Gen5. Sake House

Reviews.Author: Yawen C.
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best sashimi I've ever had. Whenever I have family in town, we always take a trip to Sushi-Gen because pretty much everyone in my family is a huge sashimi fanatic. I must've been here at least 20 times! Even with a big party, we will tough out the no reservations rule and wait for an hour+. At least parking is $2 with validationSashimi deluxe is big enough to share, good variety of fish, they often change it up. Sashimi lunch special is a steal for $15, comes with rice, miso soup, pickled veggies, and tofu! I find it funny - EVERYONE orders it during lunch that when I ordered something else, the waiter thought he misheard me.Not a fan of raw fish? Do not fret, there's good cooked food here too! I love the yellowtail collar and the salmon collar. Almost as good as the raw! Their softshell crab is typical, as is their tempura. Steamed egg custard is small but I love the abundance of seafood. I like my avocado, but I don't like their avocado roll; it was tiny. If I remember correctly, their beef teriyaki is nothing special.Their green tea is wonderful. I've sat at the bar before but personally didn't enjoy it because you have to order nigiri. I'd rather have their entrees and platters.

Reviews.Author: IC C.
Reviews.Content: Back in the day, Honda Plaza was the only thing in this corner of Little Tokyo.  Across the street where the Starbucks and Staples and tons of people are... that was all an empty lot.  Amazing how development happened over time.Sushi Gen has been around in Honda Plaza for all that time.  You could go in for really great sushi, done extremely well... Then head next door to a Japanese hostess bar.  Forgot what it was called, but it was the type of place where guys go in, a bunch of girls come out to keep you company and serve alcohol and light your cigarettes... At the end of the night the guys get stuck with a nasty bill plus massive tips for all the girls that came to hang out with you.Some of those girls were pretty hot... It's hard being a guy sometimes...  How can you resist really hot girls even when there's not much underneath the exterior?    But back to Sushi Gen.Came over to catch up with a friend I haven't seen in awhile.  Without a doubt, the food quality is really very good.  Some extreme food snobs might find things to nitpick about Sushi Gen's sushi, but from my end I feel like it's one of the best in L.A.   It's pretty damn good.And a lot of people agree.  I arrived at 11:15 am into the parking lot, and there was a long line of people waiting for the place to open.  It was like people were waiting a day in advance to get the new iPad or iPhone.  Sushi Gen normally opens at 11, but today they were late in opening up.Dealing with that kind of demand, I'm sure it can get old if you're the host dealing with it.   But guess what?  A crabby host gets old when you've been a customer who's been many times, and has gotten the crabby attitude enough times to remember.For today's lunch, my friend and I waited for 45 minutes.  The host came outside and called my name three times literally in 15 seconds.  Because we didn't come running up immediately within 5 seconds he gave away our table.  When confronted, he made it seem like he called me name for five minutes or more, making a stink about how he was calling our name but didn't respond.  Obviously we were in fact there... So after this awkwardness, he dismissed the people he gave away our table to, telling them they'd have the next table.  And my friend and I got to sit down and eat some great sushi.   The wait staff is friendly and good.But based on the host's silliness today and his lack of basic courtesy, I won't be making any effort to return at this point.  As exceptional as the food is.  This wasn't the first run-in with the host.  Looks like it's just too difficult when you're that good and popular.Oh well.

Reviews.Author: Camille H.
Reviews.Content: The sushi was great!! Better than most places I've tried but the food is quite expensive and the service is mediocre. I expected much more from this place.

Reviews.Author: Joy J.
Reviews.Content: Two words:Simply incredible!  Arrived at 5pm, the place open its doors at 5:25, by 5:30 the tables were all taken; leaving a long line outside. No Joke!  Its a very popular restaurant, the fish is so fresh and delicious, it's a must try.  I went with a friend, two tiny ladies, our bill was $210.00, yes, we ate over $200 worth of sushi, and it was worth every dime. :)

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been here since July of 2006 due to the non-proximity to the living/working arrangements in my life, but it was every bit as good as I remember it.  We waited in the hour lunch line, but I spent half of the time inside savoring the heavy smell of soy sauce.  The waitress made a mistake & gave us all the sides of the sashimi combo & the sushi deluxe combo (what was actually ordered) so we didn't need to really eat a meal for the whole rest of the day.   I was in my personal sushi-heaven for the day...I hope I'll get to try some of the other places recommended, but I have to say I'm really really happy...

Reviews.Author: Stan Y.
Reviews.Content: Aside from the long waits (even if you go before it opens), Sushi Gen doesn't disappoint during lunch time.  I have tried the Chirashi and Sashimi sets.  For $15, thats relatively inexpensive for Japanese food.  And they give you sooo much food.  Just look at the photos!   I try to eat here whenever I'm in the downtown area on a weekday, which is not very often.  The fish is fresh and everything else is delightful. If you are around Little Tokyo and have two hours for lunch, its well worth it.  If you have less time for lunch, you'll need to show up at 11 (Sushi-Gen opens at 11:15), or you'll probably need to wait half an hour since people line up early.   Also, parking is $1.50 with validation for two hours.   I haven't been here for dinner yet, but I expect the plates to be relatively more expensive with the same portions.

Reviews.Author: Arin G.
Reviews.Content: Okay. The word 'Sushi Gen' makes me salivate......so I don't think I need to type any further to describe this fine establishment.Introduced to this Little Tokyo sushi joint by a good friend who works and dines in Downtown LA, I am happy to call this my favorite place to eat sushi.Definately do try the Yellowtail and Red Snapper (sashimi, of course). The soft shell crab is to die for and the albacore sushi, as always, is fantastic. Arguably the best stuff in LA.Always crowded in the evenings - so arrive earlier than expected as wait times are long. But nonetheless, definately worth it.If you like sushi - this is a must.

Reviews.Author: The E.
Reviews.Content: The sushi was very good but the service was not.  If the service was better I would have given it 5 stars.  The White-Tuna and Tamago were so good, the best I have ever had.I went with a friend and had a shock when the bill came, $100 was the final tab.  Not what I was expecting, considering I did not have a lot of sushi and did not order expensive items like Toro.  There were no prices on the menu, so unless you ask before you order every item, expect to pay twice what it normally costs.  But it was still really good.

Reviews.Author: Megan L.
Reviews.Content: WARNING: If you "like sushi" (CA-Philly-Tiger-Crunch rolls with the cream cheese goops) please don't eat here, and please stop claiming that you enjoy sushi. Not that I don't enjoy those above rolls, but Sushi-Gen is the real McCoy.  The fish cuts are always fresh and of high quality. Their Maguro (fatty tuna) and Amaebi (sweet shrimp) are SO incredibly rich, it's, dare I say, orgasmic. Of course, for the authentic sushi experience, I'd sit at the bar. The sushi chefs are the best, so entertaining and welcoming, and the older veteran chefs always recognize a regular. I always come here with my dad every once in a while (we eat about $90 worth of sushi...serious business, not your daily fast food). We always find ourselves starting convos with the people around us and it's great.One thing I absolutely love about Sushi-Gen is that at the bar, they give you the fish. They don't fatten it up with way too much rice to fill you up. Any other average sushi restaurant will do that and make you full so you can't enjoy the amount of fish you probably could. Even if you don't sit at the bar, you can order the most amazing sashimi combinations--my jaw drops at the whenever I see the colorful plate of raw goodness ready to be served elsewhere in the restaurant.Just go. Order whatever you want. So, so good.

Reviews.Author: Susan K.
Reviews.Content: Ate here for the gazillionth time tonight just before the Laker game and I kept reminding myself this is my favorite sushi restaurant in Los Angeles.  Other than Matsuhisa's kanpachi jalapeno and some of the other "innovative" sashimi dishes and R-23's unagi (the best), I wouldn't go anywhere else for raw fish.  Try the Japanese snapper (don't dip this one in soy sauce... eat as served) and the kanpachi (the most buttery I have ever had).I remember loving Kabuto in San Francisco a whole lot (they have grilled unagi sushi and very, very innovative choices like fresh pear w/ mustard/curry on top of hamachi sushi... you can order 1 pieces instead of the standard 2, also, so you can try a lot of stuff)... but tonight, Sushi Gen is at the top of my list.

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: Only been here for their lunch menu. My mom took me to this place after hearing a raving review from a client of hers. Supposedly, her client does sushi import business and she said Sushi Gen imports quality fish. When I hear restaurants using quality food, I get over-hyped before even trying their dish and sometimes, come out disappointed, which was not the case for Sushi Gen. Their Sashimi Combo platter was amazing! It was not the typical Tuna, Salmon, Yellowtail dish like other Japanese restaurants. This place was an authentic sit down quality restaurant with real Japanese dish. They served slices of quality tuna slices, thick and fresh, along with other flavorful dish that I have never tried before. It's hard to explain what they were but it was really good. The dish also came along with miso, rice, and something like a seaweed salad.The ambiance felt like you were in an actual Japanese restaurant. Portraits of Sumo wrestlers and Japanese employees. It had a good vibe. The line can get lengthy at times and they do not take reservations, but if you have the time, I believe it is all worth it. Overall, this place gets my vote as the best Sushi restaurant for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Adalon C.
Reviews.Content: I think this is my favorite place for my favorite food - sushi.  Maybe 2nd favorite?  (The other one will be my secret place.)I try to come here once a week - sushi bar omakase only - usually either really early or really late to avoid the dinner rush.  It is AMAZING!  Sometimes we get items that aren't on the menu.  For example, last time we got Ayu sushi (very seasonal), which I've never had before raw.  I usually share an omakase with my friend, so that we each get one piece of each course.  This way we have more variety.

Reviews.Author: Kelly L.
Reviews.Content: This place is always busy.  There is always a wait here.  I had read so many great reviews on here that we decided to try the sushi here one day.  Well, that one day finally came with over an hour wait (all thanks to my stupid fortune cookie that I got earlier that day "Now is the time to try something new")... and I find this place, just OK.The restaurant is bustling with people.  It is full of energy and the place is great.  With over an hour wait, I had high expectations, which ended up with huge disappointment when dinner was over.  We ordered a sushi combo with 8 assorted sushi.  I guess it came along with salad and a cold appetizer?  The cold appetizer was yam noodles with grated mountain yam.  That tasted pretty good.  Besides the 8 pieces sushi we ordered, we ordered uni, sardine, albacore, giant clam, and 3 more sushi which I forgot.  The sushi came out at room temperature.  It seemed like they left the sushi on the counter for a while before making it my table.  Not like this was a cheap dinner either.  We ended up spending $108 before tips for little amount of sushi we ordered.  With over an hour wait, with room temperature sushi, I wish I can have something better to say about this restaurant... All I know is, I won't be wasting my time waiting in line again.

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi restaurant in Little Tokyo hands down.  Toyo-san keeps the menu simple and rather traditional versus all of the sushi restaurants that you see around town.  The freshness of the fish speaks for itself.  No gimmicks like the conveyor belt sushi places, just good food.  If available, we always try to sit near where he is at the sushi bar.  Their a la carte menu isn't too extensive besides the usual items found at a Japanese restaurant like edamame, chicken karaage, miso soups plus some other items.This place is always busy which shows you that the food here is really good.  You often see people waiting outside prior to them opening both at lunch and dinner.  The parking lot isn't very big and also has other restaurants so it does fill up rather quickly.  I really like their food and is one of the last real Japanese restaurants in JTown.

Reviews.Author: Heather C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE their sashmi plate for lunch. It's only $15 - what a steal for all that fish! If you don't want to wait, you should arrive at least by 10:50 and get in line. Everyone needs to be there or else they won't seat you. Don't worry - you don't have to wait long. Their door opens at 11:15.  And shh... this is a secret - but they do take reservations for lunch. Only a few tables a day but worth it if you call ahead. Dinner is good too but the same sashimi plate for dinner is $26 (well you do get a little bit more food but not that much).  Ditch work and go Mon - Fri for lunch. Well worth the trip if you love straightforward, good quality sushi.

Reviews.Author: Chris W.
Reviews.Content: Go at all costs.  Especially if you love sushi, but don't want to spend over 150$/pp.  If you really want to do it right... sit under the head sushi chefs and order the omakase... it is mind blowingly delicious.  Their cuts drape over the rice and you can ask them to make all their cuts on the belly, the area which, of course, is the most tasty :)Toro (always orgasmic)Halibut Fin (my new favorite cut of sushi)Giant ClamHamachi BellyKanpachiUni (some of the best i've had)AjiSweet shrimp (they'll deep fry the heads for you, this is my favorite part)SabaFresh Water eelQuality and freshness is the creed here along with expert cutting... you really will not regret it and for good sushi it won't destroy your pocketbook.  Go on a Tuesday if you can... since most of the Japanese chefs in the LA area go to the fish market on Monday... but I will go here any day of the week.  Remember to eat your ginger between orders!

Reviews.Author: H L.
Reviews.Content: And I'm 537!  Ever since I was but a wee sapling I've always dreamed of being Numero 537!Big, fresh, fat and moist slices of freshly-killed fish.  With plum wine to kill. 'Nuff said.Absolutely splendid.

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen rocks.  I went twice this week:  Once for lunch and once for dinner.  The line is insane if you come at the wrong time.  For lunch, we made sure to arrive at 11:15 for the first seating, and for dinner around 9:40, just before closing.  For lunch, I ordered the sashi lunch special.  It comes with a giant plate of sashimi, including maguro, hamachi, salmon, and ika.  It also comes with a tofu appetizer, a small salad, and miso soup.  For $16, this is simply unbeatable.  The quality is top notch, too.  For dinner, Sylvia and I started with a salmon skin salad, and each got an order of asari miso soup.  The salad was light with crispy pieces of salmon skin mixed in--just how I like it.  The miso soup had four tender clams packed in, and hit the spot--especially for a chilly Friday night.  For our entree, Sylvia and I shared a sashimi plate and ordered ikura, hamachi, unagi, and tai sushi.  The ikura was perfect, not too salty.  The hamachi was the best I've had in a while.  We finished the meal with an order of tamago sashimi for dessert.  The service was excellent, as usual.  My tea was refilled every time it was half empty.  My only complaint is that they charge for ginger.  I just don't get it.

Reviews.Author: Daryl W.
Reviews.Content: We ate here for my parents wedding anniversary. This is by no means a romantic place nor one particularly charming for special events. We came here for the quality sushi, stuff that melts in your mouth. Sushi that makes me willing to deal with LA traffic so I can eat it again. Sweet shrimp, fatty tuna, I loved all of it. I highly recommend their $35 sashimi plate that can feed 2, but add extra sushi or rolls for those with an appetite. Parking is tight, and have a few bucks ready because even if you validate u gotta pay.

Reviews.Author: Tommy L.
Reviews.Content: I think the other 209 people have said all that there needs to be said.  If you're gonna go for lunch go EARLY....they open at 11:15...be there at 10:30 if you want to be first in line!  But first in line doesn't always mean you'll get served first....my friends and I got served last!  oh well...the wait was worth it!  Maybe they don't like asians?  =PSashimi lunch special the best $15 you'll EVER spend on sushi.  Dinner was awesome as well but it can get very expensive....the last time i had dinner there it was $180 with tip and 2 bottles of beer for 2 people...but hot damn it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: This place rocks!  Their sushi is so fresh that it seems as though the fish was caught the same day and driven directly from the ports.  The sushi rice is done magnificently, not too hot, not too vinegary and not too sweet.  Just perfect.  The amaebi (Sweet Shrimp) is so good.  Very fresh and sweet!  The prices are kind of high but you get what you pay for.  Service is top notch also.

Reviews.Author: jasmine p.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here ever since I can remember. My parents love sushi, so they use to drag me here as a kid. Of course I didn't really appreciate sushi till I was much older. When I was younger I would get an order of California rolls, and gobble them all up. Now it's a mix of sashimi and sushi, everything from uni to salmon, of course there is always the occasional California roll to remind me of my childhood. There is always a wait, but it is well worth it. Or, get there early and you can have a table right when they open!

Reviews.Author: Lakwanza W.
Reviews.Content: After hearin everybody talk about dis sushi joint on yelp, i knew that it was gon' be good. But the best sushi restaurant in LA? Nuh-uh. Wherever that may be, I sho as hell haven't found it yet.The sashimi lunch platter is worth it for $15. But it came with cooked salmon, wtf? I wanted sashimi not no gad damn cooked fish. It also had some weird fish/green onion pate type stuff that I didn't care for. The service aint bad or good, but I can live with dat. You can't expect to go to any asian restaurant and get good service now, lets be real. The inside is kinda run down and dark, but you aint in lil tokyo for the ambiance. For parking, just use the lot for convenience and pay 2.00 for lunch time.  There were so many unemployed people up in that joint for a Monday afternoon.. You know what they say... No one in LA works.... well it's true, and i'm just tryna get by on my EBT like the rest of em. Ya heard?

Reviews.Author: Angela C.
Reviews.Content: You HAVE to try the $15 Sashimi Lunch Special!! Oh. My. God. It is the BEST $15 you'll ever spend. The price is sooo worth it and the fish tastes super fresh and delicious!! Not only is the fish delicious, they give you a LARGE platter of several different items! including large cut pieces of tuna, yellowtail, squid, toro? and octopus, and two variations of raw fish/spicy tuna? (not sure what it's called) which were reallyyy good (the spicy flavors complemented the other raw sashimi really well), a portion of salted eel, and a piece of cooked salmon. AND they also give you a large bowl of rice, some steamed tofu, pickled vegetables, and miso soup!! Despite it being reallyyy busy and crowded, the waitress was still really courteous and nice. And even came over to refill our tea every time my cup was low without us even asking!OMG i just ate there a couple days ago but I can't wait to go to LA just to eat there again!! I went on Friday around 12:45, it was superr crowded. I waited a little over an hour for two people. But it was def worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Eugi H.
Reviews.Content: A great sushi place in Little Tokyo, probably my favorite sushi place in Little Tokyo! Their fish is fresh and great quality! They are always packed but sushi bar seating is pretty fast, so we didn't have to wait as long. The chefs are so nice and fun to watch as they whip up all the sushi you ask for super fast! Came with my friend and she could easily see why it was one of my go to spots in the area =)If you don't sit at the bar then you'll be able to get their lunch specials, which are all really great deals. I believe the day we went it was a sashimi platter that was seriously loaded with at least a dozen pieces of sashimi. They were flying out of the kitchen, everyone there was getting it! It almost made me wish I had waited for table seating, but then again, you don't get the bar experience.

Reviews.Author: Joy D.
Reviews.Content: This place would have gotten 4 stars from handsome and me; however, the wait for our food was awful!I ordered the chicken teriyaki with tempura and it came out first before Handsome's sushi. I was done with my meal before he even got half of his order. The other half came 20 minutes after his first half was brought to the table.Handsome enjoyed the freshness of the fish and I enjoyed the teriyaki but for the price we paid...the wait was ridiculous! Hate to say it, we won't be back. Sorry...

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: My dad told me about this place, so I brought a friend who is from japan to eat some sushi here. We sat at the bar where the japanese sushi chef and my japanese friend struck up a pretty personal conversation since it seemed they had a lot to talk about, I did not understand since they were speaking in japanese but they got a long very well. He was very satisfied and was so happy I had brought him that he insisted on paying for the bill which was not cheap since after we ate a lot of good sushi. We ordered a lot of toro, ama ebi, uni, unagi, and he ordered some octopus and squid which I did not like, but my favorite is the toro and uni. Everything was so fresh and tasted orgasmic. My japanese friend just kept making these faces of pleasure whenever he took a bite, LOL.After our first great experience here, I started bringing other people here. This places gets really crowded, but if you go early, the wait is not long. I have brought several dates to this places and it is a great place to bring your girlfriend or boyfriend. I hate oyster and never liked it until I tried the oyster here.. it was so fresh and delicious, also the sake is high quality as with everything on the menu, my girlfriend always orders the oyster and sake. Now if my japanese friend who has great taste, wealthy, and born and raised in Japan in the city of Sendai approves of the sushi here, then you can't go wrong coming here for "real" sushi.

Reviews.Author: Liam B.
Reviews.Content: Toro is superb. Albacore divine. Clam miso will please. Worth the wait. Don't tell anyone about this place : )Toro is superb. Albacore divine. Clam miso will please. Amazing eel! Everything was enjoyable i could have eaten it all again. Worth the wait. Don't tell anyone about this place : )

Reviews.Author: Sharon T.
Reviews.Content: Thank you Yelp for being in existence otherwise I would never have known about Sushi-Gen and missed out on one of the best sushi experiences I've had. We arrived just in time to grab a seat at the Sushi bar. I later lived to regret it somewhat (I've learned this is the most expensive option) but I'm so happy we were seated within 10 minutes of arrival. There was a constant line the whole time we were there. We sat down to one of best experiences and made our trip to LA so fun. We keep talking about it even now. We weren't sure what we wanted and were up for some experimentation. We ate what our neighbors were eating and seemed to be enjoying including the freshest tuna sashimi we've had, scallops in a shell, yellow tail nigiri, etc. We really enjoyed our experience and our sushi chef even added in an item he thought we would enjoy. Nicest gentleman, so we lucked out. I paid for it in the end but so worth it. I only come to LA once or twice a year, so I highly recommend this restaurant. I plan to come back again and experience the sashimi lunch next time I come to town.

Reviews.Author: Haiku-Project H.
Reviews.Content: While we ate we said,"This is fuckin' delicious",'Cause it fuckin' was.

Reviews.Author: Alan K.
Reviews.Content: How did I ever forget to review this place? 4.5FOOD QUALITY:For a $15 sashimi combo or a sushi combo, including miso soup and rice, you'll be leaving here with a full stomach of good fish. Their miso soup didn't taste cheap or watered down; their rice was soft, fluffy, and fresh; and their fish was simply fresh. Good fish. Good food. Good value. SERVICE:Upon opening you'll notice that they have a whole platter of sushi combos ready to be served; they're prepared. They have everything set to be served out to the wave of customers trampling inside. While the waiters/waitresses come off as a little bit rushed, they do their job at being polite and check regularly if you need something. The manager that stands near the front is very kind and polite though. ENVIRONMENT:This place is so small! I felt a little cramped since there's not much privacy and it gets pretty loud. I like coming here but I don't get the chance to do that very often. I do, however, mind the lengthy wait even though I'm already waiting half an hour before it opens.

Reviews.Author: Angela S.
Reviews.Content: Finally! The best Sushi restaurant I have ever eaten at! Thick cuts of fresh & delicious Sashimi and Sushi, simple menu, fast and friendly service, and comfortable ambiance! Packaged hand towels for after or before your meal was a nice touch.And the amount of food for the price was great.I will rave about this place for a long time!

Reviews.Author: Jane L.
Reviews.Content: This place is SOLID.  Just go.A little pricey, but worth every bite.

Reviews.Author: Peggy Y.
Reviews.Content: NO. I know this place has a 4.5 stars on yelp or whatever, but I am here to diss.I came here last night with my boyfriend after a movie. It was packed, but I was so shocked that I got my table for 2 in like 2 mins- literally.  That's when I thought to myself..am I in luck, or does this place suck?  I saw a lot of people waiting..and I clearly know I came after them, I felt kind of bad :(Man, how I wish I was wrong.  FIRST OF ALL, the sushi sheet has no price.  I'm not cheap, but hey what if I wanted to pay cash or something, that's already negative .5 star.  Sorry but there's no public parking either, another -.5 star, so you must valet and pay 3.50$ with validation.  Luckily, we found parking down the street for free, because this place isn't worth it.  I will give you props that the hosts are very friendly, and explained to me that the sushi bar only serves sushi and apps but no table menu, whatever, we got the table and here we go...I was pretty surprised by the diversity of the menu, I found things that I normally wouldn't see at other places, even though to a point where I pretty much have to guess what some of the items are..but I went with the usual.  Bf and I got:- yellowtail belly (was chewy, I've never had chewy yellowtail before, not the good chewy but the plastic kind of chewy...)- toro (and we were later informed that it was sold out at 8pm. great.)- salmon (was average. I'd say..7 out of 10)- albacore (THE BEST!!! +.5 stars, and I don't even like albacore.)- munkfish liver (sp?) (average)- sweet shrimp (I didn't try this one but it's probably average by the looks).- Uni (didn't eat this either)sushi wise..I got:- avacado eel cut roll- spicy tuna cut roll(their cut rolls are EXTREMELY small, I forgot how much they were each..but I guess they were ok...)app:-small tempuraFYI, a "small" tempura- it was $9, the large is $12.  (I just saw EVERYONE ordering it so I thought it might be soo deliciousss...)  I thought I was in Hollywood or something for the price, and the tempura better be OFF THE HOOK with that price, right? Uh, no.   The shrimp is soggy.  I HATE SOGGY SHRIMP and I HATE EXPENSIVE SOGGY SHRIMP.  The last time I checked, our economy isn't doing too well.  Why are you doing this sushi gen? Why?  You have money to buy fresh flowers for the place (btw it's really pretty...) but dude, please serve some fresh shrimp! Or is it just me?  Fine, so I do have expectations, but it's called having standards.  I've eaten over maybe 1000 places and I have to open a Yelp account to share my thoughts.  I'm so disappointed.  I will never return, unless you prove to me that you will improve.  If you do, let me know.All in all, it is very average, but definately does not reflect that in the price.  The food is fresh..but that does't cut it.  It has its crowd and all I can really say is..I've had much better food in Jtown.OH. our tab?  I think 83 or something for two.  For drinks, we only ordered an iced tea, and I got iced water -__-. Is it worth it?   You be the judge.

Reviews.Author: Kislev A.
Reviews.Content: Go for the sashimi.A bit pricier than other Japanese restaurants but worth it.There's usually a line for lunch... It's that good. Parking at the Honda center is validated.You can use street parking as well.

Reviews.Author: Queenie L.
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with the lunch special sashimi which is $15 with quite a few of sashimi!!! Food is yum, servers are nice but the line is a bit too long during lunch time....

Reviews.Author: Rajiv S.
Reviews.Content: Simple is sometimes better. And at Sushi Gen, this couldn't be more true. If you're looking for specialty rolls, this isn't the place for you. Sushi Gen is all about high quality, traditional sushi that literally melts in your mouth. Portions are small and pricey (there are no prices on the sushi menu but expect to pay anywhere from $8-12 per single order) but well worth it for the flavor and quality. I haven't found another place in LA that does traditional sushi this well. Another component is the rice, the amount of vinegar they prepare the rice with is perfect and compliments the flavors of fish that are paired with it. Sushi Gen is a busy place and expect a wait, sometimes very long, during peak hours. The space is small, simple, and clean - just like their brilliantly made sushi and sashimi.

Reviews.Author: tae k.
Reviews.Content: My latest experience at Sushi-Gen confirms it is still one of the best downtown.  I had a lot of individual pieces and the yellowtail belly and toro were exquisite (like butta!).  I also had the sweet shrimp which was also delicious.  A must try with the fried head.  The sea urchin was also good.The tuna, salmon, and halibut were all above average.

Reviews.Author: Terrance Y.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the sashimi here. Freshest always!Get the chirashi deluxe or the sashimi deluxe. I can still taste the tuna melting in my tongue. Even the chicken teriyaki is pretty good if you want to preserve the leak in your wallet when you come here.There's always a line here and it's no surprise. My family and I often will travel 25miles to get here before 11AM (their opening hours) so we can be the get in the first round before the line really builds up.The service is excellent. The waitresses come back often to check on us and refill our tea/iced water. They always remind us to get our parkig ticket validated. Unfortunately, even with parking validation, we usually still end up tithing to the Honda Plaza. So... I park at my own secret spot now. =P

Reviews.Author: Marcus L.
Reviews.Content: Summary:  The quality is great here and you pay accordingly.  Everytime i've been here i've had to wait.  I've always been happy with the food but the waiting is really a painService:  good/averageParking:  ok- shared parking lot

Reviews.Author: Willy W.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were wandering around downtown LA when we eventually got to Little Tokyo. And what else is there to eat there besides ramen and sushi, right?Ok fine there are plenty of other things, but those are the top two that come to mind.Nevertheless, I pulled up my phone and was led to this place. 1200 reviews and what more needs to be said?I looked at the pics and off we went.Yes, we could have gone somewhere else, but I was counting on my yelp mobile phone app to not lead me astray. Plus the long line and 30 minute wait was surely a good sign, right?We were eventually called and seated. The waitress took pretty good care of us. We saw a bunch of people getting a pre-selected dinner sashimi plate, but we kinda wanted to choose for ourselves. And I actually like nigiri. So we went down the list and selected a few things. They came out relatively quickly and then we went back for round two. Service was good, quick and friendly. Most importantly, the fish was great. The only complaint I had was that there are no prices on the sushi menu. So I have no idea how much each individual piece (well, pair really) of sushi cost.For about $65 (split check & including tip) I got:2 toro2 uni1 monkfish liver1 yellowtail belly1 jack mackerel2 king crab1salmon3 unagi1 sea eel2 japanese red snapperwarm sake and green teaDoesn't get much better than that! So worth it!!I would gladly come back for more =)

Reviews.Author: Kathy W.
Reviews.Content: Review for dinner. The 1st review was for lunch.Dinner menu is pretty much the same as lunch except it's more expensive but at least there is more sashimi.Karage:- 2 fried chicken balls- not the best I've had but it was still pretty juicy probably from the oilChirashi comes with soup- takes a bit longer to prepare for some reason- sashimi over sushi rice- comes with large fish eggs that squirts- fish selection is different from the sashimi dinnerSashimi dinner- similar to the sashimi lunch- comes with more tuna than the sashimi lunch- instead of the cooked mackerel it's cooked salmon Service: not as good as it was during lunch. Then it again it was dinner and the restaurant was packed.Parking: being noobs I thought parking was the same price as it was during lunch which is $2 with validation. It turns out at dinner that doesn't apply. We aren't quite the ballers like all the people parking in the Honda Center with their ostentatious GTR and Porches. As we pull up to the place thinking we were only going to pay $2ish the parking attendant tells us it's $9. We exclaim in disbelief "9 dollars?!" Then I quickly look and we were too excited to eat that we just didn't want to walk. Oh well, we were ballers for a day in a Camry.Overall, lunch or dinner is a good option but lunch is cheaper. Park in around the area unless you want to fork up $9 in addition to your meal. Also please don't order Teriyaki chicken/salmon or whatever that is not sashimi unless you are planning to be pregnant or are pregnant. Yes I'm judging you. It's a sushi restaurant with tons of fresh fish! If you want a teriyaki rice bowl go to Yoshinoya it's a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Author: Helena H.
Reviews.Content: It's kind of funny that I have just finally written a review about this spot when half of my friend list has already written theirs.I recommend this restaurant very often and people rave about it after, so Sushi Gen must be doing something right. If you're a roll kind of person, well sorry, they don't have too many options. They are great for sashimi. You can taste the freshness in every bite.It's always busy, so plan ahead and make a reservation. They don't seat you if your entire party hasn't arrived.Only negative thing I have to say is that, THEY CHARGE FOR GINGER!! $1.00 for a small dish of ginger. Fail. Minus 1 star.Enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Alan C.
Reviews.Content: 1417 Reviews....make that 1418 now.Ridiculously (so ridiculous i don't even know if i spelled that right) good deal!Sashimi Lunch Combo ......$15.
