Mostly tuna, but high quality and fresh. You can taste the "sweetness" in the fish, that's how good it is. They slices are nice and thick so you can fully appreciate the texture of raw fish.So why 4 stars and not 5?Lunch Sashimi Combo: Great great deal, but lacks variety you would expect from a "combo". It was literally tuna prepared 4 different ways. I would have liked if a larger variety of fish was in it.Ankimo: Monk fish liver is prized for being very creamy, but this was not the case. It was rather dry and hard.Albacore: Sear on it wasn't tasty, fish itself wasn't that great either.Giant clam special: clam was great, except half the dish was mushroom :(Impressed at the price point for the Sashimi Combo, and the quality of the fish. But that's about it....their other choices were a big dissapointment unfortunately.So.....5 stars for lunch combo, 3 stars for everything else I ate.

Reviews.Author: Richard E.
Reviews.Content: Three and a half stars.I usually go here for lunch since I work downtown.This place is well known and get very busy at lunch time. expect long wait lines.the service is good, the place is fine.They have other stuff besides sushi, but you know what, when you go to a sushi place, it's best to get the sushi. You know what I'm sayin?Now, I know people love this place, and everyone gives it five stars, but to me this place is good, but not great. The Fish is good. The cuts of fish are pretty good.This place is solid; It's good, but not super great. And this place is pretty expensive. for what you are paying I think you would expect a little more.check it out.

Reviews.Author: Adele F.
Reviews.Content: So. Many. People. Boohoo.Arrived at 11:30 AM to find a good number of people ahead of us. The bar had open seats, but you don't get to order from the menu if you sit at the bar. Boohoo. We put our name down with our party of 3 and proceeded to wait. Unfortunately, my eagerness to visit Little Tokyo got the better of me, and we took a quick excursion to a nearby plaza in Little Tokyo. 15 minutes later we returned to find that the gentleman had already called our name :c We waited some more (a full hour total), and a table finally opened. At last.We sat down and our waiter brought us our menus. Take note: GREEN TEA is an additional $1.50 per person! Mind you, I did appreciate their use of legitimate matcha green tea, but I didn't know it would cost extra until I saw the bill :cAll 3 of us ordered their SASHIMI LUNCH COMBINATION for $15, which includes rice, soup, tofu, and pickled vegetables. And oh my goodness, they include so many pieces of fresh sashimi, along with many other delectable goodies like sushi tartare (not sure if it's actually called that haha) and octopus! On top of that, they let you split the bill, no extra charge!Below is my order of preference (although I have no idea what anything is called, so I used location for placement...):yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…Right middle dark pink fish (so soft and flavorful), middle middle evenly pink fish (softer than the first fish, but not as flavorful), bottom right spicy fish mush (fish tartare amirite???), somewhat bottom left raw fish mush, grilled salmon, eel, middle middle white fish on the left, middle middle white-pink fish on the right, crab, octopus, weird white strand thing in the middle, left middle transparent chewy squid square, lettuce :PService was fast, the ambiance was busy and pleasantly crowded, and the experience was fantastic. Tasty food at a superb price means I'll be back next time I'm in LA!And for future reference, as stated by the front desk staff member: you can schedule reservations in advance for any number of people. However, the restaurant only takes 3 or 4 reservations a day, so you may need to call 3 or 4 days early to book your reservation.Oh, and parking is a beez. But I'm just not used to LA parking. Make sure to get your parking stub validated or sacrifice your meal receipt so that you only have to pay $2 for 2 hours of parking!

Reviews.Author: Monica T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen according to my super picky Taiwanese girlfriend is one of the most authentic sushi places she has found in the states. From my own experience, it is the best sushi place I have had ever had.

Reviews.Author: Eli B.
Reviews.Content: One of those places that's so damn special you don't want to review it, but the secret was out long ago. Sushi Gen is one of LA's best sushi spots. It's right next to Kagaya (another fave) in Honda Plaza, it's fairly small, and it's pretty perfect.I prefer Sushi Gen to the 818 sushi temples (Nozawa, Katsu-ya, Kazu) because there's no attitude and the fish is...a little weirder. In Little Tokyo you will get a more exotic range of choices & that we love. Masa, the head sushi chef, is a master and a very nice guy. Please try to leave us room at the bar!!

Reviews.Author: Tim E.
Reviews.Content: My first time here and the wait is out the door, but thanks to Lorena I didn't have to wait more than a minute. So they have this lunch special for $15 which I have posted a pic with. I think it is a great price and is filling. The fish was definitely fresh. I guess next up would be checking out this place during dinner time one of these days. This place was packed and looking very Japanese inside with the typical decor. It was well lit and the servers were eager to get your orders out for you. And which parking lot can beat $1.50 for lunch. Though when i got there the parking lot was ful.

Reviews.Author: Teresa N.
Reviews.Content: What's the best place for burgers? Pasta? Tacos? Even desserts? It's always hard to choose THE best restaurant for a particular dish. There's never a consensus because people are different and so is food. But, I think I can put this to rest when I say the best sushi restaurant is Sushi-Gen. This place is found near the outskirts of Japan town. If you're lost, look for a long line outside the restaurant before it's even open. I have been meaning to come here for awhile now but, for some reason, there has always been an excuse. Today was going to be different. I came here an hour early, and we made it inside on the first wave when the doors opened. We ordered two sushi deluxe. It was an assortment of sashimi for only $15! I wasn't going to celebrate just yet because I have been disappointed many times by other sushi restaurants' commitment to "low cost, high quality" propaganda.  The sushi deluxe included maguro, salmon, mackeral, octopus, squid, toro, and much more. ALL this for only $15! Everything was fresh! It was hard to believe that all three factors came into play: quality, quantity, price. It was definitely worth the wait, and I could never been happier with a meal.Don't make excuses. Just come. Thank me later.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: I've now been to Sushi Gen at least ten times.  Although it's not amazing, it is certainly one of the most consistent and reasonable sushi bars in LA.  And that, in my opinion, makes it unique.There are too many sushi bars to count now.  But I can say, Sushi Gen is one place where you'll always find a good variety of fish, good/very good quality of fish, and reasonable prices.  This last time, I had tai with lemon juice and salt (very good belly cut) , kanpachi (tail end cut - not my fave), tako, iwashi, aji, marinated sanma (not my fave - I really like this fresh while it's in season during the fall, but I was glad to see they had it), akami (bluefin) and two types of toro - one slice each of Canadian chu-toro and Boston o-toro.  The Boston o-toro was unbelievable.  Although a little sinewy because it was real o-toro from the center of the belly, the meat had the this unbelievable firm, yet fatty and rich texture that I haven't had in a long time.  This is why you go to Sushi Gen.  Although they sometimes have Yellowfin Tuna, they almost always have Bigeye or Bluefin.  And the tuna is high quality.  While you can go to many other places to get the same farm raised fishes (i.e. east coast fluke aka hirame, salmon, hamachi), Sushi Gen has the real stuff.P.S. - All of this for about $40, including soup to end.

Reviews.Author: Tim B.
Reviews.Content: Vinegared warm rice + fresh wasabi = good sushi jointThese are two telltale signs you will be getting quality sushi and Gen provides both. But is it LA's best? Nope. If I have a choice, I'm at Sushi Zo or Sasabune hands down.

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: What I found beautiful about this visit was witnessing their attention to detail and tradition.  Being the 2nd to last customer placed onto the waiting list at 1:50 pm for a 2pm closing, by the time we were finishing our meal around 3:30pm, we watched the cleanup of the front kitchen.  Every knife is sharpened by one chef, washed by a second, and slowly hand dried, inspected and polished by a third.  Every step was performed with the utmost care.  The entire front kitchen is scrubbed head to toe as if it were the end of the day, but they are merely just closing from lunch.  What was already seemingly spotless was made more spotless.  Seeing the adherence to tradition, procedure, and greatest of care makes me respect this institution.  I now understand why they have been around for ages and with great success.Now onto the food.It's been a few years since I've been to Sushi Gen for lunch.  After a 2-3 hiatus, I've found that the legendary high quality sashimi used in the lunch items are gone.  Costs have increased and green tea is a charged item now.The fish is no longer the choiciest cuts, not longer sinew free, and no longer the freshest, but make no mistake the fish they serve is acceptable.  What hasn't changed is their attention to detail and quality of all their other non-fish items.  their rice is still immaculately perfect and every part of your chirashi still has the same attention as before.

Reviews.Author: Janet T.
Reviews.Content: Gen doesn't need another 5 star review it seems. . .Awesome Sashimi Platter - though it does vary depending on the season.  It usually has 5 pieces of Tuna (Medium Toro sometimes), Salmon, Amber Jack, Yellowtail, Halibut, Surf Clam, Squid, Cooked Salmon, Mackerel, Shrimp, Toro Tartare, Hamachi Tartare, Real Crab, sometimes Giant ClamI eat this Platter for two myself :DWhen I have to share the platter I subsidize with some yummies: - Live Scallop.  The chef cooks up the scallop liver and the crisp scallop is absolute heaven.  - Ankimo- Albacore Tataki.- And seriously, I am not a Green Tea Ice Cream fan, but theirs is divine.  Warning - This is not a roll place.  In fact their rolls suck.  Eat Sashimi and sushi only.

Reviews.Author: Anto M.
Reviews.Content: My friend Stephy S. needs to give this bad boy of a sushi joint another try! So after 1209 reviews, the place has 4 1/2 stars, over at least 6 years? Law of averages would say "Effing YES!" to this unassuming restaurant.  The freshness is what makes this place. When it comes to Sushi, that's half the battle.  The salmon sashimi, for some reason, is better here than anywhere else.  Yes I did say salmon sashimi, sue me. It's that good. The rolls are compact little bundles perfect to share with friends at the bar or table.  Although the omakase is not that of Koi in Seal Beach (#1), they do have skillz. I was even able to impress a very picky friend with the food. She didn't like the way the restaurant looked.  took one bite, and didn't care anymore.  Go early. Lunches and dinners get packed.Kanpai!

Reviews.Author: mark s.
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best sushi in la!I'm not that big of a fan of seafood but this place really takes the top.When ever I'm in the area I try to eat there

Reviews.Author: Jonathan K.
Reviews.Content: There are 187 other reviews, so I'll just keep it short.Sashimi special.

Reviews.Author: Maxwell C.
Reviews.Content: ...so rarely I'd give 5 stars but it is no coincidence hundreds other yelpers have rated this as highly as I have. Without repeating other yelper's awesome comments, I'd just reiterate that 1. Sashimi is definitely one the best tasting around2. If you like clams, do the steamed clams as the sake they add to it makes the dish so much more inviting.3. Uni (sea urchins) seem to sell out fast.Great job sushi gen!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan L.
Reviews.Content: What's the hype all about?I've eaten here about 12 times since 1999, and every time I walk out full but wholly unimpressed, and as such, I can't give this place more than 3 stars.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not advising you to stay away, just to not expect anything special.The good: the sushi and sashimi is pretty decent.  The prices are fair.The bad: fugly decor, horrible ambiance in the general area (tiny shopping center with tiny parking spots) and a parking attendant that hates life, hates his family and hates you!Go to Fisherman's Village just north of here (much larger center).  There are several sushi places in this center that are far better than Sushi Gen and you're less likely to get mugged/stabbed/spit on in the sketchy parking lot of the beloved (??) Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Derek S.
Reviews.Content: No frills, just awesome food. I wouldn't even call this place pricey -- the last time I was there, I ate my fill of sashimi and was out for about $25-$30, which seems pretty reasonable for a top-notch sushi spot. I mean, even crappy sushi will set you back a minimum of $20/person.Don't waste your time with rolls -- just go straight for the sashimi. It's all killer, so just order what you like.Atmosphere is terrible, so I wouldn't recommend it as a date place unless you are out with a major foodie.

Reviews.Author: lil l.
Reviews.Content: On the recommendations of everyone, the BF and I came to eat some of Nemo's buddies.  Everything raw on the sashimi plate was some variation of tuna.  They had some good stuff, and the amount of food you get will fill you up.  However, the toro I was given was horrible - didn't-even-finish-it-bad!  BF ordered the sashimi again (he first had a pricey box of rice and fresh eel).  The second time around, the toro was much better - you could see a HUGE color/quality difference, which makes me wonder why his toro was ten times better than mine.Lunch special for a full plate of sashimi is $15.  It's an EXCELLENT deal considering the abundance and freshness of the fish.  But then you factor in tax/tip and parking ($1.50 validated), and your LUNCH comes out to much more than what I would consider to be a "value meal."  If it was mind-blowingly good (Toros in Alhambra anyone?), I would be back and maybe splurge for dinner.  But as it was not, I'll stick to Fish-o-Filet Fridays for my Omega-3s.

Reviews.Author: Dana N.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!!  Just be mindful the line is pretty long. I went there for lunch just before they opened. There was a line already! It's totally worth it, believe me. My Japanese instructor took a bunch of the classmates there for lunch. Try their Chirashi. Very fresh and good portion of sashimi toppings. The egg topping melts in the mouth. For "I-don't-do-sushi" peeps, try beef teriyaki. The meat is very tender. The portion is okay but you can't beat the quality.

Reviews.Author: Bob C.
Reviews.Content: In about a two-week stretch, I've tried two of the most highly rated sushi joints in the Little Tokyo area and I've had very different and yet eerily similar experiences at both.  Unlike Restaurant Komasa, we were promptly seated here (table for 2).Several nigiri were simply top-notch and we actually ended up ordering more to finish our meal. These were:  - Ami Ebi (Sweet Shrimp, bodies nigiri-style with the heads deep fried, mm-mm good)- The Yellowtail, Konpachi, Unagi, and Scallop Nigiri were all very tasty.Much of the other nigiri was just okay, nothing earth-shattering (like the Salmon, Tuna).The  Oyster (wrapped with seaweed, blech) was one item I actually had to force down and would not recommend.  There was also another roll that we got that was just not very pleasant.  I also don't think that I would order the Spicy Tuna Roll or Uni again here.The impression I have right now is that Sushi-Gen has more variability (taste-wise) in their food (more highs and more lows as well).  The stuff that's good is really good, but there is just stuff that I didn't care for.  Unfortunately, I don't think I'd drive out for either of them.

Reviews.Author: Kim N.
Reviews.Content: Came here for an early dinner on a week day, my friend said it was the first time he didnt have to wait so that was nice. My friend got the sashimi plate and I got the teriyaki salmon with the sashimi side. One word: FRESH!the fish tasted so fresh, pretty much melted in my mouth. The teriyaki salmon was also very good. I am definitely coming back again! my only gripe was they didnt give you any ginger with the fish -_-

Reviews.Author: Bonnie S.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm, Sushi Gen...I'm a huge fan of Japanese food, so really anything will satisfy me. Sushi Gen was truly unbelievable though. We arrived at 5:00 and were seated immediately. It's probably best to come early because when we left at 7 the place was really crowded and there was a line outside. The interior of the restaurant, although nicely traditionally decorated, is kind of small and squishy.The food: I had the dinner sushi deluxe combo, which came with miso soup, salmon skin salad, seaweed salad, sushi. For dessert: green tea mochi ice cream. The salmon skin was crunchy, which was nice. As for the seaweed salad, I've never tried anythign like it and it was interestingly slimy. I don't think that it's for everyone. The sushi: wow!! Sashimi is very obviously fresh, the meat is so soft and squishy and just plain delicious. It really just melts in your mouth...ahhh, My favorite of the sushi is probably the unagi eel which was very crunchy and savory, plus I still prefer the cooked sushi over the raw stuff. They don't have too many rolls, I think they are more famous for their sushi/sashimi. It's also kind of pricy compared to other places, but I assure you that it's worth it. Nevertheless Sushi Gen is very authentic and definitely a restaurant worth visiting/revisiting!

Reviews.Author: Jolene H.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I've never written a review for THE BEST sushi place in Los Angeles, hands down! Why is it the best place? Their sashimi is the freshest most wondrous fish I've ever tasted in my life. It's cut perfectly, it melts in your mouth, and comes with an abundance of seaweed. I've been here both for lunch and dinner and usually get a combination of cooked and raw - the cooked salmon and sashimi combo. Even the cooked fish is wonderful. The potato salad is also very tasty. Only thing about the entree I would change is the salad (shredded iceberg with creamy dressing) - but I don't really have much energy to spend on the salad anyway. I have so much fresh fish to chow down on that I'm not focused on salad. As for the sashimi - I think my favorite is the tuna. HEAVEN. Also, the prices seem to be pretty low for the quality and amount of food you get. Not only does the food taste good, it looks good. The sushi combination platters always look so artistic and filling, although I've never ordered one. Everything is attractive and fresh. My kind of place, really. I would love to try the Omakase because those sushi chefs certainly know what they are doing. The only downside to this experience is the inevitable wait that comes along with it (oh yeah and the crowded parking lot). It's a popular place with a bar and a small dining room. Service has always been very efficient, though - and you can make a reservation - so that sometimes makes it easier. It's totally worth it, though, for the best sushi in town.I usually only get to eat here once every few months, but I seriously dream about this place!

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST SUSHI I'VE EVER HAD (yes, it does deserves capital letters). I know that there are places where you can spend $500 a head and probably get better sushi, but for the price we paid this really was a phantastic experience. I'll keep it simple, we ordered:- Sushi deluxe plate (which came with Toro to my surprise!)- Sashimi deluxe plate - Tempura- 1 diet cokes- 1 White riceTotal: $85We were both completely stuffed. The only downside to this place is the parking and the wait, both of which were a pain in the ass!

Reviews.Author: Christine N.
Reviews.Content: Lunch special is great, get here before 11:30 if you don't want to wait (yes, even though it opens at 11:30)Got there at 11:50 and there was a 45 minute wait for a party of 6. Luckily, turn over is rather quick. Sashimi lunch special is AMAZING and only $15. Was enough to fill 3 guys, too. Lunch special comes with tofu, picked cucumbers/cabbage (flavor is different from suonomono though) and a big bowl of rice. Fish was super fresh and melts in your mouth. I also liked the seaweed that was served underneath the squid and sashimi. The host is super friendly as well. Make sure your whole party is there because they can't seat you until then. I have been here for dinner before and it gets rather pricey because the fish is so good you just keep ordering more!!! Don't waste your appetite on sushi/rolls if you can help it. The sashimi is too fresh and too delicious to pass up!

Reviews.Author: Arcadian B.
Reviews.Content: FRESH is all I have to say to describe the sashimi....we sat infront of the sushi chefs and just looking at all the varieties of seafood they had makes u drool...the thing is I kept ordering and ordering cuz there was no pricing and when I got the bill...HOLY SHIT but still worth it Btw the line up is insaneeeeeExpect at least hour and half wait on weekends

Reviews.Author: Vicky L.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this place.  I love it because the fish taste so fresh! I would come more often if the line wasn't always crazy long for dinner (more than 1 hour).  The reason I've gone to the other sushi places in Little Tokyo was because this place was always packed :(I'm jealous of the ppl who work in DTLA because they get to dine here for their lunch special ($15)! One day.. one day...

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best lunch sushi/sashimi plate ever. for $15, you can get sashimi lunch with various sorts of fish, miso soup and a bowl of rice. They are pretty large in size and will definitely make you full. I tried their uni, toro, and unagi separately and man.. i gotta say their fish is very fresh. Pros- very fresh sashimi/sushi- $15 killer lunch sashimi deal that comes with rice and miso- servers are quick with your orders and attentive- nice interior decoration and friendly environmentCons- long wait (30min~1hr)- $15 sashimi lunch special doesn't apply on the weekends- parking can be hectic sometimes.

Reviews.Author: Ingrid P.
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best sushi restaurant in North America.  Certainly the best in LA.  The freshest, highest quality fish I've had from coast to coast.  The service & the chefs are a delight.  Have the prawn sushi with the heads cooked in miso soup (or fried as tempura -- I prefer the miso soup).  One of the best meals you'll ever have. (And if you don't have a reservation and there's a line, it's one of the few places where the hour long wait is absolutely worth it.)

Reviews.Author: Taryn B.
Reviews.Content: After years of reading the amazing yelp reviews of this place, I now live next to it and finally gave it a try.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing (sashimi platter) but I was really disappointed.  Having eaten at Sugarfish, the best sushi in LA, I expected this to be at least close in flavor and quality and it was not anywhere close, especially for the price.  My husband had something else, a bento box of sorts with cooked salmon or something, he enjoyed it.  There are plenty of great sushi places downtown, so I doubt I'll make it back here.

Reviews.Author: Devina G.
Reviews.Content: 3 stars for the quantity and food presentation ONLY. We anticipated eating here for the longest after hearing so many good things! we waited over an hr but it was expected so we didn't mind. I 've read the menu thoroughly so I knew what to order by the time we arrived. We ordered ALOT lol. I ordered the sashimi deluxe dinner. We ordered the sashimi and tempura dinner and We also ordered an order of uni and monkfish liver.The uni came first and It didn't live up to my expectation. My sashimi deluxe dinner looked amazing! it had tuna tar tar, toro, blue fin tuna, small pieces of salmon, yellowtai, and some other fish. It looked amazing but it didn't taste as good as it looked. IDK,... . yes the sashimi were soft and melt in your mouth, but I couldn't taste that distinctive sashimi taste. The sashimi dinner had less variety of fish and it ame with tempura. The tempura was drenched in oil. I wasn't too fond of the monkfish liver but it was my first time trying so I have nothing to compare it to. Overall, I wouldn't come back to this place. I guess my sushi taste bud has been spoiled by Komasa. NOthing will ever taste as good as Komasa sushi imo lol. If you care more about quantity vs quality, this is the place for you. I mean where else can you find a sashimi dinner with good variety of fish for 35$??oh and my stomach started hurting before I finished my dinner. WTH....

Reviews.Author: Antranig K.
Reviews.Content: I've been on a mission over the past few years to try as many sushi places as possible in the LA area.  I've been to all kinds.  Sushi Gen was a spot I used to frequent years ago as a law summer intern nearby at federal court.  The judge had introduced us to it one day when he took us out for lunch - I still remember how it blew me away as it was my first time eating "good" sushi/maki/etc. - being from the east coast sushi is not as prevalent, readily available and high quality as the west coast. It hurt my wallet that day but left an impression on me.After I moved back here about 6+ years ago, I started going back recently - and I've been to many other places since as well. Sushi Gen is good, but I still prefer Chiba.  Chiba's fish is too good, preparation too perfect, atmosphere too welcoming, and overall experience too stellar for anyone to supplant them yet - but I still have a few places to hit up... but it's pretty much over in terms of trying to find a better place. Sushi Gen put up a valiant effort over my last 3-4 visits there, but it just doesn't compare.Sushi Gen positives - good fish and good attention from sushi bar chefsSushi Gen negatives - way too expensive, not "top quality" fish and small portions, a bit stuffy and snobby clientele I'd say top 5 in LA, but not the best

Reviews.Author: Marlon T.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to try this place for a long time and finally got to while exploring J-town last week. I am giving it 2 stars because of something that is sort of my fault.We had already eaten a lot during the day before coming here so we weren't that hungry and just wanted to try their signature things. Specifically, we wanted to try the sashimi platter. As we entered the restaurant on opening (5:30PM), they asked us if we wanted to sit at the bar or on a table. We chose the bar since it looked cool with authentic Japanese chefs. They have a 4 piece minimum if you sit at the bar. Retrospectively, we should've chosen the table because at the bar you can't really order the sashimi platter (I think). If you sit at the bar, you'll feel that you should order sushi a la carte since that's how it's set up--they place a nice wooden plate in front of you where they drop off the sushi. So we sat at the bar, but this is not what we should've done. We ordered about 8 pieces each (salmon, abalone, eel, sweet shrimp, etc.). I didn't like that we didn't see any prices while ordering. When we got the bill, it was ~$120. Not only was I unsatisfied without the sashimi platter, my wallet was angry for this unexpected price. We wanted to spend about $50 total just for tasting sashimi but we spent a lot more for something we didn't intend to get. Furthermore, the chef didn't speak English well so it was hard to communicate. I mean, that's cool how it was that authentic, but how can you order effectively?We paid the bill and left a little disappointed.Again, this is sort of my fault for having a poor time, but since my experience was far off the desired beaten path, I am just giving an honest amount of stars. To end on a good note, I like how some of the employees were wearing this cool blue jacket with Kanji printed on them.

Reviews.Author: Tina K.
Reviews.Content: It's more like a 3.5 for me. The review is just for the sushi bar only. I live close by so it's a short walk for me. When I don't have time to trek to the westside for sushi, Sushi Gen is the best option for me. Fish is definitely fresh here, but I think it's rather pricey for the quality at the sushi counter. Fish is a bit too cold for my liking and the rice sometimes is also not very warm. The temperature is a bit off in my opinion. The sushi here is really just not as heartwarming & satisfying as some other high end sushi restaurants' sushi on the west side. There's also limited types of fish here. But overall, it's not bad, just not as good as it could be. I must say though,  they do care about what they serve. they are not sloppy,  they make their own sauce for the sushi, and they serve raw ginger. Most sushi restaurants in little tokyo use kikkoman  soy sauce and purchased red ginger. I have also realized that when I go eat sushi here with a japanese , they season the sushi pretty well, but when i go by myself (i am not japanese), they tend to over season the sushi pieces. It is what it is. lol  it is a general understanding that non-japanese people like more sauce on their sushi so i guess it's time for me to learn japanese!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: My brother is a wholesaler for fresh seafood so i get to eat everything from king crab, hamachi, uni to sweet shrimp. yes, i wanted to brag. :) My brother took me to Sushi Gen, and the reason why i never go with the mother is because she hates waiting. My brother is a big critique on seafood, and he says this place is very fresh. It is very fresh, and i think that's the most important part of sushi or sashimi. Even though the quality might not be the best, at least you won't be growing worms in your stomach. i would go there for lunch. great prices as well.

Reviews.Author: Carol S.
Reviews.Content: Anyone who knows me knows that I must come here when I come to town. It's just one of those places that I can't find up here in the bay area, much to my disappointment of my stomach.  Ok, so my friends and I have this system. We all sit at the bar (always!)and try to order so that we each have one piece per order, so that we can try more different kinds of fish, got it? But that's neither here nor there. Anyhow, this is what we ordered:- salmon: get this w/the seaweed on top and sesame seeds. trust me, it's damn good.- japanese snapper: with lemon and salt only. don't dip in soy. yum.- kanpachi: this tasted like a mix of yellowtail and halibut - very tasty.- sea urchin: so buttery. so good. spanish mackerel, scallop, yellowtail, fatty tuna, sweet shrimp (get the fried heads), unagi. All of it was good. Never noticed a fishy smell to the place but I probably fixated on what fish I wanted to order first ...One thing I don't really understand here is ... sometimes you'll be given this free appetizer before you start ordering and sometimes you don't. What test do I need to pass to get this every time and not some of the time?? It's mountain yam sliced julienne atop some seaweed mixed in a light soy/vinegar broth. It has the consistency of snot but aside from that, it's quite tasty. I would have given 5 stars but I took one away since the prices seem to have increased since the last time I was there. And the wait can literally kill you if you're really hungry.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is my favorite sushi restaurant.  I compare all sushi to Sushi Gen.  Located in little Tokyo, in Honda Plaza, Sushi Gen is no longer a hidden gem.  Everyone seems to know it.  I would not recommend going unless you had a reservation.  The food is fresh and top notch.  The toro,  yellowtail, and halibut are of excellent cuts.  Since the place is always packed, the fish must always be fresh.  Almost anything you would want at a typical sushi restaurant - Sushi Gen would have.  With regard to Sushi restaurants, I strongly suggest that you find a place that you like.  It may not have to be Sushi Gen.  Once you have found a place that you like and enjoy.  Get to know the staff, the chefs, etc.  Once you develop that relationship with them, they will begin to treat you well.  They will often suggest things that you may not have had.  Heck, even buy them a beer or two.And one last thing.  Eat at the sushi bar. . . it is part of the experience.  Don't go a sushi restaurant and order a sushi/sashimi plate.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: All I gotta say is the sashimi is like butter baby!Sushi-Gen is located in the Honda Plaza on 2nd street in Little Tokyo.  I've only visited this place during lunch because they have great lunch combos!  I usually get the chicken teriyaki and sashimi combo, but have tried their salmon teriyaki too.  Depending on what combo you get you could end up spending ($15-$20), but it's a good price for the amount of food they give you.  They give you miso soup, pickled cabbage, and tofu to start.  The teriyaki/cooked items are a decently sized portion, but they are pretty average in flavor - tastes good, but it is nothing to rave about.  The sashimi includes 9 pieces of three different kinds of fish - tuna, yellow-tail, and snapper.  The fish they use here is great...very fresh and very tasty.  Like I said before - it's like butter baby! You don't have to come here during lunch, but I have a feeling it can get pretty pricey during dinner.  I've eaten at the sushi bar and it does cost more than ordering a lunch combo.  Just a tip if you decide to sit at the bar - you have to order a minimum of 4 sushi items and you can't order the lunch combos.  I  must say that I did enjoy the spicy tuna cut roll!  I'm telling you the fish is awesome here!This place gets pretty crowded during the lunch hour.  People wait in line starting at 11am, to get in to the restaurant that opens at 11:15/11:30.  If you come later, expect to wait 20-30minutes (but I've waited longer before).  For the quality and price it is definitely worth the wait!  Plus Yogurtland is just across the street.  (see my review on Yogurtland)

Reviews.Author: Kimi O.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! For real sushi/sashimi lovers only! Do not come here for a romantic setting or elegant interior. This is a place to get great, fresh sushi at an authentic Japanese restaurant.First, make a reservation. The wait is usually long. Parking can also be a headache if the small parking lot is full and street parking is nowhere to be found. As a back up, I would just park in the Japanese Village Plaza parking structure and walk. Environment:Bright lights. Good service. Simple menu. Definitely not a romantic or intimate setting. The small dining room is always packed and noisy. They have a sushi bar available, but I have never sat there.Food:Their sushi and sashimi is amazing. Their sushi dinner is pretty large and has a great variety of fresh and tasty sushi. The hamachi (yellowtail) sashimi is so fresh and soft, it practically melts in your mouth. They also have yellowtail belly which is the fattier version and was just as amazing (I believe a bit more expensive). Their sake (salmon) sashimi is so sweet and tasty that nothing compares to it. All other sushi after Sushi Gen will be such a disappointment.Warning - kinda pricey! Remember, you're paying for quality! If you want a cheap sushi dinner where quality is not a concern, I'd recommend Kabuki.

Reviews.Author: Hector D.
Reviews.Content: Garbage, this place is so overrated and overcrowded, fish is not fresh, likely frozen and chefs pump out orders. Sat at bar, witnessed plate after plate of lunch special get rolled out assembly line style, pieces from their actually looked fresher than the ones served at the bar. As a tip it is a safe bet to order either the lunch special (available only for patrons seated at a table) or the fish that is served in the lunch special (tuna). Here is what I had:Tai (red snapper)- tasteless and watery likely frozen no biteIka (squid)- frozen pre cut variety taste was fine Anago (sea eel) - well cooked overly saucedShima Aji (spanish mackeral) - poorly marinated, sloppy skin removal, tasted like mushKanpachi (amberjack) - better tasting than other pieces, still missed that snap usually found in the fishHotate (fresh scallop) - It was from a live scallop, so you'd think it would be good, instead of sushi was served sashimi style as this is the way it is done here with presentation on shell, so cheesy, anyway super thin slices and use of lemon between each could not mask the poor quality and fishiness that should not presentChefs are butchers as I witness an order for albacore passed on to an assistant who proceeded to destroy the fish in creating the order. Gristly pieces were apparent from my vantage point and the assistant also decided it would be wise to cut the fish five different ways when the original manner did not work. NOT GOOD...Service was also meh, likely based on the crowds, but tea should be refilled (especially when servers frequent the area and notice the empty glass rather than bumping into when taking orders to table). Cooked dishes looked fair, yellowtail collar was a nice portion that looked properly cooked, i.e. not overcooked. Sushi here is for those happy to pay half price for mediocre fish rather than spending more for a true experience and proper taste. It also suits the crowd who prefers to drown their fish in soy sauce laced with gobs of wasabi paste, creating more of a chinese spicy mustard dip (commonly seen in at least a third or the patrons here), whose sauce ends up masking the inferior fish served here.

Reviews.Author: Jamie Q.
Reviews.Content: I have been to this place twice now. The first time I was seriously not impressed but I came back recently and wow was I wrong. This place has catapulted to the top of my list for sushi places in the Los Angeles area.I was instructed to get there early because it gets filled up fast. I showed up and parked in the plaza parking lot. It costs money but its not bad at $2.50. Don't forget to get your ticket validated or else you will have to pay more. When I walked in, I noticed that it was indeed a small place, so I'm glad I got there early. Luckily, we were sat immediately. I don't know much about sushi, so upon the recommendation of a friend, I decided to get the sashimi dinner. I was a bit worried about the portion size because I was hella hungry, but boy was I wrong. It was a ton of food.The meal starts off with both soup and salad. Then comes the actual sashimi which is a good portion and extremely fresh. But thats not it! It also comes with five pieces of tempura, which are perfectly fried. I eat alot and there was no way I could finish the meal. The price is noticeably more than other sushi places, but you are paying for better quality and bigger portions.Trust me and just go.Cost: $116 for 4 sashimi dinners

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: Great place for sushi with a great value. I didn't expect the sashimi plate to fill me up, because it rarely does at other places. But I actually couldn't finish this one. Services was friendly, and we surprisingly didn't have to wait long.General rule on Japanese food: Don't let one of your friends convince you that the wasabi is green tea ice cream.

Reviews.Author: ninjamichi l.
Reviews.Content: This was the first sushi restaurant I ate at when I visited Los Angeles to look for a place to live back in 2003.  My old college friend brought me and my mom here for dinner and compared to any sushi restaurant back home (Texas), this place is amazing.This restaurant is what has been called a true sushi restaurant.. meaning there's no specialty rolls made with cream cheese, jalapenos, etc.  The fish here is fresh.  The salmon melted in my mouth.  Even my mom was impressed with the quality of the food.  The green tea looks like the genuine green tea from Japan.The wait during dinner time can be frustrating but its well worth it.  The place is definitely pricey so eating here once in a while is ok.

Reviews.Author: Fanon P.
Reviews.Content: In my opinion little Tokyo has the best sushi restaurants in la!Sushi Gen falls in that category of such said!First of all they're clam Miso soup is dangerously good!! full of clams and a heavy bonito flavor, i love it! Came her with a friend and ordered the sashimi deluxe platter, it was a display of beauty so many different sea creatures on one plate! My friend and I just stared and marveled at it for a while, I had no idea of what a few items were on our plate, Those were the things I ate first, lll figure it out and edit my review.All the fish were fresh and pretty tender with the exception of one cut, i enjoyed the seared salmon a lot I thought it was a nice contrast to all the raw items, the salmon sashimi was butter soft and that square fish thing was delicious. I also thought the octopus was real good, most of the time its always chewy in the sushi joints, sushi gens was nice & tender, I felt the same way about the clam as well.Service was superb our waitress was this sweet little lady didn't know if that was the manager or what but it seemed like she was in charge, she was on top of everything. A1

Reviews.Author: Shane S.
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Sushi Gen.  I always think it's important to go 2x before rating a sushi joint.  One of things I'm looking for is consistency.  The first time I thought it was way over-rated (2 stars).  The 2nd time I liked it (4 stars).  And so... I'm giving it 3 stars.  I would go 3.5, but Yelp doesn't allow those half stars.  So 3 it is.Both times I've been here the place has been packed.  So be sure to make a reservation before you go.  The pros:1- Very friendly host and attentive sushi chefs (I sat at the sushi bar both times).  Even though they won't take sushi bar reservations, they will try to seat you at the bar if you request it nicely - and both times they did this for us.  I was very pleased.2-  Some sushi pieces were absolutely off the hook* Tai (snapper) and live Hotate (scallop) were scrumptious.* The Anago (sea water eel) was as good as it gets.* The Hamachi (yellowtail) and Unagi (fresh water Eel) were very good.* The saba (Mackerel) was nice.The cons:1- Some of the pieces weren't as good as I hoped for although none were fishy whatsoever - just not as good as the rest:* The Chu-Toro (medium fatty tuna) was OK, but a little too fatty.* The Aji (spanish mackerel) was too firm.2- They don't have an extensive sake menu, just a few average sake's.3- $80 pp for dinner was a bit much.  Especially since we only shared one large Sapporo and one small bottle of sake.All in all - I'd go back here.  But it is far from me (I live in Culver City) so I'd need a reason to head downtown.  But if you live in the area, it's def worth checking out, especially if you sit at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: C T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is the perfect place for sushi! The restaurant is situated in the Honda Plaza in J-town. There are other sushi restaurants close by, but Sushi-Gen appeared to be the only place that was bustling with people.-Apparently, it's always busy, so my advice (as always) is to get there early! We arrived there at 5:30pm on a Saturday and luckily, we just beat the crowd. The wait wasn't too bad and we were seated pretty quickly. Service was fast and our drinks and orders came out promptly. -Nice! We ordered various sashmi and sushi items for 6 people and chicken terriyaki and tempura combinations. The combination dishes came with miso soup, noodle tofu, and rice The sushi is melt in your mouth amazing and the other dishes were simply delicious! Everything was super fresh and the portions were large. It was all in all a great dining experience and we are planning on another visit in the near future!!Incidentally, the types of people that ate at Sushi-Gen that evening were from the very hip to the traditional Japanese crowd. It was a nice mixture of people and good ambiance.Go try it!Just wanted to add: The evening we visited 100% of the proceeds from that evening went to the Japanese Relief Fund. I think that was very, very generous of the Sushi-Gen owners. Other restaurants were only giving 20% -30% of their proceeds to charity.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: Came for dinner last night. Experience was magical, as usual. =) Started with snapper, uni, ikura. Had a couple firsts:Otoro sashimi - I DIE!!! This cut of fish is similar to toro, but closer to the neck? Yeah, I think that's it. Hell, it tastes so good I wouldn't care if it was near the anus! Or even the A itself! It's slightly lighter in color than toro, and more marbled. Served slightly lukewarm/room temp, the oils had "liquified" perfectly and texture was incredible!!!Anago - salt-water eel. Perfectly sweet finish to a satisfying meal. Ankimo - steamed monk fish liver served in ponzu sauce. Foie gras of the ocean. Yummers!Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Caroline C.
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the advice and reviews of our fellow Yelpers, my friend and I arrived early and ordered the sashimi lunch plate and had a 5 star experience.That is all I have to say.  Otherwise, I'd be echoing all the other rave reviews about this place.Oh, how I missed you fresh, delicious, melty goodness sushi.

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: What else needs to be said about this place?  Just look at the pictures of the sashimi lunch (ONLY $15).  They tell you all you need to know about this fine establishment.I generally don't like tuna...at all.  It has that metallic taste.  THIS is the ONLY place I eat tuna!  And not just toro, but their normal everyday maguro is amazing too!  It all just melts in your mouth...like butter, with varying degrees of oily goodness depending on how fatty the tuna is.Portions are generous here.  Don't overdo it!  Also, be prepared to wait 30 mins - 1 hour for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Alice Z.
Reviews.Content: If you are craving for authentic, fresh and delicious sashimi/sushi and aren't afraid to burn a hole in your wallet then I would recommend this place! This restaurant truly lives up to the motto, "you get what you pay for".This is the only place where my taste buds had experienced the most freshest sashimi/sushi. I brought my boyfriend and friend here and they both loved it! We came here for dinner and dishes were relatively $20 and up. But it was totally worth it. Words can never express how much I enjoy dining here. I would highly recommend making a reservation first because this place does get packed for dinner. The parking lot is extremely tiny and we ended up parking a block away in the Little Tokyo Galleria parking structure (which wasn't too bad).

Reviews.Author: Erica Z.
Reviews.Content: I came here for the $15 sashimi lunch special, which is actually not very clear on the menu. What you want is the sashimi lunch, not the sushi or the chirashi! The portions were huge, the quality of the fish was amazing (highest quality I've had in my entire life so far, seriouslyy), and service is quick. The sashimi truly melts in your mouth, and even the side dishes of tofu and picked cabbage (?) were very tasty. I am definitely coming back for lunch again.Prepare yourself for the 40-45 minute wait if you come here for lunch! I think the wait is totally worth it, but just don't miss your name being called because they move on FAST.

Reviews.Author: Valerie L.
Reviews.Content: $15 bucks for a sashimi lunch is a pretty good deal. The quality of the fish wasnt top notch, but the price you pay makes up for it. The wait can be over 45 minutes long, but worth it if you are not in a hurry. I would give this place 5 stars if it included salmon in their sashimi lunch :)

Reviews.Author: Bryan H.
Reviews.Content: I have been hearing about this place for quite some time now.  I was really excited to finally get a seat at the sushi bar with my girlfriend.  We were seated right away at the bar and noticed the massive staff they have on hand.  the restaurant was a good temperature with nice decor including large fresh flowers on the sushi bar and warm tones throughout the restaurant.  did i mention the staff was huge?  there were no less than 8 sushi chefs and about 4 other "helpers" behind the bar.  update: i am writing this later on in the evening the very evening we ate at sushi gen.  my girlfriend and i have now been suffering hours of pain in our stomach and we have no doubt it was from the fish at the restaurant.  we eat sushi at least twice a week and sometimes three times  a week, so our bodies are very used to raw fish.  i have never had pain like this from sushi.  so i really don't think i can return.  i don't really blame the restaurant for this and the food did taste good but some thing got us.  that is all i am saying for now . . .  the food: the fish was very clean and served up instantly by a very courteous chef who was extremely pleasant to share our time with.  we enjoyed Japanese red snapper, salmon, yellow tail, albacore, blue fin and a few hand rolls.   i believe 7 orders of sushi and a hand roll with 2 green teas came out to $42 w/o tip.  not bad for good fish.  back to the fish . . . i felt the cuts were a little thick for my taste.  almost a sashimi sized cut on the sushi.  this could very well be a plus for many but for me it took away from the texture a bit.  the sushi was served a slightly chilled temperature which i appreciate (not cold!!) and the ginger and wasabi portions very large from the start.  overall i felt this place was very good and the atmosphere was extremely pleasant with a very authentic feel.  the staff were amazing and we were in and out with a great meal in 30 minutes due the speed of the chefs and the restaurant was packed.  However, it is not the best I have had which is what I was expecting from the reviews here on Yelp.  However, it could have just been the fish for the day.  I will go back.

Reviews.Author: andy d.
Reviews.Content: Ordering straight off the menu can be the kiss of death at a sushi place, but in all honesty why?  I don't have to tell the chef at a French restaurant what kinds of meat I like.  Certainly sushi is best when you've created a rapport with the chef making it, but Sushi Gen has shown me the glowering hole that is table service at all too many sushi places.It's not that any of the fish was bad, it's just that other than my wife telling me her toro was fantastic, this place was no better than any of a hundred of other sushi dinners I've had around LA.  Fish was fresh but boring.  My sashimi dinner was half tuna pieces of varying sizes in three separate areas on my plate--not including the spicy tuna.The price wasn't as high as I'd expected, but I won't be going back anytime soon.  If the other four or five places in the area don't hold up I'll just skip sushi in Little Tokyo all together.Again, not bad, just not special.

Reviews.Author: conson l.
Reviews.Content: the good-   high quality sashimi,  very reasonably priced.  If you weigh actual quality of food vs dollar amount... this is hands down the best deal in town.  the sashimi combo comes with a hefty portion of hand selected tuna that is sometimes sold at lesser joints as toro.    Yellowtail Kama is also one not to miss. the bad-  killer waits for both the lunch hour and weekends.   if you show up at wrong time for lunch, it is quite possible to wait over an hour.. if you show up on a sat even... expect to wait 2 hours for a table for two.  that being said, I'll wait as long as I need to do get my GEN fix... why go elsewhere with no lines to eat crappy overpriced sushi?additional notes:  this Japanese restaurant is J owned and operated..  the wait staff has more or less been the same for the last 10 years.  there's one busboy that's been there ever since my first tasting.  throughout all the years, sushi gen has been able to do what many other restaurants can't seem to do.. THEY REMAIN THE SAME. Sushi Gen has been in my Top 5 for a loooooong time now..   do me a huge favor.. read and enjoy the review.. but don't go.. there's enough of us lining up already.

Reviews.Author: Ed K.
Reviews.Content: This is the place where Japanese ex-pats go for their sushi fix. Don't get lured into the "hip" sushi bars by some marketing ploy, but go to this gem of a traditional, yet REALLY friendly restaurant. Just sit at the bar, let the itamaisan pick the best stuff of the day and you're golden.I've only had better in Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: We were really hungry and in a rush because baby was sleeping. We decided to go for the bar instead of wait and I'm so glad we did. Fish served at the tables is excellent, but I think that they reserve some of the extra special cuts for the bar. When you are willing to shell out a little more, do it. For example: Got the Scallop sushi at the bar. Seasoned just right with lemon and sea salt, it was so much better than the same order I received at a table. Also, get the Toro. OMG. I had a flashback of Tsukiji. Tip: I have a better experience with the chefs in the middle area. I do not mean to disparage any of the other chefs but the older guy and the lean handsome chefs in the middle were so good to us. The perfect combination of friendly and hard core.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Jermaine Dupri once said, "Fresh, like a million bucks (throw on the Bally shoes and the fly green socks)."That's what Sushi Gen gives you - fresh sashimi and fresh service.I came here on a weeknight and did not experience a wait (which was surprising given the experience of other people). We were seated almost immediately, and the wait staff was extremely welcoming, friendly, and timely. Our drinks were almost always topped off.Everything on the menu appeared appetizing, and I settled for the sashimi combination, to get a sufficient sampling of goodies. It was melt-in-your-mouth legitimate.I would warn that parking in the area is slightly limited. While Sushi Gen is located in a plaza with a parking lot, if it is full, street parking is often difficult to get.

Reviews.Author: Rolo M.
Reviews.Content: Don't go here if you like rolls.  However, they do have very fresh fish, good sushi and sashimi and the staff is fairly nice.  I didn't like that you don't get a menu....I like to know what my food costs and asking is embarrassing.  Nevertheless, it gets a thumbs up for freshness and next time I'll go more prepared as to what to order.

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for years with the family since this is my parents' favorite sushi place. Coming here is always a feast for us. Their prices are on the higher end of the scale but definitely worth it. I highly recommend just getting the sashimi combo for lunch or dinner. The fish is so fresh and the quality is pretty good that the fish just melt in your mouth. Their Unagi Bowl is good also if you like eel. However, as much as I love this place, I have to subtract one star due to the high price and some inconveniences with this place. Like mentioned in the other reviews, parking is painful and the wait is long. So painful that everytime I come here I ask myself why I endure this suffering and still come back. Make sure come here early when they open so you can line up and get in early to avoid the rush, or you have to be strategic and come here after the first round of crowd has finished eating and get in as part of the second round. They are really strict with their business hours, and they will turn you away and not put you on the waiting list if you arrive after their lunch time.

Reviews.Author: Gaby A.
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. We sat at the bar and ordered, albacore, unagi, toro, japanese snapper, and uni. IT was all mouth-wateringly delcious.It can get a bit pricey, especially when you don't know how much everything is when you're ordering it. However, despite our crazy bill it was still well worth it. Our chef was nice enough to let us sample the herring roe on kelp that we pointed at in curiosity. I can never go back to those random hole in the wall sushi places again without comparing it to sushi gen.  I'll come back on my next payday.

Reviews.Author: Reid N.
Reviews.Content: Best sashimi I've ever had - nice cuts and very flavorful. I ordered the sashimi combo here and it came with miso soup, sashimi, rice, and tempura. The sashimi was excellent and the tempura was also delicious. As an appetizer, we ordered an sushi sampler plate that came with different types of sushi and some cucumber, yellowtail & green onion, and tuna rolls. Although the food here is quite pricey, it is definitely worth it!Definitely make reservations because it was very crowded for dinner, even on a weeknight.

Reviews.Author: Jensen S.
Reviews.Content: Sushi's difficult to review.  In addition to the different types...nigiri, rolls, sashimi...there are so many fishes that its really difficult to go yelp a sushi restaurant and get an objective opinion.  So my review is based specifically on the sashimi (and a few nigiris).  (bear in mind that they don't have many rolls - a sign of a more authentic sushi restaurant).  Had their sashimi deluxe, and...5 stars.  For a decent price, had a wide variety of fish.  All there fresh and well-cut.The dealbreaker for me as usual....the Uni. 5-stars.Instantly my favorite sushi joint in LA.  Thanks Sushi-Gen

Reviews.Author: Moistnchewie L.
Reviews.Content: traditional japanese sushi restaurant.  the sushi is fresh, quality grade.  However, there is really no vibe or special decor.it's owned by japanese with japanese sushi chefs, unlike some americanized places that are owned by koreans and chinese.best sushi i've had next to sushi at the tskiji (sp?)  fish market in tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Alan W.
Reviews.Content: The food is great - the fish are all very fresh and delicious! You have to try their Toro (Fatty Bluefin Tuna Belly) and Yellowtail Belly - these items are pricey, but they are top-notch. Their Seaweed appetizer (Mazawaka Seaweed? I'm not sure) is very good too and a great way to start off your meal.I would advise potential customers to avoid sitting at the tables though and choose only to sit at the bar - the difference in the quality of your sashimi and sushi orders is quite noticeable! I didn't give this place a full 5-stars because of the inconsistency - if you get seated in front of a stingy chef, both the quality and quantity (size) of your sushi orders will suffer. Also, make sure to come earlier as it gets pretty packed during regular eating hours.

Reviews.Author: pinkusaru s.
Reviews.Content: Great if you can get a seat at the counter.  Sometimes there is a wait, but it is much more fun than sitting at a table unless there is a secret conversation you want to have, the sushi chefs may harass you and your guest which is the best part as everyone becomes a family and drinks together!! Their fish is superb and I would trust it over any other restaurant.  I love Kazu-san and Toyo-san as they're always so friendly and if you are unsure of what you'd like they will make you something  you will love.  The atmosphere is a party all the time!  It is pricey but it is so worth it! Easily the best sushi place in town!

Reviews.Author: Shirley L.
Reviews.Content: Delicious!! My 2nd time eating at this place since is at Downtown LA. I ordered sashimi and salmon collar combo for 15.00. Its very FRESH!! The miso soup is delicious!! Rice was perfect. not soggy.. not undercook or overcook.THe best time to go during lunch is arrive before 1130 or after 1230.  1130-1230 is pact. You will have to wait for a long time. I got there at 1125.. made it just in time before I have to wait ^_^

Reviews.Author: Tom J.
Reviews.Content: Not satisfied, I felt ripped off. Maybe I am in the minority here.  But has anybody else had the Deluxe Chirashi for $15 before?I ordered the Deluxe Chirashi since I wanted to get a sampler, and everything in the bowl was cheap - cheap - cheap. The main fish was a couple of slices of cooked octopus and maybe 4 better peices - a couple of pieces of tuna and a couple of pieces of whitefishbut the rest was filler - a few chunks of seasoned radish, powdered pink sugar, tamago shavings, and not much else. When I had asked the waitress what was in the Chirashi, she would not tell me just saying several fresh picks of the fish of the day.  She was too busy to come back around after a table cleaner delivered the Chirashi bowl to me.So essentially for $15 + tax and tip, you are getting about 4 small better peices of fish for $3 each and another $3 for a couple of peices of octopus. Next time I guy, I will have to try sushi directly from the sushi menu and pay their high price - but at least I will know what I am getting.I would opt to go to Hide Sushi in West Los Angeles on Sawtelle which in my opinion is equal in quality and better priced.

Reviews.Author: Charles K.
Reviews.Content: Oh man.Oh man oh man oh man. I don't think words could adequately express the quality of the sushi here. The fish is so fresh and tender, it literally melts in your mouth. I don't know if it's placebo effect or whatever, but even the sushi rice tastes incredible. I could just eat the sushi rice (chirashi, anyone?) and I'd be content.Many of their cuts are incredibly delicious, but of special note is the Japanese snapper. They treat it with a tiny pile of yuzu peppers and a dash of lemon. Absolutely incredible. I frankly have no clue how badly the snapper raped my wallet (no prices are listed on their sushi list and I didn't want to sound like a stingy bastard so I never asked...but ignorance is bliss), but I don't care if I have to shell out a hundred bucks for just one morsel of that stuff.Their albacore tuna is also pretty amazing. They give it a liberal treatment of ponzu and dress it up with some green onions, all of which makes for a very delectable party in your mouth.The waiters/waitresses/front-desk-dude weren't that great though. Very impersonal. Hostile, almost. We were largely ignored by them...but I guess it didn't matter in the end, since we were sitting at the bar anyway. Speaking of which, the sushi chefs were very amiable. They didn't rush us at all. They worked efficiently, but a huge amount of attention went into every order as well.All in all, after blindly ordering sushi left and right, the damage came out to be $92 + tax + tip for two. We had roughly the same number of orders (7 each), but I had more expensive orders on my side. Worth the price? Undoubtedly.

Reviews.Author: Vivian D.
Reviews.Content: If you want melt in your mouth delicious mouth watering sushi take your mouth and appetite directly to Sushi-Gen! You will never be disappointed. The line outside doesn't lie. This is authentic Japanese cuisine at its finest! If you want excellent sushi - this is where you must eat. This is on the top of my list! There are no frills here - it's located in a small mini-mall in Little Tokyo. I happen to go the chiropractor a few doors down, so I'm fortunate enough to be in the area quite often to frequent this amazing sushi bar. The toro, yellow tail, tuna, salmon, scallops, tako and even the clam miso soup is incredible! Your head turns from side to side to check out what the next person or table is enjoying. If you love sushi - you will more than love it here.

Reviews.Author: BK Y.
Reviews.Content: I heart heart heart Sushi Gen....except for their long waits which is like all the time! I've been coming here for years now, never had their omakase, but always left with a huge smile on my face.A reliable place to fill that sushi craving - my bf and I used to order sushi on end and the sushi chefs would always look at me like "really, more", but now that we've become regulars, they know my sushi belly and they just smile and offer us the best of the day. Yup, I eat just as much as my bf and sometimes, maybe more  Besides always being reliable for good fish, I think that their ameibi sweet shrimp miso soup is the best I've had. I always look forward to ordering the Ameibi nigiri and then when they ask what to do with the heads, we'd get 2 fried and 2 miso soups please.  For some reason, the soup is just so flavorful compared to other places. Also, the chefs here can accommodate to your taste buds quite well.  Sometimes, I ask for 'easy rice' when I'm feeling like I'm getting a little big and I need to control my carb intake... they just chuckle a little and say no problem without asking any questions.Verdict: This place makes me smile.  When I'm in a bad mood, having a bad day, just plain cranky, my bf knows to take me here. It doesn't hurt that I work close to sushi gen and yes, if u don't sit at the bar, the lunch special is a great deal if you're feeling for some melt in yo mouth sashimi!!

Reviews.Author: Izzy B.
Reviews.Content: Toro is there best plate... I did love everything except that there is too many hands in the kitchen I like eating amazing food especially sushi in a quite not so visually busy or load restaurant it was a bit distracting from the actual amazing taste of the food and experience. I sat at the bar the master is so nice... I though the rice could of been a bit more on the room temp size... I found it quite to warm for the fish and the fish a bit to cold. Anyways I'll go again since I live close by... But hands down best sushi place on LA is Nishimura taste like I'm in Japan... This place is number 2 best sushi in la :)

Reviews.Author: Sun O.
Reviews.Content: The food:4~4.5 stars.  We always sit at the bar when we get there and ask for the specials/recommendations of the day, dropping about $150 or so every time.  Non-specials can be lackluster at times, and there have been off-days.  Fridays and Saturdays are apparently the best days to visit in terms of quality - but also the busiest.This is the yardstick by which all other sushi restaurants in LA should be measured - anything below ought to be a "fail".Other issues:Parking can be a pain - get there by 6pm?  Lunchtime is also very busy.

Reviews.Author: karen m.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Delux is definitely worth trying. Though pricey, this place has amazingly fresh sushi!Small area, but friendly service and quiet atmosphere.Food is worth your money!

Reviews.Author: Alan C.
Reviews.Content: By far this is my favorite sushi restaurant... fish is very fresh.  I had to work on Labor Day and drove by thinking i can enjoy some good quality sashimi after a hard day's work.  They were closed... so I went again on Thursday.  Surprisingly, I discovered they closed at 10 pm.  So one more choice I can go when I have to get a light, late night dinner.Fish is fresh as always.  I ordered the $26 sashimi dinner, which came with tempura and rice.  I did try to ask for changing the tuna to salmon (I am a Salmon fan) but no good.  No problem.  It is still one of the best deal in town.  If I am here, it's either this or the sashimi deluxe (came with toro).  Occasionally if there is a large group we'd also order the uni dinner and share.Definitely worth trying if you have not been here yet.  It will be worth your wait... my wife and I have had to wait for the restaurant to open at 5 pm to get a guaranteed seating as we hate waiting.  :-P

Reviews.Author: Cece W.
Reviews.Content: If you like to sit at the sushi bar and get chef recommendations, you have to be patient, as they do not take reservations for the sushi bar, it's first come first serve. If you don't mind sitting at a regular table, make a reservation!We went on a Monday at 7:30pm, and waited 45 mins for a seat for 3. However, if you grab drinks next door at Bar C - let them know and they will come get you when there is a seat for your party.The sushi is VERY fresh. Some of the things that I would recommend the following:-Toro-Spicy Scallop Sushi-Hamachi Kama-Unagi-Shrimp-Mackeral-Ginjo Premier SakeYou are allowed to BYOB - but the corkage fee is approx $20 - you can find good sake on the menu.Parking is $3 w/ validation

Reviews.Author: Min K.
Reviews.Content: Wanted sushi for lunch, and arrived around 11:05 and there was already a long line at the door. As mentioned in another tip/review, the doors open at 11:15. We were only a couple of couples away from getting a table, so the wait was around 25 minutes.I got the uni/sashimi combination for $35, which is pricey, but they give you TONS of uni! I'm not from LA and uni isn't as readily accessible but the amount they give is awesome.There's the main plate with the uni and little sides around, along with another bowl for the sashimi. There is also some tofu, a little bit of a cabbage salad (tiny) and miso soup. My friend got the sashimi plate and it was also fullll of food, she couldn't even finish it.I definitely found it worth the wait and would return if I lived in LA!

Reviews.Author: Joe E.
Reviews.Content: Yes! Amazing sushi and cheap! We get the sashimi deluxe dinner every time. The only downfall is the wait to be seated. But hey, it makes sense..

Reviews.Author: Jim J.
Reviews.Content: Great Cho Toro.  Had a box of the Uni and some other weird Ikura nigiri preparation that the cute Korean lady next to me insist I ordered.:-) Thought the weird Ikura nigiri thing was a little too sweet.  The Ankimo was passable however not the best I have ever had.  The Hamachi Toro was ok too.  The miso soup sucked, especially the miso fish soup(extremely fishy despite the miso!).   The Abalone was ok too, not great.  Mirugai was also just passable.Basically, just order Cho Toro and enjoy.  Giving them the 5 stars because of the Toro.  BTW, EXTREMELY BUSY!

Reviews.Author: marc v.
Reviews.Content: This is for table seating for dinner:Yellowtail = GoodBaby Yellowtail = meh...just OK.Fried Shrimp = Very Good.Sweet Shrimp = unfresh, slimy.. worst ever..At 489 reviews @ 4 1/2 stars, I'm assuming this was an off day.

Reviews.Author: Heather M.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. I am still learning the sushi world and had to streatch myself in trying different things at this place. If you sit at the bar (which I recommend) do NOT ask for a roll. The Chef looks at you funny and will have someone in the back make you the roll. The Chef's are artist. They want to make you try new things and cut you fine pieces of fresh fish. Loved my time here and hope that my fiance takes me back ASAP.

Reviews.Author: michelle l.
Reviews.Content: I live near the fisherman's market (tsukiji) in Tokyo, Japan but when I came here, I would say they had the best quality fish here in LA. I rarely give 5 stars!!! The food is pretty traditional japanese but the prices are very reasonable. This is the one place everyone must try at least once in their life, I mean, they always have good reviews, amazing food, reasonable prices, people lined up outside every day, great staff, great vibe, so what are you waiting for?????????? I always recommend the Sashimi Deluxe, a dish full of different sashimi with miso soup and white rice for only $21!!! Definitely a must-try. Plus I get green tea ice cream on the house because my grandma is the owner of Honda Plaza:9

Reviews.Author: Lensman G.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal sushi, sashimi and traditional Japanese eats!Been frequenting this establishment since the early 1980s.  Awesome, fresh sushi that remains excellent.  Truly as good as it gets.Won't belabor other points fellow Yelpers have made  ad nauseum.  Just wanted to throw in my rating for this excellent place.  Sushi bar is top-notch sushi; dining tables are also good for standard fare.Best values:  Sashimi Lunch or Sashimi Dinner.Cost:  What you'd expect for excellent sushi, but not absurdly expensive.  Just be prepared to fork out some bones.Wait:  Retarded waits during busy hours.  While they take reservations, sort of, you might as well be prepared to wait, too.Parking:  Sucks.  Now you have to pay for parking within Honda Plaza ($3 with validation), which is yet another deterrent for eating here.  Parking in the local environs can run upward of $8 or $10 at a local lot.Request/Recommendation:  Come here to eat, enjoy, and then get the 'eff out ... so that others can get in and eat, too!  ;-)

Reviews.Author: richard k.
Reviews.Content: Heavenly Sashimi ... freshly cut and good price... also they take reservation.I never seen my girl friend smiling crazily about food before. She's a picky eater ... but believe me in this ... when she said it's good it means amazing ^__^ We ate there 7/3/07 and seated on the sushi counter table. we can see the actions from the back of the line.The chef was very creative and fast . . . I tried their TORO, URCHIN, SCALLOPS, SHRIMP, SALMON, HALIBUT, TUNA, YAM, and CRAB . . . just remember, everytime you swallow it worth about $ 4.00 and up ^__^Worth every fish and every penny that you earn... Their portion was very small, eat something before, or eat some thing after.

Reviews.Author: Cali B.
Reviews.Content: This is a true, authentic sushi restaurant.  I told my Japanese friend I wanted chu-toro and he recommended this place.  The sashimi here is so fresh!  I had the $35 deluxe combination, which included toro.  Yum.  The service was impeccable, both friendly and efficient.  The decor of this place is also clean and modern.

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: I recommend sitting at the sushi bar for the full experience. The sushi chefs are a lot of fun. The young one is serious and really knows his stuff. Some of the older chefs like to kid around with the diners. The friendly banter keeps the evening lively. Make no mistake, though, the chefs are all about preparing great sushi. If your sushi chef is in a good mood, he will "gift" you some tasty seaweed sometime during the evening. To boot, there's always this communal feeling with the people that sit next to you at the sushi bar. At Sushi Gen you don't mind when the people next to you are craning their necks to see what you're eating cuz you're doing the same thing when you see something you've never ordered before. Yes, there is such a thing as sushi envy.I like to order the mixed oshinko as the first of the a three-part appetizer menu that I have created for myself. The pickled carrots and radishes are the best I have tasted in a restaurant in the US. The oshinko is made in-house, and not taken out of a vacuum-sealed plastic wrapper.Part two of my appetizer is the mixed tempura. The batter is the right amount of sweetness, and they fry the vegetables and shrimp to golden perfection. It never tastes oily, and they give grated daikon for the tempura sauce. This is key! The Japanese pumpkin, sweet potato, and shrimp taste fresh under the fried batter.The last part of my three-part appetizer is the monkfish liver, lightly bathed in a delicate soy sauce and garnished with scallions and shaved onions. Thank you to Tim and Anton for turning me on to this delectable dish! I've always loved monkfish, but never thought I would love its liver more. Until now.You'd think I'd be done by then but I want more. I then go into the sushi: scallop, toro, albacore, red snapper, Spanish mackerel, eel... It's all fresh, simple, and melts in your mouth. Maybe the octopus or the abalone doesn't melt, but almost everything else does.I have to say I am never disappointed. This is why I return a'Gen and a'Gen and a'Gen. OK so I didn't come up with that pun myself. My devotion to this place is such that I'm willing to resort to word piracy.

Reviews.Author: Dmitriy K.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Sushi Gen for at least 11 years and most times that was for lunch. They have an excellent lunch specials menu, for which people line up before the restaurant opens. They open at 11:15 am and if you are not in line by 11:10 or earlier, you will have to wait at least 40 minutes for a table. That is unless you want to sit at the sushi bar.The reason to get a table at lunch hour has been simple. The lunch specials were very reasonably priced. Although I long for the old days when the sashimi plate lunch special was less than $11 and green tea was free with it, even with the $15 or so for it today and extra for tea, it is still a decent bargain.The sashimi lunch special includes little dishes of tofu in some kind of meat broth, which is delicious (and I don't even like tofu otherwise). It also includes a small cabbage salad, miso soup and it used to include seaweed salad, but recently I haven't seen it.So even before the main dish, you get a few little "appetizers" that taste great. And then you get the sashimi plate itself (and a bowl of rice which I usually barely touch). The sashimi is rather a generous portion and has several kinds of fish (e.g. tuna), little octopus, salmon and teriyaki something. The contents vary slightly, but the fish is always super-fresh and portions rather generous.I did try the lunch specials with rolls and nodi maki were good, but not as glorious as the sashimi plate. So needless to say, I always got the sashimi lunch and I have been there at least 150 times in the last 9 years.The parking used to be free, but is now $1.50 with validation from the restaurant. And if you get there after 12pm, there might be no parking available. So come early and get in line.But why the 3-star rating? I have noticed that if you are not Asian, you might experience other parties that arrived after you, be admitted before you. This happened several times and I don't believe this to be a fluke.

Reviews.Author: Vicky K.
Reviews.Content: all i have to say is the sashimi lunch special!

Reviews.Author: Hanson T.
Reviews.Content: As DTLA's most popular sushi spot, I've had Sushi-Gen bookmarked for a long time. I finally had the chance to come here for lunch on a weekday. Apparently, it doesn't matter if you come right before their lunch hours are over because you'll still have to wait for a table. I was hoping that the lines would die down by the time I arrived (twenty minutes before closing), but I guess the ten parties ahead of and after me had the same thing in mind...There's no avoiding the lunch rush hour, so expect to wait unless you come prior to opening.  Service was speedy, as it should be for a restaurant with this much business. The workers were courteous but not particularly attentive. Understandable of course, since they need to get customers in and out as fast as possible. In any case, everything arrived promptly. Sushi Gen's lunch menu is small and revolves mainly around sushi and sashimi, the latter of which can be supplemented with unaju, uni, teriyaki, or tempura, provided you're willing to pay extra. I decided to keep it simple and ordered the sashimi lunch combo which came with an assortment of fresh fish, spicy tuna, crab meat, seaweed, some sort of tartare, and braised fish. Also included were miso soup, tofu, pickled vegetables and a bowl of steamed rice. At $15, the combo was a fantastic deal, considering the table was brimming with food, enough to send me off blissfully replete.
