However, despite what was stated on the menu, a lot of the plate's contents could hardly qualify as "sashimi."  I wish I hadn't been so intent on getting just the sashimi lunch because, unbeknown to me at the time, they offer okonomi sashimi (your choice) as well. I definitely would have liked to make my own selections as I didn't care for some of the items that were included. Lesson learned: if money is not an issue, it's best to venture beyond the sashimi lunch combo, even if it is their most popular and reliable option. The sashimi was good, though for the most part, it wasn't the best or the freshest fish I've had, with the toro being the only exception. It was impeccably fatty, unimaginably delicate and so fresh that I was convinced the fish now on my plate had been swimming with vigor not too long ago. The spicy tuna was also excellent. The hamachi, maguro, sake, ike and tako were less remarkable, but I enjoyed them all. Albacore, my favorite fish, was missing altogether, so I was slightly disappointed about that. The braised fish, crab meat and other non-sashimi items were the least palatable. Though not unpleasant, I would have preferred a few more slices of toro instead. I'm gonna go out on a limb and say that Sushi-Gen is not the best that Little Tokyo has to offer when it comes to sashimi. Still, prices are reasonable during lunch (I've heard otherwise for dinner) and the fish is undeniably high in quality. The wait can be a bit rough though it's certainly not unbearable. This might not be my favorite sushi bar around here, but I'd gladly return.

Reviews.Author: Marc R.
Reviews.Content: Awesome all around. Crazy busy. Didn't have reservations so waited with a pile of other people and had an amazing meal. A fun place if you are not an LA native. I really enjoyed waiting in line and talking to people about how good this place was going to be. Not like the more sedate upscale places in Chicago or New York, but one of the best fast placed sushi experiences I have ever had. Yum, yum, and yum!

Reviews.Author: Elisa C.
Reviews.Content: If you don't eat sashimi... don't come here. Seriously.For awhile I was not a fan of sashimi at all, just rolls and such since I wasn't a fan of cold fish sliding down my throat. So when I came here my first couple times, I was not the one to be judging this place, since it really isn't that friendly in options for non-sashimi eaters. It's like going to an American restaurant to order a quesadilla, you know? Just not worth it.But as a fan of sashimi (now, hurrah!), their $15 sashimi deluxe is such a GREAT deal. So fresh that it just melts and of a large variety, the TORO (yummmmm) And really, it's not hard to tell if its lacking quality--trust, its not. You can tell by the crazy lines, always, outside the door. Convenient with parking, if you're in the area, this is definitely one of LA's must trys.

Reviews.Author: Marc L.
Reviews.Content: If anything, Sushi-Gen's reputation precedes itself. Located in Honda Plaza, away from the more heavily-trafficked Japanese Village Plaza at the center of Little Tokyo, true Japanese food lovers have no problem finding this place- especially during lunch.My first experience with Sushi-Gen was during their famed lunch hour that starts at 11 am, where they have discounted prices on some of their meals. As a college student, I usually WAKE UP at 11 am, so getting up that "early" was a small sacrifice in order to land some really tasty sushi.BEWARE! Although there were only about 20 people ahead of me in line when I got there around 10:40 am, the moment they opened the doors there was a near bum-rush of senior citizens and Taiwanese aunties pushing their way through. Calm down y'all- there's plenty seats for everyone!Like everyone says, Sushi-Gen's fish is fresh and the portions are perfect. The interior is basically traditional Japanese minimalist, with no frills, and the same can be said of the servers- curt but polite, they would prefer you order and finish your meal without not dilly-dallying away too long... There's probably another line forming up while you're having those last sips of green tea.All in all, a nice place for lunch and dinner (if you're willing to pay full-price), not just because of the quality sushi, but also because you're able to get away from all those scatter-brained yuppies that seem to fill Little Tokyo on a daily basis these days...

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: Yes the sushi is fantastic, so fresh it melts in your mouth, but my visit was marred by the total meanie of a sushi chef, Tatsu! The guy would NOT let me eat in peace! Now I've eaten sushi at many fine establishments here in the States, China and Japan, and NEVER have I been so harassed by the guy at the bar! One instance that really irked was his loud admonishment not to put my sushi down. I'm petite, and cannot put an entire spider roll in my mouth lest I choke and DIE. Go for the high-quality fish, but if you're at the bar and a dude named Toshi looks to be in an ornery mood, try to sit elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Jeffery J.
Reviews.Content: Finally got the chance to try it, and it doesn't disappoint!A bit sad that we didn't get to try the lunch special, since the wait for a table was ridiculous, we decided to just sit at the bar.Basically, everything we tried were fresh and tasty.  The only disappointment was their Uni, the serving was so tiny! (maybe I just got spoiled by Rokuan's serving).  The toro was just amazing, literally melted in my mouth - was tempted to get a second...but it ain't cheap.  All the other sashimi we tried (salmon, tuna, albacore) were very fresh as well.  I will definitely be back to try their lunch special.

Reviews.Author: jerome c.
Reviews.Content: I soooo did not like this place.  Forget about the line.  That was not a factor.   OKok, my head is down (ashamed), I got the Deluxe Combo or something.  But I went with a couple of hakujins in town and THEY ordered.  I so knew they wouldn't go for the uni or anything, but STILL.  Tuna was soso, and the monkfish (?) was even worse.  I swear - go to your nearest Bristol Farms, or even a Nijiya, and get better fish. So. Not. Good.Other notes...Interiors/decor was cool.  Nice and open. Good noise level.  Tea was pretty peppy hot. Quick service.

Reviews.Author: Adrian D.
Reviews.Content: Before you die...you MUST eat at Sushi Gen!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Enough said! lolThe sushi melts in your mouth the moment you put it in there....even the seaweed melts in your mouth.  Amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: Nina C.
Reviews.Content: This is my sister's favorite sushi place and I was in desperate need of a sushi fix, so she took me here.We ordered tons of different sushi and also got the sashimi dinner as well.  The sushi was awesome.I would have given them 5 stars, but my salmon sashimi appetizer was a disappointment.  As soon as they put the plate on the table, my face fell.  The salmon did not look good - not in the I'm gonna get sick if I eat that or the I'd send it back way.  The color was just not as bright as I expected it to be and it tasted kinda bland.  Not what I was expecting and it kinda made me rethink coming to this place since salmon is such a common sushi fish.The saving grace was the yellowtail belly.  It was melt in your mouth awesome.  The regular yellowtail, ika and scallop were also yummy.  Maybe the salmon was a fluke that night (no pun intended), but the rest of our dinner was still fabulous.I left full and happy, so I guess it worked out.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: I have only been here once so I still have a lot more to taste, but based on my Sushi Deluxe platter, I can tell that Sushi-Gen has incredibly fresh fish without all of the fuss and frill of those fusion sushi places.I spontaneously felt like sashimi one day and heard of this restaurant from a friend who lives in Downtown.  She makes all of her dates and boy-toys take her here for the sashimi.  So I figure that if she likes it enough to eat here with her multiple men, then I think I should try it out.So I called about 30 minutes before we would arrive there to make a reservation because I heard that there can be a wait, via Yelp.  Even with my reservation we had to wait.  So basically, come prepared to wait a little even if you called in advance because this place is busy!I am not usually a fan of sashimi but Sushi-Gen made me a believer.  I was really tempted to order something cooked, aka Teriyaki salmon but I had to try out their sushi and sashimi.  I ordered the Sushi Deluxe and the bf got the Chirashi.  They were almost identical but his came with the extra octopus which I don't like so much.  My fave was the Toro because it melted like butter in my mouth.  Also, the Sushi Deluxe came with wasabi in EVERY piece.  I should have mentioned no wasabi to the waitress but I wasn't thinking.  We also ordered the Yellowtail Collar, which takes 15 minutes to prepare.  I think if we hadn't ordered this we would both still be hungry after each eating our sushi.  I guess I needed that little bit of cooked food to settle all of the raw.After I almost finished all of the sushi on my platter, I found my tuna sashimi left, which I had saved, and said loudly "OH YEAAAAA," in the Kool Aid guy kind of voice as he runs through walls.  The waitress laughed at me as she filled our water cups.  I guess I was too excited to find that little bit of fish left.I was a slightly sad that they didn't give any salmon sashimi in either the Chirashi or the Sushi Deluxe, because I like salmon sashimi even more than tuna!  Sadness.  I would have gladly traded in a squid or white fish for one salmon.  I also thought that my water cup smelled a little of fish.  Maybe too much fish in one restaurant can be a bad thing.I must come back to try their lunch.  It sounds like a steal, dinner costs mucho dolares.

Reviews.Author: Lainy C.
Reviews.Content: Oh how I miss being walking distance from Kanoyama.This is the one place most people recommended to me for affordable and fresh sushi in LA. Too bad downtown's so far, but it was worth it. The sushi dinner combo is reasonably priced, and its a decent amount of food. They give you standard cuts plus a few others.  Now that I know its good, I'll have to come back, sit at the sushi bar, and try the special stuff to really judge...

Reviews.Author: eileen h.
Reviews.Content: Located in Little Tokyo, I heard this place is a must go around this area.  $15 sashimi lunch special is such a steal.  The fish is fresh and the portions are generous.  I wish this place was closer to work since I don't have in-n-out parking. The only problem is the parking lot.  You have to pay and space is limited during the lunch hours.I am definitely coming here again.  You really can't go wrong with their specials here.

Reviews.Author: Karen W.
Reviews.Content: Favorites: - tamagoyaki: sweet, skillfully rolled egg, unpredictably tasty. - unagi: crispy edges (perhaps, a little overly), but still so good. - tuna: fresh, goes down easy. - hamachi: fresh and good. Only thing about the nigiri is there's a little too much wasabi between fish and rice-- takes away from the sushi taste and experience. Busy, busy all the time. Prepare to wait or make reservations.

Reviews.Author: Rina L.
Reviews.Content: I'm drooling just thinking about this place.  The sushi is super fresh, the portions are big, and the price wasn't as crazy as I thought it would be.  I went with a 4 other people and we had so much sashimi left (I literally forced myself to eat 4 more pieces than what my stomach could handle). We ordered 2 sushi deluxe combinations, chicken teriyaki combo, sashimi deluxe and extra sushi/sashimi on the side.  The total came out to less than $100!  That's pretty good for the amount of food we got.  The server was nice but we had to flag her down a couple of times for more water and tea- but the place was packed, so it was OK.Arrived at 7pm (on a Tuesday) and the place was packed.  We left at 9pm and the place was packed.  That's always a good sign.  I'll defintiely be back....Tips:  $3 parking with validation in the lot.  I think the plaza is called Honda plaza?  Maybe....

Reviews.Author: Tuan T.
Reviews.Content: I never thought I'd see the day people line up to eat sushi at 11am. I mean, I was super skeptical at first, but once we got inside and quickly ordered the Sashimi Lunch, my mind was forever blown. Like WHOOOOOOOOOOSH on the fly.The quality of the fish was fantastic. Super fresh and oh so tasty. And they don't try to skimp you; you get a whole lot of sashimi with your order. Oh, and you also get a side of rice, tofu, salad and miso soup. All for only $15! What a deal.I would seriously suggest getting in line by 10:30am. Anything after that, you might be waiting at least an hour for a table when it opens. Recommendation: Sashimi Lunch Special

Reviews.Author: Julie K.
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review on my blog before I started Yelping...but I SERIOUSLY need to dish it so my fellow yelpers are in the know...Here we go guys, it's a doozy!!I seriously need to get on Yelp y'all.  Can't tell ya how many times I rely on that sucker to map out my next meal.  When I'm feeling sharp hunger pains, I open the app.  When I'm on vacay, I open the app.  When I'm working in LA, en route to meet clients, or even lounging in and around my own hood, I open the app.  I have such confidence in Yelp that I'll rely solely on high star ratings without reading any reviews and happily shell out a couple hundred bucks for dinner if users say its 4.5 stars and above.  Has Yelp ever done did me wrong?  Hell mo-fo'in YES!  I rarely ever outwardly dis an establishment on the blog...ok maybe ONE time (hello, remember Season's 52? Egads!)...but I gotta set the record straight concerning the HIGHEST rated sushi joint in Downtown LA, Sushi Gen, so y'all are in the know. Spicy Tuna Tsumami:  The meal's only saving grace and this was our first dish...lucky bastards...saved the establishment from a negative star rating...Fresh and savory with bits of masago mixed right in.  But c'mon, who the eff charges for ginger???  Oh, I know...Sushi Gen.  Cheap bastards!Miso-marinated Black Cod:  I don't think anyone can mess cod up.  Buttery fat oozing from it's pores...juicy and well portioned...here's where it starts getting baaaaaaddd....Sweet raw shrimp "Amaebi" with fried heads...The shrimp was super-duper fishy, tough, and lacked the sugary sweetness usually found in sushi-grade shrimp...the heads seem to have been deep fried in week-old oil...you know how sometimes you can "taste" the used oil that's been recycled from tempura to "crunchy rolls" and now to shrimp?  Yup, that's what it tasted like...grossnage!Assorted sushi:  Toro, yellowtail, salmon, octopus, amberjack, uni, and clam...An EPIC FAIL!!!  Dude, the sushi came out room temperature (Travesty!), they charged (again!) for extra ginger, and uni like this (fishy, old, and grainy) is the number one reason I used to abhor uni in the first place.  Ikko (in Costa Mesa) is the singular reason I learned to lalalallaLOVE it (See here for how it's supposed to be done).  Note:  I rarely order sushi...The boy and I are sashimi peeps, low-carb style, very LA I know, except they wouldn't break up the standard sashimi order (7 pieces per) so we had to get sushi instead.  Rules, schmules!Y'all don't wanna mess with me when I'm hangry (hungry + angry...my new FAVE word, thanks Jess!) but I gotta say, my first written review on Yelp will be a copy and paste, word-for-word document of this exact post!  Don't be fooled by their crowded parking lot, their line around the corner, or their 4.5 star Yelp review dude.  Sushi Gen gets a measly 1 star markup in my Yelp book.  Plus another +1 for holding my table as we were running 12 minutes late.  Can't say it's all bad, right?Bon Appétit my beauties!

Reviews.Author: Walt L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is probably my favorite sushi restaurant in terms of price vs. value.  Considering the amount of business they generate, I'm surprised that they haven't expanded or relocated in the decade plus that I've been going.  Its amazing how people wait before 11am to be able to get a table.  I think their best value is their chirashi and sashimi lunch specials.  The deluxe shashimi is huge and I couldn't finish it the last time I went.Its a bit of a hassle, what with parking and the crowds but its definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Sheree P.
Reviews.Content: My bestie wanted to meet for sushi in little tokyo, somewhere neither of us has been before.  Since I've always wanted to try Sushi-Gen but have always been taken aback by the long wait (I don't want my food-deprived-passed-out-limp body to be carried to the table) I've never paid my sushi patronage here.So we've decided to stick it out no matter how long the wait would be just to try it...at least once.  Whoa....surprisingly there was no wait for the sushi bar!! Score....air kisses!!We ordered ankimo to start and the sashimi deluxe dinner to share and also ordered the yamagobo (mountain yam). The quality of fish is super fresh.  Unlike some places, they don't douse the sushi in ponzu sauce, but instead lightly drizzle some so one can truly appreciate and enjoy the taste and quality of fish. Sushi-Gen, check.  One satisfying trip indeed.

Reviews.Author: Mitchell P.
Reviews.Content: Sushi wasnt all that great and had to wait

Reviews.Author: matt c.
Reviews.Content: One of the most highly rated Sushi Bar in Los Angeles and they certainly live up to their reputation.  We always order the Chef's selection dish which comes in large portions of the best fishes of the day (including both sashimi and sushi).  Order a Sake along with it, you'll be in Sushi Nirvana.

Reviews.Author: Diego A.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of those places you might consider not telling others about, because you want to keep it for yourself, but it seems as though the word is out!  I knew I was in for a treat when I saw the line waiting outside the door on a Monday evening before they opened for dinner! Very excellent and straightforward sushi and sashimi, meticulously prepared and fresh as can be.  The tuna sashimi, a staple in most sushi joints, is a cut above here - full-bodied and rich.  But all of the fish is excellent - the miso-sweetened blackened cod somehow stays flakey without being dry.Service is good, and prices are very reasonable when compared to newer, more gimmicky sushi restaurants across town - but it's not cheap.

Reviews.Author: Karey P.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi I have ever had in town. Never mind the wait! It is all worth it. I will always come back for more!!

Reviews.Author: Melissa K.
Reviews.Content: GOOD food.  Bad service!!  I mean, terrible!First me and my friend get to the sushi bar and our sushi chef asks us what we wanted--we didn't even have a menu yet!  Then when we asked for one he looked pretty irritated.Then, I love this...no prices on the sushi menu!  I'd really like to know what the heck I'm paying before I order.So I started off with yellow tail, which was GREAT.  My best friend however wasn't very happy with her spicy tuna and opted at this point to have something from the dinner menu.  Of course, you can't have stuff from the kitchen at the bar so we asked if we could sit at a table--reasonable request to make in opinion.  Of course, not to them!  They wouldn't sit us to a table because "we're not allowed to go from bar to table".  Even after asking if we could pay for the bar check and pay for a table check they still said no way (and very rude-ly).So at this point my best friend is PISSED.  I'm frustrated and wanted to leave so we asked for the check.  Our sushi-nazi chef then tells us that we had to order a four order minimum to be at the bar and starts working on other people's orders.  Then he cues us to order something at this point I'm now furious--how can any establishment force a patron to order a four order minimum?  The chef actually wouldn't give us our check until I finally said I'm not ordering anything else and we wanted to leave.  At which the chef tells us dictates the rules of the bar and chirps for the host to get us our check.  Me and my friend were anticipating to order more than yellow tail and a spicy tuna but NO WAY would we give our patronage in exchange for rude service.  Yes, the food is traditional and good (at least for me, the spicy tuna was fine) but I would not recommend anybody to go there from the bad service we got at Sushi-gen.  Simply RUDE.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca C.
Reviews.Content: This place is GOOD. Most sushi places you have to order their daily fish specials to get it fresh.  You can try the rest of the menu and freshness is a toss up. AND esp. when you order the sashimi combo, it's mostly likely not going to be all that fresh.  So sad.  This place, all the sashimi is oh so wonderful all the time!  My friend and I shared the sashimi plate and a yellowtail collar.  Sashimi plate - more than enough for two people.  I would say 25-30 pieces, oh my. All of it was awesome.  Yellowtail collar - crispy skin, juicy and tender meat--some of the best I've had.Although we only ordered 2 things we both had food babies at the end of the night. No rice, no edamame, no miso, just straight fish. We had made it a mission to finish everything.  And I got to say, it was quite the battle. Parking - you pay to park in the lot.  Forgot how much or if there's street parking.  But since it is in Little Tokyo, I'd opt to say street parking is pretty hard to find. Wait - went on a weekday for dinner.  It was rather later in the evening so the wait was only 15-20 minutes.  But I heard this place gets packed! This place has some of the best sashimi I've had.  It's well priced and consistent sashimi quality.  Can't beat that.  I can't wait for next time!

Reviews.Author: tawny w.
Reviews.Content: And all this time, i've been thinking that GEN was going to be one big let down. Whenever i get my hopes up about a good restaurant, especially ESPECIALLY sushi restaurants, it never quite lives up to my expectations.  Not only did Gen prove to be exactly as good as it was described to be, but it's sashimi deluxe dinner pretty much looked me right in the eyes and said: Oh, you silly girl, look what you've been missing all along..Now i know why Gen has thousands of reviews, most of them 5 stars. Who wouldn't give this place 5 stars? Melt in your mouth sashimi and great service. $35 for a sashimi deluxe dinner and $15 for the lunch equivalent.  WHAT A FRIGGIN STEAL. The down side? the wait. Seriously, the wait here is no joke.  Expect to wait for 1-1.5 hours to get a table. Another downside is that, like most japanese restaurants, they close in the middle of the day. So: 11-2pm, m-fri, is there lunch hour and they open back up at 5-9 or 10pm for dinner.  Not open for lunch on weekends!Be mindful of the wait and their hours and you'll be set. There's a ton of bars walkable distance from Gen, so don't be afraid to shy away after putting your name down. Be sure to come back 15 min before the est. wait time and you'll be set.  TANOSHIMU!

Reviews.Author: HL H.
Reviews.Content: I had very low expectations because we had to wait for a LONG time to get seated and my friends insisted at eating at this place.The rolls are mediocre, but what you need to taste is the sashimi! Granted I never been to Japan, the sashimi here is the best I have thus so far.  They literally melt in your mouth and all of it is so fresh.Name it and we have tried it.  The sashimi has no price so don't buy 20 items like we did =XNow I can't eat sashimi anywhere else because it doesn't compare.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: My FAVORITE place for japanese food.  Try Sushi Gen if you have never been, you won't regret it.  You can't go wrong with anything you order.  There's always a long wait for dinner for a reason--the food is DELICIOUS!It's past midnight right now and thinking about Sushi Gen..is making me SO hungry! My favorites here are their steamed egg (which has different seafood in it), monkfish liver, spicy tuna roll, sweet potato tempura, baked scallops and mushrooms, albacore, oysters on a half shell.... MMMMMMmmmmm....Sushi Gen emphasizes high quality and authenticity.  No crazy rolls here.  The food is really great here.  I've always walked out of this place with a big smile on my face and a full stomach.  If you appreciate places that stay true to the natural taste of sushi instead of others that add a bunch of other items to the mix, then It really doesn't get any better than this.

Reviews.Author: Andrew-London P.
Reviews.Content: The lunch special sashimi combo is an amazing deal. $15 for lunch (not including tax/tip) that has TORO SASHIMI??? and 3 hearty pieces at that? Not only is it melt in your mouth good, but the quality of the fish is top notch. No wonder there's a wait before they even open for lunch!Once inside, the atmosphere is really cozy and it feels incredibly authentic. As soon as you sit down, you know there's some bomb a** fish coming your way. TIP: Get there early! They open at 11am for lunch and we arrived at 10:45am [to a line already formed outside], and still waited for 20-30 mins after doors opened.

Reviews.Author: Gabriela V.
Reviews.Content: Went for an early birthday dinner. Got the sashimi dinner. Doubt I will say anything that hasn't already been said but it was fantastic!Came a generous amount of sashimi, miso soup, rice, tempura, a cumcumber and glass noodle small dish, and another pickled small dish.Great meal that I will absolutely come to again. Worth the wait... and, yes, you will be waiting to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Elyse K.
Reviews.Content: What more can i say that the others haven't?  Yep, nothing.  I couldn't decide on 3 or 4 stars.  The draw is the food, and yes, it was amazingly fresh, top quality fish. The internal debate comes from my overall dining experience was pleasant and just fine, but with nothing to really set it apart.  If you dimmed the lights a little, upgraded the seating and decor, it would probably be a no brainer for me.  Nevertheless, i went with 4 stars.Some of the reviews called it pricey, but for 3 of us, we ordered a HUGE plate of sashimi for $35.  Of course add on some wine, beer and sake and you pay a little more, but I feel you get a great deal for your money.  I don't know what was on our tray, but i enjoyed 90% of the selections.   We scrambled for a last minute reservation on a week night, but when walking in, the place was not as crowded as expected.  As we left around 9, the dining room was practically empty.For you sushi lovers, this is a place on your LA sushi circuit.  For you downtowners, you have no excuse not to give it a try.

Reviews.Author: Susan T.
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews my expectations were set very high... and when we do this we typically get disappointed because it doesn't usually live up to all the good reviews.....And in this case it was absolutely NOT that way at all! Since it was our first time we ordered the sashimi deluxe.  The sashimi tasted like butter!  We also got the oysters which was very fresh but i think i prefer my oysters with lemon and tabasco. Other things include halibut, masago, giant clam and sweet potato tempura.  The only thing that was a little strange to me was the sweet shrimp, I don't think it tastes bad at all but it has a very strange texture....Takes some getting use to.  Also you have a choice to get the head from the shrimp deep fried or in a miso soup.  We got it fried and that was good.  But anything fried is usually pretty tasty =X At the end of it all, my stomach was happy.  When the bill came around I thought it would have been a lot more damage than it turned out.. So I definitely recommend sushi gen.

Reviews.Author: Jonas B.
Reviews.Content: The meal started off well.. We had 7pm reservations and right when we showed up at 6:59pm there was an open table for us. Looking around its notable how immaculate the restaurant is (this scores major points with me when eating sushi). For drinks: 5 StarsSuper large sake and an AsahiTo start:  5 StarsTempura dinner, Miso soup, clam Miso soup, and 6 of the most delectable oysters I have ever had. Sushi: 5 Stars4 - Salmon, 2 - Hamachi, 2 - Ama-Ebi, 4 - Kampachi, 2 - UniCut Roles: 3 StarsCalifornia Role (not sure why we got this), Spicy Tuna Role (Much better at Hama...;)Sashimi: 5 StarsThin sliced Halibut, two orders of Toro and two orders of Giant Clam.The four of us devoured the generous perfectly cut fresh morsels of sushi and sashimi. As most others I am going to have to say Sushi-Gem is great and a must try. The only draw back is the price. Be prepared to spend a pretty penny, this place does not come cheap.

Reviews.Author: Demetrio P.
Reviews.Content: Food was good at Sushi-Gen.  We wanted to get Japanese food, and this place was recommended by some colleagues.  We ordered for appetizer a Spicy Tuna roll, which was pretty good.  I ordered for dinner the Beef Teriyaki dinner with the Tempura, which was good as well.  The Beef Teriyaki was sliced up pieces of steak, with a sweet sauce.  I've had better in other places, but Sushi-Gen's was pretty decent.  The tempura was crunchy and fresh.  Our meal also came with complimentary miso soup, a small cucumber salad, and some other small salad, all were okay as well.Overall, good food, okay prices, excellent service.

Reviews.Author: MIGUEL M.
Reviews.Content: If there's ever a time to live by the words 'Early Bird'....think Sushi-Gen!This tiny little hole-in-the-wall (isn't most in Little Tokyo tiny already?) is a GIANT when it comes to Sashimi. One of my friends raved about this place up and down for years, but for some reason or another we never made the time it would take to make it to the door fast enough. Whenever this place was mentioned it was usually followed by a 'But we have to get there at the crack of dawn!'....for lunch....Well...the time came. We finally made it early enough. I was able to lose some sleep one morning with the mission of getting to this place early enough. But why so early? and what time is early enough?The suggestion of the locals, according to my pal, was anytime before 11am....I know 11am doesn't seem like early, right?, but when it comes to Sushi-Gen, 11am is too late. The line starts forming about 10:30. If you get in line at 11am, then expect to get lunch about 12:30, if you're lucky!What is so special about 11am in line for LUNCH, you ask? well. plenty....They have this hidden gem of a lunch that will have you camping out the next time you decide to go for sashimi here.Talk about bang for your buck! the lunch of choice for most everyone before the noon hour is the same reason you go there early. The Sashimi Lunch special. You know this one is popular when even before the door swings open, you see all the trays of sashimi waiting to take flight to each table. The serving is the most sashimi I would ever imagine for as little as $15. (see the pic). They serve you at least 5 different types of sashimi, accompanied by a tofu/miso, and a cabbage/cucumber side bite. Did I mention $$$$15. Good luck finding something comparable to this!Since my first time in this place I am prepared to set up at least 2 alarms and leave my house early enough to avoid that line (see the other pic). All for the satisfaction of diving into that sashimi medley. the Sashimi Lunch is only offered Monday - Friday. Plenty of Parking in the strip mall. (Make sure you validate for a discount)*try not to park in front of the restaurant as some late-arriving  customers find it ok, as they wait outside, to sit on your car hood. Can be annoying.Just remember the 11am rule and you'll be in for a treat!

Reviews.Author: Eddie W.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Food is definitely tasty and the constant lines of people waiting for the sashimi lunch special definitely proves it. Don't be an idiot like me though. I ordered the Unagi rice + sashimi comb (comes with pickle salad, tofu cubes,and miso soup). Definitely not worth it compared to the sashimi lunch special. (Sashimi lunch is the huge plate filled with sashimi while if you get a combo + sashimi, the sashimi is only like 7 pieces).

Reviews.Author: Richard G.
Reviews.Content: Ok look.  I really would give this spot the 5 star salute, BUT - and that's a big J.Lo status kinda but - our waitress was extremely rude and had a very condescending attitude.  Nope, didn't like her one bit.  Now that we've gotten that outta the way, let's get to what matters - their outta this world, next level quality sushi.  This was by far the freshest, highest quality sushi that I've ever had.  When I saw all the marbleization in their Toro, I knew things were about to get real up in here.  I got the $35.00 sashimi platter and shared with a friend, along with a spicy tuna hand roll.  The sashimi platter really is a great deal because it comes with a boatload of sashimi that is of such fresh and high quality, you'd think that they had the Pacific Ocean smack dab in their kitchen.  I couldn't say enough superlatives about their quality of fish here, so it's just best to go ahead and experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Author: MIke Tyson L.
Reviews.Content: Everything from this place will taste like a sushi version of cotton candy, it just melts in your mouth. Eyeballs from a near sighted squid, gut of a hermaphrodite tuna from alaska, fin from a ebony mermaid, whatever you want it's all freaken here and it SOOOOOOO damn delicious. Oh god it's so good.

Reviews.Author: Honest I.
Reviews.Content: There is a pecking order at the fish markets, and Sushi Gen is near the top, which is why you get the freshest fish ever. Japanese style sushi, not American rock n' rolls. 1. Cheap meal, sit at a table for a boring experience.2. Real experience, sit at the bar.3. Omakase- Don't blink when you get the check!4. Best place to try the uni if you're bold enough, fresh, fresh fresh.5. Fun Fun Fun.Things to eat:SnapperSweet shrimpSpanish MackerelSayori (seasonal)UniOnigoroshi Sake

Reviews.Author: Toro O.
Reviews.Content: It was pretty good but not that great.I was not overly impressed by the presentation or the quality of fish.It was definitely not worth the long wait.update: i think it's actually quite good but they charged extra for ginger.WTF?

Reviews.Author: F U.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fish. Amazing prices.Skip the Tempura.

Reviews.Author: Val L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of THE best places for sushi in LA....Happy Birthday son!Best to sit at the bar, I wouldnt recommend anything else, love the Japanese mackerel..... I always ask the sushi chef to just serve something up and he always delivers something great.

Reviews.Author: D S.
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I'm not buying it.  I've been here twice, and had the exact same experience each time.  Average sushi, in a bright room, with less than average service, and a very long wait.  Had the sashimi platter this time, it was average at best, maybe even slightly below.  After I signed the check, it wasn't 3 minutes before the waitress came back over and asked us to give up the table.  It was pretty ridiculous to be so quickly rushed out.  I have no idea how they attract the crowd.

Reviews.Author: Christian S.
Reviews.Content: One of the absolute best Sushi restaurants in Los Angeles. Yellowtail belly is out of this world.

Reviews.Author: N V.
Reviews.Content: Good quality sushi made by Japanese sushi men.Only bad thing is the wait. Go there at the opening time or be ready to wait for your turn for a while even on weekdays.Even with reservations, we had to wait for a long time.

Reviews.Author: Kelly G.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Little Tokyo. Sushi is my favorite food and I've been to a lot of sushi restaurants. If you're one of those pseudo-sushi lovers who can only eat California rolls and Dragon rolls, this is not the place for you. And one more thing, those rolls with sauce and imitation crab inside are not "Japanese."I went with 3 of my girlfriends and I ordered the dinner SASHIMI DELUXE. I don't remember the exact name of it, but it comes with sashimi, tempura, etc. for 30-something dollars. It's quite a bit of food. And it's good food. The fish is fresh. You should definitely try this place. The wait is long, so get yourself a cup of Yogurtland or something while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Julianna J.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try this place, since it has high ratings. We waited about 50 minutes to be seated, which was fine the first 30 minutes because my girlfriend and I were talking, but after 30 minutes I ran out of things to speak about. Sat down, the service was good, not great. Ordered miso soup which was amazing!Next ordered the sushi deluxe and tempura, it was good nothing I would travel 30 minutes to go back too. We also had the spicy Tuna roll, they do not have rice paper so seaweed was my only option and I don't care for it. The roll was alright,they had this really good hot sauce I wanted to ask for tortilla chips because it would have been so good. Last we had greentea ice cream, average. This place does have fresh fish, other then that I could take it or leave it.

Reviews.Author: Stephen H.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my girlfriend for her birthday. Wow! This place was awesome! The place looks nice on the inside with a sushi bar up front, few small tables in the front, and some bigger tables in the back. It was actually kinda small. We ordered the Uni Dinner with Tempura and the Sashimi Deluxe. First thing that came out was the Uni. It came with a wooden block of a bunch of uni laid out, a big bowl of rice, and some packs of nori. This is a dish for people who enjoy Uni a lot.Next out was the Sashimi Deluxe. There were a lot of different types of sashimi on the plate. Toro, Salmon, Tuna, Octopus, Squid, the best spicy tuna ever, surf clam, and a few others.The fish was super fresh and super delicious. For really good sushi, this is the place to go. I will come back again.

Reviews.Author: Dee M.
Reviews.Content: No arguments here, the sushi that is served here is as fresh as it gets. I mean if want it any fresher, you might as well be eating the fish while it is still swimming. This place is packed, Boiling crab status packed. But the good thing about this place is you get to make reservations :D. but sadly I didn't and i had to wait 40 min+ in line :(.But once i got inside it was amazing.  Me and friend both ordered the sushi deluxe. It was delicious ^___^, we savior every bite.  I would go here every day, but i live in the Inland empire T____T or as like to call it the Ghetto empire, and gas isn't cheap.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: This place gets crowded fast, so get there early or expect a long wait.It's pricey, but well worth it if you are craving good sushi.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know people are going to riot or hang me for this review.  I didn't like this place...at all.  I had to wait a long time to get in, which would have been fine if the food was really worth the wait.  We were seated shortly before they were closed for the afternoon.  I got the Sashimi lunch special...seriously..what the heck. The sashimi looks like it came from the scrap ends of the fish discarded from the REAL piece of sashimi.  I guess I can't really complain for $15. All of that could have been forgiven if the service was good.  IT WAS NOT. We were seated in a rush and they didn't bring water over until wayyy into the meal.  They brought us our check in a rush and basically tried to get rid of us.  I guess it was SLIGHTLY understandable since they were closing...but we waited like an HOUR to get in...rude.  Sorry, to all the fans out there, but not loving this place.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Waited over an hour to get seated, was hyped as this place has the best rating in J-town/ Little Tokyo area. Once seated the waitress was very prompt if not a bit too pushy for us to order. Tried the Deluxe Sushi dinner and had cold tofu appetizer. Portions were ok, however other then the fatty tuna the sushi included was nothing special. Since u was not full yet i added orders from the sushi bar for yellow tail and spicy tuna handrolls. These tasted surprisingly better then the dinner set for some reason. Maybe you get better fish from the bar then at a table? For the price and wait time there are several better or comparable options in the area in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Brought a Japanese friend there and she said the sushi was even better than Tokyo's!  Sashimi lunch is just simply irresistable.  The dinner portion is about the same as lunch except you get tempura and it's $5 more.Owner knows nationally renowed Waseda player.

Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as fond remembrance of fish past.  This is the best of the Little Tokyo sushi joints in my humble opinion.  Once, eons ago I sat at the sushi bar here  and ordered ami-ebi.   Being perhaps a teensy bit hammered I skewered the deep fried shrimp heads onto my chopsticks and pantomimed a small fish drama for my dinner companion.  For ages after that the sushi chefs here remembered me as the fish head pantomimer (is that a word?)  and always greeted me with much celebratory gusto when I came to visit, it was nice.  Then I fell on hard times and had to stop going out for weekly fish treats, sigh.Oh, and the food?  Di-vine.

Reviews.Author: Ekabutr S.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in LA.  Sometime I got two pieces of Toro for sushi lunch set.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-gen is a great place for sushi in downtown. I've been here many times and everytime I come it never disappointing. They have a sashimi plate that comes with a wide range of different kind of fish. I would recommend this place to sushi lovers.

Reviews.Author: HP M.
Reviews.Content: Fish is very fresh  - but warning, only go here if you like genuine authentic healthy no grease Japanese sushi. Unadventurous americans - you will NOT find a Philadelphia or "crazy roll" on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Hanna P.
Reviews.Content: I suggest making reservations if you're going for lunch, but do keep in mind the only time that's available is 11:15. There was a well formulated line when I arrived 5 mins before they opened. My friend and I both ordered the sashimi lunch ($15), which came with a side of tofu, miso soup, rice, and of course a plater of sashimi. At first we thought it looked pretty skimpy, but we were beyond full. Everything was good except for the spicy tuna (?) and other thing next to it; they were too fishy and oily..

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: Bottom-line: Good food if you can wait out the line.Waited about 45 mins for two. I'm a sushi noobie (been to only like 5-6 places in the ladt area) but I love how you can order a dinner and get it over with. Got the unagi (my fave) dinner. Loved the rice, could have been a bit warmer though. The fish was really fresh. Can't really beat the price either. One sushi dinner for $30 is pretty affordable.

Reviews.Author: Carson T.
Reviews.Content: If you love sushi or sashimi, this is the best you can get in LA! The fish is really fresh and the Toro melts in your mouth. Get a sashimi deluxe and you won't regret it

Reviews.Author: Sue S.
Reviews.Content: I went there for lunch special. I waited 20 mins and was seated @ 130pm.I ordered sashimi deluxe but sold out :( I didn't know until the plate came out. The sashimi was good and very cheap. For $15, you will a variety of  quality fish. That was about $1 per slice. It also came with a bowl of rice. The rice was cooked perfectly!!! It was moist, and soft and a bit chewy. The sushi chef was an old man with a lot of experience. I didn't sit a the bar but could still feel their warmest welcome and goodbye to their customers. The plates didn't have enough wasabi so I asked for extra. The extra was too much -_-ll. I felt a little wasteful.I also ordered a sushi plate for $15. It was still good but was little worse than the sashimi. You know sushi has rice but sashimi is all-meat..(shy faceThe restaurant was super busy and please be patient ;Parking is free with validation:)

Reviews.Author: Christina D.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice already-both times for dinner. I got the sashimi dinner both times and for $26 you get a lot of food. I couldn't finish my meal both times. The quality of the sashimi isn't the best but it's good especially for the price you're paying. My friend last time got the teriyaki chicken dinner which was about the same price and her dinner portion was huge as well. The wait to eat can get pretty long. I hear great things about their lunch too so I'll definitely be coming back to try that out.

Reviews.Author: Nathan W.
Reviews.Content: Almost 2000 reviews doesn't lie.  This sushi spot offers great quality at a very reasonable price.  Gets very crowded so make reservations early.  Great service and I enjoy sitting at the bar and watching the chefs make the sushi.  One of my favorite sushi spots.

Reviews.Author: Russel M.
Reviews.Content: Best Lunch Deal. Incredible Omakase at the Bar.Freshest Fish.Good Prices.

Reviews.Author: Angie L.
Reviews.Content: If you're talking quality sushi - fresh, fresh, fresh, Sushi-Gen is the place to go.  But we're not talking fancy Americanized rolls here, we're talking authentic Japanese, the real deal Holyfield, that will knock out your craving for true sushi.  My dad and I always hit up Sushi-Gen when I'm in town.. the menu isn't rocket science, and you know what you're getting.Food:I like the salmon-skin salad they serve, and did I mention all of their sushi/sashimi is super-fresh?  Atmosphere:Face it, you're just here for the sushi - not the ambiance.  If you want fancy-shmancy decor and paintings and seats, this is not what you'll find here.  This is just a place you go for sushi.Price/Portions:Eh... yeah, you are going to spend a good amount of money on sushi, no matter where you go.  Some people might think their portions are small, but this is the standard serving size for sushi - you wouldn't want to be bloated off of sushi would you?  Quality over quantity, I say!  But yes, this isn't a cheap lunch or dinner, expect to pay a little more. The Bad:OK so I already raved about the fresh servings of sushi -  the bad part is, it's not a secret.  Everyone and their mom must know about Sushi-Gen because every single day I've gone whether it's a random Wednesday or a Saturday, it's always been jam-packed!  If you want to get lunch, the line starts forming like a good hour in advance.  The wait is just crazy, crazy, crazy.  If you don't want to wait, you can travel across the street to a few nearby sushi joints that are probably not as fresh, but at least you won't go hungry and get tired standing in line.The Good:I love Little Tokyo and so many of the restaurants are great finds.  I'm lucky enough to be spoiled by all the good Japanese places in Torrance, too, but if you're looking for an impressive, conservative, Japanese restaurant for a business lunch or with your closest friends, Sushi-Gen is a nice place to enjoy some sushi and sake.  If you wanna do take-out, try their salmon teriyaki, it's also pretty tasty.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: When you think of Sushi-Gen you immediately think of their sashimi deluxe.  Many of my friends are addicted to this place.  It is true that their prices are decent considering you're eating seafood.  The first time I came here I got their unagi on rice.  It was SO good, but nothing special.  I noticed that all my friends got the sashimi deluxe.  POO!  I made it a goal to come back here again and get that deluxe, because I am seriously in love with sashimi.If you're not into tuna, then the sashimi deluxe is not for you.  I fall into that category.  I ended up trading all of my tuna with my friend.  Everything else included in the deluxe was very appetizing.  The wait gets CRAZY here on the weekends.  I'd definitely eat here if I were ever in the neighborhood and the wait wasn't too bad.  Otherwise, there are tons of other sushi places in Jtown.

Reviews.Author: Anne W.
Reviews.Content: Another spot in Little Tokyo which is filled with Japanese people so you know it's legit.  That's the mark of a good Asian restaurant.. well authenticity wise at least.  The wait is kind of long here.. we were a little late for our reservation and we had to wait another 15 minutes.  The sashimi deluxe special is really worthwhile on the menu.  Fresh.. varied.. large spread... great deal!  The mistake we made was that we thought the sushi deluxe special would be as good.. it's not.  Saw the salmon teriyaki.. quite large piece of salmon.. so you wouldn't be going wrong with that either.The only thing I wish ther was... more rolls.  They had maybe a handful of rolls where half of them were California or cooked ones.. if they have fresh fish, they should show it off with tasty exotic rolls!

Reviews.Author: Scott T.
Reviews.Content: Get the Japanese snapper... squeeze a little lemon on top, no soy sauce.You're welcome.  :)

Reviews.Author: Earlene C.
Reviews.Content: Fresh, raw and simple - Is all I need in a sushi joint! This place hit it spot on!Hubby took me here for my birthday dinner and it was perfect. We split the Sushi Deluxe dinner with the fried chicken to start.  It was more than enough to feed us both.Service was good and worth the wait on a busy night.

Reviews.Author: Scot E.
Reviews.Content: This very well could be the best sushi in California.I've never had any that's better.I live nearby and I walk by this place often and usually see people waiting outside.For some reason, I've been lucky and have been able to walk right up and get seated.  If I've had to wait, it was a short wait.Their lunch specials are very reasonable (it's actually a steal for the quality of fish that they give you).  I recommend the chirashi sushi for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Jennie T.
Reviews.Content: They open at 11am on Mondays, and my friend and I got there about 20 minutes earlier. We decided to take a walk around the area, and we came back around 11:15-11:30am. The place was almost packed! I was really surprised. I was filled with anticipation. "This place must be good!" I thought, and it was. It really was. My friend and I ordered the tempura and sashimi lunch special, the unaju and sashimi lunch special, and a sushi combination. Yes, three lunch portions for two people! And a large bottle of Asahi beer. We were quite ambitious! The lunch specials came with miso soup, a tofu dish, salad, and some pickles. Everything was delicious! Like everyone said, the sashimi was fresh! I was in food heaven. Our total came out to be around $60. A pretty good deal, considering how fresh and delicious everything was.

Reviews.Author: Teresa C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of those restaurants where I have to stop and really think over the meal, trying to figure out if I liked it because of its popularity and the thrill of trying something new or if it really was that good. We came here for lunch on a weekday to celebrate our monthly anniversary (yay!) and enjoy something different. We found metered parking across the street and walked over ($2 for 1 hour, quarters, dollar coins and credit card only) but there is a parking lot with validation...it just doesn't have a lot of spaces and is always crowded. When I went in I was immediately reminded of Taiko in Irvine which has that same decore style and even menu. Although it had a little more on the sushi & sashimi side, something about Sushi Gen just didn't make me love it. They have decent lunch specials, prices ranging from $15 to $30+ depending on the combination of ingredients. I picked the uni and sashimi combo ($32) which came with a tray of fresh uni and a small bowl of 8 pieces of sashimi as well as rice and a bowl of miso soup. K ordered the sushi deluxe, which was a round tray of a variety of sushi. ($17, I think?) The fish was alright, it was fresh but after the initial piece, I kept thinking that it wasn't...wow. It just didn't have impact. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't...great. The flavours weren't memorable to the palate.I did like the uni, tasty and fresh, K and I omnomnomed our way through the tray, plucking at the sides like seaweed and mixed tuna salad that decorated the plate the tray arrived on. K really liked the cooked tofu side, which didn't fall apart on his chopsticks. The meal was okay for the price we paid, which was already cheaper than our meal at Toro's last week and tastier at least. But if I was given my choice, I think I'd rather pay less at Oomasa or drive to a further restaurant for a cheap omakase than drive to Jtown just for Sushi Gen. Decent but a let down in my opinion. My fishie cravings will continue to search out other places. A puzzling thing...there was no salmon in either of our dishes. None at all. I don't know if they ran out or this is just not part of their repertoire for the dish but I thought that was a bit strange.

Reviews.Author: Sonia H.
Reviews.Content: Good salmon, rolls, and terriyaki. Always seems crowded, even late at night near closing hour but the service is quick and the servers are friendly and attentive.Definitely will come back to try the sashimi !

Reviews.Author: Kaylin O.
Reviews.Content: So fresh that it melts in your mouth?   How many times have I heard/read this only to try it and be disappointed.  Because of this restaurant, I've given up on being adventurous with sushi.  I tried their sushi deluxe which came with a good variety of fishes.  I believe it was octopus, hamachi, toro, tuna.  I did order a side of salmon nigiri and it was good. I feel like I can get good salmon almost anywhere so no need to come here just for that.  The sushi deluxe was $21.  2 salmon pieces were $5.  That wasn't bad at all.  Sweet shrimp on the other hand was $18.  A bit pricey.  I was also able to try the salmon teriyaki.  It was decent.  Tempura was decent too.  Nice batter but dipping sauce wasn't that good.  Although the people there are nice, I noticed them ignoring my glass of water.  I had to request it from them.  This place is tiny and gets very busy. You can make reservation up to the morning of that same day. Otherwise, you will have to wait.  The wait wasn't too bad. $3 PARKING with validation.

Reviews.Author: Pete C.
Reviews.Content: Finally had a weekday free to go try their $15 sashimi lunch.  Many reviews say to get there early, so I got there 30 minutes before they opened and there were already 10 people in line.  By the time they opened, there were like 30 people in line.I been wanting to try the sashimi lunch for a while now so I ordered the sashimi lunch.  While waiting for my food, I looked around and it seem like everyone ordered the sashimi lunch.I don't eat sushi that often so I didn't know half the stuff on the sashimi plate.  There was tuna, salmon, albacore, and 5 other things.  To me, half the dish was pretty good, the other half was ok.  But for $15, that's a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Author: Dave F.
Reviews.Content: This is insane, over the top excellent sushi with parking! The unagi and salmon were my favorites! Only downside, the only seating was at the sushi bar with a limited sushi/sashimi-only menu.Expect to wait and it will but the mojo on your wallet, but worth every penny!

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of my favorites and it's worth the wait every single time. Came with my boyfriend at around 1PM hoping to grab lunch before his interview, waited for about 30 minutes which is perfectly logical. Right before we went in to be seated for lunch a woman and her friends storm out saying,"You're going to regret this. You're going to get a bad review." I hear her mumbling about minimums and not being told and I just thought to myself,"There's a sign sitting on the desk at the front 'Bar Seating (minimum 4 orders)' I'm sure you were staring at it while you waited 45 minutes-an hour." A bad review? I don't know if a bad review can really hurt Sushi Gen, the quality of their fish is the best and I have never been let down. Cockiness? I think a restaurant that has earned it is definitely allowed to ask for respect from their customers. Anyway, back to the review about FOOD. I ordered my customary sashimi lunch and the boy ordered the uni & sashimi lunch platter. The food is ALWAYS too much for me, but I always gobble it up in happiness. The quality of the fish is delicious, melt-in-your-mouth happiness. Always, always worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Linda S.
Reviews.Content: Make a reservation.Sit at the bar.Let the Omakase begin.Besides being served top quality sashimi, you really can't beat the friendliness of the sushi chefs. Our chef asked my bf and I what the occassion was (and who was paying) before he crafted our Omakase meal.I love eating slow.The bill can ring up to 150 a person, but with such a sweet staff and free birthday dessert, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla Z.
Reviews.Content: This place is authentic.Waited for almost an hour for lunch. It was insane, but it worth it.The lunch special is really good deal. The sashimi is fresh and thick. REALLY great!!! only $15! I can come everyday to eat lunch here if i work nearby.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: I've been here many times... each time getting the same thing: Sashimi dinner.No need for me to rave any more on that since all the reviews seem to agree that their sashimi dinner is freakin awesome (and affordable!!).This time, I sat at the sushi bar... right in front of the young, cute sushi chef (tehehe). I got o-toro, maguro, kanpachi, uni, ikura, mirugai, and amaebi (head in soup). So fresh... so good... perfect fish to rice ratio. The amaebi head miso soup was dericious!! Mmm. The best thing of the night... TORO. Straight up from a fresh slab of the fattiest fish I have ever seen. So nicely marbled, so tender, so fatty, so good. Definitely worth every penny that I spent tonight.

Reviews.Author: Tony W.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi and the freshest sushi in town.  Everything is good!  There's not much I can add to the other reviews already posted, so just come with a hungry stomach and you'll leave a happy camper.The only negative I can think about is the huge line out the door.  Prepare to wait 1-1.5 hours if you arrive on a Fri or Sat at 6:30pm.

Reviews.Author: Joyce C.
Reviews.Content: We were walking around Little Tokyo one day looking for some dinner.  Walked past Sushi Gen and saw the number of people waiting outside, so we decied to go check it out.  The wait for a table was over an hour long - even though there were just two of us - so we decided to go with the sushi bar.  We got seated immediately and ordered a large Sapporo.  The sushi chefs were attentive and the servers as well.  One downside is that the staff here speaks little English.  We ordered a number of nigiri and small dishes.  Steamed clams, collared fish, salmon, albacore, red snapper, yellow tail, toro, etc.  Everything was extremely fresh and the slices of fish were huge!  The bill came out to be a little over $100 after tax and tip but we were not extremely satisfied.  Looking at the people sitting at tables, their dinner combos looked extremely satisfying and for a good value.Not to self: make reservations next time.

Reviews.Author: Won K.
Reviews.Content: Probably some of the best quality sashimi I've had in LA. Ordered the deluxe platter and got a nice assortment of the traditional stuff, nothing too adventurous. We ordered the fatty tuna and yellow-tail on the side as well, and like the tuna and salmon in the deluxe platter it just melts in your mouth. But for the price, I would expect this much.That being said, if you're looking for rolls, go elsewhere cause their menu is very sparse on the crazy sushi roll concoctions you might find elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine C.
Reviews.Content: I really don't have to say much more; Sushi Gen is one of my favorite sushi places EVER. Not just in LA. Ever. First time I came with Todd O. about 3 years ago because it's one of his favorite places and I totally could see why he likes this place too. One word will do it all when it comes to great sashimi: FRESH. The hamachi just melts in your mouth and there's no nasty stringy cuts in your fish ever. We got sashimi combos for dinner at that time. To be honest, I'd pay more than just the $15 for the lunch special for those combos too. Huge FRESH plates of sashimi with soup, salad, a variety of tempura, until you're super full...and those were under $30 too. Of course the $15 lunch specials recently have blown this place up even more than it used to be. Lines are always ridiculous, so come with some good company and time to spare because you'll be waiting if you don't get there RIGHT as it opens. (or before.) Lunch special is amazing for what it is...you'll probably never find a fresher, cheaper, yummier sashimi deal anywhere!!! I loveee Sushi Gen!

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is my absolute favorite place for delicious and fresh sushi. The lunch deals are outrageous, and everyone seems to know about them. Get ready to wait unless you get there right when they open (and even then, there will be a line of people who showed up BEFORE the doors are open). I always get the sashimi lunch for $15. It is such an incredible deal. As you can tell from the pics, the portions are very generous. In addition to the huge platter of sashimi, you also get a bowl of rice, a bowl of miso soup, a little dish of pickled veggies, and some really good braised tofu. The quality of the fish is suberb. I'm also a fan of their combo meals on the days that I can't handle all that sashimi. Their chicken teriyaki is pretty tasty, and it comes with a little plate of sashimi. I am also a big fan of the chawamushi (steamed egg). It's loaded with delicious bits of seafood. If you come in for dinner, there is usually little or no wait. The prices are a little higher, but if you don't want to wait an hour for food, its not a bad compromise. Remember to get your parking validated! I believe parking is $2.50 for 2 hours. The parking lot is pretty small, but like other yelpers have mentioned, people are always coming and going.

Reviews.Author: Giao T.
Reviews.Content: I really rate this place 3.5 stars.Food is 4 stars.Service is 3 stars.I have been here several times, but I can't rave about it like everyone else does. I've sat at the sushi bar and had a $180 (after tip) meal for two and thought it was great. I've also sat at the sushi bar and had a $200 (after tip) meal for two and thought it was ok. So I've had good meals and have also been disappointed.One thing I don't like though I've given in to is ordering things when you don't know the cost. The sushi list does not show the cost which bothered me for a while but I guess I eventually got over it. If you're on a budget, this may be quite annoying. You don't want a surprise at the end of your meal.Also, last time we were here, the host was extremely rude. I literally stood in front of the host stand for 5 minutes to try to leave my name and was completely ignored, which explains why it was the last time I was here. They may have great business and think they're the greatest, but honestly, there are a lot of excellent sushi places in Little Tokyo that have been more consistent (food taste-wise) than them, so I just haven't gone back.In short, the sushi has been mainly but not always fresh and they do have a large variety of sushi, but I don't care for the service. Prices are cheaper than places in Beverly Hills, I guess, but are more expensive than others in Little Tokyo such as Sushi Go 55 and Sushi Komasa. I prefer these other places as their sushi has been more consistent and cost less.

Reviews.Author: Frank K.
Reviews.Content: i love sashimi all my life.  probably the only thing I can stand eating 5 times a week and still wouldn't get tired of it.  Sushi Gen is by far one of the very best restaurant on my list.   Highly recommdend for people with average budget for dinner:39 dollar uni dinner combo, a plateful of uni, (at least 1/3 of the uni will be bigger than your thumb),  a plateful of sashimi (yellowtail, tuna and a few other choices), and a bowl of rice.   Highly recommended for people who is ready to spend 100 - 150 per person:  sit by the bar, and ask the chef to "IMPRESS ME"TIPS:  If you really want the chef to give you the best stuff in the house.   remember to "TIP" the chef before you start.   believe me, i done it a few times, and that 20 dollar investment is worth every penny.  Of course, you still have to tip the restaurant when you pick up the bill.

Reviews.Author: Anthony V.
Reviews.Content: By far the best sushi place I've been to. Best fish, best service, best name in town. And everyone knows it. Lines go around the corner every lunch and dinner. Been coming here for years and if you don't get there by 10:45, you might be at risk of missing the 1st round. 5 Stars!

Reviews.Author: Kevin T.
Reviews.Content: The maximum occupancy of Sushi-Gen: 75. Now count how many people are in line in front of you... Before the place even opens.  So, clearly everyone got the same memo about this place.  In fact, the 74 people in front of you at 10:59am are all going to get the same thing as you.  That's right, they're all here for the $15 sashimi lunch special, a variety of thick-cut melt-in-your-mouth fish selections slash some chewy things and a big bowl of rice that have somehow resisted inflation, served to you by elderly Japanese women who, when you accidentally bump them as they walk between the packed tables and chairs apologize with repeated, heartfelt gomenasais.  That's why you're here.  That's why you're all here.   In fact everyone knows it.  They're so used to it that they have these sashimi plates constantly coming out and they simply hand them out -- like when McDonald's would just make batches of burgers and just had you one.  This run for efficiency has made its way through the chain -- a woman with nothing but tofus to pass out to the entire restaurant, the miso soup guy, a tray of rice makes its way through the place... But you're not there yet.  You're outside.  Eventually herded in, you deal with (depending on how you want to look at it) a rather curt or downright rude host who seats you.   No, he doesn't even seat you, he sort of points in the direction of a table and you walk into the most generic Japanese restaurant ever.  How can it be the most generic restaurant ever? I'm not sure, that sort of defeats the notion of generic doesn't it...?  In any case, it looks like ever strip mall sushi place you've ever been in.  Random paintings of sumo wrestlers and kanji? Sure, we got that.  Oh we definitely need a mountain painting... oh good we've got a few of those.  But what am I saying, you're here for, what basically amounts to a value.  Sure $15 isn't the cost of a Double-Double, but for fish this good it's a steal.  Of course ,it's created a bit of an attitude.  It's created a sushi-providing clockwork motion, an assembly of sashimi -- the sort of a place where the guy whose entire job it is to welcome you to this establishment is kind of a dick because he knows it doesn't matter, you didn't wander over here -- you knew what you came here for.  That's a little bit of a shame.

Reviews.Author: Grant N.
Reviews.Content: Melted in your mouth!  If you are looking for authentic Japanese sushi restaurant in LA, Sushi-Gen is the place.If you are looking for sushi rolls then you have the wrong place, Sushi-Gen, is just GREAT raw sushi!!!

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: My first reaction to seeing over 400+ reviews was "wow, this place must be stellar". But in looking again I acknowledged the fact that this place is in LA, which means everyone and their grandmother's weekday bingo friends have made a review. Sometimes when seeing such a large reviewing populous I feel the credibility is diluted if only because is seems people in SoCal will yelp about just about everything (and some without ever having tried it). Fortunately this place proved to uphold and even surpass the hype. It really is quite good. Simple décor, attentive service, and knock out raw ingredients. I usually judge my sushi experiences by how many "holy shit that's good!" moments I have. I counted two of those here, and that's really saying something. These moments generally come about 10 times a year for me so I'm for sure not just throwing those around.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie P.
Reviews.Content: #427 Yeah, it was good. Yeah, we had to arrive 30 minutes before the place opened. Yeah, I would come back. But, I really would have been happier getting a 5-star experience from Sushi-Gen because that's what 1000+ reviews led me to believe. But, lesson learned. The service was rather rushed and, though understandably so, I would have preferred a personalized experience, rather than an efficient robot. I wasn't impressed with the sunomono salad. But the miso soup and tofu were surprising standouts. The tofu was infused with strong flavor, which is rather rare. The miso was clear, with a subtle hint of flavor - exactly the way it should be. The Sashimi Lunch (still $15) itself looked rather impressive. But, the flavors just don't match up to the presentation or the hype. I really only enjoyed the tuna tartare and the halibut; though, the fatty tuna was an interestingly new experience. Not sure if I would order it anywhere else though. In the end, I was underwhelmed and, after spending $33, I was craving Shoboo Kitchen's generous $30 Sashimi Coombination A. Too bad for Sushi-Gen and their paid parking ($2 with validation for the first 2 hours).

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the trip when you're in DTLA. Decent prices and service are a rare combination here. Best advice, so show up early before noon to avoid the wait and come hungry.

Reviews.Author: Johnson N.
Reviews.Content: The sushi here is spectacular.  The presentation is eye-catching, the flavor is top notch, and the freshness is hard to match anywhere.Some favorites of ours during our visit, if you're willing to spend a little, is the Toro and Otoro (if they happen to have any).  These items are rather pricey when ordered as sashimi, but they are very much worth it.  Looking around, the dining room felt somewhat cramped, with just enough space between you and other customers to not feel entirely intrusive to each other's conversations.  The wait staff was good, though my water was left empty for much of the night.Overall 4 Stars.  If not for the water and somewhat tighter quarters, it would have most definitely won the 5.

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: Favorite sushi place. I've been coming here for as long as i can remember. My grandpa was absolutely in love with this place and really only comes here for sashimi. Closest he's found to the real thing having spent most of his youth in japanese occupied taiwan and having traveled to japan several times. My best memories from childhood are the journeys we had to take to travel from the valley to this place to get here at lunch opening. First ones in line all the time!! I still come here but since my grandpa's passing not as often as we use to. The place basically your typical sushi place. They have a couple tatami rooms for the more "authentic feel" its the ones with the hole for your legs...those make me giggle. I've always gotten the Sashimi plate. I don't know what its called my grandma usually order in japanese, but its the freshest fish I've gotten. Really good quality and a good portion. Comes with miso soup, rice, and pickled cucumbers. Never ventured farther than that. Never needed to. It's always busy. Especially at lunch hour on any weekday (hence, the lining up). The people are very nice but they are always so busy.  Really nice, made us happy :)I would love this place even if the food sucked. But it doesn't. so go! and enjoy! you'll make the gramps happy :)

Reviews.Author: Safford B.
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to LA, my wife and I came here twice: first for dinner, and then a few days later for lunch. We did this not because there isn't good sushi at home in Denver, but because we've never seen good sushi this cheap!The definite winner of both trips was the sashimi deluxe platter. It has a great sampling of sashimi and other delicious morsels (e.g. tuna and salmon tartare).The red snapper off the ala carte menu was probably our favorite.The wait can be pretty brutal at dinner, so definitely call ahead for reservations if you can.

Reviews.Author: Alice L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen has been a family favorite for years. My dad's been going here for over 15-20 years. The quality is still the same. Superb quality that is. The fish is always fresh and you always know you'll get the highest quality food for the most reasonable price. Having gone to japan a handful of times, i would definitely say that its comparable to real, honest, traditional Japanese food. It's rare to come by these days.  If you eat at the bar, prepare to eat omakase style which'll run you about $120 a head. But if you eat at the table, i'd recommend getting a sashimi dinner and order additional sushi on the side. My favorite is definitely the yellowtail. Can't wait to go back.NOTE:  MAKE A RESERVATION!

Reviews.Author: Kaylie D.
Reviews.Content: love this place! It delivers every time! Went here for V-day and they were prompt and on time. Really appreciate them honoring the reservation policy. Fresh sushi, no bs crazy rolls and great service. Wham-bam thank you ma'am, favorite sushi place in downtown.

Reviews.Author: Julia W.
Reviews.Content: The place is always crowded. Just accept that it is and be done with it. The line goes out the door, especially during lunch, since this place has amazing lunch deals. That said, if you're going for pure sushi, the wait'll be significantly shorter to sit at the bar.Very fresh foods. The chefs are more than happy to tell you the recommended fishes that day.Quality matches the prices, so expect to spend a bit more. :Validated parking. Drop by the bakery, Frances, next door on the way out. :)

Reviews.Author: Samira M.
Reviews.Content: Adding this to my list of good dinner places in parts of LA that I don't frequent. Ended up downtown early for a concert - decided to head to Little Tokyo for some grub. Since it was already after 9 pm, only a 4 minute wait for a table. Got the yellowtail belly, the freshwater eel, the scallop sushi  - plus some crab sunomono, some veggie tempura and cucumber rolls. Everything was very good - the scallop sushi was just divine. That slighty sweet and fresh taste that great scallop sushi has. YUM! The cucumber rolls were the most authentic cucumber rolls I've had in North America - with that great wasabi kick. Not many places put wasabi in their cucumber rolls. We came in with no expections (despite the raves Sushi-Gen gets) and got a great dinner. The price was okay - about  $60 with tax and tip - not supercheap sushi, but the quality was good. Not OMG, eyes-rolling-back-in-my-head Azami good - but good. Definitely worth another trip!

Reviews.Author: Darin L.
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of Sushi-Gen for some time now. It was actually one of the first sushi places I was introduced to when I moved to LA.There are a number of directions you can go here. Their combinations are quite good, and I think their chicken teriyaki is some of the best. It comes with a serving of miso soup, sunomono, rice, and either sashimi or tempura. A pretty full meal for about $20.However, you can also go with their sushi or sashimi combinations. These come with soup, sunomono, tempura, and a selection of various sashimi/sushi, of the same quality as you would get a la carte.Personally, when I want to treat myself, I'll just order off the a la carte sushi menu and just pick out exactly what I want. The sushi is as good as any that you'll get in Little Tokyo, and I think it's pretty much as high of quality as you'll get for the price.I do enjoy sitting a the sushi bar, but similar to other sushi joints, you can only order sushi there - small drawback. If you know you're just gonna get sushi, go for the sushi bar (the wait is usually shorter there too). If you want to try out the combinations, you'll have to wait for a table (which can be quite long at times).Parking in the Honda plaza is $2.50 if validated. Street parking is ample with a decent walk.

Reviews.Author: Matthew R.
Reviews.Content: Freshest fish this side of the water! Oh man, I think this is the best sushi I've ever had. I sat @ the bar, which has a four order per person minimum and does not have the full dinner menu available, but who needs it when you have sushi this good. The presentation is somewhat pedestrian, but the friendly sushi chef's are very personable and entertaining. It's a bit pricey, but not the priciest out there. I spent about $100 per person, and that was with only two alcoholic drinks per person. The Japanese Red Snapper was something I will always remember! There are a few parking spaces in the plaza, otherwise, park down the street at the Little Tokyo Plaza parking (about $4).

Reviews.Author: Bobby B.
Reviews.Content: Jackie B is spot on; I do love this place.  Came here every week with my mom several years ago.  My god...I've had almost evey item on the menu.  I must say everything I've had tasted freshly killed.My favorite dishs are pretty simple: salmon collar (speaks for itself), tempura (not too much batter, not at all greasy), and toro sashimi.TIP: If you really want to know the quality of your sushi, take a look at the restaurant's toro.  Is it marbled?  Is it red?I can't say much else about how great this place is because the SUPER LONG wait does the talking.

Reviews.Author: Imran H.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best sushi in the area. Just hit the Deluxe button and call it it day. Wow. Lawd. So good. Going back now.

Reviews.Author: Youbi K.
Reviews.Content: Two words. Very. Fresh! We had to wait in line for 1 hour but it was worth the fresh, fresh sushi !

Reviews.Author: doug m.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice and haven't been dissapointed yet.I went this last weekend, around 9 on a saturday. The line seemed daunting and the host told us it was a 45minute wait. We decided to stay and were seated in 10minutes.The albicore was like butter, really, it seemed to just melt in your mouth. It aint cheap, but its not super expensive either, and for the quality its well worth it.

Reviews.Author: JS P.
Reviews.Content: When it comes to sushi, I'm not into trendy a la trendy.  Just give me good, fresh fish.  Sushi-Gen is perfect for that.  It's quality.I order the Sashimi Deluxe platter and it had absolutely everything I could possibly want - the sides of tempura, it had tuna, eel, albacore, squid, salmon - it was like a bottomless pit of sushi, so much so that I couldn't finish.  The price is def. right - I had sake & the deluxe platter for $30, with food to spare.  if you're all about the food - this place is great.  Expect a short wait, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Dean Y.
