Reviews.Content: Good place to have sushi in LA.  The lunch specials are much better.  Dinner is pricey so- bang for the buck is lunch time.  But it gets really crowded from all the workers from downtown so avoid 12-1pm.  Better to go early or after 1pm.The fish is fresh - and the quality is very good.  The place is great for drinking and socializing with the sushi chef.  The place is not quiet so don't come here if you mind chatter.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: i don't really understand that kumi said "tourist" trap as I rarely see tourists here, however, I am sure that the 200+ reviews on yelp do make it quite a popular place. I consider a tourist trap to be something lame and gross like. Joe's crabshack. Ok. anyways. I really like Sushi gen. The fish was very fresh. Ok, it was f*in delicious. My favorites were the uni, albacore and the snapper. Oh and the natto roll. Ya, ya roll your eyes at me! I was 100% satisfied with the meal I had at the gen and will gladly go back any day. Except maybe a weekend when it takes forever to get in.

Reviews.Author: Frank Q.
Reviews.Content: Pretty damn awesome every thing we ordered was tiny but very delicioso in my mouth. I did have to much sake and ended up throwing my chopsticks since I was using them as drumsticks and hit the tallest asian dude ever who just looked at me and said something that I did not understand, I apologized and said sorry but I am kinda drunk and may I please have my chopstick back he did not give them back as he also did not understand me. Good times where had by all and I would definitely go back and try to hold on my chopsticks. ( why are they called chopsticks if you don't chop) why can't they be called eating sticks.

Reviews.Author: Yuko K.
Reviews.Content: Hands down 5 stars.My mom was visiting from Michigan, and I took her here on a Monday night for a sushi dinner. It was about 6 pm, and luckily we were one of the last ones to be seated at the sushi bar.We first ordered toro and it was to die for! It just melted in my mouth...oh soooo good. Another highlight was the engawa sashimi. Engawa is the fin area of a halibut. You must try this! Best sashimi I've ever had.We had a decent amount to eat and our bill came out to be $90 for two people. Sorta pricey, but definitely worth it if you're a sushi lover!

Reviews.Author: Arisa W.
Reviews.Content: This place is really as good as it gets. I had Chirashi, and it was PERFECT. Really, the freshness, the texture, the flavor, and the presentations were PERFECT.I must mention their sushi rice, because if there's an utopia, the sushi rice would be Sushi-Gen's rice. It is light, fluffy, with perfect amount of salt & vinegar.Did I mention, everything is perfect?

Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: Went back on a Tue or Wed night.  Not much of a wait.  Chirashi was excellent.  Waitress was great, in fact, she shared a hot tip.  She said that you can ask for extra rice in the chirashi and they don't charge you.  However, less than a few minutes after having our beer and finishing our meal, we were asked politely to leave by the host, b/c a party had been waiting for 30 min.  Way sub par for a Japanese restaurant, which are generally known to have above and beyond customer service.  It sucks for 3 people to spend $120 and be asked to leave early.

Reviews.Author: robert s.
Reviews.Content: I went to this restaurant during lunch rush and was lucky enough to get an immediate at the sushi bar.  I ordered uni, saba, hamachi, and a couple of Spanish mackerel and it came to be about $60 with a small Asahi beer.  I loved the quality of the sushi but the prices are a bit high.  The service was not very attentive as I was low on water and no on filled it and I had a hard time to place an order of beer till the sushi saw that I needed something and yelled for my beer.I would definitely go back but since I know Komasa is right down the street and excellent quality sushi too and cheaper; I think I will stick my preferred of Komasa (smaller and smells like tempura).

Reviews.Author: Jeannie H.
Reviews.Content: One of my friends from Japan recommended this place to me and I didn't hesitate.  I'm really not "in the know" when it comes to Little Tokyo but after having sampled multiple places, this is definitely one of the best ones.The wait was long.....really long.  After 1.5 hours of loitering, we were finally seated at the bar (only choice since I always opt for omakase) and was completely ravenous.  This is one of those places where they are purists.  Great fish, good rice, and no fuss.  The chef who was serving us had a little bit of a sense of humour.  A couple sitting next to us looked at him to place another order and the response was "More salmon?"  I don't think the couple knew they were being mocked.  It's one of those moments when they should have enforced the "soup nazi" attitude.  If you don't know how to order, you should get kicked off the bar area.  I will definitely be back but will try to avoid peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Edgie T.
Reviews.Content: FRESH, FRESH, FRESH! Best Sashimi combination I've had for lunch. WHAT TO EXPECT-Long line before opening so be sure to arrive 10 to 15 minutes early-Fresh and delicious sushi, hands down-Reasonable prices PARKING-lot for a fee $2-$3This hole in the wall gets packed on weekdays.  Fast and quick service once seated, wide sushi selection and basic roll selection.  Definitely recommend this place if you appreciate fresh raw fish!

Reviews.Author: Becky A.
Reviews.Content: Where to begin where to begin....First of all be warned that without a reservation it's impossible to eat here. (but we got lucky and got a sushi bar)The place is packed and buzzin with activity but it's so small!!! =( I felt so cramped and claustiphobicky sitting next to someone that I dont know and paranoid ill elbow him in the face while I eat... ):This isn't your usual sushi joint where they give you a piece of paper and you order off of there... No you have to flag down the sushi chef and do a mass order of sushi/sashimi to keep you going while you order more while stuffing your face.Think of the wait at a sushi bar like this... *the bar at a club* (I swear it's like when you go clubbing - you gotta flag down the bartender and wait and wait for them to come around to you ahah)Why -1 stars? -1 star for the cramped sushi bar (i wasn't in my comfort zone. the person next to me was in my comfort bubble ahah)Why +4 stars?+1 star for the friendly staff+1 star for the fresh sushi+1 star for the service+1 star for the atmosphere (:But all in all the sushi was delicious and very fresh. Our sushi chef was awesome~. And~ came out with a full stomach and very satisfied (:

Reviews.Author: Tony D.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a wait into the world of sushi awesomeness.Food:The sushi here is probably the freshest I've had in a long time. The sashimi is what I go for and the consistency and taste just can not be beat. It may be pricy to some people, but that's what you pay for if you want some high quality stuff. Just try it out and you'll see.Service:They try really hard here. I appreciate it. It's crowded and stuff all the time and they really try. Once inside and seated, they will try to get your order ASAP. I appreciate their efforts a lot in such a stressful environment.Environment/Location:Location is a tough call because you have to pay for parking unless validated. It's also in a VERY small plaza so be careful about time if you are thinking you will park fast. Wait times are so long here, too, so again you don't want to come here for a quick lunch if that's what you are planning. Inside is pretty crammed and small, and tables don't accomodate more than 4 people, so don't come here with a large group.Overall: 4/5I'm a fan of this place for their excellent sushi, but not a fan of their parking and tiny seating area.

Reviews.Author: Ed K.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi place, probably one of the best moderately priced sushi houses in LA.I came here for my birthday dinner with a group of friends and once we got over the wait for a slow moving dinner group that wouldn't clear their table, dinner was on!We proceeded to start off with drinks that included a couple bottles of Sayuri unfiltered sweet sake and then ordered a round of various appetizers and sushi/sashimi combos.Among the appetizers my favorites included the monkfish liver w/ ponzu and salmon skin salad, although the whitefish w/ ponzu sauce was notable as well.There were at least 1 sushi set and 2 sashimi sets that basically went around to everyone at the table. As mentioned before, compared to more upscale sushi places like Sasabune, K-zo, Matsuhisa, there is less flair in the presentation and style, but then again, you don't have to pay for that extra premium either.Fish cuts were delicious and fresh while presented very straightfoward and traditional.  All the enjoyment without the frills and frippery. Sushi-Gen is quite popular and even tho we had a reservation, because 1 or 2 in the party were running late, we still had to wait a while for our table.  If you plan on going and not sit at the bar, definitely call ahead of time.  Although not as small as my other Little Tokyo favorite, Hama Sushi, this place will fill up fast on a busy night.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the lunch alone. Sure it's packed. Busy. Cramped. It is worth it. Fish is fresh. Service is nice and swift. The lunch special has so much much. It's kind of ridiculous. Basically like most reviews state, there's about a 20-30 minute wait, but you get your food fast and you are literally done a little over an hour. Parking is validated for a few bucks and can be a pain, but there are places close by to park and if you have time, just walk around. I love the consistency of this place. Never had a bad meal yet.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa V.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sushi!  My friend and I sat a the Sushi Bar and it was fun getting random sushi.  Our order came out to $100 for the two of us for roughly 6 different types of sushi. Pricey, but delicious.

Reviews.Author: Bob Q.
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot about this place but never had a chance to go until recently..Went on a Friday at around 1 and it was packed as expected but after only about 15 minutes my party of 3 got seats at the sushi bar. *Make sure that if you put your name down that you and your ENTIRE PARTY are very close by because if not the host will go onto the next group with the quickness*My only complaint about this place was that although I can definitely discern quality and freshness when it comes to sushi, I do not have a connoisseur's knowledge in terms of variety and therefore I know I  missed out on a lot -  although I specifically asked the chef what was good, the ONLY recommendations he gave me were amberjack and toro and the rest I had to ask for. I thought it was pretty odd given that every other sushi spot I've ever been to the chefs try to get you to eat everything on the menu.. oh well.The quality is undoubtedly top notch but it's not the only place you can get fresh fish.

Reviews.Author: Amit S.
Reviews.Content: This is most definitely my favorite sushi spot.  This place doesn't have the atmosphere of those trendy "sushi" places, but there is a reason why you will always wait for a table even with a reservation and you are excited when you're name is finally called.Hands down the best Sashimi and Uni I have tried, even the chicken teriyaki is well done.  I do not recall seeing the Americanized rolls here, which to me is all presentation and nothing special.This place is not cheap.  Night out for two typically sets me back close to $150-175, depending on how much I drink.Absolutely make a reservation here.

Reviews.Author: Yum E.
Reviews.Content: Sushi was good but not the best.Presentation was a bit blah.  I kept looking up to see if it was some non japanese chef that made my sushi cuz it was sloppy presentation.  I think I've gotten spoiled at other location so it's hard not to compare.

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite sushi bar in LA. The quality of the fish is to die for.  We usually sit at the bar and order omakase and we are never sorry. You will only find traditional sushi here and its well worth the wait. Service is always friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Zach R.
Reviews.Content: There is a reason no other sushi spot in Cali has more reviews and the high ratings that back it!  Sushi Gen is worth the 45 minute to 1 hour + wait on a Saturday night.  By the way even though they close at 10pm i saw people being seated after 945pm and when we left at 1030 the place was still 2/3rds full, so they do not rush you out of there if you are trying to grab a late table!  The quality and quantity of the sushi/sashimi definitely is not inline with the prices, they really could get away with charging a lot more and it would easily be justified.  Never a miss here and always a packed house with people eagerly waiting outside for their chance to experience sushi heaven for an hour or two.  Service is super fast on the sushi side but hot dishes take a bit longer which would be my only complaint if you made me find one; we got our tempura order after we had already finished both chirashi and sushi deluxe dinner orders.  See you again soon old friend!

Reviews.Author: Claire P.
Reviews.Content: If you like Blue fin tuna and if you are in the mood for a truly enjoyable dining experience Sushi Gen will not let you down. No wonder their ratings are so high! Love you Sushi Gen! ^_^

Reviews.Author: Jenn M.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi lunch. Get it. Don't be late to the line.

Reviews.Author: Pat A.
Reviews.Content: I had the sashimi lunch special thats much-heralded. Toro, squid, tuna, salmon, octopus, yellowtail, and equivalents of a beef tartare making a tuna and also spicy tuna version. So effing good!Complemented by the miso soup, tofu, and rice bowl. For $15 bucks is a steal. I was full at the end of this meal, no doubt.This was my first go at sashimi. I was nervous to be honest, having colitis, and not knowing how my body would take to it. But did am I ever glad I made the right decision! Everyone says its melt in your mouth good and they aren't kidding! Was like jello man! Never had anything like it. Now that they've turned me onto sashmimi, other places have the duty of meeting or exceeding the bar of eating high quality seafood.Only downside was our 40 minute wait. Place gets crazy packed. Got there around 11:20AM and got seated around 12 noon.Tip: Have the place validate your parking to reduce to $2 dollar charge at the gate.

Reviews.Author: Fifi L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen sushi is fresh, no frills and the service is great.  You definitely get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Author: Toby N.
Reviews.Content: If you are sucker for Uni they have an Uni dinner a box full of Uni and complemented with a Sashimi dish.  Updating now we went for Jo's birthday din-din in June.  Wendy and I ended our "serchin for Urchin" expedition!

Reviews.Author: Mag L.
Reviews.Content: I didn't try the sushi bar as it would be very expensive. I ordered 2 sushi sets, tempura and scallop, salmon and egg sushi. The portion of the sushi set is huge. Quality is fine.

Reviews.Author: Ben M.
Reviews.Content: When you walk into a sushi restaurant and there is no price on the menu, you know you are in a   place that takes their fish seriously.  I've eaten at a lot of sushi restaurants and while I don't consider myself a sushi elitist or an expert, I do know what good sushi taste like and I can safely say that Sushi-Gen has the best sushi that I've have ever eaten.  Coming from me that is a pretty damn good testament to the quality of the fish.  I ordered all nigiri pieces and actually felt bad for ordering the spicy tuna roll in addition because I felt that I completely disrespected the sushi chef and the restaurant for ordering a "non-traditional" menu item.  Here is what I had and each piece was phenomenal with absolutely no fishy taste to it whatsoever.1) Toro2) Halibut3) Japanese Mackerel4) Yellowfin Belly5) Spicy Tuna6) Baby Yellowfin7) AhiI loved each piece that I had and can't really say which was my favorite because they all had different qualities.  But what I do know is that biting into those pieces was just as good as great sex, in fact it may have been better.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: So many raves about this place already.. so .. I'll just sum it up in one word...DITTO!

Reviews.Author: Momo K.
Reviews.Content: I'm definately not a sushi buff as this was the first time I've had sushi anywhere sitting at the sushi bar.  But in my humble opinion, which goes along with everyone else's, the sushi was soo good!!!  Had the red snapper which was flavored with a squeeze of lemon, halibut flavored with ponzu, maguro (tuna), Japanese mackeral, buttery salmon, ama ebi with the head cooked in miso soup, albacore with ponzu, and lastly yellowtail.  All of the cuts of fish were very fresh and every sushi piece was so pleasing to the tastes.  My tastebuds have been pleasantly spoiled.  Now that I've had Sushi-Gen, it's going to be hard going to other "regular, fast-food" sushi place.  Still thinking about Sushi-Gen's sushi.....omg, I want to go back already...

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline T.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of sushi and we ended up at Sushi-Gen after many family friends who recommended this restaurant.  After passing by this restaurant mayn times on the way to Curry House, I had this image in my head that it was a grudgy, hole-in-the-wall Japanese restaurant.  Little did I know, it was a remodeled location with fantastic servicce.  My boyfriend and I came here for our Valentine's Day dinner and it was packed!  We had a choice of the bar or a table.  If we chose to sit at the bar, we had to order 4 dishes minimum and we weren't allowed to order a dinner combination.  Since we didn't like to held back from conditions, we decided to wait for a table.  We walked around J-town and visited the local Japanese market and bought some goodies.Once we got seated, I had my eye on the Freshwater Eel combination that came with sashimi or tempura.  My dish cost $23.  My boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki combination with tempura.  His dish cost $24 or $25.  He also ordered spicy tuna roll.  After looking around the whole restaurant, I had a sinking feeling that our food would take ages to arrive.  Little did I know, the food came within 10 minutes.  I was satisfied!  The sashimi was super fresh.  From the spicy tuna roll to the freshwater eel, it was mouth watering.  I would come back to Sushi-Gen again but only for special occasions because the bill can be muy expensivo.

Reviews.Author: Chris N.
Reviews.Content: Since moving to LA, I haven't found a better sushi place.  This place has super fresh fish and their rice is perfectly made.  I've sat at the tables once, and the experience pales in comparrison to eating at the bar.  You are not going to find fancy rolls at this place.  Sushi Gen is about pure sushi done perfectly.  I've been here at least 10 times and have never had a bad piece of fish.  And despite having eaten more than my fair share of sushi, I'm always a little intimidated when I go here.  I'm afraid of being laughed at for ordering something that offends the sushi gods and afraid of being laughed at by the sushi chefs.  But I'm sure I'm just being paranoid because the sushi chefs all seem like really happy, easy going guys.  They always look at me as if they recognize me and are welcoming me back.  I wish I could afford to go here more.  I want to know all these guys by name and have the guts to buy them all beer or sake.  If you are planning to go here, be prepared for a wait.  I actually try to go here by myself because it means I get seated faster at the sushi bar.  But if you have two or more, waits are often 30 mins plus.Others seem to like the place for their fabulous chirasi lunch special.  So getting a table is really hard at lunch time.I love this place!!!

Reviews.Author: Lah G.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I've had in LA.  I've never been to the higher-end sushi places, so I'm sure I have yet to have the best available.  But I've never liked scallops in my life until someone convinced me to eat scallop sushi here. The wait sucks and the portions can be a bit on the small side, but if you are patient, you will be pleased.

Reviews.Author: Gil K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi quality is prime. Fatty tuna, albacore, all good. I went here with another person and we got the seafood salad and deluxe sashimi plate. So much sashimi for ~$35 bucks. The seafood salad was very standard and nothing special really stood out there. The sashimi was so good that I recommend it to anyone that is a sashimi lover.3 stars because it was $75 after tip for deluxe sashimi and seafood salad (no alcohol). That's pretty steep for the whole experience. This review might be affected by my date. Was not a stimulating conversation so might have a little bias on this review.Pros:you're going to get quality sushicons:price

Reviews.Author: Charles H.
Reviews.Content: I walked out of the restaurant and had a feeling of deja vu.  It's one of those weird moment.  You felt like you had ate at this restaurant a long time ago (I think I probably had a while back).  I decided to pick the Omakase cause I was having a long day.  Only the live scallop stand out in my mind, cuz my eyes were fixate on the "regular special" next table to me.  I am not saying the chef serving me is not good, it just doesn't feel as good as the people sitting next to me, plus the drunk couple on the other side of me bring down the experience.  I had a hard time trying to talk to the chef cuz they are consistently busy prepping the next course.  I guess next time I will sit at the table and get a better value out of a set course.  =p

Reviews.Author: Donny T.
Reviews.Content: I have never been there for dinner, but I go there sometime for lunch on my day off.    We always try to get there before 1130 because the line for lunch is loooong.  People start waiting in line at around 11.   The opening of the restaurant is just like the scene of Best But after thanksgiving (just kidding)   My buddies and I always order the same thing.....sashimi lunch special.  Just take a look at those pics ....you'll understand why I would wait in line before the restaurant opens =)I'd like to try the dinner someday.

Reviews.Author: Caroline W.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving Sushi-Gen a 3.5I found out about this place through yelp. A friend and I eat lunch often in downtown LA, and we've been wanting to try this place. The reason why we did not try this place sooner was because some reviewers complained of the wait. Today, we ended up going anyway for lunch. When we got there at 12:45PM, the waitress had seats for three in both the bar and table area. The server was friendly and service was quick.I ordered the sushi deluxe combination. My friend ordered the salmon terikyaki. Overall, the fish was fresh and the food was good, but not as spectacular as I thought it would be. Perhaps, we ordered the wrong dishes. Or maybe our expectations were too high because of all the hype on yelp. I might go back and try something different.Good sushi, but for $21, I didn't expect anything less.

Reviews.Author: Yo M.
Reviews.Content: So far so good. That was definitely the best sushi I've had in Los Angeles by far.OK OK, I ordered the (don't laugh) chicken terryaki and a couple of pieces of salmon nigiri. Don't be fooled by the dollar signs in this profile. It was well worth it.The great:The sashimi that came with it was AWESOME! Large chunks of yellow tail and tuna that was choice!The good:Value. great value for the price.The bad:The fact that I didn't ask for recommendations from the server. Turns out I would've been even happier if I had ordere the Sashimi deluxe. Wow! What a beautiful looking dish!When I go back, that's what I'll definitely order.-cheers

Reviews.Author: Vanessa H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent sushi. The lunch special is a great deal (full sashimi plate for $15) but as others have mentioned, if you don't time it right you can end up waiting a LONG time. I've also come here for dinner and would come here every week if I could afford it. Dinner is significantly more expensive than lunch.I highly recommend the uni as it is the best I've ever had. Other good ones:- toro (melts in your moth!)- unagi- sweet shrimp (with the heads fried)- hamachi belly- blue fin tunaMinus one star because there is a weird fish smell when you walk in. I don't know what it is, but usually it stops bothering me after a few minutes.

Reviews.Author: Jen Y.
Reviews.Content: Male Host = Stinking attitude.Female Host = Better attitude.Wait staff = Excellent service.Sashimi Deluxe = Yum yum til I puke.  Not very particular about the slimy squid with a starchy texture.Oysters = Not worth the $25+ for five.Overall, Sushi Gen and Komasa are comparable.  However, Sushi Gen has a greater selection of sashimi (Deluxe).  Sushi Gen gets 4 out of 5 stars thanks to the male host's stinking attitude about seating requirements on a Saturday night at 8:30 p.m. when it wasn't even packed.  Apparently it's their policy to have the entire party present before being seated.  We had a party of 4 and although half of us were there, we were ready to order for the entire party as the other 2 were sitting in the car, waiting in line on 2nd street to bypass the slow security guard as we entered into the parking lot.  Bottom line, it's a bad policy to have the entire party present, especially if it wasn't busy.   It hinders the quick turnaround of tables, which results in more revenue.  After ordering, it takes a while for the sushi chefs to prepare and serve anyway.  Boo!

Reviews.Author: isabel l.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an authentic sushi restaurant, then Sushi-Gen is the place to go (even if it is located in Little Tokyo).  The fish quality is extremely fresh. For example, i am not a typical fan at squid or octopus; however, i was in love.  This was my first experience here, and i only ordered the Sashimi Deluxe since i heard that the price is worth the amount of food given.I went there during lunch time, and their sashimi deluxe was only $30, which included: Tuna, Salmon, Yellowtail, Toro, Albacore, Spicy Tuna, Grilled Salmon, Squid, Octopus, Tamago, and a few other items i was unsure about.  The quantity was huge and the quality was superb all for just $30 :)We also ordered their oysters as appetizers which of course, was perfect in size and taste.Overall, i had a great experience and would definitely go again!

Reviews.Author: Alice H.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm!!  Went here for dinner.  Decided to sit at the sushi bar.  Chefs and service was really fast.  Seating for sushi bar is generally much faster than table seating.The sushis served here is really fresh and well prepared.  Definitely worth it.  I had all sorts of sushi, even ones I wouldn't normally order.  Surprisingly none of the unusuals grossed me out because they were THAT fresh!  If you are ever in LA's J-town district, try this place out.  There's also this really neat bar a couple doors down called Bar-C.  Waitresses there are really friendly and have the cutesy outfit on.  ;)

Reviews.Author: Danielle D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sushi and sashimi, and I always love their tea. Plenty of food, a little expensive but totally worth it for the super-fresh fish. We brought a sushi neophyte with us the last time we were there and got a bunch of dinner specials and he was able to sample everything from octopus to roe. Reservations encouraged in the evenings- it gets busy around 7 or so.

Reviews.Author: Erica L.
Reviews.Content: If you're a huge "sushi connoisseur" like I am then I highly recommend going to Sushi Gen!!  This lovely place is located in the heart of Little Tokyo, Los Angeles.  This place has authentic sushi that simply melts within contact with your mouth!!!  The restaurant also has a very intimate ambiance....perfect for dates!  I highly recommend getting their sashimi and eel avocado roll!!  However, keep in mind that this place doesn't have much selection for those that do not eat raw fish, cause this is legitimate sushi only!!!  Also, this place is a little pricey for the average college student.  Prices aren't listed on the menu, but I spent around $30 eating there.  In addition, most of the menu is in Japanese, so if you don't really understand what's in the dish, just ask the super-friendly waiters.  If you go, remember to get there early.  The place gets pretty packed around dinnertime.  All in all, if you want pretty high quality sushi that is slightly pricey, check Sushi Gen out!  What I also like is the fact that their IS free parking!  So, sushi fans in Los Angeles or visitors, check out Sushi Gen!!  I guarantee you'll like it!

Reviews.Author: Mira C.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and sweet since I'm sure everyone has said all there is to say:I came here with the bf, and ordered omakase.  Absolutely amazing and probably the best sushi experience ever.  Everything was so fresh!  Even stuff that I didn't normally like (ankimo and uni) I fell in love with because it was all that fresh.  Yes, it's expensive but you can't beat the quality.  $170 for two people, omakase, and a bottle of sake.  Can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: A great little sushi dinner was had here-- Sashimi Deluxe on my end, and Sushi Deluxe for the lady.  In summation:  Portions are fantastic, the fish is fresh, and service was excellent.  Price is also definitely a great value.I've been told that the waits here can be horrendous, but we were lucky and got seated right away.Our server was very quick, and was helpful with suggestions regarding the menu.  She was very attentive, despite a very crowded and full restaurant.  The chefs were all quick and skilled from what I saw.  Our dinners arrived-- the lady's sushi deluxe platter looked wonderful, and the Sashimi Deluxe platter was loaded with at least 10 different varieties of fish.  Do try to come early, since by the time we left, the line was completely and utterly full.  That said, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: ERIK E.
Reviews.Content: Located in Little Tokyo, Sushi-Gen is considered a more "traditional" sushi restaurant. I've only been there a few times now, and each time the dining experience has been excellent. The fish is fresh and delicious, and you're not going to break the bank. Make reservations on peak nights.

Reviews.Author: C W.
Reviews.Content: Five stars all the way.  Whether you order a la carte at the sushi bar or boxed lunches at the tables, their food is just awesome.  For lunch, I love their sashimi lunch.  Its a full late of delicious fresh sashimi and cooked/grilled salmon that would just make your taste buds sing.  the sashimi just melts in your mouth!  The steamed tofu in light soy that comes before the meal is also very delightful.  For dinner, sushi bar is great!One draw back though, the place does get very packed during lunch time even during the week so give yourself extra time b/c the wait for a table may be up to an hour (I waited 1.5 hr once during lunch).  However, the food is well worth the wait if you are not in a rush.

Reviews.Author: Renny C.
Reviews.Content: In our desperate search for a sushi fix coupled with a spendthrift attitude, my friend and I trekked all the way to West Hollywood in hopes to try our virgin tongues at Wa Sushi only to find in our disbelief--it is closed on Mondays. And lunch hours are non-existent.So the idea came to mind: Hey, we've never had omakase at Sushi-Gen! So with the plan in mind, we set off into our journey for spectacular sushi in J-town. Dealt with the usual crowd that looms outside of their doors, we waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated at the sushi bar located far into the restaurant near the restroom (I was tipped off by a third party sushi chef that it is the better seat, I cross my fingers). Let me just start off by saying that I appreciate sushi creations by quality and use of variety of modifications to deliver a punch that would resound with a CHO-OISHIIiiii (Very tasty). That may sound like more of a fusion taste, but whatever it is, I was expecting to see some exotic mixtures of fish and unfamiliar tastes.With that said, we were greeted with an appetizing bowl of muzuku with nagaimo, had no idea what it was but it was a welcome change. It was quite slimy but I didn't mind, though I can tell there would be some that would not be able to appreciate it. Then came the barrage of sushi that I'm more familiar with--kanpachi, tuna, uni, aji, hirame, giant clam, etc. All VERY fresh and good, but it was lacking in one department... and that is taste. Not to mention the cuts were a little shy compared to what I am used to, but that is besides the point.The snapper topped with the green sauce (wish I knew what it was, lol) was delicious and is totally what I'm looking for in sushi. Sushi that deserves to be eaten without the aid of wasabi and soy sauce. Sushi that makes you see colors the first time it pairs with your tongue and shifts colors in the mating duration. Honorable mention would have to go to the monkfish liver sushi, first time having it and despite the fact I don't like liver anything, it was surprisingly good! Good job! Got a serving of anago and in my previous experience, anago has always been on the dryer/bland side so I was a bit scared. To my surprise, I liked it! Not bad :)Otherwise, I craved a little more flavor. I craved a little more sauce on each bit (or any sauce for that matter). I tasted quality, which was quite apparent when Sushi-Gen is full house everyday, inventory definitely does not have a chance to become "un-quality." I should of ordered the oyster shooter with the quail egg and a mixture of other unobserved ingredients, big regret. Otherwise, good dining experience!Omakase for 2 came out to be $189 pre-tip, which sorted out to be a little over a bill a head. Would I come back for omakase or regular dine in? Hmm... probably not. Sorry Sushi-Gen, but my heart is still partial to Toros in Alhambra.

Reviews.Author: Donna F.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi in Little Tokyo!Everything was pretty good and the sashimi portions(from what I remember) were very generous.In general, this place has great prices for good quality fish.

Reviews.Author: Ray C.
Reviews.Content: Not better than Sasabune, but right up there with it.Friends from the East Coast and Central America were visiting and craving some fish on the raw so I thought I'd take them to one of my favorite spots in LA.  If you don't know what to order here, just order the dinner specials.  If you know how to order Nigiri or Sashimi a la carte, by all means, knock yourself out.  You will not be disappointed by the freshness of the fish here.  Try the Toro - the best cuts in LA are here.Make reservations as this place usually has a wait (which is worth it).

Reviews.Author: Melissa L.
Reviews.Content: I came here last night and had an amazing dinner with my best friend :) We met up in Little Tokyo because it was the middle to where we both were at. Having no idea where to eat, we decided to yelp something closeby. There are ton's of sushi restaurants around this neighborhood so it's hard to pick one. Sushi-Gen came up as a familiar name and they had good reviews. It was obvious it was a good place when we walked over, the place was packed on a Wednesday night. We had to wait about 25 minutes to be seated.We started off with a few drinks, Sake & Soju. I'd never had Soju before and was tempted to order it and try it. I was very suprised at what it was, I was always under the impression that it was sweet, and more of a mixed drink. In my mind, I'd always thought it was a Korean Sangria or something lol. Boy was I wrong. It was pure alcohol on the rocks. Granted I drank it :P It grew on me. Reminded me of a vodka tonic with the wedge of lemon that was inside of it. We ordered a few things for dinner, Miso Soup of course :) I had the regular Tofu one, my friend had the Mushroom one (she said that one was a bit slimy with the mushroom). I was happy with my Miso, it was average.We ordered the Fried Eggplant and it was incredible. I'm a huge fan of eggplant and the flavors with the sauce where so delectable. We had an eel avocado roll & a spicy tuna roll, they were both very good. The fish was very fresh and the size of each cut roll where perfect. Bite size, not falling apart. Lastly but not least, we shared the Black Cod which was seared, unlike any fish I have ever tasted. It remind me of scallops. They made sure it was cooked with plenty of butter and each bite melted in my mouth.It's a small place and I'm not sure if they take reservations, but it was well worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of the best sushi places I've tried.  This place is a tad bit pricey and the wait can be a bitch if you come too late (heck... even when you come early!) but it's worth the price and the wait. The bf and I usually sit at the bar and our mouths are at the mercy of the chef (omakase!).  Excellent stuff.  Their salmon is so fatty it melts in your mouth. YUM!

Reviews.Author: Marcus L.
Reviews.Content: FRESH FRESH FRESH!Gen Sushi has the freshest fish in LA. They specialize in serving nigiri and sashimi, NO rolls. Three of us came here on a Saturday night and the wait was about 45 mins, which was definitely well worth it. We sat at the bar and just began naming off types of fishes we wanted - fatty tuna, hamachi, mackerel, uni and the list goes on. Every type of fish was very fresh and tasty. We also ordered the yellowtail head which came with a lot of meat and cooked very well. For 3 people (with beer and sake) the total was about $250. I consider this pretty cheap for the quality of food we received. Will come back for sure!!

Reviews.Author: Susana B.
Reviews.Content: So this is a review for my most recent visit during lunch and for the sashimi platter. Only get the sashimi platter if you're hard core about sashimi.  I like sashimi but I prefer to sit at the bar and have nigiri with sushi chef's dressings on it.  This was sashimi overload for me.  The fish is fresh, yummy and it is a very large portion for $15 but it was just too much for me.That's the only reason I am giving it a 4 star instead of a 5.  Sushi Gen's regular experience while sitting at the bar with the sushi chef always merits a 5 but leaves a pretty big hole in your wallet too..

Reviews.Author: Cono W.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT I LOVE IT~!!By far the best sushi restaurant i ever tried in LA!We sat in the sushi bar, everything is extremely fresh~live shrimp, uni, saba, salmon, tuna, and their ALBACORE!!!Melt in my mouth~ yum yum yum~!!Fried shrimp head, miso soup~Overall, the experience was excellent~!! even tho we waited more than an hour when we had reservation already, but the quality of the foods make it totally worth it~2 people spent around $140~!! very fair price~ cant wait to come back~!!

Reviews.Author: Esther L.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe a place like this exists!!!This is my FAV place for sushi.. next to sushi Zo.  Then again, I place sushi zo in it a totally different category of sushi.$21 for assorted sushi (which included a piece of toro @_@) salmon skin salad, miso soup, and some kind of mountain potatoe appetizer thing?  Ru freaking kidding me?!?! Every single piece melted in mouth like BUTTER.  Best toro I EVER had... I had to get another order which cost $10 but it was well worth it.I got there at lunchtime 20 min before they opened and there was already a long ass line outside.  So get there EARLY if u don't want to wait.I am officially addicted.  I love u sushi-gen!!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: 800+ reviews so doubt i can add anything new or insightful, but i will try...  and keep it short and sweet!- no frills, traditional japanese sushi- priced very reasonably- expect to wait to be seated, even if its just 15 min- the menu is not extensive beyond sushi...  some broiled fish collars (salmon, yellowtail) and a few teriyaki dishes are about it besides dead fish- the sushi menu itself is not extensive either...  no frills stuff, but they will make some things for you if its traditional sushi, i.e., negihama maki (yellowtail cut rolls) aren't on the menu but they obliged my request.as others have said, some of the freshest fish you will ever have.  the sashimi lunch, and even the sashimi deluxe, are true bargains...  you can easily pay 2x for the quanity and quality you get.  you may not get the variety of fish other places offer, but (1) you wont get the quality of Sushi Gen and (2) if you do get the quality, it will be double the price.  the other specials are great as well, i.e., think salmon collar, 7 pieces of sashimi, miso soup, rice, & tsukemono for $15...along with Komasa down the street, one of the top sushi restaurants in all of Los Angeles...

Reviews.Author: Malachi B.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for years.  Here's what you need to know : Expect :- To wait 20+ minutes to be seated- Top notch sushi in all ways, including: quality, preparation and selection- Much lighter wallet afterwards- Unparalleled authenticity- Pro serviceSome find the decor a bit modest, and the service is a bit overworked sometimes.  Neither of these detract from the unparalleled sushi experience I receive with each visit.  Well done Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Rina C.
Reviews.Content: yes! sashimi combination is the best!I love the variety.satisfy all my taste bud.sashimi, with marinated fish, spicy tuna and seaweed all in one plate.love italso ordered ankimo. it was ok. nothing special.

Reviews.Author: Clara K.
Reviews.Content: It was 12pm on a Tuesday when I ventured to this joint, and luckily I only had to wait 20 minutes to be seated for two.  We parked in the plaza's parking lot as it only cost $2 for two hours with validation.  So here's what we tried...Lunch beef teriyaki and sashimi combination:  This is what my lunch partner got.  The beef teriyaki was all right.  The sauce was too salty, but that seems to be a universal issue with teriyaki sauce, and not this beef teriyaki itself.  The sashimi came in this small bowl.  If you want to order this, do not expect a generous portion of sashimi as that is not what you'll get.  I posted a photo if you'd like to see for yourself, but it's hiding amongst the sea of photos other yelpers posted.Lunch sashimi deluxe combination ($15):  Any sashimi lover's dream.  I must say, the cuts were rather fresh, and there was a nice variety; however, I realized that I'm very very picky when it comes to the raw fish I like so I didn't finish my plate.  I'm still a novice when it comes to eating raw fish so my palate just needs to adapt to the taste.  Only two real problems with this dish:  the crab tasted weird (it had a chemical taste) and the grilled salmon was too salty.  Both lunch combinations were accompanied with a side of rice, miso soup, and warm sweet tofu.  Be tentative when you first bite into the tofu.  It's hot so make sure it's at the right temperature for you before you indulge.Albacore nigiri sushi ($5):  My favorite part of the meal as albacore is my favorite cut of fish!  Extremely fresh, and the cuts were fairly generous.Service was pretty kind.  Waitresses were sweet.  If you want servers to talk to you, you're a dummy as this place seems to be bustling with business.The naked total came out to $41.  Naked as in, without the tip.  For two lunch combinations, and one order of nigiri sushi, $41 is not too shabby at all.So why not a 5?  Sushi-Gen is just not worthy to me of the hour drive through traffic.

Reviews.Author: Valerie L.
Reviews.Content: Not like this place doesn't have enough 5 stars reviews. I'll tried it twice before writing this review so I know it is a consistent experience. The fish both times were fresh and delicious. We only do sushi so we had tuna, salmon, yellowtail, yellow tail belly, blue fin tuna, and sometimes albacore.  Everything was yummy. My favorite is the yellowtail belly. Please try it. I like the waitress with high pitch voice, for some reason that really added authenticity to my experience. She was very nice and quick about refilling drinks. I had no problem getting a seat at bar. Great experience. Will try to come back for more if I am in the area.

Reviews.Author: kent c.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I had the pleasure in trying out.. With 900+ reviews, I'll keep it short.Pros:- THe fish is like BUTTER-Incredible quality in freshness of all their fish (toro, salmon, red snapper, yellow tail) Probably one of the best sushi places I've had in Cali.. -Awesome experience if you sit at the sushi bar (very knowledgable sushi knives men)-The entree dinners are excellent,, They have a unique teriyaki sauce -Good serviceTips:-Large parties you will have to wait.. maybe quite a long time -Small parties 2-4 you will have to wait. SO get here early.-Sushi bar has a minium limit or 4 ordersVery very good sushi. TWO THUMBS UP!!

Reviews.Author: Hai B.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is pretty bomb when it comes to fresh sushi.  It's best to sit at the bar and order as you go.  The fish are fresh and delicious!  Among my favorites were the uni and monk fish liver. It's really hard to find good sushi places that serve up a nice cut of monk fish liver and fresh uni that's not brownish green in certain parts.  The basic toro, yellowtail, red snapper are amazing as well.Make reservations if you can or prepare to wait for an hour or so.

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: i could come here at least ONCE a MONTH!  Actually, I did...for 6 months last year.  It's hard to go elsewhere when living walking-distance from Sushi Gen.  It's not bc the distance is so appealing, but the quality and service is impeccable.  All my orders listed here are Nigiri (fish on rice).  I'll start off by ordering the Red Snapper with the yuzu (citrus-sour) paste, Halibut, and Albacore.  All 3 are decorated with either a ponzu or yuzu sauce.  Then, I will pander my palate with Yellowtail and Salmon (it is consistently THE bomb here!--so soft, moist, and melts in your mouth).   If you like a little crunchy taste, highly encourage the Halibut Fin which is seasoned with Yuzu paste.  Toro is always good.  Believe it or not but their Tuna is REALLY good, nothing to hype about, right?   But trust me, this is the ONLY place where I can addictively order Yellowtail, Salmon, and Tuna.  The sushi is SO tasty here that I won't even mix my wasabi into the soy sauce.  Seriously, I'll drizzle a little soy sauce into my dish for the nigiri-s waiting to be titillated in sodium.  In addition, I love the fact that my chef knows I appreciate a generous slab of wasabi, and he decisively tucks it under the fish-on-top-of-rice.Sushi Bar Fo Life!

Reviews.Author: Cathy N.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen has been on my list to try for the longest time. I first heard of Sushi-Gen from my roommate, Kaylie D.. I came here for lunch just before noon on a weekday and already saw a line out the door. Wow, they looked like serious sushi eaters! Luckily, I didn't have to wait, since I chose to sit at the bar.The bar has a nice, unique set up. It was almost like an open kitchen. There were a lot of fresh, beautiful flowers (Peruvian Lilies) around the room, even in the bathroom. That was definitely a nice touch, especially since I love Peruvian Lilies. There were a lot of sushi chefs for a lunch time crowd. I really liked how all the sushi chef are all fun and interactive with each other and the patrons.The waitress gave me a menu, but I ended up not using it. At sushi restaurants, I typically order a negihama, negitoro, and any other recommendations from the sushi chef. I noticed the other patrons at the sushi bar knew what was good, so I asked them for recommendations. The other dishes I ended up ordering was the sweet shrimp with the deep fried head on the side, Muzuku with Nagaimo (an appetizer that consisted of seaweed and taro), Snapper, and Spanish Mackerel. I was really impressed with the sushi. The sushi was so good that I didn't need to dip it in soy sauce or ponzu sauce. It was really fresh, the sushi rice was perfect, and the presentation of the sushi was just like a beautiful art. Exquisite. I was more than satisfied and my tummy resonated with me. My total bill came out to be $53. A bit pricey, but definitely worth it. I would definitely come back - often!

Reviews.Author: Pierre B.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, cheap japanese fare.Skip the sushi and stick with the sashimi. The Deluxe Dinner Sashimi is sufficient for two while the $15 sashimi lunch special is quite a steal.

Reviews.Author: B D.
Reviews.Content: Good... I like the ambiance... and the service. Very traditional sushi. I'm not sure why it's hyped so much... but if you're looking for the basics, this place has it. Not a place that explores new flavors or new concepts. This place sticks to the simple and traditional.

Reviews.Author: Belinda Y.
Reviews.Content: Got the sashimi lunch special- such a good deal! Try it with sushi rice on the side instead of regular white rice. :)Come early and be part of the first group into the restaurant or you're looking at about a 30-45min wait!!Lots of street parking nearby. Or just pay $2 to park in the plaza.

Reviews.Author: Jillian T.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to go with a group to get sashimi or the big bowls assorted cuts.If you are into thick rolls with a lot of fish this is not for you. I am too American in the tastebuds!Fresh ingredients, but not as client friendly as other sushi places because of the lack of explanation on the menus- but I bet its a more authentic experience and for those who know Japanese a great find!

Reviews.Author: TH C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent. The sushi rice was warm and delicate.I indulged in one of everything. The Kanpachi, Surf Clam, Uni, Ikura, Toro were all exceptional. I see why the place is stacked on a Tuesday evening. No question about it. Eat at the sushi bar. 4.5

Reviews.Author: Christine N.
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers has stated, it gets packed before opening, it surely does.Friday, July 22nd, arrival to Sushi Gen was 10:45 AM. Thought they opened at 11, but the restaurant changed opening time to 11:15 AM. Two people were waiting ahead of us. By the time it was 11:10, i counted over 20 people arriving and waiting in line. By the time Sushi Gen allowed everyone in, the place was instantly packed. Yes, I did count! =) Took my cousin from out of town here, along with my bf, and I.My bf, a Sushi Gen fanatic, and I ordered and shared the Sashimi Lunch (exactly on the menu) and the Salmon Collar Lunch Special. Both $15 each. He has mentioned that the Salmon Collar was amazing. Tried it and OMG,it heavenly melted in my mouth. I, not a big fan of ANY salmon skin, was actually able to eat this. First time ever eating salmon skin from the SALMON COLLAR LUNCH. I tried to switch lunch plates with my bf, but we ended up fighting for it. Not only does the Salmon Collar lunch comes with the usual miso soup and salad, but it also comes with a sashimi appetizer of 3 pieces of tuna I believe, 2 slices of unknown, and two more of another fish. What a deal! Definitely want to go back for this entree. I ordered the Sashimi Lunch, if you love raw fish, this is the best! Worth the price. I was definitely in fish heaven after seeing all the pieces of delectable fish I can eat. Ate 3/4's of the plate, it was A LOT. Ended up giving the rest to the bf to finish. My cousin ordered the salmon teriyaki lunch special, which too came with a sashimi appetizer. Tried some of her food and it was delicious too. Service was excellent!! Worth the drive. Can't complain about the food at all. Best recommended for sushi/sashimi/raw fish lovers! Or for authentic Japanese food. Dessert, we walked to Beard Papa's for Cream Puffs.

Reviews.Author: Teresa A.
Reviews.Content: Erik says: Ooohhh this place is mouth sexI say: This place is good. We love sushi, especially legit sushi, and this place is no joke. We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs were friendly and suggested good stuff. Plus...FREE PARKING (in downtown? Unheard of!)...yum! royalkombucha.com check out my hubbys awesome website, thanks!

Reviews.Author: Hee K.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite japanese restaurants. Pricey but it expected. Sometimes there is a long wait but you can sit at the bar. I believe there is a minimum order at the bar though. Everything here is fresh and good. If you pick sushi from the list, it will come out a lot for sure so I suggest just ordering a sushi or sashimi combination and maybe one or two additional sushis on the side that is not included. It's a little cheaper and still satisfying.

Reviews.Author: Catherine H.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Friday night around 7pm and it was already busy and people were waiting for tables.  My friend and I waited around 25 minutes until we got seated.  We ordered some single orders of toro, tuna, salmon, and also the sashimi dinner.  They were all delicious.  The sashimi dinner is totally worth it, it comes with miso soup and a plate of assorted tempura.  The fish is all very fresh and delicious.  Will come here again!  Hopefully I'll be able to try the lunch specials next, I've heard they are really good and you get your money's worth!

Reviews.Author: M W.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here recently.Was super crowded, but I was alone and sat at the bar.Wasnt what I would call "cheap" or "average" but I did just tell the sushi man to just start making me whatever he wanted.  Fish was super good, really fresh and some of the pieces just melted in your mouth.I would totally go back here but I would get a table so I could try some of their kitchen dishes.

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious but not the best sashimi/Japanese food I've ever had.Found this restaurant on Yelp and had higher expectations when we arrived to find so many people waiting outside the restaurant. My boyfriend and I put our names down and walked down the street to do happy hour at a nearby Japanese restaurant. After an hour and a half wait, we returned and were seated.We ordered the salmon skin salad, fried chicken (bf's impulse want), the sashimi dinner and the charishi. The salmon skin salad was just okay. It tasted like something I can make myself at home. The sashimi in both the sashimi dinner and charishi were both delicious. It was fresh but not the best I've had. Not sure if I'd come back especially since the restaurant is pretty pricey. Located in Little Tokyo, I enjoyed walking around on the streets and dining here but feel like there's better out there!

Reviews.Author: Evelyn S.
Reviews.Content: BEST SUSHI PLACE IN TOWN!!!Their fish is so fresh, and they give you thick thick thick pieces. If ordering sushi, they give you a lot of fish and less rice, just the way I like it!I ordered the sashimi and sushi combination, and the sashimi one definitely blew my mind away! Each fish melt in my mouth...especially, you guessed it, TORO! We got several pieces of this, and this is probably the best tasting toro I ever had! Just chew it, sit it on your tongue, and let it MELT in your mouth. Also, the sashimi came with 3 different kinds of tuna made as a side like spicy tuna, etc. Those were unique and new to me, so props for that.Small parking lot and no reservations, but worth all the price and all wait in the world. GET THE TORO!

Reviews.Author: G Z.
Reviews.Content: woooooooooooowBEST sushi I have had since visiting Tokyo with a business expense card.LOVE the sushi masters. They are the real deal, not sushi rollers.I'll be back again and again.

Reviews.Author: Willis W.
Reviews.Content: A HELLA LONG WAIT...well 40 mins. We can there when it just opened like literally just opened. There was already a line forming. I recommend being there at 11 or best 1045. There is a parking lot that cost 2 dollars with validation for 2 hours. Not too bad, but if you are stuck waiting then you better eat fast. Though the guy seemed really chill since we went over by 10 minutes and he still just charged us 2 bucks.Got the Sashimi plate. Kind of felt smaller than the picture but hey you get a lot of variety for 15 bucks. Sad that it was not raw salmon but rather baked salmon. I wish they told you what you were eating, but what is the surprise about that. The fish does taste fresh. and it comes with rice and soup and tofu and pickled carrots.The other stuff, looks good but it seems people come here for the sashimi plate. Also if you sit at the bar, you can't order the sashimi plate. Sashimi plate is for lunch only :(

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: I wish I was a big sushi/sashimi fan. .I ordered the sashimi plate a few times and never really deviated from the plate. High quality cuts of fish.Get there before rush hour because it can be a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Drea L.
Reviews.Content: This is sushi done right! The wait can be daunting, but definitely worth it. Sitting at the sushi bar is a completely different experience than sitting at the tables. If you sit at the sushi bar you aren't allowed to order any food from the menu. There are also no prices at the bar so make sure your wallet is stacked or else you'll be in for a big surprise!You have to try their live sweet shrimp with the option of frying the shrimp head or having it in miso soup. I went for the miso soup and OMG! So gooood!! The kumamoto oysters were by far the freshest, most delicious oysters I've ever had. They are also famous for the toro, which literally melts in your mouth. Other recommendations are the red snapper, albacore, and spicy tuna. Never have I had such delicously fresh sushi!Best sushi around. Hands down my fave sushi place!

Reviews.Author: Cody Z.
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. Highlights.-Good food. Quality is good. Doesn't look like a lot, but gets you pretty full. -Jimmy McMillan would say the "Wait is too damn long." Cause the wait is too damn long.-Price wise. $15 SPECIAL or gtfo (get the f*ck out). This place will put a hold in your pocket. However, for quality and service at a higher end Japanese Restaurant in LA this is to expected. -Seating - Not a lot of room to move. Would not recommend a birthday party or anything of that kind here.-Skip if you're a female. Review ends here (: -Do not bring your girlfriend here. She will want to come back and being a gentlemen and all that won't make your wallet very happy.

Reviews.Author: mei m.
Reviews.Content: It was very fresh and delicious sushi.  Probably one of the best (yes, there are better places) in the business in LA.  But....it was too pricey.  And I didnt like how we were never shown the price of anything and blindly ordered $200 worth of food that didnt really fill neither one of us (party of 2) up.  So, I would appreciate it if the waitress was more attentive and not be as busy as she was.  So, one star off for the price and service.  Otherwise the chef was great and food was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: it's good, but i don't know if it's worth an hour wait if anyone ever had to wait that long. there are couple other choices within a mile radius without the starvation outside the restaurant. i got the chirashi bowl and it was good, but not melt in my mouth amazing. i think i had too big of an expectation b/c of the notorious wait time and the 5 star reviews by many others. the food was good but if the wait is 1+ hr long? don't starve.

Reviews.Author: V T.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for YEARS! It has always been a go-to place for me and my siblings. Still the freshest fish which makes for the best damn sushi in J-town. My usual is the sashimi combination which comes with a variety of fish. Fresh might I add! Customer service is good as well as parking as long as you come early before the crowd. We always go right when the restaurant opens for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Rako H.
Reviews.Content: Great food, quality is really good and the price they ask for it is also great. Is one of the best sushis I had in a long time. You need to go there . Try the sashimi deluxe.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi, very fresh fish and excellently prepared, but at a price that I feel is just a tad inflated, but still worth it. I've only had the sashimi and uni plates there and it definitely hit the spot.Yelpers beware, as people have stated, the parking lot is small, but if you can get in it's not so bad. Otherwise there are lots and metered parking around Little Tokyo if you know where to look. Also it can get a little crowded.The thing stopping this from being a 5? I'm willing to let the crowd and parking go, it comes with being a great restaurant in that area, but last time couple of times I was there I feel like the service was a little lacking. Yeah, they got us what we needed but I always felt they were quite short with me and my friends when we were talking to them, but I assume it's because they're so busy. Regardless, it's nothing that should be a huge deterrent, so give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: Melts in your mouth delicious! Oh god, literally with every bite. You must have the albacore sushi. Spicy tuna cut roll was so good. Tuna sashimi was like taking a bite out of the ocean, it was all so fresh. More please!

Reviews.Author: Bronwyn B.
Reviews.Content: This place totally blew my mind the first time I went.  Every day at lunch it is packed full with Little Tokyo locals, so you can expect a wait.  But they manage to push their customers through head-spinningly quickly (without making you feel rushed while eating).  I showed up at 1:45 one day with about 12 people ahead of me and was still seated within 10 minutes.For lunch, the sushi box has a larger and more varied selection than your standard sushi-special fare, and will only set you back a mere $12.  The staff is friendly, attentive, and just boistrous enough to remind me of the loud, bustling sushi bars that are standard in Japan.  Not to mention the fish, which is so tasty and smooth it's almost like butter (the yellowtail was especially delightful).  This place is my number one choice for nigiri and sashimi, which is quite the feat considering the numerous other options to be found in the neighboorhood.

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: The best fresh sushi in L.A.Long wait but well worth it.  Good service too.Pricey.Nuff said.

Reviews.Author: George R.
Reviews.Content: Jeez this place is good.  I've been coming here for years and I have to say this is the best sushi restaurant in Los Angeles.  Here's a few insider tips:1)  If you want a table, get there EARLY, preferably when they open.  The wait is very long each and every day.2)  The difference between the sushi you get at the table and the sushi you get at the bar is quite drastic.  If you want sushi, sit at the bar.3)  Sit towards the back of the restaurant where Kazu and Masa stand.  These 2 chefs are way better than the rest.4)  The toro here is the best in LA.  Be sure to tell the chef you like it oily and you'll be rewarded with the most creamy, juicy, flavorful sushi your tongue has ever had the pleasure of encountering.5)  One of the secret hidden gem at Sushi Gen is the albacore belly sushi.  It is OMG good.6)  The Amaebi here is really good, but really really expensive ($12 for 1 piece).

Reviews.Author: eric p.
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I finally made it here after all the hype I've heard. I had the sashimi platter along with some uni and scallop sushi and i was happy. I went on a weeknight, called 2 hours before for  a reservation, and was seated like a VIP within 5 minutes of arrival.The sashimi was fresh and plentiful, just as you yelpers promised. Sadly, however, I think I've lost my taste for uni. Who knows if it was the quality or what, but the fishy flavor just didn't agree with me this time.One of the most memorable parts of the nights for me, weirdly enough, was waling through little tokyo and smelling all the different scents wafting form the restaurants. Just take a 20 minute stroll and you're ready to eat forever!

Reviews.Author: M T.
Reviews.Content: The best sashimi I've had in the states so far. It's authentic and fresh. All the thanks goes to my wonderful Fourth Year Japanese teacher, who told me about this place.I hate the large crowd and long wait (to get a table and to get your food), but it's worth the trip, JUST for the quality and deliciousness of the fish here.The salmon sashimi is my favorite-- it's not on the menu, but they offer it on the paper you write your order on. It *used to be* $15 for 6 or 7 generous pieces of fresh, succulent salmon, but now it's $21. I swear by the salmon belly at Sushi Ota (in Pacific Beach), but this salmon (even if it's not the belly part, I assume) is also orgasm-worthy. Eating this sashimi makes the world stop and time go slow. I wish I could come here once a week.My only gripe is that none of the entries on the menu serve raw salmon sashimi (or sushi, I believe) at all. Even the regular and the deluxe sashimi entries DO NOT have any raw salmon! The deluxe has a portion of salted cooked salmon, which isn't nearly as good. Thus, my only question is, WHYYY??! It's the yummiest fish they have there, and it doesn't get featured! Oh, the agony.I usually order the sashimi deluxe and the salmon sashimi, and it's more than enough food for two. The tuna sashimi is also excellent.The first time I visited, I ordered the sashimi + tempura combo plate. My tempura came out relatively fast, and my sashimi took forever to get. Once I got the sashimi, I was shocked at the quantity of food (even for the combo dinner entry), and could not finish it. :( As we all know, leftover raw fish is not recommended for eating.Cons: again, the long wait. The parking lot isn't too great or big, and you have to pay to park there. Also, the place is pretty tiny, and I've heard it used to be even smaller, back in the day. Also, the servers are running around like crazy in between all the tiny spaces separating the seating areas, trying to get everyone's orders. It is noisy there, even with the no-cell-phone rule, so it's not so much a quiet and romantic place. BUT, it is the perfect place for the freshest, most delicious, and most authentic sashimi at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Author: sophia c.
Reviews.Content: it's crazy how long the wait is.  seriously.  BUT well worth it.  the sashimi deluxe is so yum.  and the price is average- about $35... the only difference is that you will eat up everything they serve you on the plate without complaints.  everything is fresh.  presentation is nice.  and the seaweed is good too.monkfish liver is tasty too.. and the sushi bar chefs are SOOO incredibly nice.

Reviews.Author: grace j.
Reviews.Content: Finally stopped by this icon for their lunch specials.Phenomenal! First of all, parking was perfectly fine. It gets a little tight for sure. My friend ordered the $15 sashimi combo - amazing! I ordered the sashimi/chicken teriyaki combo - $14 and amazing in terms of taste and amount. One less star because I hate, yes HATE, restaurants that don't give little sides like banchan or ginger for free with your meal. Sushi Gen charged $1 for ginger. Oh come on! Ginger is so cheap...With the economy the way it is, lunch specials like these allow for a great meal without hurting the wallet too much!

Reviews.Author: Greg N.
Reviews.Content: The quality of ingredients is first class.  The menu is traditional and is nice change from all fancy pseudo gourmet stuff that is out of hand.  This place is all about the quality.The two best things on the menu so far are yellow tail belly, toro, and albacore.  The yellow tail belly is a must.This place is pricey, but worth it.  You have been warned.

Reviews.Author: Elaine C.
Reviews.Content: Love the sashimi here, and the chicken teriyaki! MUST MUST try this place.  It's an OG sushi restaurant. The service is pretty prompt, except for the seating-- if you go during the main lunch and dinner times be prepared to wait an 30-60mins on avg.  Everytime I've been i've never been disappointed. I prefer to sit at the tables vs sushi bar- you can order hot food at the tables.  Sushi bar is limited to only sushi/sashimi items. The quality of the fish is not comparable- I would have to say the best so far in LA.  The bill can run a bit high but you get what you're paying for. That's some Damn great sushi!! haha  Quality vs Quantity- I heart this place very much.

Reviews.Author: Virginia L.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi was really excellent quality, but nothing to write home about.  I am a part of the old school sushi eaters where I usually rate a sushi restaurant based on their quality of simple fish rather than how creative their rolls are.  Sushi-Gen should take advantage of this fact.  I mean.. the sashimi was good but I've had better (like at recently rated Kirala in Berkeley).  We started with a nice agedashi tofu that I quite enjoyed.  After that it did not go above and beyond.  The best pieces were the albacore and the uni.  Salmon, tuna, halibut and surf clam I've had better (but it's still very good).  Ambiance and service was standard for any nice sushi restaurant.  I can't speak to the prices because I didn't really look at the check but I think I paid about $20 for myself.

Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a fan of Sushi Gen.  Ordered the sashimi plate.  Isn't a sashimi plate only supposed to have sashimi?  Then why the hell was there a few pieces of cooked fish on my plate?  If you want the pickled ginger, it's gonna cost you extra.  I ordered a (very small) glass of Sprite and they wouldn't even give refills!  I will not be going back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Johanna W.
Reviews.Content: BEST SASHIMI EVER! There are days I work in downtown LA and those days, this is the place I have my lunch. For $15 you get so much sashimi. There are times I don't eat some of it as I actually get full from all the protein.The quality of their fish is amazing! It's perfectly cut and really fresh. Most of it is tuna but I swear, there was a time they served toro. There's a lunch line ... but if you decide to wait. Definitely worth it!

Reviews.Author: Josie L.
Reviews.Content: You'll spend a lot here... but I have to say.. they have the freshest sushi in town. I once spent $50 on dinner for myself here. The times I have come here, it has always been busy. I have waited 30min-1hour before. But the food is good.. so I don't mind all too much. The place is very clean, and they even give you hot towels. (NICE!) Parking in Little Tokyo seems to always be hectic. They do have parking for in that lot though. I think it ranges $2-5, but it beats driving around forever to park.

Reviews.Author: Kinndy L.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what the hype is about this place! We decided to do a nice family dinner and came here on a Saturday evening. Before the place even opened, there were already 10+ people lined up at the door. When they finally opened their doors, there was a mini rush into the place, to my amusement. Anyway, we were promptly seated and within 5-10 minutes, the place was packed and more people were waiting outside.I don't remember specifically what we ordered since my mom did the ordering, but we tried most of the things on their menu. The tempura was good--just the right amount of batter so it wasn't too thick, it wasn't soggy, and the crisps were delicate and not oily. Sashimi was fresh fresh fresh but, sadly, not served in generous portions.The place was good but not OMGlet'slineupbeforeitopens amazing. I was not reeling or raving about the place when I left.

Reviews.Author: Katherine M.
Reviews.Content: yumm!popped by here for a group lunch on a weekday. SO GOOD! Service friendly and attentive.  Sushi delicioius. Beers cold.  Can't get much better. We ordered loads of food (rolls and sushi) and it was all fresh and delicious. Hands down the best unagi EVER.  Also they aren't kidding when they say "spicy tuna roll".  Tuna, scallop, sweet shrimp - you can't get enough. We ordered TONS 'O Food and several beers.  Bill at the end was pricey but not out of control for so much quantity AND quality. 250 for five peeps.  Pop in - though be prepared to wait. There was a line at 1:45 PM.

Reviews.Author: Sashin N.
Reviews.Content: By far one of my favorite sushi restaurants of all time. Order the sashimi dinner ($35), and the fresh oysters. :) YUM! (usually feeds both of us)Price is not that bad, parking is usually good if you go early.

Reviews.Author: Tae N.
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-known sushiya among the Japanese in Los Angeles area. So you can't go wrong with this place if you are looking for any authentic traditional sushi experience.I had deluxe sushi combination and chirashi deluxe. They were pretty good. Most of the sushi neta melted in my mouth and the temperature of the sheri was just about the same as body temperature, which is the perfect condition.  it made the rice feel so comfortable in mouth and it also made freshness of the sushi neta stand out.I haven't tried the Omakase yet so there's not much more I can say. But from my 5 visits here, I can say that Sushi Gen is a really good place for authentic sushi experience, where sushi neta melts in your mouth and the rice tastes perfect.

Reviews.Author: Xinyi W.
Reviews.Content: Well, It is good, The food quality and service are both nice, very popular. But nothing special for me. Mediocre~ You can park in the small plaza, and mention that you are going to  Sushi Gen, they will ask the price for sushi gen for your parking. And get validated in Sushi Gen.I had their Chirashi, Sushi deluxe. They are OK, but the cooked fish is excellent! Forgot which one though, based on the grilled fish, I give them Four Stars.Don't expect too much, I think they are slightly over rated here.

Reviews.Author: Dennis N.
Reviews.Content: I've been here two times now, first for Lunch and most recently for Dinner.After both of my bouts with Sushi Gen, I've made a few conclusions. 1) Hands down BEST SUSHI LUNCH SASHIMI SPECIAL. It's an incredible amount of food and quality for a low, low price of $15. A cornucopia of flavors and freshness! It's wonderful.2) Expect to wait for seating unless you come extra early for lunch or dinner. Each time we waited around 20 minutes. If the wait is especially long, take a walk around the corner to the Little Tokyo Marketplace! Sooooo much cool stuff in there from the supermarket to the gift shops and one of the rare Video Game Arcades I know of. 3) Park in the Sushi Gen parking lot, sounds like a no-duh but it was only $2.50 for dinner. No need to validate or refill a meter.For dinner we wanted an encore of the Sashimi Lunch goodness we had here the first time. We both ordered Sashimi Lunch Dinner for $26. This dinner includes the usual Miso Soup, Sunomono, and a pickled cold noodle dish. It also comes with a tempura dish with your typical tempura shrimp and assorted veggies. However, to our surprise the Sashimi plate is exactly the same as the lunch except with Tamago! Not that it was a bad thing as that plate is off the hook!So essentially the difference between our first and second experience was $11, which only accounts for a tempura dish, a small pickled noodle dish, and a piece of Tamago on the sashimi plate. Only more reason to come here just for the lunch special ahhhhhh yumminess.I probably won't order that meal again even though it was tasty and filling. Also second time around, I didn't notice it but they charge for hot tea ($1.50). Lame. Still, I love Sushi Gen and I will be back in the future but probably just for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Timothy H.
Reviews.Content: Quite good but you're no EichigoCame here for lunch with the wifey.  Great deal for lunch.She got the Sashimi combo - 15 bucks for a lot of fish.  Good too.I got the Sushi Deluxe - 15 bucks for a decent spread, including a very good unagi.However, there is a wait.  I arrived at 11:10, just after they opened.  The line was out the door and we didn't get seated until nearly noon.  Was it worth the wait?  probably, especially for the value.However, still not quite as good as Eichigo.Or Tokyo...

Reviews.Author: Crandall W.
Reviews.Content: It's a 4 star restaurant but it loses a star due to the wait and the front host who would not let us sit because 1 member of our group had not arrived.  (we were a party of 6).  Our friend that was coming told us to go ahead and order.  This was a sloppy handling of handling the guests.It's a decent sushi place, but i felt that the sushi pieces look incredibly small compared to other sushi places i've been to: kabuki, taihei, tenno, and the one that's upstairs in the korean market (forgetting what the name of that business was)My friend had hyped this to be the best place to get sushi.  I personally didn't feel that the small establishment and roll appearance was "epic" as what my friend had described.Meh.  There is always a wait, and the venue is NOT good for bringing groups of people 6+.

Reviews.Author: Darlene P.
Reviews.Content: Ate here last night. Sat at the Sushi Bar. The sushi was super fresh and it was soooo yummy. Hardly any soy sauce was needed. I love the use of fresh wasabi on the pike mackerel and the red snapper. It was sooo yummy.This is what we ordered. Me Salmon Sushi, Toro Tuna, Uni Sushi, Yellowtail Sushi, Sweet Shrimp Sushi, Red Snapper, Pike Mackerel, and oysters Boyfriend Salmon Sushi, Yellowtail Sushi, Red Snapper, Pike Mackerel, Two orders of Toro Tuna, Three orders of Yellow Tail Belly Sushi We sucked down two large Sapporos. Total sushi price was $128.00 plus $26 for the Sapporo. Everything was super fresh. The meal was great. It was expensive but we left happy. I took one star off for the wait to get a table and the parking.

Reviews.Author: Michele S.
Reviews.Content: FRESH SUSHI! The sashimi platter is amazing, a lot of fresh fish and never been disappointed! Being a new Californian this is my to-go spot. The wait is the only downside. Even though you have reservations you will have to wait a bit since its not a big restaurant but definitely worth the wait for me!

Reviews.Author: Thomas L.
Reviews.Content: I have been here over 25+ times in the past few years. One thing I have always found consistently fresh is their sashimi and sushi. From what I hear, the owner himself goes to the local fish market and handpicks each fish selection.I'm only giving this four stars because of the 30+ minute waits I always have to go through during lunch over the past few years....but hey I can't complain! There are always other mouths as hungry as mine :)and be sure to stop by the small french/japanese cakery Frances a few doors by for delicious dessert

Reviews.Author: Tina S.
Reviews.Content: LOOOOVE IT! I love the weekday lunch special! For a $$$ restaurant, it's madd cheap. My friend recommended the sashimi special and woohoo, it was the best I ever had! They serve you everything from squid, toro, tuna, cuttlefish, salmon, etc etc... For those of you lucky enough to be free from 11am to 2pm during M-F, go go go :D

Reviews.Author: Barbara L.
Reviews.Content: First time I came here was last year on a wednesday afternoon at like, 12:30. it was PACKED... but that's a good sign.
