It took about 20 min to get my party of 5 seated which wasn't that bad. The service there is fast but polite. We ordered, they got our food to our table quickly and made sure our water/teas were refilled AND they never rushed us. THIS is how all sushi/japanese restaurants should be like. I ordered the lunch special. Can i say that it was the Best. Lunch. I. Ever. Had. ?Yes I can. For all of those poor souls who have not eaten here yet, let me just say that this place is hyped up... but it actually meets that hype. Such few places do...The fish is so fresh and it just melts in your mouth. Everything is so good there! Even the rice. The rice is so chewy and so fragrant and so delicious! All the times I've come back to eat here, I've had NO complaints. And as of the price... 15 dollar sashimi special ftwI will be coming back again... and again.... and again......

Reviews.Author: Kate B.
Reviews.Content: Bottom line about this place, in my opinion, is that while I didn't have ANY problems with the way my sushi tasted, this place isn't OMG THE MOST AMAZING SUSHI PLACE EVA!!!!My BF and I came here after we tried to go to Wurstküche and were hit with (literally) a 50-60 person line going down the block. It was already late-ish and we wanted to eat. So, Yelp suggested this spot.We opted for a table (after waiting for about 20 minutes, which didn't bother me since it was a Saturday) since we weren't all that hungry and apparently the sushi bar has a 4 order minimum per person. In my opinion, that's too much food for one person but whatever.We split 4  sashimi (yellowtail, albacore, tuna and salmon) and 1 spicy tuna roll (and a side of white rice) and were beyond full. I was semi freaking out because the couple at the table next to us had a bill for $350 (!!!!!) but our total (with a large beer) only came out to $40. Just to spell it out for you, we ordered 5 pieces for the both of us....thats slightly more than half the bar minimum, so at the bar we would have been paying about 70-80 for too much food.Not to say this place isn't good, it definitely is! But I've gotten sashimi this fresh at Haru Sushi Cafe in West Hollywood, for far less money. I guess this place deserves 4 stars for being the "freshest" sushi spot in downtown, since the little tokyo food scene isn't that great?

Reviews.Author: Russ N.
Reviews.Content: They won't seat you until your entire party is here. Expect to wait 30-45 min if you get here around 6:30 pmHowever this is definitely one of the best sushi places I've been too.  The prices are also very reasonable and they have a lot of the more rare fish here.Parking here can be tight during lunch, but during dinner its not really a problem.

Reviews.Author: Val B.
Reviews.Content: Yes the lunch deal has got to be the best deal in town. Maybe even the state. And they are PACKED so everyone knows it. Get the sashimi, their shari isn't their strength.  And the fact that they declined the latimes feature (which is supposedly one of the handful of times that a rest. declined) makes me adore them more. Btw, the dinner is a good deal too. This is a good relationship builder date. It's like the watered down urban version of the suspension bridge effect. Waiting and agonizing and chatting and then the thrill of shared victory at snagging good grub at an insanely good price. And if you're lucky the cake store next door will be open. Yummmmmm.Oh and don't be a douche and go w/ a big group. It slows down the turnover and the space isn't big enough either.

Reviews.Author: Sindie Y.
Reviews.Content: The first time I ever had Sake with shiso (Japanese mint leaf) and seaweed was here @ Sushi-Gen in the late 90s.  To me: salmon is a somewhat smelly fish, the shiso is strong enough to cover the fishy smell but yet not strong like the American or what we get here @ the American market, and the thin piece of seaweed is sweet you can't even tell it's seaweed.  It is a great way to have raw salmon or the first time you ever want to try Sake sushi.  Once you try this combination, you probably won't want to eat Sake sushi without the shiso and seaweed.  I had requested this combination @ other sushi bar or Japanese restaurant and no one can beat Sushi Gen on this!!

Reviews.Author: kat c.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi spot in the area. The lines get long, so come early. Fresh fish, great quality, not for the 'roll-lovers' out there.I always get the Chirasi bowl with a side of uni and amaebi. Good Fish = Happy Kat

Reviews.Author: Barbara B.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an itch that needed some serious scratching and thanks to a friend's recommendation, we tried Sushi-Gen in Little Tokyo and that did the trick!The fish was by far the freshest fish we've had in a while. It melts in your mouth!!!! The wait was not bad for a Friday night, 20 min. max. Note: they do not have rolls. Just the real deal: sashimi and sushi.Definitely going back.

Reviews.Author: Ben W.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place 20 years ago. I would have given it 7+ stars back then. But now it's overrated and overpriced. I guess that's what happens sometimes when your place becomes a local legend. All the hype goes to your and you become arrogant and cocky.Pros: sushi is pretty good, but I had better at the $1/plate kaiten sushi joints in Japan. Ok I'm not being fair...  But if your gonna boast then step up to the plateCons: host is rude or clueless and plays favorites, long wait, rest of food on menu is mediocre.If I was rating on food alone I would give this place 3 stars but the rest of experience subtracts 1 star

Reviews.Author: Shar N.
Reviews.Content: This place has all the elements for such a great restaurant. The best part is when you put it all together, it all works!1. Food Quality: Fresh2. Food Price: Great! (Now I'm not saying cheap, but for the serving size, quality and quantity it actually makes sense)3. Authenticity: Real Japanese by Real Japanese4. Popularity: HighShoot for a seat at the sushi bar, best spot in the restaurant.If you have a table seat, get one of the combo dinner sets and share.Parking in lot in front of restaurant but don't forget to get your ticket validated. Oh yea, get there as early as possible because the wait is crazy . There were people waiting with us, that were still waiting outside when we finished our meal (over an hour). Not even that, 15 other  groups were also waiting for a seat..that's how good this place can be.Ok, now you're set...GO!

Reviews.Author: Alisa Y.
Reviews.Content: Best lunch sashimi special in little Tokyo!! Fresh and generous cuts.  Get there at 11:15 or 2:30, otherwise the wait is long. Not perfect though because the quantity can be inconsistent. Also, there was one time when I found a fish bone and a piece of hair in my rice, yuck!(This is for lunch review only, dinner is just way too expensive for the quality)

Reviews.Author: JORGE R.
Reviews.Content: I love Sushi and Sushi Gen is reasonably price for the quality of food that is served.  It's not the best Sushi I have ever had but it is a very good. This is my go to place when I'm in LA, in the mood for Sushi and I have to do a quick hit and run.  The Sashimi dinner is a good example of a reasonably price menu item.  You get a good portion of Sashimi, Tempura, Rice, Salad, Miso Soup and a choice of Beer or Sake. You are looking at about $26.00.The restaurant is small and fills up early.  They do take reservation to make the wait a little easier.  My tip is getting in early if you can.  I usually make my reservations for 5:30PM and I done by 6:30.  Then I'm off to do what I came into LA for.  Most likely I'm going to a concert or some type of entertainment in the City.  A good way to try this place is to get there for lunch. The lunch menu is very good and the prices are a little less.

Reviews.Author: Ryko C.
Reviews.Content: It is stupid to comment here about how good this place is cuz it will only make the waiting line longer but the line is already long so WTH. I will make this short. The best sushi place in LA hands down. Go during the lunch time cuz the lunch menu has good prices (dinner is expensive). The quality of sushi is days in days out very consistent n I think that's what separates this place from every other restaurant. I have had 100 dollar per person sushi course n they didn't impress me but their 20 dollar sushi delux makes me smile every time. If you have the sushi here once and you were not impressed, try it again cuz next time you wont fail. Its just that good.

Reviews.Author: Joseph C.
Reviews.Content: I have worked behind sushi bar and worked as server at sushi restaurant, and this is the best sushi in southern california.Price can be very resonable if you just want a bowl of chirashi, which is the definition of The Chirashi, chirashi other than is is pretty much junk.But price could go up too, last time I was here was a day after Valentine's day. (Valentines Day is one of the most busy day in sushi industry.) I was here at 10:50, and restaurant opens up at 11:00, Well... it was raining too, but guess what, as usual line was already there, i was about 5th on the list. so I got in right after open)For party of two, we had Deluxe Sasimi ($30), Deluxe Sushi ($20), 2 oolong tea, Ama Ebi, and mirugui, before tip total bill was over $80 for lunch for two people.was it worth it? heck yeah, The Best Japanese Sushi experience you can have.Probably only sushi and sashimi I would pay to eat

Reviews.Author: Diana A.
Reviews.Content: Went here with my cousin for dinner.We sat on the bar and ordered omakase. The sushi is SO GOODD!! The fish fillet is so thick.It costs us $200+ but it worth it :)

Reviews.Author: Frank S.
Reviews.Content: You can come here for the weekday lunch special. But you've missed the point of this sushi bar.  And let me clarify.  The lunch special is super cheap, great portions and ridiculously fresh. But you have to deal with the line that goes out the restaurant and overflows into the parking lot.  Or you can sit in the sushi bar.When you sit at the sushi bar, you'll notice a man in the center ordering everyone to do what he bids.  His name is Toyo-san and he runs the show.  He even taught the Mexican chefs to speak Japanese.  How cool is that?Let's see.  You should order for yourself...1. Ankimo (monkfish liver)2. Fried Pompano (you can eat every little bit of real estate on there, including the bones)3. White Fish (Engawa, Hirame, Aji, Tai, etc)4. Mirugai (giant clam)5. Red Fish (Maguro, any variation of their toro, Hamachi, Kanpachi, etc)6. UniNow that you've spent over $100 on yourself, you should feel happy that something on you is lighter- your wallet!

Reviews.Author: Kathy L.
Reviews.Content: Love coming in here for lunch!! Great/fresh sashimi.

Reviews.Author: Esther L.
Reviews.Content: 1,500+ reviews? Crap!If Sushi-Gen weren't located in DT, they probably wouldn't be as popular or even be open. I guess I've just been spoiled, doesn't bother me about the quality of their fish since you only get a few pieces. $15 for an appetizer? There are places in LT that will give you the same quality of fish for half the price. Plus you only get four pieces here... I've gotten a few more...

Reviews.Author: S P.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi : $15 for the whole plate, lunch only !  $26 for dinner; the same amount for the plate, but add one plate of tempura. Personally, I feel the fishes are more fresh at dinner than lunch.  Their fresh oyster & Uni are SO good :D

Reviews.Author: Alex G.
Reviews.Content: The food is good... but it isnt worth the hype.First of all, its really crowded... Being crowded kind of goes without saying, its a well known placed and the #1 rated sushi joint in LA. Even if you show up at 5:00 on a Saturday night (when the place opens), youre going to have to wait. One thing that particularly ticked me off was that they didnt let us order off the menu if we sat at the sushi bar (there was no wait for this). We've never been there so we decided to wait... 40 minutes for an open table. Portions are pretty small... I wasnt hungry to start with so it was okay but if I actually were hungry, it wouldnt be good. The bill was 54 bucks for two people, we had the sushi combo deluxe and the sashimi plate. The fish is fresh. Overall, I wouldnt go there again because of their snobbish attitude, long wait, and high cost.

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: Incredibly long wait, outside with no seats nonetheless.  Then once inside it took quite a long time as well, granted they were really busy, which I always take as a good thing.  The sushi delux was very traditional, more nigiri and sashimi versus rolls with sauce.  The miso soup was pretty good.  They brought the fried shrimp head out from our sweet shrimp nigiri but I wasn't too sure what to do with it.

Reviews.Author: S J.
Reviews.Content: This is my go to sushi restaurant. I've been coming here for years and thought it deserves a great review since their sushi is always fresh, the sushi chefs are always friendly and I'm always guaranteed a great time.I always sit at the bar and order the chef's special. I can only dream of it now...

Reviews.Author: Jen J.
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best sushi lunch that you can get in little Tokyo. The portion is pretty generous and the service is fast.

Reviews.Author: YP M.
Reviews.Content: Great Food but the wait time is too long at the lunch time...Chirashi sushi is pretty good!If you order Sashimi lunch special, order sushi rice for $1. It is a lot better than regular rice!

Reviews.Author: Natalie M.
Reviews.Content: GREAT sushi in Little Tokyo. if you like seaweed salad def order here. also the crab hand roll was outstanding, warm, buttery, crisp nori that snaps and melts in your mouth. Gets super crowded. I like to go right when it opens at 5p!

Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in five weeks we have dined here.  Five weeks ago, we sat at the sushi counter with Kazu san.  The sushi was decent but not great as other reviewers have raved.  We ordered Otoro, ama ebi, sayori, kanpach, hamachi, ankimo, aji, unagi..  I was not blown away.  Fish is fresh, and sushi rice decent, but not excellent.  I guess my taste is different from most reviewers here.  Then we came here last saturday night.  Did not feel like being squeezed in the back again (even though Kazu san is the best there), we opted for the table.  We ordered similiar items, but was more underwelmed than five weeks ago.  Just don't prefer eating sushi other than at the sushi "bar"/counter.

Reviews.Author: Trina L.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi lunch special is delicious and very fresh! I enjoyed all the variety of fish. Too bad I couldn't eat the rice, miso soup and tofu... but it was tasty nonetheless! The wait was ass long but that was to be expected! I'd like to have more of it but I can wait for a while since that line is too long, and I'm a hungry for the sushi!

Reviews.Author: Fred A.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding sushi and sashimi. The halibut was superfresh and clean. Friendly guys next to me at bar made good recommendations. Beer cold and service good. 10 minutes from Silver Lake. There must be a reason why Sushi-Gen is packed when their neighboring restaurants are not, right?

Reviews.Author: charlie w.
Reviews.Content: It's okIt may have been the hype but I expected much more from Gen. Oomasa has been my go-to sushi place and still is after Gen. The food and service were ok.

Reviews.Author: T T.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, you can't beat the wonderful value of the Sashimi Special available in the dining room only.  Although the wait is horrendous, it is worth it.  Love to do some cold sake, uni, and the sashimi special.  Can't beat it.

Reviews.Author: C P.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were there last night. Parking was $2.5 with validation at the Honda Plaza just across Office Depot. There was a fairly long line. I heard it wasn't because it's Saturday evening-- this place is busy during the day as well.I can't tell whether the food was good or super good. I know it wasn't bad anyway. We ordered the sashimi deluxe for $21. Hot tea was $1.5 per person. Our server was friendly and quite efficient but the guy at the front desk was not very attentive and slightly intimidating. Had it not been with my friend, I might have walked away. I do have a tendency to walk away when I think people are rude.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: The wife and I had a late (8:45pm) dinner here on a Thursday night on a visit from Chicago.  We were jonesing for some good sushi on our last night here and were NOT DISAPPOINTED!The place was pretty crowded, but no wait at that hour (kitchen reportedly closes at 9:30 p.m., but I find that hard to believe as they were still making stuff for folks while we were there.)  We got two seats at the sushi bar and couldn't have been happier there -- min. 4 orders, which we had no problem filling. We had a couple of the Sake sashimi orders.  Hamachi, Kampachi, and Fatty Tuna sushi.  A spicy scallop hand roll (not on the sushi bar menu, but didn't faze the chef one iota).  And, a spcy tuna roll.  Everything was fantastic.All that and a bottle ($25) of an extremely good and mellow Gingo sake, we we tabbed out at about $100.All in all, fantastic.Arigato Godzaimas!

Reviews.Author: Ted B.
Reviews.Content: Been here several times in the last couple years, and only now have I decided to get off my butt and write a review LOL. Anyway, I find that Sushi Gen is best value and best priced Sushi joint in all of downtown LA. I definitely recommend the Sashimi Deluxe for either lunch or dinner; you just can't go wrong with that meal. Of course you do have to be a fan of sashimi to appreciate it hehehe.If you're looking for rolls you've come to the wrong place; however, if you have a passion for sashimi/raw fish than this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Author: Hazel A.
Reviews.Content: I'd give this place 5 stars, but I can't because I found this place to be ridiculously expensive--by my standards.  Hey can you blame me, I'm an Architecture student! i spend all my money on materials.3 of my friends and I came here because of all the hype we'd heard from Yelp.  We thought it'd be decently priced, but when we got there and saw the menu we thought ourselves idiots for not looking at the pricing that yelp had surveyed.Though the food here is super expensive, and that if you're going to split, you have to spend 10 bucks each...it was really confusing to order, the food is actually really good.  The tuna sashimi literally melts in your mouth.  The california rolls were good, and the Miso soup was super good.  The tempura is ultra crunchy which is a definite plus.  I really want to go back, but that won't be till I'm a baller.  I mean if you think about it, I should've noticed this place was expensive when I saw Porsche's and Aston Martin's parked in front of it.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: The White Devil STRONGLY recommends this place.Just Do It. Have the sashimi platter...

Reviews.Author: Emmie T.
Reviews.Content: Ask me what L.A's main food staple is!  Is it hotdogs?  Is there L.A. pizza?  Maybe there's a Hollywood Carne Asada burritto out there somewhere, but if you ask me, it's California Rolls!It's the only food item that even incorporates a locale into its name, as opposed to the ubiquitous LA street taco?  In n Out is just one chain.  So I digress...Well I was in the middle of a good review until my co-worker came in and asked me for stuff, so I've gotta keep this short and say, the sashimi, tuna and salmon pieces were great.  I love to order handrolls, and their's did not let me down.See you later kids.

Reviews.Author: Catherine S.
Reviews.Content: My first experience here was with a couple of friends back in 2008 to hit up their lunch specials in the dining room section of the restaurant. I remember the meal being good but nothing extraordinary. Fast forward 2 years and my parents invite me to lunch here - except this time, it's at the sushi bar. My life, is forever changed..I can't remember all the Japanese names for the sushi we ordered but let me try:Toro Amaebi (Raw shrimp)Engawa - I loved this here, I had two ordersHirame HamachiUniBottom line:  Lunch for the three of us, ordering sushi a la carte (no alcohol), set us back $180 inc tax and tip.  What I learned? That in all my years, I never had proper sushi until that afternoon.

Reviews.Author: Jason V.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best sushi places I've ever been to. The best way to go is the omakase route. The sushi chef picks out the best of the day and serves you till you are finished. Of course you can ask for your favorites but they keep the fish coming. They have the freshest fish I have had in a LA. The other reviews here say all that needs to be said but I encourage you to try this place. Might be a little bit pricey for some, but the quality more then makes up for it. Seating at the sushi bad a must.Another note, make sure you get the nigiri and/or sashimi. You can do without the rolls.

Reviews.Author: thy L.
Reviews.Content: Omg! my fav sushi joint eva....I rarely eat sashimi cuz I hav an extremely sensitive palate esp to anything remotely fishy but I swallow every sashimi on my platter.  Every piece was sooo fresh, I love snapper and tuna tartar the most :)This is literally the best of the best!

Reviews.Author: Calvin K.
Reviews.Content: I ordered a dinner set, Uni. I had a couple of Uni Sushi in Japan, so I was interested to get that in SUSHI-GEN.The FoodThe UNI set was really creamy because they gave me a whole plate sized. I would not recommend UNI. My party ordered different dinner sets, SOUL FISH and they were good. The sushi was not a disappointment. SALMON & TUNA SASHIMI was juicy.The ServiceI always find Japanese people very respectful towards their customers.AtmosphereI felt like I was actually in Japan.I gave 3 stars due to my mistake of ordering a very creamy food and later I got a little sick.

Reviews.Author: Pamela S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a couple times during the typical mid-week lunch-rush and I really love it.Usually I get the "lunch special" (i.e., "sashimi lunch special").  It's very good: excellent fish quality, generous lunch-size portions, and a great price for what you're getting ($15?).What I don't like:(1.) parking - though the restaurant validates, you still have to pay(2.) the wait - although, in all fairness, it's not that insane... i think i waited about 20 minutes both times(3.) service - even though they are very polite, they make you feel like you have to rush through your lunch; i don't particularly appreciate that  =\

Reviews.Author: O T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen!  I love you.  My parents love you.  My friends love you.Sometimes I feel as though every other sushi restaurant on yelp needs to lose at least one star in rating because in terms of price, service and most importantly the quality of food, it is completely top notch here!

Reviews.Author: Will C.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sashimi place in L.A.  They have really good sushi/sashimi combinations too. The fish is always SUPER fresh (melts in your mouth) and the daily crowds that gather there are always hungry, so expect a wait if you have more than 2 people. Another option would be to sit down at the sushi bar (very friendly sushi chefs)  I always order the sashimi deluxe for dinner.  A large variety of sashimi with a very plating presentation making the food that much more enjoyable. I usually get a clam miso soup on the side.The waiters are very friendly and attentive.No matter what hours of the day i come here there is always a crowd of people, so you know this place is credible. (Parking may be difficult)

Reviews.Author: James N.
Reviews.Content: Definitely my favorite sushi place in Los Angeles, hands down.Located in the heart of Little Tokyo, the restaurant faces fierce competitions from its fellow Japanese brethren; but the quality of food that it produces makes it stands out among the other restaurants. This is the place that I always bring my girlfriend to for special occasions.Parking is definitely a minus here, as the parking space in the lot is very limited (there are about 10 other eateries in the same tiny plaza,) I often find myself parking on the street about a block away. If the lot is open, however, be prepared to shell out ~$2 even with validation.Wait time can also be very long; even on a Tuesday afternoon at 11:30, my girlfriend and I had to wait for a good half hour before we were seated; during busy hours you're probably looking at a 40 minute wait (depending on your party size, of course.)But is all the trouble finding a parking spot and waiting for a table worth it in the end?It definitely is.Sure, their menu can be intimidating in the price range (ranging from 25-35 for dinner,) but the sashimi that they produce is top-notch. My favorite is the sashimi combo- they give you a VERY generous amount of tuna, hamachi, snapper, spicy tuna, and other breeds for $15 (lunch) and $26 (dinner)- it's a STEAL for lunch. I have tried their beef/sashimi combo as well, and the amount of beef that they give you is pretty generous as well.Don't forget to get your ticket validated on the way out!

Reviews.Author: Helen K.
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between several other Japanese restaurants in a relatively quiet plaza sits Sushi-Gen, a cozy yet "happening" sushi spot that delivers good sushi to the local Los Angelonian masses. Don't be fooled by the place's tranquil facade- once you enter the restaurant, you'll be submerged into an atmosphere that is buoyant with multilingual conversations and as bold as the bright red-painted walls that encloses the quaint, yet clean space. The sushi was relatively fresh. To my (and most definitely my sinus') surprise, they pack their Tuna and Salmon sushi pieces with a little more wasabi than normal. Their spicy tuna roll and fresh water eel were particularly good, and their Ankimo was excellent but must be eaten fresh. Considering how busy they were, I was pleasantly surprised by the excellent service. Our adorable Japanese server was incredibly attentive, and she would come by every 5-10 minutes to refill our green tea. Parking hint: Though they usually place a "Lot Full" sign in front of the plaza parking lot, if you drive up to the entrance, the guys will usually move the sign for you and tell you there's a spot. $3 for parking with validation.

Reviews.Author: Mina M.
Reviews.Content: If I have to choose my last meal on Earth, it will be Sushi Gen.i've been here about 100 times now! once a month sometimes twice for the past 4 years. I've always loved loved their Sushi.I made some good friends with Sushi men there, and they are very friendly and helpful on choosing dishes.I like seating at the sushi bar better than the table.Their sushi is always FRESH and I espcially love their Uni & Snapper (ask them to make it with Lemon Salt sauce) which I can eat all Day and all Night!! Also, I like to pair my sushi with onikoroshi sake.!It's simply HEAVEN!I've never been during lunch time, but I'm sure it's also FANTASTIC!!Cheers to Sushi Gen!!! xo

Reviews.Author: CheBerks P.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Simply put, it's fresh melt in your mouth sushi. It's cut correctly, served at the perfect temperature and everything that sushi is supposed to be. My favorites are their sashimi combinations (which you can only get at the tables but its the best bang for your buck), the uni and the japanese red snapper. I've tried almost everything on their menu and while everything is great, I say stay away from the teriyaki dishes and the chicken karage. They are good but not worth the cost that they charge for these dishes. Besides, they are known for their sushi and not their bento boxes.Be careful at the bar, you could easily get lost in ordering sushi and sashimi and ultimately walk out with a healthy bill. Not a big deal for what you get but if you are expecting a $40 bill and walk out with an $80 bill, it dampens the experience. One of our favorite sushi places.

Reviews.Author: Loren L.
Reviews.Content: I've only ever come here for their Sashimi Lunch Special, which at $15 cannot be beat.  Be wary though; pretty much every person in the Greater Los Angeles area has heard about this outstanding establishment and what they have to offer at lunchtime...weekdays it'll be JAM PACKED with people waiting for their chance to chow down on raw fish.  Do yourself a favor and stop by, wait for a long time, and then enjoy the best sashimi lunch in LA!

Reviews.Author: Kimberley C.
Reviews.Content: Good Sushi @ a good price with an excellent wait staff.   Is it worth all the amazing reviews????? not sure about that!  I've eaten sushi all over the world from London to New York to Miami to St Tropez.  Nobu and others like him, at his caliber or those that are competing with him and doing even BETTER than he is at creative, succulent, luscious pieces of sushi.....THEN...... Sushi-Gen is sometimes convenient, mostly not because of the crowds and the lines waiting outside.I try to swing by and go and eat at the sushi bar ......because I know that I'll have a better shot to "eat & run" before going back to running my errands than a "wait in line forever"....and wanna kill myself for having to wait so long for a table!

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: One of the most expensive sushi restaurants I've been to but it's definitely one of the freshest sushi in La. The sashimi is deliciously tender and seriously melts in your mouth! Staff was very accommodating. Traditional Japanese decor to set the sushi styling atmosphere.  Worth the wait and good luck on finding a good parking spot!

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: If you want great quality sushi, you should try this place. This is by far my favorite sushi joint in Los Angeles. My girlfriend finally got to try this place for the first time and she enjoyed her sushi as much as mine. Note, if you sit at the bar, you will not be allowed to order the lunch special and be prepare to spend $$$ for quality sushi. I ended up paying $125 for sushi but the quality was really good.The sushi chef was very attentive and recommended us to something new. If you do not know what to order, ask what is good and the chef will make something good. Service was great as usual. The lady kept refilling our green tea without us asking for it. Definitely a place for 1st timer if you are willing to shell out the cash. If not, arrive early...I would say aaround 11:15am to wait on a table to order the lunch special.

Reviews.Author: May C.
Reviews.Content: Made last minute reservations for Friday night at 9 (with the amount of people that were there, I'd say reservations are necessary! So crowded!) and was super happy with the food!We had the edamame that came with a separate dish of salt so you can control the amount of salt sprinkled on top. We also had an order of the sashimi deluxe (~$30-$35) that had a wonderful variety of sashimi! There was the usual tuna, salmon, yellowtail but there was also some squid, octopus, crab, shrimp, tuna poke, tamago, spicy tuna, grilled salmon, and some brown, salty, earthy/flavorful fish mmmmm! There was a lot of sashimi on that plate.I also got an order of small tenpura that came with two shrimps, zucchini, potato, and eggplant which was all very tasty. We also ordered off the sushi/nigiri menu, which all came with two pieces: Japanese red snapper, uni, aji, yellow tail belly, toro, octopus and two bowls of rice. I was full and my date was uncomfortably full because he ate the bowl of rice and demolished the sashimi plate. I, on the other hand, wanted rice to accompany my tenpura so I was okay.I probably missed an order or two off the sushi/nigiri menu, and our bill came to $106. Our server was a sweet, older lady that helped me choose the best fish to try and on the way out, the hosts asked if we needed our parking validated so that was very nice :)We will definitely be back for the food and the service!

Reviews.Author: Kari R.
Reviews.Content: Yum! Got there before opening and there was already a line. Great sushi at amazing prices. So fresh

Reviews.Author: Yau L.
Reviews.Content: Host was unenthusiatic when me and my gf walked in. I asked if it was too late he muttered disgustingly, "We close at 9:30,(it was 9:15) but I can still seat u." He didn't even say hello or smiled. He just stared at us in an intimdating way as we walked in.We got seated in the corner booth and my gf asked me to ask the waiteress if they had Philly rolls with creamcheese. She kept saying huh? Like she didnt speak english well. I Ordered salmon sashimi 21$ for 7 pieces. Holy shit this place is PRICEY! I felt like walking out but I didnt want to look like an idiot. My gf ordered the california roll which was 18 pieces for 17 dollars. Holy moly!After we paid and prepared to walk out. A second waitress who seemed to speak english fluently, took our bill as we were walking out, and stopped us in our path and asked in a very sarcastic and intimidating way "is everything alright"?!? it seemed she was not pleased with the amount of tip we had left. This showed that they were very greedy for tips and some how expected us to give more. It justs means this place only cares about charging high prices and presenting minimal quantities.I don't know what all the hype is all about. Maybe this place is only for old and rich people who love to blow money. This was not for me. I have had same quaility and half the price at GIN SUSHI in pasadena.Overall Ill never come here again unless the world was about to end tomorrow and this was the last sushi restaurant on the planet.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth X.
Reviews.Content: I went to sushi gen last Saturday. The last time I went there is over 3 years ago. And this time it confirmed me again that this is a really over-rated + over-priced sushi place. Salmon, tuna, Uni and toro are all very mediocre. I can have all of them at half price in other sushi places with even better quality. Service is awful too. One of my friend found a lipstick mark on the cup of ice water and asked for replace. Then the waitress never came back...

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: Had the sashimi dinner, seems like the choice most people got. It was a great choice. Tasted very fresh with generous amount as they give u bowl of rice, miso soup, and small "salad". Complimentary wet towel along with good service was a plus. Ambiance is typical of what u would find in a sushi restaurant, except its always packed with happy customers consuming good sushi. Great place worth the price. I recommend making reservations, I only waited 5 minutes to get seated while some waited 45 minutes to an hour.  Consistent place, one of hundreds to choose from, yes i know, but this place has been around.  Check this place out and go to 'far bar' across the block for some good ambiance, music and drinks.

Reviews.Author: holly l.
Reviews.Content: My son and I went for sushi there this week. We go to Little Tokyo about twice week for sushi and always see a long line. We decided to try it and we waited for about forty  five minutes to get in. I got the sashimi platter and my son got two spicy tuna rolls.The sushi was good... nothing great and the miso soup was alright. The best thing was the tofu. We will stick to our regular sushi place that is better sushi and not such a long wait.

Reviews.Author: M H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen screwed up and gave our table away during the lunch hour rush and tried to fool us by saying a table will be ready in 10 mins! Yeah right, 10 mins my ass. Ugh, never again!

Reviews.Author: Albert K.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to Q for 30 minutes or more if you come during lunch hour. The ambience of the restaurant is purely traditional Japanese with an accent of bamboo and Hapi coats. The atmosphere is really jubilant and sociable, the waiters are enthusiastics to introduce you to the seafood selections, and the food is truly Japanese.I love coming hear to momentously savor the variety of sashimi and handrolls. If you're on a budget just try the sashimi lunch special for a beginner's experience to Japanese seafood; and if you got the guts for more raw and mysterious seafood, just order from the menu. I like to drink a cup of sake to wash down the crude taste after every bite. Since I am a frequent sashimi eater, I like to try new kinds roe and yellow tail. The sushi bar looks really good with the highly-talented crafters, but I'm gonna save up my dough for some more affordable sushi.Oh yeah I forgot to say that your bill WILL definitely be big!

Reviews.Author: Kris I.
Reviews.Content: I want to give it 4.5 stars, but I couldn't. I see some comments who say "fishy", "unexcited menu".... well welcome to one of the few authentic sushi place.  One guy made a good comment about good sushi smells like ocean.  Thats great statement.  Perhaps that is why I wanted to give 4.5.Sushi-gen has been opened since the 80's I believe (correct me if I'm wrong).  They have been keeping their strict guidelines for many years.  That is something cultural.  That also speaks for it's freshness and taste as well.  Not sure about recently at night, because I only go during LUNCH time when they have the fresh stuff...My family invited a sushi chef from "Japan" (our friend) and ate here when he came visited us.  He was overwhelmed with the quality (long long time ago when there was no waiting line)  The decor and lighting might not be that great, but this is a place where we should let the sushi speak.*** If you want to enjoy the lighting and the color of the wall then go to Kabuki, etc.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: Best hamachi I have ever had.  If you are looking for some amazing traditional sushi at a reasonable price then this is the place to go.  One tip, I would avoid the toro because it can be pricey and not as good as other sushi spots in LA (i.e. Katsu-ya).

Reviews.Author: Yelppy M.
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW WOW!!!! Did I mention WOW? This place was amazing!!! I drove over an hour to get here based on the stellar reviews to treat my mom to a special birthday lunch, and although I was apprehensive on taking my mom on her special day to a place I had never tried myself before, all I have to say is WOW! Not only did Sushi-gen not disappoint, but it exceeding my expectations! I love sushi, and this is by far one of, if not the best experiences I've had. The place is an un-pretentious casual friendly restaurant with EXCELLENT sushi. My mom and I sat at the bar where you can only order sushi, but after the drive, that was all that I wanted to have anyways. The fish was all amazingly fresh and the staff was very friendly and very quick to serve you. The fish was so fresh and so buttery and full of it's natural oils that it was like trying real sushi for the first time, and not the frozen re-thawed out ones we have probably all experienced.  We were also very lucky, because we didn't arrive until around 12:30pm on a Thursday and expected to have to wait for 40 minutes or so, but we waited only about 10 minutes! I definitely recommend sitting at the sushi bar if you are planning on having sushi only. The sushi chefs are great and you really create a rapport with them, the service is fast, and you can order whenever you want without having to wait for the waiter/tress.I have only been here once due to distance but it's SOOO worth it if you're close by, and even if you're not like me, if you're heading up that way, stop by the sushi will make your mouth water!

Reviews.Author: Paolo D.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I've had in L.A. and in California so far, fish and rice combination has a flavor that closely matches what's in Japan. Prices are too high and the sake list is laughable. It gets really crowded on weekends so get there early or be ready to wait a while! I would not go with a big group of friends. Two people will wait 15 minutes tops, four people more like 30 to 45 minutes.Bottom line...go there to reminisce about Japan's sushi~ drink at home!

Reviews.Author: Casey C.
Reviews.Content: It wasn't very pleasure visit. I can write a book about how much I don't like this restaurant, but I won't. I'll try to keep it as short as possible. Sashimi was fresh. That's for sure. But I'm not giving five stars just for the freshness. That's how sashimi is supposed to be. Service was mediocre and it was too crowded. I don't know. May be I was there on a wrong date at a wrong time. Over 200 people rated this place with an average of 4 1/2 stars and I'm only giving this place three stars. May be I'll try this place again IF someone takes me for a treat.  Otherwise, I probably won't go again.

Reviews.Author: Catherine C.
Reviews.Content: I have to give this place 5 stars!They serve the best sashimi ever with such reasonable (unusually cheap?!) price. Since I had been here, I've always compare other sushi places with Sushi Gen. I tried even more expensive places but man~ Sushi Gen is still unbeatable!Lunch special is really really special with the variety, quantity, quality, and the price of the meal. I always get sashimi special. Their fish is so tender, soft, and fresh. I don't know which part of fish they use. The fish tasted like it could melt in your mouth! I thought about taking out one star because they only serve salmon salad instead of sliced salmon  sashimi, but I couldn't because the fish is just too good to be true for less than $15!The wait for lunch is awfully long (Mon to Fri only). I still think it's worth it! I loved it so much I even came for dinner. Dinner gets more expensive and not much more food, but I think the price is still decent with its quality. After all, I cannot always afford to wait in line for lunch. :PI hate that I'm moving out of LA. How can I find such a good sushi place with this kind of price in the Bay Area?! :(

Reviews.Author: Stephanie A.
Reviews.Content: 5 star for the quality of the sashimi (prices taken into consideration)The uni dinner is heavenly, though a bit pricey. good bargain for uni-lover. For a refreshing and deliiicious lunch, opt for the sashimi lunch (which is way cheaper than its sashimi dinner - $16), which includes steamed tofu appetizer, miso soup, rice, as well as the sashimi plate (that is pretty accomodating, i have to say). Now, the downside? the waiting time can be a drag! especially if you have a party bigger than 4. I usually like to pop out either at 1pm for lunch (which is near closing time 2pm) or 8.30/9pm for dinner - which is perfect time and you dont have to squeeze with other people!Overall, sushi gen is still my fav place to go when i have that raw fish craving! de-lii-ciouuss!

Reviews.Author: Janet L.
Reviews.Content: The sushi here is ridiculous.So perfect, literally melts in your mouth to where you're like, no~ don't disappear yet. :)I was disappointed at first, they didn't have any fun rolls, but soon realized that this is the true way to eat sushi. :)  (I have left all grown up, hehe)Roll-lovers may be converted here. Don't be afraid to try. ;)

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: I was treated to a meal here by one of the biggest diamond dealers in LA. The details are fuzzy - all I can remember is sheer pleasure. It didn't hurt that the man spared no expense in what he ordered.I'd recommend Komasa over this place, honestly. The food is *basically* as good and at about a third of the price. (Or so I'd estimate - I never saw the bill, though I heard rumors.) I'd pay the extra for the uni at Sushi-Gen, though.

Reviews.Author: Unis K.
Reviews.Content: Japanese people have told me about Sushi Gen, so I had reasonably high expectations going in. They did not fail me. If you are looking for hip, young, trendy, famous, Hollywood, and all that jazz and pay for a premium, go somewhere else. If you want yummy raw fish, do try Sushi Gen.It was not cheap as the bill came out to about $80 per person, but then again we ate a LOT.If you want to park in the plaza's lot, pay $2.50 upfront for 3 hours (with validated ticket). They'll start charging you if you're there for too long.--Service - 4 starsThe wait was unbearable, but I won't hold that against the restaurant. The hostess was very friendly and assured us that we get our seats at the sushi bar. And even though we sat in the very corner right next to the kitchen, our hot teas were refilled in a timely manner, and dishes brought/taken away quickly.--Ambiance - 3 starsThe place was surprisingly small and cozy. None of that snooty modern decor- there was a lot of wood inside. It was a little crowded but not too noisy, and the sushi bar was fun. Sit at the sushi bar if possible, you'll get to know the chefs and they will apparently hook you up. I saw several regulars getting something special. It's a fun, cozy and friendly place without the 'modern' decor that, sadly, is sometimes evidence of the owners trying too hard to make the place classier and charge you extra for mediocre sushi.I really didn't care for the ambiance, I just wanted some good sashimi, and they did not disappoint.--Food - 5 starsThe fish was fresh and delicious. Once I saw the fish, I didn't bother with the rolls; I need to have as much sushi and sashimi as possible when there is good fish available.I think we had toro, tuna, uni, yellowtail, sweet shrimp, salmon, albacore, fluke fin, eel handroll, and a few other things.. They were all DELICIOUS.I was beyond stuffed by the time we were done with our meal, but was very happy. For any sushi lovers out there, Sushi Gen offers fresh raw fish- what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Author: F. Roman C.
Reviews.Content: Ever have fish melt in your mouth?  It happened at Sushi-Gen!! There is nothing on this Earth that compares to the sushi here while downing large quantities of sake.It's in a small strip mall in a private lot -- so get there early if you want a parking spot.  Otherwise, roam the streets of downtown LA for a spot.Although they take reservations, we had none and tempted fate by arriving when they opened.  Luckily, a party didn't show and we were seated.I am still dreaming of the sushi...so I have to go feed the beast there again...this time with reservations!

Reviews.Author: lo k.
Reviews.Content: Take it from someone Japanese, Sushi Gen is great.It's not the place if you want those trendy LA sushi rolls, but a great place for authentic Japanese food, and great, super fresh fish. I recommend the sashimi dinner. It has a little of everything and it's a great price. The only reason it's not 5 star is that the wait can be pretty horrendous. Notwithstanding, I'll wait for great sushi. I don't think there's a better place for low key, fresh sushi.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Good Service At The Sushi Bar!I finally experienced Sushi Gen after hearing about it for over a year.  On an early Wednesday afternoon (5:30p), I was able to walk in and sit down at the bar.  I ordered most of what I normally do, but did ask the chef for a recommendation or two.  Here's the breakdown:Uni - pretty good quality, but I have had better at Wa Sushi and Sachi.Yellowtail - delicious, fresh, very good and highly recommendRed Snapper - fresh, delicious with the sauce they put onSpicy Tuna Handroll - not a big fan of the tuna in this one, the only item I would steer away fromSpanish Mackeral - so glad I asked for a recommendation, they prepare it with enough flavor that you don't need soy sauce.  Sooooo Good.I would definitely return and keep it in my top list of sushi bars.  My meal was about 50 bucks including a small bottle of dry sake (before gratuity).

Reviews.Author: roger w.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so i heard so much hype with this place and as a sushi lover, i had to see what all the fuss is all about....Lets just say this, for me, sushi-gen is too fancy.  you get small portions but a big check in the end.....i mean, sure there are some things that i ordered that was just ok, but come on , could you slice the fish any thinner?  they make the entrees all nice and pretty but im not here for that.  just give me good food at a fair price please!  In summary, if you want sub-par sushi, and have money to waste, this is the place for you....otherwise, please go to Mako Sushi in Arcadia, tell the chef I sent you....

Reviews.Author: Alain W.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi. Period. Seating at the bar is highly recommended. Toro was amazing. Girlfriend asked for seconds, and she usually doesn't! Also ordered oyster shooters, uni, kampachi, amaebi, monkfish liver, albacore and a few others that I can't quite remember, but they were all very fresh and well cut. Rice was perfectly made as usual. Our chef was also very friendly. Staff is overall nice, though they seem to be running around a lot more than other places. Can't blame them, the place is always packed. Had to run to car to grab girlfriend's passport for an ID check because of the oyster shooters. "No id, no shooters for you" Well, I guess that's a compliment. For the quality and variety, price was not excessive. HIghly recommended if you are a sushi fan.

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: This place sucks!After waiting for 45 minute for a table, we finally sat down. Getting our drinks took a while but that was ok because we were excited to try the food. We ordered the deluxe sashimi plater and some spicy tuna rolls. The platter was not that great, but the spicy tuna was ok. The food is too authentic for the casual sushi eater. I don't think I would eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: Pretty darn good sushi! Not cheap but worth it. I've only had a few places better than this.  Had the monk liver for the first time, but I'd recommend staying with the sushi.  Saw my relatives that own Mikawaya next door there also on the same night, so you know this place is legit!Gave the sushi chef there the reigns to make me sushi and sashimi and then some more sushi! Everything was very fresh and tasty... you  can't go wrong here and you know its legit and not some KOREANNNNN Japanese restaurant, trying to front as some Japanese restaurant.... holla!!

Reviews.Author: Nancy V.
Reviews.Content: One of the best, if not THE best, places for sushi in Little Tokyo/Downtown Los Angeles.  The sushi is so fresh it melts in your mouth and the dinner plates are hefty portions for the price.  Advice:- Make reservations beforehand!- Dress casual (not a fancy place and you can walk around Little Tokyo before and after)- Free meter parking on the streets after 7pm- $50 total for 2 (drinks, appetizers, a few dishes, tip, etc.)

Reviews.Author: Missy L.
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to yelp about this place because I don't want it to get busier than it already is.Go during off hours...early/late lunch or early/late dinner....I haven't had to wait at all if you go during those times.  You must eat at the sushi bar.  You get the best service and get your sushi instantaneously....although there is a danger in that.  You definitely eat way too much, way too fast, and your bill turns out to be way too big.  Hahha.  But well worth it.  Amazingly fresh sushi.  Hamachi, toro, uni, etc, etc....delish.  I could eat here every single day of my life.  I LOVE YOU, SUSHI-GEN!!  I'm always on the search for amazing sushi.  And this one tops the list so far....

Reviews.Author: Samantha T.
Reviews.Content: I only tried their sashimi and sushi and I have to say their sushi is very fresh and delicious. Their sashimi deluxe is the number one dish, as I was recommended by my friend, and I was totally in love with it. ALL of the sashimi, even ones that I would not have ordered by myself, tasted terrific.Not only is their most popular dish, the sashimi deluxe, a wonderful experience, but also, their other sushi were great too. So all in all, there is no question about the quality of their food.However, my only complaint is that, because the restaurant is so popular and so many people go there, I feel that their service is not good enough, which is not a huge problem since many popular restaurants are like that.I highly recommend this restaurant, but please prepare to wait in line unless you arrive before the restaurant opens.

Reviews.Author: Adam S.
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype, this place is amazing! Personal faves were the Japanese Mackerel (best Ive ever had), and the Toro. We also tried the Hamachi Collar which was fall off the bone amazing too... A must in LA if you like seafood even the least bit..

Reviews.Author: Phu L.
Reviews.Content: Would have been 5 stars if they still had what I wanted. The things I did get was great though: tuna, yellowtail, salmon, toro. Missed out on the abalone and yellowtail bellyI also tried the california and spicy tuna roll for fun. Don't waste money/time on those and just stick to the real sushi. Komasa has way better cali and spicy rolls. Had reservations at 830 was seated a lil bit earlier which was nice.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Large portions, high quality sushi (as far as my poor knowledge of good sushi knows, which is my tongue), and very fair prices. I had no complaints.

Reviews.Author: joanna l.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at Sushi-Gen, and honestly, I was not expecting good sushi, given the run-down look the place had from the outside.And again, I was taught the lesson: "Don't judge a book by it's cover" cause the sushi was pretty darn good! :DI ordered the chiraishi (~$27: bowl of rice topped with various sashimi pieces) and loved it! It's definitely one of the better ones that I've tried at various restaurants in Little Tokyo. The sushi was really fresh. I was really impressed. :)It's definitely one of the pricier sushi restaurants, but i think the quality is totally worth it. :)I'm only giving 4 stars, cause this place lacks a little bit of something to make me want to come back (other than the food). maybe service? charm?

Reviews.Author: Chih W.
Reviews.Content: yes sir this place is good.   I don't frequent this restaurant often but it's just the way I remembered from 20+ years ago.  We came right before 11am there was already a line waiting for the place to open.  I guess everyone is waiting to get in for the $17 sashimi special.  That's what we got tasted pretty decent can't beat the price..I rank it 4 stars plus all the people/line/reputation +1 = 5 stars.Congrats sushi-gen keep up the good work.

Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: Hadn't been there in more than a decade but met a friend for lunch.  Still a busy place with a waiting line out the door.  The sashimi set isn't as generous as it was but the price hasn't gone up as quickly as the market price of fish, so it is explainable.  Everything was still top quality and fresh.  The service is still good but I it seemed there were fewer waiting staff.  As a result, the waitress forgot our rice.  I still believe Sushi-Gen offers the best sushi as it has the widest variety of seafood and it is fresh.  It can do this because it is always busy and does't have to risk as much in terms of spoilage.  The only place in LA which was better was Sushi-Co but that cost $250 per person back in the mid 1980's and has since moved to NY.  I'd like to find a place locally that offers live fish kept in tanks which i experienced in my travel to Japan.

Reviews.Author: George C.
Reviews.Content: A week day around 12pm, already a crap load of people outside waiting. Had to wait 45 min for a table (but it was al worth it). You could also sit at the bar but they do not offer lunch specials at the bar.Sashimi lunch is usually what I go for. It has tuna, toro, yellow tail, octopus, grilled salmon, spicy tuna and some misc. Generous portion and delicious if you asked me, and at $15 it is well priced.They have an outdoor parking lot ($3) or you can opt for street parking ($4 for 2 hours).The hype is very real.

Reviews.Author: Kumiko Y.
Reviews.Content: Very good sushi....I am japanese but still admit that it was very good.try their chirashi sushi!

Reviews.Author: Jina H.
Reviews.Content: You can't have fresher sushi in LA then this place!I go this place at least once a month even it's pretty expensive.Everytime i go, i have to wait at least more than 20 mins but it's worthy.I will earn more money to have the best sushi here! lol

Reviews.Author: Cameron O.
Reviews.Content: Maybe the best tuna I've ever had. Amazing.Sashimi plate is enough for two people and it costs $35. Thrown in an appetizer, another roll, a beer, and some sake ... you're looking at about $40 a person for some of the best sushi you can get.

Reviews.Author: Jess A.
Reviews.Content: I can eat oysters because of this place. I don't eat oysters anywhere else. I also can eat uni/ sea urchin because of this place. I don't eat it anywhere else. Also.Love their:Albacore with ponzu sauceSpicy tuna rollHamachi/yellowtail with scallions rollChicken teriyaki set, salmon teriyaki set, beef teriyaki setTamago/egg sushiTheir sashimi is super fresh. Salmon, yellowtail, I like those...I don't really like tuna sashimi, don't know why, but their spicy tuna roll is good.Lines can get long during busy hours, wish they took reservations also. But even so, worth the wait cos food is yummy!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy D.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant.  I'll be blunt - I love sushi.  I've eaten at just about every sushi joint in Orange County, and quite a few in LA County.  Nothing compares to this place.  The freshness of the fish (salmon, tuna, yellowtail, you name it) gave me this tingling sensation of unparalleled satisfaction...and no, it's not because I ate Fugu. My favorite entree is the Salmon Collar.  The outside is perfectly blackened, encapsulating a sweet, tender, juicy and succulent center that tastes like no sea creature you've ever sampled before.  After staring blissfully with a distant smile on your face for a few seconds, you realize that you're simply eating salmon.  The businessman sitting across the restaurant gives you an awkward look because you may or may not have been inadvertently staring at him during the dreamy moment of the first salmon collar bite, but you don't care.  You have an entire plate of salmon collar in front of you waiting to be finished!  Couple that with one of their sashimi lunch specials and you're in for one of the best Japanese lunches you'll ever eat.  Last time I went, they were out of salmon collar, and a part of me wanted to cry on the inside...but that's cool.  The beef's pretty good too.

Reviews.Author: Johnny W.
Reviews.Content: I came here last week with my parent because my mom's friend always talk such good stuff about this place, after coming here, I finally understood whyService: the Service was great, the waitress keep coming over to ask if i need more water or rice when it seems like I am out and the food was send out really fast tooFood: I ordered the Sashimi lunch combo, Freakin good, best Sashimi I had in a long time for only 15 bucks. I would definitely come here again, the fish was fresh and the platter looks very organized, kinda just make you wanna chow it down immediately. Their rice was good. The lunch combo also come with Miso Soup and some pickle, both taste great tooOverall: I would definitely come to this place again if I ever had a chance to go down to downtown La again, love to eat at this place. Warning, come here early for lunch so you can get in the first round, not really down to wait that long because so many people are always there.

Reviews.Author: Frank T.
Reviews.Content: Short Review: As far as I know...Food: 100% (clean and large portions for price)Drinks: 100% (as far as I know)Service: 100% (kind service people and they operate quickly)Parking: 80% (toll. stamp needed to get out for cheap-er)Wait: 70% (if you choose to sit at table that and considering the toll)Price: 80% (some items are absurdly expensive)My father introduced me to this awesome restaurant on a random weekday. From what I can remember, the guy who helped me made it seem like lunch specials are where they get a lot of business.My dad and I chose to sit at a table because he wanted to introduce me to their lunch special plates.What we got:$15 plate of lunch special sashimi  I'm not sure what different kinds of fish were on there, but I can say they were all raw and looked extremely delicious and tasted that way.  We ordered water, which was fresh and was constantly refilled.  We were visited frequently enough about how we were doing, so we never had to call them over.  Parking was a bit difficult to manage with a truck, but we got it to work. Also, we got our entrance card stamped. The toll can vary, so never pull out and show them a lot of money.The wait... that was the most annoying part. We waited outside against the wall for at least 30 minutes. Don't get me wrong, the place was pretty much packed because everybody wanted to sit down at the tables. Sushi bar only serves sushi (kitchen vs sushi bar), so there were frequently seats available. Only sushi items at the sushi bar.The menu is small, but you can customize some things for your personal preference.Oh, and of course, they give an awesome bowl of miso soup. Careful, it's hot.

Reviews.Author: J. N.
Reviews.Content: Go for lunch! It's cheaper and the sushi still tastes deliciously great! I got the Grilled Collared Salmon with a sashimi appetizer. It came with rice, soup, and a small plate of salad all for $15. Might I say they offer a generous sized salmon. It was tender, juicy, and matched great with the light green onion soy sauce. The combination was fantastic, healthy, and satisfying.+good service & definitely a clean place (host kept trying to keep a persistent fly out while still managing the seats)

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars to the most important thing that matters, FOOD!The sushi is fresh. I repeat, the sushi is FRESH! It's amazing of what you can actually eat and enjoy when the fish is fresh. If you're brave enough, ask the chef to prepare you his choice of "rare" fish. ;)I don't really care for the other side dishes to be honest. I'm only there for one thing. The wait can be brutal, but you're going to have to wait at any decent restaurant in the area. Just make sure you get your valet ticket validated.

Reviews.Author: Stacy L.
Reviews.Content: I love Sushi-Gen, they serve the freshest sushi ever! I always go to this restaurant every time when I'm at Los Angeles.  During the dinner rush, the wait could be a bite long, but it worth await. This is authentic Japanese sushi. The workers are really nice and pleasant. We like to sit at the sushi bar because I like to see how the chef cut and make the sushi. We ordered Nigiri only, so the bill was slightly high but was acceptable. Specially, with the quality of the sushi were served.Below are my personal flavor Nigiri:-Sweet Shrimp -Scallops-giant clam-toro -tuna -Japanese Snapper-Yellow tail

Reviews.Author: Kristen Y.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen = sashimi heaven!This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in L.A.  The sashimi is super fresh - my favorites are the toro and yellowtail (you get a good amount of them when you order the sashimi deluxe platter, it's big enough for two people to share).If I were just rating this place on their sashimi I would definitely give them 5 stars, but I had to knock down a star because some of the other items on their menu were only okay.  The chicken teriyaki was only mediocre, a bit on the dry side.  You should definitely come here for the sashimi experience.The only drawback to this place is that there is a really long line every night - but that's already expected since this place is so great!

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: Um wow...this place BLEW my mind. The sushi was super fresh, the fish totally melted in my mouth. The flavors were simple yet very effective and DELICIOUS. I definitely recommend this place.The one downside - LOOOOOOONG wait on a Friday night. I mean LOOONNNG. And it was cold waiting outside. Definitely try and make a res (not sure if they take them). The tempura was super light, fresh and delicious. I can't recommend this place enough, will definitely be returning.Oh, and another down side - because they were so crowded, we were asked to leave after out meal. We were just winding down from being so full and shooting the sh**, but then homedude came up and told us we had to go. LOL!The end.

Reviews.Author: Jae K.
Reviews.Content: For lunch specials, hands down the best place to enjoy sushi.we had sashimi special and kenpachi head special.the kenpachi head, may not be so pretty but very good. it also came with sashimi appetizer.the service was pretty good. may be little slow but the ladies are friendly and try their best.got there around 12:11 and there were 10 tables before us already. waited about 30 mins. don't forget to put your name.left around 1:30 and still many people waiting outside. Get here early( they open at 11 am)  or be ready to wait.validation is good for 3 hrs for $3.walk around little tokyo and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Author: Monkey T.
Reviews.Content: Dinner is overpriced but decent.Go for the lunch specials!!! Fresh quality sashimi sets for $16!!! They even offer carry-out which is SMAT if you want to avoid the long wait.

Reviews.Author: Husam S.
Reviews.Content: Hello good sushi.This 80 style sushi bar, has all the charm one would expect in Little Tokyo.  The staff is super helpful and on point.  It can get a bit crowded, but if you manage to get a table, you'll be in for a treat.I had a birthday dinner here. The food was amazing, the drinks always flowing, the fish fresh, the cooked dishes well seasoned.  But the price was a bit high for the quality/ quantity of the food.  It's good.  I would go back.

Reviews.Author: Sean K.
Reviews.Content: Top notch sushi.  Best that I have had in LA, so far.Yellowtail belly, Monkfish liver, Toro, Amaebi were all fantastic.  We especially enjoyed their Kanpachi, which is melt in your mouth tender.  Uni was very fresh, and scallops had a nice little grating of citron peel.  They offered to put the amaebi heads into a miso soup for us.Authentic and highly recommended.  Be prompt, with your entire party or they will give your table away, as this is a busy establishment.Not cheap.  If you like the good cuts, expect to pay $100/person, though prices are not on the sushi check list.

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: We had the sashimi deluxe, salmon shioyaki, and a miso soup.  The salmon comes with a choice of sashimi or tempura (I chose tempura), miso soup, sunomono, and a very small dish of pickles and lettuce. The sashimi deluxe does not include anything else, which is why we ordered the extra miso.  The sashimi deluxe and salmon were good.  Here is the problem - the dishes didn't arrive at the same time.  They served the miso soups, pickles, and sunomono.  Then a few minutes later, the tempura came out.  WHY?  Shouldn't that be served with the salmon?   Ok.  That's fine.  As long as the salmon and sashimi deluxe come out together.  Guess what?  Salmon came out and we had to wait about five minutes or more for the sashimi.  WTH?  And I hate the fact that the soup is served first (this is not an American or European restaurant).  I should've said something, but the soup was hot and it came with a lid, so I was able to keep it hot until the main dishes came out.I would've given it four stars, but the service thing messed up the whole experience.  I wouldn't come back here.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is my favorite sushi place in L.A!  As good as it gets... fresh and authentic! It's always fun sitting at the sushi bar and trying new pieces, I always ask them to surprise me with something different :)If you're into fusion sushi rolls, this is not the restaurant for you, this is straightforward authentic sushi...  I always get  Yellow tail belly, Mackerel, monk fish liver, tuna and toro.... oh their Toro!  It melts in your mouth! There is no way to describe it! Simply Amazing!I usually go on Saturdays, and there is always a line even before they open, so I suggest to be there 40min before... It's worth the wait, trust me! You can always walk around Little Tokyo and try the creme brulee mochi ice cream :)

Reviews.Author: Mie H.
Reviews.Content: Gen sushi is amazing! Every time i go there, they are very busy so you gotta wait for more than 20~30 mins, but it's worthy to wait ;)

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: Fresh sashimi at great price!  The negative is the long wait during lunch.  I would not go there for any business lunch unless you have an assistant who is willing to spend 30 to 40 minutes waiting for you at the line.  (There are 15 to 20 people waiting there every day from 11AM) The bar is less of wait and the sushi man can make some of their best rolls!

Reviews.Author: Michael Y.
Reviews.Content: Probably one if the freshest sushi around this town. Very busy and that keeps the fish going and coming. Meaning there's a high turnover. No need to worry about eating old fishVery busy.  Make reservation if they take it

Reviews.Author: Howard C.
Reviews.Content: Very fresh and so, so good! Sat at the very crowded bar, as I was solo. Quickly ordered and was served almost immediately with sashimi. Hamachi belly was so buttery and decadent. Ordered a second serving! You can get more "platter" type options in the dining room but the bar is efficient and very enjoyable. Pricy but worth every penny!

Reviews.Author: Aaron C.
Reviews.Content: You know what I like about sushi-gen?  It's a restaurant that snowballed into success.  The sheer amount of sushi they output a day means they can buy in huge massive bulks.  Not just the standard kind, but the fresh quality kind too.  Sushi-Gen's buying power in the fish market is undeniable and explained in its food and prices.For dinner, a $21 dollar chirashi includes a bunch of standard fish from tuna to yellow tail to salmon, to other types of fish you don't see... Did I mention the nice slab of toro you get along with it?  At any regular sushi place, this chirashi would have sky rocketed to at least $30 because of it.Sushi-Gen offers real quality sushi with experienced chefs on a nice budget.  This is why there's so many people and why even sushi fanatics like me are willing to wait over an hour and leave full and happy.

Reviews.Author: Rod D.
Reviews.Content: Go there, get the sashimi dinner, experience a little piece of heaven.  This place has great sushi and sashimi.  This is LA and there are plenty of Japanese transplants here.  If you ask them where they go in LA for sushi, I can guarantee you that they will name Sushi Gen in the top 5 with other big name sushi joints.  There's often a line and you have to wait to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Janie L.
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best sushi experiences I've had in LA! Make sure you come here with ample time for your dining experience. The restaurant opens at 5 and we went around 5:15 on a Saturday night. There was about a 30 minute wait for a table. We ordered the salmon skin salad, giant clam special, sushi deluxe, and sashimi deluxe. The salmon skin salad makes for a great appetizer and is one of the better salmon skin salads I've had. The sashimi deluxe was my favorite. It was very fresh!! There's a good variety of fish and it comes with a bowl of rice, which was also delicious. I highly recommend Sushi-Gen for sushi lovers!

Reviews.Author: Elisa H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious sushi. Best deal is on weekdays during lunch. If you like sashimi then you have to get the sashimi lunch special. Totally worth it. They also serve the special during dinner for a little more and it includes tempura. Be aware there will be a wait, it gets packed fast during lunch time.

Reviews.Author: Brandon R.
Reviews.Content: The only issue i had with this place was driving to downtown.  The food was everything that it was built up to be.  The sushi pieces & sashimi were as fresh and tasty as i've had.  You really feel like your at authentic sushi spot, i would highly recommend Sushi-Gen.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: People go crazy over this place, but to be honest.. I think it's a little overrated. I mean yes, the sashimi is good, but I wouldn't say it's the best that I've had. For the price you pay, however, it's definitely worth it. With $15, you get a good variety of sashimi and everything comes out super fast. We waited for about an hour or so, but we finished all our food within 20 minutes. If you're looking for some out-of-this-world yummy sashimi, this isn't it. But if you want good quality sashimi at a reasonable price... COME TO SUSHI GEN! Keep in mind though that this isn't the best place to come if you're in a rush, seeing as the waiting time is usually at least an hour.

Reviews.Author: Ume E.
Reviews.Content: This is always consistently great sushi.   Always fresh, never had a bad piece of fish here.  The only bummer is the long waits... but hey, there's a reason why this place has em waiting to give them their cash haha.

Reviews.Author: PJ P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing sushi and the sashimi plate that everyone is also talking about.  I know something about sushi.  I've eaten some amazing sushi in some of the most famous places in Tokyo.  I had o-toro, chu-toro, and variety of other sushi at Sushi-Gen.  This place buys tuna from Spain.  I don't know if Oma tuna gets to the U.S. (I highly doubt) but the Spain tuna is pretty much the second best.  Their toro is simply amazing.  I highly admire their obviously superior knowledge of fish as a buyer.  Alternatively, their cheaper plate - $15 sashimi plate was very tasty and well put together.

Reviews.Author: DM Y.
Reviews.Content: How I wish that my search for our replacement of R23 ( pre-2010 ), Nishimura ( now that it is closed ) and Katsuya ( before it sold out and went commercial ) will be finally over! While the quality of fish is good overall, I felt like I was dining in a neighborhood diner - no ambience, perfunctory service, and hardly any interaction between the chefs and the patrons beyond the minimal. May be I am expecting too much, after being spoiled for many years at R23, Nishimura and Katsuya? May be the perfunctory service is by design, so they can turn over the tables/sushi bar seats faster? If all you care is food, you may be satisfied. For me, I look for celestial food, attentive service ( yes you can find that in sushi restaurants too! ) and inviting ambience. Otherwise, I can do better staying home or going over to a friend's.

Reviews.Author: Rosanna K.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi restaurant by far... The quality of their food are amazing!! Must sit at the bar to experience the full effect of sushi gen. Tai ( japanese white fish ) and halibut fin are to die for..

Reviews.Author: Steven A.
Reviews.Content: Been a regular customer for several years and they normally serve my order on my table in 10 minutes or less as usual until that day which I had to wait for almost 45 minutes for my order to come to my table while my Dad already got his order 45 mins earlier and even waited for me to get my order on my table.. The waitress kept insisting that it'll come soon every time I asked.

Reviews.Author: Perer O.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best sushi out there!  This place is a must for anyone who likes sushi.  Me and my wife just let the sushi chef make whatever he felt like and it was phenomenal!  This place is a staple and a standard setter for the rest of our lives.  Unfortunately I don't think we will be able to find any other sushi restaurants in the near future that match this places expertise.  Clearly if you read all the reviews and compare ratings this place stands out in all of LA.  Its not a coincidence.

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: So my girlfriend had been raving about Sushi Gen for a long time, especially since we always passed it when we went to Aloha Cafe next door (also a really good place in the same strip mall), and when my mom came to town we finally took the dive. I felt like I was back in Tokyo at one of the local haunts I went to when visiting, and the fish was so good.You may be turned off by the price and a small menu that you find online, but that's shouldn't stop you. First off, most of the dinners come with a ton of food (salad, soup, rice etc etc.), so much so that my mom was full on the sides/apps before her main dish appeared. They also offer a lot of appetizers and their meals a al carte, which can be great for the foodie looking to try everything. Though if you are a fish lover, I suggest that at least one of you get the sushi or sashimi combo, its guaranteed to be a crowd pleaser.

Reviews.Author: Rung T.
Reviews.Content: BEST SUSHI in town!!!My bf took me to this place. Worth every penny he spent :PThe sushi is so fresh. I tried their beef teriyaki, it's great. One tip from me is if you want to eat only sushi, you'd better sit at the bar. I think it taste better there.Don't have anything much to say but just go. Try it and you will go back there again.

Reviews.Author: Josephine C.
Reviews.Content: Love this sushi place!! It's my favorite!! I usually sit at the sushi bar and order their uni, toro, amaebi, salmon, japanese red snapper, tamago, aji, etc...I'd eat this anytime!!!!

Reviews.Author: amil e.
Reviews.Content: Are you guys kidding me?????? This place blows for the money.Ive had it all in LA. and im talking about quality places from the hole in the walls to the $$$$ places and what  my experience today was just terrible. After all the hype I decided to check it out since people try to tell me that its better than my usual favorite spot Sushi Iki. I ordered:Yellowtail Sashimi (joke)Albacore Sushi (3/5)2 Red Snapper Sushi(5/5) the only tasty thing on the menuHalibut  Sushi (3/5)Salmon Sushi (0/5) ive never had a sushi taste this fishy ever at a sushi spot. the salmon did not go in right at all. in fact i think im getting sick from it.Spanish Makeral Sushi (3/5)Makeral Bones (1/5) sad part is they dont even know how to deep fry this correctlyAll this came out to about $110 with two unfiltered nigori cheap saki bottles. Usually I go for the Otokayama but felt like getting unfiltered today.Now lets say all the fish was amazing for this price and their tiny ass portion sizes I would say it was more like a $60 meal.Id rather cork over the extra money and go to Matsuhisa or Urasawa.

Reviews.Author: Jeeun P.
Reviews.Content: Wish I can give them an extra half star.My go to sushi place in LA overall because of their combination of price and quality.

Reviews.Author: Carrie B.
Reviews.Content: I am not the type of person who is willing to wait in line for a restaurant.  But my mother was in town and she really wanted to go, so my mother my husband and I waited for an hour IN THE RAIN to be seated.Lemme tell you: I would wait for two.That is, hands down, the best sushi I have ever had.  I cannot imagine anything better than the albacore I had that night.  Poor albacore.  Lucky me.

Reviews.Author: Richard T.
Reviews.Content: I used to be a regular. They always had the best quality fish. Then one day...;(It just wasn't the same...maybe I was having a bad day?I don't think so. I heard they changed owners.

Reviews.Author: Aaron W.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice now in the last week, and it is worth every penny!First time I was here and sat at the bar for some omakase, and the second time I had nigiri at the table. I have to say that going omakase is definitely the way to go at sushi gen.
