Customers have to remember that the whole point of a sushi bar is so that there is an interaction between the chef and the diner. Like a guest, the customer is treated to an enjoyable evening while the chef prepares the fish as he sees fit.Compared with my experience in Japan however, sushi-gen is still not the best. Some of the fish were lacking in flavor, and the order of the fish is problematic at times. The tamago was boring and stiff, and the yellowtail belly was slice thin. However, hats off to the unagi and the amaebi, which were quite good. The amaebi was firm and vibrant in flavor - sweet but not overwhelming, tender but chewable. I think the amaebi that I had a la carte was only $6, and it came with two soups with the heads. Amazing deal. Will definitely visit again to try the lunch specials, but I think i'll be tempted by the omakase again. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Author: Adeline J.
Reviews.Content: I wonder if there is really a need to add on reviews for Sushi-Gen. It's heavenly in here.Make sure you do a reservation if you want to be seated within 15 minutes. My friends and I ordered tempura dinner, sushi combination and sashimi set. From the appetizers to desserts, everything was A+ even if you can't appreciate Japanese food.Best toro sushi ever. Don't hesitate anymore, make a reservation now!

Reviews.Author: lamb l.
Reviews.Content: Since this place is so close to my home, so i went there and see what is going on.We were at the sushi bar, the food was pretty good, the longer we sat there, the more random food they gave us.

Reviews.Author: Christe K.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi place u'll ever had!Everything is so fresh.. Prepare $70 and up for dinner for two when dining at the sushi bar... But ITS WORTH THE MONEY!!!

Reviews.Author: Miko L.
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch special! 15 dollars? you can't beat that price!!!We also ordered monk fish liver, toro, yellowtail belly, spanish mackerel. Every bite was like in heaven. It was that good.  Go early before they open. They open at 11. Get there before 10.30! Trust me its worth it!

Reviews.Author: Alyssa B.
Reviews.Content: This is my first yelp review, so I chose one of my favorite restaurants in L.A. Sushi-Gen is one of the best sushi places I've ever visited. When many of the customers AND chefs are Japanese, you know you're in the right place. The bar has a fun environment, but I would recommend a table if you want a quiet conversation or an intimate date. Also, if going on the weekend, prepare for a long wait.Order:TORO!!!! For Real. It's like butta. Yellowtail is out of this world. Crab/Seaweed Salad. Other than those musts, you really can't go wrong. Even the sweet shrimp head is good! Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Koki G.
Reviews.Content: I went there today as a party of four during lunch hours. A friend of ours told us that this place has a great cost-performance, so we decided to check it out. Looking at the previous yelp-comments, I knew about the average 30-50 minute wait. However, they skipped us and seated a few pairs of people that came after us. Totally understandable because we were a group of four, and there wasn't enough seats for us. But if that happens too much... There's a problem there.All of us ordered a Jyou-Sushi set (About $16) which comes with 8 or 9 pieces of sushi. The neta (fish on the sushi) was fresh and tasty, but the cuts were a little too small. They made the portion of the shari (rice) smaller to adjust to that small neta. Thinking that Edo-mae (Legit Tokyo style sushi) is supposed to be like that, it may not be a problem, but after finishing the meal, I thought I could eat another set. I recommend the teens who eat a lot to get some sides with it too.We asked for some oshibori's (wet-towels) to wipe our hands before eating the sushi, but they said they were 50cents each. Hot-Teas are a $1.50. Extra Gari (Ginger) $1.A little too stingy and miserly. What sushi restaurant charges the customers for extra gari?It was certainly not bad, but was it worthy of all that hype? I really think that Sushi Gen serves solid Sushi, but there are many other places around LA that deserve just as long lines, considering quality vs. price. Because they are not THAT cheap and really not THAT good.Overall, the sushi was good. Not bad.Still, it was a little overpriced, and I probably won't go there again.

Reviews.Author: Frank S.
Reviews.Content: best sushi in l.a. +  low priced sashimi lunch special = one hour wait....but it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: De D.
Reviews.Content: Its fine.  I don't understand the hype.

Reviews.Author: Chloe H.
Reviews.Content: Fresh enough~ good spot

Reviews.Author: Gnuf S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Emphasis on LOVE. You can splurge and sit at the bar ordering sushi a la carte (fantastically fresh) or you can sit at one of the few tables and have the set menus, which is AMAZING. Sure the fish at the bar is the better cut, but the sashimi in the set menus are still better than 99% of other sushi restaurants out there AND at a fraction of the cost! You can't go wrong (just looking at the photos make me drool). I live out of town now. But my visits to LA are never complete without a visit here!

Reviews.Author: Sharin C.
Reviews.Content: This place is always my old time favorite.  One time my ex was going to give me a surprised...he said he wanted to take me to a really nice sushi place.  I was never thinking it was the same place that I LOVE...I can only say - Great mind think alike.  I would highly recommend this place with anyone of you - Sushi Lover.  They made a great tasty sushi there. The only thing I was disappointed ...it is they don't open on SUNDAY anymore.

Reviews.Author: Jennesa M.
Reviews.Content: For many people who are picky about their sushi and authentic japanese cuisine. this has been a favorite place for locals for many years. Sushi is very good.

Reviews.Author: sabrina c.
Reviews.Content: I waited about an hour before it even opened for a table on a monday morning. I think it was worth it because I am a sushi lover and especially with tuna. If you like tuna in different cooking preparations, you should definitely try this place out. The sashimi lunch special is only on weekdays and recommended to come early because there is always a line. I think the tuna is really fresh and very affordable.

Reviews.Author: Erika C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOVE THIS PLACE. I can honestly say this is my all time favorite restaurant EVER in all of Los Angeles. Though, I must mention sashimi is my absolute favorite food of all time. This place is not only frikin insanely delicious but holds great sentimental value in my heart. My mom and I have been coming here since I was 7 years old and this is where I learned how to eat raw fish as a little girl. That's many many many years of my business. And I continue to be a loyal and devoted customer to Sushi-Gen. Now, I take my mother here for Mother's Day and her birthday (usually). It's a mother-daughter family tradition that I plan on passing down to my future kids :D I seriously didn't know how popular this place was until I checked it out on Yelp. My world came crashing down on me when I realized my little secret mom & pop sushi restaurant wasn't so secret after all. Sigh... good for you Sushi-Gen. Well deserved notoriety. This is NOT a place for noob california roll "sushi" eaters. Don't expect this place to serve crazy named rolls! This is a place for sashimi, nigiri, fresh fish lovers. They do have teriyaki and tempura items but I never order those items. The fish here is too phenomenal to even look at those items (though delicious, I'm sure). They have the best sushi specials (lunch special sashimi, chirashi, sushi dinner deluxe, etc). It's ALWAYS beyond super fresh. Literally tastes like they're in the back fishing for your food as you're looking over the menu. Top quality fish for reasonable prices. Whatever you order, you can never expect less than the best. I have never ever had a single complaint about the quality of the food. I've introduced many of my friends to this restaurant and I always make them a fan. The service is always good, the staff is super friendly, but the wait can get long. They are always busy! The restaurant is pretty small so expect to wait unless you make a reservation.

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: One of the best Sushi restuarants in town. Their toro melts on your tongue and its prob the best toro I've tasted by far. I came here for my bday dinner and for 2 people, we ordered alot! Let see if I still remember: Hot sake (must have), Sushi combo $35 was the best sushi combo I've ever had, it came with tons of diff sashimi items including the TORO. We had yellowtail collar and bunch of other random stuff. Anyways the bill was $160 i think and we were stuffed. So much fresh food and price was good. Def coming back!

Reviews.Author: Giulio Cesare G.
Reviews.Content: i was referred this place by many people, some japanese, so i went with high expectations but the food was just a 3 stars, and considering the  price is high give a 2.the place is nice, japanese-looking and cozy. but when it came to the fish... it's just average. the monkfish liver and the japanese snapper were good, the halibut was hard, chewy and tasteless, as you don't even find in the cheapest sushi places.

Reviews.Author: DeAnna J.
Reviews.Content: WOW. Blown away. From the quality of the fish, to the presentation to the taste. Now I know why people think Minnesota sushi blows. We had a nice spread. My friend took me here and he said it's the best! He'd know more than I would since he lives in LA and is also partially Japanese. The ponzu sauce was dead on. I honestly don't think I've had one so good. The cuts were beautiful! We got there right at around 9:15PM I believe. They don't take reservations, so we were cutting it with time. We were so lucky to get a table for two right when we got in. Heard this place is always super packed! It's very authentic and the service is prompt and respectful! Will definitely go back if I'm in California! Such a good deal! What a bang for your buck for real!

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi has come a long way from being a practical joke Japanese restaurateurs played on American business men. Some people equate the little pieces of uncooked fish flesh as culinary art or, in a more salacious way, food porn. The imagery and true vulgarian impulse of the term lands this term onto my banned lexicon list. That is neither here nor there, so let's get down to it. Little Tokyo has three real sushi spots. Komasa, Sushi-Gen, and Hama. Go to Komasa if you are looking for a regular dinner. Sushi-Gen would be when you want to splurge a bit. Hama probably falls into the same category as Sushi-Gen, but feels pricier for what you get. All the places have superb freshness and good variety. What Sushi-Gen has unique is it's combination sushi plates - namely their sashimi deluxe. It is slap your Mama good, so get ready for some jail time afterwards. And a good whupping if you have a Mama that is worth a damn. Seeing I have spoken about your Mama twice in two sentences, and am not Wilmer Valderrama, I will get back to the sushi. Seriously, though, say hi to your Mother for me. The octopus, squid and spicy tuna are even good and I am 100% fine with compromising those for higher quality salmon, tuna, and yellow tail. Get this special - it really encapsulates what sushi should be, which is a journey across wonderful flavors, temperatures, and textures. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: Positives: Awesome taste, quality, appearance and freshness.  Negatives: none, except for how busy it was at lunchtime; slight wait for orders from the sushi chef (but still well worth it and not knocking a star for that!). Out of hundreds, if not thousands of sushi experiences, I can say that the toro, halibut and salmon were the best I've ever tasted.  Toro sashimi is a must and the chef prepared a special snapper sushi which made it the first time I ever loved a snapper serving; it was a bit spicy which made it delicious (try it!).

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: At first, considering the price, the food is decent(lunch set is around $20 ~ $30 w. tips and tax). Sushi Gen is one of the honest Sushi restaurants in terms of the price in Los Angeles. But the waiting is the hardest part. I needed to be there around 10:40. I arrived at 11 and I waited for 40 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Laura W.
Reviews.Content: Think this place is soooo over rated. I've eaten there twice. Its really crowded and popular during lunch and there's always a line to get in. I dont know why though. Their sushi is just okay. I did take out once and their portions were tiny! expensive and small portions. not a good combo. get better sushi some where else

Reviews.Author: Ab L.
Reviews.Content: We're incredibly spoiled to get so many choices for tasty sushi. After spending a summer in the midwest I was desperate enough to make my own california roll. What was the place I first stopped by when I landed home? Fresh fish- order omakase and at the bar. This place is worth the wait and the texture is just exquisite. Please, I never want to leave LA

Reviews.Author: Ricardo R.
Reviews.Content: Really great quality and beautiful presentation. My only problem is the menu is not very Western friendly. It wouldn't hurt to have a bit more information of what each dish is. Was expecting a bit of more specialty rolls--but the regular Spicy Tuna is the best I've ever had. Sashimi is a must do if your into that. Also try the Red Snapper Miso ---Incredibly delicate and delicious....Awesome service.

Reviews.Author: mira s.
Reviews.Content: The best sashimi in LA! great prices and staff are always friendly. Must make a reservation to get a table for dinner, else wait 30mins to an hour. But, it's still worth the wait. The sashimi dinner is to die for. No where else can you get top quality sashimi for under 30$.  Always get top cuts of maguro and hamachi, as well as tempura, rice, and soupI don't want to say too much, cause it's my favorite Japanese restaurant and having to wait for a table is the bane of my existence!!

Reviews.Author: Christopher K.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quality food at the sushi bar. Tried a host of different meals. Went around 1230pm but unfortunately 4 item minimum per person which can easily cost up to $50. The wait for tables was a little extreme, 20-30 minutes for two people.I've been to a sushi bar or two before and can appreciate the style. It's expensive but pleasant to sit quietly and just enjoy the chef's food. Although the options are limited the sushi menu is quite diverse. I tried Albacore to Fatty Tuna and everything in between, all of which was superb. In particular those two items were extremely soft. The wasabi on the white rice adds a little kick to each roll. I tried the octopus as well for the novelty which was a little too chewy. A small bottle of Asahi coats the meal great, probably a good idea to get a drink of some sort.All in all very enjoyable if not extremely pricey. I'm not sure how it is at night but during the day a nice, slightly relaxing place to get full on great sushi.

Reviews.Author: Anne L.
Reviews.Content: With all the other omakase joints closed on a Monday, we gave Sushi Gen a shot. The wait was actually somewhat lengthy. The fish quality is definitely fresh, but the taste is mediocre. For mediocre tasting omakase, it was definitely over priced. There is, without a doubt, quality in the freshness of their selection. The problem is that the selection isn't anything out of the ordinary. We were given muzuku with nagaimo as an appertizer. It was then followed by a selection of tuna, kampachi, uni, aji, hirame, giant clam, amaebi, monk fish liver, anago, etc. I'm used to having more creative and adventurous sushi. Thus far, I prefer Toros in Alhambra. The cuts are not as generous as Toros nor was it as tasteful. At Toros, you know you'll never have the need to use any soy sauce and the wasabi is the real deal. I also did not like that Sushi Gen did not provide an itemized bill. Sushi Gen is a great place if you prefer the more common selection of sushi and traditional taste.

Reviews.Author: H. S.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a very solid sushi restaurant with fresh fish and reasonable prices.  There are several sushi chefs, each with a different style, but the experience has been pretty consistent regardless of where I sit at the sushi bar.  In my opinion, this is the best sushi bar in the Downtown/Little Tokyo area.  For some reason, the sushi served at the sushi bar tastes and looks much better than the sushi served at the tables.  Anybody else feel this way?  I suspect that they use different fish for the sushi bar and tables, but I do not know this for a fact....

Reviews.Author: Ron L.
Reviews.Content: Good stuff! Always have to wait for a table, but it's worth it. I've been there several times now, and have never had a bad meal. The sushi tastes fresh and the staff is under control no matter how crowded it is.If you want sushi, this should be on the top of your list. You and your stomach will be happy.

Reviews.Author: Jose W.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place, I think it's right there among the best in LA. But what to me subtracts from having the ideal experience there is that since there are always people waiting I feel "rushed", to some degree. It does have a bit of a hectic atmosphere. And especially when I have sushi I like to be in a more relaxed mode.

Reviews.Author: Ray U.
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Best Sushi & Japanese food in Little TokyoCons:  Long wait, get there when they open or make reservationsFreshes, best prepared Sushi in LA

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: This has always been a staple in my family for special occasions and dinner before shows - I spent my 21st  birthday here years (years!) ago and the quality and service is so consistent. Believe it or not, as you pull into a rather bizarre spot, you are about to enjoy the best sushi. Come here if you do not douse everything in soy sauce, ginger and wasabi and are willing to listen to the chefs on how to eat each item. Trust them, it will be amazing!

Reviews.Author: Susan Z.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a friend a few weeks ago, both of us were here for the first time, thought the wait would be pretty long since it was Satruday night, and there were a lot of people waiting. The host said about 20 to 30 minute wait so we went next door to get a drink first, it ended up being less than 15 minutes and we sat down at the sushi bar.As soon as we sat down the chief gave us each a bowl of appetizer, I'm still not sure what it was, but it was good. We ordered a bottle of sake, and decided to go with omakase. Everything was really fresh and delicious, there was nothing I didn't like, my favorites were the amaebi (sweet shrimp) and scallops, and toro. Sake was also really good :)  The only small complaint I have is that they sat many people at the sushi bar so it was a little tight on space, but as long as the food is good, I don't mind it much.The bill came out to be pretty high but was worth it, just not all the time. If not for the price and the drive (from Irvine), I would definitely be coming here a lot more.

Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: Man this place in Little Tokyo is the truth! Just like the other reviews say, try the sashimi deluxe plate! Was recommended by the waitress to try the monkfish liver, superb! I must warn you, for dinner, you have to make a reservation unless you wait an 1.5 hours.

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: I knew I had stumbled onto something good when I saw the crowd waiting outside Sushi-Gen.  Like previously mentioned, make reservations or expect to wait!  I noticed a good percentage of people were ordering the sashimi dinner, so I ordered it also and it did not disappoint!  After, my boyfriend and I walked to Mikawaya, the home of ice cream mochi.  Know the ice cream mochi they sell at Trader Joes?  This is where it originated and was first sold in America.  In addition to the standard flavors of ice cream mochi they mass produce, they have gelato mochi in flavors like peach, mint chip, cookies and cream, pistachio and coconut, to name a few.Top it off with a trip to the roof-top garden at the Kyoto Grand (which you can also walk to) and you have a really nice date!

Reviews.Author: Cecil K.
Reviews.Content: Does this place live up to its reputation? Certainly. Sashimi combo is hands down-best dish to have when you are having biz social drinking.I think they have at least 10+ sushi chef behind the sushi bar. Must be super organized. Will have my business. Try to go here around 9- line isn't too bad.I also tried what everyone is talking about - $15 sashimi lunch special. It's really good and really good deal. I mean- miso soup alone separates them from other blend instant soup taste. Anyway- try their sashimi lunch, it's a good deal.

Reviews.Author: Solamente A.
Reviews.Content: I'm always baffled by the great reviews this place gets. I've been 3 times over the last 10 years or so, and every experience has gone the same... friendly staff, good drinks, mediocre fish. Sure there are always a few delicious pieces of fish - like the Spanish mackerel I had last night. But then the salmon and snapper were both awful, and everything else was just average.I won't bother naming the far superior Little Tokyo offerings, but I kinda feel like you're hard pressed to find something more average... VENTURE OUT PEOPLE!!!! Seriously, any person who has eaten truly excellent sushi would not even give Sushi-Gen 5 stars on it's very best day.Many people cite the long lines and glowing reviews as proof of how great it is. Well in terms of lines, think of the lines at Pink's hot dog stand. Need I say more? That place SUCKKKKKS! And yes there are a lot of positive reviews for Sushi-Gen, but I can't tell you how many times I have been told by self proclaimed "sushi snobs" how great some place is which turns out to be very average. It's a common problem - most people simply don't know the difference between good and great. I find the same to be true of wine. If there is a big fat rating from Robert Parker, most others jump on the bandwagon and say they love it. But if they find out the review was lousy, they suddenly don't love it as much. Typical.Anyhow my FOOD rating is 2 stars, based on the Yelp description of what 2 stars means "Meh. I've experienced better." My gut was to give it 3 stars, however I cannot call Sushi-Gen "A-OK." So there you go. I'd give the staff 4-5 stars. They were so accommodating and friendly. Can't complain there!

Reviews.Author: CarolinaNJoshsFoodAdventures s.
Reviews.Content: Carolina:Best Spicy Tuna sushi I have tasted...thus far!  I do wish the pieces were bigger, though! Word to the wise: make reservations beforehand.

Reviews.Author: Barton D.
Reviews.Content: The best I've ever had.  Fully authentic.  Toro is a no brainier, their tai is a close second.  Mirugai and live scallop are also high on the recommendation list.  If you need rice, I'd suggest the negi-toro, spicy hamachi, or natto roll.  Gen gets perfect marks on my basic sushi restaurant test: seaweed is crunchy, rice traditional, tamago slightly sweet and very fresh, maguro, dark red, firm and rich, toro great marbling and melts in the mouth...I could continue.  Gen is always busy, if you want a table (you can only order their bentos and sushi/sashimi plates at the tables) you will wait, no question.  For me the bar is the place to be and 9 times out of 10 it requires a wait...Bar C next door is a fun place to grab a drink while you wait.  The chefs are friendly and hyper experienced.  Whether you are a connoisseur or just appreciate top-notch traditional sushi, Gen will not disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Kenny S.
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but very fresh sushi and excellent service as always. It gets really packed during prime time -- especially in the bar and the wait can be at least 45 minutes or more. Luckily, we never had to wait for a table the last two times we came. Also loved the interior setup, overall, a very clean restaurant. Nigiris are a bit small in portion compared to others (like Hamakawa when they used to be in business across on Central) but again the fish was super fresh. Closed on Sundays, bummer.

Reviews.Author: Rocky F.
Reviews.Content: My fave sushi in DTLA...it would be 5 stars if we didnt have to wait in a parking lot and if they re-train Hideki the anti-customer service oriented host with the bad haircut.

Reviews.Author: don k.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best sushi place in little Tokyo and perhaps in LA.

Reviews.Author: Hillery G.
Reviews.Content: Good, they forgot us and others who were seated after us ordered and were served before we ordered.  The servers did that thing where they are moving very fast and avoiding eye contact, so it is very difficult to even catch their attention to let them know that you have been sitting there for 10 minutes without menus.  I don't see what all the fuss is about, I thought the food was ok and the service was terrible . . .  won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Tn S.
Reviews.Content: How did this place get almost a 5 stars?  Most of the reviewers are raving about their $15. sashimi lunch special.I sat at the sushi bar (no choice, no table) which has minimum of 4 order policy.I ordered two orders of sushi, which had much smaller rice than usual and part of the rice keeps falling off!1 order of spicy tuna hand roll which was very small and was wrapped flat and square!  Aren't they supposed to be cone shaped w. lot's of fish on top?  What a disappointment!1 order of sweet shrimp which wasn't all that fresh.1 order of two slices of toro sashimi which was decent.What's odd is that they don't give you menu to order sushi, you just have to order without knowing how much you'll be charged.I later found out that my 3 orders of sushi was $24., sweet shrimp was $12., two slices of toro sashimi was $13.My total came out $53.29 + tip.  I didn't even order any drinks and I totally didn't expect it would be so expensive compared to what I ordered.I heard a guy sitting across the table who brought his family saying that he came here before and it normally adds up to $100. per person!  Wow!Totally makes sense.  If you're not a petite girl like me and usually likes to have drinks w. your meal, it would adds up to $100.+.If I am to pay this much for sushi, then I expect something out of ordinary, but I had better sushi for half the price elsewhere.Why don't you show us the price?

Reviews.Author: H H.
Reviews.Content: the best sushi lunch deal in DTLA.  sashimi lunch is indeed a star, but their chirashi actually comes with toro and mirugai.  worth every penny.  yes, the wait is ridiculous, but reward is beyond the expectation.  their tuna is the best.

Reviews.Author: Eri V.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for Sashimi lunch, and 3 stars for the rest.However, I don't think it's worth waiting for long. Last time it took me more than 30 min to get a table even though it was before noon. It was insane.  Sushi bar is not bad, but nothing stands out considering the price they charge me.Yes, I had better sushi and better value somewhere else. Unfortunately there are not many sushi choices in downtown. If you are wiling to pay more, I would recommend Mako. if you go cheap, Kula would be okay. For people in the middle, Toshi would not be bad if you can sit in front of him.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: Fish was fresh! Service was awsome!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: X B.
Reviews.Content: :'( ordered omakase like usual but it was not special... shame to pay so much for regular stuffsuggest you ask what is special and order your own... skip the omakaseroe and urchin not fresh ... very sad

Reviews.Author: Velinda L.
Reviews.Content: I've had the luxury of coming here for dinner 3 times (without having to wait a century because I make sure to arrive 15-30 min before opening! *hint hint) and my goodness, this place never disappoints. Their sashimi is perfection - just-fished-out-of-the-water fresh, authentic, juicy, and absolutely delicious. I usually get the dinner combos which come with your entree, a choice of tempura or sashimi (I always get the sashimi!), miso soup, some pickled veggies, and rice. I absolutely love their grilled salmon dinner. I've gotten it with butter and teriyaki before and I personally liked it more with the teriyaki sauce. My sister got the sashimi dinner combo (which comes with tempura by default) and that was amazing but a plate of pure raw fish is too overwhelming for my taste, no matter the A+ quality of it. It's definitely a great option for those sashimi lovers out there though. Everything they serve is definitely grade A stuff - even their rice is superb! Their green tea is fantastic (and tastes like real green tea) but keep in mind that they charge $1.50 for it. Service is wonderful - the waitresses are so polite and friendly and they are always refilling our cups. Judging from the other reviews, the lunch deals seem like a good idea if you're on a budget. This place can really make your wallet cry (at least for dinner) as dinner combos generally range from $24-30 but I have to say, it really is worth every penny considering the awesome quality of what they give you.

Reviews.Author: Vivian C.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite sushi places! I'm super picky when it comes to raw fish & sushi gen is to my standards. The quality is so fresh & service is awesome. There is usually a wait but totally worth waiting for. We got a combo plate with assortment of sushi & sashimi. Every single fish on there was fresh & melted in my mouth! If you are hungry for sushi I suggest sitting at the bar  (min 4 orders) & get the whole experience!

Reviews.Author: Angela H.
Reviews.Content: my japanese fd brought me here. really good quality food!

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: Simple... one of the freshest sushi in Los Angeles.That's what it is all about. Service is ok... considering this place is always busy, don't expect the servers to be attentive to you.And always expect to wait at least 30 minutes.

Reviews.Author: babooh h.
Reviews.Content: I should have read the review more carefully next time before going to this place during lunch. I ordered the fresh eel and California roll and I felt like I've been robbed. lol. For ~$14.50 dollars you get two fried fresh eel over a box of rice.  The eel was really fresh with no fishy smell but the portion was really disappointing.  (I want my money back.)  Don't order the California roll. You will feel robbed as well.Order, instead,  the sashimi lunch. You get plenty of fresh varieties of sashimi, a bowl of rice, miso soup, and tofu. All that for $15 bucks. The food is great. Okay, enough with my redundant reviews, and happy dining.

Reviews.Author: Bea L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely the Best sushi place in LA!You will not be disappointed whatever you order here!The only downside is the long wait on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Ryan D.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite sushi spot.  I usually order hamachi, maguro, sake, toro (if I'm feeling spendy), and a few orders of ama-ebi.  The ama-ebi heads here are cooked perfectly. I usually need to have four, not just the two.  I don't even live in LA anymore, but anytime I am in the area it is my go-to spot for lunch or dinner.  With rolls becoming the more and more popular at most sushi places, I like Gen because they are a more "traditional" sushi restaurant.  You can tell by the crowd that the people are here for the sashimi and nigiri-not the rolls.  Gen also has a ton of sushi chefs working so the service is always very good and your food comes quickly (especially when at the bar).

Reviews.Author: Atsushi F.
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and go here.  Its the REAL DEAL.  No samurai, ninja, sumo, teriyaki, sake-bomb, sushi wannabe.  Hell, the hired non-Japanese help are more Japanese than 90% of the other so-called Japanese spots.  Fresh fish + good sushi rice = Awesome It's not hard people...  but hard to find.  I think Gen means heaven, and it is apropos.

Reviews.Author: Walter J.
Reviews.Content: Now everyone, this is Japanese as good as it gets (without having to fly to Japan). I am sure you will notice once you will have to be in line at 11am before the restaurant opens.I had never seen such a long line in my life. So be prepared!Pros:The best fish I have ever had, sweet, soft, fresh.Price is good for what you get ($15 for a ton of sashimi for lunch).Cons:Must wait for ever to get a table, so if you are hungry don't go there unless you buy a snack on the way.Every time a friend from out of town visits we go there. I really love that place

Reviews.Author: Veronica C.
Reviews.Content: Pros:Sashimi nigiris were greatfish was very fresh. Just melted in my mouthrolls were good as wellCons:Took one star off because it is expensive if you order a la carte at the bar. I thought the prices were supposed to be reasonable but it reflected a moderate/pricey sushi restaurant when seated at the bar. I will try their lunch specials or combos next time and sit at the table since other yelper say that is less expensive.

Reviews.Author: Alice C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi place in Los Angeles.  Wait is not very long if you get there early enough.  Weeknight and weekend dinners are very packed and they are pretty busy during lunch with their lunch specials.  Fresh, fresh, fresh.  Melts in your mouth like butter.  My boyfriend and I loooooove this place and apparently so does my family.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea M.
Reviews.Content: no arguing....The ABSOLUTE BEST AND FRESHEST SUSHI YOU CAN GET IN LA.A MUST GO!!!!I stick with the Sashimi platter...it samples some of their BEST fish!!!

Reviews.Author: Nom B.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of my favorite sushi places in Little Tokyo. This place is always packed by 7 PM and the wait becomes an hour long so going right when it opens (at 5:30 PM...) is highly recommended. They also seem to have fresher sashimi available earlier on in the night. We ate: Uni, Toro, Albacore, Soft Shell CrabSoft shell crab: This is amazing. Once you bite into it, you feel like you're swimming through a medley of flavor. I can never share this - always get your own order. Delish.Sushi: Sometimes you get lucky and the sushi chefs pile on the uni- othertimes, you get a mere single slice. The toro is usually consistently good here and isn't too veiny or oily. As for the albacore, Sushi Gen is my favorite place for it. Just the right amount of green onion, ponzu and ginger!

Reviews.Author: Kay D.
Reviews.Content: My friend had recommended me this restaurant long time ago and I finally went there. Restaurant is really packed!!! I was pretty amazed. I ordered Sashimi&Tempura combo. I got Tuna, Yellowtail and white fish sashimi and they were super fresh and yummy. Tempura is OK but I should have just got Sashimi lunch. I ordered Iced Tea and it was really small and never got an offer for refill or anything. I guess this place is eat and go place. You cannot or I should say should NOT stay long after finishing your meal.

Reviews.Author: Timothy S.
Reviews.Content: Definently the Sushi joint you want to go to. This place is simply amazing. The food they prepare/serve is top-notch and tastes utterly amazing that it will have you in tears. (In a good way of course.)As long as you're willing to doll out some cash, this place is as good as it gets when it comes to a Sushi resturaunt. Take my word when I tell you that this place is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Mikey R.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a delicious sushi place for my 30th birthday and am so glad we came here.Service was great.  All the fish was super fresh.  Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Author: James Y.
Reviews.Content: This is the "never go wrong" sushi bar. The many many many times I've been here I've never had bad fish, it is always so fresh. The service is very fast too probably because they want you to get out so that the next customer can get in. There is always a wait. They do not take same day reservations.

Reviews.Author: Jell O.
Reviews.Content: Took my bf here for his bday dinner (which he ended up paying by insisting, how humble). Heard so much about this place and hes also a sushi connoisseur. The sushi were all great. I had their deluxe sashimi combo, yellowtail belly, extra fatty tuna, halibut & albacore sushi. All good but honestly nothing to write home about. I probably wouldnt come back here again for the price i have to pay for their sushi. Just the 6 orders of sushi came out over $70. eh, i had better for less so moving along.

Reviews.Author: Cam T.
Reviews.Content: BOmbbb

Reviews.Author: Ariane R.
Reviews.Content: On the upside, I did a much better job of eating in front of my date here than I had on our first sushi date (at Mosun).  My hands worked better, and I could take bites larger than a cucumber sliver at a time.  So that rocked.  It's always nice to feel that simple things, like eating, are not over one's head.I loved Sushi Gen's authentic dishes- I hadn't had yama kake (mountain yam) in a dish in L.A. before, and I love it in all its slimy glory- it comes in their seaweed salad, which was a great little dish (little being the operative word).  There was a good variety of fish, an array of which I had not yet encountered outside of S.F.If there is an upside, that must mean there was a downside too, otherwise this would be a 4 or 5 star review.  So: what the hell is up with the lack of prices on the menu??  This isn't a $300 fine dining meal where I am throwing caution to the wind and don't want to know what everything costs; this is a jeans-and-a-t-shirt Monday night "Let's grab a bite to eat" meal and not a single fish had any pricing next to it, for any size.  Based on how little the salad items we got cost, the fish must have been outrageous; like $30-40 for two small orders of sashimi (scallop and salmon, not anything pricey).  We both just sort of stared at one another, and the bill, confusedly, and each put down a credit card.  I'm a small eater, and I wasn't even full, yet I spent far more than normal at a sushi restaurant of this caliber.In retrospect, I wish I would have just flipped the damn bill over and looked at what each sashimi order was priced at, b/c the not knowing is still driving me mad.  There's a lot to be said for fledgling relationships: you're giddy, eating is hard, and you're so overwhelmed by the amazingness of the girl sitting across from you that you figure, hey, maybe it's normal for a small order of sashimi to cost three times as much as one would anticipate based on the price of the non-fish menu items.

Reviews.Author: Ben L.
Reviews.Content: The fish is delicious and fresh.  The soy sauce is a little salty.  The price is expensive but not really.  The service is ok.  Great sushi, but I'm not gonna fap about it.

Reviews.Author: J D.
Reviews.Content: Great food, reasonable prices, friendly staff

Reviews.Author: Amie Ranmin C.
Reviews.Content: a little bit expensive but it really worth!! the salmon was really fresh and the uni was really awesome! will come back to try more

Reviews.Author: Wa N.
Reviews.Content: We just found our new favorite sushi bar!  The rice was delicious.  The hour of wait was really well worth it! If you have to pick between Restaurant Komasa and Sushi Gen, do yourself a favor and pick the latter! Everything we had at sushi Gen was fresh and yummy.  There were multiple selections of fishes that you will not find at other sushi bar! Kohada, Sayori, Engawa and Mozuku were out of this world.

Reviews.Author: Wesley C.
Reviews.Content: There's a crowd outside for a reason. They don't take reservations because they don't need it. With the amount of fish they serve everyday, the fish will always be fresh. Do yourself a favor and sit at the bar. Don't hesitate to ask your sushi man what that guy over there is eating. It's a factory, come in, order and enjoy the product. No nonsense sushi and the quality is top notch.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: yuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmy!!!!!!YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY!!!!OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOH MYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYGOOOOOOODDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD!!! =Dis it because i havent had sushi in awhiles? why was this place so darn good .... FRESH, FRESH, FRESH !!!! LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT....aishteru sushi gen! :)

Reviews.Author: Lena B.
Reviews.Content: you remember what i said about my conversation policy with restaurant staff?  the "yes, no, thank you, please" part...well, sushi gen is the place where you don't need to say anything other than those 4 words to their staff (not because the waitress didn't speak english!!!).  our waitress was very attentive and quick, yet never overly intrusive and rushing.my bf and i ordered a sushi deluxe combo with salmon skin salad and mozuku, a large tempura combo, and spicy tuna rolls.  we never had mozuku (wet seaweed with white foam on top) before but we devoured it.  i enjoyed the salad more than my bf which he thought was too fishy (i reminded him that it is made with salmon skin).  the tempura dish had 4 large shrimps, a set of eggplants, zucchini, sweet potato, and some other veggies, coated with light, crisp batter.  the spicy tuna rolls were really tiny (no prices were listed for a la carte items), but very delicious.  as for the sushi, i had better.  however, the rice had the perfect vinegar and sweet flavor to it...one of the best sushi rice i ever had!!!more than anything, our waitress really made our dining experience pleasant.  i wish she can give a restaurant service 101 lecture to all aspiring waiters and waitresses.  p.s. - there's about 30 to 60 min wait on weekend nights, but use the time to walk around little tokyo.  it will work up your appetite and you can buy some dessert for later.

Reviews.Author: Erika M.
Reviews.Content: The sushi here was GREAT, but I felt it was way too expensive.  We sat at the bar and ordered omakase.  Now looking back, we should have shared so we can try more varieties of fish.  The fish was super super fresh, but I feel like I can get fresh fish at other places for much less.  There wasn't anything too special, and I would rather spend the money at Sushi Zo or Sushi Sasabune.  I think I would come back for a regular sit-down dinner, though, because I really did enjoy the fish, and the dinner menu looks much more affordable.

Reviews.Author: Wasin L.
Reviews.Content: There may be other places in LA that offer better ambiance with their sushi or serve more gourmet sushi, but if you want the most authentic and fresh tasting sushi that come from various cut of fish and seafood, then Sushi Gen is a must.They offer the same items for lunch and dinner. Lunch can be a bit more packed so expect to wait in line for a bit unless you come a few minutes before the restaurant actually opens at 11.  If I sit at the table, I'll usually order the sashimi deluxe plate which can be shared with two people.  That should satisfy even the biggest sashimi fan's craving for a while.  The kumamoto oysters here are a bit small but is so fresh and is paired so well with the sakes they have in the house which makes it hard for me not to order this combination as well when I come here.Service is ok considering how busy the place can get.  The servers don't really do a good job helping you select a dish or a bottle of something if you ask for their advice so come here knowing what you feel like ordering and just get it.  There really isn't a wrong choice for choosing something at random either.  The selection of sake and beer is limited.  At time they run out of stock of a certain bottle and will ask if you want to order something else.  One time my server told me she doesn't drink sake at all so she wasn't able to help me select a bottle.  When I picked something that sounded promising based on how it was made, she came back and told me they don't have that bottle but how about I get this other bottle which was double the price because she said she liked having this bottle of sake with her food usually. Umm, ok... just a bit earlier she told me she didn't drink at all so how would she know? That was probably the only time I was ever annoyed at the service of this place.  Besides that time it's been fine.If you're short on time and can't get a table, you can always get seated at the sushi bar in front of the sushi chefs.  This is your opportunity to go omakase style and let the chef prepare your meals for you if you so desire.  All of the items that are made omakase you can order from the sushi list if you were sitting at the table, so don't expect to try fugu for the first time here or something fancy like that.  It's just an opportunity for you to try something you might not order on a routine visit or have interaction with the chefs.  Omakase was a fun and delectable experience albeit the pace in which you were served a new dish was a tad slow for me.

Reviews.Author: Joey G.
Reviews.Content: O MY GOD!!!!! Soooooo amazing!

Reviews.Author: Koi K.
Reviews.Content: Good sushi at reasonable price. If you sit at the bar, try to get the bald guy with glasses in the rear corner - he knows what he's doing and can handle the whole corner (6-8 people) by himself. Some of the other chefs at the bar are not very good - small cuts, too much rice, clumsy handling of fish, etc. Lunch special is great if you can make it inside. Wait times for both lunch and dinner can get atrocious.No point going to a yuppie $$$$ sushi place in santa monica or beverly hills. Doesn't get much better than this at this price point.

Reviews.Author: Baro W.
Reviews.Content: you know that axe commercial where, all of a sudden, a girl starts dancing in front of a man while chanting, "Bow-chica-bow-wow"?well that's what went on in my head when i saw my lunch special sashimi plate. AND!!!!!! I would've started dancing and chanting that porno music too if it weren't for the 2384203498 people that were there. if you look at the pictures, the sashimi lunch special is pretty much the same thing as the dinner sashimi special except without the tempura. Holy crap!! All of that for 13 bucks!?? Bow-chica-bow-wow~! haha.The fish was very fresh. The cuts were very big and there was a huge variety of fish that was served on that plate. Along with the lunch special: miso soup, rice, tofu, seaweed something, and neverending green tea. Their green tea is good, but tastes a little powder-y which i don't like too much.What a ggggggrrrrreeeeeaaaaat(Tony the tiger....sorry that was lame) place to eat lunch. I'm going to try and eat here for lunch every week. bp.s. when the old man host isn't there, a beautiful hostess replaces him. Beautiful.Bow-chica-bow-wow~!

Reviews.Author: Bryan K.
Reviews.Content: With 600+ reviews and 4.5 stars what else more needs to be said about this place?  Fresh fish, a great place, always crowded.  In Honda Plaza in Japantown.  It'll run you about $100 a head, but what do you expect for great sushi?

Reviews.Author: Deanna M.
Reviews.Content: can i just say ohmyeffinggee!!!my first time here was a couple years ago for a second (mercy) date.  our first date was pretty disastrous and i decided to give him a second chance... i AM nice after all!  :p well... actually, it was because he did bribe me by offering to take me to his secret sushi spot... hehe.  shhhhh... don't tell him i told you that!but let's just say, the zero turned into a hero after that experience.  everything was so melt-in-your-mouth-mmm-mmm-gooooood that each time i tried some new and exotic fish (that he was ordering in japanese i might add), he was becoming more and more attractive with each bite.  the sushi was so orgasmic i almost jumped the guy right at the sushi bar... he actually morphed from insecure and blubbering into suave and debonair... this place does wonders for the average romantically-challenged guy!don't bother sitting at a table... go right to the bar and just tell them to give you whatever specials they have.  don't bother ordering the usual fanfare you can get anywhere else (i.e. tuna, salmon, etc.)... ORDER THE SPECIALS!  i do recommend the yellowtail toro, however.  it is so buttery-melt-in-your-mouth smooth... it's like a choir of angels singing in your mouth!  and don't bother ordering anything from their menu.  you haven't had mothereffin sushi until you've eaten sushi at sushi-gen.  i'm serious!as for the hero, we dated for about half a year and parted ways after realizing we didn't have much in common except love for food but i am definitely grateful to him for introducing me to this gem.in any case, my love affair with sushi lives on...

Reviews.Author: Andrea W.
Reviews.Content: My favorite go-to restaurant in Little Tokyo. The sushi is fresh and delicious. There is always a line outside of the door. This place is more traditional Japanese so it will not have a lot of speciality rolls that Americans tend to order.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: You can totally judge a dude by his food. Any guy who eats omakase will get a PLUS +++++++++ in my book. That said, I certainly don't want my guy to be a frequent patron at Sushi Gen. Screw me over once. OK. Maybe it was a fluke. Screw me over twice? Sayonara, Sushi Gen! I don't mind a mediocre sushi place because hey, not every meal can be orgasmically memorable. BUT OH THE WAIT! I HATE waiting for mediocre food. Been here once for dinner, got the widely acclaimed sashimi platter as well as many pricey a la carte sushi. Not impressed. The sushi I had was made with no heart. Just fish. Everything was massively produced in the kitchen (yes I said kitchen, I highly doubt most of their sushi even comes from the sushi bar). Been here another time for the every so popular lunch special. $15 for a plate of sushi. Again, not  impressed at all. I can name at least 3 other places in Little Tokyo with better fish and the same reasonable prices.Everything was fresh... I'll give them that. But a memorable meal? NO WAY. I compare Sushi Gen to Costco. Great value. Decent quality. But something is missing. And that something is HEART.

Reviews.Author: Mimi C.
Reviews.Content: "Cheap, cheap!", sings the little birdyQ. and quietly whispers, "...at least at lunch!" *flap flap*Ordered the sashimi combo for $15.Fresh and good variety of fishies (salmon, tuna, snapper, beef..yes) on my plate. Comes with a little salad and misoHubby ordered the sushi deluxe  - good fish, good rice (a big plus in my book). Comes with miso. About $ 15 -$17. Wait is pretty long, we got here just a  few minutes past opening time and there was already a line. We waited 20 minutes, which was fine since we simply meandered over to H.I.S. Travel to check out upcoming deals. When noon hits, the wait turns into an hour. eep.Echigo vs. Sushi Gen - Echigo would win simply  because its omakase is way too good. And they have real wasabi.

Reviews.Author: A C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen, though ownership had changed hand, still maintains the quality it had. As a downtowner, I go there often and have tried virtually everything on or not on the menu.  It has some of the best Sushi close to real Japanese sushi.

Reviews.Author: Minah L.
Reviews.Content: hmm.. u know. i wish i could rave about this place like every other review.. but i wasn't all THAT impressed. i mean don't get me wrong, it was pretty good sushi/sashimi and the service was pretty great. but it was NOT a "omg.. you have to try this place.".. definitely california overplays everything.. it's a little on the expensive side too. but it was good money for good food with good company. i don't complain about the price as long as i came out enjoyed. and yes. indeed. i did enjoy it. :))well my friends and i wanted to sit at the table but that took wayyyy too long. so we just asked to sit at the sushi bar. and i LOVEEEED OUR chef guy. he was sooo freaking adorable. small old man who doesn't really speak english was sooooooo cute. and he like gave us free pieces of things. hahahaha. seriously so cute.MUST TRY:yellowtail!! it's so thick and it melts in your mouth.the spicy tuna roll was a taker too. yumm!and for appetizer.. sweet potato tempura. DOUBLE YUM! :))

Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go out to eat sushi, Sushi Gen is the first place that comes to mind.  I am so lucky to have found this place in the midst of all of the sushi restaurants that have overwhelmed modern society.  While sushi and sashimi were considered taboo only 5-10 years ago, it now seems that around every corner there is some sort of sushi restaurant.Sushi Gen has, by far, the best quality fish I've ever found at a Japanese restaurant in the U.S.  Moreover, it ranks amongst the top 5 Japanese restaurants I have ever eaten at, including those in Japan.  Although I have only eaten at Sushi Gen two times, I can comfortably say that their food is authentic.  The second time I visited I brought a group of 8 friends, including a couple that was not comfortable with consuming raw fish.  However, to my delight, they were willing to try the bluefin toro (you'd have to be crazy not to) and found it to be enjoyable.  To get a true sense of what Japanese cuisine is all about, Sushi Gen is a good place to start.  Their service, food preparation, and decor is highly reflective of modern Japanese dining.  I highly recommend trying the Deluxe Sashimi Dinner or if you're even more adventurous, try sitting at the sushi bar and having the chef choose several nigiri-style sushi selections, it's the best way to ensure you're getting a variety of fish that are fresh and tasty.  Look to spend around $30-50 per person, including drinks if ordering from the menu, $50-100 if at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Andrew J.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Deluxe Platter... $35 dollars.   I've never went to eat sushi and left feeling this full before.   The quality of sashimi they give you is excellent, Toro, Yellowtail, Amberjack, Bluefin, Yellowfin and more!... its AMAZING!  Quality is great.. how does this place make money? :)

Reviews.Author: Toni L.
Reviews.Content: I guess am not as much of a sushi snob as I originally thought because I have no idea why people are obsessed with this place. Food: So yes, the fish is quite fresh. $200 to feed four people fresh? I'm not yet sold. We ordered a seemingly endless array of sashimi, nigiri sushi, and a few rolls (yelp.com/biz_photos/YBmk…). I say seemingly endless because it certainly wasn't. I was starving at the end of this dinner because we were trying to keep the cost down. My favorites were the ikura (salmon eggs), pickled gourd rolls, sweet shrimp, and the red snapper. If you've never had pickled gourd before, you really haven't lived. It's tangy, crispy, and best of all neon yellow. The sweet shrimp is severed and served in two pieces. First the head is deep fried, feelers and all. Next, the body is served raw as nigiri sushi (on rice). I loved the head. The body was a thumbs up as well, but probably less so. I wasn't blown away by the texture or taste of anything on this plate unlike my experience at Sushi Go 55. Perhaps because of the long wait I just ate way too fast. Service: Expect an hour wait or more for dinner and equally crazy hours for lunch. According to friends who are loyal customers, it's possible for your wait to exceed the operating hours of the restaurant. Have a backup plan ready and definitely do not go here when you are starving. You might die. Atmosphere: Pretty low key inside. It looks like a sushi restaurant with dimmed lights and big comfy booths. I wouldn't call it spacious so be wary if you are bringing very large parties. Synopsis: I've heard it's better for lunch. Although the price is significantly cheaper you essentially get the same meal. After almost starving while waiting for food, starving while eating food, and facing an exorbitant bill, I think I'm done with high end sushi.

Reviews.Author: Tara C.
Reviews.Content: I finally had the famous sashimi lunch!  After having Sushi-Gen bookmarked for some time, I was recently able to try the lunch deal that everyone raves about.  So, for $15, you get miso soup, Japanese pickles, a hot tofu appetizer, and the main event: a large plate of different sashimi and a bowl of rice.  The presentation is simple yet lovely, and the fish was fresh and pristine.  On this particular day, we were served slices of yam cake with yuzu vinaigrette, kanpachi, yellowtail, cooked tuna, cooked salmon, toro ceviche, spicy tuna, tuna belly, squid, and TORO.  My favorites?  The cooked tuna was quite flavorful and the toro was, of course, fantastic.  Best of all, the piece of squid had the most amazing, buttery texture.  So why only 4 stars?  Even though the value is great, especially for the quality, I was hoping for a little more variety.  I didn't care for the toro ceviche or the blob of spicy tuna.  Then you have the wait and the huge crowds.  The service was pleasant enough, but you really felt rushed, especially when you have barely started your sake or the appetizer dishes and the sashimi main course appears, further crowding your tiny table.  The place looks like a cute, traditional sushi joint but it is very noisy and the numerous customers and servers rushing about and jostling you or your table continue to disrupt an otherwise lovely meal.  It was hard to get refills of water.  The food was quite good and I would return, but I would not suggest Sushi-Gen as the place for an easy, relaxed meal.

Reviews.Author: Philip L.
Reviews.Content: had lunch here the other day and the quality of sushi was superb.  i was actually in the mood for some indian food but since we were in the area, decided to check out sushi gen. the line was long and the wait was horrendous.  the restaurant was cramped and we were seated at the very center of the table section.  gosh, i felt like sardines in a packed can.  scanned around and all i saw was orders of sashimi.  i ordered the famous lunch time sashimi plate and she had the teriyaki beef with sashimi.  we were both provided with some miso soup, tofu and a small portion of dressed cabbage.  overall, the meal was good but i was in the mood for indian so i didnt enjoy it as much as i wouldve had i been craving for sushi.  the sashimi was melt in you mouth good, but i just felt like some complex spices.gonna get here early the next time im really in the mood for sushi.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: Yum, Yum!  This is probably one of the best sushi restaurants in all of Little Tokyo if not all of Los Angeles.  It really doesn't get better than this.  The parking lot is inadequate AND, lines and wait times can be a little long so....be prepared and aware.  Other than that, sushi is "on point"!

Reviews.Author: jacqueline k.
Reviews.Content: I'm once again reminded of how fresh and delicious the fish at Sushi Gen really is.  The sushi chefs knows exactly what the perfect temperature, fish/rice ration, seasoning should be.  I had switched over to Hama Sushi for a while because of the long wait, but last night I actually realized that the longer the wait, the fresher the fish. It totally makes sense since they have to restock quite frequently.  And let me emphasize that experiences may vary depending on who your sushi chef is.  I usually sit at the bar and prefer the animated older (grandpa-type) chefs.  Sushi is an art, and the older chefs have the advantage of having had more time to masters at their skills.  In Japan, the people tend to work diligently their whole lives, mastering whatever their craft.  I love the animated chefs because their sushi becomes animated as well.  You really can't ignore the heart that goes into how your food is prepared.   The UNI and AJI were PURE JOY on my palette.  The uni was so fresh that it melted perfectly over the slightly warm rice and seaweed in my mouth.  It turns actually sweet after 2 seconds in your mouth, and I couldn't help but eat 3 more.  May I say it was the BEST AJI I'VE HAVE EVER EATEN IN MY WHOLE LIFE.  I usually enjoy the Aji at Sushi Gen but last night's was truly the BEST.  We also ordered hamachi (rich and buttery as usual) and ankimo (sooooooooo good).  RED SNAPPER is also one of the best.  I love the jalapeno relish garnish on top which brings out the clean taste of this fish.  We ended the meal with a spicy tuna handroll, the best way to end a great sushi meal.  There wasn't too much rice and the coldness of the spicy tuna went perfectly with the warmness of the rice.  The nori was also perfectly crispy.  EVERYTHING WAS PERFECTION!Oh yea their green tea is so good! Real authentic Japanese green tea. :)

Reviews.Author: Gayle K.
Reviews.Content: I went here for lunch and had the nigiri sushi.  The fish was fresh and the cost wasn't that bad.  If you want to come here for lunch I would probably suggest getting there early.  The line starts lining up at 10:30 am.  (The restaurant opens at 11:15 am.)

Reviews.Author: gabor m.
Reviews.Content: The sushi was of excellent quality but the bill leaves you with a feeling of gross violation.The first warning should have been the sushi menu with no prices listed on it.  We were at ease throughout the meal due to the jovial nature of the sushi chef.  The second warning should have been when we asked for the bill and we saw the chef scribble the word "food $98" with no itemized listing of our order.  Now mind you we had only ordered 10 orders of sushi totalling 20 pieces of fish.  No 100 year old vintage, rare fish but your run of the mill sea fare.  Maybe the beer we drank had kept our instincts at bay but as we walked out we could not help but feel as if I was visited by my cell mate bubba for a night of spooning.  How on earth do 20 pieces of sushi (not sashimi) equate to $98 of "food"?  Needless to say I was awestruck by the price for a good four hours afterwards.  What had provoked this price?  I warn all diners to ask for pricing before you order.

Reviews.Author: Christina O.
Reviews.Content: super fresh, super high quality sashimi, reasonably priced. the best deal is the sashimi for lunch!! i've been eatin' here since 1982!! there is ALWAYS a long line for lunch. so, be there by 11am or just before they close. if you get there just before they close, *cross your fingers* that they'll let you in. sometimes, their waiting list is so long that they'll stop takin' names earlier than 2pm or whatever time it is that they stop serving lunch. dinner is awesome, with the small tofu & beef broth appetizer that comes complimentary with each person's entree order. I LOVE THIS PLACE. warning: the host is a real ass but you can't blame him. he's always swamped with names and parties and people constantly asking him if they are next. GIVE HIM A BREAK!! but be sure to listen for your name and make sure your ENTIRE party is present. or else you don't get seated!!

Reviews.Author: Ayami H.
Reviews.Content: finally visited sushi-gen with the recommendation from my mom. yes i am 100% japanese...born in japan...but do not eat raw fish... must have been something my mom had while she was preggers with me :PANYWAY, i still love my japanese food and can appreciate dishes for its appearance. we got there at about 1pm, waited 15 min and the food came out pretty quickly. for lunch i ordered the tempura and sashimi special. $15comes with tempura: pumpkin, sweet potato, zuchini and 2 shrimp. 3 kinds of sashimi that my bf ate, side of warm tofu that was really good, big bowl of really good rice and miso soup. bf ordered the sushi deluxe $15. came with one each of every sushi and miso soup.would i come back again? yes... probably to eat at the counter though and order all my cooked rolls :P

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: After trying many places over the last 4 years, I still only have 2 go-to places to get my sushi fix in Los Angeles. Sushi Gen is my only choice in downtown / Little Tokyo and Wa Sushi in WeHo is my only go to place when wanting to stick closer to home. I can confidently say the following after many visits to Sushi Gen. 5 Stars for consistent and very high quality fish. 5 Stars for very knowledgeable sushi chefs.5 Stars for value and price when considering the quality. NONE of the (significantly) more expensive joints can hold a candle to this place when it comes to authentic nigiri sushi, sashimi, and cooked dishes. Whether you eat at the sushi bar with any one of their super knowledgeable chefs or eat at a table and order cooked dishes, you will not EVER be disappointed by their quality. They don't serve the "fusion" dishes the other places serve, but WOW do they blow away the quality anywhere else. Their toro, crab, bluefin tuna, scallops, japanese and spanish mackeral, and live sweet shrimp are to die for. If you are in Los Angeles and looking for the freshest fish and highest quality authentic Japanese food then Sushi Gen should be at the top of your list. Skip the "see and be seen" places and come to Sushi Gen for the best nigiri sushi and sashimi that Los Angeles has to offer!!

Reviews.Author: LiLLy C.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  My co-workers and I are here for lunch @ 11:15 about 2-3 times a week!  We work for a seafood importer near Dtwn LA so we know our fish =)  This place definately has some of the freshest/ inexpensive seafood in town.  I recomend this place all the time =) Our fav pick is the Sashimi Lunch Special- can't go wrong for $15.99 a plate.  Our buddy Hiro (the host), Jose, & Javier are the best!  Look for mE and my buddies we usually get a corner table...

Reviews.Author: Apple P.
Reviews.Content: OK, I went back to the $15 lunch and got the sashimi special with my boyfriend when we happened to have a day off.  We showed up at around 10:45 and were around #19 and #20 in line.  We were seated in the first round of eaters once the shop opened at 11:10.  As promised,lunch is a ridiculously good deal.  You get some otoshi appetizers-- good miso soup and tofu-- that tide you over as you endure a mercifully short wait for the fish to arrive.  You get a huge platter of tuna, hamachi, salmon (both cooked and raw),  negi-toro, etc and a bowl of rice with fresh tsukemono.  I really can't emphasize how good of a place this is.  Go, if you happen to be in Little Tokyo on a weekday morning!

Reviews.Author: Ange W.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is pricy and over-rated. Three of us went on Sunday night around 6:30 PM and we didn't sit down untill 7:30 PMThe Uni (sea urchin) sushi is the smallest portion of uni that I have ever seen. 1 piece uni for each sushi. Hamachi was very greasy to the point that you want to throw up. NOT GOOD! The Hamachi toro was the signature sushi of the restaurant however it's just WAY over priced.The california roll is $15, I know where I can order the best california roll in L.A. for $3.50... It's just a mystery to me that why this restaurant is so busy.I was very disappointed with their service too. It was way too many tables and way too little waiters/waitresses. We waited about 15 minutes to get our food. The only satifsfying dish was the "Tuna with grated potatoes", but it should be the japanese yam instead of the potatoes that you have in mind. It's very authentic japanese food and I was impressed of the taste of the dish.I honestly wouldn't go back again.... BTW... our tab was over $200 for three people. We order ed two big bottles of Sapora and the rest were the food. It's just way too expensive~~~~

Reviews.Author: Adhi T.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is still the lunch sashimi choice for many Japanese and Korean patrons in the downtown area. I do feel though the sashimi lunch special has deteriorated in selection and value. Price has gone up from $10 years ago to $15 today. Service is still very decent. Food appears 10 mins after order and green tea is strong and tasty. Try iced ocha on a warm day.

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: I been wanting to come here for over 2 years and every attempt was a failed one, I think I made reservations for dinner on a Saturday 5 times and each time some unexpected event would pop up which prevented me from coming here for dinner.  It really sucks that they don't open for lunch on the weekends nor are they open on Sundays.  Business is THAT good.  So this past Friday my hubby told me that we should head to Sushi Gen right after work and just sit at the sushi bar since they were fully booked for dinner.  I was really happy to finally be able to try them out.  We arrived at around 6pm and were immediately seated at the bar.  I was wondering why the bar wasn't full because there were people waiting at the front.  I then found out it's because you can't order their sushi dinners at the bar.  I would definitely want to sit at a table next time because seeing those plates of sushi and sashimi prepared at the bar made me want to try them even more.  So this is what the hubby and I ordered at the bar:Toro - Oh em gee, the toro was the fattiest I've ever had.  My eyes rolled back.  We had 3 orders of them.  Melt in your mouth delicious!Sayori- this was recommended by the chef.  I had it w/o soy sauce or wasabi, it had a uniquely delicious texture, so yummy.Albacore - soft and buttery, again, delicious!Sake - so fresh, the fish was glistening, it had the perfect texture.Scallops - very good, scallops could be a little bigger though but they were very freshTuna - fresh but I did had to spit out a small piece of chewy tendonKing crab handroll - It was good, made w/ avocado and cucumber, but I wouldn't order it again.  I prefer blue crab handrolls but they don't have that.Overall Sushi Gen is delicious and very reasonably priced.  I will definitely return.  They should really consider opening for lunch on the weekends!

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: My long time favorite! It was here that I began my love affair with sushi and sashimi. Their sashimi lunch special is an unbeatable value. It comes with the most delicious soft tofu side that is only served during lunch with the sashimi special. Their dinner sashimi deluxe is great as well. 5 stars for their sashimi lunch and dinner sets:) The value ends there, however, as the sushi bar is pricey. The set sushi dinner is weak, with only an inferior selection. Make reservations or expect to wait even on weekdays.

Reviews.Author: Jason X.
Reviews.Content: This is awesome due to most other customer service for sushi. If all of these reviewers can suggest their own better sushi in the area then bring it on. If you can't then stfu and stop being a hypocrite. likewise, sushi gen in little Tokyo taste like horrible. I don't know why so many people like things made so cheap for such an expensive price range. We ate sweet shrimp for 19.95 for 3 pieces and taste soggy, like flour. And we waited 45 minutes to be seated and also, they favored old customers to seat earlier. Wow like really... And everything else is wrong there. Right after I paid for my bills they didn't even serve me tea anymore. Sushi Gen is a no star place for $100 spent in trash. Therefore, Gatten sushi has the fresh baked menu and that's the only reason it takes a long time. You fking retards. Why do you think they cook in front of you guys to give you a taste of Japanese sushi. Don't get me wrong for all those unreliable stupid people out there for cant even read open books. If your physically and mentally retarded then I am sorry. That's it sushi lovers.

Reviews.Author: Sara L.
Reviews.Content: PHENOMENAL.Fresh and delicious sashimi! Everything was perfect, except for the long wait. 40 minutes to seat a party of 3 when I went in (tuesday night around 6pm). Wait 20 minutes longer and we could've gotten a table, but our stomachs were getting too impatient. At the bar seats, combination plates are not allowed to be ordered, so we just got hella sashimi, and oh my gosh it was glorious. Even the stuff we were skeptical about, such as the mackerel because they tend to taste/smell fishy, were extremely fresh with no strong aftertaste. Our chef recommended the Spanish mackerel, and it was hands down the best mackerel I've had.I've always been a fan of yellowtail, but the yellowtail belly here melted straight down my esophagus. Probably the best yellowtail I've had as well!Everything else I ordered was just as amazing. The fatty tuna was super soft; uni was so delectable; halibut was one of my favs. There was a lot more I ordered but it's all the same story. Next time I would make a reservation or wait a little bit longer for a table seat so that I can order the combo plate. I believe ordering the sashimi one by one is way pricier than the plates. Our check came out to be ~$200. Eeks... No regrets nonetheless! Please, come here for sashimi! It is a must-try!!!PS $3 for parking in their parking lot 3 hrs max.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie Y.
Reviews.Content: finally i got to try this famous place! i had no idea it's in the same plaza as kagaya!everything was as fresh as it could be... i guess that's why everyone just LOVES this place... and how it always gets so crowded.i was surprised that even their tempura is really yummy, i am not usually a tempura girl but after some raw fish and cold beer, it's nice to have something hot!i would go back if i am ever in the hood and mood for some fresh sushi again.it's pricy! if it could be a lil cheaper than it'd be on my 5 stars list! :)

Reviews.Author: Anne C.
Reviews.Content: 2 words: UNI DINNERwhen they have it, that is.  and when they have it, it's too good for words.  most of my friends and ppl that i know are not uni fans, and i like to keep it that way.  MORE FOR ME.uni aside, the sushi at sushi-gen is uber fresh and reasonably priced for sushi at that quality.  you won't find crazy rolls here (nothing fried, no cream cheese) -- it's straight up sushi.  the waiters are wonderfully nice and will tell you when you're ordering too much (who tells you that?!!!).the wait is a beeeeeeyotch, so try and get there before peak dinner hours.  i have been told that the lunch specials are fantastically priced, but i've never had the pleasure to partake at that hour.the honda plaza has a $2.50 charge for parking.  you can risk parking at the lot across the street, but that would be wrong.  and you didn't hear it from me.

Reviews.Author: Clara K.
Reviews.Content: reservations are a must unless you want to wait for a long, long time in the cramped entryway or outside the restaurant. i actually overheard the group next to me debating whether to stay or leave. i think they eventually stayed. luckily we had a res and were seated almost immediately.the sushi was good, but i wasn't really blown away. given all the rave reviews for this place, i must be really picky about my sushi or something. at 8:30 on a saturday night, they were sold out of a lot of things i wanted to try, including live scallop and spanish mackerel. my favorites were the yellowtail belly and albacore. we tried to order uni but our server must have misunderstood us because we got some kind of clam instead, which was actually pretty good. parking is $2.50 with validation in the outdoor parking lot.

Reviews.Author: Flora C.
Reviews.Content: You know when old ladies bust a move on you to beat you to the entrance that this place is good! The sashimi and sushi was very, very fresh, of high quality, they gave you a good amount, and the service was great.  It is a bit expensive and there is a wait, but it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi bar in LA.  I have never had such delicate, fresh, and flavorful red snapper with salt/lime anywhere.  All the Nigiri are made just right proportionally which seem tough to find these days with all the Korean sushi places around. The fish is sliced perfectly with the right amount of sushi rice.  The food is definitely worth the long wait and price.

Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this place even though I pounded 18 hot wings before meeting my friend here for dinner because I didn't know we were getting dinner.

Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to go here, eat all really really good sashimi and give them 5 stars. Instead I came here, ate SOME really really good sashimi and decided to give them 4 stars.We arrived nice and early due to the legend of the epic lunch crowd, and boy was that a good idea. There was 1 man seated outside when we arrived and so we took a seats next him and soon after an endless flock arrived to the point that when they opened the restaurant every table was filled and people were still waiting outside.We sat down as the staff bustled around in automation. We knew we were going to try the Sashimi Lunch so there was little need to look at a menu, we ordered right away and before we knew it miso soup was served with 3 large medium tofu cubes and a small plate of salad. I myself placed the tofu in the miso and ate them out of there, yum yum, and then drank the miso, very good. Basic but well flavored with a nice consistency.Then very shortly after, even before my gf had time to finish her miso, the "Sashimi" (it wasn't all sashimi) arrived. At first glance it did not seem like much, but i was full by the time we were done.Now I'm going to make an attempt at listing what was in it (sp = speculative).Fresh Water Eel (Unagi) : Grilled to perfection. So good, I could eat it all day.Lightly Grilled Salmon : Slightly cool and good, although I would have preferred it be sashimi.Octopus (Tako) [sp] : Best I've had to date, but didn't make me a fan.Squid (Ika) [sp] : Interesting texture, not my favorite. Clam [sp] : Never really liked Clam sashimi, but it was okay.Unknown [sp] : White stick of something that flakes, didn't taste great, not nice texture. What was it? I don't know.Krab (Kani) : Its imitation crab... whats to say.Not-spicy Salmon [sp] : Tasted like the scallions more than salmon, hence I wasn't 100% sure it was salmon.Spicy Tuna : Pretty good, very scallion-y but at least you could tell it was Tuna.3 types of tuna:Yellow Tail (Buri/Hamachi) : Very delicious, up there with the bestAkami : Chopped into smaller pieces than usual, and not the best I've ever had, but good regardless.Toro of some grade : I'm not sure what cut of toro this was, probably Chutoro (medium fat), but it was absolutely delicious on the first bite, and every bite after that I had to question whether or not I had just put a sliver of fish flavored butter in my mouth. It literally melted on my tongue. Very delicious, but very fatty which is why I'm wondering if it was even possibly close to regular Toro (fatty), or Otoro (very fatty). If it was just Chutoro I fear what true Otoro tastest like in ones mouth.I failed to ask exactly what everything was, and it would be great if someone could and then post a review on the exact contents.Anyhow. I think the primary issue with this restaurant is what I ordered.. too much of a sample and not enough just good stuff. I think if I had a plate of toro, unagi and salmon I would be I would be dead happy and slip them 5 stars without even trying it.Worth the wait? not sure it. Worth the price? Questionable. I'd actually like to try them one more time, but with only fish of my choice.

Reviews.Author: Keisha A.
