Reviews.Content: It's good, but I don't know that it's wait for 2 hours to be seated good.  The sushi is fresh, the menu is varied, the service is quick and the prices are reasonable.  This is a great place to take a sushi snob.  They provide validation for parking in the lot.  The lot tends to get crowded though.

Reviews.Author: Jenny Y.
Reviews.Content: 15buck lunch sashimi special TO-GO is probably the best thing in life. No lines to hassle with. Call in your order before 2pm weekdays. Man. Best value for lots of yummy lusciousness. This is the brokeman's semi-quality sushi experience.  Sushi Gen: you deserve all the praise that you get.

Reviews.Author: Yui Y.
Reviews.Content: Attn Sushi Lovers!!If you want the best sushi experience just pls pls pls order Omakase.  They don't have a set omakase menu price but if you let the chef know i'm pretty sure he'll be happy to work with your budget.  Trust me it's worth the $$ :)  I always ask for omakase and order a bottle of sake which comes to around $120 ish, but keep in mind I do eat ALOT.  Sushi Gen is the place for real traditional sushi not for fusion rolls, but if you do want rolls thats full of flavor try the Negi Toro Takuan(scallion toro radish) Roll.  I prefer hand roll to cut roll because of their nori (seaweed).  Buy your chef a beer so he can enjoy it after work.  Use the restroom before you're seated.  Don't walk out in the middle of your meal to smoke your nasty cigarettes.  Don't complain if they squeeze you in for a seat just be grateful dammit.  Pour little soy sauce at a time.... It bothers me when I see people filling their little dish up.  You can always pour more right?Now go enjoy your meal like you've been eating sushi your whole life.  Trust me that this will be the only sushi joint you'll be visiting from now on.  If you don't like this place.... then just go back to katsuya..

Reviews.Author: Wayne K.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is good and fresh but the only thing I cannot get by is the rudeness.  They just give you the feeling like you are not too welcomed.

Reviews.Author: Jessica F.
Reviews.Content: my mouth is just watering thinking about the sushi there! it is one of the best sushi deals in LA based on quality for price.  Mainly its agreat deal for lunch, but its very reasonably priced for dinner as well. The plate includes several slices of lean tuna prepared in various ways, by itself, spicy mixed, etc. Also there is a couple slices of bluefin tuna, some yellowtail, calamari, a piece of octopus, among other variables. It comes with as much sushi rice on the side as you need, a couple pickled vegetable dishes, as well as miso soup and green tea. And this is fresh, caught off the West coast fish.If you get there after they open, be prepared to wait at least an hour in line outside before you are seated. If you come about half an hour before they open at 11am, you will most likely be seated right when they open.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the lunch sashimi and I must say~ it freakin rocks! Sooo good for the price...this is the sushi restaurant equivalent of Shabu Shabu House. Unbeatable quality for the amount you pay~ Long lines and devoted clientele. I heart Little Tokyo~

Reviews.Author: Dennis Y.
Reviews.Content: Definitely overrated sushi... It's decent Cal-style sushi but not the authentic Japanese style... You know something's up when there are very few native Japanese customers there...

Reviews.Author: Joanne L.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, super fresh, and reasonably priced.  Come early to this place since reservations don't necessarily guarantee you a spot.  My parents were visiting for the weekend and we were craving some gooooood sashimi.  They prefer the real deal Japanese sashimi as opposed to the celebrity infested trendy Japanese fusion stuff so Sushi Gen sounded perfect (no offense). The ankimo was so fresh! Not a hint of fishyness to it at all.  Tempura that came with our beef teriyaki steak was lightly battered and delicious. The popular sashimi deluxe was AWESOME! I'm drooling just thinking about the melt in your mouth hamachi. It was so big, the three of us couldn't even finish it. The only disappointment was how small the uni nigiri was. I'm not a big uni fan but my mom and is she said it was very good quality but just kind of small.  Can't wait to come back and eat at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Scott K.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately Sushi Gen is too far for me to come to on a regular basis but my yelp list wouldn't be complete unless I said something about this Little Tokyo mainstay.  The sushi here is superb and alwasy fresh so let's just get that out of the way.  You can read the other reviews about how awesome the toro, yellowtail belly, uni, etc is...and it's all true by the way, but what's the secret not too many ppl know about is the sashimi deluxe dinner.  For something like $35, you get a mountain of every type of sashimi you can imagine including uni and toro!  Just order two sides of rice and you and friend are set.  Try it sometime when you don't get a seat at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: I was sold when the sushi chef gave us our Amaebi (Sweet Shrimp) with some Uni (Sea Urchin) as a seasoning topping followed by a, "Ssshhhhhh.  Don't tell the boss."  That's what I call a YakUza sushi chef.  True artist..  Nuttin' like a school of ganGzta fish swimming in my stomach.  gLP!

Reviews.Author: Grace S.
Reviews.Content: Pricy but quality is awesome

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Only been here for the $15 sashimi lunch special and I must say, I'll buy into the hype.  Not only was the meal a steal, but the quality of the fish was excellent!  Not sure if it's worth the wait, but if I ever want to have this again, I'll make a reservation a week in advance.  I would like to come back and try the other items they have to offer.

Reviews.Author: Jane Y.
Reviews.Content: In the words of our waitress "This restaurant is real japanese sushi. No fancy rolls. *rolls eyes*"OK, I get it. The fish is fresh. So what? It's not like the chef just caught it this morning. It still had to be imported. The only reason the fish here is SO FRESH, is because they have higher turnover, allowing them to order fish delivery more often. It is NOT because they have special fish that by natural selection was strong enough to swim from Alaska to California's muscle beach, even if they do share the same coast! so, SLAP & flips table.I'm not actually that angry because it's been a few months since I've been here. I came here with my bf on our california vacation because I raved about how many amazing reviews it had. I wish I hadn't.My bf is someone who likes a little bit of everything, yes and that means specialty rolls too. To be honest, so do I. Although I do love a fresh plate of raw goodness. The restaurant was full when I came here, but we only had to wait for around 10 minutes for a table. We got seated fine and began looking at the menu. We immediately saw that there weren't a lot of things my bf loved, so it took us a while to decide what we wanted. Also, we saw that their california roll plate was $18, so we had to ask. The waitress had come by every 2 minutes to rush us to order, and when we asked about the california roll plate, she simply said "this restaurant is real japanese sushi. No fancy rolls. This is 16 piece of california roll."  She also gestured to take our menus away so we could leave. We didn't appreciate that at all! I also understand they are busy, but we weren't there for 30 minutes trying to decide. It was 10 minutes max. I felt very stressed. We ended up ordering a "tuna tatare" appetizer, a sashimi platter and some simple rolls. One of them was the spicy tuna. The tuna tatare ended up just being the spicy tuna mix on top of some cucumber, and seaweed. So we ended up having too much spicy tuna in our meal. The waitress, knowing this did not advise us towards something else, or let us know this was the case. I used to be a waitress for 5 years, and this was definitely something I would've pointed out to my guests so they can experience a broad variety of what the restaurant has to offer. "Meh. I've experienced better." was definitely the best way to rate my experience here. Thanks yelp.

Reviews.Author: Jane C.
Reviews.Content: yumm.the endPlease see my photos for my favorites =)

Reviews.Author: Claire U.
Reviews.Content: I love Sushi Gen! I've only had one dish the four times I've gone there (sashimi dinner for $23-$24), and it's great. The dish comes with cucumber salad, miso soup, and tempura (shrimp and veggie), too, which I think definitely helps justify the price. The sashimi dinner itself is really yummy. Every time I've gone, the sashimi selection kinda changes, excluding the usual 3-4 sets of different tuna cuts (I'm not complaining, I love tuna!). It's always so packed, though, the wait is a little tough. I hear going there for lunch on a weekday is best, but I haven't had the opportunity to.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: Hip, Hip, HOORAY -- I VOMITED REPEATEDLY IN THEIR RESTAURANT AFTER EATING THEIR SASHIMI DELUXE PLATTER  AND THEY STILL HAD THE F-ING NERVE TO CHARGE ME FOR IT!!!As a preface, I have been eating sushi my entire life (30+ years) ever since I was a young child.  Possibly no more than three times in my entire life, including this one incident, have I been sick as a result of eating raw fish.  However, this time, without question, it was due to some of their fish NOT being FRESH and some LOW quality CUTS.  Tonight, I ordered the sashimi deluxe as I had done numerous times before, although, this time I got some slightly less than fresh fish, but the chopped tuna was pretty fishy and immediately made my  stomach turn, so i stopped eating pronto.  Additionally, all the premium cuts (toro, hamachi, etc...) had this string thick white stuff running all through it and that stuff is completely inedible -- it's like slimy floss.  So I very politely asked my waitress to remove the plate and take it off the bill.  She refused and said I would need to speak with the manager.  As I waited and waited, with this nasty platter in my face I began to feel more and more ill.  I walked over to the manager and told him I was not feeling well because of the fish and wanted my bill and asked him to remove the sashimi deluxe platter.  He had the nerve to say I would NEED to pay for what I had eaten -- I corrected him and said what had made me SICK to my stomach.  The bill came and he attempted to charge me $21 instead of the normal $35 when I hadn't even touched the premium cuts on my platter, and I was literally turning green faced because of the BAD FISH.  Plus they had made me wait at least 15 minute during this horrible ordeal and I could no longer hold it anymore and I rushed to their restroom to vomit.  Upon coming out of the restroom, I informed the manager I threw-up and that he should take the sashimi deluxe off the bill, so I could pay it and leave -- again, he refused.  I sat back down at our table and did not feel comfortable paying for this platter nor was I about to just walk out, but again the urge came to vomit, so I rushed yet again to the restroom to relieve the brewing discomfort in my stomach.  At that point, I had had enough and told the manager that if DID NOT immediately remove the sashimi deluxe from my bill and if I needed to throw up again before he could make it happen it would be happening  in the center of the restaurant, so he could see it firsthand.  I guess he finally realized I really wasn't feeling well and about to lose it, so he conceded and stated he'd take it off the bill -- I find it absolutely ridiculous that I had to take it this far.  Still they had the nerve to make me wait at minimum another five more minutes  and in that time I again needed to rush off to the restroom and VOMIT.After leaving sushi-gen I vomited in their parking lot about five more times over the course of the next twenty minutes.  Only fish came up and after I believe I got most, if not all, of it out of my stomach did I start to feel better.  I TOOK PHOTOS of the whole incident, though, I am somewhat indecisive as to whether I should post them on yelp....F sushi-gen -- this used to be one of my top sushi joints in LA, but that all changed after tonight!

Reviews.Author: C B.
Reviews.Content: Hospitality not given here. The staff seems pretty full of themselves. I was told by the sushi chef not to eat rolls because there was too much rice and I should be so happy to have a professional chef behind the counter. Hmmmm. I thought to myself okay, but right now I don't want just sushi or sashimi, I want a roll. Needless to say, I was with 2 other friends and was forced to sit at the sushi bar and only after done with our meal was told that we didn't buy enough dishes to sit at the bar. We waited in line for 45 minutes to come here for lunch and there was never a minimum discussed with us when we were seated. I don't mind spending the money, its the principal. I will never go back again. They should be so gracious to have their business, cockiness will shut you down in seconds!

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: Probably my favorite sushi place in LA.  Everything is always fresh, best ankimo I've had so far.  Even their steak teriyaki is good and really well fried tempura.  If the sushi chef recommends anything, just eat it without asking, it's never bad.

Reviews.Author: Allison Y.
Reviews.Content: been here many times for dinner - sashimi is definitely fresh. everything else is ok. never really felt an urge to come back (especially since its pretty expensive) until i found out about the LUNCH SPECIAL. a full plate of FRESH ASS sashimi, miso soup, huge bowl of rice and tofu for $15. FIFTEEN DOLLARS. no better deal out there. i promise u lunch is 11am-2pm on weekdays. seems that they seat you after 2pm as long as you get your name down on the list BEFORE 2pm.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy O.
Reviews.Content: sushi gen in my opinion is a fine option for sushi.  it isnt the greatest nor is it that bad.  their toro was just  mediocore at best while their uni was probably the best that i had in little tokyo. prices are not indicated so order wisely or you can end up spending 500 for a table of 4

Reviews.Author: G T.
Reviews.Content: Still the best sushi bar in Little Tokyo and the wait wasn't half bad on a Friday night (table not bar).  The toro and uni still rival those i've recently had at more expensive sushi houses.  Good thing too because those are my faves.  Had the trifecta of yellowtail, yellowtail belly, and kanpachi (baby yellowtail).  The belly tastes like toro.  Kohada (gizzard shad) was mmmm  good..  Tried the appetizer version of the ankimo which comes with a slightly spicy ponzu sauce.  Not bad, but found the sauce overwelmed the fish a bit too much.  I like that fishy taste.  It's sushi afterall.   A personal fave of mine is the kazunoko which is herring roe.  It's salty and crunchy and goes well with beer.  Only downside is the high cholesteral.

Reviews.Author: Mihae T.
Reviews.Content: By far THE BEST sushi place in the LA area.

Reviews.Author: Heejin L.
Reviews.Content: pretty good.not your "budget" sushi.good quality.and it has the real japanese feel. YUM.

Reviews.Author: Carese L.
Reviews.Content: went here on a whim early one thursday evening 'n it's good we got there when we did cuz right after we were seated, a line formed 'n remained long til we left.  i let my friend do all the ordering, we had the sushi deluxe and the sashimi deluxe.  good quality and quantity of fresh fish - the only one i wasn't a huge fan of was the fatty tuna mixed w/ green onion, just a weird consistency.  staff were very attentive, friendly 'n knowledgeable.

Reviews.Author: Lynne C.
Reviews.Content: came here on valentines day bc due to my perpetual tardiness we missed our reservation at the original restaurant my date had schemed.for whatever reason i dont usually go to japanese restaurants. this place has crazy good reviews and its no wonder, the sashimi is like buttttAH, im actually getting a little drooly as i type. the ambiance is cute, authentic japanese, warmly lit, quiet, accessible (not too trendy, too tightly packed, loud, dark, hipster) its perfect for dinner with the significant others parents (which is what was happening at the table next to us), the family (i would totally take my raw fish loving family here--and even my grandfather, who gets agoraphobic and hates waiting to be seated, hates clatter clutter, but love loves himself a good chirashi bowl--this place would even meet his high and picky standards), or a date.bc its such a chill ambiance it feels like a neighborhood spot you could pop in weekly, but i dont actually think thats financially sustainable--so sad.they have their own parking lot--2-4$ to park, but you need cash. there's also a cute japanese bar two stores down w/flatscreens and i'd imagine lots of scotch. we thought it was a strip bar or burlesque joint or something, but i think its just a normal bar...its a great place to chill while waiting for your table at sushi gen--we were so hungry we shared a hot dog at wurstkuche beforehand (which is just down the street); the perfect appetizer..hehe

Reviews.Author: Angel N.
Reviews.Content: I really still don't understand why this place is so popular. Came here twice n both time super disappointed. A lot of people were raving about this place, so I gave it a try. The first time I came here, everything was ok.......Gave it another try because I thought maybe the first time I tried it was just a bad day but no, another disappointment. I tried almost all the sushi there n I still don't get what all the hype is about. Sorry.

Reviews.Author: Vivian M.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for their sashimi combo plate! That's the best deal there ($15.00), go early for lunch, sit at the table, and make sure to order that. It comes with miso soup, marinated tofu appetizer, pickled cucumber seaweed salad, a giant bowl of rice (which is refillable), and a plate full of assorted fishies, all served sashimi style. Yum.

Reviews.Author: Luke D.
Reviews.Content: Yes I'm a fan this place is always good. i enjoy there Sashimi and find the service good. This place never disappoints.

Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: Great place for sushi or sashimi right on the edge of Japantown. Expect a line if you come on the weekend. Put your name on the list and go for a walk. You'll wait half as long as their estimate (never fails, you'd think they'd get better at this). While the teriyaki and tempura are decent, stick with the sushi/sashimi. Service is a little slow. I usually get a table because the bar is a bit shy on elbow room. They have a parking lot (it's in Honda Plaza) that sometimes is free and sometimes is not so I usually park on the street. I've always found free parking within a block. Personally, I think their sashimi is the freshest (and best) in all of Japantown.

Reviews.Author: david c.
Reviews.Content: i'm a little bit shocked at myself.i can't believe i haven't reviewed sushi gen. i thought i did.this is the probably the single restaurant i've been to the most in all of los angeles. perhaps a hundred times by now.when i worked at barwick studios i probably ate here three times a week to skip the traffic back to westwood and i probably had mercury poisoning as well. the GEN is like an old reliable friend. some sushi joints are sexier or fancier, more rarified, or more sushi nazi, but nothing can beat the value and consistency of sushi gen. the sashimi dinner, although its price has creeped upwards over the years is probably the best deal in town. i just got back to LA this past friday, after an epic two months of insane travel in spain, morocco, new york, hong kong, macau and thailand, and i had to get my fix. my favorite chef, hiro is no longer there, but you know... its too legit to quit.i'm now in baton rouge on a movie for two months (til august/september). if anyone knows any fools out here give me a shout, cuz i dont know anyone! and i need to explore some southern cooking! looking forward to fried foods and getting called chink! aw yeah!

Reviews.Author: C P.
Reviews.Content: For a celebration the bosses left it up to me to choose a spot for lunch on them. Of course my counter part is up in age and SUPER picky! She only eats Mexican food! Because of this,  I've let her choose the place we eat to celebrate for the last 4 years!  Finally, I had ENOUGH of tacos and burritos and I suggested something I wanted to do. So, I took a chance on Sushi-gen . I mean geez, my first choice in 4 years best be good and I best not disappoint!  So I called ahead of time to make sure they served chicken teriyaki for Julie, they did (I know, I know...chicken?!?!).  They also informed me there are NO reservations available.  So we hopped the metro, walked a couple of blocks and found this delectable little place. It was a Friday, probably about 12:15 pm...LUNCH RUSH!!  There were several parties waiting to be seated, I asked the host how long the wait for 4 would be, he informed me 15 minutes. I said okay but was seriously doubting we'd get seated that fast.  Well, color me happy, it really was only a 15 minute wait!!  The restaurant was packed but the host and other staff was friendly (but not too friendly) and informative despite a slight language barrier.  When we were seated they gave us just the perfect amount of time to sit, get comfortable, wash our hands and make up our minds on drinks before taking our order. We admired the artwork and decor of the establishment and as soon as we knew it, another waiter was back with our drinks and ready for our food order. Very quick and impressive with it being during the lunch rush and all.  As everyone seems to agree, sashimi was off the hook! And thanks to everyones informative reviews, I even tried uni for the first time! Everyone was extremely satisfied with their meal, even picky Julie!! And also I forgot to mention my boss is vegetarian but he managed to find a veggie alternative and also liked the place. I had no regrets choosing sushi-gen and I have a feeling it will be my new craving : )If you like sushi, sashimi...try this place! Fresh, tasty, perfect temperature, presentation is great, staff is nice and not disgruntled. GO...GO NOW!

Reviews.Author: Shelly H.
Reviews.Content: Good sushi, sashimi, kitchen food, however service is horrible.  Today I had lunch at the sushi bar and I accidently spilled miso soup, I understand it was my mistake but I should not be fully responsible to clean up the mess.  The waitress simply just handed a lot of cheap napkins for me to clean up.  Actually she didn't hand it to me, she dropped it on the table.  Sushi chefs are not entertaining nor friendly.  Maybe I'll have a better experience next time.

Reviews.Author: david p.
Reviews.Content: I admire japanese culture because they can focus on just one thing and one thing only in the hopes of simplifying it and taking efforts in perfecting its form. Sushi in it's most basic form should be just that. I am starting to cringe when I see the words "Catepillar", "Volcano", and "Dynamite" when restaurants are trying to describe sushi. I am starting to dislike all this sauced up nonsense that has become popular mainly to bring sushi to the masses. Cooking should be a celebration of the ingredient not a smoke and mirrors operation to hide what you are eating. I came here and order sushi, sashimi, and a beer. I enjoyed the fish, not the avocado, or sauce, or sprinkled crunch crap.

Reviews.Author: E L.
Reviews.Content: After coming home from Japan, I needed to find the best sushi in LA at a reasonable price to measure up to what I found out there.  Sushi Gen offers some of the best quality fish you can find that I've seen so far in southern California, albeit at a steeper price.  It was definitely worth the visit though.  It looks like I will be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Dayna C.
Reviews.Content: WASABI......... I happened to get lucky because I heard this place is usually extremely crowded.   I ate here early before the dinner rush.  We ordered yellow tail, salmon, sashimi, and of course California Roll. The fish tastes very fresh and everybody enjoyed their sushi.  The staff was friendly and attended to our table often.

Reviews.Author: Joey J.
Reviews.Content: do not be put off by the strip-mall-ish location -- this place is awesome.  you couldn't ask for a better sushi meal or restaurant ambiance.  definitely the best sushi i've ever had in LA.  the service was very prompt and attentive considering that it was so busy.i recommend the sushi deluxe combination ($23) or the sashimi dinner (also $23).  also the plum wine and green tea were very good.

Reviews.Author: Melanie F.
Reviews.Content: fresh.amazing.expensive.well worth it!will come again. :)

Reviews.Author: Kezo N.
Reviews.Content: had the most amazing sushi, since i was in Tokyo, WOW, i can't wait togo back for my birthday, it's the bomb sushi joint in LALA,  well i had theocassion 2 hit, Sushi Gen this past week and ordered the Sashimi DeluXWOW, prolly the most amazingly fresh sumptuous fresh fish ever, it doesnot get any better than Sushi Gen, now i'm a happy camper and still in damood 4 more, i just can't get enuff tasty Raw-Sashimi, then Sushi Gen !!!!!don't think i'll wait another year 2 go there,...LOL, Mahalo nui loa ,kezo/K.

Reviews.Author: Leni A.
Reviews.Content: this was one of my fave places to eat when i was a young intern in downtown l.a.  after about six long years away, i finally went back recently.  i used to order the sashimi plate, which was a great deal at $11. in this reunion of sorts, i debated if i should do the chirashi (because other reviews noted that the sashimi platter was tuna heavy and i've since tried to avoid eating a lot of that) but the sashimi plate lunch special included other goodies so i went for that.  and, heck, for old time's sake, ya?  it's happened several times when i revisit a place that i liked a lot before, that it wasn't as great as i remembered.  i was really crossing my fingers that this wasn't going to be another one of those times.  much to my relief and surprise, it was even better than i expected!!remember when i mentioned that since it was a lunch special, it included other goodies?  well, watch out for those because those could get pretty filling...i mean you can't help eat them, they're so good.the first thing we got was a small appetizer of pickled cabbage(?). then came nori, then meaty flavored tofu pieces, miso soup, and THEN a payload of sashimi!  okay actually not everything was raw.  the salmon was cooked (to my disappointment--it's one of my raw faves!) plainly while other unidentifiable fish were cooked in a sort of marinade...i don't know how to describe it, you just gotta try!  there was a lot of fish that's for sure.  and all this for only $12.50!for a sushi lover, i'm embarrassed to admit i wasn't sure what all the fish were--i stick to my favorites; leave me alone.  but if it was tuna heavy, it was mainly the white fish variety and all of it was like BUHDAH!!  the ahi, the yellowtail....HOLY MELTIN MOLY!  what a special treat and surprise coming here again was.  if you're gonna try sushi gen (at least for the first time or on a budget), this is the way to go.p.s.to me, there was no overwhelming "fishy smell" but i grew up in a house that cooked a lot of fish and other "funky" stuff.  i think i know what other reviewers meant but i felt it was barely noticable (i was looking for the scent!).  btw, the bathrooms are quite clean!  oh, and we got there before it opened on a monday and there was already line!!  you may need to time going there in 1 hour increments from opening to avoid waiting too long.

Reviews.Author: Suji C.
Reviews.Content: i have claimed to be a sushi-lover for as long as i know it...but have never tasted sushi/sashimi as such!it's fresh. legit. and there's actual japanese workers! (or they appear to be so)get the $15 lunch combo that everyone is raving about on this thingonly downside can be the waitbut just do what i did. walk down a couple stores & buy a couple macarons at the bakery. dessert 4 laters - perfect!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa K.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this place gets so many great reviews and why the line is so long. I ate at Sushi-Gen tonight, and got there at 5pm, and the place was already at half capacity. I heard so many good things, how it's fresh, and reasonably priced. LIES! The fish was not fresh. It didn't have the nice cold feeling you get when you eat sushi/sashimi. The sushi didn't have the nice bite, where you're biting into something, rather the sushi was short, and thin. I took a bite, and I went straight to my tooth, there was no give. The pieces were small and the place was completely overpriced. What everyone calls fresh and "authentic" just shows me that Los Angeles does not have great sushi. I've eaten at a lot of places, and while I may not yelp them all, I've eaten and experienced a lot. Hong Kong had amazing sushi and for half the price. San Francisco's Tekka is 100 times better. The sushi is three times the size and much more reasonably priced. A yellowtail (hamachi) is three times the size, and is only $4.50 for ONE PIECE. The uni is definitely fresher, and instead of giving you one piece, Tekka gives you THREE PIECES, and it's only for $5! The toro is definitely toro at Tekka and it doesn't have fibrous fish tendon hanging. The scallop is HUGE and has a bite at Tekka. Sushi Gen has NOTHING on Tekka. It's completely overrated. Travel around and have sushi and let me know. Compare the quality of the fish, the size and the price. Anyone can pay an exorbitant amount for good sushi, but it's all about a balance, and Sushi Gen doesn't have it. I don't understand the line, oh WHY! Bad palates!

Reviews.Author: Kim H.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places in LA.  Come early or expect a wait.  If you are eating at the sushi bar be fully aware you can't order from the menu so it gets pricey.  As the other reviewers point out it is top quality and consistent, not the trendy foo foo type sushi places for the in crowd.  You are here to eat awesome sushi so for those that care about the scene, the looks, the hot place to be....go to the other sushi places like R23 and pay three times as much for lower quality food.  But hey if you like appearance over substance go for it.  This is substance over appearance.  Tip...speak Japanese or act like you are and you get seated quick!

Reviews.Author: Clara L.
Reviews.Content: my go to place for decent affordable sushi. after living in japan, i know it's nearly impossible to find great sushi here (unless you shell out the big bucks or your boss treats you to matsuhisa) but sushi gen is one of the better joints out here in LA. not tsukiji market at 5AM quality but good enough where you won't leave thinking "what did i just eat?!" (trust me, i've felt that way at many "sushi" restaurants here in LA)i only go for dinner and usually get the sashimi deluxe and yellowtail collar. i've heard that the wait is usually long here but everytime i've gone, i've gotten seated quickly.  the waitresses are nice and while they seem a bit shy to converse in english, they totally open up once you start conversing in japanese. a lot of them tell me they miss home. :( definitely somewhere you want to try if you want decent sushi that wont break the bank.

Reviews.Author: Jessica O.
Reviews.Content: The Sashimi Lunch special is a steal at $15, but there is a ton of tuna on that plate. Lines are long. Get there 20 minutes before doors open for lunch if you want to make into the first seating.

Reviews.Author: Shane S.
Reviews.Content: Ive been coming here for years...probably just when it first opened. Many of the chefs are the same and for that matter the waitresses! I really like this place, however I do feel it is  become a bit average from too much word of mouth or Yelp! The fish is fresh?  to me that should really be a given a sushi bar..... if you don't have that than what else? But can you tell fresh fish from frozen? flash freezing fish from japan and other countries is a must. Its  the quality of that particular fish, where it is from, and the expert way they cut and serve it.    They do have some of the best selections here, however that has changed somewhat over the years . They used to always have their name on the best fish at the fish market ( yes i do know) and the  time and effort to make each piece has fallen a bit.  The assembly line of the "tuna sashimi plate" has taken over. Now please don't get me wrong I love this place.... i guess i'm just a little bitter everyone else does now too! I do get the sashimi deluxe platter, and i sometimes even eat at the bar like old times. They serve high quality traditional fare. everything is usually very good ! I cant say that it is the best anymore, but its above average and very good.  I guess i like to talk to my chef ,look at all the fish choices, maybe get something special.... share some beer. its just now very hard to do with such a wait and an army to feed every day!

Reviews.Author: Celia C.
Reviews.Content: I'm a real fan of Sushi-Gen.  They have the absolute best freshest sushi I've ever had in my life.  I've come in for lunch specials and find that they are truly affordable and tasty.  This place is a classic sushi restaurant in the city of angels in Little Tokyo.  If you have never come here.....don't wait for a special occasion or special invite.  Just come on down to Little Tokoyo and ENJOY!

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best sushi place I have tried in LA and in the entire United States. We've been here twice and each time waited for 1 hour, but it was well worth it. We always sit at the sushi bar and ask the chef for recommendations on their best fish of the day. I do not think it is fair for people to give negative reviews  because they didn't like their "spider roll"  or "shrimp tempura". Come on, if you are going to order stuff like that, don't need to come here and wait for an hour.  Almost every piece of fish we put in our mouth makes us go "OMG, I've died and gone to heaven". Especially the TORO!!!! Holy Cow!!! After experiencing the most amazing piece of goodness, we no longer care how much it costs and would be ok spending all our money here. Our bill typically comes out to be around 135 bucks between 2 people and we walk away completely full and satisfied. The point I have to knock off is the consistency. The fist time we tried this place, it was absolutely incredible. For example, I normally don't like Tuna but their Tuna tasted almost like fatty tuna. The second time we went back, their tuna tasted more like what I'm used to, bland and not that much taste. Anyways,  I still ove this place and find any chance to go back.

Reviews.Author: Jay F.
Reviews.Content: In order for a business to be successful you have to do one thing better than anyone on a consistent basis and have a real vision for what your customers want that thing to be. There is a market for Gen. Sushi Gen is traditional Japanese to the very core, nothing more, nothing less.  The sushi is a good, fresh, quality grade but nothing really got my attention. No vibe.I've been to at least a hundred Japanese restaurants in my life. Ninety of them were exactly like this one.  It's the other 10 that I remember fondly. This is not one of them. Parking is $2.50

Reviews.Author: Retired B.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars. They are super strict about reservation time. If you're late by 5 minutes, they'll give your table away. Service is slow- they need to improve that since the waits are very long get a table. At closing time, there are about 15-20 people outside still waiting! Some of the sushi is really good (uni, chu toro) some of them were okay (hamachi, albacore, spicy tuna), some were awful (spanish mackerel, monkfish liver) - it's all across the board. Sasabune in LA is still my fave sushi spot.Hamachi kama (yellowtail cheek) and Salmon ochazuke (porridge) were both good.

Reviews.Author: Oscar L.
Reviews.Content: MAKE SURE YOU ORDER THE SASHIMI PLATE!!!! The wait is about 20 - 30 minutes on a busy day. You must go up to the front and ask for a table or else people will start cutting in line like a douche assuming you put your name on the list. Better yet, make reservations early. The sushi bar is only for big eaters in my opinion because it says "minimum 4 orders" AND THAT IS PER PERSON. I did not like the place because of how crowded it was and the fact that their menus had no pictures at all. MAKE SURE YOU KNOW YOUR SUSHI. This is no Kabuki or Midori. It is mostly just fish along with other Japanese food you see in cartoons. There is no fire cracker roll, dragon roll, or spider roll etc. The fish was amazing, but I give it a three because of how crowded it was, the unorganized line, and the fact that I did not really know what I was ordering.

Reviews.Author: Pat C.
Reviews.Content: Top quality sushi at great prices. Haven't tried the dinner, but the $15 sashimi lunch is a great bargain. Full plate of sashimi with soup, sides, and rice. Just be prepared for the 40 minute wait. They take lunch reservations, but only about 4 days in advance. Plan well or prepare to wait.

Reviews.Author: Gurei K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is an authentic sushi-ya for the counter sitting fishy. They are always spot on. Make sure to ask what is fresh today before ordering away. Gen will tell you the truth which is good because the truth always comes out in the flavor and texture of the fish. They seem to always have amazing yellowtail belly, and the Uni here has never let me down. They have quail egg in abundance, so put it on your Ikura & Natto handroll, delish! The rice is also suprisingly high grade, this place hits it right on the nose.

Reviews.Author: Grace J.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch.  Nuff said :)

Reviews.Author: Danny R.
Reviews.Content: I love Yelp cause its reviews are always spot on. So i would like to thank my fellow yelpers!!. Sashimi plate was soo good!. My favorite is the salmon sashimi since it melts in your mouth. How can a fish melt in your mouth you ask?..I really don't know..it just does..LOL.  We also had the salmon skin salad (my favorite salad)   Everything we ordered was good. Toro, Uni, yellowtail..etc etc

Reviews.Author: Peter C.
Reviews.Content: It is one of the best sushi restaurant here in LA! It is always crowded. A *must try* restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: My bf took me here yesterday for dinner to celebrate. With reservations, we waited about 5 minutes tops. He ordered the sashimi deluxe (came with tempura) and I got the chirashi. When our orders came, I realized why we don't come here that often (besides the fact it's pricier than other places); there's no salmon pieces. Well, there's a piece of cooked salmon on his deluxe, but that doesn't count. As for my chirashi, I remembered it to have more pieces of fish. However, overall, the service was great and the quality was close to excellent (my toro was lacking a bit of flavor and my minced tuna was a bit fishy). Would I come again? Yes, but not anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Billy C.
Reviews.Content: Four and a half stars, over a thousand reviews, can't go wrong right?  As hard as I try to write as many positive reviews as possible, people need to know!  6 pm on a Wednesday evening, the place was filling up quickly but not THAT busy.  Reminiscent of the good ol' days of Sam Woo, the service was rushed, the waitresses not personable, the feeling was hurry up and eat so we can turn the table.  I'd pay anything for fantastic food!  Portions were small, the deluxe sashimi plat was disappointing, and the overall experience was a blah!  Definitely the wrong way to start an awesome evening.  With so many better alternatives around, I should have chosen more carefully and not rely on just the number of reviews and average star rating.

Reviews.Author: Tina L.
Reviews.Content: Our USUAL sushi-eating experience at other fine sushi establishments in the larger LA area (Hama Sushi, Ichi Sushi, O2 Sushi, Sushi Komasa) involves us sitting at the counter, ordering sushi, watching the sushi chef slice up and place the mouthwateringly fresh pieces of sashimi on well-made sushi rice, devouring the sushi chef's magical creations, and sighing with content.Here, none of that really happened. What went wrong?- Since we were a table of 4, we didn't get a chance to sit at the counter (not their fault, we were a "large" party). The service outside of the counter area was slow and unenjoyable. Our waitress didn't really know too much about fish... though that might have been a language barrier issue.- The taste of the sushi was... fine. We found that the pieces of sashimi on the sushi weren't actually cold.- The portions were ginormously tiny and thin compared to other places. The sushi was ridiculously expensive for what we received. A vegetarian in our group ordered a vegetable roll, which cost more than $15 - what we received were 6 unbelievably small pieces of a cut roll, MUCH less than an inch in diameter. We spent almost $200 for 4 people and left hungrier than when we went in. We actually went to have a satisfying second dinner at Hama Sushi down the street.Tip: if you have a vegetarian in your party, go to Hama Sushi down the street; their miso soup and vegetable roll (and I believe tofu) are of good portions, flavorful, and really well priced.Now, I did take a look at what other tables were ordering--sashimi platters--and they did look good. So in summary: DO NOT ORDER THE SUSHI DELUXE OR VEGETARIAN ITEMS HERE - go only for the sashimi platters (which I will try next time). Better sushi experience at the counter can be had down the street at Hama Sushi or Sushi Komasa.

Reviews.Author: Cindy Y.
Reviews.Content: So after all of the hype about this place, I decided to give it a try. My friend and I got here around 45 minutes before the place opened (11:15 AM on weekdays; 15 minutes more of waiting than I expected!) We were fortunately seated right away, so we did not have to wait long for our food to come. We decided to get the Sashimi lunch special, just because I've heard great things about this place. I think I've ACTUALLY been here before, when I was about 8, but I don't remember it. I can't believe I don't, because I will never forget it. For $15, you get so much fresh fish, it's ridiculous! You get a platter of sashimi, miso soup, small salad, and a bowl of tofu with a light broth. Thank goodness for the small dishes, because those came fast, and I was starving! I thought the small salad and miso soup were just so-so; nothing particularly special. However, the tofu was really delicious. It was a firm tofu similar to agedashi tofu, but not fried. It was dipped in some sort of beef broth it seemed, which paired so perfectly with the tofu. I liked it since it was firm too, since it didn't fall apart when you tried to grab it.Next came the almighty sashimi platter! Tuna, yellowtail, toro, squid, this sort of dried fish, cooked salmon, diced yellowtail with green onions, crab, and spicy tuna...all for $15, what? And this wasn't just any kind of sashimi--it was a kind that literally melted in your mouth once you bit into it. The fish was so fresh and soft that you did not have to put any effort at all into eating it. It was fantastic. There was a generous portion of each. The tuna, yellowtail, and toro came in the traditional style sashimi--sliced fish of about 4 pieces. Each piece was so delicious, I did not want them to end. I think my favorite was the toro; it was almost as if you were eating butter (the consistency, at least) but tasted SO MUCH BETTER. My words don't do it justice, but definitely save this piece for last :D There was a piece of squid, which was also fresh. Very chewy texture, which paired well with the pieces of seaweed they gave. The dried fish that came with it was also delicious--a bit salty, but so good when paired with the rice. The cooked salmon (although I usually like fish of any sort) was nothing compared to the sashimi! It was still pretty good though, just not the best on the plate. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. The diced yellowtail with green onions, crab, and spicy tuna all came in a spoonful placed onto the plate. It was kind of like mini dons, if you know what I mean. Take a spoonful of rice and pair it with these, and you've got a good meal. I liked these, but once again, the sashimi was the star of the show. The sashimi here was probably one of the best I've had, and hence, the 5 stars. Also really good service and very efficient! They seat people instantly and there is practically no wait for the food. Will be back soon :)

Reviews.Author: Amorn B.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi Lunch.  That is all.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla P.
Reviews.Content: this place was okay. come here early to avoid long waits if you like sushi and sashimi equally, i suggest going with the sashimi dinner instead of the sushi deluxe combination to get more bang for your buck.The sashimi dinner comes with many cuts of fish AND Tempura, whereas the sushi deluxe comes with about 8 pieces of standard sushi and some cut tuna and cucumber rolls. the sushi deluxe combination comes with a salmon skin salad (barely any salmon skin) and some slimy little thing, both which aren't worth the extra $5.the highlight of the sushi deluxe was the TORO. excellent. this was heavenly. however, the squid was tough, the shrimp was overcooked, the unagi was too sweet and overpowered with soy sauce and one fish still had a bone or two. if i come back, i'd definitely stick with the sashimi. also, they quoted us 45 minutes - 1 hr but our table was ready 20 minutes later -_-

Reviews.Author: V. S.
Reviews.Content: If you want to make me happy, please just take me here. That's all I'm saying. I fell in love with this sushi place when I was serving jury duty up the street. Scrumptious and the freshest fish in all of LA.

Reviews.Author: Marie V.
Reviews.Content: I think I love you. But 689 reviews??? You little sashimi whore. no wonder there is always a line out the door. but your hamachi, sake, and maguro are mouthwatering, and for that I still love you.

Reviews.Author: Bryant T.
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to come back again...I would definitely recommend sharing the sashimi platter and tempura.   Even if you don't have reservations, I would still wait for a table.  It's a great sushi experience.

Reviews.Author: Art O.
Reviews.Content: My sweet damsel lady friend invited me here for some sushi.  And, as a native Angelino; this is the best place for sushi.  Everything is fresh and made to order.  Although, we had to wait a half an hour; it was well worth it!  Forget the rest--this place is the best!  Food TV, where are you?

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: Bes sashimi lunch special of all time, so fresh!

Reviews.Author: Monica H.
Reviews.Content: I've heard so many good things about Sushi Gen so I decided to take my family here on a week night.  It was kind of disappointing, we made reservations early but still had to wait.  You get a good amount of food for the price but I did not think the sashimi or sushi was that fresh or outstanding.  I like that the lot was pretty empty and they validated.

Reviews.Author: Long T.
Reviews.Content: Met up with some friends here during a business trip to L.A. as part of my Super Fantastic Happy Fun Time L.A. Sushi Tour.  Rumor had it that this place was pretty dy-no-mite as the wait apparently pretty long for the food here.  Thanks to my fellow yelpers who waited while I was stuck on the 110 and then after taking a wrong turn down E. 22nd Street instead of E 2nd street... (BIG difference), I finally made it to the J-Town eatery.  I got the Freshwater Eel Sashimi Dinner and I was satisfied with my meal.  All in all a very good and popular J-town sushi dinner restaurant with many cooked entrees.  It is in the medium price range as far as LA sushi goes...

Reviews.Author: Ashley H.
Reviews.Content: best sushi lunch special i've ever had. all i have to say.

Reviews.Author: Hamed M.
Reviews.Content: didn't have any problems making a reservation for just an hour ahead. the fish here is definitely delicious and melts in your mouth. i had some communication problems with the waitress due to lack of english fluency, but she was nice and tried to be as helpful as she could.i ordered 7 different nigiri, and all were great. the clams were awesome, too.there is plenty of bar seating, and plenty of tables.parking costs $3.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this place gets all the buzz. I consider myself a sushi snob and I only care about one thing when I go to a sushi place, the quality of fish. My wife and I tried the omakase and I'd have to say, for the price they charge, I'd rather go to a high-end sushi place. The quality is not BAD, but it's not worth the price or the wait. My toro (fatty tuna) was a particularly bad cut and had a lot of gristle. Overall, there are too many sushi places in Little Tokyo that I prefer to go before Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: Salina V.
Reviews.Content: Everything here is delicious.  The salmon sashimi was pretty much the best that I have.  It melted in my mouth.  The yellowtail collar bone was also amazing.  Even though there was a 30 minute wait on a weekday it did not matter because the food was well worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Ben G.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is, and it isn't what it isn't, it is a place to get great simple very high quality sushi, it isn't a fancy dimly lit restaurant.  I think many people go here expecting it to be something exciting and amazingly unique, but that's not where sushi gen shines.  Sushi Gen has the highest turn over of fish in LA for a sushi restaurant, that means they can offer great prices on very high quality fish.  If you like simple sushi at a reasonable price them Gen = Good.

Reviews.Author: Dennise d.
Reviews.Content: Does "market price" freak you out? Don't be, that's how Sushi-Gen does. Actually, that's how top sushi restaurants do back in their home country. Want good stuffs? Prepare your guts and wallet, and come to Sushi-Gen.I've been to JP for many times and always love to try any sushi retaurant that has a line outside their door. Sushi Gen has the same atmosphere and smell, like Tokyo and Tsukiji central market. I went there with my best friend on Thanksgiving weekend. We arrived at 12:10 pm and there was already a long line for it. We sighed up on waiting list (host was very friendly) and waited for 45 mins. And then, it was the sushi feast.I don't really care about "no price on sushi menu". To be honest, living in Austin, Texas is a disaster for Sushi lover like me. When I'm in LA or SF, I'd love to pay pretty money for EXCELLENT sushi. Here I was. We sat at bar and greeted by a young sushi chef who worked next to the oldest chef. I'm sure he needs to watch his back all the time hence quality is undoubtedly good. First round, we had ika, taco, ikura, and hamachi. Ika and taco were prepared and preserved carefully. I could taste the fresh and subtle seafood protein sweetness without anything extra to ruin it.They were also very easy to chew and swallow (not like those crappy and gummy ones). And then comes hamachi. The color and texture of this baby was gorgeous, so was it tasted in my mouth. Other than that, our sushi chef did a great job of making nigiri. Fish and rice melted in my mouth as they touched my tongue, with perfect portion of FRESH wasabi, YUM. You ask me about ikura? All I could remember is they pop in my mouth and I know only top quality ikura can bring you that. Since ikura is one of my favorite, 5 points extra for ya, Sushi Gen. Unagi, tamago, sardin, saba and benito are also very very good. If you like vinegary  flavor, definitely try saba and sardin. The reight- to-point sourness from rice vinegar dresses with grated ginger would bring you to heaven directly.The most important stuff that afternoon, of course, was amaebi. Listed on VIP price line, I was quite hesitated if I should get them. After 3 seconds struggling, my appetite told me "you fool, try it while you can". So I did. It. was. de-li-cious. I repeat, DELICIOUS. Amaebi means sweet shirmp and once they touched my tongue, it was literally melted. The smoothness and sweetness were even better than hamachi. For those like shirmp head, Sushi Gen would deep-fried them for you. As for the taste, do you really need me to explain?We order about 12 sets of nigiri, almost tried everything they had that day. Nothing I could really be picky about since it reminds me so much of those great nights in Tokyo. I'm sure I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special. what a deal.*doing my happy dance*fresh. delicious. just the right amount of food. perfection.

Reviews.Author: Mindy H.
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sad that they raised the price for the lunch special (used to be $12.95). . .but it is still a GREAT deal despite the price hike.When I didn't have work, or while I still went to UCLA, I would go home on a Thursday night and have my daddy take me to Sushi Gen for lunch on Fridays.  We'd wake up early, leave the house around 10:30AM and get there before 11AM.  The place doesn't officially open until 11:15AM (sometimes 11:30AM), but already, there would be a line 20 deep.  So no matter what, you'll be waiting a minimum of 30 min.  for this place.The wait is absolutely atrocious if you arrive after the place opens.  If you do have to wait, go shop across the street at American Apparel or go to the bakery next door to buy some sweets to kill time.  But let me tell you, the wait is worth it.They give you a couple of small dishes to whet your appetite before the show:  miso soup, this sweet and sour seaweed thing, warm marinated tofu, and pickled cabbage.  Then the main event:  the sashimi lunch special.  They give you SO MUCH FRESH sashimi.  I can't even name all the fishes on the plate. . .I only recognize tuna, yellowtail and maybe mackerel.  All the other ones are mystery fishes to me.  But delicate, thick slices of mystery fishes. . .as soft as tofu. The only sad thing is that they don't give you any salmon sashimi (they usually give a piece of cooked salmon) :[  But that is okay.  It's still worth it.  I don't even have to pair it with the rice to be full (by the last piece of fish, I'm kinda uncomfortably full, but being a glutton and being a cheap Chinese, am horrified at the thought of wasting such good, fresh fish, I shove it down my gullet anyways). However,  I have realized that the boys still needed the rice to get full.Parking is somewhat annoying, especially when it gets full.  Sushi Gen does validate, I think the price for parking comes out to be like 60 cents or some weird number like that.  So worth it!!!

Reviews.Author: Jolene M.
Reviews.Content: For the sashimi lover, Sushi Gen has good quality fish for not that much dough.  I got the sashimi dinner ($21) which was just a platter of sashimi--no tempura/miso soup/etc.  It came with tuna, yellowtail, cooked salmon, spicy tuna, sweet egg, a piece of mirugai, and a bunch of other stuff i can't remember. You can get the full sashimi dinner for $26.  I also got the unagi sushi, which was small but delicious.  The eel was not as bony as I've had at other places, but the unagi at sakura is still my favorite, even though it is so massive that it falls apart after one bite!

Reviews.Author: Jenni C.
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with Sushi-Gen shortly after i moved out to LA (circa 1998).  Definitely one of the top sushi destinations in LA!  period!

Reviews.Author: Erika N.
Reviews.Content: I had to make my first review something worthwhile...  I had been trying to keep Sushi Gen on the underground, but there's no doubt that the word has been out for some time now... hence the increasing amount of wait time for seating... Although I just went last night and luckily was seated at the end of the bar within a mesmerizing 10 minutes. I guess people were waiting for a table, which was going to take about an hour. I think the bar is the best, yet dangerous place to sit, due to the amount of food you will want to order after each delectable piece of fish. I've taken a few friends here and the place has become their new fave sushi joint as well. The yellowtail sushi is chunky and oh so good. I have not had it elsewhere the way it is put together here. It's not mush like at other places that slab it onto a roll; it is popping out of the soypaper... you'll want to order more. Last night I overheard the patrons seated next to us ask the chef what we were having and that they would like the same just because it looked good. The tuna-I've never seen such a red pretty fish. The albacore sashimi dissolves in your mouth. The toro is like butter. The uni is not too fishy or too sweet. Just a perfect ending to a sushi meal... I've been with people who have also ordered the teriyaki; you can tear the chicken just by poking the fork into it. I don't stir away from the sushi though. It's not fancy, just plain fresh perfect cuts of fish!I love sushi and have tried several places throughout the LA county and there is no doubt this is the freshest authentic sushi I have had.

Reviews.Author: Shirley F.
Reviews.Content: J-town L.A. is nostalgic in many ways... When I was going to a school nearby downtown LA, my dad and I regularly met up in J-town and explored all the sushi places.  Over the years, it became a routine that we'd check whether the (long) wait at Komasa was tolerable, move on to Sushi-Gen, and then Hama Sushi, in that order.  Even after I moved out of LA, somehow I'd find myself in J-town during the holidays... Last night, I retraced the steps and found myself @ Sushi-Gen again, after Komasa closed early because the chef went home sick.  Sushi-Gen was exactly how I remember it to be - fine quality sashimi and sushi (albeit over-priced), with a live buzz in the air, esp. if you sit at  the sushi bar (with a minimum of 4 orders per person) where you can see real kitchen action.   The Asian sushi chefs in the front line, and the Mexican sushi sous-chefs in the back.  This is just an awesome melting-pot scene, typical of LA, that you've got to appreciate.   As I did many times before, I secretly wished that one of the Mexican sous-chefs would be promoted to front-line...  but it hasn't happened yet... not when I was there anyhow.  And as I did before, I secretly contemplated an employment class action lawsuit, on behalf of all Mexican sushi chefs who have ever worked at Sushi-Gen...  If my dad was there, he would've heard a whole earful of how the situation was "F@#&%-up", while I'd have to endure one of his lectures on the fine art of sushi by only Japanese chefs.   Our politics disagreed, but we agreed that Sushi-Gen served fine sushi.  And last night, even without my dad, Sushi-Gen's sushi was just fine.    $2.50 for parking.  Reservation highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Katie K.
Reviews.Content: after my two favorite sushi spots turned me down for take-out on a busy weeknight, I wandered over to Sushi Gen. the host was more than happy to accommodate me, even though they were busy as well.our sushi was great, my only complaint was that it was about 50% more expensive than Komasa, my all time favorite, the food was comparable, though, so I was happy. :)

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen is my go-to spot for sushi in LIttle Tokyo.  The quality of the sushi is top-notch and just shy of some of the elite joints, the waitstaff is attentive, and the sushi chefs are warm and welcoming.  Price is higher than average, but well worth the quality of the sushi (I spent about $86 for two people).  The sushi offerings here are simple and traditional, and you won't find any crazy rolls named after states or eastern cities.  This place gets very crowded, so you might want to get there around opening.  Overall, this is one of the better sushi joints in L.A., and a solid choice.

Reviews.Author: Connie W.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best that I have been to.  I had my first toro here and it was beyond words.

Reviews.Author: Cindy H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is the only place I can order a sushi combination and have it full of GOOD SHIT. Normally, ordering a platter at a sushi restaurant (as opposed to a la carte) implies that you are lazy, have no imagination, and not enough taste to specify exactly what kind of fish you want. As punishment you'd get the dregs of the kitchen - the unwanted, filler pieces - the egg, the plasticky octopus, way too much tuna. But the combos at Sushi Gen are legendary for being abundant, fresh, full of interesting pieces (I'm embarrassed to list what you get because some of it I don't even recognize!). And you get a LOT of it. And it's way cheap for what you get. $15 for 20 pieces of quality sashimi on the lunch menu (it's listed simply as "Sashimi"), including rice, miso soup and tofu is jaw dropping. At dinner, the $26 Sushi Deluxe meal is mindboggling. I mean, it comes with a million things including uni. I'm baffled by the variety and consistent freshness of their fish and can't help imagining that they've struck deals with mob fishmongers or something. But whatever, don't question, just trust.Whenever I have friends who move to another city, say New York, where you can get decent sushi but will pay through the nose for it and end up with just a tiny thing on plate, they always lament the lack of a Sushi Gen. And then I feel an embarassment of riches.Service is nothing special. They're fine, but have such a long line of waiting customers that they just want to keep it moving and it's not really about having a magnificent experience. Doesn't matter, just keep the fish coming. P.s. it's pronounced Gen with a hard 'g,' not "jen" as I had been mispronouncing.

Reviews.Author: Patrick T.
Reviews.Content: do not come here for dinner. you will overpay and undereat.had the sashimi dinner which was just deplorable. dilapidated. disappointing, who puts leftovers on a $35 plate?? if you come for lunch you get 3 options for sashimi, and the prices are better and they do not give you little slivers of fish. literally, like little pieces of beef for fajitas, and smaller! the sushi dinner plate was also unsatisfactory. im very sad. still. so you your sadness for something elsethank youwont come back for dinner, maybe lunch.

Reviews.Author: Xin S.
Reviews.Content: We have been here many times...but this was our first time at the sushi bar.  HUGE difference.  I strongly recommend it.  Fish is as fresh as you can get.  we got our usual...yellow tail belly (OMG), uni (OMG!!!), scallop with yuzu(perfection), salmon (fresh).  Gotta get the monk fish liver hand roll.  I normally dont love the monk fish liver.  But the fishy-ness is gone i dont know what they put in it but its sweet and creamy.  Come here and sit at the sushi bar!

Reviews.Author: Michele W.
Reviews.Content: eye heart sushi gen... everything is *nom*-worthy.this is what you should eat:2 orders of toro sashimi2 orders of uni (sweet slimy goodness...)1 order of monkfish liver1 order hamachi collar1 order amaebi (+ miso soup)trust. just do it...

Reviews.Author: Steven P.
Reviews.Content: TORO!  I thought I was so special when I got big cuts of toro in my lunch sashimi platter.  I proudly showed a photo of my platter to my Facebook friends and it didn't take long for them to bring me down because apparently, Sushi-Gen does this all the time.  Whether that's true or not, I won't know until my next visit there but this place is definitely for the serious sushi lovers.  Just be prepared for a long-ass wait to get seated!

Reviews.Author: Soojin S.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi lunch special for $15. I don't even like sashimi (I prefer sushi, the rice makes it that much better for some reason), but my mouth is watering just thinking about the yellowtail melting in my mouth!!! My only complaint would be that the wait was long (over an hour for a table for 4) but it was definitely worth it. I just walked on over to the bakery, as my yelper friend Suji C. recommended in her review, and bought some macarons, which I ate as an appetizer for my lunch. The lunch special came with rice, miso soup, and a small salad. I also ordered a sunomono, which is a marinated cucumber dish and that was superb as well. But how could that go wrong. All in all, it was a fantastic lunch that started an awesome day in LA with friends (:

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: BEST sushi/sashimi place I have ever been to in the east and west coast. Great prices and quality of fish. Pretty curious as to where they get their source from. It seems like it is a family-run restaurant, because I always see the same host and you can tell he is more than just a host. Lunch sashimi special is amazing... $15 for a VERY generous portion of fish, including toro. On top of that, they give you miso soup, pickled cabbage, and tofu as appetizers. I've came here for dinner as well, but prices are a bit higher and no sides. I've also tried the grilled mirugai (clams that seemed to be baked in foil).. very tasty.. everything I've had there is delicious. You can't go wrong!!! There will be a wait, but well worth it!!!!

Reviews.Author: Joyful S.
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with their sushi.  I had the chirashi lunch special and the portion was great and very fresh!  This is my new favorite sushi restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Avik A.
Reviews.Content: If your into quality sushi this is a place you have to try. One of the top quality sushi places Ive ever been to.

Reviews.Author: Amber H.
Reviews.Content: i dont know what else i can say about this place other than just thumbs up A+++!!lots of people on saturday night, of course. this place was recommended to me by several coworkers and i finally tried it w/ my bf. the wait was out the door. for just 2 people we had to wait 30 mins, and it was only 6pm!we sat at the bar, and for some reason they told us there were no menus for sitting at the bar. and then we were confused bc the next couple sat right next to us got to order from the menu..? but regardless, the chef we had was awesome. he realized that it was our first time there at the restaurant, so he suggest to make us whatever he feels. and he did a great job! everything was so fresh and so good!! simple as that! the restaurant was packed, and the chefs also had to make other people's food, but he was still very focused on us sitting at the bar. we must've had about 15-20 orders of sashimi altogether in a span of 1:30 hrs. and when the bill came, it totaled up to about $150. as i was about to sign, the chef called over the server to fix the bill. apparently he noticed that there was a mistake, and the bill was too high. which we wouldn't have noticed because we didnt count the orders we had. we were very pleased with the food and service. definitely will go back again for the best sashimi in town!

Reviews.Author: Andrew J.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-gen is the best sushi in Los Angeles. Whether sitting at the sushi bar or eating at the tables, I enjoy every visit to this Little Tokyo landmark from the pre-packaged hand-towels to the last bite of fresh fish and crunchy tempura. My friends tend to object to the prices and have on occasion texted me--from brand new iPhones of course-- to decline a visit and tell me about how far in the red a dinner at Sushi-gen will put them. But never fear, ordering the sashimi dinner is a good investment considering the quantity and quality. Never had a bad experience, tried most of everything there is to try. An easy five stars.

Reviews.Author: Paula L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best sushi I have every eaten.  The quality of the fishes were unbelievable.  In fact...every piece of sushi / sashimi was melt in your mouth, good.  The softest and freshest fish, ever.  This place is pretty packed, but well worth it, if you are looking for quality sushi.

Reviews.Author: Aaron F.
Reviews.Content: Fresh sushi for a reasonable price, but still not the best sushi resturant in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Peter H.
Reviews.Content: The Freshest Sashimi and Sushi I EVER ate. Great texture, fresh, and it melts in your mouth but it was very pricey. We ordered, yellow tail belly, toro, ebi, tuna, salmon, albacore, eel and giant clams. Good stuff, worth every dollars we spend there.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: Maybe "fresh" is a subjective term used here.  But my notion of the word is seafood that emanates the deep ocean.  Clean, blissful, roll your eyes back into your head type bites -- only attained by fish caught recently and post-rigamortis for ideal flavor.  Here, not so much.  The price was decent but I've had the same quality from all-you-can-eat sushi joints in college towns.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: This place makes you thank God for fish. You really can't find anything better for sushi. Other places may claim to have the best sushi, but this place is consistently the best sushi, the others can't say that.  TY Sushi-Gen.

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid sushi eater, but I'm pretty blue collar when it comes to sushi. I know what I like and don't usually order omakase unless the place is amazing (like straight up "Jiro Dreams of Sushi"). I pretty much stick with the basics - salmon, albacore, yellowtail, tuna, shrimp, eel.On those:The best fatty tuna I've ever had. Two pieces is perfect.Amazing yellowtail (also the best I've ever had) and albacore.  Fresh and texture like butter.Great tuna. Great shrimp. Very good salmon (although salmon is pretty good almost anywhere and I've had better).Eel was okay.A note for people who like spicy tuna (as I do): Pass. Most really good sushi places don't have good spicy tuna and this place is no exception.

Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: I research sushi restaurants whenever I am in another town (which is often) so I have had a lot of fresh fish.  I am very picky and I told the sushi chef that I am a difficult one to please and to bring on the omakase.  Most of the fish matches some of the freshest I have had.  Wasabi is not real, but you can ask for the real stuff (it should just come with omakase).  Left very impressed and much poorer ($135 for two with tax/tip).

Reviews.Author: Cristina M.
Reviews.Content: this place deserves me making a yelp account and actually contributing to my fellow yelpers. went to Sushi-Gen for the first time with my boyfriend, who is a foodie connoisseur. We were seated right away at the sushi bar - you can not order from the dinner menu when you sit at the bar - sushi chef only. This is better because as soon as he places the meat on the rice, he leans over the glass freezer case, and places the sushi on your plate. we ordered a few sushi items on our own, but eventually let our chef give us his favorites.... Fatty tuna is probably the best we've both had. Spanish and Japanese Mackerel were both great, i like the Spanish better. The Snapper was delicious! Halibut, Albacore, Fresh Water Eel (is served warm, not too sweet, perfectly tenderized) and a few other sushi items. we also got the Spicy tuna roll, which is also very good. The Avocado Eel roll was delicious as well. Overall a very nice experience. Sushi chef was friendly and funny!! A MUST GO!!!

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: I do LOVE the sushi here and I'm a guy who's worked around Japanese culture (including 8 months in Tokyo) so I'm decently experienced in that field.  The long lines, ambivalent wait staff, over-priced saki, and poor beer selection brings it down a bit. But somehow, this is tolerable because the fish is exceptional.  Despite this, I'll keep coming back for sure.

Reviews.Author: strawberry s.
Reviews.Content: This rating is purely based on the lunch sashimi to go box... it's about $16 and packed with very very fresh fish.  They also give you a side of rice.  Amazing price and freshness.  Just call it in and it's ready in about 20 minutes.  I think they start taking phone orders at 1130am.  Side note, they do not offer this on their menu during the summer (sashimi to go) due to the weather (heat).  Another side note, rolls are not available to go... only sashimi and teriyaki.Waiting to finally get the time to eat there.  It's one of my friend's favorite sushi places.  Have been told that they are know for their fish, so rolls are  not as recommended.

Reviews.Author: Andrew U.
Reviews.Content: what do you get when you combine $15 and a large plate of the most delicious sashimi you've ever had in your life???  SUSHI-GEN. for me, hands down, this is the best sushi in the history of all sushi in the entire universe.  if there ever was a sushi heaven, then sushi-gen would be it!  go there right now.  the line is long but it is worth every minute of your life.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C.
Reviews.Content: I really don't need to be writing another review about how this is some real amazing sushi. But I will say that, as of now, I can barely remember any place that has better sushi! ( I have been to Hokkaido and stuff too, unfortunately probably not to all the right places). So, I'll proceed with my list of favorites and possibly some tips?Upon reading lots of reviews here, it seems like most people take advantage of the sashimi deluxe and eat at tables and stuff. People, you don't get to appreciate the true awesomeness of Sushi-Gen by sitting at the tables! I mean, the deluxe is great for price + quality and all, but people can't expect to be blown away by that. I truly believe that the best way to have the Sushi-Gen experience is by sitting at the bar!Now, my favorite chef of all is Chef Masa, but that could be because he seems to know exactly what type of sushi I'm into, and he's much more adventurous with me. Another good option is Kazu, who also seems to be a veteran. The sushi bar is no doubt much pricer (possibly double the price of the sashimi deluxe and stuff), however the quality of the food is just completely better. Boyfriend and I used to sit at the tables, until one day we braved the bar. Needless to say, there was no going back. Shelling out that extra 80 dollar difference to sit at the bar was worth it for us.Personally, their staples of awesomeness are definitely the Toro and Uni. But, because I tend to like things that other people don't order as often, I'm going to have to vouch for their lemon-salted halibut fin (seared) and the Ankimo with ponzu. Also, try coming during the  opening hours, or at least before 7pm. Unless you want to wait 30-45 minutes, don't come between the hours of 7-8:30pm. No kidding. After 8:30 pm works too, but you do run the risk of them running out (gasp!) of the best sushi (They've run out of hamachi belly and uni and toro on me once....I was sad). The chefs are real friendly-- the bar is like a family atmosphere, so don't be afraid to chat them up!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence C.
Reviews.Content: This has been a long time coming, really.  In actuality, it's a travesty I didn't review this restaurant first.  This, to me, is the penultimate experience in sushi in the greater los angeles area.  I don't mean just in little Tokyo, I mean in the entire LA county.  While I can't claim to have tried every top flight sushi restaurant (urasawa is gonna be for a special occasion in the future), I have been eating sushi for 15+ years, up and down California, and without a doubt, sushi gen is my go to spot.  When someone asks me what I feel like eating at any given time, its sushi gen.  I have brought all of my friends that visit me to this wonderful establishment, and they all tell me I have excellent taste in food.  I wish I could take the credit, but to not like sushi gen must mean your taste buds must be allergic to excellence.You have the option of either eating at the bar (omakase style only, minimum of 4 orders per person) or at the tables.  When I come here, usually in small parties (between 2-5 people), I go for the table.  My go to meal?  The sashimi dinner with a side of tempura ($26).  I think 95% of the time I have dined at the table, I get that.   All the dinner plates start with miso soup, tsunemono, and pickled vegetables (usually a cucumber and cabbage concoction).  Lets start with the miso soup.  I feel like you can judge a good sushi restaurant by the attention to detail in the miso soup, having the correct ratio of dashi to miso paste, as well as having the tofu be unbroken.  Sushi gen hits all three of these aspects wonderfully; this is how I know this is the precursor to a wonderful meal.  The tsunemono is deliciously sweet and tart at the same time, serving to counterbalance the saltiness of the pickled vegetables and miso soup.  The salty pickled vegetables are the weakest part of the trio, but it's refreshing when eaten in conjunction with the other two items.After that comes the main course: a plate full of sashimi, a bowl of perfectly cooked hot sushi rice, and a side of shrimp and vegetable tempura.  The tempura itself is delicious; not too heavy, crispy, crunchy, and piping hot.  It's the perfect side to a cold plate of heavenly sashimi.  The usual suspects in an order of the sashimi dinner?  3 slices of tuna (sometimes fattier, sometimes leaner), 3 slices of hamachi, their house special spicy tuna (I guarantee you its like no other spicy tuna you've ever had), chunks of yellowtail, chunks of regular tuna, tamago, either tako or ikura (octopus or squid), some sweet preserved fish (this is indistinguishable to me), and a cooked piece of salmon (kind of the odd man out), all served with a generous helping of seaweed.  The specifics are up to the sushi chefs, but it usually comes out like that in some fashion.  All of the fish is of the highest quality, although I wish they served salmon sashimi instead of the cooked salmon (they don't make substitutions).  A comparable plate would cost 3-4 times as much at any other establishment west of downtown (sasabune and hide sushi come to mind, but I'll be honest, those restaurants pale in comparison), and the portions are so generous it borders on the obscene.  For my money, the sashimi dinner combo is the best meal in town, and I will challenge you to a duel if you dare dispute this.I've also had the pleasure of trying their various appetizers, from the ankimo to their fried chicken, and the quality of the food is definitely there.  But honestly, if you are going to go to a sushi restaurant in the heart of Little Tokyo, you should be eating the raw goods and eschew the cooked.I've only eaten the omakase once before, but I must say, it was absolutely delightful.  While I am sure there are better authorities than I to the world of omakase, the flavour pairings and the order of the fish prepared by the chef were simply superb.  From what I recall, we started with the prototypical orders of fish, including toro, hamachi, and mackerel.  It pains me to say it, but the quality of the fish served with the omakase is just out of this world, just a cut above what is offered to the main restaurant.  Pun intended.  We proceeded with other more adventurous fare: albacore with thinly sliced green onions, mirugai with a touch of yuzu pepper for added kick, and scallops so sweet it threatens to overwhelm.  A nice touch
