is that the chef intersperses the orders in a way where some of the nigiri you eat with soy sauce, and some you don't; he will tell you beforehand what the proper way of eating the order is.  The amaebi is also exceptionally sweet, with the fried head serving as a textural counterpoint to the sweet shrimp.  The only downside to the omakase?  It can easily run you 50+ per person before sake, which ups the joint a dollar sign.  It's a bit more decadent than the table meal, but either way, you can't go wrong with Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: beauty m.
Reviews.Content: Since sushi is one of my passions, I like to start my life as a critique by adding to already numerous FANTASTIC reviews for Sushi Gen.  Yes, there's long wait; yes, there's no parking; yes, they don't take lunch reservation; yes, it's hard to stand around or sit outside while you wait for the table.  However, as a loyal customer for the past 6 years, I have to say that the consistency and freshness of quality of food is unbeatable.  I like the basics.  Sushi combo or Sashimi combo.  For a faster service, you can call-in to ask to put your name down on the waiting list.

Reviews.Author: Ruth C.
Reviews.Content: This place is always bustling, but the service is attentive nonetheless. Find parking in the lot isn't too bad if you plan well in advance. The sashimi plate was quite satisfying-- I highly recommend the tuna here. Acceptable prices overall, and the furnishings were comfortable even if the decor was a bit cheesy. No real complaints from me, though I hear they changed up their hours after the business boom. That's a pity, since their lunch special certainly hit the spot. I definitely ended up eyeballing my friends' bento boxes.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla C.
Reviews.Content: this place is one of the best sushi places I've gone to.  Fresh and delicious, but pricey... so I only go when my boy pal takes me :D

Reviews.Author: Andrew Y.
Reviews.Content: Close to 600 reviews and 4.5 stars? I held Sushi-Gen to very high expectations given the stellar yelp reviews. I'm glad to report it lived up to the hype. Came here for dinner on a week night, and as others have said,  expect to wait for a table as the restaurant is by no standards large. We took the sushi bar, which I actually prefer anyhow. To make a long story short, it was some of the most fresh sushi I have ever had in my life. All of the following were excellent: hamachi, spanish mackerel, maguro, toro, uni. Sweet shrimp was very good as well - you can choose to have the head fried or served with miso. I went with the latter and it was delicious. We also ordered monk fish liver, which was so rich and creamy. Overall I had a great dining experience here. Yes, crowded as heck, but some of the best sushi I've ever had. 5 star!

Reviews.Author: Patrick L.
Reviews.Content: the rumors are true.  $15 sashimi lunch with TONS of fish in la...that is actually FRESH and pretty AMAZING.  tuna, tuna, tuna.  fatty tuna!  spicy tuna! tuna w onions!  too bad no salmon (well sashimi.  they had a cooked piece of salmon which i dont know why they had on a sashimi platter).  excellent bed of seaweed salad too.  they even provide a miso soup, tofu, and pickled cabbage appetizer. (side note: the white fish appetizer we ordered was so so.)for the price+the amt of food, this is unbeatable at lunch.

Reviews.Author: Joyce H.
Reviews.Content: $15 for a huge sashimi lunch, comes with stewed tofu appetizer, pickled cucumbers, and miso soup. I couldn't believe the low price for the huge assortment of fresh sushi! Wait was around 30-40 minutes; park in the lot the restaurant is in for $2.50 with validation.

Reviews.Author: Lucia C.
Reviews.Content: So you are at the MOCA, trying to decide just WHAT the artist was trying to say with that smear of paint, when you realize that you are starving, and naturally, craving sushi. Being near Little Tokyo, you'll have a very hard decision to make with all the great choices in sushi restaurants (or noodles!).  But you have definitely chosen correctly if you end up at Sushi-Gen. From the line out the door at 1:30pm, we knew we were in the right place. This is clearly an LA favorite. We were told the wait would be 15 minutes, but after 5, the funny host asked if we would mind sharing a table - of course not! We were just happy to start our midday meal! In any case, our new table friends were very friendly. Our server was also very helpful and friendly, and the food came out rather quickly considering how busy they were.The lunch menu is very simple and in my opinion does not do justice to the variety of fish and dishes available. Getting past my initial confusion, I ordered the salmon collar lunch special which comes with a nice portion of sashimi, miso soup, rice, and a small amuse bouche for the table. My friend ordered the veggie roll, and we also had a tempura appetizer. Wow! I loved everything. The tempura was crispy soft and delicious! We had shrimp, zucchini, eggplant and potato, all perfectly done. The miso soup was just right, and just what I needed. I found the sashimi very fresh and melt-in-my-mouth delicious - their fish is perfectly cut into thick slices and feels nice and cool on the tongue. The salmon collar was amazing - a huge serving, perfectly flaky and moist. It was served with squid, crab, and sweetly fried anchovies - the mix of which was excellent with the bowl of rice. I wish I lived in LA and could get this lunch special everyday! I thought the prices were high, especially for the veggie roll and the tempura, but the lunch specials are priced well for what you get. If I am every in LA again, craving sushi, I will know where to go. I envision myself in the future, sitting at the sushi bar and ordering way too much - and loving every bite!

Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi is fresh....

Reviews.Author: Alex P.
Reviews.Content: A very good place to pick up some good ol' authentic Japanese place. If you are looking for your typical sushi roll, this is not the place for you.  The sashimi is so fresh and you'll have to ask someone how to order the great appitizers and sides. Don't expect to leave here full though.

Reviews.Author: Kaz K.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best sushi restaurants in LA.The fish is seriously fresh! You have to try it here - it is hard to find great fresh sushi in LA. The fish literally melts in your mouth, like it's supposed to... get the combo. If you're here, I think you  might as well splurge a little and get a good combo set and enjoy the fish. And a beer. Mmmm....There will always be a wait, oh well. But it's worth it! Parking is validated in the lot, might be a little hard to find. Maybe you could park across the street in the Office Depot lot and try to not get caught.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: This place is good.  If I lived closer it would definitely be a place I would frequent.  Upon the recommendation of fellow Yelpers, I got the sashimi plate.  It is a huge portion with generous cuts of fish at a very reasonable price.  The sushi combination is not as impressive and I would recommend ordering your sushi a la carte instead of getting the combo.  The staff here is very friendly, nice, and courteous.  The only part of my experience I did not enjoy so much is the amount of green onions they blended with their cuts of toro and tuna on the sashimi plate.  My friend is a sushi chef and she told me to be wary of restaurants who pair their sashimi/sushi with lemon or the like because it is their way of masking the scent/flavor of older cuts of fish.

Reviews.Author: Jim B.
Reviews.Content: Hi all!  I want to share my omakase experience with ya (and to make you jealous of the dinner I had last night).   We received two pieces of sushi for each order.  We ended up paying about $100 per head.  Here is a list of what we got and the order it was presented:1.  otoro (super fatty toro - almost too fatty, no effort needed to eat because it just melts in my mouth)2.  kampachi (one of my favorites - just enough chewy texture)3.  tai with yuzu and light soy sauce ponzu (loved the yuzu and ponzu combination, came with partial skin)4.  aji with grated ginger, onions and ponzu (tasted more like snapper than mackerel - ginger and ponzu works)5.  mirugai (one of my all time favorites, but just ok here - probably the least fresh of everything I had that night)6.  anago (usually would never order cooked stuff, but part of omakase, not smelly or fishy, sauce was not overly sweet)7.  uni (very fresh and clean, not muddy and salty)8.  ama ebi (very good, funny how entire row had it at same time)9.  ama ebi head in miso soup (soup was not salty, good use of white miso, shrimp head added a deeper flavor not found in regular miso)10. engawa for me (engawa better as sashimi, but still very good)11. negi-otoro maki (otoro maki was so good - I could eat 50 of them)12.  hamachi belly for me (so buttery, the color was very pure)Worth every dollar, including the $2.50 parking fee for the lot.

Reviews.Author: Alan L.
Reviews.Content: Dood, Sushi Gen has some bomb bay sushi! I would say better then Yoshida. Reading the reviews of this restaurant just makes me feel just a little bit more special. Why you may ask? Cause I didn't have to wait. Muhuhaha... Evil, I know... but it was great. My experence of this place was amazing. If your wondering how? I got people. Yes people... lol Who are my people? My "big boss" (he hates it when I call him that) lol We desided to come here before our Club Event. I've read the reviews before and was scared that we might have to wait long. When we got there and I asked the host how long was the wait? 30mins... I was sad unitl the manager came by. My boss went to high school with him. Which I didn't know and he didn't know he worked there. 10mins later we had our seats at the bar. Now that is service. I felt bad for the two old couples that were in front of us. =T sorry... I don't think they wanted to say something because they most likely thought we were gangsters. We just came from a funeral and we were in all black suits. We're big guys too... lol but I really felt bad. (Trust I'm not part of the Tri-ad or yacuza how ever you spell it. I'm a nice gentle person. ^_^V see...) The sushi made me feel so much better though. I'm cold when it comes to my tummys happiness though. lol I recommend just eatting the sushi, FORGET THE ROLLS! If your going for the gold, stick with the sushi, trust! The sushi Chefs are GREAT! My first time and forsure not my last.

Reviews.Author: Mia S.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fish, imported japanese sushi chefs, and a long line before the place opens.... this place is probably worth every penny if you are into sashimi. You definitely want to sit at the sushi bar if you are there strictly for the sashimi. I still can't get over the fact that there was a line before the restaurant opened, that just tells you how great it is that people are willing to stand out in the cold to grab a seat by the sushi bar. What more do I need to say!

Reviews.Author: M W.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi combo is a deal! Fresh toro, tuna, poke, etc... for $!5. Comes with rice, miso, tofu, and small salad. Don't expect the best service. You will feel kinda rushed. Wait was about 45 min. Parking lot usually full, but there's street parking. Would definitely come back for more.. when the whole radiation scare is over.

Reviews.Author: Lina S.
Reviews.Content: If I didn't get mercury poisoning I would eat here everyday.

Reviews.Author: Ryan P.
Reviews.Content: I went here for dinner and had a lovely experience.  From the moistened cloth towel at the beginning, to the prompt service, they got it right all the way through.  The restaurant has a vibrant buy cozy feel to it.  The rolls seemed wanting in size when they first came out but after a mushroom miso soup (also excellent) it was just the right amount to fill me up but not slow me down.  They are really good at what they do.

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: They have some of the best quality of fish in so-cal.  As most people seem to point out, this is for serious sushi eaters, not beach bar "magic roll" people.  The Gen is the spot; its the cheapest top of the line sushi you'll ever eat.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: omakase:snapper with lime & peppertorobroiled salmonsweet shrimpuniunagidelicious and fresh and it shows in the price (but it was my bday dinner....so my bf at the time paid the bill. score!)

Reviews.Author: Phi N.
Reviews.Content: Lets just say... the fish melts in your mouth like butter.SPOT on!

Reviews.Author: Rachan S.
Reviews.Content: love their chirashi and their sashimi combination.. their fish are so fresh and good... yes its expensive but its worth to eat it once in a while. especially if you are sashimi fan, u want to eat great fish right?! not the one that cost u only $10-$15 but it doesnt taste fresh and will give u food poisoning after eating it!! i think their sashimi combination is about $30 and chirashi is a bit less.. i cant remember exactly coz i havent been for a while.. dont come here if u want to eat rolls!! u come to the wrong place, they dont have it.. they only have sushi, sashimi, and some beef or chicken combo for those who cant eat raw fish.. they also give u free tofu appetizer and its so smooth, silky, healthy, and just the way u want it!!the only downside is the LINE!! this place is always packed when i come (maybe coz i always come on the weekend). even before the place open, people already line up to eat here.. thats how popular this place is... customer service is fast and quick. u eat and they expect u to leave as soon as u done eating.. why?! coz they have people waiting outside... not to mention that this place is quite small and cannot fit too many people.. so be prepared!!

Reviews.Author: Candice E.
Reviews.Content: They have the best sashimi lunch special. The price is considerate since you are getting only the best sashimi in town. The lunch line are long, so show up early to get a set.

Reviews.Author: Susie L.
Reviews.Content: Food is great... service is okay, except when you sit at the sushi bar... they're quite entertaining.  Parking can be difficult (small lot).

Reviews.Author: andre s.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi that achieves both quality and price.  simply great.

Reviews.Author: kento O.
Reviews.Content: If you don't already know about their $12.50 sashimi lunch, you are totally missing out. It is definitely an eye-popper. It's just so much fish!!! Only draw back is that you always have to wait (sometime up to an hour!) and the selection of fish is very tuna-heavy. If you want more variation, go for Chirashi Lunch for the same price. Or their sushi (same, 12.50) is excellent to. But the real secret is the daily specials that they write down on the Post-It notes and stick on the menu. I had Hamachi Head the other day. The whole fucking head of a yellowtale on a huge plate staring at me. Not for the faint of heart. Yummy stuff, though!

Reviews.Author: Johnnie J.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen offers the usual nigiri sushi and roll choices that are reasonably priced.  By reasonable pricing, I mean that you'll probably be spending anywhere from $10-$25 per person at lunch and $25-$50 per person during dinner hours.  Note the price differential between lunch and dinner for your own budgeting needs!One important thing to note!  If you eat at the sushi bar, you cannot order from the lunch or dinner menu.  You must order sushi and rolls.  However, if you eat at the tables or booths, you can order both sushi/ rolls and menu items.The Sushi-Gen atmosphere differs between lunch rush hour and dinner time.Their lunch hour is packed!  They open at 11:15 AM sharp.  People wait as early as 10:45 AM to get in!  It has a cafeteria atmosphere.  It's so loud where people hustle and bustle in and out.  The staff wants to get you in, serve you food and get you out!  It's not a place and time to sit, eat and relax.Dinner time is very chill.  You're not rushed to finish off your food.  They serve you tempura as appetizers with your dinner which they don't do at lunch hour!As for quality, it's "fresh" and by the quotes, it's still edible in terms of safety standards.  I wish it were fresh as in "just delivered."The owner of this restaurant worked as a sushi chef in a very high end sushi restaurant in Japan during the late 1960's.Last thing, parking is easy, convenient and inexpensive.

Reviews.Author: Jean L.
Reviews.Content: Decided to try it out since we were staying near little tokyo for the weekend. We got there around 9:00pm on Friday and waited for only 15 min. Best ankimo and chirashi deluxe!

Reviews.Author: Adam Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: Alright, first of all this is definitely NOT a moderately priced restaurant. I will say their food was extremely good and my friend and i both agree, but we only got to try a LITTLE bit. If you're on a budget you'll probably want to go somewhere else, like what we did after we ate a sample of their food. The restaurant is authentic itself and owned by Japanese. I think when I have more money I'll come back, but as for my experience now it was not as pleasant as I would have wanted. The waitresses were also a tad pushy, trying to get us to order right away so they could seat other people I suppose. It's hard though with a friend who CAN'T decide haha.

Reviews.Author: Suzn L.
Reviews.Content: To me it's overrate...Small portions, Pricy, Sushi a bit mushy.  I much prefer Oomasa or Komasa.  Just ok to me.

Reviews.Author: stephanie l.
Reviews.Content: Went here about 3 months ago to visit my former professor.  Ate at this place and all i can say is that if you are a sushi lover....This place is the REAL DEAL...Japanese food is always going to be priced a bit high but it's probably the insurance that they have to purchase....  This place has fresh as you can get sushi.  Presentation is clean and visually pleasing.

Reviews.Author: Masako K.
Reviews.Content: SO FRESH & expertly served!!!! They have the best fish, always!  Toyo, owner & main sushi chef, makes his daily run to the fish market early in the morning to hand-pick the best.  Once you try their authentic sushi and sashimi (no frills), you can't go elsewhere.  The consistency of the rice is perfect and always the right amount, which is a mark of an excellent sushi chef.  I've had sushi at Tsukiji (famous fish market in Tokyo) and I can say that Sushi Gen delivers!!

Reviews.Author: Rodrigo C.
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is by far the best sushi/sashimi restaurants that I have ever tried. Enough said!!! So now the review: Food is amazing, you cant go wrong in this place. Every plate is full of flavor. It is pricy compared to other japanese restaurants around (but worth every penny!!). It can get crowded and sometimes you have to wait 30-60 mins for a table (but worth every second!!). Staff is super friendly and cordial. They have private parking or you can park on the street (if you are lucky to find a spot). This place is great and if you like japanese cuisine, you should definitely try this place...promise you are not going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: kathy t.
Reviews.Content: Lunch at the sushi bar was just ok. The fish is very fresh however, service sucked and for the prices charged,  they really skimp on the ingredients placed in their rolls. We also had a trainee who was very nice but the preparation was not good, tataki dish had chunks of fish cut too big and was way oversauced and the ankimo was overcooked! Yuck! Service:At $80 I do not want to have indigestion from placing 5 people next to you in a space for 4 and a waitress who practically throws the hand wipes at you, seems irritated that you are there and you can't even get a water refill. This is a place to get a cheap and fresh meal as long as you stick to the prefab specials. For the sushi bar pricing, I will go somewhere more service oriented.Dinner at the sushi bar is a similar experience. You still feel rushed as if they make their money on turnover. But at those prices I want to savor the food.

Reviews.Author: S. K.
Reviews.Content: I'm not here to extoll the quality of the fish because there are plenty of people who've already done a good job of that.  What I did want to share was the experience I had at my most recent visit last week.A drop of soy sauce had fallen on my blouse and our waitress had noticed from a distance that I was trying to clean it up.  She brought over a tiny packet/towelette of Shout.  5-stars to the establishment for keeping a supply of it and 5-stars to the waitress for keeping a close eye on her customers and tending to their needs, unbidden.

Reviews.Author: E J J.
Reviews.Content: The Sashimi at Sushi-Gen is incredible!! It is the best value of any sushi/sashimi restaurant I have ever been to in Los Angeles - in the US for that matter.  The sashimi is so fresh and the appetizers compliment the meal perfectly. It is best for lunch, but dinner is good too.  The only downside is that there is a long line and if you choose to sit at the sushi bar, rather than a table, be prepared to pay.  The table menus are a good deal, but  the sushi bar is pricey - you can't order from the table menu.  This place is GREAT though.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars...BUT!!!!A big but!!  You see, eating at Gen is all about which chef you sit in front of.  I totally understand how people can be underwhelmed here.  There are probably 6-7 sushi chefs working at dinner time, and most of them will give you an above average sushi experience.  I've tried most of them and my experience has ranged from "wtf...this is supposed to be top notch sushi???" to "not too bad."But there is one chef that served me sushi that was the best in the city.  The best.  Twice.  His name is Kazu-san, and he is stationed at the far end of the bar, furthest from the entrance.  You can tell he's special cuz he's the only one that's always got a bunch of japanese people sitting around him.  He is the real deal.  If you hand yourself over to him and let him serve you what he deems best, you will be blown away.  With him, you will get the best sushi in L.A. (that's near blasphemy to me since I've always felt that Kazu sushi in studio city was the best...but I'm tellin you...).If you don't think Gen is all that (and I don't blame you...the other chefs are meh), go there again.  Tell the hostess "I want Kazu-san.  Yes, I'll wait."  Then, sit and tell Kazu-san "omakase."  And I dare you to tell me that its not the best sushi you've had.

Reviews.Author: RICK H.
Reviews.Content: I read positive review posted here prior to going there.  I was disappointed.  I used to work at a very busy sushi restaurant in the Valley.  I know what makes a restaurant stand out of the crowd.  Service is nothing special.  The who greeted us in the front said we could not be seated because the rest of the party had not arrived. we had a reservation and got there in time.  There are plenty of tables open.  So that was kinda rude right off the bat.Sushi was just okay.  Nothing special to note.  I thought their sushi is  overpriced.  Nonetheless we had a good time until a guy from the restaurant came to our table  and kicked us out.  He said there were many customers waiting. I understand  it is a bit frustrating for the customers to leave so other customers can have a table but you just don't kick out your customers.  That is just not a right thing to do to your customers.  Will never go back there again.

Reviews.Author: Tea N.
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my saying I've been going to this place since it opened.  Always liked it and even referred all of my friends, and had many dates at this place as a first date (girls, we know how important the first date pick is and I actually did like this place for a first date)  But today, I was not only disappointed but offended.We ordered the things we normally do, sashimi, mozuku, some sake.  The Ebi taste like crap but ok, we ate it hoping it wouldn't be so bad.  The yellowtail belly, giant clam and salmon sashimi came.  It was cut like crap and tasted like ass, so of course, we told our waitress we can't eat this.  She looked at it like, yeah, I see what you mean.  So she took it back to the kitchen.  Then we see her talking to the front guy person who I assume is the manager.  Minutes later, we were going to order the yellowtail collar.  She walks away to put in the order but then comes back and says if you order it, you can't send it back.  I'm like wtf?  Apparently, my guest had been there before and had sent it back for being too burnt to eat.  The manager remembered I supposed and told the waitress to tell us we can't send anything back anymore.  So we fingered for the manger to come over.  He was like, and i'm quoting, "I'm sorry, we are not accepting anymore complaints".  My guest was like "What?, not accepting complaints?, we've been here for so many years, always liked it, but if something is bad, you can't force us to eat it?  Especially at the price we are paying."  He said, "you are the only ones who ever complain."  That's when I jumped in and said, "I know that's not true.  A restaurant should know how to handle complaints better."  He was like "then maybe you shouldn't come here anymore".  WTF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!As customers, in this economy, restaurants should know better than to piss off paying customers.  And for the prices this god forsaken place charges, we should always have the right to send things back if the food is bad.  I understand there are the types that complain about everything, but we've been here since it opened and have been loyal customers, we expect a standard for what we pay for and shouldn't be forced to eat that is terrible, let alone pay for it.  To quote Alan J. from a couple days earlier, today's Sushi Gen is over-rated, and yes, today, the fish totally tasted like it was frozen and defrosted....don't even go for lunch.  If you go, you will need to accept that you can't send anything back, if its burnt, taste like ass or is terrible, better be willing to eat it/pay for it.If you've been offended or told the same thing by any restaurants, specifically Sushi Gen, you need to voice you're opinion.  There are many other restaurants in the area who know their manners and how to treat their customers, and more deserving of our business.  Sushi gen does not and I will be damned if I, or any of my friends should ever come here again.I recommend Komasa or Hama Sushi.  They have equal quality food and at better prices.  Its a little bit more dive-y than sushi gen but at least they know their manners.  That's a big win for me!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie T.
Reviews.Content: I love their lunch special..such a great price ( $15) for the amount of food and the fish is fresh as well. I just wish they have the special on weekends..

Reviews.Author: Rachel H.
Reviews.Content: This place has awesome Jap sashimi and great price for the UNI sashimi lunch!!! The only thing that I won't rate it 5 stars its because the gentleman from the check in was kind of not friendly... Otherwise, everything was good and the food was very tasty!

Reviews.Author: Frederic C.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in LA by far!

Reviews.Author: Alice T.
Reviews.Content: All the reviews don't lie- yes, it's a long wait and yes, you have to pay parking, but one taste of fresh fish and mm...  now I know what I've been missing. Honestly, I don't LOVE sashimi and I definitely don't understand much- and I was expecting rolls but here.. it's a whole new level of sushi. Don't wimp out and get teriyaki here. Just get the fish- chirashi bowls and a big plate of sashimi all run for about $15 each. Comes with soup and pickled cabbage. Doesn't get any better than that.

Reviews.Author: Julie S.
Reviews.Content: I took my bf here for his birthday and we ordered omakase.  They don't take reservations for the sushi bar, but we didn't have to wait.  The sushi was....... mindboggling.  My favorites were the halibut fin & the monkfish liver.  My only regret is the fact that I'd been living in LA for all my life, and this was the first time I tried Gen. It's just not right...

Reviews.Author: Terence N.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen is one of the better sushi bars in LA.  The prices arent over-priced, and the fish is always fresh.  Ordering from the sushi menu gets pretty pricey, I think you can easily spend $40-50 at the bar.  But, if you order from the regular menu, the prices are reasonable.  ive been here multiple times and the fish is always of the highest quality!     The tempura here is excellent, its nice and crispy, and they give moderate portions.  I think this place serves better tempura than most japanese places i've eaten at.  I really like the sashimi dinner, its comes with a huge plate of sashimi, tempura, rice, soup, and all the fix-ins.  The price is about $26, and it will definitely fill you up!  If your more adventurours, id suggest the sashimi deluxe.  The price is a tad high at $35, and it doesnt come with rice, soup, or anything...but they give you an excellent assortment of fish!  Pretty much everything you desire except the Uni and sweet shrimp.  They include, chu-toro, yellowtail, squid, spicy tuna, toro tartare, snapper, salmon belly, octopus..etc..It was by far the best assortment of fish I have had, and they give generous portions of fish.  I definitely love the variety in their sashimi, almost ever table orders it!       The one thing I really dont care in the sashimi dinner is the piece of cooked salmon they include..I really dont get why you would put a piece of cooked fish on a raw-fish platter?  The grilled salmon always seems a little overcooked and dry, I think they should include raw salmon instead of the cooked version.   BTW you dont get salmon sashimi in the regular sashimi dinner, only the deluxe.  The salmon is very fresh and tasty!  THey definitely serve high quality salmon, maybe thats why its not included in the regular sashimi dinner.   I also did not like the sushi dinner, the variety is limited and I personally feel like the sashimi is a better bargain!   you only get about 8 pieces of sushi, along with a small tuna roll, and its about $21..for the same price you can get the sashimi dinner and it will satisfy your craving more!     Overall the prices here are reasonable, ordering off the menu averages $30 per person, ordering off the sushi menu can get expensive, but it is well worth it!  The fish here is always fresh and delicious!  The wait here is always long, so I suggest coming here before 6pm!  It really starts to get packed around 6pm, so come here early!  The parking situation is always horrible, you either find street parking (which you have to pay for) or you have to pay lot parking ( $2.50).  They use to offer free parking inside the lot with validation, but i guess times are rough, and they are trying to take advantage of everything!    The street parking is even more expensive than parking inside, they charge $2.00/hr, so i'd suggest trying to find parking inside the lot, but during busy hours this can be hard.

Reviews.Author: Josh d.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best sushi I've had (excluding Masa - I don't consider Masa a "sushi joint" though...) the rice is perfect, the fish is fresher than any other I've had.

Reviews.Author: Dave Y.
Reviews.Content: With this many reviews of this place, I'll just chime in and say that Sushi-Gen is one of the very very best places in the LA area for sushi, which is saying a lot given our Asian communities around here. The sashimi I had here is quite possibly the best I've ever had. It's also quite expensive, but you get what you paid for. They do have pretty good lunches which are less expensive than dinners. A very classy place for very good treats without fail.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best yellowtail, salmon and uni sashimi i've ever had.

Reviews.Author: H M.
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation earlier in the week for a special occasion dinner, but when we arrived it still took 30 minutes to be sat. Not sure if that's always how they do reservations, but it seemed walk ups waited just as long. The host was also not the friendliest. Bummed because it was for a special occasion & the reviews for this place seemed to be great. However, our server was very friendly and polite and the fish was pretty amazing.

Reviews.Author: Susan C.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to try sushi-gen after hearing my boss rave about it 100 times.  I agree, it's good.  It's the best, most packed chirashi I've ever had.  And it wasn't all that expensive.  I can honestly taste the freshness.  I think.

Reviews.Author: susan l.
Reviews.Content: ate dinner here. the wait for 3 people took about 45ming.what i ate:- deluxe sushi combo: deliciously cut sushi with a lil bit of everything. if youre curious about what comes out, check out the ten thousand pictures available. the combo comes out with salad with salmon skin (yummy fishiness) and i forget what its called, but i know in korean its mountain yam. if youve never had mountain yam before dont be shocked. its a slimy SLIMY texture. the flavor was there, but im not a huge fan of the slime factor. .... this is enough for one really really really hungry person (like me, oink oink) but this and another small order should be enough to share. OR you could share the sashimi plate like my other friends didpros:- fish. this is old school japanese sushi. if youre used to the fushion style of sushi (think kabuki/niko niko), this place is not for you! this is pure clean slices of sushi without the bells and whistles of sauce. cons:- wait. like i said, i came on a saturday night and they said that a table for 3 would take about an hours wait. we scored and were able to be seated in about 45 mins- eat and run: this isnt really a place that lets you linger over your meal. i mean, no one asked us to leave after we finished, but shortly after we ate, our check came without asking for it. to me, thats the restaurant telling us to get the heck out so they can seat more people. - service: busy much? i guess, typical of most traditional asian restaurants. we had to flag her down if we wanted anything after putting in our order- parking: located in a small lot, parking cost $3. its a small lot, you may have to wait for a spot. but theres enough turn around that its not too bad getting a spot if you wait around long enoughalso a note for those thinking that this place is expensive.... its NOT. does it cost a lot? yes, of course! but dont be eating sushi expecting champagne quality sushi on a beer budget. if budget is a problem stick to kabuki/niko niko. considering the quality and skill of the sushi chef, the prices are right on point!so why only 3 stars? ... to be honest, while the sushi was great, as my friend said, there wasnt anything amazing about it. the wait, and the lackluster service werent enough to have me trek back out to lil tokyo again. BUT i can see why people gush about the $15 lunch special - THAT is worth itso would i come again? probably not.

Reviews.Author: Jojo H.
Reviews.Content: This place always has a line.  I made a reservation for dinner and I still had to wait over half an hour.  The line for lunch is even worse because of their ridiculously cheap sashimi lunch special.  It's probably the main reason this place has such a high rating.  They also have quality sushi.

Reviews.Author: Melody W.
Reviews.Content: Best bang for your buck! I went here with a friend on a Monday for lunch and the wait wasn't that bad. The sashimi lunch combo was SOOO friggin good and was only $15! I've never seen toro served as part of a sashimi platter anywhere. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: rich k.
Reviews.Content: worth the wait if no reservation.  fresh and authentic.  try it at least once.  cheers

Reviews.Author: Donny N.
Reviews.Content: The sushi/fish itself was one of the best I've had, very delicately sliced and fresh tasting BUT .... you pay a hefty premium for this delicacy! Don't plan on feasting here unless you come with wads of cash, because you WILL leave here poorer :) But, at least you leave with a happy stomach :)

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: maybe it was the fact that i walked in with a chip on my shoulder, but sushi-gen didn't exceed my expectations AT ALL.  yes, the fish was fresh, but it really doesn't offer anything beyond that.  first of all, the host is an ass.  he acts as though he holds the ticket to the hottest seat in town.  he refused to seat two of us, even after we told him that we'd be ordering drinks and appetizers before the other two people in our party got there.  he didn't tell us that's their policy, that he's sorry, etc... he just said, "nope." "no." "i can't seat you."  UGH. second, i don't usually do rolls at a sushi restaurant, but one of my friends got the spicy tuna roll.  i thought it was really not good.  i think that they use the worst/least fresh bits of tuna to make it, and just mask it with that awful spiciness.  maybe, though, i can't blame this on the restaurant.  i really never enjoyed spicy tuna rolls. and third, no green tea tempura ice cream!!! hahaha... i guess another thing that i can't hold against the restaurant, but i was craving it so badly, and thought that they would definitely have it.  since i go the criticism out of the way, onto the positives.  yes, the fish was fresh.  one of my friends ordered the sashimi platter, which is actually a REALLY good deal.  you get a plate full of decent sashimi pieces, and a side of mixed tempura all for $21.  my friend and i opted for the sushi a la carte.  we ordered the following: uni, spanish mackeral, yellowtail belly, yellowtail, spicy tuna roll.  the uni was really very, very good.  the flavors were all there, but i don't think that it was the BEST uni i had.  in fact, i've had better at Taiko.  my favorite was the yellowtail belly, which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  my friend told me that the spanish mackeral was to DIE FOR, but i thought it wasn't that good.  i guess she got my hopes up, and although it was pretty yummy, i thought that the yellowtail belly blew it out of the water.  all in all, i guess sushi-gen is pretty good.  i get why some people would rank it as one of their favorite sushi spots in town.  i personally don't think that i'd re-visit the place (unless i was near the area), but i would recommend to others. p.s. i'm not sure if the rainy weather contributed to this, but the place was not packed AT ALL on the thursday night that we went.  we got seated immediately WITHOUT reservations.

Reviews.Author: Norrie A.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend mentioned this place to me a few times and finally took me there. It was his first time going there too. It was a week night and the place was crowded. They sat us immediately at the sushi bar as we had requested. We got "Omakase style" and we were truly satisfied with everything the sushi chef served us. We love uni and I have to really give this place 5 stars for the delicious uni that they have. All of sushi there is amazing. We left there oh so satisfied. If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. That is how good it is. From the service to the food. Yum yummy yum.

Reviews.Author: Esther S.
Reviews.Content: Sushi gen is officially my favorite sushi place. Forget the pretentious over priced sushi places, this spot has the freshest sashimi for an unbelievable price. $35 gets you the sashimi deluxe, it's got practically every variety from halibut, octopus, buttery tuna, to shrimp. The platter is huge and can fill 2 people easy. Who's ever heard of a $35 sashimi plate that can fill 2 people! It's unreal!

Reviews.Author: Tyler B.
Reviews.Content: I don't get the hype about this place.  It's pricey but the food is just OK.  Not bad, not great.  I've definitely had similar quality sushi for less than what Sushi Gen charges not to mention the ridiculous wait to eat here.  Their Deluxe Sushi or whatever it's called is basically all their leftover end pieces that they cannot serve as Nigiri so they mash it all together, put it on a pretty plate and call it "Deluxe."  And you pay $33 or something like that and you say "Mmm that was some great toro in my Deluxe Sushi Meal" because you waited 3454dfdk3 minutes to eat there and 'cus you don't want to admit to yourself what a dumbass you are to have fallen for the hype.

Reviews.Author: Jen Y.
Reviews.Content: What better place to satisfy my nigiri craving than Sushi Gen, located in Little Tokyo and serving some of the freshest fish in LA.  To experience our food the way it was meant to be enjoyed, my boyfriend and I decided to sit at the sushi bar, something I rarely do.  It was my first time actually ordering sushi at the bar.  I usually just order simple hand rolls or a spicy tuna roll.  My sushi tastes have expanded since then, thank goodness.I had been reading about sushi and talking to some friends who consider themselves as sushi snobs, and I decided to try something other than salmon and tuna.  I took the advice of fellow Yelpers as well asked our sushi chef for his recommendations.  Note that you can always order ONE sushi (two pieces) and share with someone else if you want to have room to try many different types of sushi.  We didn't realize this until halfway through our dinner.  We tried lots of things that we both have never had, making our dining experience 10x more memorable.  Every single item we got was delicious, but a few definitely blew my mind!My boyfriend and I got:*Kampachi (high-end yellowtail): the texture of this fish is more solid and has more substance to it.  The flavor is buttery, rich and smooth.  Definitely better than the regular Hamachi*Toro (fatty tuna): this was the first and last sushi we ordered at the bar.  we started off with this since the chef recommended it, and it was so good, we wanted to end our meal with it again!  It is so creamy, fatty and flavorful.  It nearly melts in your mouth*Amaebi (sweet shrimp): I've been craving sweet shrimp for a while, and my bf has never tried it before so I ordered it for us.  I got the heads deep fried, and they served them with a wedge of lemon, which added a nice touch.  My bf claimed that the shrimp heads were the best he's ever had.  The sweet shrimp itself was so fresh!  It wasn't mushy at all.  Instead, it was almost crunchy and crisp when biting into the shrimp.  I love the slight hint of sweetness.  *Ikura (salmon roe): I've never really liked this, but I gave it a try.  I ended up giving it to my bf since he really likes it.  Too fishy for me.  However, I must admit it's the least fishy of the Ikura I've had in the past.*Spanish Mackerel: I loved the way our chef prepared this sushi.  He drizzled it with ponzu, topped it with some fresh grated ginger and daikon.  I usually dislike mackerel because of it's overall fishy flavor, but this was absolutely amazing.  The fish was so fresh that it had little odor to it, and the sauce was so good with it.  Note that the sushi chef will tell you when to eat your sushi with soy sauce and when not to.  *Hamachi (yellowtail): It was very fresh here and delicious.  Since I have Hamachi often, I didn't consider this mind-blowing or a new experience.  However, it is definitely very good here*Red Snapper: Our chef put a bit of salt and finely diced Jalapeno on top of our fish.  I've never had red snapper sushi before so I didn't know what to expect.  The fish was good, but I didn't like the Jalapeno with it.  I'm usually a huge fan of Jalapeno with rolls, but not so much with nigiri.  Our total came out to be $95 pre-tax/tip.  We were pleasantly full after dinner.  I'm pretty lucky to have a bf who loves making me happy and eager to experience new things together.  =)  Thanks darling for satisfying my sushi cravings and treating me to the best sushi I've ever had!

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: What a great deal! It's authentic without being culturally overbearing, the fish is fresh and delicious, the price is just right. Don't really know what else to say. It was great :)

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: So yums! Servce was attentive, sushi was exquisite, lived up to its 800+ reviews!

Reviews.Author: Sid P.
Reviews.Content: On any given night some of the best sushi served in Los Angeles if not the US.  Toro, Uni, Albacore, Unagi - just wonderful - I've only sat at the sushi bar and have eaten sushi and sashimi so I cannot speak of the many cooked dishes only provided if seated in the dining room but this is as good as it gets here in the states.

Reviews.Author: Kathie L.
Reviews.Content: My definitely go-to place for sashimi everytime I crave it.  After you've been spoiled at Sushi Gen, you won't want to go to another place for sashimi.  The portions from the sashimi combination for lunch is very worth its price.  The side dishes are really good as well.

Reviews.Author: Rashel P.
Reviews.Content: Small place so there is always a wait but i'll tell ya, it is definitely worth the wait. I've gone time and time again. The quality of food is superb and authentic. I feel like I have just stepped into Japan.

Reviews.Author: Vince A.
Reviews.Content: FRESH SUSHI. Expensive, but incredibly high grade sushi. It gets busy during lunch time, so call ahead and make a reservation, especially for the bar. Note, there is no menu for the sushi bar, so be ready to call out your favorite sashimi.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: Quality sushi/sashimi for decent price. Gets very busy, so get there early or make reservations. Sashimi deluxe was good. Will be back... when it's less busy... but not likely that will happen because this place is awesome.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is nothing special- but the prices make you think it will call you in the morning.  Sadly, it never does.

Reviews.Author: Brent T.
Reviews.Content: Friends who live downtown have been raving about this place.  How good the fish is...What a value this place is.  I agree, it is inexpensive, but this is not good sushi.  Reading the other reviews, most people tout the toro, writing that it is like butter.  That's what it's supposed to be!  To me, it's like praising a steakhouse for having tender filet mignon.  Found the fish cuts to be sloppy, the wasabi was powdered(it's really colored horseradish), the nigiri was packed too tightly.  They didn't have the wide selection of fish consistent with a first rate place.  The unagi and anago were both preprocessed and frozen.  A mark of a great sushi place is that they prepare their own unagi from fresh eels.  It is a labor intensive task and demonstrates that the establishment cares enough to present a good product to its customers.Overall, if you enjoy spicy tuna rolls and mixing powdered wasabi into your soy sauce, you may very well like this place. If not, look to some of the Michelin starred sushi places around town.

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: Everything tasted fresh.  It's good.  Just don't give any money to anyone that might approach you in the parking lot.

Reviews.Author: craig m.
Reviews.Content: i have to agree with some of the previous reviews.  i tried a few things that should be good at such a highly rated sushi spot and they were at best average.  the "fresh" sardine was hardly fresh at all, the giant clam was average at best, and the ankimo and toro were okay...nothing to rave about.  even the hamachi, maguro and sake were just above average.  i'm not sure if it's cuz i've been spoiled by places in the bay area but this place isn't in the same league.  note: : my friends and i waited for over an hour to be seated and we the last to leave so i'm assuming we may have not gotten the freshest stuff...they had run out of sashimi by the time we were seated....i'll bring them up to 3 stars from 2 assuming if we got there earlier some of the fish we ate would have been better...but i have doubts.

Reviews.Author: yuyi x.
Reviews.Content: yesterday was my second visit there....food:sashimi dinner: fresh...but low quality fishsalmon dinner: its DRY!!!!!!!!!!service...mediocre~~~~~~

Reviews.Author: Curtis L.
Reviews.Content: Look for the Blue awning in the Honda Plaza, parking 3hrs is $2.50 w/ validation, but street parking is possible. 2 people will generally seat quickly, but partys may have to wait.Food Quality is excellent, prices are harsh but sustainable. Great taste and texture. If something tastes bland, it's meant to be dipped in something. The dinner combos are suggested since they come with Miso soup, Rice and the side of Tempura or Sushi. ~$20-$26 for most dishesAlso FYI, the sushi paper menu prices go $13, $10, $8, $7, $6, $5, $4 from top to bottom seperated by the bold boxes since those prices aren't listed. The menu is for people "in the know" so don't expect a description of anything like the sushi deluxe (equivalent to around 15 pieces/piles of fish). Or that the dinner combos come with 5 peices of Tempura or ~7 pieces of sashimi. Or you can order the Sole dinner and request that they use red snapper Fillet so that there are no bones to pick out. Some of the food can seem bland, but they flavor the sauces so that everything is delicious. The spicy tuna was pretty spicy though.Might be 5 star worthy, but it's my first review..., gotta save 'em up.

Reviews.Author: nina s.
Reviews.Content: don't come here for any fancy rolls with a-z fillings... they keep it simple here.. ULTRA SIMPLE. and the results are amazing::::the sushi melted in my mouth. enough said!

Reviews.Author: Deivido M.
Reviews.Content: Fish was delicious and fresh. Skill  to execute could be better. Overall good meal. Service was the way it should be. Best in Little Tokyo. Will drop by again when in area.

Reviews.Author: Misa C.
Reviews.Content: I love coming here for their lunch special.  Great deal, and such fresh sashimi!  We usually get the Tempura Sashimi set, but I think I'm going to try a different set next time since Tempura is not their strongest item on the menu.  I try to go here at least a couple times a month to get ma sushi fix!

Reviews.Author: Leonardo Di K.
Reviews.Content: If you like #1 stuff like me, you come to sushi gen. The quality of their sushi is one the highest in town, and their price is very fair for the quality of you get. Im more a quality over quantity type of person. Their portions are actually pretty good. The only better sushi place in LA is urasawa and be ready to spend anywhere from 300-500 dollars if you choose to dine there. The other alternative is sushi gen where you can order a plate and be satisfied for about 30 dollars. I tend to seat at the sushi bar, because the wait is shorter and i dont really order their plates anymore. Been coming here almost 5 years now. The past year i was visiting sushi gen almost every friday. Their spicy tuna is so delicious, it never gets old.

Reviews.Author: Esyah H.
Reviews.Content: Pricey, parking is a mess, BUT the food is AMAZING! Would definitely come back here. Reservation is a MUST or show up early and count your lucky stars for a seat.

Reviews.Author: Edda S.
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this place for years. 17 years, really. My family has been going to this restaurant since the Sashimi Dinner (this is our dish of choice) was $12 or 13, since the tomago on the Sashimi Dinner plate was two big fat slices (it's now a half slice), and since the Mexican(?) busboy was working there (well, he's still there!).  Aside from the obvious increase in prices over the years, the restaurant is still great and still offers a relatively good value for the quality of food. The tempura is still as crispy as ever, the miso hot and savory, the green tea strong... I could go on.....

Reviews.Author: nat m.
Reviews.Content: they charge you for everything..for the pickled ginger, the ponzu sauce...i am surprised they didnt charge us for the chopsticks... yes, everything was fresh. Service was horrible. We barely sat down for a minute when the waiter came and expected us to order right away. Then right after we ordered, the check was placed on our table..When I told the host that I dont understand why the check was placed on my table when I havent even received my food...All he said was sorry and walked away.  I rather go to Komasa where the sushi is as fresh and it comes with all the pickled ginger and ponzu sauce you want. It's just wrong to charge $1 for sides that are given away elsewhere. Did I mention the wait was horrible? They told us it will take 10-15 mins wait but we waited for 30 mins. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Vahe M.
Reviews.Content: Hells yeah!  FRESH FRESH FRESH! GO GO GO !

Reviews.Author: mayumi m.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi in la. always a wait but have a drink at bar c next door while you wait! Also I like to support Little Tokyo businesses whenever possible!

Reviews.Author: Gigi C.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the better sushi spots in LA.  I only wish I could afford to eat here as often.  I agree with the other yelpers that the fish is super fresh.  You don't get that after taste that you get with not-so-fresh fish.  They slice the sashimi pretty thick too so you get what you pay for.  You can easily find yourself placing order after delicious order at the sushi bar and getting a $200 check at the end.  There are plenty of other sushi restaurants in Little Tokyo, and cheaper at that, but you won't get the same quality.  At least with Sushi Gen you're not wondering where the fish came from.Go before the lunch and dinner rushes or expect to wait at least 20 minutes for a spot at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Amiel C.
Reviews.Content: I was there for lunch 2 times last week because the food was really good and the price was very reasonable. I was there on Monday at around 1130 and waited 20-25 minutes for a table for 2 and then again on Wednesday after 12 and waited for 10-15 minutes for a table for 2. There is usually a waiting list and the wait is usually over 30 minutes, according to my sister. However, both times when I went, it was alright. (guess I was lucky)I love sashimi so both times I ordered its sashimi lunch, which has a big plate of sashimi, grilled salmon, spicy and non spicy tuna, and other stuff. Soup, tofu, sunomono, and rice also come with almost every combo. And the best parts were the food was soooooooooooo damn fresh, tasty, and high in quality, and for all of this you only pay 15 dollars.If you are a fan of uni, try its uni and sashimi combo. It comes with a smaller order of sashimi and a box of uni (check out my photos).

Reviews.Author: Erik Q.
Reviews.Content: Some of the freshest sushi I have ever had! If you are in the little tokyo area this is a must try place. Expect to have a wait for lunch and dinner, but the wait is worth it every time.

Reviews.Author: EE X.
Reviews.Content: The service is horrible!  when we went there the waiting list was out of room for us to write anything. There are 4 more groups behind us. so we told one of the waiter, but he passed by without a single response. Then we told another waiter, same thing happened again! How rude was that!! so after about 10 min of standing at the entrance, we, and who ever behind us, all left...

Reviews.Author: Melissa R.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best sushi in Little Tokyo, but the wait is super long and the food is mildly expensive. Yelp gives $$$, but I'd say $$. They really pride themselves in traditional Japanese sushi. They don't mess around with newer rolls that most other sushi restaurants offer. They stick to the essentials and they definitely do it right!

Reviews.Author: Hobart L.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi probably the best one I tasted anywhere.  It's fresh, but real expensive.  I ate here once before for dinner by myself because my girlfriend was away and the bill came out to be $100 for myself??? Ate at the sushi bar because half of the place is a sushi bar.  Sat next to a guy who was a regular there who was a rich millionaire with a black amex celebrating his anniversary with his wife.  Long wait to get in there and I was sitting at the chair and I gave up my chair for his wife while we were waiting to be seated.  I ended up seating next to them at the sushi bar and we chatted.  In the end he paid for my dinner bill :-) what a nice guy.. hope he's there again when i go.. haha..

Reviews.Author: Bobbie G.
Reviews.Content: Basically the best sashimi you can get at the best price anywhere in LA or anywhere near LA. I sadly have been here only once and although I have had some pretty good sushi experiences since at other restaurants I have never been blown away by the affordability of the bill like I have at Sushi-Gen! Love it Love it Love it!

Reviews.Author: Alvin C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, especially for the price. I shared a sashimi deluxe when I came here and it was fresh, delicious, and plenty of food for the both of us. Other orders at my table included a few appetizers and the chirashi, which looked amazing as well. Service was friendly and fast. I look forward to coming back here again.Bonus: We asked for fresh ground wasabi and the waitress immediately brought it to us. Not easy to find in your average sushi spot!

Reviews.Author: Ana M.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm! Sushi-Gen is Deliciously fresh! It is one of the best sushi restaurants in Little Tokyo. We ordered a variety of nigiri pieces, my favorite was the Spanish Mackerel. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: Order lunch sashimi n you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Will G.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for delicious traditional Japanese then this is the spot. Bring a magazine or some friends because you will wait about an hour to be seated (party of 6 got seated in an hour which was not bad at all.) The food is worth the wait. I got the sashimi lunch which was a absolute steal for $15.00 . Thick cut ,really fresh and generous portions of melt in your mouth sashimi will have me coming back here. The hour long wait is because this place is great don't sleep on this one.

Reviews.Author: Joanne L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of my favorite sushi places.  The key is to sit at the bar. My favorites are the albacore, Japanese snapper with yuzu paste, toro, yellow tail belly, and scallops.  You also have to try the spicy tuna hand roll and spicy scallop hand roll. They also have a variety of miso soups - my favorites are the clam and snapper.

Reviews.Author: Gina YeeJi S.
Reviews.Content: mmmmmmmmmhands down best sushi ever! don't know about the service that people complain about. I always just sat at the bar...it's pretty simple, you order, you receive, when you're done you ask for ganjo, and you pay'nuff said

Reviews.Author: Thomas V.
Reviews.Content: Amazing sushi, some of the very best I've had. The place itself is pretty ordinary.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: My absolute favorite sushi place in LA! Everybody knows the weekday lunches have long long lines because it's so good and so cheap!  I can't really eat sushi at other places because its just not as fresh as Sushi Gen! I usually order take out from them at night as well.  I just found out that they will not let me order take out in the summer because it's too hot out =( The Sashimi plate/lunch/dinner is so good so fresh and only $15(lunch), $26(dinner) and the portion is huge!

Reviews.Author: Chev C.
Reviews.Content: I was told from a friend to go for lunch and have the sashimi. Straight up the best. I dont even have to yelp any further I go for the sushi. Parking Dont forget to get your crap validated or else youll get pipped. Lessons learned take the metro if you dont wanna deal with stupid parking fees. But the food is good :) id go for lunch I cant say much for dinner but lunch these guys are fast like ninjas. =)

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: Here for the first time.  Fish are fresh... To be expected in Little Tokyo.  I preferred Komasa any day !

Reviews.Author: Lisa T.
Reviews.Content: HANDS DOWN THE BEST SUSHI I ATE IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!! This place seriously is the best, I swear! After eating here, I can no longer eat anywhere else. Their seafood are so fresh so well prepared. UNI super delishMONK FISH LIVER sounds nasty but omg, its so goodSWEET SHRIMP i thought it was good but my bf thinks its the sweetest shrimp he's ever eaten FAT TORO one bite and you can feel your whole mouth "oily"RAW OYSTERS are to die for!!theres so much more but i dont remember the names because this was last year, i cant believe i forgot to yelp it =[IF YOU ENJOY GOOD SUSHI YOU REALLY NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE!!little bit pricey but so worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Garen G.
Reviews.Content: Simply THE BEST sushi restaurant I've been to.Everything is exceptional, extremely fresh.  Never disappoints.  One of those meals you think about weeks later.  Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Hiro N.
Reviews.Content: This place is usually the standard that I measure other sushi places in LA in terms of quality of cuts.  If money is not an issue and you want to enjoy quality sushi, go to the sushi bar and ask the sushi chef to make you whatever...omakase is the term.  If you are there with someone, just ask to split the order (which is usually 2 pieces) that way you are able to enjoy a wider variety of sushi and then later on you can reorder your favorites.  In my opinion this keeps the experience fun and fresh and allows you to get to know your sushi chef better as well.  If money is an issue an ABSOLUTE must try dish is their sashimi plate which last to my knowledge isn't even on the menu but EVERYONE there knows about it.  Order it!  Great cuts of all sorts of fish and traditionally made.  (No mayonaissey concoctions...again traditional and back to basics which they do very well)  Sashimi plate runs at lunch time at around $11 to $13 and is very filling.  I do believe the dinner version is a bit more closer to $20.  Due to their known quality you will find people waiting in line for lunch at around 10am to get in.  The crazy thing is they open for lunch at 11am. Usually the sushi bar is less crowded for lunch since everyone is there for the sashimi plate.   Great value for what you get at lunch but note dinner menu is considerably higher.  Dinner for 2 at the sushi bar can easily carry you over $50 and probably closer to $80 to $100 if you really enjoy sushi...so definitely a place to spluge.  This place has been one of the few Japanese owned with Japanese sushi chefs since the sushi restaurant industry in Los Angeles have been taken over by Koreans...not that is an issue for me.  Few people feel that those places lower quality for quantity and price which works for me as well.  Recently I have heard rumors that sushi gen have been bought out by a Korean owner, but I haven't seen if that has affected their quality or call to traditional japanese cuisine.  Again I'm not knocking on other sushi places that are owned by non Japanese owners, but if you are looking for a specific traditional experience, that may be a footnote for some.  For me, if the quality is still there its all good.

Reviews.Author: varesa c.
Reviews.Content: Love this place , the sashimi deluxe is the one that i always order and everytime it's came out very very GOOD

Reviews.Author: Obstinate N.
Reviews.Content: I need to marry one of Sushi Gen's chefs.  Or kidnap one and make him name the restaurant's tuna supplier.  I got a chirashi bowl for 15 bucks and it included some of the freshest tuna I've ever had.  I also ate some of my friend's chicken teriyaki and it was surprisingly good.  The chicken was cooked very well, with a layer of crispy skin to boot.  Service is friendly and fast for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Kookie Monster V.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING quality sushi! The toro is fantabulous! I also love the red snapper and halibut. They squeeze some lemon juice over the fish with a dash of salt...no wasabi/soy...YUM!  They are a bit pricey, but for the quality, it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: C C.
Reviews.Content: This place would get a 4.5 for being more expensive than it should be and for slightly lacking service...However, Jason (the receptionist guy...He's there EVERYDAY!) remembers us by name evertime, is very kind/patient and tries hard to get us in ASAP. 1/2 star for JASON. However, the other 4.5 stars goes to the freshest (with the exception of urasawa) fish in LA. Have tried almost all the sushi joints in Little Tokyo. This is the ONLY sushi restaurant I frequent. By "frequent" I mean atleast once a week, and up to 3 times a week. No thank you: "Hama", "GOGO" "Komasa" the list goes on and on...Here's the quick list of what to get:LUNCH: SO worth it $15 for the sashimi: You get agedashi tofu, tsukemono (japanese pickles), rice, miso shiru and a combination of their freshest fish. Once in a while you'll get some very generous pieces of toro! they charge close to the price of the meal (for toro) if you order it at the sushi bar! Ask for sushi rice instead of reg. rice to complete your experience. Sometimes it's free, sometimes its a $1. Dunno. Dun ask.Dinner: Sashimi Deluxe (although it doesn't come with everything that comes with the sashimi lunch, not even rice) Worth it! Comes with Toro everytime! It's decently sized: can share with a friend! Uni dinner is also pretty amazing if you don't mind the price tag+all that UNI!!!Sushi Bar:They are experts @ Japanase Snapper and Scallop. They use YUZU PEPPER, sea salt and lemon.  Others who do it don't compare. Dunno why, dun care. Don't forget especially for these: Fish side down or sideways on the tongue, then chew! yum!

Reviews.Author: tamia k.
Reviews.Content: This was hands down one of the best sushi experiences I have ever had. The food was extremely fresh and delicious, there wasn't a thing we ordered (and we ordered a lot) that we didn't like. Everything was fresh and delicious. Service was excellent...can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Shop F.
Reviews.Content: The sushi here is very fresh and delicous. But getting a table during lunch is nearly impossible. There's always a wait of 20 min or more...so if you're not in a hurry I suggest the sushi here...

Reviews.Author: Rodney J.
Reviews.Content: Came here a lot when I worked in Downtown LA.  Great sushi and good service.  I loved the Chirashi. Unfortunately, the line to get in was often long, but it's definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Mark W.
Reviews.Content: This place gets crowded so go early. I dont normally eat sushi but this was great. I now see why people go spend hundreds of dollars on raw food. If I eat sushi Im going back here.

Reviews.Author: Sandra M.
Reviews.Content: Ironically (what with over 75 reviews and a packed room) I hadn't heard about this place--perhaps I'm out of the hype/hipster loop?  A maybe date (you know not sure if it's a date situation) took me there (yes another one--is it me?) and we had a great time--the sushi was fresh and we got fresh wasabi--which I had never had---completely makes a difference.  All in all the food was good the sushi chefs attentive and I walked away satisfied..with the food.  The date..continues to be a maybe.

Reviews.Author: roger l.
Reviews.Content: never had the chance to visit this place for the lunch special, as they are not open on saturday for lunch.  But I did have a great time for dinner, deluxe sashimi is very fresh, presentation was great, you should definitely give it a try, I deducted 1 star for not having one close to where I live (sorry but distance needs to be taken into consideration for me )

Reviews.Author: Albert W.
Reviews.Content: Good for the price/quality.  There is a wait even on the weekdays.   The problem is that I typically spend much, much more on sushi (~75 to ~100 per person).   I enjoyed what I had but if you have the money, I would save up 3 of the Sushi Gen trips and go for the best.   Hama Sushi just down the street is where I would spend my money.

Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: Kind. Fresh. Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Maria G.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi in Los Angeles!

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: At last, I've managed to get away from crunch rolls and spicy tuna. Even if you've had better, there's no questioning that Sushi-Gen does authentic Japanese right. The sashimi combo is perfection--fresh, fatty cuts of raw fish for a kickass price. Most of it is tuna, and I can do without the cooked salmon and eel, but for $15 I feel like I'm getting away with highway robbery.

Reviews.Author: Yoning Y.
Reviews.Content: Don't want this to be redundant so I'll make it short- I heard this place was famous, etc, and had pretty good sushi- but wasn't all that satisfied - I've had better sushi at better price- I guess i should have gone for lunch but I don't live around this area and don't think I will ever go for lunch so I guess I will never come again D: sucks for me ;

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: eh...whatever there are waaaay better spots a block away. Want traditional? Go to Hama, want more than sushi go to the Japanese Tavern....

Reviews.Author: Ellie L.
Reviews.Content: OMG. Okay this is by far the best sushi I ever ate in the city of Los Angeles. Like the 30 minute wait on a crowded Saturday night was well worth it. I ordered the beef terikaryi dinner with the 7piece sashimi. The sashimi was very delicious and high quality. To be honest, I really hate the texture of tuna from my past experience, but this tuna blew my mind away.! it was very tasty and as I placed it on my tongue, it just melts away! My friend got the sashimi dinner, it was randomly selected by the chef and there was no substitution period..Every piece of fish on the plate were delicious, there were no left-overs! This is definitely my spot to grub for sushi when I visit LA again. You won't be disappointed. Although, I didn't understand why there were no cellphones allow. I couldn't take a snapshot of that yummy-ness. T__T

Reviews.Author: Ty C.
Reviews.Content: Top notch! Get in line its worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Sharon G.
Reviews.Content: 8.10.07 update :: sat at the bar at lunchtime. the special isn't available at the bar at lunch and there's a four piece order minimum per person, but none of this matters, as the  the fish was truly supurb! fresh, delicous, and the sushi chef were weird and wonderful. --------------------------------------------------­----------------------------i guess i'm a sucker for the hype machine and as a result was slightly disappointed. it wasn't like i expected a sushi miracle but after trying to get in here twice, (one time the line of people was spilling out into the parking lot, most of them japanese - a good sign, i think) and hearing rave after rave, i thought i was going to experience the coveted S.O...or sushi orgasm. i loved the variety and more traditional-ness of the place. no deep fried creamcheese rolls here...just straight fish and a variety of things i had never heard of: jack mackerel and gizzard shad come to mind (both really good and fresh). they have 3 different types of yellowtail (please, i could eat yellowtail everyday). fresh and different, but not mind blowing.we sat at a table because there were so many of us, but i hear the bar is the place to be, (they don't take reservations for the bar ). so next time i'm going to go with less people, put my name in and head over to a local watering hole to wait out the 6, 478 people ahead of me.

Reviews.Author: yeana j.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite sushi places of all time. I'm pretty picky about sushi, especially sashimi, but this place always has a great selection of fresh fish. I firmly believe that japanese style sushi/sashimi should be done in a traditional Japanese way, with none of the silly crunchy roll crap--and this place stays true to its roots. I always get the sashimi platter, and I usually go for lunch, since it's a little cheaper. I love the variety of sashimi and the small side foods that comes out. Everything tastes delicate and never fishy. To top off great traditional sushi is the REAL green tea they serve (now they charge for it...boooo). Even though it's pricey, I can never say no to really great real japanese sashimi!

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: My go to spot when it comes to sushi.  Everything is fresh and reminds me of when I was in Japan.  The quality is unequal as well as the sushi chefs talent in creating these masterpieces.  It gets crowded though but worth the wait.  This was the first place I went with a friend and tried Ankimo (Monk fish liver) which is surprising good but I am not into anymore.  The halibut, red snapper, halibut fin, salmon, spicy tuna handroll are very good.  The yellowtail and the albacore are excellent.   You can tell a sushi place is good when you order tuna (maguro) and it melts in your mouth and has no skin (which makes it chewy and not very good)

Reviews.Author: Derek J.
Reviews.Content: Not much more can be said than whats already been mentioned.  This place rivals and surpasses most trendy and expensive Sushi restaurants in Beverly Hills for a fraction of the cost.  Absolutely fantastic.  Their fish tastes like it just came out of the ocean and is rich, silky and buttery.  It's so fresh I can almost swear its still moving.

Reviews.Author: Adelaide L.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness, how come I barely discovered the best place for sashimi in LA? Their quality of raw fish is outstanding! Me and my buddy sat at the sushi bar (which was quite pricey, but totally worth it thank you J!!). The fatty tuna and yellow tail belly were my fav. The yellow tail collar was juicy, unlike other places that fry it dry. My new sushi hot spot!

Reviews.Author: Victor W.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of sushi, let alone uni, so I was highly recommended to go to this place near Little Tokyo for lunch a few months ago.  Sushi Gen, from what I was told, is the central supplier for sushi restaurants across Los Angeles.  How much truth there is to this, I don't really care.  I was told that the lunch specials and fish quality here were great for the price.  I ordered the uni combo which literally consisted of a box of uni (2 layers deep), some miscellaneous prepared sides, a small sashimi platter, and a bowl of rice.The uni tasted what you would expect of fresh uni.  It was sweet to the taste and maintained its texture and consistency as you would expect when served individually at a restaurant.  The sides served (as you can see from the picture) were not very memorable.  There was some chopped octopus, shredded crab, marinated fish, mashed tuna, a tofu block, and 2 packets of seaweed.  The quality of the sashimi meat was pretty good.  It certainly was not the best I've had, but it definitely deserves recognition.  This uni combo cost (if I remember) around $30.Would this be considered a bang for the buck? Based on the menu, I think prices are a little steep for what you get.  The fish itself is good, but I was definitely not wowed.  Price aside, I still think Sushi Ko's fish quality was the best I have had so far.  Nonetheless, the portions, fish, and price delivered a nice package.  If I craved for sushi and I was near downtown LA, this would be one of my places to go to.

Reviews.Author: olive f.
Reviews.Content: I've seen Jean Claude Van Damme here twice.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Short & sweet review:  Good place, a little tight on the seating side, but the sushi was excellent!

Reviews.Author: Steven G.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen has been my favorite sushi place for lunch in downtown L.A. for a few years.  I like to sit at the sushi bar, which allows me to order my lunch one item at a time and go with the flow of the meal.  Everything I've had here is very good.  Their toro handroll melts in your mouth.  They do a really nice ankimo sashimi that I love to start with.  I have had some really interesting sashimi and sushi here, when it was partiularly fresh (as reccomended by the sushi chefs).  I've never been dissapointed.

Reviews.Author: Erin S.
Reviews.Content: Walking through this door was like being beamed back to Japan. The sushi here is amazing. Very fresh like the fish was caught that day. It's hard to empress me with sushi but here I was for sure impressed with what I had. The wait was a bit long but totally worth it. The service was good as well. Very nice sweet lady helped us and was on it with the water and tea. I would go back to this place in a heart beat!

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: The absolute best sashimi meal I've ever had. Given, I came with a friend who wanted to take me out for "real" sashimi, after I had told her I love sashimi. As a result, we literally went all out on the ordering, with sashimi deluxe, toro sashimi, uni sashimi, and an individual order of beef teriyaki with sashimi each, which was slightly overkill. I've never had to actually hold myself back from consuming rice while eating sashimi, because it definitely doesn't come cheap, but this was one of those rare moments in my life until I become a sparkling entrepreneur (as opposed to a budding one).Uni I believe speaks for itself. Always been one of my favorite sashimi dishes, and always will be. Toro on the other hand, was a whole different experience. This may have been my first time trying it, but damn it does not look like your typical fish. It actually resembles more like quality raw kobe beef, glistening with fat, unlike the typically transparent form of tuna. If tuna was chicken of the sea, then toro was definitely the prime quality bacon of the sea. I could've cried with my first bite, soaking in the buttery taste while I bit into it ever so slowly, letting the fish dissolve itself in my mouth. drool.Yellowtail hamachi (also one of my favorites) was very delicious as well, in the best quality you can probably get this side of the pacific.I think I've consumed enough fish for a month. And then perhaps another trip back here. ;)

Reviews.Author: Asuka N.
Reviews.Content: After seeing the very high ratings for Sushi-Gen - along with the high number of reviews - we decided to check this joint out for lunch today. We arrived just before noon, and there was already plenty of people waiting outside...so if you are working on a tight schedule, it's probably best to get there a little early or to call ahead and make a reservation. Since we were here on vacation, we could absorb the 35 minutes of waiting around in the parking lot area until we finally got a seat. It's not a tiny place (at least by the Manhattan standards I usually measure against), but it's definitely packed at lunchtime. Service isn't anything remarkable, but they do get you your food quick, and the waiters definitely give the aura of wanting you to be quick with ordering, quick with eating, and quick with paying as well.That said - I was shocked by the amount of sushi you get for your money out here. When I saw the sushi deluxe and the sashimi were each $15, I questioned whether or not this was going to be a large meal - with $15, you might be lucky to get 3 pieces of sushi at some of the high-end sushi spots in NY. Boy, was I wrong...they give you a TON of sushi and sashimi at these prices. And we got the cooked eel over rice with sashimi...so we ended up with a lot of freakin' fish on the table. And to be truthful - the quality was pretty good overall. They don't do exotic types of fish like they do at higher-end stops, but they give you lots of tuna - both the fatty kind, as well as the regular bluefin - as well as yellowtail.
