The sashimi comes with some tartare-style tuna as well, which was delicious. One highlight was the squid, which definitely was a lot less chewy and tough than I've had at other places. The toro here is pretty well-done - very buttery, very rich flavor, and they present it in many ways (tartare, sushi, sashimi).I wouldn't say that the sushi here is the best I've had, but for the quality and the quantity you get, Sushi-Gen is pretty much a sushi joint that you have to stop by. I do wish the variety of fish was greater, but they are very good at what they do here, and the price is unbeatable. It's probably a better deal than most of those Chinese-run sushi joints that are just about everywhere now.

Reviews.Author: Melisa C.
Reviews.Content: If you find yourself anywhere near Little Tokyo during lunchtime, this place is a definite MUST GO!  They have the best lunch specials I've had at any Japanese restaurant (both price and quality).  I always get the $15 sashimi lunch.  It comes with a huge variety of of super fresh fish prepared many different ways.  I can't describe it in words, so just check out my picture!  The lunch also comes with miso soup, pickled veggies, and steamed tofu.  It's truly the best....I look forward to coming here everytime I'm in LA.  Be warned that the wait can be long, so either get there early or be patient...it's totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: is there more than 5 stars?? we wait for everything and everywhere so what is the big deal to wait and end up having at the end of your wait some of the best sushi around!!go there and refrain from whining:-)

Reviews.Author: Raphael H.
Reviews.Content: This place has the worst attitude in Los Angeles.  Every single time I go there, the host makes me feel like I wronged his mother or something.  On top of that the wait is absolutely atrocious.  They don't care to change their attitude since they feel like they are doing you a favor for letting you to eat and spend your money there.  Despite their great food and extremely fresh sushi, I have finally decided to give up on this place since I would rather not put up with their attitude, as there are plenty of equal quality alternatives that can provide service with a smile and not have an eternal wait.

Reviews.Author: Jenn T.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Sushi Gen numerous times but haven't had a chance to yelp it. We came back here the past weekend for some delicious sashimi. The wait time was about 45 minutes before we got seated. This time I brought my parents, so we ordered a pretty good amount of food. My mother is not a big fan of sashimi, so I got the beef teriyaki dinner with tempura it was was very tender and not over drenched with the teriyaki sauce. The rest of us shared the sashimi deluxe, yellow tail tatake, rolls, and other small dishes. It was a very satisfying meal between the 4 of us. If you are looking for fresh sashimi that will melt in your mouth, you ought to give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: Anthony M.
Reviews.Content: For the  sushi purist who has scoured the city for an authentic sushi experience without the flashing bulbs of hollywood -- i would suggest this hidden gem in downtown LA (Little Tokyo)... The sushi is fresh and the variety is amazing, word is the sushi Chef has been a staple at the fish market for over 20 years and gets prime choice of fish.... And tasting is believing... If you want to venture out for a great lunch or a quick seat at the sushi bar.... i suggest you try -- yellow tail, toro,  japanese red snapper...and the eel is second to none...    The ambience is authentic, no slick art or art deco chairs -- just a basic interior where the attention is paid to your "sushi" not your "inner" art critic...

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: It's like an explosion in my mouth with every bite! :) I don't think I can go anywhere else for sushi ever again. This is REAL sushi, no BS. Amazing. I am already planning my next trip.However, it is expensive, but the portions are generous.

Reviews.Author: Deborah P.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add to TCI A.'s review about the bad attitude the employees exhibit to their customers.In December 2012 my 78-year-old mother and her friend took a one-hour drive to Sushi-Gen for lunch, and waited in line with everyone else who were waiting for the restaurant to open. My mother takes water pills for her high blood pressure, so she needs to use the bathroom frequently, especially after a one-hour drive. There were several employees inside, and she asked if she could use the bathroom, and they flat-out told her NO. She ended up having to walk alone to a mall off of Alameda a few blocks away to use the restroom. When she returned, she learned that her friend was refused seating because both of them weren't present.Suffice it to say that I was quite angry upon hearing my elderly mother's account of her lunch experience.The bad attitude at this restaurant is deplorable.

Reviews.Author: Jack M.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fish!!!!! One of our favorites!!! Cannot wait to go back to LA and eat here!

Reviews.Author: Pauline L.
Reviews.Content: I went there a couple days ago with a few friends for dinner and I'm glad we got there early because by the time we left, the line was out the door.  I heard a lot of good things about this place, but I have to say that it was kind of forgettable.  The sushi was fresh and good, but the portions were very tiny for what you pay for.  I guess I'm kind of spoiled with the places that give larger rolls and more sushi for the same price as this place.  The service was ok - we had to wait awhile before we got our food and the people sitting next to us, who arrived after we did, got all their food before we did.  I hate when that happens at restaurants because it always makes me feel like they forgot about you.  Overall, this place was good, but not great.

Reviews.Author: Rich O.
Reviews.Content: Excellent sushi. The freshness of the sushi was something I have missed since eating sushi up in the bay area. I went here with my brother and his wife on my birthday. Granted the wait time to get a table was extensive to say the least, however, it was well worth it once I took my first bite of sushi. The next time I make my way over there I'm going to make sure I can make it an early dinner so hopefully I'll miss the rush.

Reviews.Author: Jay C.
Reviews.Content: Woah, this is an amazing sushi restaurant.  The quality and selection boggle the mind, we had quite a spread and the bill was not too bad.  We had uni, monkfish liver, halibut, fatty tuna and a clam app that was frickin amazing.  This is a very authentic very delicious place to eat, take my word for it this place is top notch.

Reviews.Author: Diane G.
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I had just missed lunch hours, and had to wait 3 more hours before Sushi Gen would open up again---but it was worth the wait! One of the best Crunch rolls I've ever had---the sauce was infused into the rice/eel---delicioso. Gave this place a 4 out of 5 solely b/c it was so busy that the waitress wasn't particularly attentive---understandable though considering the amount of customers they have at a time.

Reviews.Author: Torie Y.
Reviews.Content: the bf and i had been planning this day for months. instead of returning to work the day after my (short) xmas break, we ventured out to sushi gen to get their awesome lunch specials. we headed out early and arrived by 1130 to avoid the lunch rush.once inside, i ordered the tempura lunch special and he had the sashimi platter. they offer some really good warm tofu (with a speck of meat if you're lucky!) and a little dish of tsukemono. man oh man do they give you a lot of fish! i was slightly disappointed that there was no raw salmon in sight, but the yellowtail more than made up for it. the fish was incredibly fresh, and their tempura is that perfect point between crispy and crunchy. the veggie slabs are huge! i stole the little squids from the bf's plate, and also got to try some of his spicy tuna. honestly, even the rice is good here! no wonder it gets super crowded. lunch definitely seems like the best deal.

Reviews.Author: Ming C.
Reviews.Content: Long wait... Difficult to park. Somewhat expensive (unless you get the lunch special), but probably one of the top sushi places I've ever eaten at. Sweet shrimp with the udon soup is AMAZING. My mouth was very happy. But everything in general was really fresh, and somehow extremely tasty even compared to really good sushi places. It never ceases to amaze me how much something as simple as raw salmon can differ from one place to another, but this place just is better. I highly recommend coming here at least once.

Reviews.Author: Brinda J.
Reviews.Content: Went here again for my bff's bday. The sashimi is just like I remembered it. But we ordered a salad and it was just lettuce leaves. I'm sorry but that's a no no. Plus there was a super amazing fish on our sashimi plate and we wanted to know what fish it was so we could order it separately and the server totally didn't know what fish it was, and brought us out a different fish altogether. It's still not 5 stars for me and I don't think it ever will be. The fish is honestly super fresh but everything else is just blah. I prefer Sushi Go 55.

Reviews.Author: Kel S.
Reviews.Content: Fresh and delicious. A little wait, which seems to be normal...Also a little pricey, but worth it for amazing sushi without the frills!

Reviews.Author: Kara P.
Reviews.Content: food: delicious & authentic.  my favorite is the "sashimi teishoku" for lunchservice: wonderful and friendlyfinal thoughts: whenever i have day off, i go to sushi gen for lunch.  my go to spot when i have friends in town.  i love sushi gen!!!

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: 2 girls. craving good sushi s/p 8.9 japan...yea.ordered: sashimi deluxe, santuryi, 2 toro piecestoro just *melts* in your mouth.half-way through, ordered another sashimi dinner. our eyes were bigger than our stomach.obviously.still championed through.don't mind the glow.

Reviews.Author: Dimitri S.
Reviews.Content: Back to the basics here with simple presentation and excellent quality sushi.  The meal started with miso soup which was perfect (not too salty).  The Sashimi dinner with tempura was great as the cuts of sashimi along with the prepared spicy tartars were fresh and tasty.  The grilled yellowtail collar was flavorful and fun to work for its tender meat.  The sweet shrimp served with fried heads was on!  The whole group left satisfied and happy. Echigo beer is always a nice accompaniment to any meal.  It was terrific!

Reviews.Author: Sanaz M.
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended this place and I wasn't impressed. Sushi is ok but its not mouthwatering delicious. There are way better sushi joints in that area.

Reviews.Author: Richard B.
Reviews.Content: I can't remember an American sushi bar that served fresher fish.  The pristine taste of the fish here is really in an universe by itself.  It tastes like it just came out of the ocean or off the fishing boat.  This is also one of the most expensive presentations of sushi ever, $65 for lunch, so this is not for the meek at heart.  But I have to say this is an unique experience, and trust the sushi masters with the omakase.  The fatty toro, the Spanish mackerel, the Japanese snapper and the Santa Barbara shrimp set the standard to judge all other sushi bars.

Reviews.Author: Theresa N.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant was so freaking good.  They have different courses per person (course A, B or C) and the cost per person depended on the course you ordered.  They all come with an appetizer, entrees and dessert.  From what I recall, Course A was about $40, Course B was maybe $60 and Course C was about $80.  We ordered Course C; it's worth it if you're a sushi freak!  Call to make reservations, as they place is so popular...my friend told me they ONLY take reservations.

Reviews.Author: Mary L.
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I have been to Sasabune and Sushi Zo.  I was not expecting this to be better but the quality was on par.  I think the difference between this place and the others is that not only is the sushi good but the other food, the Japanese tapas and food, are great.  Those were the ones that really reminded me of Japan.  The egg custard, the salmon skin salad, the miso soup with clams all reminded me of Japan.  It was a great feeling.  I actually didn't think the uni was great.  Sushi Zo definitely has the best Uni I've had in the US.  This place can get pricey if you don't notice what you're ordering but it's totally worth it!  Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Bernadette M.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Tuesday and thought their wasn't going to be a wait at 1130am, boy was I wrong!  We waited for about 45 min for our table and so glad we did!  I ordered the uni sashimi combo and it was a lot of food!  Definitely for uni lovers!  Also got the salmon teriyaki and it was perfectly cooked.  The sushi was the best part of the meal.  Our favorite was the yellowtail!  Yum!

Reviews.Author: Pegah Y.
Reviews.Content: I give this place a 4.5.  The quality of the food definitely deserves 5 stars.  The sushi is to die for here.  I ordered the combination sushi box and it came with a variety of good sushi, including toro, uni, albacore, unagi, etc.  SOOO GOOD!  I LOVED that toro.  It just melted in my mouth.  That's how soft and luscious it was.  However, I give a "4" for service and for the quantity of the food.  I wasn't quite full after the combination sushi box, though I paid a good $15 for it.  The wait is also quite annoying.  I met a friend there for lunch on a weekday and I had been forewarned through yelp reviews that I should get there extra early and well before the 11 AM opening time so I could get a good spot toward the front of the line (yes, there is a line to get seated, and quite a long one at that).  I got to the restaurant at 10:30 AM and there were still at least 15 people ahead of me.  By around 11 AM, the line had made serpentine twists and turns in the complex where Sushi-Gen is located.  It was pretty ridiculous.  Thankfully, we were one of the first ones in and seated, so that was good.  However, the waitress was very short with us when we were ordering.  It was apparent that they were hurrying to get us out since there was a long line and other customers.  I understand that there are other customers, but hurrying customers doesn't allow them to truly enjoy their food.  And this was all at 11 AM!  I can't even imagine how crazy packed this place must be for dinner... Still, the sushi was fantastic!  I would definitely go back again just to get that fresh sushi, regardless of the service or the annoying wait.

Reviews.Author: Pauline N.
Reviews.Content: Parking is a bit tight. The restaurant validate though. I didn't have to wait long because my friends were waiting for 1 hr before I arrived. Price is good, fishes here are real fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Author: Su L.
Reviews.Content: I have two favorite sushi restaurants in LA and this is one of them. The fish is always fresh and has solid flavor. Their lunch menu (if you work close by) has this sashimi combo that you have to try at least once!!! So yummy. The wait is always long though, lunch or dinner. Be warned. But it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: one of the best sushi place ive been to!hamachi, tuna, aji, saba, uni, salmon, unagi! all so fresh and delicious! love sitting at the bar and just ordering piece by piece! unagi was warm, meaty and crispy! tuna melted in my mouth! everything was delicious!good friendly service too

Reviews.Author: Sherry L.
Reviews.Content: Spending $75 on sushi for lunch? Yeah, it happens. But this is SO worth it. I had a total of 20 pieces and 1 roll (uni). So it's actually really good value. The fish was as fresh as you can get.. I had tamago, uni, amaebi, hamachi, salmon, shima aji, scallop, anago, and a bunch of others. This is some of the best sushi I've had in California.

Reviews.Author: Donna S.
Reviews.Content: preparation//parking is heinous....why? because this veteran of lil' tokyo is still top notch...so go early!!*note* you can tell if you'll make first seating by your place in line according the the awningambiance//***all the good stuff of a traditional japanese restaurant...split seating btw sushi bar vs. table areaservice//***it's pretty standard for any busy restaurant when you sit at the tables@ the sushi bar, i rely on MD. to speak japanese....definitely much more efficient ;pfood//*****lunch specials are always good for those that need to get in and out quicklysushi bar- omakase!^^sashimi and nigiri are always very fresh!traditionalist in preparation...none of the ponzu laced sauces aside from the hirame and tai~*~it's a treat to eat omakase here! especially if you enjoy your sushi in the traditional form~

Reviews.Author: Rickey K.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi spot in LA. I make it a point to eat at the sushi bar. My bar for a good sushi comes down to the quality if the uni, not the tuna. The uni is fresh from Santa Barbara. And their toro is top grade. Great choice of sake. Great place for conversations and catching up with old friends.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne S.
Reviews.Content: So  I decided to try this place out after all of the beaming reviews, and when they warn you about coming to this play early bc its busy for lunch... they are not kidding. OMG I showed up at around 11am when it opened, on a tuesday morning and the line was at least 15 people deep, we waited about 30-40 minutes to be seated.(Quick tip: there's usually no wait for the sushi bar but the downside is you MUST order 4 things per person which will most likely end up like alot of $$ just for lunch)  I ordered the salmon teryiaki and sashimi lunch special. It came with miso soup, some tofu side, and some other small side salad (think banchan like sides) as well as about 6-8 pieces of sashimi. I have to say their sashimi is pretty freaking amazing. Fresh, decent-sized portions of really great tasting fish. 'Im no fish connoisseur so I cant tell you what fish they were, but either way pretty freaking fantastic. The salmon teriyaki was pretty good, it was a whole side of salmon (skin and everything drenched in teriyaki sauce. My bf ordered the sushi lunch special and he liked it except for one little thing--if they ask you if wasabi is ok, say NO! well unless you want that stuff on everything... he thought they meant is wasabi okay on the side but it was not on the side it was all over the sushi rice. to conclude: 1. great sashimi2. no to wasabi---unless you're really into that3. get there early or you are gonna wait!as for the star-rating, this was a borderline 3 or 4 star establishment, good food, decent service, dislike the wait (but thats not really they're fault), dislike the requirements on sushi bar. I highly suggest for true sushi lovers, not for the faint of heart who want deep fried- cream cheese type rolls (not that theres anything wrong with that.)

Reviews.Author: Gene S.
Reviews.Content: Good food, but certainly not something to wait over an hour for.  Especially when the restaurant wasn't even open yet.  Overall good quality fish...there are places I would wait in long lines for but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Author: Jack X.
Reviews.Content: Sushi duplex is nice

Reviews.Author: Anna S.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I couldn't help but to visit a few yelp spots while I was in LA. My aunt from Korea was visiting and I suggested we try some sushi instead of Korean food. *(For those of you that are up on your Asian history, she was around during the Japanese occupation of Korea and was forced to learn Japanese. Long story short, she is fluent in both Japanese and Korean and was able to speak to my friend who is Japanese and the Sushi chefs also.) I couldn't even speak to her because I am a horrible part Korean hybrid American... English only, knowledge of only names of Korean food. Pathetic, I know... *Well, we chose to eat at the sushi bar instead of waiting for an hour for a table. The sashimi was excellent, high quality for sure. The staff had very strong Japanese accents and it was clear that we both had a hard time understanding each other. However, my aunt was able to order some dishes for us and it was very good. *Drawbacks include, $140 check for 4 people including tip, long wait if you want to be seated, you have to pay for parking! Oh well, that is the story of a nice restaurant in downtown.

Reviews.Author: Elaine C.
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Sushi-Gen. We came on the Saturday night with three adults and two kids. Luckily we had reservations, otherwise I think our wait would've been well over an hour. At 6:30, the place was crowded already and people were spilling out the restaurant door. Make sure you show up on time if you have a reservation. When I called, they told me they would not hold the table and that the entire party had to be present. The restaurant has a private lot (entrance on 2nd) which made it easy to find parking. The information on yelp says that it's not good for kids, but they do serve food other than sashimi, so it's all good. We ordered yellowtail belly, salmon, salmon skin salad, beef teriyaki dinner, california roll, spicy tuna roll, and sashimi dinner. The dinners come with miso soup, pickled seaweed, tempera, and rice. I must say that I really enjoyed the soup and the seaweed salad. The tempura was also very good. The rolls were delish and the sashimi were awesome - definately felt like heaven in my mouth. The sashimi dinner came with various sashimi including tuna, spicy tuna, some white fish, squid, cooked salmon, sardines...sorry don't remember/know the rest, but it was good. You never know what you're going to get with the sashimi dinner though, so what I list wouldn't even matter. But I believe the waitress said sashimi dinner will always come with white fish and tuna - the rest is up to the chef. For drinks, we ordered green tea. My sister and I had it hot, and my husband had it iced. Though the tea is the same, the hot was actually $1 more than the cold at $3 a pop. But the green tea brought me back to Japan - tasted like what I remembered it to be at the tea plantation in Japan. Loved it. Thank you Sushi-Gen. You held up to your 4.5 star rating!

Reviews.Author: jess w.
Reviews.Content: i frequent this place at least twice whenever i'm by downtown LA.  yes, get the sashimi lunch special. def well worth the price. the staff is so efficienct, and not only with your sashimi plate, that'll actually fill you up, you get miso soup, seaweed cucumber, and warm, lightly soy sauced tofu. for an awesome deal of 13 beans ish. tip: you cant have lunch special if youre seated at the sushi bar, which can rack up the dollas. big time. be there at 10:45 sharp. no later. so you can LINE UP BEFORE THE RESTAURANT OPENS. haha seriously. i once got there at 10:55 and there was already a huge line, and my bastard ass didnt make the first cut. meaning i had to wait another hour for the second round. =( great deal, 5 minute drive to little tokyo from downtown LA where the office bldgs are. never had time for dessert, and once i had some fish collarbone special dish. was awesomeeeee. i forgot what fish. but it would be located on a post-it next to the lunch specials. haha.

Reviews.Author: Cheyne N.
Reviews.Content: Pretty amazing here. Waited about 20 min to get seated, fish was excellent especially the yellow tail. Service was on point and very clean inside. The kicker was watching the drunk dudes next to us eat the fried sweet shrimp heads at the end of their meal, so cool.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle R.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the prices are a little high, but for the quality and the amount of food you get, it is totally worth it.  So far, it ranks pretty high as far as sushi joints go.  I had the sushi deluxe and everything was yummy.  I would have given the place 5 stars if the octupus sushi was softer, but really I am being a little nit-picky. I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could.  I like the atmosphere and the fact that is in Little Tokyo.  I'd come back again.

Reviews.Author: Angela W.
Reviews.Content: The sushi and fish are AMAZING. Don't come here expecting the huge, Americanized, rice-stuffed, cooked rolls. I came with Christina O. who is friends with the owner and has been familiar with the restaurant for years. We had the tofu broth to start and enjoyed lightly battered tempera, unagi, yellowtail, and salmon skin. It gets ridiculously crowded during peak hours (dinner) and the wait can be fairly long but the freshness and quality of the food is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: I came here to seek the best sushi experience that my friend and I could afford.. LOL According to the reviews on Yelp, Sushi-Gen always has the best quality fish. So we decided to head over! It wasn't exactly what I had in mind.. maybe they were having a bad day? Not sure.. But I'll have to give this place another try again soon.

Reviews.Author: Solomon W.
Reviews.Content: This is basically what I had expected out of California sushi, but I was by no means disappointed.  Long waiting probably has this place as the hot spot of Little Tokyo.  I just should have stuck with the standard "Sashimi Deluxe" like my friends.  It contained the best cuts of your standard fish, with a few fun items.  The real gem of the platter was the Toro, which was true to the authentic cut.  For $35, this huge portion of sashimi is a steal, and my friend said its even cheaper for lunch.  I thought I'd venture out and go for the Omakase, which was about $38 that night.  I was happy with everything I had received, but nothing was that great, except the hamachi.  Though I received some exotic cuts, I was a tad disappointed that I had only received about 10 pieces of fish that didn't have me ecstatic.  Overall, this is one of the great sushi joints around.

Reviews.Author: Picabo S.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful.  The freshest and the best sashimi I've had in LA so far.  Not cheap but definitely worth every penny you pay.  Little Tokyo is the place to be.

Reviews.Author: Greg T.
Reviews.Content: fresh fish + warm dining room + friendly wait staff = sushi gen.  this place gets super busy so make sure to call for reservations.  can't go wrong with the raw dishes...hamachi kama was good but not spectacular.  Chirashi was excellent.  nice selection of fish and pickled goodies but also a nice piece of toro thrown in to really send you over the edge in the best way possible.  mmm...toro!  rice was on point.  good job, Sushi Gen!

Reviews.Author: Sona B.
Reviews.Content: Have read RAVE reviews about this on yelp. And I am totally a believer!! Best freshest tasting sushi I've ever had in my life. We decided Omakase was the way to go, so we took a seat at the sushi bar. Our sushi chef was awesome, he really blew my sushi mind. He would give us advice on which pieces to avoid the soy sauce as to truly attain the flavor of the fish. And here's a first, fried shrimp heads, yep, i'm a newbie and had no idea on how to begin devouring this fried goodness. Luckily, the couple next to us were super friendly and gave us some pointers.  When I was down and off that sushi train, the BF kept going, being presented with amazing new fish and delicacies. When we were both sufficiently satiated and happy, we got the bill. This place is decently expensive but the relatively cheap house sake evens it out ;)

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: Cant say I have had better sushi in this town.  Very warm and  tender to chew, excellent taste, and the price is reasonable for the quality.  Be prepared for a wait at the sushi bar, but its definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Aaron C.
Reviews.Content: Up there with the best.  Definitely the best in Little Tokyo.  The omakase is very good but I found out it's almost the same menu, in the same order, every time.  Other than that.  Super fresh.  Can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Author: Jennie K.
Reviews.Content: I am such a big sashimi girl... so this place fits right in my alley. Go for the delux sashimi plate, (it's super fresh) and get some sake with that!! Can't go wrong with that combo.  Enjoy...my hungry yelpers!! Oh yeah, don't forget to make reservation... last time we were there without a reservation... we waited for almost an hour! We were drooling as we sat in the waiting area and watch all the yummy sushi being served. sniff..sniff..  hehe... oink!

Reviews.Author: erika h.
Reviews.Content: We sat at the sushi bar, SURPRISINGLY, we were seated immediately for dinner. We must have timed that right. The bar is large, seats many , unlike most of the tiny Little Tokyo bars. There were  no visible sushi specials, or the little beer sponsored sushi menus to clutter the counter. Immediately, we were brought our OSHIBORI, which often restaurants take forever to do. Because we were at the bar, we didn't order entrees,  which would be rude to do anyway. I think the host said it's a 4 order minimum per person and no menu items. Sushi bars should be that way, so that's not offensive to me. 3 stars for the rice...it was hard, not as tender as I expect sushi rice to be. However, the sweet vinegar taste was on  par. Toro - MELTED IN MY MOUTH! 5 star toro. Toro should always be this way. Hamachi - good 4 starKanpachi - good 4 starikura - good , standard and freshsalmon - 3.5 stars it was kind of standard fresh, not exceptional. That's all I can remember that I ate. All the fish was fresh.Green Tea - was fresh ground tea leaves strained, very oishi. But I had to wait and ask for more tea. Service - typical quick Japanese style. Its the way I like it. Feed me and serve me and leave me alone. Sushi Chef was friendly enough, very talented (I always observe the cutting techniques.) He was quick with making the rice balls, while paying attention to the customers he was serving.  This place would have gotten 4 stars if it had better rice. Sushi really can be hit or miss. First of all, it should always be fresh. Rice should always be tender. And the chef should be trained Japanese style (These guys were.) I was once told by a sushi chef I used to know, that he didn't eat sushi. He only ate it while apprenticing to understand the freshness while training with observation. But when he came to the States, he only wanted Hambagas...tasted better to him. My point (in a confusing way) is that excellent sushi is all relative. It depends on what you've had before and what you like. It also depends on what the fish buyer can get. The freshest Squid or Eel will never taste good to me because I simply do not like it. I've had lots of Toro, and this one is the best, but next time I go, it probably won't have the same tasting Toro, because I ate the last of that one.  The toro they find might not be as great a quality like tonight's. That being said, it's not the greatest place, it wasn't the worst, it was standard. Fish is fresh, chefs are trained, service is quick.

Reviews.Author: Kate P.
Reviews.Content: I've been here numerous times and what kills it is the service. I don't have to tell you about the amazing fish/food but the service an atmosphere makes me feel rushed. I go here just to eat but when I eat, I prefer to be in good company and Sushi Gen and that concept just doesn't go together. Because it's such a popular place- they whisk you in and whisk you out. You can't seem to just relax and enjoy whats in front of you because there's so much commotion and people in such a small space. But when I'm craving for some good fish, and my friend and I just want to eat, this is the spot.

Reviews.Author: Jose S.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best sushi spot that I have ever been to.  Every place that I go to will be compared to Sushi Gen.  SUPER YUM!!

Reviews.Author: T S.
Reviews.Content: I love their sushi and sashimi.  The cooked dishes are very good as well.  Always fresh and at the right temperature (some places have them too cold).  We will try to go right around the time it opens for dinner so we will have a table without having to wait.

Reviews.Author: Macelle A.
Reviews.Content: Finally tried this place. Ate at the bar on a Saturday Night. Got there earlier to beat the rush and still had to wait 20 minutes. Fish is Fresh. go for it.

Reviews.Author: Dimitri K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is probably the best sushi in Downtown LA.  And that's saying a lot considering all the options in Little Tokyo.  It's a no joke, old-school Japanese sushi house, no rolls, pure nigiri.  If you go to the bar, you're expected to know/appreciate all kinds of fish.  The quality is always superior, and they make your everyday albacore, salmon, tia pieces all taste how they should.  Nothing excessive, just the right amount of ponzu, salt, lemon, etc. to make every piece stand out.  Friendly chefs. Always packed for lunch. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Claire L.
Reviews.Content: Words of the wisdom: Totally Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kent H.
Reviews.Content: I come here for sushi...it's pretty good...come come.

Reviews.Author: Twila B.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short, because a place with over 800 reviews really doesn't need my two cents. Went here for a late lunch last Friday. We knew we were in the right place given the crowd of people all waiting outside for their names to be called. We dined at the sushi bar. I chuckled to myself when the maître d' told us that we could only order sushi at the sushi bar and that each person would have to eat a whopping 4 pieces. Don't worry buddy, that won't be a problem! The sardine sushi was excellent, and perhaps our favorite. The yellowtail, toro, sea urchin, oyster, snapper, and scallops were all fresh and delicious - everything was really good. Just thinking about now makes me wish I could be there for the opening bell!

Reviews.Author: Anonymous P.
Reviews.Content: A step below places like Mori and Zo, particularly with respect to the quality of the sushi rice and the ability of some of the chefs.  However, the quality of the fish is very good, and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Chelle B.
Reviews.Content: 5 enthusiastic stars for their sashimi plate lunch special ... Absolutely love it. Authentic and fresh and delicious.  Plan ahead though as it gets crowded - I believe lunch ends around 2pm ish.

Reviews.Author: Tri D.
Reviews.Content: Fresh high quality fish.  Will make it difficult to go back to eating sushi at other places.  The selection of fish is also fantastic, with fish that is normally not offered at typical sushi bars.

Reviews.Author: Janet C.
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend making reservations!!!!The $15 sashimi lunch here is a great deal! The service is okay... the atmosphere is like any other sushi restaurant! Other than the lunch deal, I'm not sure I'd come here for dinner or pay more for the other dishes

Reviews.Author: James W.
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, the sushi here is excellent.  I don't doubt the other reviewers who state that it's probably some of the freshest sushi in LA.  But the line is simply ridiculous and the prices aren't exactly cheap enough to justify the wait, especially in the evening.  I think this place must have made it into a few mainland china tour guide books, because the line is always about 30-40 deep outside.  Had dinner at the sushi bar once, and yes it was good, but definitely not good enough to justify the 1 hour or so wait we had to endure.  Also at 300 bucks for 3 people it wasn't exactly priced better than most good sushi places in so cal.  We tried to go for lunch on a weekday, showed up about 10 min before they supposedly opened at 11am, line was already about 40-50 people long and they actually opened the doors at 11:20.  The first 30 or so people got seated, it was about another 30min to 1 hour wait for everyone else, we decided it simply wasn't worth the wait.  Essentially if you don't mind paying a few more dollars , you can easily find other sushi places with comparable fish without the ridiculous waits and probably a lot more ambiance. In case any you are thinking of taking a date here, don't, if the the long wait outside the strip mall  doesn't turn her off, I'm sure eating in a well lit room filled with middle aged people won't help you get lucky either.

Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: Nice sushi restaurant. Quality of food and service is exceptionally high. I will be back.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: Pre amble: Not from LA; NorCal...eat a lot of sushi but not '-town' sushi...hosting a business colleague...Very interesting place....definitely not what I expect. ..my guest turned me on to some tastes that I'd never had and throughly enjoyed... four stars....

Reviews.Author: Mina H.
Reviews.Content: delicious. nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Steph L.
Reviews.Content: We went here last night and it was the best sushi we've had in LA thus far.  (Haven't tried every place, so I can't say for sure.)  But I read about this place on Yelp and we finally were able to stop in.  The wait was only about 10 minutes around 9 pm Friday night.  We sat at the sushi bar and had the blue fin, hamachi, kanpachi (amberjack yellowtail), toro, unagi, half beak and shrimp.  Every piece of fish was fresh and delicious, and the sushi chef was great.  We were also there pretty late and watched them scrub everything down (and I mean everything) with bleach and soapy water.  I would come back here any day.

Reviews.Author: Connie K.
Reviews.Content: Fish is amazingly fresh. I'm a big sushi junkie and I've been disappointed by so many restaurants until Sushi Gen. The prices are decent for the quality of the food and although the language barrier is annoying (i asked for wasabi on the side for all the sushi pieces because it's too spicy for my 13 year old sister), the food is still tasty enough to make me craving for more. You have to try the oysters! From the presentation to the actual dish, it is soooo yummy. Oysters, uni, toro, and halibut hit the spot for me!

Reviews.Author: Cathy L.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi was very fresh, but that's all I have tried. The service was mediocre and prices were decent. I heard they have a great lunch special, but have yet to try.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: I gave this place 5-star in terms of the quality and price you can find in L.A.  It's unbeatable!  If you're looking for reasonably priced good-quality-sushi and don't mind the wait time for seating, this is definitely the place to go!

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: Really fresh sashimi, one of the best I've had in LA.  I feel that dinner is better.  Lunch is pretty good too, and you can get a good amount of sashimi for only $15.  I would definitely eat here whenever I visit LA.

Reviews.Author: Ricky C.
Reviews.Content: This place is very good. I'm not a big fan of parking in general in the Little Tokyo area though. Very crowded, and the tables are a bit too close to each other. The food makes up for it though, very fresh, very generous cuts of fish. Must get: Baked Giant Clams (appetizer...comes in a foil pouch). I hear from regulars that it's better to go during lunch. Supposedly same portions as dinner, but at lunch price.

Reviews.Author: Steve J.
Reviews.Content: Lunch costs only half as much as dinner does, but the crowd is always big. It's not as bad as it looks as long as you get there early. The sushi quality and quantity is great. The parking lot is small, so you may have to park on the street and walk over. If the crowd is too big, just go somewhere else. The sushi is indeed very good, but not good enough that you can't just skip waiting and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Steph S.
Reviews.Content: after reading all the reviews on yelp, i was afraid that i would be waiting an hour to get a table!! but surprisingly, i dont think i waited longer than 15 mins! and that was a BIG PLUS for methe sushi bar is the place to be!! my chef was unbelievably funny and friendly...as everyone else on these reviews, yes..the sashimis are to die for! rarely do i order sushi dishes...but i believe it was the eel with avocado sushi roll..and it was sooo good. their rice inside the roll is very tasty and different from all the other regular sushi places. even though my birthday was well over two weeks, the sushi chefs still made me feel very special, brought out complimentary green tea mochi ice cream, and sang to me. sushi/sashimi + sake + dessert = HAPPY :)i will definitely be back!!! :)

Reviews.Author: Graydon A.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi, reasonable prices, lackluster decor.

Reviews.Author: Gregory C.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this restaurant.  The quality of the sushi is outstanding, the atmosphere is warm and busy, and the price is reasonable given the quality of the food in this restaurant.  Try the White Fish in Ponzu Sauce, you will not be disappointed.  The sushi selections are simple, but the quality is above average. More proof that high quality fresh ingredients, prepared well, and presented in a simple manner, is a real treasure. Not much more to say, other than a wonderful dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Al C.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi joints in lala land.  The uni is very creamy and the toro was just excellent.  Also had a fatty yellowtail which was nice.  The kuamoto oysters were really good although very expense.  I think it was like $24 for a half dozen.  I really enjoyed the monk fish liver and they gave us a good amount.  This is not a cheap place but well worth it.  Only downside is the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kelly W.
Reviews.Content: with over 400+ reviews, you probably don't need mines so i'm going to keep this short. this is one of the best sushi restaurants i've been to in la! make sure you order their toro, yellow tail belly and albacore because they were so good. it literally melted in my mouth!

Reviews.Author: Yam Yam C.
Reviews.Content: I am really picky about fish, especially sushi and sashimi.  I would rather not eat sushi than eat mediocre sushi....That being said, one of my favorite joints is Hama - just so you have something to compare this to.Fish quality is good for the price.  I can't complaint about that.  Good selection, good quality and good price.  Service, however, keeps me from going back. Each time I went (total of 3 times just to give it a 2nd and 3rd chance), the host and servers were extremely rude.  The host is a table nazi.  My friend dropped us off to park the car - right in front of the restaurant.  The host refused to give us a table even though I told him my friend was parking and I would order for her.  My friend paked and walked in as he gave the table away.  I had to wait 40 minutes for a table - during lunch!  He didn't even apologize. The servers and hosts treat patrons like crap - I guess they are conceited about their food and don't feel the need to treat people fairly or nicely.  I would never go back to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Rex L.
Reviews.Content: Came for lunch on a Monday around noon. There was no wait and we were seated quickly. Service was fast and food was good. I have been before for dinner but never for lunch. Food was pretty good but not amazing.

Reviews.Author: Staci Y.
Reviews.Content: I hate this place.  It gets 3 stars b/c I'm not a huge sashimi freak but I know if I was, I would appreciate the food a lot more.  (And you can't beat $15 for a huge plate of sashimi!)  BUT we were told the wait was 20-30 mins (do-able) which eventually turned into over an HOUR (not do-able).  My poor little grandma had to sit there waiting to eat for over hour which is NOT cool.  And even more not cool was the lame host dude who kept jerking us around for the last 1/2 hr, telling us repeatedly "We are clearing a table for you right now...".  LAME.  He was so lame, I think the other host dude felt bad & ended up seating us himself, took our order & brought some comp edamame.  (He gets the 3 stars).

Reviews.Author: Ulysses H.
Reviews.Content: I've never been here for dinner so I'm only rating Sushi Gen on my lunch experience which has always been great...now that I think about it I've never ordered anything other than the sashimi platter...but anyway, the sashimi platter for $15 is absolutely fantastic...a HUGE plate of sashimi with 5 or 6 different types of fish that are all fresh and delicious...There are alot of sushi places in LA but you won't find that kind of value anywhere else...There can be a bit of a wait but it's definitely worth it...

Reviews.Author: Jeannie J.
Reviews.Content: My mouth waters every time I think back to my meal at Sushi Gen about a week ago.   Everything was fresh and tasty!  Even though this place is pricey, you do get what you pay for.  We had maybe a dozen or so orders (I lost count after the 5th one though!), sake, and tea and the bill came out to be about $150 before tip.  The monkfish liver was esp memorable!  If you can, try to get a seat at the bar.  I like telling the sushi chef directly what I want.  I also like to leave some orders up to him.   As others mentioned, be prepared to wait!  When we left around 9pm on a weeknight, there were still tons of people outside waiting!  This place truly lives up to the hype.  I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Danielle D.
Reviews.Content: I had a great dinner here with a friend last night, we reminisced about other fab meals we'd shared at sushi gen in the past. mmm. sushi gen is amazing for high quality fish and good service. Sit at the bar. Don't bother asking what things cost (really? If you're out to eat sushi, don't let the cost deter you ever). Order the hamachi-kama, which is the best broiled hamachi collar you will ever eat. So buttery and delicious. Spanish mackerel with their green yuzu sauce (which they'll put on scallops if you ask), heaven. go. bring your mom.

Reviews.Author: Debbie P.
Reviews.Content: I use to come here for their sushi lunch special as it was a great deal for what you got. Unfortunately due to its popularity the wait has become ridiculous and the quality of the fish has thus deteriorated as well.

Reviews.Author: Gary I.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely a true sushi place. It's been here for more than 30 years. The sushi is fresh and the service is great. The trouble with this place is that the parking sucks and there's a long wait time. The sweet shrimp was delicious and we had the tails deep fried. AMAZING!! I had sea urchin once and it was disgusting. My co worker recommended their sea urchin to me so I decided to try it and it was delicious. The texture was gooey but it was unusually sweet and very tasty. If you want real Japanese sushi, send your friends here.

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch here on March 22 and had been a few times several years ago.  What can I even add to the 600+ reviews here?  Sushi Gen is amazing.  AMAZING.

Reviews.Author: Vincent C.
Reviews.Content: We waited about 45 mins on Sat night but still think it's worth the wait.  We ordered a monfish liver and the sashimi deluxe in which the portion is large enough for two people.  I like the sashimi a lot as they were very fresh.  Best sashimi I've eaten in LA so far.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: Damn I love this place. The atmosphere is too bright, the service is nothing spectacular, and they close too early. But the sushi is melt-in-the-mouth, like-buttah delicious. I can always tell a good sushi place by how tender the salmon is and SG has the best, most tender salmon ever. I'm happy to sit at the bar and let the sushi chefs deliver piece after piece of fantastic fish. This place has simply the best sushi I've eaten in LA.

Reviews.Author: Louis R.
Reviews.Content: Amazing sushi, #1 in Downtown. You have to wait, but it's worth it for the food. Downsides for the picking peeps are that have to wait or find parking, well that's L.A. for you.

Reviews.Author: Melanie Z.
Reviews.Content: They have a great Sashimi combination lunch plate for a great price! I couldn't even finish the whole thing in one sitting! A great value! :) But you have to arrive early since there's usually a wait outside the door when you arrive (unless you're the first one there!).

Reviews.Author: Tobi L.
Reviews.Content: We visited Sushi Gen because of the great reviews on yelp. We went during a weekday around 6pm(they just opened) and it was already crowded. Me and my husband did the omakase at the sushi bar. We also ordered 2 glasses of house red wine. The bill came out to be about $180, not including gratuity yet. Wow, I normally don't do omekase, didn't really know how expensive it can be But I must tell you, the sushi was great, nothing that we would normally order. It was so fresh and succulent. It's definitely a great splurge.

Reviews.Author: Noel P.
Reviews.Content: I would say one of the best sushi place in little Tokyo.  Reasonable price for fresh sashimi, very authentic!  I suggest to get there before 11 am mon-thurs and half hour on Fridays before they open.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: Waited to eat at this restaurant for 30 minutes, which isn't THAT bad. After reading all the great reviews, I was ready to be blown away but everything was very standard. We thought the toro was going to be fresh but it had the stringy/tough white part that just had to be removed before eating the fish. The albacore was tough and not impressive. The Uni only came in a whole box, which was too much for my party of three to handle so we just skipped out on it. This place had fresh fish but nothing made it stand out and i don't think it was worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: helen k.
Reviews.Content: wow, best sushi i've had! the toro, tuna, and salmon just melts in your mouth! spicy tuna handroll was awesome too. i tried a bunch of other stuff that i can't remember the names of but everything was good. just be sure you try the toro!i sat at the bar and the customer service was great. definitely one of my new fave spots, can't believe i haven't checked this place out before!

Reviews.Author: S. L.
Reviews.Content: Best Sushi in LA.

Reviews.Author: Tim Y.
Reviews.Content: I sat at the sushi bar and had the chef choose everything. I had some nice toro, yellowtail, sea urchin (not my favorite but I hear it's the freshest here) and a variety of other sashimi. Everything tasted very fresh and the bill was about $55 for 5 different items. Pretty steep but the line out the door suggests I was right to come here. I'll be back but will try some other non-sashimi items. Long wait all the time so be prepared to stand outside for awhile. It's in the run-down Honda Center strip mall so don't expect anything nice in terms of vibe though the inside is just fine.

Reviews.Author: Jennie V.
Reviews.Content: i love the lunch special...a little bit of wait (everyone in your party has to b present in order to be seated) but soo worth the wait...u can only get lunch menu at the tables...

Reviews.Author: Ellen K.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I ever tasted. So fresh and delicious. My BF and I just stumbled in and never been in here. What a great find. We came in on a Monday; the slowest day of the week and still busy!. We spent $200 for two people. We ate good!

Reviews.Author: Jason Y.
Reviews.Content: Easily my favorite sushi spot in the area.  The wait is pretty bad, but it's kind of worth it.  It's not one of those fancy places you'd take a date either.  Basically, it's for serious sushi eaters.  So yeah if you're not serious about sushi, go to Kabuki or something.  Try the toro.

Reviews.Author: Jinny H.
Reviews.Content: Favorite sushi place in So Cal now.  Took my mom here for dinner on her birthday.  Didn't make reservations but got seated in a reasonable time (20-25 minutes) at 6pm on a Saturday.  Ordered the sashimi platter - their fish is truly fresh and high quality.  The toro was my favorite along with the yellowtail and Japanese red snapper.  The service was pleasant with our Japanese lady that was quite good in recommending dishes and refiling our tea.  So tempted to skip work one day and go for lunch (for a cheaper price :P).

Reviews.Author: Vee H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a regular for me! Fresh and great tasting all the time!

Reviews.Author: Nicole K.
Reviews.Content: So delicioussssss. got there early for lunch and there were already people lining up, now i know why.

Reviews.Author: Tony M.
Reviews.Content: They are not messing around over here this sushi is LEGIT. Very good sushi, lots of options, definitely an  impressive place especially for the sushi purest. The only bad thing as that if you eat here prepare to drop some cash because this place is very pricey, but in my opinion its one of the few places that's actually worth it.

Reviews.Author: Erica C.
Reviews.Content: came here with my mother for lunch on a tuesday around 11:30am. we thought that since it was pretty early, there would probably be not be many people waiting to eat but when we got there it was VERY crowded and for a party of two, we waited for 40min. i feel like the wait is the only downside to this placeparking is very practical. the plaza where sushi gen is has its own parking lot and upon entering, u take a ticket and wait for a spot. since this little plaza consists of many restaurants, people are constantly leaving and arriving so its not difficult to land a parking spot. REMEMBER TO GET YOUR TICKET VALIDATED! ($2 with validation, not bad at all)my mom ordered the lunch special chicken teriyaki & sashimi combo ($14) and i had the lunch special sashimi ($15), both were YUUUMMMYY (: !! $15 for the amount of sashimi i got was DEFFFFIIINITELY worth it AND it lived up to all the hype. and if u want more rice, they offer free refills which is a plus.

Reviews.Author: Joyce Y.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi for a great lunch price!Finally got to try Sushi-Gen.  I went way early since I wasn't sure how traffic and parking would be.  I was also waiting for a friend.  She was running late so even though I was the first one there, they don't seat you until the entire party is there.  We waited about a half hour before we got seats.We both got the chirashi bowl for $15.  Delicious, fresh sushi!  Yum.  I would love to come back again and try the sashimi lunch plate and the sushi deluxe.  Chirashi bowl had a great mixture of fresh fish, salty and sweet flavors coming from the fish, rice, ginger (and I normally don't like ginger), egg, etc.Service was friendly but a little slow.  They didn't come by to check up on us or refill our water.Park in the Honda plaza.  If you eat here, they will validate your parking, which is $2, for first two hours.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Awesome fish. Perfect rice. Nothing like it in the Bay Area...

Reviews.Author: Nicolo R.
Reviews.Content: The OG sushi in LA. I come here once to twice a week for lunch and absolutely love it. A California roll, yellowtail, tuna, freshwater eel, and king crab sushi with green tea. Probably my favorite meal ever.

Reviews.Author: Andrea C.
Reviews.Content: Best teriyaki chicken I've every had.  #1 sushi place for my husband.  My boy loves eating here too.

Reviews.Author: Annie S.
Reviews.Content: never disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Amy G.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep it short and sweet! This place is awesome! Food is fresh- EVERY SINGLE TIME!! And I eat here 2-3 a month! It's causal place- but it's always packed with people who are waiting to be seated! I never sit at the tables- because I'm not a fan of the menu that's only for table seating! Take it from me- sit at the bar- and ask the chefs what's the special and freshest fish and he will take care of you!!!

Reviews.Author: Andrew N.
Reviews.Content: Got the chirashi (sashimi over rice) and an order of uni (sea urchin) for take out. Very fresh, decently priced. However, always seems to be a long line and not open on Sundays. Also, very traditional Japanese, not a big variety of rolls or fusion food.

Reviews.Author: Stephan H.
Reviews.Content: Positives:  Fresh Fish.negatives: Ok, So the Sushi place  we really wanted to go to tonight was closed (Komasa)) :(.  so my husband and I decided to try a new place. After reading reviews and ratings we both agreed on Sushi Gen right down the street. Well let me tell you. Poor choice. Yes the fish was fresh, but for the money the quantity and the choice of fish you get was not up to standards as our favorite place (Komasa's) down the street. First of all the size of the sashimi was quite small as what we are use too, and the choice of sashimi, well that is not an option. You order a sashimi plate and you get what ever the chefs choice is for the night . So if you have your heart set on the kinds of fresh sashimi you want or like, then don't come here . If you like someone else to pick your full sashimi dinner then this place is for you. Just beware that most of your dinner will be cooked salmon, rubbery octopus, cooked crab amongst other rubbery crunchy slimy fish and other side things that you don't know what it is as well. Oh and ginger... Well if you like ginger, just know that this is another extra charge. Service i must add was very poor,  the server was too over whelmed and very hard to understand as well. So if you like good fresh sashimi or sushi for that matter and want to order just what you like and like good quantity as well as quality. Then drive a quarter block down the street to Komasa's and I promise you, you will not regret it. The best quantity quality and freshest Sushi place ever for the price by far. Service is outstanding as well :) P.S we sat at a table. Maybe the bar would have been a better choice?

Reviews.Author: E G.
Reviews.Content: whenever i'm in town this is my favorite place to stop by for some sushi!!! yummy!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence F.
Reviews.Content: I have yet to be disappointed by this place.

Reviews.Author: Ranee L.
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite Japanese restaurant. The sashimi is so fresh I don't think you'll find any sushi better than here. Their sashimi specials are worth every penny (lunch or dinner). Their rice is cooked to perfection! individual rice, tender texture, and just beautiful. Their miso soups are excellent as well (with clams, shrimp, mushroom or tofu)The only con, they take reservations one week in advance. and they open on 5pm on weekends and 5:30 on weekdays. (just in case you want to get in line before they open :p )Highly recommend their sashimi/sashimi deluxe. i dont think their dinner combo's are worth it as much....

Reviews.Author: Yum Yum D.
Reviews.Content: Just as everyone claims, this place is as good and authentic as it gets.  I waited in a line of about 20 people for lunch, and it was worth the wait.  The tuna and salmon were like butta.  One of the best I've ever had.  I had the sashimi plate and everything, I mean everything, was perfect... right down to the salad and miso soup.  Oh and the green tea was fragrant and green like I've never had before (random, but true).  I like rolls, but if you're a strict sushi-lover, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Angela E.
Reviews.Content: first let's say this place is located on EAST 2nd st.  we had the hardest time finding the place.right when you walk in the smell of fish takes over. at this point you know its different from your regular sushi spots.the sushi chef we had (did not get his name) was great! very nice and accommodating to us first-timers. DO: - get the plum wine. - try the spicy scallop, japanese mackrel, and monkfish liver. - expect to spend at LEAST $40 for a meal that tastes amazing- probably the freshest fish i've ever had.DON'T: - expect any of your regular rolls (i.e., anything with tempura, mayo, etc.). - come hungry.. you won't leave happy.overall a great sushi spot if you wanna have fresh fish and good conversation.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I've been going there for years.  By far the best sushi place I've ever been to.  The decor is nothing to rave about but the quality and freshness of the fish is amazing.  Only minor drawback is the long wait and you have to pay for parking.  I thought their service were adequate.  They may be a bit understaffed when they're busy but the waitresses were always friendly.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: This place is dope, except the lines and the bill.  They know they're da sh-t and they let you feel it, you feel me?  I can't complain about nuthin', but the bill.  It was as traditional and good as traditional nigiri sushi gets.  They're so busy that there's no real personal touch and there's not a lot talking or socializing the chef do with their patrons, except the usual drinking.  I give this place a 4 star on value, and a five star on straight quality and delivery, once you get in.  I had a ticket (RSVP) to get it, so I didn't have no problems.  Plus, I was packin'.  Just get a reservation in so you don't have to resort to violence.

Reviews.Author: X R.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen is legit. When I take the train up from SD, sometimes my gf and I will stop in here for a quick sushi fix in Little Tokyo. Such a random little spot in that little strip mall with a bunch of Japanese restaurants surrounding but this place stands out. Even the lot attendant makes the mistake of asking if we're going to Sushi-Gen and then corrects himself. Fish is always super fresh and tasty. Usually pretty crowded with a short wait. Love the uni w quail egg. A lot of times we'll look over to the people next to us and have sudden urges to order whatever it is wondering, "How do I even order that?!"
Reviews.Author_Location: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Mark P.
Reviews.Content: The fish is fresh and the nigiri is made with the perfect amount of rice. The uni is high grade but to be honest, it doesn't go above and beyond the typical traditional sushi joint. There's no niche or anything that propels it beyond anything more than old school. But then again... that might be the beauty of it.

Reviews.Author: Colleen C.
Reviews.Content: sashimi combo was super fresh and delicious, full of flavortempura was delicious, not too heavyservice was excellenttry to make reservations those 2 dishes and 1 beer cost about $70 with tax/tip.totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: wsl l.
Reviews.Content: So I came here on the first night after landing into LA. Friends of mine took me here last Wed night. It was just the 3 of us and we feasted!! We ordered the sashimi deluxe which was absolutely fantastic. I think the assortment really depends on the day you go. Hit or miss. I don't really like ordering chefs choice of assorted anything.. but my friends advised that it is really well worth it. The assortment of the sashimi deluxe was awesome. We got some toro, tuna, yellowtail, ika and salmon. Not to mention the tuna tartare(both in regular and spicy) We also got the sushi deluxe- that was sad and I was not impressed and it was smaller than the sashimi delux. I had asked the waitress if they had grilled chicken gizzard, and they said yes- they came back with pieces of fried chicken- don't ask. Wanted to return that but the friend had already dived in to it. We also got miso soups which were pretty good- not the heavy and powdery stuff. Also ordered shrimp and vegi tempura which was alright. Including the 2 bottles of sake we ordered I think the bill came out to be $175. Since I had a good experience here and it was the only sushi joint I knew of, I took my cousin here last Sat. It was just the 2 of us and we got there around 9pm. It was packed, but we didn't have to wait. We ordered the sashimi deluxe - and I was soo disappointed. I never stuffed myself with so much tuna! That's all there was and like 3 pieces of salmon!!! Fresh, yes- assortment BAD!! We also ordered the grilled smelt fish which was sad. I've had much better in NYC. We also got an order of uni - thank goodness I was happy with uni.. ohh.. yummy uni.. Anyway, would I go back again? Maybe on a week night. Would I give the sashimi deluxe another shot?? yes, but on a weeknight- What about a weekday? No - order a' la cart

Reviews.Author: Sophie S.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is a delight if you are into sashimi. Plain and simple. Between two people, we ordered the Sushi deluxe and with two sides of rice. The deluxe has an assortment of everything ( seaweed, meshed spicy tuna, salmon skin  and the sashimi ( yellowtail, toro, tuna , salmon) are super soft. They melt in your mouth!! I give 4 stars for the sushi. Now the reason for it being a 3 star... The wait is way too long especially if you go during dinner time. I like walking into a restaurant and being seated within the next 20 - 30 minutes. Any where that you have to wait longer than that, sends my appetite away. We had to wait an hour until we got seated and it wasn't even a weekend. Also, some of the host at the front is not very friendly, nor the waitresses. They are so busy that you have to repeatedly ask for your request and when asked, they seem annoyed giving us short answers. Toshi in Studio City is still my favorite!

Reviews.Author: Dan R.
Reviews.Content: The Sushi was really good. Very fresh and delicious. Very traditional. I do love the creative sushi with the various rolls and sushi dishes, which this place does not have. If you are of this sort too, then you will be coming away missing something...

Reviews.Author: PJ M.
Reviews.Content: Maybe i went on a bad night? But even still, a bad night at my Miki's in A-squared would be about 7 times better....so....i mean, great sushi makes you freak out a little. This limited, frankly- boring menu was on the expensive side esp considering it's ho-hum factor. I don't mind paying those prices when your eyes go wide and the freshness awakens your palate and excites your mind- but NONE of that is happenin' here. Again I ask- does LA even KNOW GOOD SUSHI? Cuz I'm getting desperate here...I might try it again EXCEPT that I have eaten at SO MANY places in LA that people rave about only to be so disappointed! And PS, lots of Asian people in a restaurant is NOT a guarantee that it is good.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie P.
Reviews.Content: Heard the raves from my coworkers and decided to finally give it a try. Had their most popular Sashimi Delux that came with miso soup, tofu and pickled cucumber. The miso soup was pretty typical, but the tofu was nicely simmered in the soy sauce. Very savory. The sashimi plate was plentiful and full of varieties that included: spicy tuna, albacore, yellowtale, crab meat, cuttlefish, octopus and toro. The food was more than enough and the quality of the fish was better than most, although I found the albacore to be a bit grainy.

Reviews.Author: marisa o.
Reviews.Content: With places like this that have so many reviews and such high ratings, I always feel like it doesn't matter whether or not I add in my two cents.  But I love to yelp when I'm hungry, and boy, am I hungry.The bf and I got here about 5ish mins before our reservations, checked in, and waited outside with the other 15+ish people waiting for a table.  About 15-20 mins go by without being called, so the bf goes inside to check what's taking so long.  Turns out, the guy forgot about us (I know, I know, Marisa- why are you still giving them 5 stars?  Let me explain)!  So he profusely apologizes and gives us the next available seating.  We order the shrimp tempura, soft shell crab, and the dinner sashimi plate.  When we were ordering our drinks, the host came and told our waitress the sake was on HIM, because he felt so bad about forgetting about us.  Talk about awesome- especially in such a crowded restaurant, he really didn't have to do that.  So a big thank you to the host!  Anyway, food was great, super fresh, super delish.  You can read about the delishiousness from all the sushi connoisseurs.   Great place, great peeps, great spooshi.

Reviews.Author: michele p.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME sushi but the wait was not fun...

Reviews.Author: sunny minh n.
Reviews.Content: does anyone know how to put in half stars? because they really deserve a 3.5 rating.i've been going to sushi gen for a couple years now.to summarize:-above average sushi-wonderful service (the japanese women there are so sweet!)-hiro, the lunchtime host, is awesome (call in and he'll save you a table!)the big sell at sushi-gen is their unmatched lunch special. i've skipped my noon classes just to make it.

Reviews.Author: jen b.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of raw fish... (mind out of the gutters you pervs) and I must say the fish here was fresh, the waiters friendly and extremely helpful... not to mention not too bad to look at; although they looked about the age of 18... way too young for my blood. I would definitely revist during happy hour. The only downside would be the creepy garage that you have to park in and the perfume of rancid pee as you walk towards the restaurant. Other than that... it's a go for me!

Reviews.Author: Uh N.
Reviews.Content: This is place is my favorite sushi restaurant. In fact, I cannot eat sushi anywhere else now. Sushi Gen has top quality fish and everything tastes just amazing!

Reviews.Author: Nadia A.
Reviews.Content: Really fresh, delicate, yummy fish in a casual, un-intimidating enviroment. We sat at the sushi bar and did a mini-omakase...just let the chef choose some sushi for us, but not a ton. Still ended up being a bit pricier than I expected for the amt of fish, but great service and really really fresh and delicious fish. I'm still obsessed with sushi-sushi in beverly hills, so this wasn't as amazing as that...but def. great sushi in the downtown area.

Reviews.Author: Daisy S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a sushi snob but I think this was the best sushi I've ever had.  The octopus sunomono was lovely; so was the fried tofu and the steamed clams in a gorgeous, gingery broth.  We couldn't try my favorite tamago because of a recent egg recall (they were just being cautious), but I really liked everything else.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.  We'd made a reservation for which we were 8 minutes late.  We waited another 5 or so and then they seated us.  I told them our party of 4 was complete even though one of us was still on the way.  It's not cheap of course.  It was crowded and a bit noisy but since we ate kind of late, it emptied out and quieted down.  I'll go back eagerly.

Reviews.Author: Jim S.
Reviews.Content: Best. Lunch. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Ryan L.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I've ever had in Los Angeles! I am going to eat there tonight and am very excited about this.

Reviews.Author: Nick T.
Reviews.Content: Best fish in LA. Come before six on weekends or you will have to wait 30 minutes or more. Great service and fair prices.

Reviews.Author: Sarmen A.
Reviews.Content: If you're serious about sushi you need to frequent this spot. It does not get any better or fresher than this. Expect a very long wait when it is busy. You have better odds if you choose to sit at the bar, just keep in mind the bar is a la carte only.

Reviews.Author: Bailey C.
Reviews.Content: The cuts of sushi are awesome - probably the best in Southern California ...but that's pretty much it ...wasn't that impressed for the price!

Reviews.Author: Yun L.
Reviews.Content: A+ - Best price, good sashimi/ combination food quality & generous serving size all the time.  The only kick is the wait.  Strongly recommended to come before 1115am for lunch and 630pm for dinner to beat the line.

Reviews.Author: Lorena D.
Reviews.Content: Super fresh, super awesome. This is my favorite sushi place of all time. Can't touch the Spanish mackerel here, and the sashimi is *always* delicious and fresh and melt-in-your-mouth goodness. During prime time, it will be a bit of a wait, but if you come for an early dinner, you'll be pleasantly surprised at the speed with which you are seated. Some street parking, and there's also a garage right across the street.

Reviews.Author: Nadiyah S.
Reviews.Content: Came back for the lunch sashimi plate.  We thought they opened at 11:30 but it turns out they actually open at 11-11:15.  Make sure to be early and not on time!  There is ALWAYS a line, but their service is great and they are very quick and efficient with getting patrons in and out.  Sushi Gen is by far the best value lunch special ever.  The fish is sooooo goooood!

Reviews.Author: Ed M.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is where you go when you want to dress up the sushi bar experience! The ambiance is nice, but the wait is a bitch! The restaurant is pricey for a high quality sushi bar, but the food is of the highest quality. Shockingly, the variety of seafood is limited. With that said, there are better deals around town. Oomasa in Little Tokyo has more personality, even though the ambiance isn't as sexy!

Reviews.Author: Tony C.
Reviews.Content: I went for dinner around 6pm and had to wait about an hour for a table for two. I had the Sushi Combo Deluxe, and it was very tasty. Everything tasted fresh. My friend had the Sashimi Deluxe and she very much enjoyed it as well. The presentation was nice. The only downfall was the lack of hospitality of the hosts and the so-so service of our waitress. I wouldn't go here all the time for sushi since it is quite expensive, but I am glad I got to try it out.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: sushi so fresh it literally melts in your mouth...i love their scallops! the scallops were so deliciously fresh with a subtle sweetness as its suppose to bebut I would forgo the octopus, i was not impressedi personally would not order the rolls, not that it's not good, but I rather fill my tummy with nigiri

Reviews.Author: Annie L.
Reviews.Content: Great fresh sushi! Ordered to go on our way to the Greek theater so didn't get the full effect but will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Adelaide H.
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Japan in Sept 2011, since we were toured around by locals while there, its been hard contemplating thinking of having sushi again stateside. Saw the reviews and decided to give this place a try, glad we did. We got there at 11am under the impression that they open at that time, was greeted by a long line and an opening time of 11:15am. Sat at the sushi bar and gave the sushi chef carte blanche, our only request was the toro and sweet shrimp with the fried head, everything he served us was magic, from the makarel to the snapper to the urchin. The sushi here rivals that in Japan, a little smaller in portion but not in flavor and sheer delishiousness. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Janet G.
Reviews.Content: Freshest sashimi ever. You can't go wrong with Sushi Gen. If you are looking for a california roll don't go here. Go waste your money somewhere else. SG is by far the best sushi restaurant this side of the Mississippi.

Reviews.Author: Lyn F.
Reviews.Content: Love their sashimi here :)

Reviews.Author: John A.
Reviews.Content: This place is the BEST...period. I am the biggest sushi snob ever and trust me when I tell you folks that this place is the real deal!!!!  When you sit at the sushi bar, talk to the guys and just order whatever is fresh. The live items will blow your mind away.

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: please don't go to Sushi Gen in little tokyo, this is my real story and not a bit of exaggeration!!! this is the first time i went to sushi Gen today.  i got stuck on freeway unexpectedly to meet friends at sushi Gen for lunch. got there 25 mins late, the manager came to the table and yelled at me when i tried to order something while my friends already eating lunch. he said that i shouldn't walk into the restaurant late as others are waiting for an hour outside, i explained that i hit into a bad traffic and drove for 1 hour and 45 mins to get there. he said not allow me to order, my friend said how about i could share their food if he gave me a pair of chopsticks, he yelled with no with anger. then we asked if i could order to go, he said i should go outside to wait in line for it. i was stun and confused at first, so friends had to rush eating and go to somewhere else with me to let me have a bite. i was furious when i walked out of the restaurant, my friends only spent 30 mins there and i was there for 5 mins.  he simply said it was their rule. what kind of rule is it??? i was so traumatized and had a huge headache and my blood press was up so high. he came to the table and yelled at me as i just sat down to order, this is the first time i went there. i had no idea what was going on.  i was late for 25 mins due to the heavy traffic!!! drove from thousand oaks to little tokyo to have lunch with friends who live in Temple city. then i talked to quite bit people in the area afterwards as i still didn't know what went wrong, they all told me that they know that manager who has been real mean to people. then i texted to my friends and they all told me that they had bad experience with this manager.  i don't understand how people can put up with this kind of attitude. the manager can explain the rule nicely, stormed to the table to yell at me when i just sat in with my friends. i don't even know whatever rule they have there! it was very abusive!!! i got bleeding nose after i came home, my blood pressure went up as i was so humiliated in the public and not mention i was starving and stressed being stuck on the freeway for so long. i am still shaking while i am writing this review, i never complained about any place in yelp before, i have to register in yelp to do so.

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I feel like top notch sushi place. This is the place for sushi lover. Been here so many times and I usually sit at the sushi bar.  Fish are always fresh here but the rolls don't have a lot of varieties. It's more like traditional Japanese sushi style. Little bit expensive but you get what you pay for tho.

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: Do they charge you for everything?  Yes, for almost everything including extra ginger to go with your sushi. They charge you for anything extra. Is it worth the wait? Sushi Gen was good back in 90's.  Not sure what happened, but it's not worth the wait or the cost. But I want some sushi! Where should I go?  Instead, go to Sushi Komasa.  It's small, affordable, and cares a lot about its quality.

Reviews.Author: akzidenz g.
Reviews.Content: ive never really been to a "best" sushi place, but if someone pointed a gun to my head and made me pick, it would be this one.the sashimi here is really fresh. my friend and i ordered this ginormous platter of only sashimi and it was delicious, but we were regrettin it. after eating about 25 pieces of sashimi and no rice, you kind of start to feel sick. (so order some other stuff.) by the end of the nite, we felt like we had turned into fish.

Reviews.Author: Ells L.
Reviews.Content: I don't think I need to go into detaisl to describe how good this place is. Excellent Toro and white tuna sushi. Waiting time is definitely too long but if you are a  party of two, you're more likely to get a seat faster.

Reviews.Author: T T.
Reviews.Content: The lunch specials are quite possibly the best deals in L.A. for fresh fish. Even though I love the weird and wacky rolls, the sushi here is straight forward and simple and it's the freshness that keeps me coming back...that and the salmon collar special where you get little mounds of various edibles in addition to your fish.
