Sure, there are  a jillion sushi places, but I've never had sashimi or sushi from Sushi Gen that tasted and smelled too fishy, like today's lunch at random sushi restaurant .

Reviews.Author: Tracy Y.
Reviews.Content: Well, Tatsu made me feel like an idiot and I will do my part and save you from the embarrassment and verbal lashing that he inflicts to all dumbasses like me. At the sushi bar, "THEY DO NOT HAVE ROLLS. FRESH FISH, THEY HAVE. IF YOU WANT ROLLS, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!" It's a lie. They have some rolls. Nothing noteworthy though.Yep. Arrogant asshole. Just askin'. Anyhow, the fish is spectacular and like all great sushi places, there's a wait. A long wait.Good luck with Tatsu and send him big fat kisses from me.

Reviews.Author: Timothy L.
Reviews.Content: All about value.I've ordered toro sushi at another lower class restaurant listed at "market price". It cost $25.I ordered it here and two pieces cost $8.The fish is extremely fresh. The first time I went here, I have never had fresh sushi. I was completely blown away and every place that has sushi and those dragon rolls don't even compare even more. Don't get me wrong, a good spider roll is still welcome in my tummy. But now when I eat tuna, salmon, etc., I just keep thinking, I wish I was eating at Sushi Gen.I got the $35 Sashimi Deluxe which is an amazing bargain for the types of freshness of the fish. I finished it the first time. And I shared it with my friend the second time.Lunch is even better. $14 gets you a decent sized sashimi lunch. Just enough to leave you satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Mr. T's Mohawk J.
Reviews.Content: Nestled in a downtown funky little strip mall called Honda Square, it's no wonder there was already a line to get in. We put our name on the list and only had to wait 15 minutes on a Saturday night at 8. All of the food was incredibly fresh and well-presented. Service and hospitality was impeccable. We kept our order simple: Miso soup, edamame, spicy tuna rolls, baked clam & mushroom, fried calamari, salmon skin salad and two bottles of hot saki. We got out of there for under $50 which is the deal of the century.

Reviews.Author: Jean S.
Reviews.Content: yum yum yum. That is all I have to say. my bf and i sat at the bar and ordered tons of sushi and beer. It was SOOO delicious. the Sushi chef was super nice and interacted with us while we ate. He recommended different fish, rolls, and items on the menu and it all turned out to be delicious! We ordered only sushi items...toro roll was great! salmon, halibut, octopus, yellowtail, fatty yellowtail.. etc... it was all good. the fish was really great quality, in fact, I'd have to say that it's better than anywhere else we've been in LA... We saw the oysters on the half shells that looked really good but we were stuffed from all the other fish so we decided that we would go back another day!

Reviews.Author: W K.
Reviews.Content: I never understand (unless it's the quest for good atmosphere) why people pay hundreds of dollars to go to R23.  Wow-this is the real deal.  Real sushi, real service, and really good prices.  $65 and you get plenty of eats, drinks, and a nice time for two.  Atmosphere is pretty typical (borderline obnoxious lighting.  Damn title 24 and flourescent lighting! ) They should get a gander at OOMASA, a restaurant with plenty of cushy booths that make you want to completely stuff and drink yourself to death!  Other than that, this place is the real rock-n-roll sushi...well, not really...which is why it's so good.

Reviews.Author: Lucky M.
Reviews.Content: In spite of the Sushi Nazi host and the weak service, Sushi Gen is still a great place for sushi.  The sushi nazi sternly told us if we wanted to sit at the sushi bar, we had better order at least 4 orders of sushi EACH and you CANNOT order any sets!   Do you still want to sit there??!!  yes....I replied meekly.  When we were finally seated at a table he did not give us menus. We had to ask several times to order, but when the food finally arrived, I remember why we always come back.  The fish is so fresh and so DELICIOUS!  So I guess I'll be a sushi martyr...

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: I came here the first time on a weekday for lunch and was impressed with the freshness of the sashimi pieces.  So my friend and I decided to eat here on a Saturday.  I think we both ordered the sashimi plate and this time, the sushi was kind of bleh.  The pieces seemed small and brownish, not very fresh looking or tasting.  Service was good both times.

Reviews.Author: Nonya B.
Reviews.Content: Just had dinner here again with the husband and they just knocked our socks off with the food and service. Phenomenal!

Reviews.Author: Amanda E.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I have been to in Los Angeles. The fish is super fresh, the star of the show, which is what a real sushi place is all about! No rolls here stuffed with imitation crab, tempura shrimp, and lathered in japanese mayo and sauces. My dad and I ordered the sashimi deluxe, sea urchin with quail egg, spanish mackeral, and yellow tail. Everything was delicious. The highlights were the toro, yellow tail, salmon, and sea urchin. Everything was so fresh that it tasted smooth and buttery. Mmmm...I could eat it everyday! I can't wait to go back for their lunch specials. They sound awesome as well! Thanks May W. for turning me onto this place :)

Reviews.Author: Brie L.
Reviews.Content: Overall:great value and AWESOME sashimi!Food:I had the sashimi lunch... extremely fresh fish, generous portions.  On my plate were 3 pieces each of maguro and hamachi, probalby 6 pieces of bluefin, 1 piece of sweet dried pork, 1 piece of cooked salmon, a vegetable, cooked squid, 1 scoop of seasoned maguro and 1 scoop of spicy tuna... all in addition to a bowl of rice, tsukemono, hot tofu and miso soup... all for $15.  We also ordered a side of toro nigiri sushi... this is possibly the best fish i have ever tasted... it was like butter.  I've had torro at other restaurants but this was cut very well and was very fresh.  Service:they are friendly, adequately attentive, but very busy.Location/Ambience:A typical Japanese restaurant, decorated appropriately.  Parking in the Honda center lot was $1.50 for lunch. It got a little crowded, so I recommend goin gearly.

Reviews.Author: Duchess T.
Reviews.Content: I'm always asked where you can find a sushi restaurant with skilled chefs (or itamaes).  I can't think of anywhere else in LA but Sushi Gen for having experienced sushi chefs who, combined, have over 100 years of experience.  For the quality of fish and artistry and skills possessed by the chefs, the price is more than reasonable... and the wait should be expected.  If you want cheap, fast, and so-so sushi, you're in the wrong place.

Reviews.Author: Celeb S.
Reviews.Content: SUSHI-GEN has to be one the top list for my sushi,SUSHI-GEN respects the fish that they serve,their fish is so fresh....I'd recommend.

Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place 5 stars but, the line is always ridiculous when I go here.  The fish quality is 5 stars hands down.  Now, this is probably the priciest place in J town but, it's well worth the wait.  Price point is another story though. There are comparable places in the area that get close to the quality of fish here at maybe 1/2 the price.  But, if money isn't an issue, and you value quality sushi, Sushi Gen is something that you would want to try.  All sashimi here shines especially the toro and yellowtail.  This place will be your standard to which you judge all your sushi from now on. LOL

Reviews.Author: Alisu C.
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best sushi/sashimi places I have found in LA!  Love the quality of the fish, nice large slices, and great variety.  And, if you are an UNI lover like myself, this is the place to get it!  Melts in your mouth! Be prepared to wait for a table but so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jasmine A.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten at a number of Japanese restaurants, but Sushi Gen by far stands out as one of the best I've ever eaten at. The sashimi is OUTSTANDING, the tempura is perfectly crunchy, and although the dishes are on the pricier side, the quality of the food more than makes up for it. This is also a great place for an informal date.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy K.
Reviews.Content: $450 for a party of 6 (not including the 20% tip).  I recently had the pleasure of eating at Sushi Zo.  When I told a friend that the experience there set a new standard of fine sushi dining for me, he mentioned that Sushi Gen was just as good and not as expensive.  I must admit that ounce per ounce of raw fish, Sushi Gen was cheaper.  But I could not help comparing the tenderness of the fish at Gen to that of Zo, the latter being significantly more tender.  Even Zo's mackerel, a fish that I usually detest, was surprisingly delicious.  Whereas our party of six left three pieces of it and did not even ask our server to box that with the rest of the leftovers.Oh, and, don't order the beef terriyaki dinner.  $24 for miso soup, six strips of beef, and a mess of a salad isn't even worth being filler food.

Reviews.Author: Nej C.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fish - plain and simple and good. However, this was one of the most lackluster Omakase experiences I've ever had. My best friend and I weren't served any particularly unique types of fish and the atmosphere was very rush people in and rush them out. I've been having Omakase at a different sushi restaurant about once a month for almost a year with my best friend and this was a very "eh" kind of experience. I did enjoy that we got a good amount of fresh fish and it was well crafted, but the itamae didn't seem to put too much concern into the order in which our sushi was given. I wanted to give 3.5 stars, but Yelp won't let me and 4 wouldn't quite feel right. So I'll go with A-Okay.

Reviews.Author: Judy H.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best!  I always come here for their lunch special.  The sashimi mix is around $12 with 6-7 different fishes, served with miso soup and rice.  But this place is super crowded.  I usually get there by 11:15am and be the first in, otherwise the wait can be more than 1 hour!

Reviews.Author: Keith B.
Reviews.Content: I heard about this place from a colleague of mine. Simply put, you will not find a better value for fresh sushi and sashimi in LA. Yes, the wait is long, but if you value great cuisine without the pretentious atmosphere, you should try Sushi-Gen.

Reviews.Author: Vegas B.
Reviews.Content: Always fresh, but service is not too good.

Reviews.Author: Miranda P.
Reviews.Content: Definitely some of the best sushi I've had in LA. The fish is fresh and they give you a ton of food. The tempura is delicious and there's something very authentic about it. There was a 30 minute wait but it ended up being a little less than that, and it was worth it! The service was a little slow but it was really busy so it's forgivable.

Reviews.Author: Teresa H.
Reviews.Content: There really isn't anything I can write that other's haven't written. The lunch specials are wonderful deals. Dinner is superb. Go now. If they have engawa on special get that.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I would go here everyday if I could.

Reviews.Author: Hana K.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi/sashimi and I really like the atmosphere here!  Make sure to come early/make a reservation or be prepared to wait a while.

Reviews.Author: Morgan P.
Reviews.Content: Been back a couple times since then and the service has been vastly improved. I think it's good to get there a little bit earlier on in the evening (say, by 6:30 or so), before it gets totally mobbed. This is my go-to place for out-of-towners wanting the best of Little Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: Doug D.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi period.  No to Nobu... this is better.

Reviews.Author: George H.
Reviews.Content: No uni, but everything else was good, kanpachi, aji, toro, hamachi, hotate.  May have to come back one day.

Reviews.Author: Billy B.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic sushi!!  Fresh, melt in your mouth yummy stuff.  Definitely one of the top 2 or 3 sushi restaurants in LA for me.  And like all great sushi joints, you gotta sit at the bar to experience it's full potential.

Reviews.Author: Lina W.
Reviews.Content: Came here because my girlfriend wanted some nice fresh sushi and Sushi-Gen had the best reviews by far... Not too sure if I expected much but it was enough for me to knock off a star.  Upon being seated, since it was pretty empty we asked if we can have a more roomier seating, which they were really strict and declined.  Aside their posh service, the food did deliver, but being the daughter of a sushi snob. I have had better of both worlds of good food+service.. the ultimate 5 star combo.

Reviews.Author: Calvin S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here about 4 times, and it is about time that I give them a review. Sushi-Gen is the best sushi restaurant in town! They know exactly what they are doing, and they have great environment! I love this place, and wouldn't hesitate to introduce anyone if they want some real sushi.

Reviews.Author: Rrrapture G.
Reviews.Content: High quality at a modest price.

Reviews.Author: Claudia S.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I lucked out-we came around 1:30 and we sat at the bar right away. This place has been on my bucket list for a while, so I was one happy camper. And when I left, I was an even happier camper. So fresh, so delicious, and the chefs were very friendly. I had yellowtail sashimi, salmon, japanese mackeral, sweet shrimp sushi and ankimo. Oh, and soft shell crab appetizer. I appreciated that the shrimp heads had the tough neck shells (?) removed-much easier to savor! Just mouth-wateringly goodness that I felt fortunate to have experienced. Be sure to get the french macarons at nearby Frances Bakery. Got there by Metrolink and Red Line-fun day for me.

Reviews.Author: Mika T.
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I'm giving Sushi Gen a four star, instead of a five star, is because they charge $1.50 for hot tea and they don't even tell you and it's not even listed on the menu. It's not a big deal if I had wanted it but to act as if it is complimentary, which is standard in most Japanese restaurants, was not nice. Case in point; the waiters/waitresses ask if you want water or tea. Obviously, you're going to think the tea is free because water is free. Other than that, the sashimi is amazing and great , great quality for the price. I would definitely recommend the sashimi lunch.

Reviews.Author: Justin N.
Reviews.Content: Came here due to the amount of reviews and stars this place has. Lives up the reputation. I had the Chirashi, hama toro, tempura and beef teriyaki. I'd stay stay with Sushi items if you come here, not that the other stuff is bad, the fish is just that fresh and good.

Reviews.Author: Nancy I.
Reviews.Content: came here on a weekend and we got lucky and only waited around 10 mins. The service here was pretty good. The place was super packed and the line was pretty long. We both got a dinner plate and those things comes with a bunch of stuff. Our table for 2 could barely fit everything that we got. The sashimi was super fresh and melts in your mouth. Yes, this place is $$ but the quality is really good. The only thing I didn't like was the shredded yams, too creamy for me.Overall, for yummy fresh sushi, I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Kesh K.
Reviews.Content: Wow this place is definitely worth the wait which can be 30-45 mins. All their sections are top choice and order the fresh wasabi which makes all the difference.

Reviews.Author: Darsha W.
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely one of my most favorite places to go for sushi.  I originally read about Sushi Gen in the LA Times a few years ago in the food section.  I felt like I had discovered my secret go to place for sushi.  I had NO IDEA how famous and popular this place is.   The quality of the fish is outstanding, fresh and tasty....never, never fishy or foul.  I usually do not sit at the Sushi Bar and have table service.  The servers are 100% Japanese.  They do an adequate job taking orders and bringing food to your table.  In addition to the sushi I can recommend any type of tempura you like.  The shrimps are large and taste delicious.  If you order a Sushi-Combo Dinner you will get a side dish of some of the best seaweed salads I have ever had! (Well I have not had that many seaweed salads....but here at Sushi Gen it is out of this World!)Sometimes if we are going to the Music Center or Disney Hall for a show we order food and pick it up before and have a truly special meal before the show.

Reviews.Author: Ann P.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite sushi place. I wish I can go there more often but it is such a hassle to go to little Tokyo and try to find a parking. I had a sashimi on their lunch special menu. It seems like 95% of customer order that. This is one of the best sushi I ever had and I had a lot of sushi when I went to Japan.The fresh was very very fresh and their price for sashimi lunch is unbeatable.  I don't think you can get any better sashimi for that price anywhere in Los Angeles.I can't wait to go back there again and again.

Reviews.Author: carlos h.
Reviews.Content: OK.. we know Sushi Gen has high rating.   How does it compare to Mori Sushi or Sasabune in NY city..  Not the same but very very good in Los Angeles.  Key points.  1. their rice portions on the sushi is Edomae/Tokyo level.   on the lesser side therefore not filling you up.   The quality of the "neta" or fish..  very very good.  my family has had service in the tables and this time we ate at the counter.. BIG difference.. At sushi Gen.. SIT at the Counter..  and I would always sit at the counter anyways as the energy of the sushi chef leaves the sushi pieces after a few moments after he puts in front of you.    if you dont believe this .. one is truly missing out on the sushi experience.   Go see the movie Sukiyabashi JIRO..!!!  20 to 30 minutes to eat  and omakase..   At Sushi Gen did not order omakase but I did ask the chef what he recommended..  the Sanma was in from Japan and was excellent..  Sanma gets more fatty in September but to be able to have it now in July was great.   no reservations at the counter.  opens at 530 p.m. so get there by 5.00 p.m. or the next wave of seating might be 7:00 p.m.     Personally, I like a smaller shop with only two chefs at the counter.  My parents were happy with the quality as well.

Reviews.Author: Sid H.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi lunch special..get there at least 20 minutes before they open!! Parking sucks here!!! I usually just walk from the gold line.

Reviews.Author: Will L.
Reviews.Content: If you want quality sushi, I think this may be the best in socal. Very authentic and quality sushi. I like rolls and more Americanized stuff, so thought this place was okay. This place is VERY authentic, the way I'm sure it's suppose to be done. You can tell many traditional Japanese folks come here. I got the $25 dinner combo and it was a ton of food. Very filled after. Think it was a combination of sashimi. Would recommend if you want to know what quality sushi is suppose to taste like.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy K.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi house in little tokyo! I would order a sake and enjoy most of sushi at the bar. Also try ordering fresh scallop half sashimi half barbeque

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: pretty high quality sushi. kinda pricey but well worth it

Reviews.Author: Junglist S.
Reviews.Content: Good sushi, great deal.

Reviews.Author: paul k.
Reviews.Content: This is a small place that has decent sushi. There were only a couple of fish that I noticed being really good, which are: yellowtail, blue fin tuna, and albacore.  We got the sashimi combo dinner which I think is a good deal.  Although it seemed like we just got little chunks of leftover spicy tuna or something.  But it had nice samples of other stuff, like octopus, squid, halibut, yellowtail, and crab.  So its a good little sampler platter, thats all.  Whatever you do, don't pay for getting cold sake in a box.  Bring your own little wooden box or something, but this is in no way worth paying double for.  Doesn't change the taste in my opinon at all.  Unless you want to imagine you're in a misty japanese tea garden or something i don't think its worth it.  I guess its for the experience and all, but you can experience that at home and pay much less.  So just get it in the regular sake cup if you're thinking about it.  Other then that I recommend sushi gen for decent sushi on select fish at a little bit above the average price for dinner.  I think about half the fish is pretty good and fresh and half is just so so.  Also, decent atmosphere and good service.  I'd give it 3 1/2 stars really.

Reviews.Author: Matt D.
Reviews.Content: Got to love sushi gen. So good. So fresh. lil tokyo's second best. Must have eaten here at least 30 times for dinner.What i dig: salmon, monkfish liver, yellowtail, baby yellowtail, halfbeak, some of the apps are good too.What i don't: price is a bit high but not outrageous, all the fun crazy sushi you don't see in other places on the menu may not be in stock. (i have ordered the bonito roll maybe 20 times and they never have it; i am begining to think they are just messing with us)i love this place. i only give it 4 stars as i feel i can only give one sushi place in LA 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: amy v.
Reviews.Content: When I first went it was really good.  That was about three years ago...  i went about three months ago and was very disappointed.  I must say, it hasn't been the same.  Never the less, it's pretty good sushi but a bit pricy

Reviews.Author: Gogo L.
Reviews.Content: Great Sushi and good price!  The Best Sushi in LA!

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST PLACE TO EAT SUSHI.I have yet to find a restaurant to contradict the above statement.  Fish melts in your mouth and it'll be the closest I'll get to the fish market in Japan.  No ponzu sauce necessary.  GREAT service.  Need I say more?  The CONS:1) The wait time can be incredibly long2) They take NO RESERVATIONS3) All members of your party has to have arrived in order for you to be seated*As a rule, I don't recommend sushi to go...I still believe the PROs outweigh the CONs.

Reviews.Author: Mag S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here literally more than a hundred times but never thought of giving it a nice review. I tried other sushi places on Yelp but this is still no.1 to me. I love going there on weekdays, 6-630pm or after 9 to avoid waiting. They're a little pricey but reasonable comparing to those Americanized Sushi places in Beverly Hills. Most importantly, I never eaten anything that is not fresh. I would definitely give A for food and A for service. I've built a good relationship with chefs and waitress that I always get free snacks, and getting sake without checking ID. =)

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is hands down my #1 sushi bar in California. The prices are worth the fresh & extremely high quality fish. Their uni, toro, yellow tail belly, engawa sashimi, Japanese or Spanish mackerel, are among my favorites. We usually eat at the bar omikase and never leave unsatisfied. Without alcohol, omikase can cost about $100 to $120 depending on how big of an appetite you've got but you can get away for less than $40-$50 a person ordering from the sushi menu. You can expect to pay less if you order the combos from the regular menu. Great food and service!

Reviews.Author: SUUUULEEEE C.
Reviews.Content: still amazing. i think those people who gave less than 4 stars probably went on a sunday and we all know you never go to any sushi place on a sunday. tonight i had the best sushi experience of my life! tip: sit on the bar BUT sit towards the bathroom away form the door. those sushi chefs know that why are doing. yum yum yum yum yum yum yum. THE BEST!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Alan L.
Reviews.Content: Food was Good, but a bit on the pricey side.  Dinner for two runs about 70 to 100 bucks depending on what you get, especially if you like the raw stuff.

Reviews.Author: s m.
Reviews.Content: We've alway sat at the bar so no complaints on the service or food. This is by far the best sushi we've had as sushi-holics. Perfect texture and taste. Yes it's pricey but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Doraemon C.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi gen. the quality of their fish never goes wrong. I went there for years and still one of my best in little Tokyo. Try their toro and uni, you will fall in love with their quality.

Reviews.Author: ellen w.
Reviews.Content: any place that serves monkfish liver already gets 4 stars from me.super-fresh, solid authentic sushi. don't go lookin for creative rolls cuz you will not find it here. but if you like it minimal and precise, you'll love it.

Reviews.Author: John J.
Reviews.Content: Enough has been said about this place; you can't go wrong here if you don't mind the wait, especially around lunch time. My lunch favorite: the Sushi Deluxe ($15) combo plate for some of the freshest, melt-in-your-mouth bites this side of Tokyo.

Reviews.Author: L A.
Reviews.Content: The sushi restaurant market in Los Angeles is hyper-competitive; on my little block of West Hollywood alone there are two sushi spots. On the drive over to Sushi Gen I thought how can this place be so popular? It's infamous for slow service and does not even have a website. When Toshiaki Toyoshima opened Sushi Gen in 1980, could he have imagined his small, authentic restaurant (now expanded to twice its original size) would thrive in a city awash with sushi options?I arrived with two friends at 1:00 p.m. on a Friday to find a packed house with a line out the door. This is my 5th review of low cost lunch offerings in Little Tokyo and we came specifically for the sashimi lunch special. We started off with small plates of pickles, sunomono (Japanese salad that enhances the appetite), delicate tofu cubes with a lovely hint of beef broth and miso soup. The sashimi special comes in ceramic platters holding pillars of fish and others made into salads. The generous portions of tuna, halibut and yellowtail were ultra-fresh with perfect texture and taste. Equally as good were small portions of squid and crab. There was no salmon except for a cooked portion which I found to be tasty (surprising given the fact that I normally feel that cooking salmon is a waste of good fish). The chopped and spicy tuna salads were good but visually unappealing. In the end, at just $15 their sashimi special is exceptional both in terms of the quality and variety of fish and price. It ranks #1 in this series to date...but stay tuned for more reviews.

Reviews.Author: Tim P.
Reviews.Content: This is a great and authentic sushi restaurant. You will not find fancy rolls here but what you will find is fresh fish, good service and nice atmosphere especially at the bar. I have gone to this place often and they are consistant with the freshness and quality of the fish. Probably cause they are blocks away from the best Japanese fish market in LA. You must try the baked yellow tail collar! Sashimi combo plate is out of this world and is $21 at dinner and $15 at lunch. One more thing, spicy tuna, wow! Best in town!

Reviews.Author: Ben S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing freshness. Great taste. Great selection of sashimi. Oveall very good. Not cheap but worth every bite.  The fish neck was absolutely amazing... We made friends with our Sushi Master which is from Guerrero Mexico!  A huevo cabrones.

Reviews.Author: Hope L.
Reviews.Content: Yay! I'm a fan! I love this place but the wait is abit long. The prices for the combo meals are AWESOME! Make reservations before you go. You'll still have to wait about 30mins or so but it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Stephen C.
Reviews.Content: Its Pricey but fresh.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to Sushi Gen last year and this place is definitely my new favorite sushi joint in LA. I'm a sashimi fan so i always get the sashimi and monk fish liver when I come here. I've had their salmon as well and its pretty good but sashimi still tops everything else. The cuts are thick, just like how they do it in Japan. The wait is always long but once you get a table, its not too bad. I would recommend this place to anybody who loves sushi.

Reviews.Author: Mari F.
Reviews.Content: I am always, always skeptical about sushi places even those with excellent reviews. I was pleasantly surprised with this place. The fish was fresh, cut well and it was nice to find a place that doesn't pour a shit ton of any kind of sauce on the sushi (it came on the side). The flavors are that of a good, regular, no-frills neighborhood sushi joint I remember from childhood... it sucks that this, in the states, would make it the excellent place to dine and a place you can't just walk in, sit at the counter and chat with the chef while enjoying some sushi. Despite the crowds and long waits, I'm glad Sushi Gen is around and I would go back (with a reservation, early, when they open).

Reviews.Author: Soo B.
Reviews.Content: As a resident of Little Tokyo, I've tried basically every sushi restaurant in the area and Sushi Gen has some of the freshest fish (Sushi Komasa isn't bad either).  There's usually a line so expect a wait but it's worth it.  The fish is so fresh it just melts in your mouth.  There's none of that gross fishy smell or taste -- just delicious sushi.  I'm a big fan of their yellowtail and halibut.  And when you order halibut, they ask if you want ponzu, which is a plus.  A lot of sushi places I've been to don't ask about ponzu.  They expect that you'll just dunk your halibut in your soy sauce.  But at the risk of sounding like a sushi snob, halibut is meant to be dipped in ponzu.  A more delicate sauce for a more delicate fish.  Soy sauce would completely drown out the flavor of the halibut.Regarding their combo/bento box type dishes, their chicken and beef teriyaki are pretty run of the mill.  I also tasted some of my friend's fried sole fillet and it was really good.  The fillet is pounded until it's ultra thin and it has a really light batter.  It's nice and crisp but not so thick that you can't taste the fish anymore.  The combos are pretty small though.  You have to order additional sushi to fill yourself up.  Without alcohol, expect to spend around $25.  With a few bottles of beer, closer to $35.

Reviews.Author: Bryan L.
Reviews.Content: Yellowtail is good.

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is probably the best for its price sushi place in LA. Don't expect your fusion rolls here. This place has a very small selection of rolls to choose from. This restaurant serves traditional Japanese sushi. I recommend the Sashimi Deluxe. I always order this with a side of sushi rice so I can eat it Chirashi style. The Sashimi Deluxe is $45 and should be enough for two maybe three people, depending on how much you can eat. When I sit at the sushi bar, the sushi chefs will always give me their recommendations. Friendly staff and good food. This place is great!

Reviews.Author: Anna H.
Reviews.Content: Super fresh ingredients, very nice sushi chefs, great environment!! It's a must-go place for all sushi lovers. It's a bit expensive, but you will feel like it totally worth the money when you take the first bite of the food. We ordered the Uni with Quail egg sushi and it had NO fishy smell at all, that tells you how fresh they are! Their fish liver dish (Ankimo) was also wonderful...We are for sure planning on going back there again! :D

Reviews.Author: Tim J.
Reviews.Content: Not as expensive as it's made out to be. It's a nice place and the sushi is fresh. The japaneses macrel and sardines are delicious. Wanted to try stingfish but they were out both times I went.One of the better sushi restaurants I've been to.

Reviews.Author: sara h.
Reviews.Content: With so many great reviews, they certainly don't need mine! This is the probably the best sushi I have had. Completely fresh and amazing. The sushi combo dinner is a great variety of sushi and an incredibly large portion (great to share). I've never liked spicy tuna until I had it here! It always seemed like a mushy mess of left over scraps, but theirs is super fresh tasting with great texture and discernible fresh flavors. The Spanish mackerel with green onions and seaweed was also a winner. Their seaweed is not at all too salty, fishy, tough, or slimy. Perfect springy texture and mild flavor. The cold tofu appetizer is one of my favorites and theirs was the best! The wait wasn't TOO bad (40 min for a Friday night). If you have a drink next door at Bar C, they'll come get you when your table is ready!

Reviews.Author: B W.
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!the ONLY SUSHI place i go too... the fish are sooo FRESH and the rice is   different from other places.  I dont know how they do it but keeps me drooling.  The price is not bad for the quality you get.  Just dont sit at the bar because it adds up 40+ per person.   It gets very very crowded during lunch so expect a wait.  I love the grilled yellow tail collar.  It takes about 20 min to prepare but its worth the wait...They get really busy so expect a great service but everyone is really nice!Pros: GREAT SUSHI and GREAT GREEN TEA CONS: PARKING... the lot is not big enough for over 10+ stores inside the plaza.  And its not FREE! with validation you still have to pay $2 ! and its more for dinner...GINGER: $1 more for ginger

Reviews.Author: Jeni H.
Reviews.Content: I've been in love with eating sushi/sashimi since I discovered it almost a decade ago. I have to have a raw fish fix at least once a week (typically 2-3 times a week). Sushi Gen is hands down, no questions about it, 100% THE BEST that I have had since the beginning of my quest to find the best sashimi. As prior reviews have mentioned the Lunch Specials are awesome because of the price. They have the same items (same quality/quantity) on the Dinner menu but at almost two times the price. My two favorite items on this menu is the Sashimi Special ($15) and the Chirashi Bowl ($15). The Sashimi Special is a generous assortment of tuna plus cooked salmon, some cured fish, a little bit of octopus and a couple of other things. Typically if I'm in the mood for a bigger variety of fish (salmon, unagi, tamago etc) then I get the Chirashi Bowl. Either ways the fish is so fresh that it begins to melt a little bit as soon as your chopsticks touch it. Then, you put it in your mouth and it disappears without any real chewing involved leaving you with the wonderful essence of the fish. The portion size is very generous and I typically have a difficult time finishing the entire meal. The meal also comes with a cucumber salad that is not sweet or sour (as I would typically expect from Japanese cucumber salad), a wonderful warm tofu that had been cooked in a meat broth, miso soup and rice. My boyfriend is not as crazy about sashimi as I am so he typically orders the cooked items on the menu. All the items that I have tried off of his plate has also been very tasty - Salmon Teriyaki, Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura Lunch Specials (so far) have all been delightful. They come with rice, salad and a yummy creamy Japanese style potato salad. I have not tried the Sushi Bar portion of the restaurant yet because they do not allow you to order from the regular menu . There is also a minimum order. Also, one last awesome thing about this place - they do TO-GO orders at lunch. If you cannot make it to the restaurant by 10:50am-ish to wait in line for their 11:15am lunch opening I would recommend ordering to-go or going a little later otherwise you will have to wait around until the first wave of people finish eating (30-45 mins).

Reviews.Author: D E.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi.  This is by far the best sushi restaurant I've ever been to.  Everything is always incredibly fresh.I also love the yellowtail collar (and the dipping sauce it comes with).  It's amazing how much meat you can dig out of that sucker.The chicken terriyaki is surprisingly good, too.  I don't usually like chicken skin, but they make theirs crispy and tasty.

Reviews.Author: Julie C.
Reviews.Content: $15 Sashimi Lunch Special!  Nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Jacky L.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sushi places I've been. It is neatly tucked at a small plaza in Little Tokyo in downtown LA. I was there for a night and thought I'd check the highest rated sushi joint in LA. Not disappointed.I tried to make a reservation, but on a Tuesday night they were too busy to take reservations at 7pm. So I went over there and for a seat of one, I waited about 20 minutes. Well worth it consider the food that I had.A very packed restaurant, but the waiters were attentive for such a busy hour. I ordered mockfish liver for appetizer, and for nigiri I had otoro, ama ebi, uni, salmon, and unagi. The mockfish liver was, perhaps only to my personal taste, not very delectable. The smell was a bit too strong for me, but that might just be me.I tried toro for the first time, and to my surprise it was not as amazing as I had heard/hoped. Perhaps all the hype and talk had gotten my expectations to skyrocket too much. The ama ebi, however, was simply amazing. The ama ebi, which is also called sweet shrimp, was very fresh and chewy, not to mention flavorful. It was so good that I just had to order twice. The restaurant also made the shrimp heads into fried delicacies, which were incredibly succulent with a drizzle of lemon juice. The uni was also one of the best that I've tasted, with the sweetness still lingering in your mouth long after you had savored the sushi. Unagi was great, melt in your mouth status, but the salmon was alright for me, above average but not on par with the ama ebi and uni.Aside from the sushi, I also had the deluxe sashimi platter, which was a huge plate full of fresh sashimi for only $35. Well worth it in my opinion. My bill comes up to be $71 for the nigiri plates, $6 for the mockfish appetizer, and $35 for the deluxe sushi platter.I had an amazing experience at the place, and I would definitely visit it again for the uni, sashimi, and most importantly, the ama ebi.

Reviews.Author: Endra M.
Reviews.Content: I love the dishes. The fish was fresh, very nice combos. But hate the long waiting lines. Very authentic, not fusion dishes.

Reviews.Author: Farhana A.
Reviews.Content: If you like tuna, get the toro, amazing! First time tried monkfish liver, as ugly as the fish is, the liver was good. This place is an amazing sushi place with excellent service and excellent fish. Saw Heidi Klum with her family there too!

Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: As everyone already commented, this is probably the best place for sushi in LA. Love their sashimi with tempura plate!

Reviews.Author: rocky a.
Reviews.Content: portion, quality, and service - im a fan. in fact, it exceeded my expectations when i first went and im happy theyre getting the recognition they deserve. in other words, with the inevitably high volume of traffic (and growing) i hope their quality doesnt falter.they had me at sashimi

Reviews.Author: Adrian M.
Reviews.Content: From Utah to Los Angeles, what an unwelcome vibe. We had a friend visit us from Utah so we figured we'd take him to what others rave as one of the best sushi places in Downtown LA...I guess they are too good, since we arrived at 5:16pm and they were preparing to open at 5:30pm.  I asked if we could please wait in their lobby, since it was cold and raining outside.  "NO you cannot wait inside".  So we step outside and try to bear it out, but my friend has to pee so he goes in to ask if he may use the bathroom: "NO"  Not even a sorry, or this is our policy, etc.  We would have been fine waiting outside if they had at least allowed him to use the bathroom.  The rude cold Japanese man working there Monday Jan. 23 has no compassion, appreciation, or consideration for another human being.  Especially in a tough economy, with 3 customers, you'd think they care about new business, especially walking into an empty place nearly ready for customers. I'll be sure never to even bother trying to try the Snobby Sushi-Gen since they don't care of the older generation of more considerate people from out of state.   I hope the owner reads this and address his staff, I would fire that rude man on the spot after reading such a review.

Reviews.Author: Cindy G.
Reviews.Content: My husband & daughter took me here for my birthday tonight and the food was delish! My daughter had the teriyaki salmon & sashimi, and my husband had the sashimi deluxe as did I. My favorite was the spicy tuna, tamago, & salmon. I was too full to desert but I snuck a taste from my daughter and it was really good!

Reviews.Author: diana m.
Reviews.Content: came here expecting a LOT A LOT...was kind of disappointed...had only a few choices...but the sashimi deluxe platter was HUGE! couldnt finish the whole thing...but i LOVED the variety! it also had toro inside! YUMMS!had the uni platter too with the sashimi that came with it (you can choose either sashimi or tempura)...it was fresh! came with a side of seaweed and rice so you can wrap it up and eat it with rice~ yummy...two of us ordered that and we took home a lot of it...big plate!fresh!taste decent!cheap prices!

Reviews.Author: Allison Z.
Reviews.Content: As if this place needs another 5 stars. . .This is one of my favorite go-to sushi places. I don't normally come here for dinner just because lunch is so worth it. They open at 11:15, but I make sure I'm there by 11. By 11:10, the line is so long, you'd probably have to wait about 30-45 minutes so if you ask me, I say being early is worth it!Like everyone else, I get the sashimi lunch. so fresh. so good. so cheap. A lot of people complain about the sashimi lunch consisting of mostly tuna. I personally prefer it that way just b/c I love tuna. And the amazing part of it all is that the tuna here literally melts in your mouth. The uni dinner is also very worth it!! I'm not sure if this is the lunch or the dinner price, but it's only about $38 for so much uni. Honestly, this place is as good as it gets! One thing I do have to complain about is the service. I sometimes want to deviate from the norm and order other things. But the lady makes it impossible. She's ALWAYS coming to ask us what we want. I get it. People come here for the lunch special (that's why if you get seated first, it comes out wihtin a minute or so because they were already preparing for it) but if I tell you I need a couple more minutes. PLEASE GIVE ME A COUPLE MORE MINUTES.

Reviews.Author: Amelia K.
Reviews.Content: Really good deal for lunch special. But need to wait to long. Can Sushi-gen resolve this by doing something?

Reviews.Author: Manso T.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Wednesday afternoon. First of all, this place isn't a secret. I think Yelp has caused this place to explode with business. We arrived 45 min after they opened and the wait was an hour long for a table for two. I really wanted to take a star off for that, but I just couldn't because they did so many other things right. We ordered the sashimi combo with salmon teriyaki and the sushi deluxe with a salmon skin salad. The piece of salmon for the salmon teriyaki was huge compared to other places i had been to. On top of that, it was grilled to perfection and the sauce tasted great. The sashimi and sushi were thick cut and fresh. Best part was, as the waitress was placing the sushi combo in front of me, my eyes had darted to what looked like a toro sighting. As I bit into it, my mouth had agreed with my eyes. Worse part was, I had to share half of that with my girlfriend. Moving on, service was decent. Everyone was polite and attentive even though they were probably the busiest restaurant in Little Tokyo on any given weekday afternoons. The parking lot was a decent size for that type of plaza the restaurant is in. That being said, given the amount of business they have, parking was an issue. They will let people in regardless of how full the lot was. They DO validate parking. Two bucks gets you three hours of parking. Huge plus for them here.

Reviews.Author: Chengchih K.
Reviews.Content: I and my firends visited this resturant almost every 2 weeks. We neeed to wait 30 minutes or even 50 minutes. The conclusion was don't go there on Friday; Monday or Tuesday might be a better time. We always ordered luch special Sashimi as everyone does. Its fresh never let us down but only quantity. We felt its quantity is less than before. If you want to save money, don't even ask tea, it is not free....

Reviews.Author: Jean W.
Reviews.Content: Best quality sushi you can get. Their Lunch Special is FANTASTIC. The tuna belly sashimi is so good that it melts in your mouth. The only downside is that you need to get there an hour before opening in order to get seated early - A little later you could be waiting for an hour or more. But, if you do end up waiting, it is definitely worth it!!!!! :)

Reviews.Author: Chunti L.
Reviews.Content: If you go for lunch, the sashimi special is the way to go as everyone says. We chose to do that-it was excellent-AND order a la carte sushi to try a few other things. The a la cart items (california roll, salmon, unagi, spicy tuna handroll and yellowtail belly) were very good quality but VERY expensive for the quantity provided. I would go back for the lunch special. I couldn't afford to go here and eat to my heart's content on anything else. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Grace K.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a Saturday night for dinner.  I put my name down for a table and was given an estimate for 30-45 minutes.  But when I asked for a seat at the bar, they were able to seat us right away.  The only thing is that you must order at least 4 items if you are seated at the sushi bar...no problem!!There were a lot of other patrons doing the omakase, but my bf and I decided to just order the fish we wanted.  We found out what they had seasonally and ordered a bunch of fish.  We did a mix of nigiri and sashimi style fish.  It was good, the fish was fresh, and we had an enjoyable meal.  Some of the things we ordered were toro, blue fin, salmon, shad, mackerel (2 kinds), engawa, yellowtail, and abalone.  This place is worth a try if you enjoy sushi.

Reviews.Author: Nuan Nuan Z.
Reviews.Content: The lunch sepecial is the best deal!!!!  Love the fresh sashimi , is the best test I ever had. But make sure that you come over before 2pm.

Reviews.Author: Maria P.
Reviews.Content: Food is spectacular. Gourmet sushi that should have a 4 diamond rating like the ones in Beverly Hills. The lines are long but worth it. Just be careful when you're at the sushi bar because there are no prices on anything, you can get sticker shocked when you get the bill. We spent $200 on just 2 of us because we couldn't stop ordering. It was worth it but it would be nice if we knew how much the items are before we order.

Reviews.Author: Amanda B.
Reviews.Content: The freshest sashimi I've ever had--BOLD STATEMENT-- I know but soooo true.  I have always gone during lunch so I pay the price of time because good luck waiting under 30 minutes, it ain' happening.  But what do you expect, a place is good when the place is packed right?! RIGHT?!  Worth the wait and they are pretty quick once you are seated.

Reviews.Author: todd s.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi i've ever had.  If someone can show me somthing better I'll buy dinner here and there.

Reviews.Author: George S.
Reviews.Content: This is the first sushi place that I tried so many different types of raw fish. I went with sushi pros so I decided to not get the usual spicy tuna, salmon, etc... It turned out to be my first "real" sushi dinner and my love for sushi has now tripled!I can't wait to go back and eat a piece of that yellowtail belly where each bite creates an explosion of delicious flavor.I'll have to try other high quality sushi restaurants to compare them with.

Reviews.Author: Lana H.
Reviews.Content: The sushi was VERY fresh.  We had the sashimi plate which comes with a variety of sashimi.  I am not a big sushi eater but this sushi is VERY good.  It melts in your mouth, doesn't have a fishy taste or smell.  There is always a wait here but it is well worth it.  I noticed that a lot of the diners were Japanese which leads me to believe it's pretty authentic.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Cliff W.
Reviews.Content: Great yellowtail collar, generally fresh fish.  One star off because it failed the Uni litmus test--the urchin tasted rotten both times I went.

Reviews.Author: Tammi T.
Reviews.Content: People in-the-know go to Sushi Gen for the sashimi plate. It's a weekday lunch special, and the restaurant gets pretty crowded. In fact, patrons start standing in line by 10:30am, half an hour before opening time. I've tried making reservations in the past, but that didn't always work out. Your entire party has to be present or else they might not honor your reservation. Service is usually pretty quick once you get seated. If you order the sashimi plate like I always do, it comes with rice, miso soup, cold seaweed and hot tofu side dishes. Absolutely Delicious!! The plate itself consists of approximately 15 pieces of assorted sashimi and some grilled salmon. Pretty sweet deal for everything you get!For those who aren't in the mood for sashimi, no worries! There's a pretty nice selection of teriyaki plates, sushi, chirashi, meat and fish dishes. FYI- However, if you are planning on doing the popular sashimi plate weekday lunch special, make sure to ask for a booth/table. You can't order this dish at the sushi bar.I love this place and have been going here for ages. This "hidden find" isn't so hidden anymore!

Reviews.Author: Alice L.
Reviews.Content: i had sashimi delux with tempura.  Sashimi was very fresh and good for the price.  The tempura was lightly breaded and very crispy! yum-yum.  Oh, i also had some spicy tuna maki and that was very good too.  I would go back for the sashimi!!

Reviews.Author: C. N.
Reviews.Content: Hmmmmmm340+ REVIEWS and almost a perfect rating......somethings need no explanation.If you like sushi you will like Sushi Gen.I have been coming here for over 20 years (yeah I got pictures bitch ass haters)Let me say that again "I HAVE BEEN COMING HERE FOR OVER 20 YEARS" - ahhhh yes Hater evaporation in full effect.This place is very good......from presentation, ingredients, decor....you know what, im starting to sound like a food snob......eff all that.This place is the BOMB....there is always a line during lunch rush...acutally theres always a line at dinner too.Dont go between 12-2 pm or 6-8 pm, unless you like waiting for about 30-60 minutes for a table.Some items I have tried......SASHIMI DINNER (or LUNCH) - Read the other reviews and you will see this is where they SHINE!  LARGE FRESH CUTS OF A WIDE VARIETY OF FISH.BEEF/SALMON TERIYAKI - I like the beef much better than the salmon.  Beef is actually very very good.TEMPURA - My daughter is a tempura expert and this is her favorite spot.Light with excellent body, very tough to do with tempura because of the way the batter is supposed to set.CHAWAN MUSHI - I dont eat it at all but my aunt loves it.SPICY TUNA - Not as good as Noshi, but good enough.CHICKEN KARA-AGE - I have had better, slightly above average.CLAM/MISO SOUP - Excellent flavor and balance.RICE - I include this because there is a subtle art in making rice, and these people are on point.SALMON SKIN SALAD - Excellent and fresh.OYSTERS - POPS LOVES EM and they are fresh.This is all I can think of right now.There are so many other things on the menu, you just have to see it to understand.OVERALL..............Food is FRESH and made with care, and thats the bottom line when you eat sushi.Prices are slightly a bit higher than normal but its not outrageous (if you have a job, you should be ok, lol), what do you expect with such quality food.Service is A++++ all day every day.  They know how to take care of a customer.  In all my years of eating here I cannot remember one bad experience. Overall a very very easy A+ grade.Peace and "Toirei wa doko des ka bitches?"

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: VenueThe inside is actually way bigger than what I imagined from just looking at the restaurant from the outside. Its cute inside, nothing grand, just a nice authentic Japanese sushi restaurant. ParkingThere is a small parking lot for the plaza. The first 2 hours are $1.50 with validation. I'm not sure how much it is after that.FoodI ordered the chicken terriyaki + sashimi combo. It comes with rice, miso soup, and a tofu side. The chicken terriyaki came with salad and a type of mashed potato. The sashimi was nice and fresh. The whole meal was about $15.  ServiceThe waitresses were very nice and polite. The service was fast. Even though there were a lot of people waiting in line, we got our table in less than 10 minutes. Overall, it was a good place to eat some simple, fresh sushi (without all that jazz).

Reviews.Author: Ray H.
Reviews.Content: This place is not overrated. It genuinely deserves 5 stars. Visited a few times in the past few months and never disappointed. I haven't met anyone who doesn't agree that  this is one of the best, if not THE best lunch sushi/sashimi place in LA.Just get there around 11am, and you should be able to make the 1st sitting. If you arrive at 11:15am (opening time) you're really pushing your luck.First visit I got the Sushi Deluxe. Great nigiri sushi. Good value for the quality, but not as good as the sashimi lunch. (both $15). Sashimi lunch is terrific, great variety, super fresh everything. Comes with steamed rice (refillable). It might not seem like alot of stuff, but I eat A LOT, and the sashimi lunch with rice is actually very filling.On my most recent visit we also got some ala carte nigiri sushis. They're great too, but more expensive. 6 pieces of Albacore nigiri cost as much as a sashimi lunch!anyways, GO EAT.

Reviews.Author: Yev K.
Reviews.Content: Just few words: Good: nice food, cozy place. Not so good: have to wait for over an hour to be seated. Very tiny place and huge bar - why this setup? Prices are a bit high - paid over $120 for dinner for 3 people (ordered sushi deluxe plate, sashimi plate and chicken teriyaki  plate. Other places with similar quality would not go more then $80.

Reviews.Author: Brain Q.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi in L.A., hands down.  Some people complain about the expense but what do you expect?  Someone has to catch a fish, ship it/fly it across the world, auction it off, truck it to a distributor, slice it up and serve it with the freshness that this place does?  NOT a $0.99 menu but that's what it takes and GEN does it better than most .  and with gracious, intensely humble chefs at your call.  When the hamachi is still twitchin' - you betta recognize!

Reviews.Author: Chi Man W.
Reviews.Content: Expect to wait at least 30 minutes before you can have your table

Reviews.Author: crystal l.
Reviews.Content: nom nom nom.  this place is awesome.  i have been there twice now, both times i sat at the sushi bar.  sadly, my first time was right before i moved out of LA to SF.  or maybe i should say luckily, because i would go broke eating there every weekend if i still lived close.  but it will definitely be on the to do list every time i visit from now on.the sushi chefs have been really great explaining the random things on the menu that i've never heard of, like engawa.  and i picked up a sweet move from my cousin, asking the chef what they think we should end the meal with.  you definitely get to try something tasty not on the menu that way.the toro is so f-ing amazing.  and i have never had scallop that melted in your mouth the way it does here.  the monkfish liver is tasty too.omg, writing this review was a bad idea because now i am really craving some sushi gen!

Reviews.Author: Jacky Y.
Reviews.Content: Definitely 5 stars.  Excellent and fresh sushi/ sashimi.  I usually get the sashimi deluxe platter for dinner. This place is really crowded so do plan on going there early and it also can get a little pricey but it's well worth it for the quality.  I got the salmon collar for lunch before and it was great as well.  You can't go wrong with Sushi Gen, it is the best sushi in Los Angeles!

Reviews.Author: Clint R.
Reviews.Content: Service was great.  Food was excellent.  I was looking for a rainbow roll or a catepillar roll but instead found a lot of Japanese.  The waitress helped me avoid certain items I likely wouldn't enjoy.  I went with the albacore tuna tataki and some other sushi.  It was great.  My girlfriend was very happy with the food as well.  She thought it was a little pricey but I was the one paying so everyone was happy.

Reviews.Author: Bryant K.
Reviews.Content: only 3 words! Fresh, Delicious and Reasonable!!!If you really want to eat a great sushi in L.A definetly you should check this out! I went lot of sushi restaurant around L.A but this one is my top 3 place!!! especially the Chirashi Sushi!!! is really great!! if you never try it just give it a shot! I can guarantee you wont be sorry for it!!!

Reviews.Author: Truffle D.
Reviews.Content: why does everyone like this place??? it's overrated and plain. They don't have any exotic fish from Japan. I guess people are just used to having boring fish and this is what they are brought up with. NO STANDARDS.Sushi Gen is obviously Japanese operated but they need to learn from restaurants from Japan. If they call themselves authentic, they must take it to another level.

Reviews.Author: John J.
Reviews.Content: What can I say thats bad about this place...hummm...long wait maybe...but well WORTH IT!!!!!! The cost might be a bit expensive but once you try this place you will totally understand why. For those of you who love sashimi this is the place to come too. Sashimi plate for lunch best deal in town if your in the mood and the area. Sashimi plate for dinner best experience for those of you who haven't ever tried sashimi or a sashimi lover. The salmon skin salad bomb....chkn tempura combo bomb...the best and my favorite is not the toro or white fish...but the salmon sushi OMG just melts in your mouth and call it a day...just order that and you in...they also have plenty other great items you can get on the menu. I here from true people from japan...if you want something authentic to japan go here.

Reviews.Author: B C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for the sashimi lunch. Best deal for all the food they give you. I would recomment going when they open or you have to wait 1 hour. Not much for ambiance.Set menu lunches are great here too. Dinner is great here too; I would recommend sitting at the sushi bar. Sushi here is great and fresh. The size nicely proportioned. A great sushi restaurant, been going here since I was a kid.

Reviews.Author: Christian S.
Reviews.Content: All the other great reviews of this place are true -- simply perfect sushi in a great setting.  All the sushi chefs so friendly and truly masters at their craft.  Highly recommended and worth the wait for a table (and yes, unfortunately, often there is a wait) :)

Reviews.Author: kevin c.
Reviews.Content: Simply, the best sushi I have had outside of Tokyo.  No specialty rolls, simple good cuts of fish on rice.  The scallop is fantastic, never had it better anywhere else.  Decent sake selection.  Plenty of seating, but everyone knows of this little gem now so it fills up quickly usually with a line waiting for it to open. I advise getting there early or expect a 45m+ wait.  Price is just above average, but less than the more trendy, hipster joints on sunset or San Vincente.  NOTE: closed on Sundays.

Reviews.Author: tony f.
Reviews.Content: Been there a few times. I think it is one of the nicer sushi restaurant in the area, but I don't think it is worth the wait. I waited at least 30 minutes everytime I dine there. Therefore, I do not eat there often. In the little Tokyo area, there are not alot of choices. I haven't found any sushi restaurant I really like in the area. I think Little Tokyo deserves a better sushi restaurant.

Reviews.Author: thi t.
Reviews.Content: Food was excellent. Quality was so fresh!  Japanese Red Snapper and Albacore was so good!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer R.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen is pretty good and a pretty good deal. Ordered the Sashimi Deluxe as recommended by many other reviewers. It is definitely a generous serving for the money. The fish is good, however, it is not anything mind-blowing. Overall, a fun experience, but probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back there. Oh, definitely go early to avoid a long wait.

Reviews.Author: buta b.
Reviews.Content: the sahimi luch special is a steal!! the fish is fresh and super afordable for the amount you get.   there's all ways a long line but its worth it!  I've eaten at the bar also but the sushi chefs are not friendly at all.   but the food is great

Reviews.Author: Darren H.
Reviews.Content: Living in los angeles, I frequently travel to Little Tokyo and this is my favorite place to get sushi.  They have very good service amidst the crowds.  The sushi is always fresh and their portions are very generous.  Going there for lunch is a really good deal and I usually order a combination of chicken or steak teriyaki with sashimi. For lunch i usually get out of there under 20 dollars total and for dinner probably more around 30.  The teriyaki is very simple and tasty.  They use very lean meat and once again the portions are very good.  My recommendation is to go for lunch early like around 11:30.  This place really gets busy around primetime and you can easily have to wait half to a full hour.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: The Best Sushi in LA!

Reviews.Author: Jackson L.
Reviews.Content: A Sushi-Gen meal is amazing in the swiftness in which $160 can be extracted from your wallet in like 20-minutes.  My friend and I sat at the bar (4 piece minimum I if recall correctly) and we blew through their sushi like a small town.  When it comes to the service, the word "ninja-like" comes to mind.  Real awesome spot (as though it needed another recommendation).

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: This was seriously the best spicy tuna roll I've ever had. My girlfriend grew up in Singapore and she agreed with me and she rarely well say something like it's the best! We had a reservation which was good! I highly recommend that. The service was great, and i can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen's sashimi simply melts in your mouth.  Also, I cannot rave enough about their lunch specials, especially their sashimi combo.  By far the freshest sashimi I've had in LA.

Reviews.Author: Bayarea K.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!  Fresh sashimi. Good price for the portion.

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: Been here two times. Once I sat at the bar, once at a table. Both time I basically just ate the nigiri they brought us. It was incredibly fresh and when I was at the table there was a little more hand holding on what sauces we should dip which piece in, ect, (which I appreciated). The bar has a minimum you have to order. Love this place. Both times one of the best meals I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Dee T.
Reviews.Content: Fresh sushi gotta sit at the bar.  the fish is somehow different then the table.  The wait for the table is crazy.  But if you like sashimi, like I do, and want it fresh and cheap.  This is the place.  But only at the table, hence the wait.  I waited almost 1 hour one time.

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best sushi places I've ever been to. The fish is fresh and the portions are very generous. You can't beat the lunch specials with sashimi! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: alex g.
Reviews.Content: yea if you hate this place. i have to question what type of food lover you are, cause its a fucking good meal. each bite makes you want more. people that gave this place 3 are straight trippin. idk whatelse to say. i got lucky and got seated within 10 minutes.. but i heard the wait list is really long but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kathy H.
Reviews.Content: Another great sushi spot!!!! I went there on a Tuesday night and didn't have to wait for a table although we didn't have a reservation. We actually sat at the bar and just ordered what we wanted. We got a bunch of usual stuff like Toro, Uni, hamachi, and unagi. Every piece was just speechless. I have no idea how many times I said "so good" that night. I think the bill came up to something like $250 with a couple bottles of sake. It was worth it, and I am definitely coming back :)

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to write this review from our visit a while back in March. This is a great place in little tokyo for fresh sushi, sashimi. Come early, because it gets crowded quick. Food is excellent!

Reviews.Author: Luyang L.
Reviews.Content: We ordered a sashimi deluxe and a sushi deluxe for lunch. Both came in a huge plate with lots of varieties! Too much for two,but really fresh and yummy!

Reviews.Author: Andrew U.
Reviews.Content: Best sushi I've ever had! Expensive though. But damn, it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Dennis W.
Reviews.Content: Ate here on 8/5 and when we arrived at 10:55 AM (5 minutes before opening), the line was 20 deep already.We did manage to grab a table, but a lined formed outside.Very fresh, authentic Japanese (served as it is served in Tokyo) sushi.Excellent service and friendly also.

Reviews.Author: Orchid T.
Reviews.Content: A hole in the wall with great sushi.  Very expensive, but you get what you pay for.  There is always a line out the door at peak hours, so go early.  Parking is validated.

Reviews.Author: S C.
Reviews.Content: Sushi's good, but $4 for extra nori? Really?

Reviews.Author: Carolyn H.
Reviews.Content: A very good sushi restaurant. Japanese owned and bustling with patronage. Very busy during peak hours. Sushi the way sushi should be! Parking is available inside the Honda Plaza lot. It gets too crowded sometimes hence makes for an unpleasant dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca K.
Reviews.Content: MY first time here at Sushi Gen and I really have to come back and do reviews .The fishes are so fresh. I got the sashimi luncg special .. Just have to say its Perfect, so fresh !!!!! .. The tofu side is yummy .. have to go back again if i have chance for sure :D

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, its that good. The fatty tuna and yellowtail belly are tasty. I gave 4 stars only because the service was marginal and it usually is at packed sushi bars. We were asked to move tables in the middle of our meal to accomodate a larger party......

Reviews.Author: Heather H.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing!  Always a line out front, and for good reason.  Bring your patience, and your wallet full of cash, but I promise it will be worth every penny.  If your idea of eating sushi is california rolls, don't bother:) But if you truly want to eat sushi, this is the place.  Bonus: you can take the goldline metro and walk to Honda Plaza!  No parking hassles and there's a cute little mochi shop in the Japanese Village down the street for dessert.  LOVE

Reviews.Author: Mama T.
Reviews.Content: Wow such great food and service, one of my fav places to frequent with friends. Great price too and nice people

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: I love Sushi Gen!!!  The best in LA.  Sushi is always fresh and melts in your mouth.  Service is excellent.  I'd come here everyday if i could.

Reviews.Author: Emma P.
Reviews.Content: Tried this place out with my hubby for lunch today.  Place was packed, but oh so worth it!  I ordered the sashimi combination.  Fish just melts in your mouth, service was impeccable, green tea was superb at perfect temp.  And my 4 yr old gobbled up the white albore with ponzu sauce!  Amazing!

Reviews.Author: Ramy S.
Reviews.Content: Just exceptional quality. The albacore sashimi was the best I've had. The salmon, tuna, and the toro were also amazing. It's definitely a little pricey but when you get quality like that, I don't mind paying. Well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jerry L.
Reviews.Content: Popular sushi restaurant.Weekday lunch waiting time to be seated:  30 minutes to 1 hour.Sashimi lunch special for $15, a steal.Decent quantity, fresh fish, yummy.

Reviews.Author: Yy J.
Reviews.Content: COME HERE FOR LUNCH. The sashimi lunch set is 15 and the same item during dinner with a side order of tempura is 26. Also, try to make reservations if you don't want to wait 30-45 minutes but show up on time! My boyfriend shares my love for japanese food and we came here twice within the first week of discovering the place. Even though prices are kinda steep you get your money's worth. We'll definitely come back for lunch!

Reviews.Author: Ron Y.
Reviews.Content: Great service, great food, great value.  I came here for lunch and was amazed.  I ordered the sushi lunch special and the fish was so fresh.  I would come back in a heartbeat.  The dried tuna was delicious and it went well with the white rice.

Reviews.Author: Van P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on a week day and it was super packed. There was a 45-min wait so we sat at the bar. 4-item minimum order per person at the bar. We each spent approx $25. Really fresh and delicious. Service is a tad below average. Not sure if the wait is worth it since there are other sushi places in Little Tokyo that are just as good and not as packed, but I would def come back.

Reviews.Author: Dennis C.
Reviews.Content: Lunch Specials! But there is a line every lunch.

Reviews.Author: Robert A.
Reviews.Content: This place merits its reputation as one of the best sushi restaurants in LA. Of course the sushi is great, but so are the tempura and miso soup. Of course you couple the great food with a nice room and the result is a crowd. An all-over-the sidewalk and out-into-the-parking-lot type of crowd. Its worth the wait, though.

Reviews.Author: E P.
Reviews.Content: Very fresh and tasty. We tried reputable sushi/sashimi places for long and this place is at the upper tier for food but still reasonably priced. Service was good and decor was simple and clean.Sit at the bar for Omakase and let the sushi chef serve the fresh delights. It can escalate the bill quickly but is well worth it.Make sure to make a reservation (especially for bar seating) or arrive earlier than opening time on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: We had 6 in our party, and had called well in advance, but still ended up waiting at least 15 minutes out front.  We were seated in a very cramped 4 person booth that was quite uncomfortable.  Close table, poor legroom.  The sake was served quickly.After we carefully coordinated our 6 orders and placed them, the waitress returned 3 separate times to inform us that they had run out of hamachi toro (our most desired selection and the impetus for our visit), spanish mackerel (another favorite) and the grilled hamachi collar (when done well its a revelation).  Sadly, the snapper collar I ordered instead was both uninspired and overcooked.  Still good, but nowhere near what it could have been.After we lived down the disappointment of being unable to enjoy our favorite selections, most of the meal was quite enjoyable.  Not the best I've had, but certainly delicious and of course fresh fish.  Those who ordered hand rolls were disappointed when they were served what were essentially uncut maki.  With none of the delicious, unique textures of a proper handroll, it was a unanimously unsuccessful portion of the meal.The service was quite acceptable, but unremarkable.  It is hard to judge attentiveness when most visits by the server bring terrible news from the kitchen.  I appreciate being informed immediately when something is unavailable.  The waitress may have done her best, but the result was a constant series of disappointments.  I felt bad for her.  Reading other reviews, it appears that running out of choice varieties is not uncommon for Sushi Gen.Finally, nothing prepared us for the moment when the bill arrived.  This is the most overpriced restaurant I have ever visited in my life.  We certainly didn't help by ordering a la carte style, rather than taking advantage of one of the sashimi or sushi combinations.  Nonetheless, for the amount of fish that we were served, the price was outrageous.  We were overcharged by $27, requiring an irritating process of going through the bill line by line with the server to make sure nothing else was amiss.  Bear in mind that budget was not an issue for this party in any way.I personally find the sheer value proposition at this restaurant offensive.  This is not the best sushi any of us had experienced, but it was most certainly priced that way.Don't believe the hype.

Reviews.Author: Joseph P.
Reviews.Content: Best sashimi in LA. Gen is both overrated and underrated. There are some bad qualities of this place but when you encounter sushi this good, you forgive and forget right? There's nothing fancy about this place and you have to go through a lot to get a seat. Service is always bad and you are rushed from the moment you sit down. I have had a forgetful experience here before but that was because I ordered other things besides their sashimi. The bottom line is that Gen has amazing sashimi and nothing more. The good news is that it is light years beyond most sushi joints. Gen doesn't serve pseudo-rolls that are fancy with predictable taste. Instead, it gets down to the core of cutting premium fish. At Gen, you will eat the best sashimi you could imagine and imagine this: the sushi actually does "melt in your mouth". You leave the place wondering where the heck they get their fish shipments from and why other sushi places in LA don't do it the way they do. It just shows you that Sushi is a food that requires skill and knowledge beyond cutting and rolling. Gen will merit a spot in any sushi-lover's top 5 list. Go 15-20 mins early before lunch hour opens to get in nice and easy. Arrive at opening time and you'll be outside for 30-40 mins enjoying the dtla smog.Highlights: 1. Lunch Special sashimi : Great price  2 . Yellowtail collar3. Toro : You come here for this. Get some.

Reviews.Author: Ken M.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to say that hasn't already been said.  Great fish, great service and really not too pricey.  There is a reason it's so popular and they don't take reservations, the chef/owner gets the best fish, and as far as I can tell, has gotten the best fish for decades.

Reviews.Author: Sean C.
Reviews.Content: oh man. i had to wait for about 1 hr to get in for their sashimi plate lunch special.and the reality is it kicks ass! usually i'm not a sashimi person but i'd say for $15 it totally worth it.btw, love the miso soup!

Reviews.Author: Philip L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite sushi spot

Reviews.Author: Charley D.
Reviews.Content: More like sushi-genTRIFIED. Amazing food, but what's up with all the whities?

Reviews.Author: Hui S.
Reviews.Content: The guy without the glasses is rude.  I guess he is too big headed with the people waiting outside his door.  We have a group of 5 and there was another group with 4 people but he would not let us sit at the sushi bar because we have 1 ten years old kid.  Anyway, our bill was more than 300 + dollars and I normally tip a good restaurant with 20%.  I ended up paying them just a little over 15%.  I paid $390. The sushi was fresh but the size was much smaller than before.   I will never go back to Sushi Gen again.

Reviews.Author: Shahzad M.
Reviews.Content: We ordered take-away and contrary to what you'd expect, it was delicious! My wife and  I had their dinner, Sashimi and Sushi plates. We also ordered a california roll. It beats having to wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Katie K.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi plate is wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Author: Ramon L.
Reviews.Content: Very busy!  Worth the wait in Los Angeles, but not Japan.  But hey, we are in the US.  Ordered sushi combo with salmon skin salad, plus six other orders of sushi.  (Was stoned)  Glad the sushi combo (unlike almost every other restaurant) has only sushi and tekka maki and kappa maki, not california roll.  I guess you can get one for $17..sounds weird, but why order it?  The O-Toro was not as marbled as O-Toro in Japan, but fuck it...close enough for here.  The Chu-Toro was good, and if you get the combo it is only $21 ($15 if only sushi).  The people are Japanese and know their shit unlike most places were the chefs know some things but are oblivious to real Japanese cuisine.  BORAGINO-RU!!!  LOL

Reviews.Author: Esther K.
Reviews.Content: YUM! Sushi Gen is one of my favorite restaurants. The best quality and quantity for my money.Go for lunch for the best deal.  You'll get the best quality and a LOT of food for ~$15When I'm there for dinner, I always prefer sitting at the bar. Uni, amaebi, hamachi....all of it's so good. They close 1 day during the week, so make sure you call before going. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Matthew L.
Reviews.Content: Been coming to sushi gen for close to 6 years now, ever since i was in High School, when it was recommended to me by a friend.  He said if you came here and only ordered the sashimi lunch plate for the rest of your life you'd a happy man.And i did...it was awesome...and i'm going there today.I've never had any other of their meals but i don't feel like i'm missing out, they give out generous portions and alot of appetizers that'll get your chops going before the main course.Pros: Fresh Fish, service, price Cons: Busy, Very Busy at lunch, expensive if you sit at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Lily C.
Reviews.Content: I am finally able to try the sushi at the restaurant instead of the take-out! Eventhough there was an hour wait for a table, the wait was worth it. The tuna was melt in your mouth! Order the sashimi deluxe because it's always a good deal and you never know what juicy morsels of fish will be awaiting you. The miso with the red snapper head was excellent! Very prompt service (they bring you the check ASAP so you don't linger) so not a good date place.

Reviews.Author: T K.
Reviews.Content: The menu linked here does not do justice to the sushi bar selection available.They have the best sushi in downtown.  My favorite is their spanish mackeril (spelling)?

Reviews.Author: Jo Z.
Reviews.Content: Sort of pricy, but really good food. so i think it is ok to spend that money.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea S.
Reviews.Content: Ugh. You SoCal Yelpers and your uneducated palates! Well maybe, I'm being a little harsh... I AM a huge sushi snob, and Nozawa has just ruined me. This place was good, but it does NOT deserve the *(*& sucking that everyone gives it on Yelp. The sashimi deluxe platter is fresh and it is a great deal for 35 bones... that and a hand roll and an order of tempura will do you +1 right and you'll have gotten out of there satisfied without breaking the bank. Best sushi in LA? I think not.

Reviews.Author: Peter and Jolie H.
