Reviews.Content: I'm not a big sushi fan but my girlfriend is.  I recommend the shrimp sushi because it is amazing.  The shrimps were huge.  The fresh water eel was also terrific.  My girlfriend ordered different types of fish including tuna, salmon, etc....and everything was so fresh.We have been to many sushi places before and this is by far the best.  At night and on the weekends, the line is long but worth the wait.  The lunch special is the best deal.....if you like assorted sushi.

Reviews.Author: Simply M.
Reviews.Content: The closest to Tokyo restaurants. FRESH! Excellent quality, this is as good as it gets. I eat here for lunch several X a week. No reservations, always a wait?  Must eat at sushi bar for the best experience.   Stay away this is my spot!!! LOL!

Reviews.Author: Regina W.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite sushi places.  If you don't like sashimi and prefer rolls, this is not the place for you.  I've been going here for years and the fish is always fresh.  The main recent changes/drawbacks the  have been due to the indirect raise in prices.  In the past year they started charging for tea and requiring that each member of the party order from the ala carte/entree menu even if that person only wants and appetizer. and decreasing portion sizes.  Nevertheless, the sashimi deluxe is still probably my favorite choice on the menu.  Also, beware of the long waits; it's best to arrive right before it opens.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best sushi place I've ever eaten at.  The tuna tastes like Toro in my opinion and I've had sushi at some pretty expensive / well reviewed places before.

Reviews.Author: Joseph J.
Reviews.Content: I don't get why this place gets more stars than other sushi restaurants in town.  There's really nothing special about this place.  Sushi's here were good but so do every other sushi restaurnts.  I wouldn't recommend ppl to wait 1-2hrs to get exactly the same stuff that you can get in other places without wasting your time waiting in line.-1 star for waiting-2 star for messing up my order (only got half of my order and the waitress didn't have a clue until I went thru my order with her and still, I never got my roll)-1 star for $2.50 parking fee

Reviews.Author: Lenzo D.
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS THE SHIZNIT!!!  Don't even bother with any other sushi restaurants without trying Sushi Gen first.  All of their sushi is fresh and super duper buttery delicious!  The sushi chefs are really funny.  Last time my husband and I went, we spent $250...well worth it though!!!

Reviews.Author: Marc C.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best sushi place ive been to so far. I have come here 3 times for dinner and it is always very very good. Sat at the sushi bar every time. Very fresh fish, and reasonably priced for the quality you get. My favorites are the salmon, yellow tail, monkfish liver, and uni. Never been here for lunch but I hear the lunch specials are well worth it. Would i come back? once a week if I had the money and time. (I come from Irvine to go here)

Reviews.Author: F A.
Reviews.Content: One of the BEST sashimi/sushi restaurants in the Los Angeles area.I have been to almost every sashimi/sushi restaurant in the Los Angeles area for the past 30 years and thought I knew what good sashimi/sushi was until I came to this place.Sushi that practically melts in your mouth.There's usually a wait to get in during dinner, but well worth it and usually not excessive.

Reviews.Author: Stan Y.
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi in LA. Price, quality and quantity can't be beat. The sushi is traditional and fantastic. Don't expect anything trendy or sushi with fancy sauces.

Reviews.Author: Huan L.
Reviews.Content: best sushi restaurant that's not on the west side.they are so busy (lunch and dinner) that they turn over a tremendous amount of fish which means you always get fresh stuff.go early or be prepared to wait.
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: James K.
Reviews.Content: BEST SASHIMI IN SOCAL!!!! Hands down, the freshest sushi L.A. has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: Love love love this place!!! Gotta try "imakasa" which is chief's choice. The chief decides what you get for your dinner.  Everything is fresh and delicious :)

Reviews.Author: Taleen K.
Reviews.Content: OMG... the fish was amazing! We will be back very soon with friends! Only one neg is that the sushi bar menu does not have prices, and neither does the check. So, no way to monitor charges or keep to a budget.  So, if you enjoy the real stuff, GO, but be ready for a hefty check. Well worth every dollar.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the hype. Kind of overpriced and run of the mill from my experience. Also the service was slow. Try Komasa.

Reviews.Author: Derrick S.
Reviews.Content: 2 peoplesushi bar on weds... seated @ 9pmomakase dinner x2 + hot green tea x2$164 (b4 tip), $185 (including tip)busy joint, nothing fancy... just fresh authentic sushi.make sure to make reservations or arrive EARLY.

Reviews.Author: Ethan F.
Reviews.Content: Parents have always brought me here for sushi since high school. Since then no place has matched up to the quality of fish this place serves.  That explains the long wait for the sushi bar.  Katzu is the best sushi chef (The one on the very end, farthest from the restaurant entrance).  He is modest, hard-working, and very friendly making sure to chat up all the customers and serve them well.  If you go on a slow night make sure to request him.

Reviews.Author: jian a.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant probably opened about 30 years ago.  Since its opening, Sushi-Gen has been providing good sushi at very reasonable price.  Yes, it is always crowded.

Reviews.Author: steve p.
Reviews.Content: I love the lunch menu.  Excellent fresh quality for the price.  It can get busy so I recommend arriving when they open to avoid a wait. Overall my favorite sushi place in downtown la for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Amy W.
Reviews.Content: So somehow I ended up in Little Tokyo one Saturday afternoon. By 1:30 I was hungry and Sushi Gen was right there so I stepped inside. There were not that many customers so I just sat myself at the bar. The staff was attentive. The sushi chef was fantastic. The fish was heavenly. I could not get enough. I tried uni, ebi, hamachi, toro, unagi, and a few others plus a sashimi combination. They were ALL great. No wonder I was so full afterward.

Reviews.Author: C. T.
Reviews.Content: Our favorite sushi restaurant by far!!  My wife and I love this place.  Better than anywhere back home in Hawaii.  Sashimi deluxe is a must order every time!  Amaebi is fresh!  Only negative is the long line, though definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Pasadena R.
Reviews.Content: Rip off. Lunch for four (2 adults, 2 kids) in the middle of the week was $51.  $15 for the California Roll lunch special which was a miso soup and 6 small pieces. What?  My 10 year old nephew who doesn't eat much actually asked for more food.This place used to have great deals but not any more.

Reviews.Author: Joyce L.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite place to have sushi in LA.  I go here every time I need my sushi!

Reviews.Author: Nancy A.
Reviews.Content: Yum! This was fabulous and simple. No silly named rolls and the best Tuna Tataki I have ever had. Also there were some very unusual items on the menu that you do not see in your "normal" Americanized sushi restaurants. Sevice was perfect and even the red bean and green tea ice cream was the creamiest I ever had. Loved it.

Reviews.Author: Jen A.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch special is great....however you DO have to wait for it.  I waited 45 minutes to get seated.  I'm giving it 4 stars because although it had plenty of sashimi, it had other side items--such as the cooked salmon--which weren't so great.  Nevertheless, this is a great deal.

Reviews.Author: Madeline L.
Reviews.Content: I had a small celebration of my own so I wanted to treat myself and my partner with something new and pricey. It was well worth it for the night, because there were so many different flavors to talk about while going through a randomly picked meal. Everything was new to me. Not to mention how healthy this food is. Definitely pays of to visit from time to time.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: $15 sashimi lunch is all you need to know.  So fresh so plentiful and so so very much delicious

Reviews.Author: M L.
Reviews.Content: Fresh sashimi, and good kitchen food.The only problem is supper crowed, both lunch & dinner time, wait for 1.5 hours in avg.

Reviews.Author: Tracy C.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best sushi in town, pricy though if you sit at the bar and order from chef.  Price tag is from $50~$120 per person plus tip at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Ok.. So i came here after reading all the amazing reviews about it and heres what i thought..Sushi was very fresh. Service was great too. We ordered the sashimi special or whatever it was called, and there was plenty for how much it cost. Also had a small order of the tempura. MY favorite thing here by far was the spicy tuna. I seriously cant have spicy tuna anywhere else..Sushi Gen hands down has everyone beat. Only negative experience was the wait. I know its a popular spot and I should have made reservations. We got there around 730 and was told it would be a 30-45 minute wait for 2 people. It ended up being an hour and 45 minutes. The restaurant is extremely small for how busy it is. The food was really good but i dont think ti was worth the hour and 45 minute wait. There are plenty of other sushi restaurants in the area. I probably wont come here again on a weekend because of the wait. However if i'm ever in the area mid week or something.. this will definitely be the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Alexander G.
Reviews.Content: For lunch, come early.  The  line starts to form around 11AM.  The fish is fresh and the service is fast an polite.  Lunch special is a good deal.

Reviews.Author: DAVID T.
Reviews.Content: Awesome and fresh. The combo sashimi plate is absolutely incredible. The miso soup was so good. One of the best Japanese restaurants I've experienced. The only downside is the long line in the evening.

Reviews.Author: L H.
Reviews.Content: YUM YUM YUM! Sushi-Gen is a small hidden spot in Lil Tokyo DTLA, but with FRESH seafood everytime we go. We usually order: Live Shrimp, Abacore Sashimi, SPICY TUNA HAND ROLL, and Red Snapper! This is the sishi spot if you love fresh sushi!Planning to go to Sushi-Gen? expect 20min to 30min wait until you'll be seated. It's always pack! BUT well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Olet N.
Reviews.Content: Sushi Gen is one of my favorite places in Los Angeles for sushi.  Japanese cuisine is so healthy that I could eat out often.  The only limiting factor is ones monthly dining allowances.  When I feel like splurging I find myself in Honda Plaza parking the car out front of Sushi Gen.  Just the other night when I was there I found out that they were celebrating more than 30 years of operation.  All I can say is Wow!.  It's no wonder why they have been going so strong for so long.  It's the quality of the fish that is one of the most important factors in making a successful sushi place.  Inside the restaurant you have a choice of seating either at the medium sized sushi bar or sit at a table and have your food brought to you.  Either way the service is perfect.  I always feel that the waitresses are sincerely interested in making your dining experience one that will be memorable.  If we are dining before a show at the Music Center we are always finished in time to make the curtain for our show.  If we just walk in we know that we will have to wait at least 30 minutes for a table.  Anyway, it is always worth it.  In addition to sushi, the tempura is also a delight.  Shrimp tempura comes with a sashimi dinner and usually we can't finish the entire portion.  What else can I say that has not already been said about Sushi Gen?  Just GO THERE and try it, you will LOVE IT!

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for fresh sashimi, this is the place to go. That's if you're willing to wait in line for about 45-70 minutes. Their portions used to be a lot bigger (3-4 years ago) but I'm sure they're affected by the economic downturn.

Reviews.Author: Gustavo G.
Reviews.Content: Wow! Speechless!!!

Reviews.Author: Allen H.
Reviews.Content: Went here for lunch, sat at the bar, which means you can only order from their bar menu, not the sit-down menu. Extremely, extremely, extremely FRESH fish! We got tuna hand rolls, albacore, yellowtail, halibut, spanish mackerel, the spicy cucumber salad, and more. Our sushi chef was Tagaki. He was super nice! Great sushi spot, definitely worth it to check out and worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Nikki S.
Reviews.Content: love their eel rice, so thought i give their omakase a try...was a bit disappointed because it wasn't anything special, more like what's fresh of the day....maybe i was expecting too much?

Reviews.Author: Jenny J.
Reviews.Content: I will die of high cholesterol and obesity for the the uni with quail egg and toro sushi. Eat at the sushi bar!

Reviews.Author: Maiko N.
Reviews.Content: Classic case of tricked by Yelp reviews... How naive was I?Basically, I expected really good quality sushi after seeing so many reviews. Maybe I ordered wrong stuff, like Uni, Sweet Shrimp (was ok), and Tuna, Sardine, Kanpachi, Surf Clam, etc. Not very impressed... Should I have ordered Sashimi instead of sushi?The best part was miso soup (!) and I feel bad cuz that shouldn't be tastier than sushi. Delicious clam & fish head miso soup :)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer G.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for a birthday dinner and it was amazing. The sushi melts in your mouth, however be careful of their wasabi, my boyfriend had some and bless his soul first time trying sushi did not have a good experience due to the intensity of it. However despite that, it was good.

Reviews.Author: Jim K.
Reviews.Content: The BEST sushi in Little Tokyo. I haven't been in for lunch, but I can attest the dinner crowd also makes it difficult to get in.  We usually try to make it in before 6. If you do have to wait, you can walk around the shops to pass the time.

Reviews.Author: Calvin S.
Reviews.Content: Simply put, Sushi-gen is the most overrated Japanese restaurant in LA. I don't know if the other yelpers are just accustomed to bad food or if they are stereotypical white folks that have never tasted sushi. I'd rather drive all the way to redondo beach for some amaebi than this restaurant.Here are some things that i really hated about this restaurant.1. Line was way too long during weekend. I usually go eat out on weekend nights and i had to wait outside for an hour and 30 minutes.2. Price isn't even that cheap. You are looking at overpriced toro,uni, amaebi for the quality of it.3. Service is slow. It's understandable in a way because there were a lot of people in the place but they should hire more sushi-man or something for faster service. I think i waited around 15 mins for a plate of sushi.4. Fish quality and portion sucks. I was expecting bigger, fresher sushi for the price but it was small and cheap quality.As a sushi connoisseur who has had sushi at many different restaurants, I found that the quality of the fish (not high ends but ones like salmon tuna yellow tail) was decent. However, you can easily find the same if not better grade at other restaurants in LA. Do not be fooled by the restaurants allure just because its located in jtown and has recieved raving reviews from yelpers that do not know what they are talking about.

Reviews.Author: OC Girl G.
Reviews.Content: This place is really good and my ultimate favorite!!! The Sushi is beyond fresh and they have great service!

Reviews.Author: Ellen L.
Reviews.Content: Thanks Yelp for this one.  Get there early because the lines get long quickly.  I ordered the lunch sashimi for $17 and it was fresh, diverse, and delicious.  It comes with lots of pieces of tuna, octopus, white fish, salmon, and seaweed.  It was well worth the price for such fun for my tastebuds.  Probably can't afford this every time, but it makes a nice treat.

Reviews.Author: Les W.
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and simple.Go at 11:00AM for lunch - skip the lineOrder the sashimi special - $15This is THE best deal in town for fresh sashimi.The End

Reviews.Author: Steve N.
Reviews.Content: This is the place where I fell in love with Sushi and that all Japanese restaurants should aspire to. I've been going there since I was in college and my days working in DTLA. The lunches are awesome and very fresh, atmosphere is second to none with real Japanese people working behind the sushi bar. Prices are a bit high and they now charge for tea, but good things are usually not cheap and I would certainly pay for it.

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: Nothing less than awesome.  Sushi at its finest.

Reviews.Author: deanna m.
Reviews.Content: if you want REAL SUSHI - go here. not going to get into anything super specific, its real sushi and the best i have ever had. go. go now.

Reviews.Author: Rose H.
Reviews.Content: Don't understand why this place got a high rating. Over-priced, sushi was blah & decor wasn't great. Three strikes. Thought it would be authentic Japanese sushi, but it wasn't.Our handrolls came out looking like messily rolled crayons, with a flap of extra seaweed at the end folded up on itself. They're supposed to be shaped like a funnel! Cannot believe they would allow that to come out, let alone serve it.I've gotten fresher sushi, from real sushi chefs at Hama Sushi and a better experience for much less.  Other sushi restaurants will also give you complimentary dessert. Sushi-Gen does NOT.Don't believe the high reviews & lines. NOT worth it. First and last time.

Reviews.Author: Brian L.
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic! The fished were fresh and the food was delicious. I ordered the $15 dollar plate with all the sashimi. It was filling and definitely worth the price. This will be one of my favs. One word: FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Author: Vicky W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious but need to reserve ahead if you dun wanna stay outside to wait for an hour for a dinner...

Reviews.Author: Sherry N.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go out to eat sushi, Sushi Gen is the first place that comes to mind.  I am so lucky to have found this place in the midst of all of the sushi restaurants that have overwhelmed modern society.  While sushi and sashimi were considered taboo only 5-10 years ago, it now seems that around every corner there is some sort of sushi restaurant.Sushi Gen has, by far, the best quality fish I've ever found at a Japanese restaurant in the U.S.  Moreover, it ranks amongst the top 5 Japanese restaurants I have ever eaten at, including those in Japan.  Although I have only eaten at Sushi Gen two times, I can comfortably say that their food is authentic.  The second time I visited I brought a group of 8 friends, including a couple that was not comfortable with consuming raw fish.  However, to my delight, they were willing to try the bluefin toro (you'd have to be crazy not to) and found it to be enjoyable.  To get a true sense of what Japanese cuisine is all about, Sushi Gen is a good place to start.  Their service, food preparation, and decor is highly reflective of modern Japanese dining.  I highly recommend trying the Deluxe Sashimi Dinner or if you're even more adventurous, try sitting at the sushi bar and having the chef choose several nigiri-style sushi selections, it's the best way to ensure you're getting a variety of fish that are fresh and tasty.  Look to spend around $30-50 per person, including drinks if ordering from the menu, $50-100 if at the sushi bar.

Reviews.Author: Danny L.
Reviews.Content: Best for 100% true authentic Japanese sushi!!!!  I can eat at this place for the rest of my llife!!!  You can't be the sashimi lunch special!!  But, get there early.

Reviews.Author: Sonia B.
Reviews.Content: Fresh sashimi and good service!! The food came out fast even when they're busy !! I will go back again soon.

Reviews.Author: lee y.
Reviews.Content: ive worked in liltokyo for years and by far this is the best spot for sushiyou pay for quality here its fresh sushi great service and a good crowd

Reviews.Author: Curt S.
Reviews.Content: We try to go today but they were closed 3pm?

Reviews.Author: Yuji Y.
Reviews.Content: This is the place where people who do not know about sushi go. I cannot believe there are always long line. Uni and Aji are good. This place is for a moodie.

Reviews.Author: Neal Z.
Reviews.Content: I ate one time here. Really fresh fish and good sushi. But too expensive. Two people we spent 140 here without tip. No left to do "to go". The table next me four people spent like 70$ total. I don't know what they eat. Probably they eat something before they come. Everyone said food is good. I know it is fresh. But really can not tell the price and quality difference can be matched.

Reviews.Author: Aki T.
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious and fresh.  During lunch they have a great sashimi special.

Reviews.Author: Louis A.
Reviews.Content: Most of the fish here is quite good.  But they couldn't care less if you dropped dead right then and there.  And who the hell serves cooked ebi as part of Omakase?!?  Like I said, they don't care about their customers.  I'm going to get my head out of my ass and stop going here.

Reviews.Author: Bella L.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi and I've been to a lot of different places, but this place beat all of them. Their sashimi is so fresh it melts in your mouth!! Very authentic. Like when you take your first bite it makes you wanna say so this is what sushis supposed to taste like lol!! I def recommend. Wait might be a little long but totally worth it

Reviews.Author: Todd K.
Reviews.Content: I came here after I heard so many people tell me this was their favorite sushi restaurant in LA.  And it was friggin delicioso!!  The atmosphere at the sushi bar is fun.  Everyone sitting next to you is in a happy mood because they're sushi snobs like you are.  And they'll gladly tell you what they recommend.  The fish is soooo good!!!  The chefs are helpful and make magic with their mini samurai swords.  Go.

Reviews.Author: Stanley L.
Reviews.Content: We went because we saw the high rating on Yelp and it was relatively busy which is always a good sign.  Boy, was I disappointed!  The waitstaff was courteous enough bur extremely busy, always rushing off somewhere. Meanwhile there's two Matre'd standing around doing nothing. My friend ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura $21 and I ordered the Sashimi with Tempura $24. The tempura was fried in thick batter instead of the traditional light and fluffy tempura batter. It is literally not acceptable for a restaurant of this caliber. The Chicken Teriyaki taste  no better than Flame Boiler's.  The sashimi was good, but I've had better.  The fish chunks don't melt in your mouth, it requires some chewing, just shows the freshness of the fish. The portions were more than generous but I must prefer quality over quantity. Neither one of us finished the whole dinner meal. With house sake ($4.00), tax and tips, the dinner came out to about $70. Definitely not worth even half as much.

Reviews.Author: Maria P.
Reviews.Content: I love love love this place! the bar is the best seat in the house! wonderful food that is always fresh and well prepared!

Reviews.Author: Schoene M.
Reviews.Content: #1 Sushi in L.A. for lunch sashimi special. Amazing value for incredibly high quality. Oh shoot -- I shouldn't have posted this 'cause -- now the lines will be even longer.

Reviews.Author: Ian C.
Reviews.Content: Sashimi here is really really really really good. thats about all i can say about it. The service was pretty good too. I would show up early if you don't want to sit at the sushi bar or wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Hungry Rat S.
Reviews.Content: Eat here on a pretty regular basis, typically for lunch, and have NOT had to wait much despite what others say.  Not sure if its timing or luck, or the fact that I usually sit at the sushi bar, but, it seems like the wait is usually for those who choose to sit at a table. My usual favorites include hamachi belly, uni, as well their monk fish liver appetizer which is fantastic when it is served slightly warm.  The amaebi (sweet shrimp) which you can request to have head used to make miso is also a consistent winner, although not coming close to the traditional japanese amaebi you find in Hokkaido which is much smaller in size, very seasonal, and usually not available.  They do also sometimes carry both chu-toro (medium fatty) as well as o-toro (extra fatty) depending on what you're looking for.  I generally don't bother with the white tunas or the albacores, so I can't speak to it.  But I love aji (spanish mackeral) except that like many sushi places, they tend to drown it with too much ponzu.  Fortunately, this is an easy fix simply by asking the chef to take it easy on the sauce.  I have yet to be disappointed by the seafood they serve here, with the exception of my last visit, where Kanpachi simply wasn't up to Gen's normal standards, but, at the same time, it the was the first time I'd been served by that particular chef (the one at the end) and maybe his knife had just been used to cut another more pungent fish.  Worth removing a star?  I think not (yet).  Bottom line, good reliable fish for those who like raw fish, with the occasional specials thrown into the mix, albeit overall not tons of variety per se.  And yes, they can be pricey depending on what you order, but, as others have said, there are other options as well.All in all, I think a few things need to be acknowledged, based on the reviews I've seen.  First of all, being busy is a good sign that inventory is being turned over, which is especially important when it comes to fish, so all of those complaining about the wait should either show up earlier or get over it.  Any busy good restaurant requires some sort of wait.  Second, the comment made about "anyone can do fresh fish" if you have the money is a little irresponsible.  Not everyone can do fresh fish, as demonstrated by the host of sushi restaurants out there, including many who can clearly afford it, who do not serve great fish.  Those of you who have been to a major fish market like the Tokyo Fish market and understand the lengths the Japanese go to in order to secure the best ingredients will attest to the fact that selecting, buying, and having access to great fish is a challenge in itself.  Great sushi preparers treat the process of selecting, handling, cleaning, preparing, triming, and serving their fish much like the way fine steakhouses and serious shabu shabu places do in how they prepare, trim, and age their own meats.  Its certainly not as simple as buy, slice and serve as some would have you believe.  So appreciate the unique attention on handling the fish for what its worth.

Reviews.Author: Mich S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of our favorite sushi restaurants.  It is on the expensive side, but you definitely get what you pay for.  Toyoshima-san (the owner) has the freshest fish available and his sushi chefs are terrific (especially Kazu!).  This is not somewhere you go to eat fancy rolls or even cooked sushi (though the unagi is good - as is the hamachi-kama) - you want to eat sushi and/or sashimi here.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: The sushi and food here is extremely fresh, carefully crafted and therefore tasty and memorable.  It's not cheap or expensive-- kind of an inbetween price (we spent about $50 for two people just for food) but if you love sushi or raw fish or japanese food at all, this place is delicious, reliable, and consistent.  Atmosphere is cute-- fairly traditional japanese decor and really nice wait staff and sushi chefs.

Reviews.Author: Karina H.
Reviews.Content: i get the sashimi deluxe and beef teriyaki when i come here.  fish is fresh.  i hate waiting though and the last few times i came here for valentines day  or for my moms bday..had to wait about an hour :(

Reviews.Author: david e.
Reviews.Content: note to self:  sashimi lunch special for $15.  get kampachi.

Reviews.Author: jenny h.
Reviews.Content: sushi gen is a machine.  they pump out quality sashimi platters at top speed.  we got a table on a friday night (after waiting for 40 minutes) after hearing all the hype.  i think i would give this place 3.5 stars for now, if i could.  everything was good, but not spectacular.  i think because this place felt like such a machine compared to Sushi Go 55, where everything is small, and there is such attention to detail.  maybe this is sort of the downtown equivalent to Hide on the westside.  both are generally good, but something about them gives me this mass production feel.  we got the sashimi deluxe platter, which had tons of fish but maybe not the best.  for example, i dont like how the tuna was chopped up.  also the spicy tuna - not so crazy about that. and the cooked salmon? i don't understand.  i like my sashimi platters to be - well, just straight sashimi.  like sushi go 55's sashimi plate, which comes with delicious albacore, rice, miso soup and tons of little veggies (all for about $20 or so).  we also had the kumamoto oysters and they were good, but i've had better (at sushi zo). overall, gen is good for the value, and i see why many people go here.  i think next time i'll sit at the sushi bar because that's going to be a totally different experience.  i'd like to do that so that i can add one more star - the sushi experience is not all about getting platters.  it's definitely not about quantity.  for now, i still like sushi go 55 better - a lot of the patrons there are actually japanese, whereas sushi gen obviously caters to a different demographic.  i guess it's just a matter of personal preference!

Reviews.Author: Shirley H.
Reviews.Content: Sushi is fresh but very small and over priced.   Hide in Santa Monica has same quality fish but double the portion.  I will not come back.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa F.
Reviews.Content: sushi gen has the freshest sashimi in little tokyo! i literally think they slice the fish alive before serving it to you a minute later. everything is delicious. from the soup to the salad you know you are getting a quality meal. it's busy for a reason! i don't mind the wait which is usually 30 plus minutes for 2 people when i know i'm going to eat a great dinner. i always look forward to going here.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany P.
Reviews.Content: so gooooooddddd

Reviews.Author: Dawn K.
Reviews.Content: if you dont like this place, you're low class.

Reviews.Author: esther l.
Reviews.Content: I was sooo disappointed with their service.  I felt so discriminated and even though the food was ok, I would never ever go back.  They need to find new waiters.  I had to take my 1 month old son with me and while we were waiting in line, waiter asked us to wait outside because our stroller was on their way.  I refused since it was cold outside and people were smoking outside.  once we got in, they made us disassemble out stroller and my son had to just lay down on a chair.  I understand they were busy but when we asked for the check, it took like 30 minutes to bring back our bill.  I was so disappointed from the beginning that I just wanted to eat and get out of there.  But when they didn't come back with my bill, I decided not to tip full 15 percent.  they definetely do not deserve it.  worst dining experience I ever had! If you have a kid I do not recommend going here.

Reviews.Author: Katy L.
Reviews.Content: OISHII!!! =)  MMm.. where do I start? This is one of my favorite sashimi places in Los Angeles. My favorite item to get is the sashimi entree with the tempura because it comes with soup, rice, and a pickled cucumber side if you make it a dinner combination. I would make a reservations ahead of time because if you don't, you will be waiting outside with the other hungry people for a very long time! Service is pretty fast because they want you in and out for the other people waiting which almost felt a bit rushed if you are the type to linger at a table but not the point where I didn't feel like I couldn't enjoy my meal. Sashimi platter will include tuna, yellow tail, spicy tuna, and other tasty sashimi delights! Fish is always fresh and slices are pretty generous. If you want to go all out with your sushi gen experience, order the nigori cold sake with your sashimi entree. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. ;)

Reviews.Author: Jerry S.
Reviews.Content: i was a regular at sushi gen while living in downtown years ago and still find time to stop by the place whenever i visit the area. i really enjoy ordering chirashi and assorted sashimi, the price is reasonable, one incident i will never forget is that my friend pour his hot green tea into ice water and the restaurant charged him for the price of iced green tea, probably the most hilarious incident i ever witness in a restaurant, still, it doesnt deter us from going back to the place.

Reviews.Author: Juan F.
Reviews.Content: Another 5 Star Experience for me!  Let me just say: Fried Sweet Shrimp Heads, are DELICIOUS!  I would have never, ever thought of eating a shrimp head.  You know what they look like: those little, itty, bitty eyes looking back at you.  That's okay, look away and CRUNCH!  So good!  That was just one of the many wonderful tastes I experienced at Sushi Gen.  We (my friend Stef and I) sat at the sushi bar. (pictures included)  We started with seaweed soup and an oyster shooter.  Both were really good; I had never had that type of cold soup before.  We ordered: Toro, Albacore, Salmon, Sweet Shrimp and Yellow tail sashimi.  There is no need for rice filler with that quality of  fish.   A hot, large bottle of sake to wash it all down.  The food was satisfying and not overly filling.  My wallet felt a lot lighter too:  Dinner for two that night $155/including tip.  It was a great experience.  For a Friday night we waited just five minutes for a seat at the bar.  Perhaps it was beginners luck.  I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Alan W.
Reviews.Content: My family has eaten regularly at Sushi Gen for the past 15 years and spent many thousands of dollars here. The food is certainly good, but the level of service, particularly the incredibly rude guy who now plays the role of "host", has gotten worse and worse over the years. It culminated today with me calling the restaurant and letting them know 30 minutes in advance that we would be 5 minutes late for a 7:30 reservation, and the a-hole host telling me that our reservation is for 7:30 and if we show up at 7:35 we will be put at the end of a long waiting list and have to wait an 60-90 minutes. The ironic thing is that we've always showed up early or on time for reservations knowing about this very strange person's behavior...and often waited 30 minutes or more despite having a reservation. Given there are MANY good Japanese restaurants downtown and around the LA area, we have now decided never to eat at Sushi Gen again. They are crowded, rude and could care less about customers. Regardless of the food, what's the point of eating at a restaurant where they treat customers so badly?

Reviews.Author: Keran L.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Sushi Gen three times in the past 3 month, the first time I went I ordered the famous $15 sashimi lunch special. I went in after 1pm and got seated very fast at the sushi bar.( usually when you sit at the sushi bar during busy hours you have to order sushi/sashimi only, no lunch specials) I sat my kazu san, who is the best sushi chef at Sushi Gen. The sashimi lunch special was very good, and it was a lot of food and definitely very good price for $15. It's a must try, and you either get there super early or should just show up after 1:30p after the busy lunch crowd. The 2nd time I went there, I so happened to be sitting at my old spot by Kazu San and the family sat right beside me has been going there for around 20 years and the dad goes there regularly like twice a month ever since sushi gen opened in the 80's. So I over heard him talking about his sushi and he knows Kazu san, him and his family had ordered Omakase, which is basically to leave it to the chef to select what's good, and kazu san served them toro, uni, spanish mackerel etc... SO I had ordered toro, uni already and after I started talking to the family, I decided to get the Omakase too. I ended up eating a little much, and Paid over $70 for my lunch. I work a lot and I eat out almost everyday, since I'm such a foodie I pay for good food without a blink. It was an experience. I'm not going to say Sushi Gen has the best sushi in LA, but you get what you paid for. They do have very very fresh fish, because Toyo San, the other older sushi Chef personally knows the supplier so he makes sure he gets the best fish. Just the past monday, I brought my college best friend who is visiting from out of town. We went Omakase style, the toro is so gooood it melts in your mouth! along with other good sushi, and an order of hot house sake, it was $170 for the both of us before tips. We also happened to see/discovered Elijah Wood( frodo from Lord of The Rings) eating at the across from us on the other side of the sushi bar. Looked like he also enjoyed it with his lady friends. I even got a picture taken with him after he finished. Basically Sushi Gen is so popular for a reason. Don't hesitate, try it and you won't regret.

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: great sushi...have not yet been disappointed once. my only gripe would be the insane waiting you would have to go through if you don't go when they first open for the day.

Reviews.Author: Vivienne W.
Reviews.Content: The Uni here is so fresh and delicious...so was the sushi and sashimi. The wait for two was not bad...we waited about one hour for the table. You can only eat sashimi and sushi at the bar...so everyone is waiting for the table, but it's worth the long wait!!!

Reviews.Author: Tieng T.
Reviews.Content: It may seem pointless to review a place with over 100 reviews but I just had to pay homage to this wonderful place where great sashimi during lunch doesn't cost you your first born.  Although it may cost you an hour of your time to get seated, it's worth it!  So take that 2 hour lunch break and enjoy a taste of heaven.

Reviews.Author: Felice W.
Reviews.Content: love it, but maybe amateur sushi eaters should not sit at the bar.  some girl shoved my date while trying to sit down next to us, and when the chef asked what she wanted, she didn't know and said, "umm, is your fish fresh?"  yes, at one of the best sushi places in town!  i've sat at both the bar and the tables, and service was great both times, but if you're annoying, then they'll probably be annoyed at you.  there is no shame in not knowing that much about sushi, just sit at the tables and ask your waitress, don't waste the sushi chef's time at the bar, they're frikkin busy as hell.  and they are not nazis in anyway.  Nozawa stresses me out.  if you want ambience, go to R23.  if you want to pay a lot more, go to Sasabune.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: the best sushi and sashimi place to go!!! sashimi dinner combination is my best choice!

Reviews.Author: Dieter W.
Reviews.Content: very good food, though the waiter was a little bit unpatient, when we asked some questions

Reviews.Author: Annie P.
Reviews.Content: craved sushi on sunday night so decided to try sushi-gen on monday! we went for dinner and there was no wait but still  pretty packed.stuff we got: OYSTER(comes in about 7pieces) very fresssh, SEAFOOD SALAD:lots of melty-sashimi ontop of greeens, beef teriyaki dinner for my g.pa: this dish suprised me cause usually teriyaki dinners are jss grilled meat with lots of teriyaki sauce on it but this one was seriously like kobe beef-status. SO tender and there want any of that nasty-gooey-cheap teriyaki sauce. it was marinated and so flavourful! it comes with either tempura or sashimi. we got sashimi and they give you alot! now for SUSHIIIIII! we got a bunch..i've never seen so many varieties! dnt get your typical salmon-tuna-shrimp lalala try toro-hamachi belly,sweet shrimp-scallops, mackerel, so much morrrre! we got about 24 peices in total. they all melted in my mouth....mmmmm 24 peices came out to be about 80 dollars..well worth the QUALITY

Reviews.Author: Manali K.
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I had mutual, very intense cravings for sushi one night, so we drove down to little Tokyo in search of a new sushi find. I recalled that Sushi Gen was supposed to be a good place, so we wandered over to Honda Plaza and strolled into Sushi Gen. For a Tuesday, it was packed, and the only seats we could get without a wait were at the bar. We ordered piece after piece of nigiri and got an appetizer of softshell crab. Everything was extremely fresh. Standouts were the japanese snapper, dusted with yuzu and a light soysauce; the yellowtail belly, which was buttery and melted in my mouth; the salmon, and the halibut. The chef told us that a lot of the fish had been flown in from Japan, and I believed him.....each piece of sashimi or nigiri was unbelievably fresh. My roomie said she was still dreaming of the taste of the snapper hours later. Even the softshell crab was excellent for what it was, it was perfectly battered and fresh out of the deep fryer- hot and succulent. Only downsides...the service was a bit spotty at times...but I think this was due to the fact that there were few servers and the place was packed. Also, the bill came out to $73 for the two of us, which isn't bad for sushi that fresh, but I have had excellent experiences at Azami for a bit cheaper. Other than that, this place was great, and we will be back again!

Reviews.Author: Georgina L.
Reviews.Content: i really like this place... i don't like waiting for a table so when i saw the saturated crowd on sat night i was a little concerned but we were seated in less than 10 minutes.  the sushi was very fresh and very delicious.  between two people who only ordered sushi, the bill came out to about $57 without drinks and that's a pretty good deal with the amount of fresh sushi we consumed. will def go again =)

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this excellent sushi place twice, both for lunch on weekdays.  We sat at the bar both times as well. No line thankfully, but the joint was pretty full.  We opted for Omakase (trust the chef), and were treated to some of the finest quality fish I've had in the US.  The toro (fatty tuna) melted in my mouth... We ate for over an hour, and everything (uni, aji, shiro maguro, saba, sake...) was excellent except the hokkigai on my second visit, which was so-so. The chefs were very friendly and fun.   All in all, 5 stars because of the outrageously good fish... if it were any less good I'd take a star for the one so-so clam.

Reviews.Author: janice w.
Reviews.Content: this is my husband's all-time favorite sushi restaurant, and he's a hard critic when it comes to sushi.  the fish is always very fresh, and the food is very authentic.  it's always crowded when we come here though, so the wait is always very long.  if you find yourself downtown and craving sushi, we definitely recommend this place.  not cheap!!

Reviews.Author: Ashlyn N.
Reviews.Content: This amazing sushi bar should not be missed.  In a land of mediocre sushi, this place is a shining star of a standout.I have been coming to Sushi-Gen forever.  My grandfather was a famous sushi chef who wrote five Japanese cookbooks and was a complete traditional sushi purist.  When he was still alive, the only places he would go in J-Town were Sushi-Gen and Sushi Imai (now closed).  Now I'm ruined for all other sushi and have very high, traditional standards for sushi quality, authenticity and presentation (i.e., I HATE things like rainbow rolls, Safeway sushi, etc.).  The way to do Sushi Gen (and all other sushi) is by getting a seat at the bar.  This guarantees direct interaction with the chefs, and you get to see the quality and texture of the sushi you order.  (This is not a commentary on Sushi Gen, but on all sushi places: I generally think managers and chefs reserve the freshest, best cuts of sushi for people who are going to eat at the bar.  I think the assumption is that people who opt for a table are not really in it for the "true sushi experience" and probably aren't as discriminating with their sushi.  Also, people sitting at tables are (1) less likely to spend money and (2) are more likely to order sacrilegious things like teriyaki chicken.)  It is for this reason that I usually discount people's reviews when they sit at tables or think that the words "affordable" and "sushi" should go together somehow.  I prescribe to the view that sushi should be an authentic experience, where people take time to savor each unique pure fish flavor (rather than mixing them all together in some weird fusion roll), and people should resign themselves to paying good money for great service with amazingly fresh fish.OK, now that I'm off my sushi rant, here is more on Sushi Gen:At Sushi Gen, you should request to be seated at the bar in front of Toyo-San (he's the owner).  He will make you feel special and completely taken care of.  If you can't sit in front of him, don't worry.  All of his chefs were personally trained by him.  Toyo-san is a quiet guy but he really loves it when people love his sushi.  He's really adorable.  Sushi eating is not a rushed experience here.  You order each piece directly from the chef.  (I have been disheartened recently by the number of sushi bars that just pass you the sushi checklist and then prepare stuff in the back, and bring it all out at once).  The fish here gleam with freshness - they never have that dull, mealy texture that is so prevalent elsewhere.  Each piece is savored separately, and there is time between servings so you can cleanse your palate with ginger, tea, beer or sake.  Embrace it for the experience it is, and expect to spend at least an hour and a half here.The sush itself is great.  The warm sushi rice is made with the perfect amount of rice vinegar and sugar, and the sushi is very very fresh.  My grandpa used to say that Toyo-san's rice was fantastic and not like "inaka" (farmer) rice which tends to be harder in texture and lack the delicate vinegar flavoring.  There is also a very good fish-to-rice ratio.  I crave the toro here.  My mom's favorite is the aji ("the fishier the better!" as she says), and my dad goes crazy for the uni - smooth like buttah.  We also really appreciate nice touches that other sushi bars don't bother with - shiso leaf on top of the salmon sushi and FRESH amaebi with fried heads, for example.  The sauces are also not too overpowering for the fish.  This place does things right.  No green tea bag - the ocha is brewed.  Homemade miso soup - not out of a box.  Oshibori towels upon sitting down at the bar.  It's kind of sad that I used to take these touches for granted.I also really like the smallish, intimate atmosphere at Sushi Gen.  It seems strange to be in a tiny, forgotten J-Town strip mall.  But once you're inside, you feel a thrill like you've discovered something special.  I have watched Sushi Gen's popularity grow over the years and - although I feel like my hidden treasure is not so hidden anymore - I am pleased to see that it has graduated from a popular Downtown lunch spot to an in-demand dinner loaction.  It's no-frills, but very cozy - and you also stand a significant chance of spotting a celebrity.  This is a fantastic place to impress a first date with your knowledge of "cool authentic holes-in-the-wall".  Just be prepared to wait a bit - last time I went, they still weren't taking reservations.  The atmosphere at the sushi bar is broadly collegial - everyone feels privileged to be there.  I took my fiance there and in one trip, he changed from thinking "sushi is ok, but I don't see what the big deal is" to feeling like he'd never even had sushi until his experience at Sushi Gen.Finish up your experience with some mochi ice cream, invented by the local Hashimoto family at J-Town's Mikawaya bakery!

Reviews.Author: Veritas Lux Mea N.
Reviews.Content: ...i love sushi........the quality of the fish here is great....as traditional as it gets...the chef gives you what he feels like giving you...so if you dont LOVE sushi or know what 'good sushi' is.......don't bother coming here bc there is no 'ambiance'...i'd come back to ensure i wont get mercury poisoning :D

Reviews.Author: don c.
Reviews.Content: i like sushi gen. yes they did change owners a few years back and yes it is owned by a korean now. but does any of that matter? the food is still very good especially the lunch sashimi deal. although they give you a lot of tuna and not so much other stuff. you can only make tuna so many ways. thus the four stars. other than that come early and expect a wait at lunch unless you go at about 10:45 and wait to be first in line which actually saves you time.

Reviews.Author: Elafoodie W.
Reviews.Content: i have been goiong to Sushi Gen for over 20 years. i still consider it to be the best sushi restaurant in SoCal. The fish is always fresh, diverse, and expertly mae, and the other dishes like tempura are skillfully made. Don't be discouraged by the wait. It is well worth it. The atmosphere is wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwalways warm, inviting, and spirited.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: I never wrote reviews based on my experience with reservation or service, because I always felt food should come first in a restaurant review; but my latest experience with Sushi Gen reservation prompted this review.Even though I understand it is an immensely popular restaurant(and I've eaten there numerous times), it is after all a restaurant, a service industry catering to customers. I made a dinner reservation for 4 earlier in the day but 2 could not make it; so I called a few hours prior to change my reservation to 2 people. The response was that I would have to lose my table and start a new reservation for 2, for either an hour before or 2 hours after the original reserved time because the time slot for table for 2 was completely booked, and I could not have my original table. They will absolutely not accommodate us! Well, I will not go back even if it is the only sushi restaurant in LA!

Reviews.Author: S P.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic sushi!! As fresh as it can get!! LA has some of the outstanding sushi places - this clearly makes the top 5.

Reviews.Author: trogdor b.
Reviews.Content: not bad, but not crazy delicious either. we waited 45 minutes for the bar and ordered omakase, which cost us about $65 a head. it's good, but you can find comparable sushi without the crowds.

Reviews.Author: Karen H.
Reviews.Content: I went to Sushi Gen for the first time last Thursday and I can say that am 100% satisfied! It was completely packed with a half an hr wait when I arrived. As soon as I saw all the Japanese business men here somehow I felt it picked a pretty authentic spot. We opted to sit at the sushi bar and we thought the best way to go was omakase. Every piece of fish was extremely fresh. We started out with regular tuna and toro, yellowtail and yellowtail belly ( my fav), freshwater eel and giant clam, red snapper, albacore, uni ( sooooo sweet), scallops from Japan, and some tuna cut rolls with cucumber rolls with shiso leaves. I usually am not a fan of these plain rolls but I thought they were fantastic. There were a couple other pieces that I think I forgot. Along with that we had 2 bottles of sake. The bill came out to be $115 which I thought was a complete bargain. I typically pay around 80-$125 for omakase. The only negative thing I would say about the place is probably that their selection of fish is not as exotic as say Sushi Zo. But the price for sushi at Sushi Zo is is pretty much doubled. I was a little worried that the Chef may have went a little conservative on us because I was with a non Asian person. We really enjoyed this Sushi joint and will definitely return. Their sake list is AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Daphne C.
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that the fish is fresh here. This is my third or fourth time here. It is never my first choice but my second or third. This past visit, we tried the kampachi collar which was very enjoyable. The uni was exceptional and the hamachi was very good. The prices are steeper but that's not the reason for my lack of enthusiasm for this restaurant. The food is solid but the experience feels like you've been thrown into a large herd or a big tour group... people are pushing you to move a certain direction whilst all you want to do is slow down a bit and enjoy the view.  For some reason I get that same feeling I do when sales people try to push me to buy (or expect me to spend a certain amount of money) while sitting at the sushi bar. Maybe it's because there is a pretty good ratio of sushi chefs to customers and you almost feel like they're impatient waiting for your order. The sushi chef's aren't unfriendly but they aren't as personable (although the guys helping the sushi chefs in the back are pretty jovial) as I would have liked. The restaurant overall has a hectic and business-like environment. Try going during the week when it's less busy and when there may be more personality.

Reviews.Author: Quin D.
Reviews.Content: Fish is fresh and so delicious. Service is friendly and prompt. You can not order regular menu item if you sit at the counter. However, appetizers are ok. Sushi is expensive but worth it. Regular menu items are so so, kinda expensive in my opinion. The place is always crowded so be prepared to wait for a long time. You get 3 hour free parking with validation.

Reviews.Author: Sarah T.
Reviews.Content: This was great particularly for the value -- Sashimi Dinner included large plate of sashimi + miso soup + tempura for less than $30 I believe.  The plate of sashimi included mostly variations of tuna but no salmon except for a cooked piece, which was disappointing as cooked salmon is really common.  The pieces of tuna were mildly fatty-- just the way I like it (and just the way I've heard the Japanese like it).  The tempura was delightful - light, crispy, vegetables not soggy.  The wait was horrible though.  Make a reservation if you can.  Sit at the bar for sushi only (no dinner menu options).  Table next to me had an Uni dinner which looked yummy - like a whole box of uni for ~$36-40 I think.  They also serve Iced Green Tea which is matcha (?) in water and ice (unsweetened).  Parking in their lot requires a fee I think.  I went on a weekday and found street parking after circling a few times.

Reviews.Author: Jim J.
Reviews.Content: Come on people, this is the real deal.  If you want the freshest sushi served a la carte, come to this place and sit at the sushi bar.  Either tell the sushi chef what you want or order the Omikase.  That is definitely the way to go at this place for one of the best sushi experiences in LA.  If you're getting a table to entertain friends, talk, etc., you can still order sushi nagiri or sashimi, but this fish is so fresh that its taste changes from the time it goes from the sushi chef to your table 25 feet away.  Seriously.  Don't get me wrong, it will still be better than 99% of all sushi served in LA, but it won't be primo.  Also their dinner specials of sashimi, sushi, tempura, and teriyaki are all extremely solid.  My only gripe is the sashimi dinner is a little bit tuna heavy, and for some of us, we'd like to spread the love around a little bit.  Also, if you're expecting antics, fire, dark lighting, or indoor waterfalls, you will be let down.  Sushi Gen does not do anything except create a clean, comfortable, well lit environment for you to sample the freshest fish available.  If you want theatrics, try Wokcano, Sushi Roku, or the like.  But, you won't have fish like this.

Reviews.Author: Terah G.
Reviews.Content: incredible mouth watering sushi!  a must eat!

Reviews.Author: Travis S.
Reviews.Content: Authentic and unbelievable. I haven't had sushi this good since I was in Japan.

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: Today was a disappointment.  We had a party of 5, but my brother in-law was pulling into the parking lot and we 4 of us sat first.  They notice we were missing one of 5 and said, we can't sit you.  We were already sat down and he gave us a minute.  I went outside to get him and by the time I get back, the host asked my folks and sister get up and wait.  He gave our tables to another party of 3.  I was so upset.  He said it's not fair to sit us when all party was not here and it was only 2 minutes.  He made us get off the table and made us wait another 15-20 minutes for another table.  The food was always premium, I come here enough times, given very generous gratuity every single time.  So, basically he can be unfair to us, but he doesn't want to be unfair to others.  We were embarrassed and people saw us sat down and get up after 2-3 minutes sitting down.  This is the worst service from a restaurant host ever.  Despite the disrespectful host, I still gave my fair gratuity today because the rest of the service is fine and I don't like making others suffer because of one uneducated idiot.

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: The habilbut fin sushi was great, as was the needle fish but the best was the toro and the hamachi belly. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: K F.
Reviews.Content: Solid sushi place- fish is always fresh, prices are acceptable.   Often can be crowded, especially at lunch.  As noted, parking can be ridiculous.  Usually has sushi combo specials.  On the whole, above average in comparison to the numberous joints in LA.

Reviews.Author: bobby b.
Reviews.Content: this place is awsome..  best experiance i've had at a sushi bar.. will be back

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: My favorite Japanese restaurant. Always delicious! But always a long wait.

Reviews.Author: K C.
Reviews.Content: great fresh sushi that made up for the long waitsordered the sashimi dinner, monk fish liver, toro....everything tasted great.\\

Reviews.Author: soplayedout t.
Reviews.Content: this place is good because they are consistent..always fresh fish..the sushi rice is always spot on..right amount of sweet and sour..texture is good too..not too sticky or dry..their spicy tuna roll is the bomb..way to frickin pricey tho..come on..$250 for two people..and we didnt even drink..f that..

Reviews.Author: Adam H.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi.. they do everything right so expect a line..

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: toro sashimi was delicious but pricey. the mixed sashimi plate was good too.

Reviews.Author: daniel s.
Reviews.Content: I cannot deny that the sushi here is excellent.  However, the people that work there are rude.  Several times I have gone there, they are trying to enforce their 4 sushi order minimum per person when I sit at the sushi bar.  They have not charged me extra for not meeting the minimum but they are very rude and pushy in trying to enforce this and have threatened that next time they will charge me.  I am sorry but after having miso soup and an appetizer, I can only do about two or three sushi orders.  It's ridiculous.  I cannot have a good experience at a restaurant when the sushi chief and waitress are berating me for not meeting their 4 sushi minimum order requirement.  There won't be any next time because I just don't go there anymore.

Reviews.Author: cyndi t.
Reviews.Content: alright so i came here with my boyfriend and since everyone likes the sushimi here we decided to come. we order the large sushimi plate for $30. that was not good at all. the fish was not fresh, in fact the fish got me sick. The only thing that was good was the albacore tataki but there was only a few pieces for $15. overall the food was overprice and deceiving. the service: people were generally nice but since we came late for lunch they should have told us that the kitchen was about to close in 20 minutes. they didnt bother getting us tea or asking us if we want seconds. all they did was handed us our bill without asking if the food is great or not.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: Waited one hour for a table at lunch because the host lost our name on the waiting list. Then our waitress wrote down things we didn't even mention. Great food as always but def a bad experience

Reviews.Author: J P.
Reviews.Content: Great sushi place but a tad stressful if you don't have a reservation.  the fish is good - the a la carte fish is better in my experience than the sushi set packages.

Reviews.Author: Anony M.
Reviews.Content: The tables were closed and we were sat at the bar.  We were not allowed to order the lunch special and was not given the price for the sushi.  We ordered without knowing how much each piece cost.  We ate about 30 pieces total and the bill was $200.  Each piece averaged $7, so a set of two pieces is $14, plus tax and tip.  A piece of fish with a gob of rice is not worth $10 a piece.  We left hungry.  Each piece was seven times the cost of the usual, but the sushi was not seven times as good as the usual.

Reviews.Author: Crystal K.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi in LA. The fish is always fresh and the prices are awesome. You have to order the toro and uni if you want a party in your mouth. The Toro literally melts in your mouth. The sashimi plate at lunch is only $15 and you get sooooo much food. FYI the bar is very pricey so wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Argie M.
Reviews.Content: great,fresh and tasty sushi fast service good prices

Reviews.Author: Don G.
Reviews.Content: I have been looking to go here and see what the excitement was about. Plus I love sushi. Located in a strip mall in the Honda plaza. My first suggestion would be to try to come early. The parking lot gets full. I was fortunate enough to find a spot in the side of the mall. This was during lunch time. Place was packed. Well a little overflowing. I have no clue how long the wait was since I met my wife and friend and they were already sitting down. Browsed the menu and looked around on the other tables. I noticed 80% were ordering the sashimi platter. Also noticed that each person is required to order $10 minimum. Most of their stuff is traditional sushi. So you fancy rolls and the eek it's not cooked folks may no find this place to your liking. So me and the wife decided on one sashimi platter and one teriyaki salmon/sashimi combo to share. The food came and we enjoyed every piece and every slice. The teriyaki salmon was cooked just right. The sashimi melts in your mouth and is so fresh. I was surprised because between the sashimi, teriyaki, soup, and rice. I was full and satisfied. I have finally found a gem in Downtown. If your looking for real sushi this is your stop. I will be back over and over again.....

Reviews.Author: PY K.
Reviews.Content: So I've decided to write about all the places that either have been truly outstanding or ones that I would never step in again (in case we post a recognizable photo)...regardless of when the last time I was there.  Sushi Gen is your no-frills sushi bar/restaurant....and I miss this place sorely.  And having read some of the reviews, it seems that they have not skipped a beat.  FRESH, FRESH, FRESH.  (Although I still never got why they serve that piece of cooked fish...could it have been yesterday's special?)  I faithfully ate at this place as often as I could with my coworkers starting about 9 years ago (oops.  I just aged myself.  Anyway, who can pass up a super fresh sashimi lunch, when you're only making beans, counting beans...I love you, my old TCW buddies, our long lunches...oh, those were the days...sigh).   Then it all came to an abrupt stop about 3 years ago, not b/c I changed jobs or stopped working in downtown....but b/c #1 came along, and when I tried to go after #1 was born, I was denied twice  b/c they were closed for lunch for remodeling?!  (so this place better look drastically different)  Then #2 came along, and...yes, now it's been 3 long agonizing years of separation.  It doesn't help when the Husband gloats when he eats lunch here.  Anyway, I was debating whether I wanted to write about this little gem of a restaurant and have my little secret plastered for the world wide web to see...b/c it seems that more often than not, when I ask people about this place, it seems they have not heard of it.  But shoot...80+ reviews already?! this secret has been blown wide open...in fact, half of you folks who have written reviews already, I'll probably see in line if I ever make it out there again....so I hope to see you real soon!

Reviews.Author: Bryant L.
Reviews.Content: Quality sushi at $15 for their lunch special. I gave up on finding a better deal.

Reviews.Author: Ross R.
Reviews.Content: great quality fish.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: sushi gen is good. slightly over priced...but quite fresh...and lots of variety.

Reviews.Author: claudia k.
Reviews.Content: hands down my FAVORITE restaurant by far....  always so fresh, i never walk out disappointed.  my husband introduced me to this place about 5 years ago and we go back at least once or twice a month.  you MUST sit at the bar and order tho... totally worth the wait!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: sashimi cravings? this is the place!

Reviews.Author: L C.
Reviews.Content: This place should really be 3 1/2 stars but since there isn't that function, i'm gonna have to round down. I ordered the $15 sashimi lunch plate which was very filling...couldn't finish it because there was so much fish and I like how they give you a lot of seaweed instead of the usual alfalfa sprouts or radish. The fish was very fresh and although tuna-heavy, still quite tasty. I wish they had included mackerel instead of some of the mounds of tuna but oh well! It seems like this place might be one of those sushi nazi places because there were a bunch of signs at the front including one for no cell phones and no substitutions. Sharing is also apparently frowned upon because there is a $10 minimum for each person so if you share, you will still pay at least $10. I would go back and try their sushi lunch special but will wait until I am particularly hungry for it cos by the looks of the sashimi plate, there will be a lot of pieces. One big negative was the additional charge of $1 for ponzu sauce!?!? Who ever heard of such a thing?! This is why I am rounding down and not up...There should be an option because I do not use the soy sauce as I find it too salty for sashimi and like the lighter taste of ponzu.

Reviews.Author: Lynn L.
Reviews.Content: Solid, authentic, delicious sushi! I had high hopes and wasn't disappointed. Will be returning the next time I have a sushi itch to scratch.

Reviews.Author: kiomi k.
Reviews.Content: great fish. great sushi. great unagi lunch special. this place is always a hit. expensive tho. i think its worth it.

Reviews.Author: Christina K.
Reviews.Content: ended up waiting 2 hours and the sushi wasn't even THAT great.  maybe i  didn't order the right thing or i'm letting the wait time cloud my judgement, but i've definitely experienced better.

Reviews.Author: x x.
Reviews.Content: very fresh, generously sized sashimi, with a good selection of unusual fish not typically found in many places.  the uni though i'm not sure was 100% fresh -it may have come from a box but was still good! the kanpachi was melt in your mouth awesome!  Was here with friends who eat, talk, and walk way faster than me.  will have to come back and eat slowly :)

Reviews.Author: Sara L.
Reviews.Content: yummmmm, the lunch special is delicious!!!

Reviews.Author: A. K.
Reviews.Content: Excellent sushi! The best sushi in downtown by far. I've been eating here for years and the sushi is always consistently high grade & fresh! The service is excellent. Its a little pricier than some of the other sushi restaurants in the area but well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Sandy H.
Reviews.Content: Went here last night for dinner and we had a reservation so they sat us within a few minutes (there were a bunch of people outside waiting so....make a reservation!). The service was good. We were sat quickly, orders taken quickly, food came out quickly, wait staff refilled our waters, and we didn't feel at all rushed even with the crowd waiting outside. The first thing they brought us was some cold pickled noodle and miso soup.  We ordered the clams as appetizer and tried some monkfish liver too. The clams came in a broth and was not that good. The monkfish liver was interesting and really had a soft melt in your mouth texture to it. For dinner we ordered the Sashimi dinner and the Sushi Deluxe Combination. It came with shrimp and vegetable tempura w/sauce (good), bowl or sushi rice, salmon skin salad (salmon skin not crunchy), muzuku with nagaimo, and miso soup. The toro was really good and melt in your mouth but everything else was okay. I think Sushi Gen is on the expensive side $$$ and not worth the wait. Although from what I've heard about the $15 lunch special that might be worth it. My boyfriend said that this place has changed and it's not as good as it used to be.

Reviews.Author: Sing T.
Reviews.Content: Went here for my brothers birthday party. The sushi is good and so is the service. The only drawback is that the oysters could be better. Some people might like it creamy, but to me it tasted a little chalky. The warm sake came out hot to the touch. The sushi was fresh and good. Everything tasted good. The mochi ice cream appeared to come from a box that you can buy at trader joes or any asian suppermarket. All in all, it was a fun time there.

Reviews.Author: Phoebe P.
Reviews.Content: Hyped up.Yes, the fish is fresh and the wait is insane, but I've definitely been to better sushi places around LA. Maybe it's my taste buds, but the fish were OKAY. They didn't entice me like Sushi Go 55 or Sugar Fish. I had the sashimi dinner and my boyfriend had the nigiri sampler. Nothing really stood out except for the salmon and albacore. Of course, everything was good -- but nothing's making me want to come back here. The prices are expected, so no complaints. However, I wish it wowed me. I had always been dying to try it out due to rave reviews, but I can say that my curiosity was disappointed.I went here on a date with my boy, and it was a great spot. Lots of couples and families were there. The environment is nice, and the service is great.However, if you've never been here, go try it for kicks. You may like it as it does have the quality meant for sushi. My boyfriend liked it better than me too!For me though, Sushi-Gen didn't leave its mark :(

Reviews.Author: T H.
Reviews.Content: best sushi ever. go for lunch and get the sashimi special. i promise u wont regret it!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jen X.
Reviews.Content: i think they named this place after me but got the spelling wrong.last night at dinner here i said, "this is the only place i ever want to eat sushi from now on'. i will seriously throw a shit fit if anybody tries to make me eat at another sushi restaurant.going by the customer recommendations we tried the toro, yellow tail belly and some others.the toro was so good we ordered another round and i told the table, 'are you ready for me to have another mouth orgasm?'the fish here is so fresh it's the kind that makes you close your eyes, chew slowly and make happy noises.our waitress was great and a little sassy in a fun way, when i ordered natto her eyes got big and she asked if i liked natto. i told her i loved natto and she brought me my little dish of fermented sticky soy beans with a smile.luckily i will be living in the neighborhood so i can have sushi gen whenever i want.the prices are very very good especially for the quality, 3 of us ate and drank and were past full for a little over $100.arigato sushi gen

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: whenever there's a special family occasion, we go here.  great sushi, great service.  get the family platter.

Reviews.Author: Paulie B.
Reviews.Content: Review # 478 for Sushi Gen...After a 3 day debacle of jury service that book-ended my 4th of July weekend, i was finally free (excused) and decided to celebrate by trying Sushi Gen for the first time.  It was noon, a Monday, and the place was jammed.  As a first timer, the host explained that the lunch menu could not be accessed at the sushi bar (which was relatively empty), and that explained the long wait for a table.  Not having 30 extra minutes to kill, we opted for the sushi bar and stuffed our faces with lots of fresh, delicious sushi.  However, having deviated from the lunch menu, we racked up $102 in charges(no, i don't weigh 200 pounds and yes, for those of us not producing $100MM films or making any substantial income, that's really expensive--i felt the bite).  The sushi is great, the service is automatic and chilly but effective, and the interior is quite comfortable.  I think the place is great, but it's pricey, and frankly the sushi is just as good at Komasa and much, much cheaper.   Plus, the service at Komasa is friendlier.  Unfortunately, Komasa is not open for lunch, so if you have a hankering for raw fish, and you're downtown, you won't be disappointed by Sushi Gen, but if you are there for lunch and don't have money busting out of your pockets, you might want to wait for table.

Reviews.Author: taro b.
Reviews.Content: I ordered omakase and spent a whooping $90 each including tips (my bf just had a small bottle of asahi). Some of the dishes live up my goodness sushi experience at Tsukiji market in Japan while others don't. I definitely have no regret spending that much for a meal but I'm not too fond with their service.

Reviews.Author: Jen T.
Reviews.Content: I never thought I'd say this but I actually was so full off sushi I didn't think I could eat anymore sushi for another month. Ok I take it back, maybe a week or so, but still, that was a LOT of food. I went for dinner and we got chirashi and sashimi deluxe. Plus an extra order of the Spanish mackerel and the sweet shrimp. Sweet shrimp was awesome, comes with fried crispy heads. But seriously, way too much food. The fish were all very fresh, and the sashimi deluxe was ginormous. We probably could've split one of those and just kept the 2 extra orders of sushi. I never thought I'd get to the point where I couldn't eat one more bite of sashimi. I also didn't know what kind of fish I was eating near the end, but I tried the toro off the sashimi deluxe. Didn't really "melt in my mouth" like people say toro is, but then again I never was a huge tuna fan. With all that food bill came out around $100. Of course, you can also go in and order California rolls and chicken teriyaki but seriously, come here for the sashimi and sushi it's more worth it.

Reviews.Author: CL L.
Reviews.Content: compared to others, its still up there but not a 5. Still the best toro tho.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: for some reason I've been going to sushi gen more often. like twice a week more often. if i had someone to go with more often i would. it just embarrassing eating by yourself at a table. the sushi by far is really high quality sushi. if you haven't been. you must go. everyone has their own sushi spot.... I'm not telling you to change but at least try this place and you might just convert. get the sashimi lunch special....

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: i hate their lunch lines, but their sashimi lunch special is worth the wait i guess, sigh

Reviews.Author: Joan T.
Reviews.Content: the sushi is just amazing! it just pretty much melts in your mouth. sadly its a bit on the expensive side, but if do go, get the lunch special. and note that you cant order menu items if you sit by the bar. i got the lunch special ($15) and the beef teriyaki combo with sashimi ($17) plus hot green tea (about $2). the beef looked like steak! not like those thin dried up pieces! the service was really good too. they helped us babysit our to-go box when we went to the restroom too. but be prepared to wait at least 30mins to get a table and thats just on a weekday too. i dont know where you can park aside from the honda plaza, and thats $1.50/20mins and $9 all day. so get it validated when youre in there, $2 off!

Reviews.Author: Andy C.
Reviews.Content: The best sushi I've had in LA. Everything is so fresh and the sushi chefs know how to cut up their fish. I recommend the uni, the natto roll, and the miso soup with the red snapper head. But everything was great. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Author: Zane L.
Reviews.Content: great sushi..not cheap but really fresh and good.... usually a wait but worth it.  and yes the lunch special sashimi is the real deal there.

Reviews.Author: Betty W.
Reviews.Content: Like all mediocre reviews, I will start by saying "I don't understand what the hype is about." I've been here three times: twice for lunch and once for dinner. For lunch, I have tried the sushi bar and the sashimi special (to go). The only thing that had the WOW factor for me was the red snapper (it is twice as expensive as other sushi joints though), the amaebi (sweet shrimp), and the toro. But I can't afford to order red snapper & toro everytime since those two things cost already $20 and that's only 4 pieces. I still need to eat another 6 or so pieces to get full. You order the ankimo (fish liver) and you are only presented with two pieces or mediocre stuff - it's not even silky smooth as it should be. The Salmon Skin salad was horrible. On top of a skimpy salad are pieces of rubbery and soft pieces of what should be "crispy salmon skin". For dinner, it came out to about $50 per person without ordering toro. For lunch, it came out to be $80 per person when order toro and all the good stuff. So you can make your own judgement call. Personally, I would prefer other places but I'd like to keep it a secret so it doesn't get as packed as sushi gen is everyday. :)

Reviews.Author: Cheryl J.
Reviews.Content: highly rated and well known thus even when i went there before it opened in the morning, there was already a line and we still waited about 30 minutes.i got the $15 sushi combo and it was really fresh and delicious.however, i never went back because the freshness or food flavor are not worth the horrendous parking situation in little tokyo and the crazy wait.Good sushi though which explains my high rating...

Reviews.Author: J. D.
Reviews.Content: More upscale spot in Little Tokyo.  Get there early for lunch because there's almost always a wait.  I recommend the sashimi platter, bomb!

Reviews.Author: J J.
Reviews.Content: Stuffed my face at this place with my family.  It was a bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.  The fish was fresh and the tempura was fried just right.

Reviews.Author: CE C.
