Reviews.Content: It's not like this placer needs another review, however everyone is right, prepare for a long wait.  We could not believe the wait at lunch when so many other places in the area were empty.  When we were finally seated we both ordered the sashimi deluxe that came with miso soup, tofu, rice, and pickled veggies.  Now the sashimi came with yellowtail, tuna, kampachi, more tuna octupus, seaweed.  It also had cooked items including salmon and tuna.  Our favorite probably was the spicy tuna since they used chilis mixed in the tuna.  I didn't care for any of the cooked items, however all the cuts were big and melted in your mouth! Definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: I went here for dinner and I must say its a different type of japanese food. I would say its more traditional. Few rolls and more main entrees and sashimi. The food was delicious and they gave you plenty. Service was superb. Food was fresh and the tea was yummy! I would go here again if I was in the neighborhood. I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan K.
Reviews.Content: A billion reviews can't be wrong, so I gave this place a shot. The only minus I can give this place is the long wait. A 35 minute wait for lunch? This is kind of silly. Anyways I waited it out because I had already driven to get here. We were seated in a packed restaurant and decided to try the $15 Sashimi plate that everyone on yelp had recommended. It started out with tofu and hot miso soup. Excellente! Then came the sashimi plate, and I was blown away. I rarely come out of sushi place stuffed but I gotta say, this time by belly was full of yummy succulent raw fishies! Each corner of the plate had some different little fishy that had its own unique flavor. Had it not been for the long wait I would have given this place 5 starts, but you got to take these things into account. I guess if you come here early u can beat the rush.

Reviews.Author: Woojae L.
Reviews.Content: I can't get enough of this place. The sushi just melts in you mouth. I'm always in search of new sushi joints but this place will definitely be hard to top.

Reviews.Author: A C.
Reviews.Content: The sushi is so fresh.  They only have the traditional pieces and none of the americanized rolls.  The place is a little small and beware it gets super busy so you must make a reservation.  I will definitely coming back again and again.  Also the prices are a little bit more expensive than your average sushi bars.

Reviews.Author: Eric V.
Reviews.Content: best sushi ever!!!!

Reviews.Author: Ji Eun K.
Reviews.Content: Great lunch specials.  They charge for everything, including ginger, which sucks.  But their fish is so good, you can't help but to come back.

Reviews.Author: Christina H.
Reviews.Content: fresh & great price for the freshness.if you go for the bar, you can be seated faster, but there is a minimum of 4 orders.

Reviews.Author: Dth S.
Reviews.Content: omggggggg omggggg omggggg I LOVE THIS PLACE!! kisskissssss.... :) (just don't get anything that has too much rice in it, per these pictures people have posted- stick with the fish!)

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: i love their sushi deluxe combination with salmon skin salad and mozudi. Delish!! Their service can be better, I had to flag two waitress and a manager to place our orders. And I hate their parking lot, too small for a busy plaza!! Sorry but they lose 2 stars.

Reviews.Author: Petra L.
Reviews.Content: Sushi-Gen serves very fresh fish, well prepared and nicely presented - by far one of the best Sushi I've had. Why only three stars? The place is extremely busy and it is the owner's goal to get as many people in and out of the restaurant in one night as possible. If you reserve a table and don't show up exactly on time, believe me I am a very punctual person, your table is gone. Also, there is no time for you to sit at the table and finish the conversation with your friends once you have swallowed the last piece of your food. The servers have the guts to tell you to leave, which, in my opinion, is not only extremely rude but also unforgivable.

Reviews.Author: Joanna S.
Reviews.Content: hands down, the freshest sashimi in california. since they have such great business, the turnaround rate for their seafood is quick, keeping them fresh.  parking could be a little difficult and the hours are strange.  call beforehand to make sure they're open.

Reviews.Author: Electric E.
Reviews.Content: Its good. Not great.  The sashimi lunch special is very good for the price, only if it includes toro.  I've had lunch and dinner here and both instances, the fish was good but not mouth watering.  Their tempura is just average, and their sushi deluxe is not worth it compared to the sashimi special.  I might need to try the omakase one of these days to fully enjoy the other fish variety.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: The fish was as good as others have suggested.  I sat at the sushi bar and the chef was attentive and pleasant.   It's not inexpensive, but for the quality, the prices are fair.

Reviews.Author: michael t.
Reviews.Content: ehh, not worth the wait.  The sashimi deluxe is the end pieces that they mush together and call tar tar.  I've had better quality for the price.  I'll say though, their fried shrimp tempura and vegetable tempura is good.  we spent about $350 for 6 people and did not leave full or content.

Reviews.Author: Aline Y.
Reviews.Content: It's pretty expensive here, but so worth it.  The sashimi deluxe is awesome! The fish is sooo fresh and delicious.  I am sooo glad to have found this place.

Reviews.Author: kasey o.
Reviews.Content: my favorite sushi bar in LA.  great food, nice interior, great location, great price.  doesnt get much better than this

Reviews.Author: J. S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the better sushi restaurants in Little Tokyo. The sashimi is usually of above average quality here and you sure pay extra for the quality. The downside is the wait - sometimes I wonder if I should go for a snack before I go there. The service could also use some improvement as well. I often feel the waitress/waiter could not wait for us to leave no matter how much food we order. I would have given this place 5 stars if it weren't for the wait and the service.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I had best sushi here. Either make a reservation or get there early before they open and line up to avoid ridiculously long wait. This place felt like a real authentic place because people waiting in line early were mostly Japanese.

Reviews.Author: Markus H.
Reviews.Content: totally overrated - except I have to give the Chirashi props. still, go to Komasa. it's alot better.

Reviews.Author: Geno S.
Reviews.Content: What's that idiom, you get what you pay for? Yea, you do. Expensive but the BOSS of sushi joints in all of LA. If you feel like splurging, go here. If not, go to Hama.

Reviews.Author: mobina a.
Reviews.Content: Very bad service.  We had to wait forever for a table, it seemed like the hostess was sitting people he knew first.  Then when we questioned it, he said "i get you table."  They seem to favor certain people.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence W.
Reviews.Content: I eat a lot of sushi and have been to great ones, bad ones and everything in between. We went to this one on a recommendation of a friend, who raved about this place, but does not have a lot of experience with a lot with sushi.First, we had one issue with service. We went with a friend to this place to celebrate her birthday. Since my wife is pregnant we usually bring a bottle of water for her just to be on the safe side. I always order drink for myself anyhow and no restaurants (including all of the other sushi restaurants) have had any issues about it until Sushi Gen. When we were seated the waitress promptly said no outside drinks. We explained the situation, but she was very, very insistent. We agreed to buy water from her since she said that they sell bottled water. She brings the menu which has the water selection that they sell. We ask for one of those that has a familiar name (Evian), but she said they didn't have any. We asked for another one, Perrier (I think) and again they didn't have any. The only ones they actually had were a unidentifiable bottle of water from some small unknown country and sparkling water.  Still they were not understanding about my pregnant wife's request.We go ahead and order the sushi dinners and a teriyaki dinner for my pregnant wife (who unfortunately cannot eat sushi for the time being). I would say that they were pretty ordinary among decent sushi restaurants. Nothing special about the quality nor the selection. It was okay. The quality, cut, and lack of anything special about the sushi definitely did not warrant the price. I've paid more for sushi many times, but it was way better and I've had this level of sushi, often for less money.So the issue would be that they don't offer value for the price that they charge. It's not that it's bad sushi, it's that you can get better for the same money or you can spend less for the same thing.

Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: Sure, there are hipper places in the Westside-Bev Hills area and Sushi Row in the Valley, but you can't beat this Little Tokyo institution if your thing is the fish going into your mouth and not who might be sitting three chairs down from you at the bar.  For someone like me, a sushi lover who is willing to spend a few bucks on a good meal provided the quality-to-cost ratio is in line, it doesn't get better than this in the city. Don't play games by sitting at a table and ordering all that other superfluous stuff you can get in any other Japanese restaurant. Do it right. Sit at the bar with a special someone (and one other couple, tops) and get the sushi--no hand rolls, no sashimi... come on, who are you kidding? Sure, you can order some oshinko, miso soup, and tempura for your date (and friends) if you must, but stay focused on what you've come for: a pure sushi experience... Luv the absence of pretense in this place. Luv the odd mix of Downtown business-types and lawyers thrown together with Silver Lake/Echo Park exiles, Japanese/Chinese hipsters, and multi-generation Nisei families in shorts and t-shirts. Definitely, my kind of place.

Reviews.Author: Wandi W.
Reviews.Content: fresh sashimi and  grill mirugai , very good japanese food , worth for wait  30 minute

Reviews.Author: Susan Y.
Reviews.Content: i've only been to this place once and i did not pay for it. haha so it was worth it for me.lol . overall this place is a legit sushi restaurant. it is quite pricey so if you dont mind spending a little more than usual for sushi give it a try. spicy tuna is pretty good. salmon is good. overall quality of sushi is legit. just eat fast food after you buy sushi cuz you'll need to save up. LOL jk

Reviews.Author: vicky c.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place. Getting close to 900 reviews with 4 1/2 stars rating lured me to give this place a try. Went for lunch on Monday, no wait. Had the Sashimi Deluxe (double the portion of sashimi lunch + 5 pieces of extremely chewy low grade toro), uni sushi, ankimo appetizer, albacore sashimi and two rolls (spicy tuna and california). Considering the price of the sashimi deluxe ($30), the portion was generous but I didn't find the fish of that great of a quality (as most reviewers mentioned). The fish has a lack of taste (since it was served straight from the freezer) and there is no bite to it. The uni sushi tasted just like the supermarket packaged uni but with a 1000% markup. Ankimo appetizer was served warm and thank goodness tasted decent. Albacore sashimi was a total rip-off ($21 for 6 tiny slices of supermarket quality frozen fish). Don't order it!! The rolls were okay. If you happen to pop by Little Tokyo and wanted a cheap sashimi lunch, this is the place for you (and I strongly believe the $15 sashimi lunch is why this place got such high ratings). However, if you want quality raw fish, please go elsewhere. I'm not happy spending over $100 for lunch here, should have go to my main man Sushi Masu instead!

Reviews.Author: Aidin Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is nearly perfect every time.

Reviews.Author: Tif Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is a good traditional sushi spot.  Its def not the best sushi I've ever had, but it is very good and so is the service.  They also have some good deals on the menu, like the sashimi dinner.  Call ahead to make a reservation, or plan to wait forever-- the place is small and very busy.

Reviews.Author: Just S.
Reviews.Content: If you want excellent sushi at a great price during lunch, come here but beware of the wait or come before the lunch crowd.  Their Sashimi Lunch is unbeatable.  I work up the street and would come more often but I only have an hour for lunch.  Dinner is significantly more expensive, but the best quality.

Reviews.Author: Laura K.
Reviews.Content: Super delicious.  Love the food.  Love the area.  You really feel like you are in for the real deal! I would recommend this place without hesitation! :)

Reviews.Author: R C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, this one is worth the hype.

Reviews.Author: Toohigh D.
Reviews.Content: if u want some real sushi,,,,not like california roll...gen is the best.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: The sushi here is premium quality, really fresh. I ordered the Sushi Deluxe Combo to try out the basics - tuna, yellowtail, mackerel. Not the cheapest place out there, but considering the primo quality of the food it's an excellent value. A little bit of a wait (30 minutes) but it was worth it. I'll definitely come back to try out some of the more exotic selections on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Sandy C.
Reviews.Content: Popular Jap restaurant in the area with reasonable price. Ordered the Uni set....loaded with uni on a fancy plate. Sashimi is fresh. Down to earth Japanese food. Nothing too creative about it tho.  I dropped by the supermarket next doors and highly suspect they got their uni box from the same distributer or something.

Reviews.Author: Fiddle S.
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid gogo swings and misses again here - Sushi-Gen is middle of the road, fairly touristy fare. Not a bad room, but the sushi is just so/so. Hama, around the corner is quite a bit better - but unlike Sushi-Gen - it's only a sushi bar, not much cooked except fish collar and eel.

Reviews.Author: ares m.
Reviews.Content: Must try.

Reviews.Author: mike b.
Reviews.Content: simply the best. there is no equal in los angeles. i've been to 'em all and no place even comes close to Gen. freshest fish in town.-deluxe sashimi platter for nights when you don't want to cough up $60/pop on sushi. good enough for 2 people to get their fill. comes w/ toro! i hear the lunch specials are awesome as well.-always get the yellowtail, halibut, toro, uni, scallop, mushroom miso, and whatever kind of cheek they have that evening.

Reviews.Author: Jessica W.
Reviews.Content: fresh sushi. amazing prices. the best sushi ever, hands down.

Reviews.Author: Alfred H.
Reviews.Content: Super fresh sushi, highly recommend this place, but due to the long wait during peak hours, I'd rather come during off hours.  Had the best toro at this place, but really puts a dent in the wallet... time to save up for another visit later this year!  only 2 bad things: long wait, parking is very limited...

Reviews.Author: JJ L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better sushi restaurants.

Reviews.Author: boah b.
Reviews.Content: i like their sashimi platter.  i used to eat here all the time.  but now i am disappointed by their sashimi platter $35(?).  it gets less and less each time, and the portion is probably 1/3 of the size they used to give before.  the wait is long, too.the male host is cool and lets me go in, but the female host is a b&&& and keeps letting other people go in as if i didn't know.i spend about $80-100 each time i go, and eating only 2 people.  the fish is sometimes very good, but sometimes taste a few days old and fishy and not fresh.depending on the day you go, you may get a very good meal or a very yucky meal.their teriyaki beef and tempura are the best, but they charge about $24 for this.  they do make very good tempura.  i haven't found a better place for tempura.if they can be a little more generous and consistent with their sashimi platter, then i would go back here.  or else i would just go elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Ayton A.
Reviews.Content: best sushi in LA.  very authentic, always fresh.  i love sitting at the bar, but they have an amazing lunch special which is very popular.  i would recommend this place to anyone who know and appreciates good sushi.

Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: What an amaizing expirence...I will be back

Reviews.Author: Rose B.
Reviews.Content: I love sushi gen.   It's my favorite- but only when you sit at the bar and even more when you get to sit in front of Masa.   He treats my like I'm a relative- he remembers what I don't like and he suggests great new things.  like squid/uni with shiso leaf.  I don't think I would have ever thought to order that!.  The sashimi is out of this world amazing.   I give it 5 (I would give 10 if that was possible) stars for the food! but I took away a star for the wait and how expensive it is...

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of the best sashimi plates you can get for the money.  Go for lunch, around 12 before the DT work crowd comes in.  Quality sushi and extremely fast service.

Reviews.Author: S. L.
Reviews.Content: Was planning to go to Sushi Zo, but ended up here. Foods were just mediocre considering the price. Was not expecting chopped crab sticks on sashimi deluxe plate...

Reviews.Author: Ken F.
Reviews.Content: Fresh, fresh, fresh.  I arrived early and joined a group of people waiting for the doors to open, and ordered the sashimi deluxe.  This plate had 5 large pieces of delectable toro, and a wide variety of other incredibly fresh fish.  Other restaurants would charge more for the toro alone than I paid for the whole plate.  A California roll that followed melted in my mouth.  Best sashimi I have had anywhere.

Reviews.Author: mark S.
Reviews.Content: The wait is a drag.  A major drag. Hanging out in the plaza as there is no waiting area or bar. But the food is fabulous. Fresh and ss others have noted served quickly.  Tempura was weak and bland.  Sushi and sashimi was so so fresh. Not for the tent of heart or those that object to long outdoor waits. Not cheap but I love the place.  Shame they don't take reservations. They would be packed either way and they could make bar money. But these guys are not interested in doing thingnany way but their highly successful fashion.  Food A+ service A ambiance B greeting E

Reviews.Author: Masao O.
Reviews.Content: the best sushi!  endorsed by Japanese customers.

Reviews.Author: AJ K.
Reviews.Content: great sushi period!

Reviews.Author: Ali S.
Reviews.Content: The place was just too crowded and the staff too uninterested to give us the time of day. The menu was in Japanese and assumed knowledge of the dishes that made it very uncomfortable for those with dietary restrictions. Wouldn't go again and don't recommend for novices or non Japanese foodies.

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: So satisfying!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay W.
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place but recently it was just ok.

Reviews.Author: Vanni M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome sushi, although I think I would rather eat somewhere cheaper and almost as good rather than dish out $60+.

Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I have had better sashimi than this place.  So fresh and they just know how to make the best sushi in all of LA.

Reviews.Author: Apollo S.
Reviews.Content: the sashimi lunch special is awesome for the price.

Reviews.Author: George M.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most popular Sushi restaurants in downtown L.A. as can be seen by the number of people waiting in line before the doors open for lunch and the number of people waiting outside after they put their name on the waiting list.  The biggest reason for their popularity at lunch is the Sashimi special.  The Sashimi special includes mixture of fresh sashimi and cooked fish, rice, miso soup, tsukemono (pickled cabbage), seasoned tofu dish and pickled seaweed and cucumber.  What makes this different from the other Sushi places is that they give you plenty of fresh sashimi at a reasonable price.  The sashimi special will fill you up for under $18 including tax and tip.  We typically go there about 15 minutes before it opens (it opens at 11:15 a.m.) and if you order the Sashimi special, you will be served within 10 to 15 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Harry L.
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the best sushi i have ever had in my entire life.We got there at 11:20, 20 minutes after opening. We were seated immediately at the sushi bar, unusually since it is usually very crowded at this time. Our chef greeted us with the usual Japanese announcement.  We first ordered a plate of yellow tail sushi. The fish tasted as if it was caught at the restaurant. Next we ordered some salmon sushi. This was the best two pieces of fish i had ever eaten in my life it was fatty and sweet and tender and oh so good. My father had also had the red snapper. he said it was the best sushi he had ever had in his life also. We finished of the meal with some tamago, egg omelet. They say you can tell how good a sushi restaurant is by the quality of the tamago and if that is true then Sushi Gen is the best sushi restaurant in America.The bill came out to $88 which since we had 5 orders each and there were three of us is actually a good price for the quality of the fishOverall my experience at Sushi Gen was the best I had ever had at any Sushi Restaurant

Reviews.Author: Sang L.
Reviews.Content: The sashimi special is ridiculously good in quantity and quality of sashimi.  The atmosphere is kinda crazy and claustrophobic with the noise and crowdedness.  I think the owners are anti-kid because it's one of the least kid-friendly restaurants I've ever been to.  The food is top-notch, if you can handle the ambiance.

Reviews.Author: amy a.
Reviews.Content: yellowtail belly so great, I love it.

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: Given all the raves, we decided to try Sushi-Gen before seeing a show at the Ahmanson.  Atmosphere and staff were pleasant, but let's cut to the chase: how can you praise a sushi place when the hand-rolls arrive wrapped in soggy seaweed?  Isn't it a requirement for passing Sushi 101 that the seaweed be crispy and crunchy?  With the exception of the melt-in-your-mouth salmon sushi, our 9 other sushi choices were undistinguished - mostly rather bland and with a microscopic amount of crab in the California roll.  A disappointment.

Reviews.Author: david k.
Reviews.Content: So far the best sushi bar restaurant in L.A.  Not cheap, especially if your into the more exotic types of fish.  What I found the most impressive was how fresh and  flavorful their fishes were.  The uni and ikura was above average, but it's all about the FISH here.  I wanna go back real soon.

Reviews.Author: Kevin J.
Reviews.Content: best lunch sushi bar none.  enough said

Reviews.Author: T S.
Reviews.Content: Although a little too small for it's long line of patrons, I can confirm it was worth the wait if all you want is plain sushi. I tried the sashimi lunch plate (upon everyones' suggestion) & enjoyed every bite, so no complaint here other than the constant buzz of worker bees & getting the bill before I even started (felt too rushed). Still, friendly place, efficient service & excellent, mouth-watering sushi! Note* Only one toilet in the women's restroom & parking's $4.

Reviews.Author: Maria F.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Sushi Gen for a few years now.  Have to admit, their quality is not as good as before .  The price had gone up but the quality of food is going down.

Reviews.Author: V. L.
Reviews.Content: I love love love this place! Even though it's always crowded (I highly suggest making reservations), its worth the wait and never disappointing

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: BEST SUSHI IN LA. Do I need to say more.

Reviews.Author: rahul g.
Reviews.Content: Better than anything in manhattan...

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: They say you have to try everything twice before judgment. I'll teeter on the fence with 3 stars for now. I tried Sushi Gen last Monday for the first time. Teriyaki Chicken was very good. But the salad (chopped julienned iceberg and thousand island) would not cut it for a restaurant so highly rated in my opinion. Teriyaki beef was sub-par. I also ordered the fatty tuna, $25 for six pieces. Tempura was just okay. I will try it again, once I save up enough money to where Sushi Gen will not make a dent in my bank account.

Reviews.Author: Dong V.
Reviews.Content: i should give 3.5. i only go there twice, food is not bad. little pricey, whenever we want sushi, we go to Komasa straight. the quality of the food is standard, nothing really surprise you.

Reviews.Author: ali s.
Reviews.Content: The overwhelming number of 5 star ratings here perplexes me.  By the end of our meal my friend and I were actually laughing at how atrocious the entire experience was, from atmosphere to food to service.  Sushi-Gen is located in a beat-up little strip mall where parking is limited on a busy night.  I had to wait 15 minutes to park, which actually got my hopes up because I figured I'd stumbled upon some cool little unexpected hole-in-the-wall that would be the next downtown sushi sensation.  The crowd spilled out the front door and down the sidewalk so I was thrilled I had a reservation.  Didn't matter.  Still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated.  The atmosphere, or lack thereof, was fitting for a strip mall joint.  No music, no style, bright lights, dime-store decor.  Service was nonexistent.  Our server didn't speak English (fine - I get it - but just sayin' - you need to know your Japanese if you eat here).  She took our order and we never saw her again until I lunged at her as she passed by and asked her for our check.  The sushi rolls were tiny, tasteless portions of GOD AWFULNESS with a thimble of soy sauce.  The edamame was cold and undercooked, served with a side of salt that slid off the beans onto the plate.  The shrimp and veggie tempura was a giant mass of deep fried grease; I had to dig around to find the tiny item inside, like a prize.  The broiled lobster and mushrooms tasted like they'd been under a heating lamp at McDonalds for the past hour.And the kicker?  It's expensive!  I seriously don't get it.  The sushi at Ralph's is a thousand times better, as is the atmosphere and service.  My friend and I wondered - is this authentic Japanese?  Are we missing something?  If so, I'll take American-Japanese any day over the real deal.

Reviews.Author: Nathanael F.
Reviews.Content: Awesome sashimi lunch special for $15 during the weekdays.

Reviews.Author: edmond l.
Reviews.Content: We were told the wait was 45 minutes, but ended up waiting for an hour and 20 minutes. The big question is, was it worth the wait?What we ordered: As appetizer, monk fish liver ($6) and salt grilled hamachi (yellowtail) head ($15). Two of us shared a sashimi deluxe ($35), two bottles of large Sapporo ($7 each), no rice ($3), no miso ($3 for a very small bowl), no sake. The waitress was pleasant and efficient. With 20% tip, the bill was $90. Not exorbitant for a nice Japanese dinner for two, but neither would it qualify as cheap eat.What we got: the monk fish liver was rich and flavorful. But then, there is no chef magic in this dish. The liver pretty much comes from the distributor as is, the chef just cuts off a piece and serves it with ponzu, chopped scallion and tobiko. No points added. The hamachi head: I am used to having more rock salt rubbed on and a little more burnt. They probably choose to use less salt to let the real taste of the fish come through. No points deducted. Lastly, the sashimi deluxe for two came with most of the varieties served in very small pieces (thumbnail size), which means the restaurant was likely using side cuts and corners that are close to the tendons, i.e, not prime cut. Also, piling small pieces together makes the portion look bigger. Not a nice trick. Points off.On the positive side, the dish had good variety. Two slices of octopus were the basic thaw-and-serve, no surprise there. The three very tiny slices of squid was fine, enough to tickle the palate. A sizable lump of spicy tuna was tasty, but still, like the squid and the octopus, it's cheap stuff. A pile of salmon skin shaving had already lost its crunch, and had to rely on its oiliness and burnt flavor to carry the day. There was one lone cooked shrimp, a slice of tamago (Japanese sweet egg), a small pile of tiny red snapper pieces, and two piles of tiny tuna pieces. Next, there were four small slices of flounder/sea bass/amadai, and two normal size slices of salmon. So far, everything was good, though nothing spectacular. But wait, right in the center of the dish was four good size slices of hamachi, firm and fresh. Impressive. And... whoa, what's that behind the hamachi? Five slices, I say again, five good size slices of toro (tuna belly). You hear it right, we got toro, and lots of it. The slices were classic melt-in-your-mouth tender with great oily taste. For the toro and the hamachi alone, lots of points added.Four or five star, you think? Not so fast. Restaurants are about not just the food, but also the ambiance, the convenience and the service. The service was ok. Sushi-Gen is small, always very crowded, crammed and has very little décor or atmosphere. The wait was unbearably long, yet they did not have any waiting area inside (there were four chairs next to the door and that's it). They would not take your phone number to call you when you are up, so you must stay and wait for over an hour, or come back periodically to check in. The two guys at the host stand were surly. Many people stood inside to wait, and one by one they were told to get out of the way. We came back from outside after the 45 minutes wait, and had to stay inside because they were about to lock up the door. The whole lot of us were physically leaning against the back of the chairs of some sushi bar diners. Worst of all, they are draconian toward diners. At the host stand there are notices, one after another, that said: no smoking (fine, that's good); no laptop use (ditto), no cell phone (I don't like people talking on the phone while dining, but disallowing it? That's going too far); if you sit at the sushi bar you must order everything a-al-carte, with four orders minimum per person; all diners must be present or you won't get seated (we witnessed two parties turned away for that reason); and written in two different notices: we reserve the right to refuse service to anybody (please sir, I want some more sushi); the list goes on. Remember Harry Potter Order of the Pheonix, when evil Professor Umbridge made one new rule after another, and you see Filch nailing the new orders all over the wall? Now you get the idea. Bottom line: Do you like eating really late? We got there at 8:20PM; we started eating at almost 10PM and that was not by choice (they locked the door at 9:30). This place is all about the food and the food only. If you want good sashimi and don't care about time or comfort, this may be your place. But for the same money or perhaps a little more, there are lots of good choices around town, where you won't have to wait for over an hour, endure the attitudes of surly staff, sit over the shoulder of other diners, and beg them to do you a favor and take your money. You are the customer. Don't torture yourself. Four stars for the quality and value of the food. One star for everything else. Two stars overall... and I am being nice because, after all, I did get toro.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome sushi!  We put our taste buds in the hands of the sushi chef and tried unusual (for us) sushi like sardine, mackerel, octopus and snapper--all were wonderful, the sardine most redolent of the sea and tasting so fresh like it had just been caught that morning (probably had--this is the freshest fish I have ever eaten). Sushi Gen is constantly bustling and although we had a reservation, we chose to sit at the sushi bar--only complaint (and a minor one given the extraordinary quality) was that we were squeezed in between the wall and beginning of the sushi bar window and couldn't easily point to what we wanted.  It's in a small strip mall in downtown LA--easy (and cheap) to park early on a weekday evening.  Not cheap, but worth every penny given the quality of the fish.

Reviews.Author: Anj C.
Reviews.Content: Good quality and an extensive menu but nothing spectacular.
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Somnus S.
Reviews.Content: i love it so much. recommend the special sashimi lunch, if you like the sashimi, it's awesome and not that expensive. the fish is fresh. a lot of people go to there for lunch, so you'd better go earlier.

Reviews.Author: Monica L.
Reviews.Content: I saw the line for the lunch special and thought this was going to be all it was reviewed to be. Not so at all. The sashimi was good, really fresh, but that's where it ended. The chicken and beef teriyaki were not great, the salad had 1000 island dressing (not traditional japanese dressing) and the little pickled salad was terrible. Soup was so so, but not at all the traditional "little Tokyo" place we expected. Won't be back. We have a great place in Redondo Beach that we love called Casa Arigato, haven't found anything better. The place in Studio City place was pretty good, better than Sushi Gen.

Reviews.Author: jack b.
Reviews.Content: the only game in town.  Been coming here for 5 years and never had a bad experience.  keep up the good work.

Reviews.Author: chau n.
Reviews.Content: the food was quite good. we had the sushi and chicken teri specials, along with a few extra maki. the turnoff - the female servers had really b*tchy attitude and i caught them yelling at the latino busboys. c'mon. not classy.

Reviews.Author: Iris Y.
Reviews.Content: went there with my best frd right before my 1st bday in LA. it was a rly wonderful experience. nice food. nice environment. sashimi is really fresh and yummy. like the green tea and red bean ice cream! :)

Reviews.Author: Mei H.
Reviews.Content: i got sick eating the sashimi special. it is possible that one reason is i went with a completely empty stomach. my friend did not get sick. however, i expect not to get sick from sushi, even with a completely empty stomach.

Reviews.Author: Masami M.
Reviews.Content: best sushi place in downtown. 5 star:)

Reviews.Author: Angela C.
Reviews.Content: one of the best sushis i've eaten in LA. up there with sushizo and matsuhisa.  the only negative thing i can say is that it was a bit pricey.  my bf and i sat at the sushi counter and shared 16 orders of sushi. every single fish was so very wonderful.  we ate whatever the chef recommended as well.  at the end of our meal the chef asks me, do you want some fruit as dessert? i say, sure, thinking that its going to be on the house, since we ordered and ate so much sushi. but no, they charged 7 dollars for some shitty ass cherrymongo fruit thing that tasted not so good.  anyway here's what i ordered that were all so deliciouso.  chu toro, hirame, mirugai, abalone, uni, unagi, snapper, hamachi, red clam, and some white fish he recommended.  he had a thick japanese accent so i could not understand. i'm gonna go back to my weekly sushi place, noshi sushi, only bc of value.  but this place excellent fish and maybe a few times a year. so pricey!

Reviews.Author: Chih H.
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for 5:45pm and arrive at 5:49pm. This place tells me they don't hold tables, and I will need to wait at least 45 minutes before I can be seated. Pardon my English, but what is the point of taking a reservation when they can't honor it? The thing that really made me mad is their manager gave me the snobbish attitude and didn't even try to apologize. Before I walk myself out, I overheard another person try to put her name down for 13 people. This manager basically tells her to go away because it's too much trouble for him to try to fit them in. Sure this place serves very good sushi, and I am sure they have enough people who are willing to wait for their tables. There are plenty of other sushi restaurants with walking distance from this place that don't have this sort of attitude. They lost my business forever. We will tell everyone we know to never go there. My advice to you is go at their opening time if you must eat there. Don't bother make a reservation because they don't know what the word reservation means.

Reviews.Author: m c.
Reviews.Content: Came here for my wedding anniv. with our 6 y/o.  The waitresses were very nice!  Excellent friendly service.  My husband ordered the sashimi deluxe and proceeded to order some fatty tuna sushi but the waitress suggested that we wait as they may have the fatty tuna on the sashimi plate.  Saved us some $ as it did some with a few pieces..YEAH!  I had the deluxe chirashi.  No salmon??? That was disappointing :(  Ordered chix teryaki for my daughter.  Dry and hard.  Then again, they are known for their fish so that was no suprise.  I was a bit suprised, however, that when a customer came in with a half drunken starbucks, the host told him he would hold it in the refridgerator for him and then labeled it and took it away.  I know they say no outside drinks, but this was a little extreme!  Anyways...the food was good!  Yes...expensive.   Was it worth it...hmmm... it was fresh.  I have had the same quality at a less expensive price though. What sets this place apart, however, is the service!

Reviews.Author: j. e.
Reviews.Content: expect long lines... 45 min wait... but the fresh fresh sushi is esp the toro... is yuuuuuuuum. never bring an empty wallet... expect to pay $$$

Reviews.Author: Rex F.
Reviews.Content: you caaaaan do it

Reviews.Author: Cathy V.
Reviews.Content: this was the first time i ever got stuffed with sashimi and not sushi rice.  seriously the best sashimi deal ever. very authentic. no fuss. good customer service - figure if they have to deal with a long line every day for lunch and dinner they should be good at it.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth L.
Reviews.Content: So I decided to give Sushi Komasa a break, and try out Sushi Gen.  Many have mentioned that it was overrated.  However, until I try it out, I'll give it the benefit of the doubt.  First the waitress that was serving us was rude and impatient.  Before we can even complete our order, she would assume we were done and just walk away.  She did this multiple times.  Our orders arrived very quickly.  For a place that is praised for its quality, it certainly failed on the basics (i.e. tuna, salmon, yellowtail).  I could of gotten the same quality at some all-u-can-eat joint.  The more expensive and exotic sushi were decent (i.e. aji, yellowtail belly), but not great.  The 3 of us spent over $200, and it's pretty sad when the best order was a clam miso soup and the sake...lol.  To make matters worse, my brother had a huge stomach ache the next morning.  I have spoken to a few friends about my terrible experience at Sushi Gen, and many have confirmed with their own horror stories about this place.  Never again!

Reviews.Author: paul s.
Reviews.Content: why do people go here? i really don't get why so many people wait to eat here. the sushi isn't that good and the host is a total jerk. we had a reservation for 7pm and half the group got there on time while the other half was parking. the full group got to the restaurant at 7:03pm but the table was given away and the people i was with have been long time customers. in all my years of eating out, i've never come across a restaurant without at least a 10 minute grace period. what if our friends' watches were slow? even 3 star michelins don't do this and this restaurant is far from even getting 1 star. this restaurant is an example of poor service and food quality due to the ridiculous demand. stop giving these people your business. go eat sushi in the westside...hiko, sasabune, zo, kiriko or in studio city. anywhere but here. stop following people here like dumb sheep. i hope more people figure it out and stop going. maybe some humility (and a change with the one host) will turn this restaurant around. i'm convinced people only go here because they live in dtla or near jtown and don't know where else to go in the area. that is the only reasonable explanation. either that or people don't know what good sushi and service is like.

Reviews.Author: brian l.
Reviews.Content: real good but kinda pricey...

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: quality quality quality!!

Reviews.Author: rindy c.
Reviews.Content: sushi gen is my go to place when we feel like downtown sushi. it does feel like you are in a factory. there is no personal contact. everything is whipped out and the delivery is just that- no smiles, no stories about the fish, nothing personal is attached to your plate.  avoid the salmon- it always tastes so weird here. but everything else is pretty awesome!
